articles:
<k>ibe</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> there; <k>adibe</k> (with motion)
thence; <k>tra ibe</k> through there, that way; <k>hike ed ibe</k>
here and there; <k>ibe fore</k> there at a distance; <k>ibe
 infre</k> down there. Ex.: Ibe esas ube me lojas. Haltez ibe.

<k>ideo</k> idea; <k>ideala</k> ideal; <k>idealo</k> an ideal; <k>idealismo</k>
idealism; <k>idealigar</k> to idealize; <k>idealista</k>, <k>ideo</k>
idealistic (person).

<k>identa</k> identical, the (self-) same; <k>identeso</k>
identity, sameness; <k>identigar</k> to identify, to make identical
(N.B. not used for persons: <k>rikonocar ulu kom ulu</k>). Ex.:
Me prestis a B. la sama libro kam ad A. (t.e. libro tote identa,
un libro). La du propozicioni esas identa l'una a l'altra.

<k>idiomo</k> idiom, language of a people, tribe, etc.; (cf. <k>idiotismo</k>);
<k>idiomala</k> idiomatic, vernacular, relative to a particular
language; <k>provincala (o lokala</k>, <k>o rurala) idiomo</k> patois
(cf. <k>dialekto</k>, <k>jargono</k>, <k>slango</k>); <k>la
 Franca idiomo</k> the French language. Def.: La linguo propra di
ula naciono o regiono.

<k>idiota</k> idiotic, devoid of understanding; <k>idiot(ul)o</k>
idiot, natural fool; (for scientific discussion of meaning, cf.
VI-243); <k>idiotajo</k> an idiotic act.

<k>idiotismo</k> idiotism, idiom, an expression peculiar to
itself in grammatical construction; an expression the meaning of
which as a whole cannot be derived from the conjoined meanings of
its elements; (cf. <k>idiomo</k>); <k>idiotismala</k> idiomatic,
relating to the grammatical construction of a sentence; (cf. <k>idiomala</k>).
Dei.: Frazo ne komprenebla per logikal analizo; VI-192. Ex.:
"How do you do" esas Angla idiotismo.

<k>idolo</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> idol; <k>idolisto</k> idolater; <k>idoligar</k>
to idolize; <k>idolkulto</k>, <k>idolismo</k> idolatry; <k>idolista</k>, <k>idolkultala</k>
idolatrous.

<k>igar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make, cause, render (= suffix <k>igig</k>
used as an independent verb). Ex.: Igar B. dicar ulo ad A. Igar
ulu savar ulo = savigar ulo da ulu. Igar ulu facar ulo = facigar
ulo da ulu. Lu igis sua flechi (esar) venenoza. La rejo igis la
generalo arestar la policestro.

<k>ignorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ignore, to refuse to notice;
disregard wilfully; to overlook <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k> intentionally.
Def.: Ne volar savar; simular nesavar; VI-165. Ex.: Me savas ke
altra faktori existas en la problemo, ma me ignoras li. Ignorar
la prczenteso di ulu.

<k>ikonoklasto</k> iconoclast, image breaker; <ex>(fig.)</ex> one
who attacks cherished beliefs as shams; a determined enemy of
image worship.

<k>iktiokolo</k> ichthyocol(la), fish-glue, isinglass, a glue
prepared from the sounds of fish.

<k>il</k> (abbr. of <k>ilu</k>; accus. <k>ilun</k>) he; <k>ili</k>
they <ex>(masc.)</ex>; <k>ilua</k> his; <k>ilia</k> their <ex>(masc.)</ex>.<k>Note</k> In order to show gender, <k>il</k> is sometimes
prefixed to demonstrative and interrogative pronouns: <k>ilca</k>, <k>ilta</k>, <k>ilqua</k>, <k>ilci</k>, <k>ilti</k>, <k>ilqui</k>. Ex.: il veis kun ilua kuzi.
Ili venis kun ilia kuzi. Pro quo vu prenas ilua libri? Lektez la
vui e lasez la ilui (plu.)

<k>iliterata</k>, <k>iliterato</k><k /> illiterate, unlettered
(person). Def.: Qua savas nek lektar, nek skribar; VI-486.

<k>iluminar</k><k /> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to illuminate,
decorate with festal lights or bonfires (cf. <k>lumizar</k>); (<ex>fig</ex>.)
to enlighten the mind of (<k>ulu</k>); <k>pregar Deo iluminar vu</k><k />
to pray to God to illuminate your mind; <k>ilumin(ad)o</k>:
illumination (as at a festival); <k>iluminismo</k><k />
the principles of the illuminati; <k>la iluminati</k><k />
the illuminati.

<k>ilustrar</k><k /> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to illustrate, to
provide or adorn (as a book with pictures); (cf. <k>enluminar</k>, <k>klarigar</k>, <k>explikar</k>); <k>ilustruro</k>: illustration (in a book,
paper).

<k>iluzionar</k><k /> (<ex>intr</ex>.) (cf. <k>trompar</k>),
to be laboring under an illusion, delusion; <k>iluzionoza</k><k />
full of delusions; <k>iluziona</k><k /> illusory (truly
so); <k>iluzioniganta</k>, <k>iluzioniva</k><k /> delusive, illusive:
which makes a delusion; <k>iluzionigar</k><k /> to delude,
deceive (<k>ulu</k>, <k>su</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>); <k>bastono en aquo aspektas
 quale ruptita; co esas iluziono</k><k /> a stick in
water looks as if it were broken: it is an illusion. Def.: (<k>iluziono</k>)
Eroro di la sensi o di la mento, qua igas konfundar la
versimilajo por la realajo.

<k>imaginar</k><k /> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to imagine, to
form a notion, a mental image; <k>imaginajo</k><k /> that
which one imagines, fancy, conceit; <k>imaginiva</k>, <k>imaginema</k><k />
imaginative. Ex.: On ne povas imaginar ulo plu extraordinara. Il
havas vivaca imaginado. Mento imaginema. V. Exp.: vid. <k>fantaziar</k>.

<k>imajo</k><k /> image, a visible representation
of something; statue, effigy, picture, idol, etc.; a picture
produced by reflection, refraction, etc.; a natural resemblance,
likeness; a mental or printed picture. Ex.: La ikonoklasti
kombatis kontre la kulto di imaji. Vidar sua imajo en
l’aquo. Deo kreis la homo segun sua imajo (E. likeness);
Esas bela imaji (E. pictures) en ca libro.

<k>imanar</k><k /> (<ex>intr., philos</ex>.) to be
immanent, to indwell; <k>imananta</k>: immanent, inherent. Ant.: (<k>imananta</k>)
<k>trancendanta</k>.

<k>imbastar</k><k /> (<ex>tr., of tailors,
seamstresses</ex>) to baste, to run or tack together (the
different parts of a garment, cloth). Def.: Sutar per longa
steburi e (ordinare) blanka filo, por pose probar; IV-167.

<k>imbecila</k><k /> imbecile, weak-minded. (For
discussion of scientific meaning of this and related word, cf.
VI-243.

<k>imbibar</k><k /> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to imbue, to
permeate, soak in, drench (speaking of liquids); <k>La pluvo
 imbibas la tero</k><k /> the rain has soaked the
ground; <k>imbibar sponjo per aquo</k><k /> to soak a
sponge (with water); (<ex>fig</ex>.) <k>–ar la mento per
 opinioni eroroza</k><k /> to imbue the mind with
erroneous opinions.

<k>imbrikar</k><k /> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to imbricate, to
overlap (<k>ulo</k>, <k>per ulo</k>); <k>imbriko</k>, <k>imbrikuro</k>: imbricating,
overlapping (as scales, tiles, shingles).

<k>imersar</k><k /> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to immerge,
immerse, to dip, plunge (<k>ulo</k>) into (a liquid); <k>imersoquanto</k><k />
(<ex>nav</ex>.) (ship’s) draught. V. exp.: <k>Submersar</k>
esas plunjigar komlete en (sub) l’aquo; diferas do de <k>imersar</k>,
qua esas plunjigar nur parte; on imersas omna navi kande on
lansas oli, ma nur poka e specala navi esas <k>submersebla;</k>
altri (salvo-bateli) esas kontree <k>nesubmersebla;</k> IV-231.

<k>imitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to imitate, endeavor to copy or
resemble <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo);</k> <k>imit(ad)o</k>, <k>imituro</k> imitating,
imitation; <k>imitajo</k> the model or object which is imitated; <k>imitachar</k>
to ape, mimic. Ex.: Imitar la signaturo, la manieri, la agi di
ulu. Juveli imitita (E. imitation jewels) (cf. <k>kontrafaktar</k>).

<k>imoblo</k>, <k>imobli</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> immovables, realty, real
estate, chattels real, (permanent) fixtures. Def. : Nemovebla
havaji (domi, agri, e.c.); II-75.

<k>imolar*</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to immolaite, offer or kill as a
sacrificial victim. Ex.: Agamemmon imolis sua filiino por la
interesto generala di la Greki.

<k>impedar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to impede, hinder, prevent; <k>impedo</k>, <k>impedivo</k> hindrance, hitch, impediment; <ex>(elec.)</ex> impedance;
<k>impedili</k>, <k>impedivi</k> impedimenta; <k>sen impeda</k> unimpeded. Ex.
Impedar ulu faca ulo. Impedar l'enemiko transirar la rivero.
Impedo a l'exekuto du ula projecto. Impedivo en sua parolado.

<k>imperaar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to order, direct, enjoin, bid,
command (N.B. not military); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to rule, have sway
(cf. <k>dominacar</k>, <k>guvernar</k>, <k>regnar</k>); <k>imperaema</k> imperious;
<k>imperavorto</k> word of command; Ex.: La patrulo imperis a sua
filio departar. Devos imperas a me. V. exp.: vid. komandar.

<k>imperatoro</k> <ex>(Rom. hist.)</ex> imperator. Def. :
Komandanto di antiqua Romana armeo; VI-213.

<k>imperio</k> empire, slate ruled by an emperor; <k>imperiala</k>
imperial, relating to an e.; <k>imperialismo</k> imperialism; <k>imperialista</k>, <k>imperio</k> imperialist(ic); <k>imperiestro</k> emperor; <k>imperiestrino</k>
empress; <k>imperiestrata</k> imperial, relating to an emperor.

<k>impertinenta</k> impertinent, saucy, pert. V. exp.:
Impertinenta esas nepolita o senrespekta. Insolenta esas, pluse,
insulentema od ofensema. kun nuanco du superbeso; II-647.

<k>impetuo</k> (of things) violence, fury; <k>impetuemeso</k> (of
persons) impetuous, vehemence, boisterousness; <k>impetuoza</k>, <k>impetuema</k>
impetuous, headlong, violent; <k>la impetuo di la tempesto</k> the
violence of the tempest; <k>impetuemeso di yuneso</k> impetuosness
of youth; <k>impetuoza deziri</k> vehement desires: <k>iraco impetuoza</k>
violent anger.

<k>implicita</k> implicit, implied, tacitly comprised; <k>to
 esas kontenata en la kontrato en maniero implicita</k> this is
implied in the contract; <k>libera volo esas la kondiciono
 implicita di responsiveso elikala</k> free-will is an implicit
condition of moral reponsibility.

<k>implikar</k> <ex>(tr. log..)</ex> to imply, to involve by
inference; <k>impliko</k>, <k>implikajo</k> implication, inference; <k>implikar
 kontredico</k> to imply or involve a contradiction: <k>l'ideo
 di la homo implikas l'idei di inteligenteso ed arbitrio</k> the
idea of a man implies ideas of intelligence and free will..

<k>imploraar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to implore. V. exp. : <k>Suplikar</k>
esas pregegar humile. <k>Implorar</k>adjuntas a suplikar l'ideo
di emociganta moyeni, aparte (segun l'etimologio) di la ploro;
II-646.

<k>importar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have import, be of importance
or consequence; to matter, signify, concern; <k>importas</k>
(impersonal) it is necessary; <k>importo</k> import, importance,
consequence; <k>importanta</k> important; <k>importanto</k> person of
importance; <k>importajo</k> important thing or matter; <k>to nemulte
 (o poke) importas a me</k> that is of little consequence; <k>sen
 importa</k> insignificant; <k>importas irar</k> it is necessary to
go; <k>ne importas ube me esas</k> no matter where i am; <k>l'importo
 di</k> <k>l'afero</k><k /> the importance of an
affair; <k>importanta okaziono</k>, <k>persono</k><k />
important occasion, person.

<k>impostar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tax <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>impost(ad)o</k>, <k>imposturo</k><k /> taxation; impost,
excise, duty; <k>impostokolektisto</k><k />
t.-gatherer, -collector; <k>imposto personala</k><k />
personal t., poll-tax; <k>sal imposto</k><k /> duty on
salt. V. exp.: <k>Taxar</k> esas kalkular quanto de imposto
pagenda; <k>impostar</k> esas igar taxito pagar ica sumo. <k>Taxuro</k>
ed <k>imposturo</k> havas la sama senco. Ex.: La guvernerio <k>taxas</k>
ula importacajo ye procento di 20 po cento, la dogan-kolektisto
direte <k>impostas</k> ica 20 po cento.

<k>impozar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to impose <k>(ulo
 ad ulu)</k>; <k>impozar su</k><k /> to obtrude oneself; <k>impozesar</k>
to be incumbent <k>(ad)</k>;<k>impozar ulo a su</k><k />
to impose something on one self; <k>impozanta</k>, <k>impoziva</k><k />
imposing, commanding, striking. Ex.: La vinkinto impozas severa
kondicioni a la vinkiti. Impozar puniso, taco, respekto.
Ceremonio impozanta.

<k>impregnar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to impregnate,
to fecundate; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to imbue.

<k>imprekar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to imprecate,
to invoke evil on a person, to curse <k>(kontre ulu)</k>; (cf. <k>maledikar</k>).
EFIS

<k>impresar</k><k /> (<ex>tr.</ex>, materially and
morally) to impress, make an impression on <k>(ulo)</k>, to move,
affect <k>(ulu)</k>; (cf.<k>imprimar</k>);<k>impreso</k>, <k>impresuro</k>
impression, imprint; <k>impresata: (bone</k>, <k>male)</k> impressed.

<k>impresiono</k><k /> <ex>(paint., lit.)</ex> an
impressionist work; <k>impresionismo</k><k /> impressionism;
<k>impresionisto</k><k /> impressionist. Def.: Artala verko,
qua tendencas expresar o reprezentar l'impresi recevita da
l'artisto de la naturo o de la temo; VI-323.

<k>imprimar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to print (a book,
paper, etc.); <k>imprimo</k>, <k>imprimuro</k><k /> printing;
(im)print: <k>imprimala</k><k /> typographical; <k>imprimerio</k><k />
printing establ.; <k>imprimeyo</k><k /> printing office; <k>imprimmashino</k><k />
printing press; <k>imprimproburo</k><k /> proof (-sheet).

<k>improvizar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to improvise,
to compose, recite, sing, etc., extemporaneously; to extemporize;
to make, do, or provide offhand; <k>improvize; improvizata</k>, <k>improvizita</k><k />
extemporized, impromptu.

<k>impulsar</k><k /> <ex>(tr., phys. and moral)</ex>
to give impetus to, to impel; <k>impulso</k><k />
impetus, impulse; <k>impulsanta</k>, <k>impulsiva</k><k /> impelling,
impulsive; <k>kuglo impulsita da pulvero</k><k /> bullet
impelled by powder; <k>cedar a l'impulso dil volo di stranjero</k><k />
to yield to the influence of a stranger's will.

<k>imputar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to impute,
ascribe; (cf.<k>akuzar</k>, <k>atributar</k>);<k>ne imputez mea taco
 ad ulo ecepte a manko di tempo</k><k /> do not
impute (attribute) my silence to anything except lack of time; <k>me
 ne imputas mea desfortuno a vu</k><k /> I do not
impute my misfortunes to you; <k>imputo kalumnioza</k><k />
a caluminous imputation.

<k>inaniciono</k><k /> inanition. Del.: Febleso
efektigita da manko de nutrivi. DEFIS

<k>inata</k><k /> innate, inborn, inbred; <k>inata
 idei</k><k /> innate ideas.

<k>incendiar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to set fire to;
to burn down (maliciously); <k>incendianto</k>, <k>incendiero</k>: incendiary
(person); <k>incendio premeditita</k>: arson.

<k>incidar</k><k /> <ex>(tr. phys. and gen.)</ex> to
impinge upon, fall upon or affect; <k>incidala angulo</k><k />
angle of incidence. Ex. Radio incidanta. L'incido di l'imposto.

<k>incidenta</k><k /> incidental, causal; <k>incidento</k>:
incident, occurence; <k>incidenta frazeto</k><k /> a
sub-ordinate, a parenthetic clause.

<k>incitar</k><k /> <ex>(tr)</ex> to incite, to spur
or urge on <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ad ulo)</k>; (cf.<k>instigar</k>); <k>incitetar</k><k />
to plague, pester; <k>incito</k><k /> incitement,
incentive; (med.) stimulus. Ex.: Incitar la populo revoltar. Ica
pensi incitis il a la venjo.

<k>incizar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to incise, to cut
in or into (cf.<k>tranchar</k>); <k>incizo</k>, <k>incizuro: incision</k>, <k>gash</k>, <k>cut</k>, <k>slash</k>; <k>inciziva</k><k /> <ex>(also
fig.)</ex> incisive; <k>incizivo</k>, <k>inciziva dento</k>: incisor (tooth).

<k>indemno</k>: indemnity, recompense; <k>indemnizar</k>: to
indemnify, compensate, recoup. Def.: Kompensal pekunio donita pro
domajo, e.c.; II-75

<k>indexo</k><k /> index, table of contents of a
book; hand of a dial, etc.: (R.C. church) forbidden books; (of
Bible) concordance; (cf. <k>indikfingro</k>).

<k>indico</k><k /> indication, sign, token, mark,
clue; -<k>i trompanta</k><k /> deceitful tokens; <k>maligna
 parolado esas indico di mala kordio</k><k /> an evil
tongue is a sign of a bad heart; <ex>(math.)</ex> <k>indico di
 radikalo</k><k /> index of a root; <k>indico di
 refrakto</k><k /> (opt.) index of refraction. Del.
Fakto donanta la certeso o probableso di altra fakto.

<k>indiferenta</k><k /> indifferent, unconcerned,
immaterial; (of persons) cold, unmindful, insensible. Ex.: Sive
ni selektas ca voyo sive l'altra, to esas indiferent a me. Il
esas indiferent a la laudo ed a la kritiko. Indiferenteso pri
temi religiala.

<k>indignar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be
indignant; <k>indignigar</k><k /> to rouse the
indignation of; <k>indigniganta</k><k /> revolting,
shoking; <k>indignoklamo</k><k /> out-cry, hue and cry.
Ex.: Il indignas pro la deyusteso di homi. Desyusteso indignigas
il. Eruptar pro indigno.

<k>indijar</k><k /> <ex>(tr)</ex> to be destitute and
in need of <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>indijo</k>, <k>indijeso</k>, <k>indijego</k>; indigence,
poverty, penury, want, <k>indijanto</k><k />
necessitous, person; pauper. Def.: Indijo esas la stando di homo
indiganta la maxim necesa kozi. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Indijo di idei.
(cf.<k>karear</k>). Ant. : <k>(indijanta) richa</k>.

<k>indikar</k> to indicate, to show or point out, denote,
designate <k>(ulo ad ulu)</k>; <k>indiko</k>, <k>indikajo</k>: indication (cf. <k>indico</k>;
<k>indikfingro</k> index finger, forefinger.)

<k>individuo</k> individual, single person, animal or thing; <k>individuala</k>
individual; <k>individueso</k> individuality, character peculiar to an
individual; <k>individualeso</k> individuality, sum of characteristic
traits; <k>individuale</k> individually, in an i. or distinct manner,
(cf. <k>single</k>); <k>individualigar</k> to individualize, render
i.; <k>individualismo</k> individualism; <k>individuisto</k>
individualist.

<k>indolenta</k><k /> indolent, slothful, sluggish,
lazy, nonchalant; <k>indolentigar</k><k /> to render i.
Def.: Expresas nelaboremeso qua venas de la mental karaktero, de
speco di moleso o deskurajo, II-19. Ant. : <k>agiva</k>, <k>indolentema;
 vivaca</k>, <k>impetuoza</k>, <k>diligenta</k>.

<k>induktar</k> <ex>(tr., log.)</ex> to induce, to reach (a
general conclusion) by inference from a number of individual
cases; <ex>(phys.)</ex> to induce, to influence without direct
contact; <ex>(phys. log.)</ex> induction, inference.

<k>indulgar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to be indulgent to, make allowance
for, forbear to inflict, spare; (cf. <k>komplezar</k>, <k>absolvar</k>);<k>indulganta</k>, <k>indulgema</k> indulgent, lenient. Def.: Dispenar de puniso
meritita; IV-562. Ant.: (esar) severa.

<k>indulto*</k> <ex>(eccl.)</ex> indult, dispensation granted by
the Pope.

<k>industrio</k> industry: business employing much capital and
labor.

<k>indutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to coat, to over with, (be)daub,
smear, to paint (with one color); <k>induto</k>, <k>induturo</k> coat(ing), a
soft or liquid covering; <k>indutar muro per gipsajo</k> to coat a
wall with plaster; <k>indutar per gudro</k> to tar (cf. <k>gudrizar</k>);
<k>la puero indutis sua kayero per inko</k> the child blotted
(bedaubed) his blank book with ink.

<k>inerta</k> <ex>(phys., mental)</ex> inert, sluggish; <k>inerteso</k>
inertia; <k>inerta maso</k> an i. mass; <k>inerta mento</k> a dull
mind.

<k>infalibla</k> infallible, not liable to fail, decieve, or
disappoint, unfailing, certain; (cf. <k>ne faliiva</k>, <k>neeroriva</k>);
<k>lua ruino esas infalibla</k>: his ruin is certain; <k>remediilo infalibla</k>
i remedy; <k>infalibla evidentajo</k>, <k>suceso</k> i. evidence. success.
(N.B. not to be used for «infallible»: not capabable of
erring).

<k>infanto</k> infant; young child up to seven years of age; <k>infanteto</k>
baby; <k>infantacho</k> brat; <k>infantala</k>, <k>infantatra</k> infantile,
childlike; <k>infanteso</k> infancy, childhood; <k>infanteskar</k> to
become childish; <k>infantalajo</k> childish act: <k>infanteso duesma</k>
dotage (cf. <k>radotar</k>); <k>infantocido</k> infanticide.

<k>«infallible»</k> infanta, infante. Def.: Rej-ido en
Hispania e Portugal.

<k>infektar</k> <ex>(tr. med. and fig.)</ex> to infect, taint; <k>infektiva</k>
infectious.

<k>inferiora</k> <ex>(sociol., econ.)</ex> inferior; lower in
station or rank in life (ex.: <k>inferiorklaso di socio</k>); lower in
excellence and value; less good (ex.: <k>komercaji di qualeso inferiora</k>);
subordonate, secondary; of less importance (ex. <k>tribunalo inferiora;
 ofico inferiora</k>). V. exp. vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>superiora.</k>

<k>infiltrar</k> <k>(tr. intr.)</k> to infiltrate, percolate:
to enter by penetrating the interstices of a substance; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to creep in, insinuate, penetrate.

<k>infinitezima</k> infinitesimal, inmmeasurably small; <k>infinitezimala</k>
infinitesimal, relative to an i. quantity; <k>infinitezima kalkulo</k> i.
calculus, transcendental analysis

<k>infirma</k> infirm, lacking full use of a limb, having
disablement of body; <k>infirmajo</k> infirmily; Def.: Qua ne povas
uzar (libere, normale) irga membro od organo: V-95. V. exp. vid
kripla.

<k>inflar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inflate, pull up or out, swell,
bloat; (cf. <k>bufar</k>). Ex.: Inflar balono. Lua korpo esas
inflita (E. swollen). <ex>(fig.)</ex> Esar inflita da superbeso.
Stilo inflita (E. turgid style).

<k>inflamar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to inflame; <ex>(tech. sense)</ex>
to set fire to <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>inflamala</k>, <k>inflamaltra</k> inflammatory; <k>inflamebla</k>
inflammable, combustible; <k>inflamopunto</k> burning-point. Def.:
Igar tre varmega; bruligar kun flamo; V-492. Ex.: Organo
inflamesas, t.e. ol esas en la morbala stando nomizita inflameso.
On havas instrumento por determinar l'inflamo-punto (temperaturo)
di diversa liquidi. <k />

<k>inflexar</k> <ex>(tr., gram.)</ex> to inflect; -<k>o</k> (<ex>gram.,
geom.</ex>) inflection, inflexion; (cl. <k>flexiono</k>, <k>modulacar</k>).

<k>influar</k> <ex>(tr., mental., phys.)</ex> to influence, sway
,bias; <k>influanta</k>, <k>influiva</k> influential(person, force,
etc.).

<k>influxo</k><ex> (biol.)</ex> influx<k /> act of flowing in;
<k>influxo nervala</k> <ex>(physial.)</ex> innervation.

<k>informar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inform, apprise, (ulu, pri
ulo); <k>informo</k> informing, news, information (given); <k>informeso</k>
information (received); <k>informesar</k> to be informed (<k>pri</k>);
<k>serchar informi</k>, <k>informigar su</k> to make inquiries,
(cf. <k>Inquestar</k>). V. exp.: vid. <k>savigar</k>.

<k>infre</k> down (as opp. to <k>supre</k>); below, at the
bottom (point in space; cl. <k>sube</k>); <k>infra</k> lowermost,
bottom; inferior<k /> lower in space, degree of importance.
quality (cl. suba, inferiora); -<k>ajo</k> lowermost part,
bottom part;<k>infrega</k>, <k>maxim infra</k> lowermost, most inferior; <k>adinfre</k>
(with motion) downmard; -<k>e di</k> at the bottom or foot of; -<k>a
 labiobarbo</k> tuft of hair on lower lip, an imperial; <k>videz
 infre</k> look below. V. exp.: videz <k>alta</k>. Ant.: <k>supre</k>.

<k>infuzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to infuse<k /> to steep (without
boiling); <ex>(surg.)</ex> to introduce a liquid into veins; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to instil, inculcate (principles, etc.).

<k>inglobar</k> <ex>(tr., chiefly medic., pharm.) </ex>to bland
together, put together, (in spherical form). Def.: Ne simple
unionar, ma mixar en un sola substanco (globo, quale indikas
l'etimologio); anke inkluzar ula substanco (farmaciala) en altra
(di altra naturo e saporo), qua envelopas e celas olu; VI-244

<k>ingranar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., mechan.)</ex> to put in (or
throw into) gear, to engage; (cf. <k>embragar</k>, <k>kuplar</k>).
Ex. Un roto ingranas (kun) altra, kande ol movas (turnigas) ica
per sua propra movo, per denti qui pulsas la denti di l'altra;
III-87.

<k>inherar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to inhere; <k>inheranta</k> inherent;
<k>inhero</k>, <k>inheranteso</k> <ex>(qual.)</ex> inherency. Ex.: Graveso
inheras en (esas inheranta ad) materio.

<k>inhibar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inhibit<k /> to check,
restran (the activity of); (jur.) to phohibit, interdict.

<k>iniciar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to initiate<k /> to introduce by
a first act, take the initiative in; to instruct in the rudiments
or pronciples; to introduce into a society, club, etc. by formal
rites; <k>inici(ad)o</k> initiating (ac); <k>iniciemeso</k> initiative
(tendency); <k>iniciala</k> initial<k /> beginning; <k>inicianto</k>, <k>iniciinto</k>, <k>iniciero</k> initiator, promotor; <k>inicialo</k> person
initiated; <k>iniciar a la misterii</k> to initiate into the
mysterios. Def.: Igar komencar, igar departar, igar debutar;
III-696. Ex.: On inicias homo a doktrino. On inicias afero,
entraprezo.

<k>injektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inject (a fluid or other
substance into something); <k>injektizar</k> to inject (a person or
thing with an injection); <k>injektajo</k> <ex>(liquid)</ex> injection;
okuli <k>injektizita</k><ex> (fig.)</ex> bloodshot eyes.

<k>injeniar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exercise one's wits, to set
one's wits to work; to contrive (tax one's ingenuity); <k>injenioza</k>, <k>injeniema</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> ingenious, clever; <k>injeniita</k> <ex>(of
things)</ex> ingenious; showing ingenuity; <k>la justa konstrukto
 di ca mashino injeniesis da me</k> the right construction of
this machine was constrived by me.

<k>inko</k> ink; <k>inkuyo</k> ink-holder, -stand, -pot; <k>inkizar</k>
to (cover with) ink; <k>inkizilo</k> ink-pad; any inking
instrument; <k>inkomakulo</k> ink blog.

<k>inkarnacar</k>, <k>eskar*</k> <ex>(intr., theol.)</ex> to be, become
incarnate; <k>inkarnaco</k> incarnation.

<k>inkasar</k> <ex>(tr., fin. and fig.)</ex> to collect, call in,
receive something which is due, chiefly commercial sense of money
but lig. of applause, compliments, flowers, etc; (kp. IV-527) <k>inkasero</k>, <k>inkasisto</k> collector; <k>inkasar checko</k> to cash a check.

<k>inkastrar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to lit in, set in, lit
together; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to enshrine; to set (a stone in bezel);
to set (a bone).

<k>inklinar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., phys., mental)</ex> to incline,
lean, slope; to be disposed;  <k>inklino</k> inclination,
incline, gradient, bow; <k>inklineso</k> inclination, favorable,
disposition, proclivity (for); <k>inklinita kapo</k> bowed head; <k>inklinanta</k>, <k>inklinita</k> inclined, sloped; prone, disposed (cf. <k>tendencanta</k>).
Ex.: Ca muro inklinas. La vinko inklinas a lia favoro. Il
inklinesas a severeso. Inklino vicioza.

<k>inkluzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>  to include, inclose, shut up
(in), insert, pen in or up; <k>inkluzo</k>, <k>inkluzeso</k>, <k>inkluzajo</k> including,
inclosure; <k>inkluzanta</k>, <k>inkluziva</k> inclosing, inclusive; <k>inkluze</k>, <k>inkluzite</k>, <k>inkluzive</k> inclusively; <k>hike inkluzita</k> herewith inclosed,
sent herewith; <k>inkluzito</k> a person shut in, recluse.

<k>inkoativa</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> inchoate. Def.: Qualifikas la
vorti (generale verbi), qui signifikas ula komenco; V-279. Ex.:
La sufixo -esk- esas inkoativa.

<k>inkombrar</k> <ex>(tr)</ex> to encumber, obstruct, block,
crowd, hinder in passing. Def. : Embarasar, impedar per l'amaso
de objekti. Ex.: La multa veturi inkombras la strado. V. exp.:
Tablo, chambro, <k>inkombrita</k>, ne povas dicesar <k>obstruktita</k>.
III-326.

<k>inkrustar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to incrust: cover with a crust;
to inlay (thin slices of fine wood, marble, etc.).

<k>inkubacar</k> <ex>(intr. med.)</ex> to be in a state of
incubation (speaking of a disease). (N.B. not used for «to
hatch»; cf. <k>kovar</k>).

<k>inkulkar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inculcate; impress on the mind
by frequent repetitions, to instil, implant (a truth, a
doctrine). V. exp.: <k>Inkulkar</k> kredo, bona mori, esas
penetrigar li profunde e dureme en la mento e kustumo;
IV-136.

<k>inkursar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make a incursion: enter into a
territory with hostile intent, to raid.

<k>inocenta</k> innocent, guileless, artless(cf <k>senkulpa</k>).
Def.: Qua tote ne konocas la malajo; IV-79.

<k>inquestar</k> <ex>(tr., adminis., parl., jur.)</ex> to make
inquiry (into), make inquest, inquisition, investigate; <k>inquestanta
 judiciisto</k> examining magistrate; <k>komitato di inquesto</k>
commitee of inquiry. V. exp.: On devas ne uzar (Quale la ???
tentesas facar) <k>inquesto</k> vice <k>questiono</k>, kande on
parolas pri simpla questiono, <k>Inquesto</k> esas ensemblo de
questioni, de explori, de serchi, qua facesas exemple (e
precipue) da policisto o judikisto (qua en ta kazo nomizesas <k>inquestito</k>).
Pro to ta vorto havas impliko judiciala, qua riskas esar
neagreabla o nepolita, kande on parolas pri questiono, quan
privato directas a privato; V-223.

<k>inquizitoro</k> <ex>(hist.)</ex> inquisitor: an officier of
the inquisition; (cf. <k>inquestanto</k>, <k>inquizitorero</k>).

<k>insertar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to insert, put in, set in; <k>insertajo</k>
what is inserted; <k>inserturo</k> <ex>(result.) </ex>insertion.

<k>insidiar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to set a trap for,
to lay snare for (<k>ulu</k>); <k>insidiema</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex>
insidious, sly, crafty, wily; <k>insidioza</k> <ex>(of things)</ex>
full of snares.

<k>insinuar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to insinuate; to introduce gently,
wind into, worm into; to hint, intimate, suggested indirectly; <k>insinuajo</k>
insinuation, innuendo; <k>insinuar</k> <k>la fingro aden vunduro</k>
to insinuate a finger in a wound; <k>insinuar bona sentimenti</k> to
instil good sentiments; <k>l'aquo insinuas su tra la pori</k> the
water insinuates itself into the pores; <k>perfida insinuo</k> a
ferfidious insinuation.

<k>insipida</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> insipid, tasteless (cf. <k>sensapora</k>);
<k>insipidajo</k> a tasteless thing; (saying) platitude; III 604.

<k>insistar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to insist: to urge or press
earnestly, to lay stress (<k>en</k>, <k>pri</k>, <k>sur</k>); (N.B. Not
"to demand", cf <k>postular</k>); <k>insistanta</k>, <k>insistema</k>
insistant, urgent, earnest; <k>insiste</k> insistently, earnestly.
Def. : Perservar demandar. V. exp. On <k>insistas</k> en
demando prego. On <k>persistas</k> en stando (mem pure
materiala). On <k>obstinas</k> en volo, deziro od opiniono;
II-648.

<k>inspirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inspire (by devine instruction,
poetic spirit, ideas); <k>inspirajo</k> that which inspires; <k>inspireso</k>
inspiration (received). V. Exp. vid. <k>entuziasmo</k>.

<k>instalar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to instal; induct a person into an
office; <ex>(mechan.)</ex> to setup or lix in position for use or
service. Ex.: Instalar episkopo. Instalo di mashino.

<k>instanco</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> instance: process of a suit; <k>korto
 di unesma instanco</k> court of first instance.

<k>instanto</k> instant, moment; <k>instantala</k> instantaneous: <k>instantale</k>
instantly, momentarily; <k>instantaleso</k> instantaneousness; <k>instantalajo</k>
an instantaneous object <ex>(as in photog.)</ex>, <k>omnainstante</k>
every instant; <k>ca instante</k> this instant.

<k>instigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to instigate, incite (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ad</k>;
ordinarily in bad sense); <k>instigata da</k> instigate by (<k>ulu</k>);
(cf. <k>incitar</k>). Def.: Penar por  persuadar ulu facar
ulo; III-417. Ex. Vu instiguis il facar ta krimino. Instigar ulu
laborar, (a) revolto. Instigo di la diablo.

<k>instilar*</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to instil: (pharm. med.) to
infuse by drops; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to infuse slowly into the mind.

<k>instinto</k> instinct; <k>instintala</k>, <k>instintatra</k> instinctive; <k>instinte</k>
instinctively. Def.: Impulso naturala.

<k>institucar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to institute: to establish or
set up, to found; to appoint to office; <k>institucar su</k> to appoint
oneself; <k>institucuro</k> institution. Ex.: Jesu Kristo dicesas
institucir la sep sakramenti Instituco (E. appointment) di
judiciisto.

<k>instituto</k> institute: a literary, scientific or
philosophical society.

<k>instruciono</k> (practical) instruction(s), direction(s)
(how to do or use someting). V. exp.:vid. sav-igar.

<k>instruktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to instruct: to impart knowledge
to; to teach, educate; <k>instrukt(ad) o</k> instruction (given); <k>instrukteso</k>
instruction (received); <k>instruktiva</k> instructive; <k>instruktar rejido
 guvernar</k> to teach a prince how to govern; <k>instruktar per
 exempli</k> to teach by examples. V. exp.:vid.sav-igar, edukar.

<k>instrumento</k> instrument, tool, implement; <k>instrumentala</k>
instrumental: relating to i.s. (as in. i. music); conducive to
some end, helpful; <k>instrumentalo</k> (Anglo-Saxon and Russian grammar)
instrumental case; <k>instrumentizar</k> (music) le set (<k>ulo</k>) to
instrumental music; <k>instrumentizo</k> (music) instrumentation; (cf. <k>orkestrizar</k>).

<k>insultar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to insult: treat with abuse,
insolence or contempt, by word or action, to affront, taunt, call
names, abuse rail at.

<k>intalio</k> <ex>(engr.)</ex> intaglio. Def.: Gemo grabita kave
(inverse di kameo); VI-528.

<k>integra</k> all parts properly united and present, whole,
entire, complete, intact, integral; <k>integra nombro</k>, <k /> (od, <k>integro</k>):
<ex>(arith.)</ex> integer; <k>integreso</k> integrity (entirely); <k>integre</k>
in full, bodily. Def.: Ne-tushita, ne-lezita, havanta omna sua
parti e membri; V-744.

<k>intelektar</k> <ex>(tr., philos. and general)</ex> to
understand, comprehend, or know (<k>ulo</k>) by the intellect
alone (opposite of to know by sensation, feeling); <k>intelekto</k>
intellection, cognition, comprehension, intellect, intelligence
(cf. <k>kompreno</k>, i<k>nteligenteso</k>); <k>intelektala</k>
intellectual: relating to process of thought; <k>intelektoza</k>
intellectual: gifted with reasoning power; <k>intelektebla</k>
intelligible: that can be known by intellection, opp. to
sensible. Ex.: On parolas pri la mondo «intelektebla»
opozata a la mondo "sentebla". Do on devas
dicar «intelektebla» (qua povas esar objecto dil
intelekto). intelekto esas l'ago intelektar; IV-231-2. V.exp.: Me
intelektas problemo. Me komprenas vua sentivesopri la morto di
vua patro.

<k>inteligenta</k> intelligent: mentally acute; <k>inteligenteso</k>
intelligence (cf. <k>intelekto</k>, <k>konoco</k>, <k>savo</k>). Ex.: Il esas
tre inteligenta employato. Puero di mikra inteligenteso.

<k>intencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to intend, purpose; have in view,
in mind (cf <k>projectar</k>); <k>intenco</k> intent(ion), purpose; <k>intencala</k>
intentional; <k>intencata</k>, <k>intencita</k> intended; <k>intencanta</k>
intentioned, disposed (<k>bone o male</k>); <k>intence</k>, <k>kun intenco</k>
intentionally, on purpose. Ex.: Me facis lo kun bona intenco. Il
esas homo bone intencanta. me intencas irar morge.

<k>intendanto</k> intendant: one who has charge of some public
business: a superintendent (of public building), colonial or
district administrator or treasurer, or the like; as intendant of
marine; intendant of finance; <k>intendanteso</k>, <k>intendantevo</k>, <k>intendantio</k> intendancy.

<k>intensa</k> intense; <k>intenseso</k> intensity; <k>intensigar</k>
to intensify; <k>intensiganta</k>, <k>intensiva</k> inttensifying, intensive.
Ant.: <k>febla</k>.

<k>inter</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> between, betwixt (of time and
space); among (of persons and things; cf. <k>meze</k>); <k>inter
 nokto e matino</k> between night and morning; <k>inter la
 nacioni</k> among the nations; <k>Sirius esas la maxim lumoza
 inter la fixa steli</k> Sirius is the brightest among the fixed
stars; (denoting reciprocity, exchange, division among): <k>la
 pueri ludas inter su</k> the children play with each other: <k>li
 kambiis sua redingoti inter su</k> they exchanged coats (between
themselves); <k>la havajo esis dividata inter la parenti</k> the
property was divided among the relations; (cf. Talmey's Text
Book, p.87, 110).

<k>interakto</k> interlude, act between acts; interval between
acts.

<k>interceptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to intercept. V. exp.: On <k>interceptas</k>
letri, telegrafaji, telefonaji. Per to on ne necese haltigas oli
nek impedas atingar la skopo; III-604.

<k>intercesar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to intercede, plead (with or
for); put in a good word (for).

<k>interdiktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to interdict, prohibit, forbid;
<k>interdiktata</k>, <k>interdiktita;</k> forbidden, illicit.

<k>interesar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to interest (<k>ulu</k>, <k>pri</k>, <k>ad</k>):
(indicates excitement of feeling accompanying special attention
to some object); <k>interesar su</k>, <k>havar intereso</k> to i. one-self, have an
i. in, be concerned; <k>intereso en (o</k>, <k>pri) botaniko</k> i. in
botany; <k>questioni di intereso</k> questions of interest; <k>interesanta</k>, <k>interesoza</k>, <k>interesiva</k> interesting (book, news, person, etc.); <k>ca
 libro esas neinteresanta</k> this book is without interest;
(cf. <k>interesto</k>).

<k>interesto</k> interest (objective interest, pecuniary,
financial); <k>interestoza</k> advantageaous, profitable; <k>interesto
 kompozita</k> compound interest; <k>interestifar</k> to bear i.; <k>sen
 interesta</k> disinterested; (cf. <k>interesar</k>) (Note: It is
necessary to distinguish clearly between <k>interesar</k> and <k>interesto</k>.
<k>Intereso</k> indicates, loosely, lively sympathy or curiosity;
a book or a subject interesas. <k>Interesto</k> relates to
proprietary right or share; it is used in such sentences as: «it
is to my interest to do it»; «to promote one's interest»;
«money bears interest»; etc.

<k>intereventar</k> <ex>(intr., of things, events)</ex> to
happen, occur (in between); (cf. <k>intervenar</k>); <k>plura
 decidi (inter)eventis en la proceso</k> serveral judgments were
pronounced in the course of the lawsuit; <k>multa kozi
 (inter)eventis dum la negociado</k> many things happened during
the negotiations.

<k>interferar</k> <ex>(intr., physical)</ex>, to interfere <k>(kun)</k>.
(N.B. for «to interfere», when speaking of persons; cf. <k>mixar
 su</k>, <k>intervenar</k>).

<k>interferdeko</k> a deck between, lower deck, space between
decks.

<k>interimo</k> interim: time intervening; <k>interime</k> for the
time being, ad interim, in the mean time; <k>interimala presidentato</k>
provisional, temporary president.

<k>interkomuna</k> party: belonging in common to several
persons; as, <k>havajo intera</k> common property.

<k>interkonsento</k> mutual agreement, understanding (F. <k>entente</k>);
<k>intero kordiala</k> entente coardiale.

<k>interkonsultar</k> <ex>(it. intr.)</ex> to hold a
consultation, deliberate together.

<k>interlineo</k> a line between; space between (lines); <k>interizar</k>
to interline; <ex>(print.)</ex> to lead; <k>intera</k> interlinear; <k>interajo</k>, <k>interizo</k>, <k>interizuro</k> interlineation.

<k>intermitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be intermittent: cease at
intervals.

<k>interna</k> internal, inward, interior; <k>internajo</k> the
interior, inside; <k>interne</k> inwardly, internally, <k>interneso</k>
inwardness; <k>intern(ul)o</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> boarder (in school);
interne (in hospital); <k>internerio</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> boarding
or private school; <k>ministro di l'interna aferi</k> Minister
of the Interior, Home Secretary; <k>il esas en l'internajo di la
 domo</k> he is inside the house; <k>de interne ad extere</k>
form within outwards, inside out.

<k>interogativa</k>, <k>interogativo*</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> interrogative. Def.: La
questionala partikli (adjectivi, pronomi ed adverbi); V-279.

<k>interpelar</k> <ex>(tr., parlm.)</ex> to interpellate: to
question formally for explanation, put a question to.

<k>interpolar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to interpolate: to insert, as a
spurious of foreign word or passage); <ex>(math.)</ex> to
interpolate; <k>interpolajo</k> interpolation (word, passage), spurious
passage.

<k>interpozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to place (<k>ulo</k>) between,
insert interpose, intercalate (a day); (cf. <k>intervenar</k>, <k>mediacar</k>). <k>interpretar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to interpret; to explain what is obscure and ambiguous in a
writing, construe (cf. <k>tradukar</k>); <k>misar</k>: to
misinterpret, misconstrue.

<k>interprima (nombri)</k><k /> prime to one
another: numbers without any common divisor.

<k>interruptar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to interrupt:
destroy the continuity of, break off, stop.

<k>intersequar (su)</k><k /> to follow, succeed
each other; <k>o</k><k /> sequence; <k>e</k><k />
consecutively, in succession; <k>anta</k><k />
consecutive, successive.

<k>intershokar</k><k /> to strike against one
another, to run foul of each other.

<k>interspaco</k><k /> interspace, a space between
places, intermediate distance.

<k>intervenar</k><k /> <ex>(intr., of persons)</ex>
to intervene, interpose, interfere; (cf. <k>intereventar</k>); <k>intero</k><k />
intervention, interference, interposition; <k>des</k>, <k>neinterveno</k><k />
non-intervention. Ex.: Intervenar en konflikto, en disputo.
Armizita interveno.

<k>intervido</k><k /> mutual sight or view; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
interview: meeting for conference; (cf. <k>interviuvo</k>).

<k>intestata</k><k /> intestate; <k>intestata heredanto</k><k />
<ex>(jur.)</ex> abintestate heir(ess). Def.: Ta qua heredis sen
testamento. V-279.

<k>intestino</k><k /> intestine, gut; <k>intestinala</k>:
intestinal; <k>intestini</k>: intestines, entrails, bowels: <k>intestino tenua</k><k />
small intestine.

<k>intima</k><k /> intimate: inmost, inward; near,
close; close in friendship, familiar, bosom; <k>intim(ul)o</k>: i.
person, close friend; <k>intimeso</k><k /> intimacy, <k>intimajo</k>:
inward part, heart (of a subject); <k>la naturo intima di kozi</k><k />
the inward nature of things; <k>la sentimenti maxim intima</k><k />
the most secret sentiments; <k>relati intima</k><k />
close relations: <k>amiko intima</k><k /> intimate
friend.

<k>intonar</k><k /> <ex>(tr., mus.)</ex> to intone; <k>inton(ad)o</k><k />
<ex>(mus. and voice expression)</ex> intonation (cf. <k>modulaco</k>).

<k>intoxikar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to poison, drug,
envenom; (N.B. not E. to intoxicate with liquor; cf. <k>ebriigar</k>);
V. exp.: <k>Intoxikar</k> expresas ido plu general kam <k>venenizar</k>.
On povas drinkar veneno sen esar intoxikita; IV-517.

<k>intradoso</k><k /> <ex>(arch.)</ex> intrados:
interior curve of an arch.

<k>intrigar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex>to intrigue: to
contrive by secret artifice; make plots; scheme; <k>intrigizar</k><k />
to complicate, entangle by intrigues.

<k>intrikar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tangle,
entangle, embroil, implicate <k>(ulu</k>, <k>en ulo)</k>; to make <k>(ulo)</k>
intricate.

<k>introduktar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to introduce <k>(ulu)</k>,
to bring <k>(ulo)</k> into notice; to preface; (cf. <k>enduktar</k>, <k>prizentar</k>); <k>introdukto</k>, <k>introdukturo</k><k /> introducing,
introduction, preamble (cf. <k>prefaco</k>); <k>introduktala</k><k />
preliminary. Ex.: Me volas introduktar il che vu. Donar
introdukto-letro ad ulu. Ca libro servos kom introdukto a la
temo. III-71.

<k>intruzar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to intrude,
obtrude, <k>(su en ulo)</k>; to interfere, meddle; <ex>(geol.)</ex>
to enter, or cause to enter, by force.

<k>inundar</k> <ex>(tr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to inundate,
overflow, flood, swamp. Ex.: Nil inundas la planajo. La inundo di
la Romana imperio da la barbari.

<k>invadar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to invade. Ex.: La armeo invadis la
teritorio di sua enemiki. Mala herbi invadas la gardeno.

<k>invalida</k> invalid: infirm, disabled; of no legal force,
void, null; <k>invalid(ul)o</k> an i.; <ex>(milit.)</ex> a soldier
disabled for active service; <k>invaliderio</k> establ. for disabled
persons.

<k>invektivar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inveigh against; <k>invektivo</k>
invective. V.exp.: <k>Invektivo</k> esas nek reprimando, nek
insulto, ma atako per parolo ; ol povas esar decanta ed
eloquenta. La Quousque tandem esas invektivo da Cicero a
Catilina; IV-513-514.

<k>inventar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to invent: find out something new
(a process, a machine); <k>inventuro</k> an invention.

<k>inventariar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to take an inventory of : to
inventory; (com.) to take stock (of).

<k>inversa</k> inverse, inverted; <k>inverso</k>, <k>inversajo</k> the reverse,
the contrary, opposite; (cf. <k>reverso</k>); <k>inversigar</k> to
invert, reverse, to put upside down; <k>inversigo</k>, <k>inversigeso</k>
inversion; <k>inverse</k> vice-versa; <k>raporto inversa</k> inverse
ratio; <k>inversigar la natural ordino dil vorti en frazo</k>; to
invert the natural order of words in a sentence.

<k>investar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to invest (with authority, office;
cf <k>kolokar</k>). Def.: Provizar per ofico o titulo; IV-167.

<k>invitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to invite; ask to go to some place
or to do something; V. exp.: <k>Invito</k> esas polita prego por
asistar kunveno, repasto, balo, festo, e.c.; III-417.

<k>involuciono</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> involution; (bot.) state of
being rolled spirally inward.

<k>Ioniala</k> Ionic: relating to Ionia; <k>Ioniano</k> an
Ionian.

<k>ipsa</k> self (-same); <k>ipse</k> (by) self; <k>ipso</k> the
same thing. Note: <k>Ispa</k> is ordinarily used in connection
with a personal pronoun; as: <k>me ipsa</k> I myself; <k>li
 ipsa</k> they themselves; but can be used with substantives; as:
<k>la rejo ipsa</k> the king himself; <k>la kozo ipsa</k> the
thing itself; <k>de la botelo ipsa</k> from the selfsame bottle;
it sould always be placed next to the word it modifies. Ex: La
mastro inspektis ipse la domo. La mastro ipsa inspektis la domo.
Il ipsa volas parolar kun me. Il pozas su ipsa avan la pordo.

<k>irar</k> <ex>(intr., tr.)</ex> to go, be going; <k>iro</k>
going; passage. Note: <k>Irar</k> is often compounded, as: <k>ekirar</k>, <k>misirar</k>, <k>pedirar</k>, <k /> etc. It sometimes takes a direct object,
as: <k>li iris penigiva voyo</k> they went a wearisome way.
Def.: Diplasar su de un loko ad altra per irga moyeno; IV-464.
Ex.: On iras de Paris a London, parte per fervoyo, parte per
navo.

<k>iracar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be angry, cross <k>(kontre);</k>
<k>iraco</k> anger, irritation, ire, wraith; <k>iracanta</k>, <k>iracema</k>, <k>iracoza</k>
angry, irascible, choleric, testy, cross, peevish; <k>iracigar</k>
to anger, incense, exasperate, irritate (ulu); <k>iraceskar</k> to
become angry, get in a temper; <k>iracemeso</k> irascibility; <k>iracigania</k>, <k>iraciva</k> exasperating, vexing.

<k>iradiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to irradiate. Def.: Optikal
fenomeno per qua la parti plu lumoza o lumizita invadas la parti
min lumoza e restriktas oli; IV-200. <k />

<k>irga</k> any (whatever): relating to something or someone
indefinite (cf. <k>ula</k>); <k>irgo</k> anything (whatever); <k>irgu</k>
anyone (no matter who); <k>irgu qua</k> (od, <k>igre qua</k>):
whoever, whosoever; <k>irge quale</k>, <k>irge maniere</k> anyhow, at any
rate, no matter how; <k>irgaloke</k>, <k>irgube</k> anywhere
(whatever), wherever; <k>irgekande</k> no matter when, whenever; <k>irgatempe</k>
at any time; <k>irgequanta</k>, <k>irge</k> in any quantity; <k>irga qua
 motivin vu havas por plendar</k> whatever reasons you may have
to complain; <k>igre quanto kurajon il manifestis</k> however
much courage he manifested; <k>irege quala esos la vetero</k> no
matter what the weather is; <k>irge quanta pekunion il havas</k>
no matter how much money he has; <k>irge quan lu renkontris</k>
whomsover he met: <k>irge quante mikra la donacajo</k> however
small the gift.

<k>irigacar</k> <ex>(tr., agri.)</ex> to irrigate. V. exp.: <k>Irigaco</k>
esas brancho di agrokultivado. Ol aquizas tota agri, formayi,
distrikti per fluigar aquo de riveri, lagi, e.c. en artivicala
kanali a la kultivoloko: IV-459-460.

<k>iriso</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> iris; <ex>(fig.)</ex> colors of the
rainbow (cf <k>cielarko</k>); <k>irisizar</k> to give the hues of
the rainbow, become iridescent; <k>irisoza</k>, <k>irisizita</k> iridescent.

<k>iritar</k> <ex>(tr. physiol.)</ex> to irritate, inflame, fret;
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to annoy, exasperate.

<k>iruptar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to invade (with great power, with
large numbers); to burst (in), rush in (as enemies, or like
enemies). Ex. : La barbari iruptis en la Romana imperio. Ta turbo
iruptis (E. burst) en la chambro.

<k>(i)ta</k> that, those (or "this, these" where the
nearness or remoteness of an object pointed out is irrelevant; <k>(i)to</k>
(<ex>obj.</ex> <k>ton</k>): that (thing); <k>(i)ti</k> those; <k>ta
 soldato e lua kamarado tre konkordas pri omno</k> that (or this)
soldier and his comrade much agree about everything; <k>ta qua</k>
he, she, who; <k>to quo</k> that which; <k>ti qui</k> those
who: <k>ta qua volas vivar felice</k>, <k>devas esar vertuoza</k> who
whould live (he, she, who will live) happily should be virtuous; <k>to
 quo plezas a vu maxim ofte plezaz a me</k> what (that which)
pleases you generally (most often) pleases me; after two mouns
already used in pointing out objects, ita refers to the first
(cf. ca); <k>ka tu preferas ica od ita kavalo ? Ita esas plu
 forta</k>, <k>ma ica plu bela;</k> do you prefer this or that horse ?
that (one) is (the) stronger, but this (one) is (the) more
handsome; <k>nek ica ita flori plezas a me</k> neither these nor
those flowers please me; when it is desirable to indicate the
gender of the object pointed at, the forms: <k>ilta</k>, <k>ilti; elta</k>, <k>elti; olta</k>, <k>olti</k> are used; <k>ilti qui konocas me</k> those
(masc.) who are acquainted with me; <k>elta quan me amas ne amas
 me</k> she whom i love does not love me; <k>kande olca (ol) esis
 trovita</k> when it had been found; where euphony permits
the «i» is omitted; as: <k>ta</k>, <k>to</k>, <k>ti.</k>

<k>iterar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to iterate, reiterate, repeat; to do
two or more times what one has arleady done before; (N.B. refers
to all acts, not merely words); <k>iterala</k> (manner) iterative,
repetitious; <k>itere</k> again anew, once more, over again. V.
exp. vid. repetar.

<k>itinerario</k> itinerary, route. Def. Voyo sequanta, sequita
o sequota da ula voyajero; V-280..

<k>izabela</k> isabel(la) colored: a brownish yellow or light
buff color; <ex>(of horses)</ex> light-bay. <k /><ex />

<k>izolar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to isolate: place apart from its
environment; <ex>(elec., etc.)</ex> to insulate; <k>izolilo</k>, <k>izolivo</k>
<ex>(phys.)</ex> insulator; <k>izolita</k> isolated, alone;
insulated. Ex.: La domo esas en izolita loko en foresto. Egoismo
izolas homo. Metal-filo izolila.

<k>waranto</k> (<ex>jur.</ex>) warrant; <k>(dogan) waranto</k> (<ex>com.</ex>) dock-warrant. 
Def.: (<ex>com.</ex>) Recev-atesto pri vari pozata en dogan-depozeyo; II-77.

<k>warfo</k> wharf, jetty; <k>warfeto</k> landing-stage, gang-way. V. exp.: <k>Warfo</k> 
esas nek <k>digo</k>, nek <k>kayo</k>, nam ol ne esas masiva, ma speco de eshafodo 
formacita ek ligna o fera trabi; II-712.

<k>weldar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to weld, forge together (iron, steel); <k>weldo</k>, <k>welduro</k> 
a weld, welding. V. exp.: La F. S. havas nur un vorto por <k>soldar</k> e <k>weldar</k>, 
a la I. usas ofte la sama por la du diferanta juntamieri. La <k>soldo</k> e la
<k>brazo</k> esas fakte du speci di glutino di du metalspeci per konvenanta metal, 
qua esas en la soldo <k>soldostano</k>, en la brazo <k>kupro</k>. Pro la tre diferanta 
fuz-temperaturo di stano e kupro, on soldas ye cirkume 300° C. ed on brazas ye cirkume 
1000° C. On povas <k>soldar</k> e <k>brazar</k> omna metali, anke du diversa. Ma 
on povas <k>weldar</k> nur tre poka de li, ex. loro, la fero (se ol ne kontenas 
troa karbo), e.c., e nur du peci di la sama metalo. La <k>weldo</k> konsistas en 
varmigo til komencanta fuzo e posa kunbato per marteli, de quo rezultas junturo 
preske tam forta kam la solida metalo; III-87.

<k>westo</k> west; <k>westa</k>, <k>westala</k> westerly: of or relating to the w.; <k>weste</k> 
(direction) westward, in, to the w.; <k>ad weste</k> (with motion) westward.

<k>tabako</k> tobacco; <k>tabakuyo</k>, <k>tabakbuxo</k>, <k>tabaksako</k>, <k>tabakpoto</k> t.
holder; <k>tabakvendeyo</k> t. dealer; <k>sniflar tabako</k> to take
snuff; <k>sniflo tabako</k>snuff; <k>tobakosnifledo</k>, <k>tabakajo</k>a
pinch of snuff.

<k>tabelo</k> a flat surface for writing, painting, drawing,
etc., hence that which is thereon: table (of contents), list; <k>tabelo
 di kontenajo</k>table of contents; <k>tabelo logaritmala</k>
logarithmic table; <k>kronologiala tabelo</k> chronological table; <k>nigra
 tabelo</k>blackboard; <k>tabelo vakua</k> «tabula rasa»<k /> a
blank tablet; <k>la lego tabeli</k> tables of the law; <k>honor
 tabelo</k> roll of hono(u)r; <k>tabeleto</k> tablet, V. exp.: <k>Tabelo</k>
esas omna plata surfaco, qua expozesas a la vido e montras ulo;
ne nur la <k>tabelo</k> di materii di libro, ma omna kadro, en
qua on expozas nomi od irgaspeca objekti; la nigra tabelo, sur
qua la matematikisti skribas; do anke la pikturi, segun quante li
esas movebla (ne adheranta a muro, ma pendita e kadrizita). <k>Tabulo</k>
esas surfaco plana e horizontala, qua dividas armoro, biblioteko,
e.c. e servas por suportar kozi. Ol esas generala ek ligno; ma
quale sempre, lua skopo multe plu importas kam lua materio. <k>Tablo</k>
anke esas plano horizontala, ma suportata da la sulo, kontre ke <k>tabulo</k>esas parto di moblo, e generale diplasebla vertikale; VI-604.

<k>tabernaklo</k> <ex>(Hebrew hist.)</ex> tabernacle, tent for
ark of covenant <ex>(R.C. rel.)</ex> receptacle of the consecrated
vessels; (<ex>fig</ex>.) holy place; <k>tabernaklofesto</k> feast of the
tabernacles.

<k>tablo</k> <ex>(furniture)</ex> table; <k>tablotuko</k> t.
cloth; <k>garnisar la tablo</k> to lay, set the t.; <k>sidar an tablo</k>to sit or be at the t.; <k>labor tablo</k> work t.; <k>ludo
 tablo</k> play-(card-) t.; <k>komuna</k>(od, <k>gasto</k>) <k>tablo</k>
«table d’hôte». V. exp.: vid. <k>tabelo.</k>

<k>tabulo</k> shelf (for books, etc.); <k>tabularo</k> shelving; <k>marmorao</k>
marble slab; <k>tabuleto de chokolado</k> cake (slab) of chocolate,
V.exp: vid. <k>tabelo.</k>

<k>tabureto</k> stool: small seat without back (cf <k>stulo</k>);
<k>tabureto planala</k> music s.; <k>pedo tabureto</k> foot s.

<k>tacar</k> <ex>(tr., of persons)</ex> to say nothing about,
pass (<k>ulo</k>) over in silence, not to say (<k>ulo</k>); <ex>(intr.)
</ex>to be silent: not to speak, to hold one’s tongue; <k>tacigar</k>
to silence, hush (<k>ulu</k>), to reduce (<k>ulu</k>) to silence;
<k>taco</k> silence, hush; <k>tacata</k>, <k>tacita</k> tacit, implied; <k>tacera</k>
taciturn, silent (person); <k>tacereso</k> taciturnity; <k>tacez</k>
be silent; hush! Ex.: Uli parolis, uli tacis. Tacigar la pueri.
Lu tacis (pri) lua aferi. Tacar la vereso (E.: to preserve
silence concerning the (whole) truth, the full facts). V. exp.:
vid. <k>silencar.</k>

<k>tago</k> tag: a metallic point at the end of string; tag (of
lace); <k>tagizar</k> to tag (lace, etc.) i.e. fit with a point; <k>tagokordono</k>aiguilette (as worn by the military, on livery of servants).

<k>tako</k> <ex>(nav.) </ex>cleat. Def.:<k />korpo T-forma,
fixigita per la bazo di la T: ol utilesas ex. por ligar la navi
per kordo (<k>amari</k>); VI-603

<k>takigrafar*</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to tachygraph: write in
shorthand; <k>takigrafo</k> tachygraphy: stenography (especially of the
ancient Greeks and Romans).

<k>takimetro*</k> tachymeter, tachometer: instrument for
measuring velocity, speed-indicator, -meter.

<k>takto</k> <ex>(phys.)</ex> sense of touch, feeling; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
tact: nice discernment of what is fit, proper; <k>taktoza</k>tactful.

<k>taktismo*</k> <ex>(biol.)</ex> influence exerted by certain
substances upon development of unicellular organisms.

<k>tala</k> such, like: of that kind; <k>tale</k> so, in such a
manner; <k>e ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> so that, in such a way that; <k>talmaniere</k>
thus, so, in such a way; <k>tala quala</k> such as; <k>quala
 patro</k>, <k>tala filio</k> like father, like child; <k>il esas tala</k>, <k>quala il esas olim</k>he is as he always was; <k>e tale pluse</k>
and so on; <k>metar la shui tala quala li esis</k> to put on the
shoes (in the condition) as they were (then). Ex.: Tala konduto
esas netolerebla. Viro tala kam me. Lu parolis tal-maniere ke me
kredis lu.

<k>taliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut (out), carve, trim, prune (so
as to give a certain form to), to shape (cloth, wood, metal,
ivory, etc.); <k>tali</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k>, <k>taliuro</k> shaping, cut.
Def.: Donar ad objekto specala, defiinita formo segun ula reguli
o por ula skopo; III-11.

<k>taliono*</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> retaliation (cf. <k>reprezalo</k>);
<k>lego di taliono</k> law of retaliation (lex talionis).

<k>talioro</k> tailor; <k>talioro por mulieri</k> a woman’s
t.; <k>taliorino</k> tailoress.

<k>talono</k> heel (of foot, of shoe); <ex>(fig.)</ex> anything
heel-shaped; as, heel of a keel, of a pipe, etc.; <k>talonalo</k>
h.-piece; <k>talonecitar</k> to urge (a horse) with the h.s.

<k>taluso</k> a slope, declivity; <ex>(of R.R.) </ex>embankment;<ex>
(fort.)</ex> talus; <k>talusa</k>, <k>taluse</k> sloping, shelving; <k>talusigar</k>
to slope (<k>ulo</k>)<k /> <k>talusa rivo</k> steep bank, bluff.

<k>talvego*</k> <ex>(physiog.)</ex> thalweg: a line following the
lowest part of a valley, whether underwater or not; a line of
continuous maximum descent from any point on a land surface, or
that cutting all contours at right angles (Webster), <ex>(gen.)</ex>
river bed.

<k>tam</k> <ex>(adv.) </ex>as (much, etc.; comparative sense;
followed by adjective, adverb, or <k>kam</k>); <k>tam…kam</k>as….as;
<k>tam richa kam</k> as rich as; <k>tam longe kam</k> as long
as (followed by a verb); <k>tam ofte kam</k> as often as
(followed by verb). Ex.: Lu havas tam multa libri kam vu; Me
savas to tam bone kam vu. Li esas tam simila kam du pizi. Tam
longe kam il vivas. Tam fore kam on povas vidar.

<k>tamburo</k> drum; <k>tamburego</k> a big d.; <k>tamburagar</k>, <k>tamburplear</k>
<ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to d., beat the drum; <k>tambur(ag)isto</k>
drummer; <k>tamburestro</k>drum-major; <k>mi tamburo</k> tambourine:
shallow drum with bells (cf. <k>tamburino</k>).

<k>tamburino</k> tambour: a small and long snare drum. V. exp.:
<k>mitamburo</k>.

<k>tamen</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> yet, however, nevertheless, still.
Ex.: Lu ne esas bona, tamen me helpos lu. Quankam la pueri ne
esas sempre jentila, tamen omna bon-kordia homo esas atraktata a
li.

<k>tampar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tamp (as with a hammer), to ram
(as with a pile-driver, rammer).

<k>tampono</k> stopper, tampon: plug of cotton, wood, metal,
etc.; <ex>(artil.)</ex> tampion; (cf. <k>stopilo</k>); <k>tamponizar</k>
to plug (<k>ulo</k>) with a tampon, to stopper.

<k>tandeme</k> in tandem: in single line (not abreast): <k>tandemveturo</k>
carriage with horses in tandem; <k>tandembiciklo</k> tandem bicycle.

<k>tangar</k> <ex>(intr., nav.)</ex> to heave, pitch: rising and
falling of bow and stern of ship or boat; <k>tang</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k>
pitch(ing).

<k>tanko</k> tank; <ex>(fig., milit.)</ex> tank. Def.: Vazo
metala klozita o klozebla hermetike (ne kuvo qua esas apertita a
l’aero); III-491.

<k>tanta</k>, <k>tantae</k> so (great, much, good, etc.); indicates an
indefinite or great quantity, degree, number; pl: so many; (cf. <k>quanta</k>, <k>tam</k>); <k>tantae ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> so much that (N.B. Note
the use of <k>ke</k>, not <k>kam</k> after <k>tante</k>); <k>tantaesma</k>
proportional; <k>tantaimo</k> proportional part; <k>tanto po
 persono</k> so much per head, per person); <k>tantae plu bone ke</k>
all the better because; <k>tantae ofte</k> so often; <k>tantae multa
 soldati</k> so many soldiers; <k>tantae longe ke</k> so long that; <k>tantae
 ofte ke</k> so often that; <k>tantae plu…ke</k> the more so
as; <k>tantae plu…quante plu</k> so much more as; <k>me esas
 tante malada ke</k> I am so sick that; <k>tantae min…quante
 min…</k> so much less than. (kp. VII-153, 291, 474). Ex.:
Nultempe me vidis tanta homi. Tanta galanteso, tanta esprito esas
bona signi. Me tante amis el ke…Ne kurez tante rapide. Ube
vu restis tante longe hiere vespere?

<k>tapar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to (screw-) tap (for insertion
of screw or making thread for putting on a nut), to worm; <k>tapilo</k>
tap-borer, screw-tap.

<k>tapeto</k> tapestry: woven hangings for walls; <k>tapetizar</k>
to hang (<k>ulo</k>) with t.; <k>tapetifar</k> to make t.; <k>tapetpapero</k>
t. paper; <k>tapetledro</k> leather t.

<k>tapiso</k> carpet; cover for billiard table; <k>tapiseto</k>
small c.; rug; cloth for table, etc.; <k>tapisisto</k> upholsterer; <k>tablo
 tapiso</k> (fancy) table-cover (cf. <k>tablotuko</k>); <k>lito tapiso</k>
bedspread; <k>tapisizar</k>to c.

<k>tapotar</k> <ex>(tr., tech., med.)</ex> to percuss (as in
massage); (gen. sense) to tap.

<k>taro</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> tare: an allowance made for the
weight of the container of goods; <k>tarmezurar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex>
to tare: ascertain the amount of tare in (<k>ulo</k>); <k>sen
 tara</k>, <k>tare</k>net (weight).

<k>tarda</k>, <k>tardae</k> late, tardy, belated, behindhand; <k>tardaesma</k>
<ex>(tendency)</ex> tardy; <k>tardaesar</k> to be late, be behindhand;
<k>tardaigar</k> to retard, delay, put off, protract, spin out; <k>tardaeskar</k>
to become belated; get behindhand; <k>tardaeskinta</k> in arrears; <k>plu
 tarda</k>, <k>tardae</k> later; <k>tardaigar horlojo</k> to put back a clock;
Ex.: Plu bona tarde kam nultempe. Tardesma frukto. La puero esis
tarda. Me venos plu tarde. La horlojo tardesas (per kin minuti).
Me kushas me tre tarde. La treno esas tardigita. Tardigar la pago
(E. to get in arrears). Ant.: <k>frua</k>.

<k>tarifo</k> tariff; customs duty; <k>tarifizar</k> to put a t.
on (<k>ulo</k>).
<k>tarjo</k> targe(t): species of shield or buckler.

<k>tarto</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> tart (cf. <k>torto</k>); <k>krem
 tarto</k> cream t. Def.: Ronda, plata kukajo kovrita per kremo o
frukto; IV- 642.

<k>tartanstofo</k> <ex>(fabric)</ex> tartan, plaid (as worn by
the Scots).

<k>Tartuf</k>(<k>ul</k>)<k>o</k> Tartuffe, a hypocritcal priest
in Moliere’s «Tartuffe»; a hypocrite; <k>Tartufeso</k>hypocrisy;
<k>Tartufajo</k> a hypocritical act.

<k>taso</k> cup; <k>tasedo de kafeo</k> cup(ful) of coffee; <k>kafetaso</k>
coffee-cup.

<k>tasko</k> task, job; <k>taskolaboristo</k> jobber: worker by
the job; <k>laborar segun tasko</k> to work by the job, by the
piece.

<k>tastar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel one’s way, grope,
fumble; <k>tast</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k> groping; <k>taste</k>, <k>tastante</k>
gropingly, tentatively. Ex.: On tastas en l’obskureso.
Ciencisto qua tastas, en sua explori.

<k>tautologio</k> tautology. Def.: Ne simpla repeto, ma vana
repeto di la sama ideo sub diversa formi; V-90.

<k>taverno</k> tavern, public-house, wine-shop, pot-house, bar;
<k>tavernestro</k> t.-keeper, publican.

<k>taxar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tax; assess (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>tax</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k>, <k>taxuro</k> tax(ation), toll, rate, assessment; <k>taxanto</k>, <k>taxisto</k>
assessor. Def.: Fixigar la quanto de imposto o kontributo quan on
debas pri ulo; V-221. Ex.: Taxar lux-objekti. On evaluas la
revenuo di ta sioro a 10,000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki,
segun la proporciono di 4 po 100. V. exp.: vid. <k>impostar</k>, <k>evaluar</k>.

<k>tayo</k> waist: trunk of the body above the hips; <k>tayo
 tenua</k> slender w.

<k>teo</k> <ex>(leaves and infusion)</ex> tea; <k>teiero</k> t.
bush; <k>teuyo</k> t. holder, t. caddy; <k>tekrucho</k> t.pot; <k>teasemblo</k>, <k>tepartio</k>t. party.

<k>teatro</k> theater; theatre; <k>teatrala</k> theatrical; <k>teatrajo</k>
play (at t.); <k>teatrostroko</k> unforseen event (in a play); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
striking event.

<k>tebaido</k> desert, lonely solitude. V. exp.: Nomo (Thebaid)
propra (geografiala) diveninta komuna per metaforo.

<k>tedar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bore; <ex>(fig.)</ex> tire, weary
(the spirit); <k>tedanto</k>, <k>tedero</k> tedious person, bore. Def.:
Esar desagreabla ad ulu per neoportuna o tro longa agado od
asisto (vizitanto tedis me); fatigar per repeto o per
neinteresanta kozo (la koncerto, la spektaklo tedis me). (On
povas esar jenanta e mem tedanta nevole e nekoncie); III-35.

<k>tegar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cover (a bed, a piece of
furniture, etc.); to caparison; <k>tegilo</k> cover (for bed,
etc.), horse-cloth, caparison; <k>tegtelo</k> cloth cover;
tarpaulin.

<k>tekniko</k> technic(s); <k>teknikala</k> technical. Ex.: La
tekniko di la pikt-arto. Teknikala termini.

<k>tekto</k> roof; (of carriages, autom.) top; <k>tektajo</k>, <k>tektero</k>
roofing; <k>tektizar</k> to roof (a house, etc.); <k>tektokanalo</k>
(eaves-) gutter.

<k>telo</k> linen cloth or fabric; <k>tela tuko</k> linen
sheet(ing); <k>telizar</k>to mount, paste, sew, put (<k>ulo</k>)
on cloth; <k>gudro telo</k> tarpaulin; <k>metal telo</k>
wire-gauze; <k>araneo telo</k> spiderweb.

<k>telegrafar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to telegraph; (<k>ulo ad ulu</k>)<k />
(cf. <k>radiotelegrafar</k>); <k>telegraf</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k>
telegraphing; <k>telegrafuro</k> (= <k>telegramo</k>) a telegram; <k>telegrafilo</k>
telegraph; <k>telegrafeyo</k>, <k>telegrafkontoro</k> t. office; <k>telegrafala</k>
telegraphic; <k>telegrafisto</k> telegrapher. <k />

<k>teleskopo</k> telescope; <k>teleskopala</k> telescopic; <k>teleskopumar</k>
to drive together trains, etc., so that one or both slides over
the other.

<k>temo</k> topic, subject, theme (treated of); <k>traktar temo</k>
to treat a subject; <k>temo Latina</k> Latin exercise or theme; <k>kompozar
 temo</k> to write a theme; <k>temo de la konverso</k> subject of
the conversation.

<k>temerara</k>, <k>temerar(ul)o</k> rash, reckless, foolhardy (person); <k>temerareso</k>
temerity; <k>temerarajo</k> rash, venturesome act.

<k>tempo</k> time: part of duration (cf. <k>foyo</k>); <ex>(gram.)</ex>
tense (of a verb); <ex>(mus.)</ex> tempo, time; <k>tempe</k> for the
time, temporarily; <k>tempala</k> temporal, temporary, transient; <k>tempope</k>
from time to time, now and then, at times; <k>tatempe</k> at
that time; <k>nuntempe</k> meanwhile; <k>justatempe</k> at
the proper time; on time; <k>samtempe</k> at the same time, at
once; <k>irgatempe</k> at any time (whatever); <k>kelketempe</k>
sometimes; <k>nultempe</k> never; <k>pasar la tempo ociante</k>
to kill time; <k>signo di tempo</k> sign of the times; <k>qua
 tempo esas?</k> what time is it? (cf. <k>kloko</k>). Ex.: Havar
tempo (libera) por facar ulo. Selektar oportuna tempo. Pasar gaye
la tempo. En la anciena tempo. Esar nun-tempa (od, moderna).

<k>temperar</k> <ex>(tr., also mus.)</ex> to temper: moderate,
allay, mollify; (cf. <k>hardigar</k>); <k>tempereskar</k> to become
temperate, moderate; <k>tempero</k> tempering, moderating; <k>temperemeso</k>
temperance, moderation. Ex.: La kolda aero temperas la varmeso.
Temperar la acideso per sukro. Temperar (E. <ex>cool</ex>) la
sango, la pasioni. Temperar la legi segun la tempo.

<k>temperamento</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> temperament; <k>temperamento
 partikulara</k>, <k>singulara</k> idiosyncrasy. Def.: Stando
fiziologiala, konstitucionala partikulare di la korpo.

<k>tempestar</k> <ex>(intr. of weather and fig.)</ex> to storm:
blow with violence, blow a gale; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to make a great
noise, rage, bluster (cf. <k>furiar</k>, <k>bruisar</k>); <k>tempesto</k>
tempest, gale, violent storm (with noise of elements) (cf. <k>sturmo</k>, <k>uragano</k>); <k>tempestoza</k> tempestuous; <ex>(fig.)</ex> boisterous.
Ex.:<ex> </ex>La vento tempestas. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Lu tempestis pri la
konduto di sua pueri. Navo batita da la tempesto. Tempesti di
pasiono. V. ex.: vid. <k>sturmo</k>.

<k>templo</k> temple; <k>templano</k> member of a t.; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
knight templar.

<k>temporisar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to temporize; <k>temporisema</k>, <k>temporisera;
 temporisemo</k>, <k>temporisero</k> procrastinating, temporizing (person). V. exp.:
La senco ne esas simple ajornar o vartar, ma plu komplexa:
ajornar o tardigar ago, vartante okaziono oportuna. La tipo di
temporisero esas Fabius Cunctator; V-676.

<k>tenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hold, have hold of, hold on; to
keep in a given situation or position; <k>tenilo</k> handle; <k>tenar
 ulu per la manuo</k> to hold someone by the hand; <k>tenar ulu ye
 la brakio</k> to hold someone by (at) the shoulder; <k>tenar libro
 en la manuo</k> to hold a book in the hand; <k>tenar ridante sua
 la kosti</k> to hold one’s sides laughing; <k>tenar su per la
 pasamano</k> to hold (support) oneself by the railing; <k>tenar su
 rekta</k> to hold oneself erect, stand straight; <k>suteno</k>
bearing, carriage, appearance (of a person).

<k>tenaca</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> tenacious: strongly adhering or
cohering; tough; (cf. <k>persistema</k>); <k>tenaceso</k>
toughness, tenacity. Ex.: Pecho, metalo, e.c. esas tenaca.

<k>tenalio</k> (hinged) pincers, pliers, nippers; <k>tenaliagar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to use p. on (<k>ulo</k>); to hold (<k>ulo</k>) with
p. V. exp.: vid. <k>pinco</k>.
<k>tenaro</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> thenar: ball of hand or foot.

<k>tendo</k> tent; (of carriage) hood; <k>tendeto</k>small tent,
awning, canopy, screen; <k>erektar</k>, <k>establisar</k>, <k>stacigar tendo</k>
to put up, pitch a tent; <k>tendaro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex> camp.

<k>tendencar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to tend: be directed to an
object or purpose; be inclined, lead to; (cf. <k>vizar</k>); <k>tendenco</k>
<ex>(of motion)</ex> tendency; (mental) leaning, inclination; <k>tendencanta</k>, <k>tendencoza</k>, <k>tendencema</k> tending, inclined, biassed, prone, disposed. Ex.:
La fairo tendencas adsupre, la stono adinfre. Ca malado tendencas
a morto. Tendenco ad egoismo.

<k>tendino</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> tendon, sinew; (cf. <k>ligamento</k>);
<k>Akil tendino</k> t. of Achilles.

<k>tenebro</k> darkness, gloom: <ex>(pl., R.C. rel.)</ex>
tenebræ; <k>tenebroza</k> tenebrous: dark, gloomy; <k>tenebroepoko</k>
dark ages. Def.: Manko di lumo; obskureso profunda; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
nul-savo, nul-certeso. Ex.: tenebro di la nokto. Tenebro di
nulsavo. Princo di tenebro.

<k>tenera</k> tender, susceptible to love or kindness, loving
(person, heart); <k>tenereso</k> tenderness (of heart).
<k>teniso</k> (lawn-) tennis; <k>tenis</k>(<k>lud</k>)<k>ero</k>, <k>tenisisto</k> t. player; <k>ludar teniso</k> to play t.

<k>tenono</k> <ex>(carp.)</ex> tenon. Def.: Extremajo di peco ek
ligno, metalo, e.c., qua eniras mortezo.

<k>tensar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to stretch: draw in length; to
strain, tense; (a gun) to cock; <k>tensar su</k> to strain, stiffen
oneself; <k>tenso</k>, <k>tenseso</k><ex>(act, state)</ex> stretching, strain,
tension, tenseness (physical, mental, social); <k>tensata: tensita</k>
tense, strained; <k>tensanto</k> one who stretches; <ex>(anat.)</ex>
tensor (muscle); <k>tensilo</k> stretching instrument. Ex.: Tensar
kordo, la fingri. Tenso di la muskuli, di la mento. Elektrala
tenso. <ex>(fig.)</ex> To tensas la situeso.

<k>tentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tempt, entice; <k>tentesar</k> to be
tempted (<k>facar</k>, <k /> <k>da</k>); <k>tento</k>, <k>tenteso</k> temptation; <k>tentanta</k>, <k>tentiva</k>tempting; <k>tentanto</k>, <k>tentero</k> temptor; <k>tentantino</k>
temptress. Ex.: Deo tentis Abraham. Me lasis me tentesar da
glorio. Rezistar tento. Tenteso ridar.

<k>tenua</k> tenuous, thin, spare, fine: thin and long; <k>tenueso</k>
tenuity; <k>tenuigar</k>to thin, make spare (cf. <k>mingrosigar</k>);
<k>tenuigo</k> attenuation. Def.: Desgrosa; qua havas mikra
periferio; qua havas nur la du dimensioni: dina e longa. Ex.:
Tenua filo, vaporo, kolono, gambi, voco. V. exp.: vid. <k>dika</k>.
Ant.: <k>grosa</k>.

<k>teokrato</k> theocrat. V. exp.: Ne partisano di la
teokratio, ma chefo di teokratio; (cf. <k>teokratio</k>); IV-643.

<k>teologala</k> divine (virtue). Ex.: Fido, espero, karitato
esas la tri teologala vertui.

<k>tepida</k> tepid, lukewarm; <ex>(fig.)</ex> indifferent; <k>tepidajo</k>
something t. (as a tepid drink); <k>tepideso</k> lukewarmness; <k>tepideskar</k>
to become t. V. Exp.: La radiko <k>tepida</k> esas necesa
por indikar to quo ne esas kolda: <k>varmeta</k> e <k>koldeta</k>
esas nejusta od neklara. La metaforal uzado di la vorti esas
utila en etiko teologio; II-712. <k />

<k>tero</k> earth (as a planet and as ground; cf. <k>sulo</k>, <k>tereno</k>); <k>tera vazo</k> earthen vessel; <k>terala</k>
earthly, terrestrial; <k>terglobo</k> terrestrial globe; <k>teroza</k>
earthy; <k>terajo</k>, <k>amaso</k>piece of e., object made from e.,
earhtwork; <k>terajisto</k>, <k>terlaboristo</k> e. worker; <k>terano</k>
inhabitant of e.; <ex>(fig.)</ex> landholder; <k>terizar</k>, <k>terplenigar</k>
to cover, to fill (<k>ulo</k>) with e.; <k>terplenajo</k> <ex>(fort.)</ex>
terreplein; <k>terocilo</k>, <k>tertremo</k><ex> </ex>e. shake, earthquake
(cf. <k>sismo</k>); <k>tertruo</k> burrow; <k>teretajo</k> ground
floor (of a house); <k>terpomo</k> potato; <k>terhavajo</k> real
estate; <k>enterigar</k> to inter, put in the e.; <k>tervenar</k>
to (come to) land.

<k>terakoto</k> terra-cotta: baked clay; <k>terakotajo</k> a piece
of earthenware.

<k>teraso</k> terrace: raised bank; <k>terastekto</k> flat roof
(of a house); <k>terasigar</k>, <k>terasizar</k> to t., to arrange in t.s.

<k>terco</k> <ex>(astron., math.)</ex> 1/60 of a second; <ex>(mus.,
cards, fencing)</ex> tierce.

<k>tereno</k> terrain: small piece of ground, viewed as to its
fitness for some purpose, as for a building, a battle, etc.

<k>teriako</k> <ex>(pharm.)</ex> theriac(a). Def.: Anciena
medikamento kontre veneno.

<k>termo</k>, <k>termi</k> thermal (or, hot) spring or spa; <k>termala</k>
thermal; <k>termaleso</k>quality, character of thermal waters.

<k>termino</k> <ex>(gram., math., log.)</ex> term (cf. <k>periodo</k>);
boundary), boundary mark, landmark; <ex>(of R.R.)</ex> terminus; <ex>(gen.)</ex>
the farthermost point; <k>terminaro</k> terminology; bounds (to which
one may go); <k>terminala</k> terminal; <k>terminizar</k> to bound, set
bounds, set landmarks; <k>komparo termini</k> terms of comparison.
Ex.: Teknikala, ciencala termini. Expresar su per justa termini.
Esas interdikta forprenar la termini di ula domeno. Pagar debajo
ante la termino. V. exp.: <k>Termino</k> ne esas <k>limito</k> (o
<k>frontiero</k>), ma ulo (stono, stango, e.c.) qua indikas la
limito. Ol ne esas extremajo, nam la termini esas sur omna
lateri, e ne nur ye l’extremaji. La primitiva senco di la
vorto esas la L. <ex>terminus</ex>, de qua venas la cetera,
metafora senci (gramatikal, logikal, matematikal termino).
L’antiqui deigis la <ex>Termini</ex>, e pro to la vorto restis
en arkitekturo, por indikar mi-korpa statuo sur pilastro. Fine,
la vorto <k>terminus</k> esas EF for indikar extremaji di
fervoyal lineo; II-712. <k /><ex />
<k>termologio*</k> thermology: science or theory of heat.

<k>terniono*</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> ternion, ternary: a form having
three variables.

<k>terorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be terrified, be frightened
(cf. <k>trepidar</k>); <k>teroro</k> terror, fright; <k>terorigar</k>
to terrify, scare, terrorize, dismay; <k>terorigo</k> terrorizing; <k>teroriganta</k>, <k>teroriva</k> terrible, dreadful, awful, terrifying; <k>terorismo</k>
terrorism; <k>teroristo: terrorist.</k> V.exp.: vid. <k>pavorar</k>.
<k>terpomo</k> potato; <k>tero en shelo</k> p. with jacket on.

<k>testo</k> a witness; <k>la testo donis sua atesto</k> the
witness gave his testimony; <k>prenar ulu kom testo</k> to take
a person to (or, call a person as) witness; <k>testesar</k> to be a
witness (cf. <k>atestar</k>).

<k>testaca</k> testaceous: covered with hard shell; <k>testaco</k>
t. animal.

<k>testamentar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make one’s will; <k>testamento</k>
testament, will; <k>testamentala</k> testamentary; <k>testamentanto</k>, <k>testamentinto</k>
testator; <k>testamentala exekutero</k> executor of a will; <k>mortar
 sen testamente</k> to die intestate (cf. <k>intestata</k>). V. exp.:
vid. <k>legacar</k>.

<k>tetanar</k> <ex>(intr., med.)</ex> to have tetanus, lockjaw; <k>tetano</k>
tetanus; (cf. <k>trismo</k>).

<k>texar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to weave (cotton, wool, etc.); <k>tex</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k>
weaving; <k>texuro</k> texture; <k>texuro lana</k> wool fabric; <k>texisto</k>
weaver; <k>texala</k> textile; <k>texilo</k>, <k>mashino</k> loom.

<k>texto</k> text; <k>textala</k>, <k>segun texta</k> textual, word for
word; <k>segun texte</k> verbatim; (cf. <k>vortope</k>).

<k>tezo</k> thesis; proposition, theme supported by argument;
undergraduate’s essay.

<k>tifo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> typhus (fever); <k>tifala</k> t.
(relating to the disease); <k>tifika</k>, <k>tifiko</k> (person) sick with
t.

<k>tikar</k> <ex>(intr.) </ex>to have a local and habitual
convulsive movement of the muscles (especially the facial
muscles); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to have a bad habit, an ugly knack; (of a
horse) to be vicious; <k>tiko</k> wry motion; bad habit. Ex.: Il
tikas (od, havas la tiko) rodar sua ungli.

<k>tiktakar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go tic-tac, to tick (as a
clock); <k>tiktak</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k> tick(ing).

<k>til</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> <ex>(of time)</ex> till, until; <ex>(in
space)</ex> (un) to, as far as; <k>til nun</k> until now; <k>tilnuna</k>
hitherto prevailing; <k>til la fino</k> unto the end; <k>til
 nova</k> od, <k>altra</k>) <k>imperi</k> until further (or,
other) orders; <k>til ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> until (followed by
verb); <k>til la rivido</k> au revoir, until we meet again,
goodbye for the present; <k>il iris til Paris</k> he went as far
as Paris (N.B. <k>Il iris a Paris</k> might signify that he went
in the direction toward Paris). Ex.: De la matino til la nokto.
Til la fino di januaro. Me restos til ke vu retrovenos. Til nun
la vetero esis sempre bela. Lu lektis til la fino di la libro. Lu
akompanis me til la proxima strado. Siori X e Y intencas irar
vers la sudo (od ad-sude). Sioro X iros til Paris e Sioro Y a
(od, til) Rom(a). V. exp.: <k>Til</k> indikas fakto, qua duras
kontinue ante la momento koncernata ed ankore en ta momento.
Ex.: «Il promisis venor ante dimezo, do me vartos il til
dimezo.» <k>Til</k> (en la tempo same kam en la spaco)
indikas, ke on atingas la limit-punto indikata. Pro to: «me iris
ad Paris» diferas de «me iras til Paris;» IV-525.

<k>timar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fear (or, to be afraid that) (or,
lest) something may happen; to dread, be apprehensive; <k>timigar</k>
to cause to dread, make afraid; <k>timo</k> fear, apprehension,
misgiving, dread, awe; <k>time ke</k> for fear that; <k>timanta</k>, <k>timoza</k> timid, timorous, fearful, apprehensive, cowardly; <k>timinda</k>, <k>timenda</k> to be feared, dangerous, redoubtable, formidable; <k>timante
 ke</k> for fear that, lest; <k>sentima</k> with assurance,
confidence; <k>la timo a la puniso</k> the dread of punishment; <k>pro
 timo ad</k> for fear of; <k>me pavoris pro timo ad morto</k> I
was frightened by the fear of death. V. exp.: vid. <k>pavorar</k>.

<k>timbro</k> <ex>(of a clock)</ex> clock-bell; a hand bell (such
as used on tables, without a loose clapper but struck by a hammer
as in a clock).

<k>timida</k> timid: not bold; bashful, shy; <k>timideso</k>
timidity; <k>timidigar</k> intimidate. Ex.: Timida mulieri, infanto.
Ant.: <k>audacoza</k>, <k>brava</k>.

<k>timono</k> <ex>(single)</ex> pole, shaft (of a cart). V. exp.:
vid. <k>brankardo</k>.

<k>timpano</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> tympanum: drum of ear; <ex>(arch.)</ex>
tympanum; <ex>(mus.)</ex> dulcimer.

<k>tino</k> tub, water-cask; firkin (for butter). Def.: Speco
de vazo konstruktita quale barelo, ma apertita; IV-643.

<k>tinio</k> <ex>(med)</ex> ringworm, especially of the scalp;
scald-head; favus; tinea capitis.

<k>tinklar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> <k>tinkligar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> (<k>lente</k>)
to toll: sound a bell slowly; <k>tinkletar</k>, <k>tinklar dolce</k> to
tinke, jingle, clink (as small bells, money); to patter (as feet,
sleet against the window, etc.).

<k>tintar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to dye; <ex>(fig.) </ex>tint, tinge,
stain (cf. <k>kolorizar</k>); <k>tint</k>(<k>ad</k>)<k>o</k>
dying; <k>tinturo</k>dye, colo(u)ring, tint; <k>tintivo</k> <ex>(substance)</ex>
dye;<k>tintisto</k> dyer; <k>netintita</k> untinted, of natural
colo(u)r. Tintar rede la tuko. La cielo tintas blua la maro.
Tintar la manui per sango.

<k>tipo</k> <ex>(print., med., nat. hist.)</ex> type; <ex>(of
measures, weights)</ex> standard, model; symbol; <k>tipa</k>, <k>tipala</k>, <k>tipatra</k> typical. Ex.: Lu esas homo segun la Angla tipo. La
paskala agnelo esas la tipo di Jesu Kristo. La tipala traiti di
la flava raso.
