resorto o flezebla parto); III-219.

<k>pinchar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pinch, nip (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>pinchuro</k>
the mark of a pinch (as on the skin).

<k>pinglo</k> pin; <k>pinglagar</k> to pin (<k>ulo</k>); <k>pinglopikar</k>
to prick (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>) with a pin; <k>pingliferio</k>
pin-making establishment; <k>pinglokuseno</k> pin-cushion. Def.:
Mikra metal–filo akutigita por unionar kozi; ornamento en
formo di pinglo, kun kapo ornita.

<k>piniono</k> pinion: small cog-wheel geared to a larger
wheel.
<k>pinselo</k> (artist’s or painter’s brush; <k>pinselstroko</k>, <k>pinselago</k> a stroke of the brush.

<k>pinto</k> point, sharp end; <k>pinta</k>, <k>pintatra</k> pointed,
sharp, peaked, tapering; <k>pintoza</k> barbed; <k>pintigar</k>, <k>pintizar</k>
to put a point on (<k>ulo</k>); <k>sen pintigar</k> to blunt,
remove the point from; <k>pintofrapar</k> to thrust, stab, lunge; <k>pinto
 di flogilo</k> whip-lash.

<k>piocho</k> (double-ended) pickaxe; mattock; (cf. <k>pikono</k>);
<k>piochagar</k> to dig (<k>ulo</k>) with a pickaxe. Def.:
Instrumento por exkavar harda materii, di qua la fera parto havas
du extremaji opozita (relate la mancho). VI-533.

<k>pipeto</k> <ex>(chem.) </ex>pipette: tube to transfer liquids;
dropping tube.

<k>pipsar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have the pip; <k>pipso</k> pip,
roup: disease of birds, poultry.

<k>piro</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> pear; <ex>(fig.)</ex> any pear-shaped
instrument or object; e.g. an electric light bulb; <k>piriero</k>
pear tree.

<k>piramido</k> <ex>(geom. monument)</ex> pyramid; <k>piramidifar</k>
to form a pyramid, rise like a pyramid; <k>piramidotrunko</k>
frustrum of a pyramid.

<k>piretro</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> pyrethrum, feverfew (genus:
Pyrethrum); <k>piretropulvero</k> insect powder (made from p.).

<k>pirogo</k> (Indian or savage) canoe, pirogue. Def.: Kanoto
di sovajo, facita ek arboro-trunko o kortico (quale uzata da la
Malayi Nord-Amerikan Indiani, e.c.).

<k>pirograbar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to engrave on wood with a hot
point; <k>pirograbo</k>, <k>pirograburo</k> pyrography.

<k>pirometro</k> pyrometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la
maxim alta temperaturi.

<k>piruetar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to pirouette: turn, whirl on
toes; <ex>(of horses)</ex> to whirl.

<k>pistar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pound, bruise, crush (with a
pestle); (cf. <k>triturar</k>); <k>pistilo</k> pestle; <ex>(bot.)</ex>
pistil; <k>pistuyo</k> (chemist’s, druggist’s) mortar.

<k>pitono</k> <ex>(myth.)</ex> Python; <ex>(zool.)</ex> python
(genus: Python). Def.: Serpento reala e mitologiala; III-142.

<k>pitoniso</k> <ex>(antiq.)</ex> pythoness, witch; <k>pitoniso di
 Endor</k> witch of Endor. <k />

<k>pituito</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> mucus, phlegm, pituite; <k>pituitoza</k>
full of mucus; <k>pituitala</k> pituitary; (cf. <k>muko</k>). Def.:
Humoro viskoza sekrecata da ula mukozi (di la nazo, di la
bronkii) en stando morbala; IV-585.

<k>pivoto</k> pivot: <ex>(mechan.)</ex> pivot, journal: pin or
short shaft on which anything turns: <ex>(milit.) </ex>the wing on
which a troop turns; <ex>(fig.)</ex> main hinge, principal agent; <k>turnar</k>, <k>rotacar sur (cirkum) pivoto</k> to turn on a pivot; <k>pordo
 pivoto</k> door-pivot, -hinge; <k>l’interesto esas la pivoto di
 multi de nia agi</k> interest is the pivot of many of our acts.

<k>pizo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> pea (Pisum sativum); <k>senshela pizi</k>
shelled peas; <k>shelo pizi</k> peas in a pod.

<k>placo</k> place: open public space, as a square or circu in
a town (cf. <k>loko</k>).

<k>plado</k> plate: small dish to eat off (cf. <k>disho</k>); <k>pladedo</k>
plateful; <k>pladego</k> platter; <k>pladmoblo</k> buffet,
side-board; <k>pladetajero (</k>o<k>tabulo)</k> plate-shelf.

<k>plafono</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> ceiling, upper surface of a room;
<k>plafonizar</k> to put a ceiling on.

<k>plago</k> sore:<k />break in soft part of body from
disease; <ex>(fig.)</ex> plague, scourge (cf. <k>pesto</k>). Ex.:
Ilua tota korpo esa kovrata da plagi. L’alkoholo esas plago
di la publika saneso. Atilla nomizis su la plago di Deo.

<k>plajo</k> beach, (sea-) shore, strand. V. exp.: <k>Plajo</k>
esas la bendo plu o min larja di sulo, quan la maro alterne
kovras e deskovras; existas plaji de sablo e plaji de rul-stoni.
La <k>rivo</k> esas la limito inter la maro e la tale dicita
ferme (sika) tero. La <k>litoro</k> esas la tota regiono
adjacanta la <k>rivo</k>. La <k>plaji</k> esas nur aparta ed
eceptala loki en la rivi: ne omna rivo esas plajo (ex.: rivo ek
klifi od ek rokaji); IV-606.

<k>plajiar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to plagiarize (words, ideas
from another).

<k>plako</k> plate, sheet, slab: flat piece of metal, etc.;
tablet, plaque; <k>plakoizar</k> to plate (over), sheathe, sheet
over, veneer, overlay; <k>plakoo grabita</k> engraved plate; <k>plakoturn
 plakoo</k> (R.R.) turn-table; <k>petro plakoo</k> stone slab,
flagstone; <k>plakoizita ringo</k> (of gold) plated ring.

<k>plana</k> plane: without elevations or depressions; level,
flat (cf. <k>plata</k>); <k>plano</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> plane
(surface, figure, angle); <ex>(aeron.)</ex> plane; <k>planajo</k> a
flat thing or place; plain: level land; <k>alta planajo</k>
table-land; <k>plankanto</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> plain-song, -chant; <k>planigar</k>
to make (<k>ulo</k>) smooth, level, even; <k>plano inklinita</k>
inclined plane.

<k>planko</k> board, plank; <k>planketo</k> small board;
(painter’s) palette; <k>plankizar</k> to board up; <k>plankosulo</k>
(board-) flooring.

<k>planto</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> plant; <k>plantaro</k> flora; <k>plantocizo</k>
pruning shears; <k>plantolauso</k> plant louse (cf. <k>afidio</k>);
<k>plantizar</k> to ornament, cover with plants (cf. <k>plantacar</k>).

<k>plantacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to plant: set in the ground for
growth; <k>plantacajo</k> something planted, slip, set, crop, plant
(cf. <k>planto</k>); <k>plantacerio</k> plantation; <k>plantacanto</k>, <k>plantacisto</k>
one who plants, a planter; <k>plantacilo</k> planting instrument;
dibble, setting stick.

<k>plantono*</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> orderly (soldier; cf. <k>ordonanco</k>);
<k>esar plantono</k> to be on orderly duty.

<k>plaso</k> place (for a person or thing); <k>plasizar</k> to
place (<k>ulu</k>); to put (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>) in a place (cf. <k>pozar</k>, <k>lokizar</k>); <k>plasizanto</k>, <k>plasisto</k> a person who places; usher
(in a theater)(theatre). V exp.: Ta vorto esas necesa por
signifikar la spaco okupata od okupebla da singla persono en irga
loko (veturo, teatro, e.c.). Ol ne povas remplasesar da <k>loko</k>,
mem min da <k>sideyo</k>; nam en omnibusi, tramveturi, urbala
fervoyi, existas plasi <k>sidanta</k> e plasi <k>stacanta</k>. Ol
povas signifikar anke la loko propra, rezervata o konvenanta por
singla kozi: «Un plaso por omna kozo, ed omna kozo en sua
plaso». On povas dicar exemple: «Me havas bona <k>plaso</k>
proxim la <k>loko</k> ube eventis l’inauguro di la statuo X.
sur la <k>placo</k> Y.»  Restis nula <k>plaso</k> en la
teatro, quankam esis ankore multa <k>spaco</k> inter la rangi e
granda vakua loki avan la pordi; II-19.

<k>plastro</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> (sticking-) plaster (for the body;
cf. <k>kataplasmo</k>); <k>plastreto</k> a small plaster;
beauty-spot, -patch (for toilette).

<k>plastrono</k> plastron: breast-plate; breast-pad;
shirt-bosom, -front. Def.: Tri senci: pectoral peco di kuraso;
pektoral peco, polster-izita, di vesto di skermisto; pektorala
parto di kamizo; IV-202. ?eFI

<k>plata</k> flat: having an even surface (cf. <k>plana</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
dull, insipid; <k>platajo</k> a flat object; plateau, upland,
table-land; <k>plata pedo</k> a flat foot; <k>plateso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>
flatness; <k>plata kalmeso</k> a flat calm; <k>plate</k> flatwise; <k>platigar</k>
to flatten (cf. <k>planigar</k>); <k>platnaza</k>, <k>plat(ul)o</k> flat,
pug, snub-nosed (person).

<k>platano</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> plane-tree, platane (genus:
Platanus); <k>platano ocidentala</k> (N. American) sycamore
(Platanus occidentalis).

<k>plaudar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> of liquids, waves: to break,
beat against, splash; <k>plaudetar</k> to ripple.

<k>plear</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to play (a musical instrument, a role
in a play; cf. <k>ludar</k>); <k>pleachar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
strum, thrum (a violin). Ex.: Plear valso. Violin-plear. Plear
(rolo di) Athalie.

<k>plebecito</k> referendum: <ex>(hist.)</ex> plebescite,
plebescitum. Def.: Voto pri ula lego o rezolvo da omna
civitani di un stato (ex. en Suisa); III-142

<k>pledar</k> <ex>(intr., legal and gen.)</ex> to plead, argue
(at the bar); to allege; <k>pledo</k> plea; <k>pledanto</k>, <k>pledero</k>
pleader, litigant, suitor; <k>pledachanto</k>, <k>pledero</k> petifogger.

<k>plektar</k>, <k>inter plektar</k>, <k>en plektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to (inter-)
lace, plait, twine, wreath, weave (straw, etc.; cf. <k>tresigar</k>);
<k>plektajo</k> that which is intertwined.

<k>plena</k> full, filled (<k>de</k>); <k>pleneso</k> fullness,
plenitude; <k>plene</k> fully, entirely; <k>plenigar</k> to fill; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to fulfil, accomplish; <k>plena luno</k> full moon; <k>plena de aquo</k>
filled with water. Ant.: <k>vakua.</k>

<k>plendar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to complain; <ex>(jur.)</ex> lodge
a complaint (<k>che</k>); <k>plendo</k> complaining, <ex>(law)</ex>
accusation, charge; <k>plendanto</k> complainer; <ex>(law)</ex>
plaintiff, complainant; <k>plendanta</k> complaining; <k>plendema</k>, <k>plendatra</k> plaintive, querulous. Ex.: Plendar pri kap-doloro. Il
plendis, ke il esas frapita. V. exp.: vid. <k>lamentar.</k>

<k>plenipotenco</k> plenipotence, fullness or completeness of
power; <k>plenipotenciero</k>, <k>plenipotenciera</k> plenipotenciary.

<k>pleto</k> tray, shallow receptacle for tea, pins, diamonds,
etc.

<k>pletoro</k> <ex>(med. and fig.)</ex> plethora; <k>pletorala</k>, <k>pletorika</k>
plethoric. Ex.: Pletoro de sango, de pekunio.

<k>pleuronekto</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> brill, flounder: a flat fish
of several species (Pleuronectes).

<k>pleyado</k>, <k>pleyadi</k> <ex>(astron.)</ex> Pleiades; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a
distinguished of authors, etc. Def.: Propra senco: ula stelaro
(en signo di «Tauro»); metafora senco: grupo o skolo de autori,
partikulare poeti (ex. la Franca pleyado en la 16a yarcento;
III-142.

<k>plezar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be pleasing, be agreeable; <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to please (<k>ulu</k>); <k>plezar (ad) ulu</k> to please anyone; <k>ta
 libro ne plezas (a) me</k> that book does not please me, is not
to my taste, my fancy; <k>facez to</k>, <k>qou plezas vu</k> do as you
like (please); <k>on ne povas plezas omni</k> one cannot please
everybody.

<k>plezuro</k> pleasure: delight, joy. Ex.: Facar ulo kun
plezuro. Dansar esas plezuro.
<k>pliko</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> plica, a disease of the hair.

<k>plisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to plait; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to pucker,
crease. Def.: Facar reguloza falduri en ulo; (kp. <k>frunsar</k>).

<k>plombo</k> lead; <k>plomba</k> (made) of lead; <k>plombea</k>
lead-colo(u)red; <k>plombizar</k> to cover with lead; <k>plombsiglar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to seal or stamp with lead; <k>plombisto</k>, <k>plomblaboristo</k>
plumber; lead-worker.

<k>plorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to cry, weep, shed tears (<k>pri</k>);
<k>ploretar</k>, <k>plorachar</k> to whimper, whine, snivel (cf. <k>kriachar</k>);
<k>plorigar</k> to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to cry; <k>ploranto</k>, <k>plorero</k>
weeper; <k>ploristo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> hired mourner; <k>ploranta</k>, <k>plorema</k> weeping. V.exp.: vid. <k>lakrimifar.</k>

<k>plu</k> <ex>(adv. of comparison)</ex> more, further; <k>plue</k>
moreover, besides; <k>plu afabla</k> more amiable; <k>plu bone</k>, <k>plu juste</k> better, preferable; <k>plu multi</k> most
(people); the generality, the majority; <k>plumulteso</k>
(condition) plurality; <k>plu multo</k> (the) more (used
substantively); <k>plu male</k>, <k>plua</k> worse; <k>tante plu ke</k>
all the more that; <k>dum plu kam</k> during more than; <k>sempre
 plu</k> more and more; <k>plu kam ultempe</k> more than ever; <k>nek
 plu nek min</k> neither more nor less; <k>quante plu granda la
 homo</k>the bigger the person; <k>quante plu me manjas</k>, <k>tante
 plu me drinkas</k> the more I eat, the more I drink; <k>demandar
 plu multo por obtenar min multo</k> to ask for more to obtain
less; <k>plu multa vino kam aquo</k> more wine than water; <k>diferar
 per plu o min multo</k> to differ more or less; <k>il esas plu
 kompatinda kam blaminda</k> he is more to be pitied than
blamed; <k>remediilo plu mala kam la morbo</k> a remedy worse
than the disease; Note: <k>Plu</k> can be used by itself before
adjectives and adverbs, but with substantives and verbs <k>multa</k>, <k>plue</k>, <k>granda</k>, <k /> etc. should be added: <k>lu plu multe</k>, <k>ofte
 ocias kam laboras; plu multa aquo.</k> V exp.: <k>Plu</k>
expresas <ex>augmento</ex> di ula quanto (qua restas o
konsideresas identa a su ipsa); <k>plus</k> (quale la
matematikal signo, quan ol tradukas) signifikas adiciono, do
generale <ex>adjunto</ex> di ulo ad altro; II-666. Ant.: <k>min.</k>

<k>plualtigar</k> to make higher, taller; <k>plualteskar</k>
to become higher. Note: <k>Plu</k> to such verbalized adjectives
as above adds the idea of comparison: <k>plualtigar</k> to make
higher, taller (i.e. it was high before, or relatively, to make
something higher than something else).

<k>plucherigar</k> to make dearer (in price), raise the price
of; <k>plueskar</k> to become, grow dearer.

<k>pludensigar</k> to condense (a liquid): make more dense,
more compact.

<k>pludolcigar</k> to soften, to render milder. Ex.: La pluvo
pludolcigas la vetero. La vetero pludolceskas. Pludolcigar la
voco.

<k>plufermigar</k> to make firm, stout, resolute. Ex.:
Astriktivo plufermigas la pelo. Ruptita gambo plufermeskas diope.
Lua autoritato plufermeskas.

<k>plufreshigar</k> to freshen; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to enliven, give
a filip to. Ex.: La pluvo plufreshigas la aero. Plufreshigar la
korpo, la trupi.

<k>plugar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to plough; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to till; <k>plugebla</k>
arable: fit for tillage; <k>plugilo</k> a plow. Def.: Sulkizar la
sulo per plugilo. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Spadagar la tero por plantacar.

<k>plukurtigar</k> to shorten, make (<k>ulo</k>) shorter; <k>plueskar</k>
to contract, shrink.

<k>plulentigar</k> to slow down, abate (<k>ulo</k>); <k>plueskar</k>
to slacken, flag.

<k>plulongigar</k><ex>(of time)</ex> to prolong, protract,
lengthen. V. exp.: vid. <k>prolongar.</k>

<k>plumo</k> <ex>(of birds)</ex> feather, plume; <ex>(for writing)</ex>
quill, pen; <k>plumaro</k> plumage, feathers (cf. <k>penacho</k>);
collection of pens; <k>plumedo</k> penful (of ink); <k>plumfasko</k>
feather-broom, -duster; <k>plumiero</k> pen-holder; <k>plumuyo</k>
pen-rack; <k>plumizar</k> to feather; <k>plumvishilo</k> pen-wiper; <k>plumpinselo</k>
a small feather-brush; <k>fonten plumo</k> a fountain-pen; <k>ganso
 plumo</k> goose-quill.

<k>plump!</k> thump! slap! bang! Def.: Indikanta falo,
precipue di ulo grava, mola, inerta; IV-511

<k>plumpa</k> <ex>(of things)</ex> unwieldy, unmanageable from
bulk or weight; <ex>(of persons)</ex> thick-skulled, dull-witted; <k>plumpa
 mashino</k>, <k>navo</k> an unwieldy machine, ship; <k>plump(ul)o</k> a
person doltish, clumsy, heavy-bodied, or heavy-witted; dullard,
blockhead, dunce (cf. <k>stult(ul)o</k>): Def.: Expresas
l’ideo di ulu, ulo grosa, pezoza e (pro to) nehabila o
groteska; IV-605.

<k>plunjar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to plunge, duck, dive, (<k>en</k>);
<k>plunjigar</k> to dip, plunge (<k>ulo</k>, <k>en ulo</k>); <k>plunjoklosho</k>
diving bell; (cf. <k>sinkar</k>, <k>submersar</k>, <k>imersar</k>). Ex.:
Plunjar en la maro. Plunjigar krucho en la aquo, dago en la
korpo, sua manuo en la flami.

<k>plura</k> several; <k>pluri</k> several people; <k>plurala</k>
relating to several; <k>plurala</k>, <k>pluralo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> plural; <k>plurfoye</k>
several times; <k>plureso</k> two or more of the same kind; <k>plurkolora</k>
of several colo(u)rs.

<k>plursenca</k> having several senses or meanings; <k>plureso</k>
ambiguousness.

<k>plus(e)</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> further, furthermore, more, over
and above, an addition; <ex>(arith.)</ex> plus; <k>plus(e)a</k>
additional, surplus, extra; <k>plus(e)ajo</k> a surplus, overplus; <k>me
 ne plus kantos</k>, <k>me ne kantos pluse</k> I shall sing no more; <k>me
 ne plus hungras</k> I am no longer hungry; <k>me ne plus pagos</k>
I will pay no more; <k>ne plus lu audez tua voco</k> no more
shall he hear thy voice; <k>pluso sequos</k> to be continued; <k>un
 glaso pluse</k>od,<k>un pluse glaso</k> one glass more; <k>nulo
 pluse</k> nothing in addition; <k>pluspagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to overpay; <k>plus(e)e taxar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to surtax; <k>du plus
 tri minus un</k> two plus three minus one. Ex.: Mil yari e
pluse. Un tablo plus quar stuli. Un pazo pluse. Il ne plus vivas.
Me dicos nulo pluse. Ne plus amoro, do ne plus joyo. Plusa pezo,
taxo. Plusajo di pekunio. Plusa exempleri (E. additional copies).
V. exp.: vid. <k>plu.</k> Ant.: <k>minus.</k>

<k>plusho</k> <ex>(fabric)</ex> plush; <k>plushatra</k> plush-like,
shaggy. Def.: Stofo simila a veluro e kun longa pili o lanugo sur
un latero.
<k>plutokratio</k> plutacracy: rule and power of the rich.

<k>pluvar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to rain; <k>pluvas</k> <ex>(impers.)</ex>
it rains; <k>pluveskar</k> to start raining; <k>pluvetar</k> to
drizzle; <k>pluvegar</k> to rain in torrents; <k>pluvigar</k> to
cause to rain; to shower down upon; <k>pluvoza</k>, <k>pluvema</k> rainy,
wet, shower; <k>pluvuro</k> rain (fallen); <k>pluvaquo</k> rain
water; <k>pluvarko</k> rainbow; <k>pluvo dina</k> a fine rain; <k>pluvkanalo</k>
gutter; <k>pluvtubo</k> spout (descending to the ground); <k>pluvtubulo</k>
spout (which drips from above); <k>pluvmantelo</k> rain-cloak.

<k>po</k> for, at the price of, in exchange for (indicates value
received or given); <ex>(fin.)</ex> per (cent.) as, <k>kin po
 cento</k> (at the rate of) five percent (cf. <k>procento</k>); <k>tanto
 po (un) semano</k> at so much a week; <k>komprar</k> <k>ulo po
 triadek dollari</k> to buy something for thirty dollars (N.B. <k>Ca
 kustas 1000 fr.</k>, <k />not<k>ca kustas po 1000 fr.</k>).

<k>podagro</k> podagra, gout in the feet; <k>podagrika</k>, <k>podagriko</k>
gouty <ex>(person). </ex>Def.: Goto di pedi; IV-516.

<k>poezio</k> <ex>(composition)</ex> poesy, poetry; <k>poeziajo</k>
a piece of poetry, a poem; <k>poeziala</k>, <k>poeziatra</k>, <k>poezioza</k> poetical; <k>poeziizar</k>
to poetize, versify.

<k>poka</k> few: not many; little: not much; <k>poko</k> a
little; <k>poki</k> a few; <k>pokope</k> by degrees, little by
little, bit by bit; <k>pokafoye</k> rarely, almost never; <k>il
 parolis poke</k> he spoke but little. Def.: Mikra nombro o
quanto. Ex.: Pos poka tempo. Poka homi esas kontenta pri sua
posedaji. V. exp.: vid. <k>kelka.</k> Ant.: <k>multa.</k>

<k>polo</k> <ex>(geom., astron., geog., magnet.)</ex> pole; <k>polala</k>
polar; <k>polostelo</k> polar star.

<k>polara</k> polar; <k>polaro</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> polar; <k>polarigar</k>
to polarize; <k>polarigita</k> polarized; <k>polareso</k> polarity.

<k>polemikar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to carry on a controversy (<k>kun
 ulu</k>); <k>polemik(ad)o</k> polemic(s); <k>polemikala</k> polemical.

<k>poliandra</k> polyandr-ian, -ous; <k>poliandreso</k> polyandry; <ex>(bot.)</ex>
polyandria. Def.: (Muliero) qua samtempe havas plura spozuli;
(speco di planti) qua havas duadek o plu multa stamini.

<k>polico</k> police administration or regulation; <k>policano</k>, <k>policisto</k> policeman; <k>policistaro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex> the
police; <k>policestro</k>the chief of police;<k>policala</k> relating
to police regulations; <k>policista</k> relating to police; <k>policanacho</k>
bobby, cop, peeler. Def.: Ensemblo di la regularo qua mantenas
l’ordino e la sekureso publika.

<k>polifonio</k> polyphony. Def.: Multeso de soni diferanta ma
sam-tempa.

<k>poligrafo</k> multigraph, poylgraph: instrument for
multiplying copies of a writing; <k>poligraf(ul)o</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> an
author who writes on several subjects.
<k>poligrafio</k> the art of operating a polygraph.

<k>polipo</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> polyp; <ex>(med.)</ex> polypus: a
species of tumor.

<k>polisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to polish (marble, wood, steel,
etc.)<ex> (fig.)</ex> to polish: refine (the mind, one’s
style, manners, etc.) Def.: Igar ulo glata e brilanta per
friciono; brunisar.

<k>polita</k> <ex>(of manners)</ex> polite, civil, courteous; <k>politeso</k>
politeness, civility, good breeding; <k>politajo</k> act of
politeness; <k>politegeso</k> urbanity; <k>des</k>, <k>ne polita</k>
discourteous, uncivil. V. exp.: vid. <k>jentila.</k>

<k>politekniko</k> polytechnics; <k>politeknikala</k> polytechnic:
relating to arts and sciences; <k>politeknikano</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> a
student in a p. school; <k>politeknikoskolo</k> a p. school. Def.:
Cienco di la mekanikal arti.

<k>politiko</k> politics, public policy; <k>politikala</k>
political; <k>politikero</k> one who dabbles in politics; <k>politikisto</k>
<ex>(good sense)</ex> politician; <k>politikistacho</k> <ex>(bad sense)</ex>
politician. Def.: La cienco di guvernado; l’adminstrado di
publika afero.

<k>polstero</k> stuffing, padding, wadding (of garments, etc.);
<k>polsterizar</k> to stuff, pad (<k>ulo</k>); <k>polsterajo</k> what
stuffed, padded: bolster, pad, cushion, padded quilt, etc.

<k>poltrono</k> cowardly, dastardly, chicken-hearted; (cf. <k>feblanma</k>);
<k>poltron(ul)o</k> coward, poltroon, skulker; <k>poltroneso</k> cowardice;
<k>poltronajo</k> cowardly action. Def.: Pavor-(eg)ema;
sen-kuraj-(eg)-a.

<k>polutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pollute, defile (cf. <k>kontaminar</k>, <k>profanacar</k>); <k>polutesar</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to be polluted; to
have seminal discharge or emission.

<k>polvo</k> dust (cf. <k>pulvero</k>, <k>pudro</k>); <k>polvoza</k>, <k>polvatra</k>
dusty; <k>polvifar</k> to rise (of dust); to be dusty (of roads); <k>polvigar</k>
to reduce (<k>ulo</k>) to d.; <k>polveskar</k> to become dusty; <k>polvizar</k>
to cover (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) with d.; <k>polvonubo</k> a cloud of d.

<k>pomado</k> pomade, pomatum; <k>pomadizar</k> to apply p. to
(hair or exterior of the body); <k>har pomado</k> hair p.

<k>pomelo</k> pommel (of saddle); knob on the hilt of a sword
or pistol. Def.: Mikra bulo ye l’extremajo di espado, di
pistolo od avan solo; III-142.

<k>pompo</k> pomp, state, show; <k>pompacho</k> <ex>(bad sense)</ex>
parade, display (cf. <k>ostento</k>); <k>pompoza</k> stately; <k>pompozacha</k>
pompous <ex>(bad sense)</ex>; <k>kun granda pompo</k> with great
pomp, in great state. ?DEFIS

<k>pompono</k> pompon, top-knot; tuft added to dress of a
soldier, etc.

<k>ponderar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to weigh (<k>ulu</k>, <k>per ulo</k>);
(cf. <k>pezar</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to ponder (mentally); <k>pondero</k>
weighing; <k>ponderebla</k> ponderable; <k>ponderilo</k> scale; <k>ponderisto</k>, <k>ponderero</k> weigher; <k>ponderresorto</k> spring-balance, scale; <k>ponderar
 ample</k> to give good weight. Def.: Determinar la pezo di ulo
per ponderilo; <ex>(fig.)</ex> explorar atencoze.

<k>poniardo</k> poniard, dagger; <k>poniardagar</k>, <k>poniarde ocidar</k>
to poniard, stab (<k>ulu</k>) with a dagger; (cf. <k>dago</k>).

<k>ponto</k> bridge (over a river, etc.); <k>ponteto</k>
foot-bridge; (R.R. culvert); <ex>(nav.)</ex> gangway; <ex>(tech.)</ex>
trigger-guard (of a firearm); <k>ponto suspendita</k> suspension
b.; <k>ponto turnebla</k> swing b.; <k>ponto tubatra</k> tubular
b.; <k>batel ponto</k> b. of boats; <k>lev ponto</k> lifting b.

<k>pontifiko</k> pontiff; (Jewish) high priest; (Roman)
pontifex; (cf. <k>papo</k>); <k>pontifiko suprega</k> the sovereign
pontiff; the pope; <k>pontifikala</k> pontifical; <k>pontifikeso</k>
pontificate (cf. <k>papeso</k>); <k>pontifike oficiar</k> to reign as
pontiff.

<k>pontono</k> pontoon, boat used as bridge; <k>pontonisto</k>
military pontonier.

<k>ponyeto</k> wrist-band. Def.: La finala parto di la maniko;
VI-245. Ex.: Kamizo ne-starchita, nokto-kamizo ne havas mansheti,
ma nur ponyeti.

<k>popo</k> (Russian, Grecian) priest, (village) pope. Def.:
Rusa (greka) sacerdoto; III-594.

<k>poplito</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> ham, region back of the knee
joint; (in quadrupeds).

<k>populo</k> people, population (of a town, city, country; cf.
<k>habitantaro</k>); <k>populala</k> relating to the people (cf. <k>populara</k>);
<k>populoza</k> populous; <k>populizar</k> to people, populate: furnish
with inhabitants; <k>populizado</k>, <k>populizuro</k> peopling; <k>populacho</k>
the mob, rabble, riffraff (cf. <k>plebeyaro</k>); <k>populacha</k>
low, vulgar.

<k>populara</k> popular: prevailing among and liked by the
people; <k>populareso</k> popularity; <k>popularigar</k> to make (<k>ulo</k>)
popular, to popularize.

<k>por</k> <ex>(prep. indicating aim)</ex> for, in view of, in
favo(u)r of; <k>por ke</k> <ex>(conj., followed by imperative)</ex>
in order that, so that; <k>por quo</k> for what?; p<k>or ne</k>
lest; <k>omni por unu</k>, <k>unu por omni</k> all for one, one for
all; <k>pregar</k>, <k>votar por ulu</k> to pray, to vote for someone; <k>kombatar
 por la patrio</k> to fight for the country; <k>ol esas por vu</k>
it is for you; <k>por la formo</k>for the sake of form; <k>por
 la venjo</k> for (the sake of) vengeance; <k>le por e la kontre</k>
the pros and the cons; <k>dek franki por un semano</k> ten
francs a week; <k>me dicas tu a vu nun</k>, <k>por ke vu esez preparita</k>
I tell you now, (in order) that you may be prepared.

<k>porciono</k> portion, ration, share, allowance; <k>porcioneto</k>, <k>porcionacho</k> pittance; <k>porcionizar</k> to put (<k>ulu</k>) on (short)
allowance; <k>porcionizo</k> rationing; <k>porcionigar</k> to portion out (<k>ulo</k>).
Def.: Parto de un toto; partikulare ula provizuro de pano, de
karno, esanta dividita inter uli.

<k>pordo</k> door, doorway; gate; <k>pordego</k> large door,
portal (cf. <k>portalo</k>); (city-) gate; <k>pord(ogard)isto</k>
door-keeper; <k>pordotapeto</k> door-curtain, portiere; <k>pordalo</k>
leaf of a folding d.; <k>pordfrapilo</k> d. knocker;<k>pordoframo</k>, <k>pordkadro</k> d. frame; <k>pordoveino</k> portal vein.

<k>porko</k> pig, hog, swine, porker; <k>porkokarno (fresha</k>, <k>salizita</k>, <k>fumigita)</k> pork, pig meat (fresh, salted,
smoked); <k>porkkarnajo</k> piece of pork; <k>porkino</k> sow; <k>porkulo</k>
boar; <k>porkopilo</k>hog;s bristle; <k>porkogardisto</k>swineheard;<k>porkeyo</k>, <k>porkostablo</k> pig-sty; <k>porkala</k> porcine; <k>porkopelo</k>
rind (of bacon); <k>porkofelo</k> pigskin.

<k>porkespino</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> porcupine (European genus:
Hystrix; N. American genus: Erethizon).

<k>pornografa</k> porngraphic; <k>pornograf(ul)o</k> a person who
occupies himself with pornography.

<k>pornografio</k> pornography: art or literature of an obscene
nature.

<k>portar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to carry, bear, bring, take:
convey in vehicles, by ship, hand, or person, also of wind,
water, etc. (as agent) to wear (clothes, a sword, etc.); <k>port(ad)o;</k>
<ex>(act.)</ex> carrying, carriage, conveyance, porterage; <k>portajo</k>
that which is carried; load, burden; <k>portanto</k>, <k>portero</k>, <k>portisto</k>
carrier, bearer, porter; <k>portebla</k> portable; <k>portar la
 vestaro</k> to wear clothes; <k>for portar</k> to carry away;
(cf. <k>transportar</k>). V. exp.: vid. <k>suportar.</k>

<k>portalo</k> portal; grand and imposing door (as of a church,
etc.).
<k>porteo</k>range, reach of a shot, bullet, of a voice, etc.

<k>portfolio</k>portfolio, a case in which to keep loose
papers.

<k>portiko</k> portico, porch, covered space enclosed by
columns at entrance of building.

<k>portreto</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> portrait, personal
representation by painting, drawing, photography; <k>portret(pikt)isto</k>
portrait painter; <k>facio</k>, <k>profil</k>, <k>staturportreto</k> face,
profile, full-length portrait; <k>facar la portreto di</k> to depict,
make a portrait of.

<k>portuo</k> (sea-) port, harbo(u)r, haven; <k>portuo komercala</k>
commercial port; <k>portuo militala</k> naval harbor or station; <k>portuo
 dopa</k> inner harbor; <k>salveo portuo</k> a saluting port; <k>portupilotisto</k>
harbor pilot.

<k>pos</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> after (in time; cf. <k>dop</k>); <k>pose</k>
afterwards, next, later; <k>poske</k> after that; <k>posa</k>
subsequent, later; <k>poseso</k> posteriority; <k>pos quar kloki</k>
after four o’clock; <k>pos quar hori</k> after four hours.
Ex.: Pagenda pos triadek dii. Unesme on devas lernar e pose on
darfas ludar. Pos ke vu esos parolinta, il parolos. (E. after you
have (or, shall have) spoken, he will speak. To eventis pos ke ne
venis. Ant.: <k>ante.</k>

<k>posdinee</k> after dinner; <k>poso</k> time after dinner
(afternoon or evening, as the dinner is early or late).

<k>posedar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> possess, be in possession of, own,
have the faculty or quality (cf. <k>havar</k>, <k>proprietar</k>); <k>posedeskar</k>
to become possessor of, take possession of; <k>posedajo</k> object
(possessed); <k>posedanto</k> possessor; <k>posedala</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex>
possessive; <k>posedalo</k> possessive case; a possessive. Ex.:
Posedar pekunio, domo, ula furio posedis il. Me pagos vu kande me
posedos plu multa pekunio. Ka vu esas la posedanto di ta agro?
Posedal pronomi.

<k>posho</k> pocket; <k>poshlibro</k> a book for the pocket (cf. <k>burso</k>);
<k>poshala pekunio</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> pocket money, (spare) change; <k>poshhorlojo</k>
watch; <k>poshfurtisto</k> pick-pocket; <k>poshkultelo</k> penknife;
<k>poshkayero</k> note-book (cf. <k>notlibreto</k>).

<k>posibla</k> possible; <k>posiblajo</k>, <k>posibleso</k> possibility; <k>posibligar</k>
to render (<k>ulo</k>) p., to enable; <k>maxim multe posible</k>, <k>tam
 multe kam posible</k> as much as p.; <k>maxim bona posible</k>
as good as p.; <k>minim posible bruiso</k> least possible noise;
<k>vua helpo posibligis a me facar</k>your help made it
possible for me to do it.

<k>posmorge</k> (on) the day after tomorrow. Ex.: Se me ne
venos morge, takaze me venos posmorge.

<k>posto</k> mail, post, postal service, public conveyance and
delivery, esp. of letters, packages; <k>poste</k> by post; <k>postala
 karto</k>, <k>postokarto</k>postal-card;<k>postopakajo</k> a postal
package; <ex>(fig.)</ex> parcel-post; <k>postala uniono</k> postal
union; <k>postokontoro</k> post office;<k>postestro</k> postmaster;
<k>postisto</k> employee of postal service; letter-carrier;
postman; <k>postotreno</k> mail train; <k>poste restante</k> till
called for; <k>postomarko</k> postage stamp; <k>postostampo</k>
post mark; <k>postomandato</k> money order; <k>postoveturo</k>
post-chaise; <k>poste voyajar</k> to travel by post.

<k>posteno</k> post, a place to guard; beat (of a policeman,
etc.); <k>honor posteno</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> post of hono(u)r; <k>postenizar</k>
to post, station (<k>uli</k>, <k>ulu</k>, <k>su</k>) (cf. <k>facionar</k>);
Ex.: Stacar en posteno. Gardar posteno. Livar, desertar posteno.

<k>posterno</k> <ex>(fort.)</ex> postern; small gate under a
rampart.

<k>postigo</k> small casement in a door or window; blind (of a
carriage). Def.: (Mikra) parto (ordinare, vitro-plako) di la
fenestro o pordo qua esas apertebla.

<k>postpoziciono</k> postposition, a word or particle placed
after or at the end of a word.

<k>postular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to demand, exact, require (<k>ulo</k>, <k>de ulu</k>); <k>postulo</k>, <k>postulemeso</k> demand, requirement, exigency; <k>postulajo</k>
what is demanded, claimed; <k>postulema</k> exacting. V.exp.: vid. <k>demandar.</k>

<k>posturar</k> <ex>(intr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to assume an
attitude, to pose (as for a statue, a picture); to sit (for
one’s picture); <k>posturo</k> posture, attitude, pose; <k>posturo
 koaktata</k> constrained attitude; <k>posturo di la guvernerio</k>
attitude of the government.

<k>poto</k> pot, kettle, jug: earthenware or metal vessel used
for cooking or merely holding something; <k>potedo</k> potful; <k>potifeyo</k>
a pottery; <k>potifisto</k> potter; <k>lakto poto</k> milk jug or
can; <k>floro poto</k> flower p.; -<k>o fera</k> iron p.; <k>terakota
 poto</k> earthen p.

<k>potenco</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> power; <k>sis potenco quara</k>
six to the fourth power (64). Def.: Produkto qua
rezultas de multiplikado di nombro per su.

<k>potenta</k> powerful, potent, mighty; <k>potent(ul)o</k>
potentate; <k>potenteso</k> potency, might (cf. <k>povo</k>, <k>forteso</k>, <k>autoritato</k>).

<k>povar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to be able (to do), can (do),
could, have the power to; <k>povo</k> power, ability, force,
means, might; <ex>(polit.)</ex> a power, powerful country. Ex.: Ni
facas to quon ni povas. Me ne povis venar hiere. Me povabus
manjar ol, ma me ne hungris. La povo di la mento. V. exp.: vid. <k>darfar.</k>

<k>povra</k> poor, needy; <k>povro</k>, <k>povrulo</k>, <k>povrino</k> poor person
(cf. <k>indijanto</k>); <k>povreso</k> poverty; <k>povrajo</k> a
sorry thing (cf. <k>meskinajo</k>); <k>povrigar</k> to impoverish;
<k>la mente povri</k> the poor in mind (in spirit). Ant.: <k>richa.</k>

<k>pozar</k> <ex>(tr., lit and fig.)</ex> to place, set, lay
(down), ground (cf. <k>depozar</k>); <k>pozeso</k> position (cf. <k>situeso</k>);
<k>pozar kom principo</k> to state, lay down a principle; <k>super
 pozo</k> imposition: laying on.

<k>pozitiva</k><ex>(math., elec., philos., gram.)</ex> positive;
<k>pozitivemulo</k> a person of positive ideas; practical,
matter-of-fact person; <k>pozitivismo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex> positivism;
<k>pozitivista</k>, <k>pozitivisto</k> positivist. Ant.: <k>negativa.</k>
<k>pozolano</k> pozzolana, a mortar made from volcanic ashes.

<k>pragmato</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex> matter-of-fact, reality;
«fait accompli»; <k>pragmatala</k>pragmatical: dealing with
practical values or consequences; <k>pragmatismo</k> pragmatism; <k>pragmatisto</k>
pragmatist.

<k>praktikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to practice, put into practice,
exercise; to observe (a rule, etc.); <k>praktikala</k> pertaining to
practice or action, practical (matter); <k>praktikema</k> pratical,
experienced (person); <k>praktikebla</k> practicable, feasible,
possible; <ex>(of roads) </ex>passable; -<k>isto</k> practitioner;
<k>praktikanta</k> practising. Ex.: On praktikas la medicino,
l’agro-kultivado. Esas necesa praktikar longatempe, ante ke
on povas divenar habila. Praktikebla ideo, voyo.

<k>pramo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> pram(e): flat-bottomed boat used in
the Baltic. Def.: Speco di navo (barko) kun plata fundo, nur un
ponto, kun segli e remili; IV-462.

<k>prearanjar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prearange, to provide (for
or against).

<k>prebendo</k> prebend, stipend granted to a prebendary; <k>prebendiero</k>
prebendary.

<k>preco</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> price, charge; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
expense; <k>kustopreco</k> cost price; <k>precoza</k> costly,
expensive, valuable, precious (in money value); <k>precoza lapido</k>
precious stone; <k>precozeso</k> preciousness;<k>precozajo</k> a
precious thing; <k>fabrik preco</k> cost of making, manufacturing
cost; <k>kozo super omna preco</k> a priceless thing; <k>pro irga
 preco</k> at any price; <ex>(fig.)</ex> cost what it will.

<k>precedar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have, to take precedence of, to
go before in rank, importance, etc.; (cf. <k>preirar</k>); <k>precedo</k>
precedence: right or fact of precedency, priority; <k>precedanto</k>
one who has or takes precedence; predecessor (in office); <ex>(pl.)</ex>
predecessors, forefathers; <k>precedanta</k> antecedant, (cf. <k>antea</k>, <k>antecedento</k>). Def.: Esir en plaso, ofico nemediate avan; <k>precede</k>
pasar avan altru segun lego, regulo; VI-418. Ex.: Grava aferi
precedas la neimportanta.

<k>precedento</k> a precedent, authoritative case, example or
instance.

<k>precipitar</k> <ex>(tr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to precipitate,
cause to fall, hurry along, throw down, hurl headlong, dash down,
plunge; <ex>(chem.)</ex> to throw to the bottom of a vessel; <k>precipitar
 su</k> to rush (upon); <k>precipitajo</k> <ex>(chem.) </ex>precipitate.
Ex.: Il precipitis su ek la fenestro. Precipitar naciono en
milito.

<k>precipua</k> principal, main, leading, capital; <k>precipue</k>
above all, especially; <k>precipuajo</k> the chief thing, essential
part, main point; <k>e precipue</k>, <k>esez prudenta</k> and above all
be prudent. Def.: Qua esas maxim konsiderinda, importanta.

<k>precitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to previously cite; <k>precitita</k>
above mentioned, aforesaid.

<k>preciza</k> precise, having fixed limitation, not loose,
vague or uncertain; definite, distinct, exact, formal, terse;
(N.B. not used of persons); <k>precize</k> precisely, just so; <k>precizeso</k>
precision; <k>precizigar</k> to state precisely, to specify; <k>precizigo</k>, <k>preciziguro</k> specification. Def.: Qua esas strikte definita o
determinita; IV-102. Ex.: Dio preciza. Horo preciza. Ordino
preciza. V. exp.: vid. <k>akurata</k>, <k>exakta.</k>

<k>predikar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to preach (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>); (cf. <k>exhortar</k>); <k>predikanto</k>, <k>predikero</k>, <k>predikisto</k>
preacher; <k>predikar per sua exemplo</k> to set an example, to
practise what one preaches.

<k>predispozar</k> <ex>(tr., gen. and med.)</ex> to prepossess,
predispose (cf. <k>inklinar</k>); <k>preeso</k> predisposition,
presumption, prejudice; <k>preita</k> prepossessed, biassed.

<k>prefaco</k> preface (of a book); <k>prefacizar</k> to insert,
write a preface (for).

<k>prefekto</k> <ex>(Rom. antiq. and chief administrator of each
department in France)</ex> prefect.

<k>preferar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prefer, like better: give
preference in mind to (<k>ulo</k>, <k>kam</k>); <k>preferesar</k> to be
preferred; <k>prefero</k> preference, predilection; <k>preferajo</k> what
is preferred, choice; <k>prefere (kam)</k> preferably (to), in
preference (to), rather (than); <k>preferinda</k> preferable. Ex.:
Preferar mortar kam vivar. Preferar la honoro kam la pekunio.

<k>prefixo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> prefix; <k>prefixizar</k>, <k>prefixigar</k> to
put at the beginning of a word.

<k>pregar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pray (to) (God); to beg, entreat,
beseech (<k>ulu</k>, <k>pri</k>, <k>por</k>); (cf. <k>suplikar</k>); <k>pregostulo</k>
praying-chair, -desk; <k>pregolibro</k> prayer-book; <k>facar (</k>od<k>dicar) prego</k> say a prayer; <k>me pregas</k> I pray, I beg;
if you please.
<k>prehiere</k> (on the) day before yesterday, two days ago.

<k>prehistorio</k> pre-history, history prior to written
history; <k>prea</k> prehistoric. Def.: Ensemblo di la konocata
fakti pri la epoko antea a la tempi historiala.

<k>preirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to precede, go before, go first or
in front of (cf. <k>precedar</k>).

<k>prejudikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prejudge; <k>preo</k>
prejudgement, presumption, prejudice; <k>prea</k> prejudicial,
preconceived.

<k>prekara</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> precarious, depending upon the will
or pleasure of another; uncertain, unsettled.

<k>prekoca</k> precocious, early, ripe befor the proper season;
<ex>(of persons)</ex> ripe in understanding at an early age. Def.:
Developita ante la normal evo; III-606.

<k>prelasta</k> next to the last, last but one; <ex>(gram.)</ex>
penultimate; <k>prea silabo</k> penult.

<k>premeditar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to premeditate; <k>preo</k>
premeditation; <ex>(jur.)</ex> malice aforethought, malice
prepense; <k>pree</k> designedly, wilfully; with malice
aforethought.

<k>premio</k> <ex>(com., fin., insurance)</ex> premium, bounty,
bonus; <ex>(in competitions) </ex>a prize; <k>premiizar</k> to give a
premium or prize to.

<k>premico</k>, <k>premici</k> first-fruits; <ex>(fig.)</ex> first mass (of a
newly ordained priest).

<k>prenar</k> to take: lay hold of, by hand, etc.); <k>preno</k>
taking, prehension; <ex>(at cards)</ex> trick; <k>preniva</k>
prehensile; <k>prenar per la dento</k> to take hold of with the
teeth; <k>prenar ulu ye la brakio</k> to take someone by the arm; <k>prenar
 kozi inverse (</k>od<k>reverse)</k> to take things the wrong
way, amiss; <k>de</k>, <k>for prenar</k> to take from, remove.

<k>prenomo</k> first name, Christian name; <k>preizar</k> to
christen, give a first name to (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>preparar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to prepare (<k>su</k>, <k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>por</k>, <k>kontre</k>); <k>prepar(ad)o</k> preparation, preparing; <k>preparajo</k>
<ex>(also chem.)</ex> preparation (made); <k>preparanta</k>, <k>prepariva</k>, <k>preparala</k>
preparatory, preparative. Def.: Aranjar antee; predispozar. Ex.:
preparar dineo, diskurso, la mento, por voyajar.

<k>preponderar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to preponderate, have a
superiority in weight or influence; <k>prepondero</k> preponderance,
sway; <k>preponderanta</k> preponderant, prevailing; convincing
(reason).

<k>presar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to press, bear upon with force or
weight; <k>preseso alta</k>, <k>basa</k> high, low pressure; <k>kun presar
 la denti</k> to clinch (clench) the teeth.

<k>presbiterio</k> council of parish trustees; vestry council,
presbytery (church elders); <k>presbiteriano</k> church warden.

<k>presentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have a presentiment of (<k>ulo</k>).
Def.: Havar sentimento nepreciza, instintatra pri ulo qua forsan
eventos.

<k>preske</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> almost, nearly, all but, scarcely.
Ex.: Me vendis preske omno. Preske nulo restas. Laboro preske
parfinita. Me preske nultempe vidis il. V. exp.: vid. <k>quaze.</k>
<k>preskisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make a preliminary sketch of.

<k>preskriptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prescribe, to set down
authoritatively, to direct, order; <ex>(med.)</ex> to direct as a
remedy; <k>preskripto</k> <ex>(gen.)</ex> precept, direction; <ex>(med.)</ex>
prescription (cf. <k>recepto</k>).

<k>presktirar</k> <ex>(tr., jur.)</ex> to bar or be lost by
statute of limitation. Def.: <k>Preskrito</k> perdo od aboliso
di yuro pos definita tempo; III-410.

<k>presorgar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to take precautions, be
cautious (<k>pri</k>, <k>kontre</k>); <k>preante</k>, <k>preema</k> precautionary,
cautious, wary; <k>preo</k> precaution.

<k>prestar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lend, loan (<k>ulo ad ulu</k>); <k>presto</k>
lending, loan (act); <k>prestajo</k> that which is loaned, a loan; <k>prestisto
 (po gajo)</k> pawnbroker; <k>prestar po interesto</k> to loan at
interest.

<k>prestaciono</k> <ex>(feudal law)</ex> prestation. Def.: Speco
di kontributo per laboro o pekunio por la manteno di la publika
voyi, e.c.; IV-447.

<k>prestijo</k> prestige. Def.: Speco di autoritato od influo,
qua venas de l’extera aspekto ed efikas per l’opiniono
ed imaginado; IV-447.

<k>pretendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lay claim to (<k>ulo</k>); be
a pretender to (a throne, etc.); <k>pretendo</k> pretension, claim; <k>pretendema</k>
pretentious; (cf. <k>pretextar</k>).

<k>preter</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> passing, past (by): indicates
motion from one side to the other past a certain object; <k>preterirar</k>
<ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to pass (by), go beyond; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
overreach (cf. <k>devancar</k>); <k>la kavaliero ne haltis apud
 la kirko ma kavalkadis preter ol</k> the knight did not stop at
the church but rode past it; <k>departinte ante ni</k>, <k>la amiki
 arivis pos ni; nam ni rajuntis li e preteriris li</k> having
departed before us, our friends arrived after us; for we overtook
them and passed them by.

<k>pretextar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to allege (as a pretext),
pretend, feign, sham (<k>ulo</k>); <k>pretexto</k> pretext, pretence:
ostensible reason; <k>pretexto falsa</k>, <k>versemblanta</k> fake,
specious, pretended; <k>il pretextas nesavo</k> he pretends
ignorance; <k>pretextar ula afero urjanta</k> to allege pressing
business; <k>kun pretexto di maladeso</k>under pretence of
illness.

<k>pretoro</k> <ex>(Rom. antiq.)</ex> pretor, prætor; <k>pretoreyo</k>
pretorium; <k>pretorano</k> a pretorian soldier.

<k>preurbo</k> suburb (= F. <ex>faubourg:</ex> district which is
or was formerly outside the city walls; cf. <k>suburbo</k>); <k>preala</k>
suburban; <k>preano</k> suburbanite.
<k>prevalorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prevail (cf. <k>preponderar</k>, <k>vinkar</k>). Ex.: Favoro ofte prevaloras super merito.

<k>prevarikar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to betray one’s trust
(N.B. not «to lie»; cf. <k>mentiar</k>); <k>prevariko</k> breach of
trust (esp. in public office). Def.: Faliar sua devo pro
interesto o ne-sincereso. Ex.: Ministro, judiciisto, qua
prevarikas en sua ofico.

<k>preventar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prevent, ward off, forestall; <k>preventiva</k>, <k>preventivo</k> preventive. Def.: Impedar o remediar ula evento (mala)
ante lua aparo; II-20.

<k>previdar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to foresee, anticipate; <k>preo</k>
foresight, prevision; <k>preema</k> provident, prudent, careful; <k>preante</k>
in anticipation of (<k>ulo</k>).

<k>prevosto</k> provost. Def.: Titulo uzata en diversa faki:
eklezio, militistaro, polico, etc. (La epiteti o la kuntexto
specialigos olu); V-89.

<k>prezenta</k> <ex>(in space)</ex> present: not absent; <ex>(in
time)</ex> present: not past or future (cf. <k>nuna</k>); <k>prezente</k>
at present, now; <k>prezento</k> (the) present (time); <ex>(gram.)</ex>
present tense; <k>prezenteso</k> presence: existence in a place. V.
exp.: On parolas pri persono prezenta same kam evento prezenta;
VI-163. Ant.: <k>absenta</k>, <k>pasinta.</k>

<k>prezervar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to preserve, save: keep from
injury (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>de</k>, <k>kontre</k>); (cf. <k>konfitar</k>, <k>konservar</k>);
<k>prezerviva</k>, <k>prezervivo</k>, <k>prezervilo</k> peservative. Ex.: Preservar ulu de
grande danjero.

<k>prezidar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to preside over; to take
the chair, be chairman; <k>prezido</k> presiding; <k>prezidanto</k>, <k>prezidero</k>, <k>prezidisto</k> president, chairman; <k>prezidanteso</k> <ex>(function,
duration)</ex> presidency; chairmanship; <k>prezidantala</k>
presidential.

<k>prezuntar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> presumptuous, presuming; to
have undue confidence in oneself; <k>prezunto</k> presumption, excess
of self-confidence; <k>prezuntema</k>, <k>prezuntoza</k> presuming, too confident,
self-conceited; without proper basis in reason. V. exp.: vid. <k>superba.</k>
Ex.: Yuneso esas prezuntoza.

<k>pri</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> about, concerning, relating to, in
regard to, in reference to, as regards, re, apropos of; <k>joyoza
 pri la bona informo</k> glad about the good news; <k>diskurso
 pri ekonomio</k> lecture on economy; <k>pri quo ve pensas nun?</k>what
are you thinking about now? <k>me pensas pri mea gepatri</k> I
am thinking about my parents; <k>me ne savas pri to</k> I do not
know about that.

<k>priklar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.; of sensation)</ex> to prickle,
tingle; <k>sentar prikleso di la gambi</k> to feel one’s legs
asleep.

<k>prima</k> primary: first in order of development, of time;
not derived; <k>primtipo</k> archetype; <k>primavi</k> (nia)<k />
(our) first parents; <k>prima nombri</k>, <k>kolori</k> prime numbers,
colo(u)rs; <k>primo</k> <ex>(fig., fencing)</ex> prime; <ex>(R.C.
Lit.)</ex> prime.

<k>primara</k> primary, elementary, first or lowest in order; <k>primara
 skolo</k> primary school; <k>primara tereni</k> <ex>(geol.)</ex>
strata earliest deposited.

<k>primitiva</k> primitive; <k>primitivo</k> <ex>(hist. gram.)</ex> a
primitive. Ex.: Primitiva naturo, eklezio, linguo.

<k>princ(ul)o</k> prince (cf. <k>rejido</k>); <k>princino</k>
princess; <k>princala</k>, <k>princatra</k> princely; <k>princeso</k> <ex>(dignity,
rank)</ex> princedom; <k>princo lando</k>, <k>princio</k> <ex>(territory)</ex>
principality; <k>princospozulo</k> prince consort; <k>princo salika</k>
Salic prince; <k>princetacho</k> a petty prince, princeling.

<k>principo</k> principle; <k>supozo di principo</k> <ex>(log.)</ex>
petitio principii, begging the question. Ex.: Extablisar
principo. La principo di movo. Homo sen-principa.

<k>printempo</k> spring (-time); <ex>(fig.)</ex> prime, bloom of
youth; <k>printempoala</k> spring, vernal.

<k>priora</k> prior, before (cf. <k>antea</k>); <ex>(jur.)</ex>
priority. Def.: Qua pasas avan irgu pri ula kozo; VI-382. Ex.: La
parento havas la yuro di prioreso (pro anteeso) dum un yaro.

<k>prior(ul)o</k> prior (in a convent); <k>priorino</k> prioress; <k>prioreyo</k>
priory, religious house.

<k>privacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deprive, take from, strip off;
to bereave; <k>privacar su</k> to deprive, stint, deny oneself (<k>de</k>);
<k>privaco</k> <ex>(act)</ex> privation; <k>privaceso</k> <ex>(state)</ex>
deprivation, loss, want, bereavement; <k>privacala</k>, <k>privacanta</k>, <k>privaciva</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex>
privative; <ex>(jur.)</ex> in severalty. Ex.: Privacar ulu de lua
havajo, lua libereso. Privaco de vidado.

<k>privilejo</k> privilege: peculiar advantage or benefit; <k>privilejizar</k>
to grant a privilege to a (<k>ulu</k>); <k>privilejizita</k>, <k>privilejito</k>
privileged (person).

<k>prizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to appreciate, like, prize, value.
Ex.: Prizar la bona qualesi, la meriti, la servado, la judiko, la
opiniono, du ulu.

<k>prizentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to present: set or place before; <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to present (arms); to introduce; (cf. <k>ofrar</k>, <k>montrar</k>, <k>expozar</k>).
Ex.: Prizentar buketo. Prizentar akredito-letro ad ulu. Ca afero
prizentas granda avantaji. Prizentar ulu a la rejo.

<k>pro</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> because of, on account of, out of,
owing to, in consequence of; <k>pro ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex>
because, since, on the ground that, (cf. <k>nam</k>); <k>pro quo?</k>
why?<k>pro to</k> that is why; <k>pro quo ne?</k> why not?
<k>trista pro la desfortuno</k> sad because of misfortune; <k>pro
 jaluzeso</k> out of jealousy; <k>malada pro diabeto</k> sick
with diabetes; <k>sufrar pro dursto</k> to suffer from thirst; <k>dispensita
 de ulo pro infirmajo (</k>od<k>pro ke il esis infirma)</k>
exempt from something on account of infirmity (or because he was
too infirm). Ex.: El ne povis venar, pro ke el esis malada. Pro
quo vu amas il? Pro ke il esas mea amiko. Pro quo vu ne volas
venar kun me? Pro ke me ne havas sata tempo. Pro quo vu ne
prestas la pekunio ad il? Me ne konocas il; pro to me ne prestos
la pekunio.

<k>probar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to test, make trial of, put to test,
prove by experiment; (cf. <k>esforcar</k>); <ex>(of ore metals)</ex>
to assay; <k>probemetar</k> to try on (clothing); <k>probotempiero</k>
probationer; <k>probero</k>, <k>probisto</k> tester, assayer; <k>probostono</k>
touchstone; <k>probar chanco</k>, <k>risko</k> to run a chance, to take a
risk. Ex.: Probar paf-armo. Probar sua forteso. La febla ucelo
probas sua ali. Probo di la oro.

<k>probabla</k> probable, likely, having more evidence than the
contrary; which is likely to happen; <k>probable</k> probably; <k>probablajo</k>
probability: thing probable; <k>probableso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>
likelihood, probability; <k>probablismo</k> <ex>(theol.)</ex>
probabilism; <k>kalkulo</k><k>(od teorio)</k><k>di la
 probablesi</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> theory of probabilities, doctrine
of chances. Ex.: La aventajo semblas apene probabla (od, semblas
neprobabla). Existas nula probableso ke il venos.

<k>problemo</k> problem; <k>problematra</k> problematical, doubtful.
Ex.: Geometriala problemo. Ol esas problem solvenda. Pozar ulo
kom problemo.

<k>procedar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to proceed, go on (<k>ad ulo</k>);
to act, behave in a certain way; <k>procedo</k> proceeding, way of
acting, behaviour, process. Ex.: Procedar a la exameno di
kandidato. Procedar lente, cirkonspekte. Simpligar la procedo.
Procedo kemiala.

<k>proceduro</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> procedure, manner of proceeding;
practice; proceedings: measures taken in the prosecution of an
action; <k>procedurema</k> litigious. Ex.: Kodexo di civila proceduro.
Spenso di proceduro.

<k>procento</k> percentage (N.B. does not refer to interest or
rent of capital; cf. <k>po</k> and Talmey’s Text Book, p.
82). Def.: Raporto di la du nombri; V-681. Ex.: Il postulas kin
po cento kom procento. Me kolokis 1000 fr. ye la procento di quar
po cento. La procento di la naski, di la morti, di la mariaji en
ula populo o habitantaro.

<k>procesar</k> <ex>(intr., jur.)</ex> to bring action, go to
law, institute proceedings, prosecute, proceed (<k>kontre ulu</k>);
(law-) suit, action; trial; <k>procesema</k> litigious; <k>procesanto</k>
litigant.

<k>procesionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to walk in procession, to
make a procession (in the streets, in the church, etc.); <k>procesione</k>, <k>procesionatre</k> in procession.

<k>proda</k>, <k>prod(ul)o</k> valiant, gallant, doughty (person); <k>prodeso</k>
prowess, valo(u)r; <k>prodajo</k> a feat of valor, exploit.

<k>prodigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lavish, be prodigal of, be
unsparing of; <k>prodigachar</k> to squander waste; <k>prodigado</k>, <k>prodigemeso</k>
prodigality, lavishness, extravagance; <k>prodigema filiulo</k>
prodigal son. Def.: Spensar abundante ed ecese (en un sama
okaziono); IV-102. V. exp.: Prodigar povas havar laudanta senco.
On prodigas sua havajo, sua sorgi, sua bonfaci a un o poka
personi. «Deo prodigas sua graco a la pekanto»; kp. <k>disipar.</k>

<k>produktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to produce, engender, bring
forth, bear, yield; (cf. <k>genitar</k>); <k>produkturo</k>, <k>produktajo</k>
product; <k>produktanto</k>, <k>produktero</k> producer; <k>produktanta</k>, <k>produktiva</k>, <k>produktema</k>
producing, productive. Ex.: Ca lando produktas multa oro. La
arbori produktas frukti. La autoro produktas verki. La milito
produktas granda malaji. La produktaji di naturo. Sulo
produktiva.

<k>profana</k> profane, not sacred; related to secular affairs;
proceeding from contempt of sacred things; <k>profan(ul)o</k> person
uninitiated into any mystery or rite; person not conversant with
any art or science; an outsider; <k>profanajo</k> a profane thing or
act (cf. <k>profanacar</k>); Ex.: Profana parolado, historio,
konduto, ago, naturo. Mixar la profanaji kun la sakraji.

<k>profanacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to profane: treat sacred things
with abuse, irreverence, contempt; to desecrate; <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
degrade, debase; <k>profanac(ad)o</k> profanation. Ex.: Profanacar
templo. Profanado di sua talenti.

<k>profesar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to profess, make a profession of; <k>profeso</k>
profession. Def.: Deklarar publike. Ex.: On profesas religio,
kredo, doktrino, fido pri ulu od ulo.

<k>profesiono</k> <ex>(occupation)</ex> profession; <k>profesionala</k>
professional; <k>profesionano</k> member of a profession; <k>profesione</k>
professionally, by profession. Ant.: <k>amatoro.</k>

<k>profesoro</k> professor (in a university, college,
seminary); <k>profesorala</k> professorial; <k>profesoreso</k> professorship.

<k>profeto</k> prophet, seer; <k>profetala</k> prophetic, relating
to a prophet. (cf. <k>predicanta</k>).

<k>profilo</k> profile, side-face, -view; <k>profilizar</k> to draw
or show (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); in profile; <k>profiligar su</k> to
appear, stand out in profile; <k>profile posturar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>
to pose in profile; <k>mi profile</k> <ex>(photog.)</ex> a pose
between back and profile.

<k>profitar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to profit (pecuniarily or
otherwise); (cf. <k>ganar</k>); <k>profitigar</k> to cause profit to
(<k>ulu</k>). Def.: Avantajizar per ulo; ganar per ulo. Ex.:
Profitar (<k>ulo</k>) per komercaji vendita, konsilo donita.

<k>profunda</k> deep, profound: extending far below the
surface; <ex>(fig.)</ex> abstruse, sagacious; <k>profundeso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>
depth, profundity; <k>profundajo</k> depth (a place); <k>profundigar</k> to
deepen; <k>lago profunda de kin metri</k> a lake five meters (metres)
deep; <k>des</k>, <k>ne profunda</k> shallow; <k>min</k>, <k>ne profundajo</k> shoal;
<k>min</k>, <k>plu profundeskar</k> to shelve. Def.: Qua relatas la triesma
dimensiono (generale vertikala) ed aplikesas a l’interna
dimensiono di objekto kava. (Vazo esas alta, regardata de extere;
ol esas profunda, se on konsideras lua kavajo.) IV-596-7. Ex.:
Profunda puteo, vunduro. Profunda dormo, doloro, nul-savo.
Cienco, pensero, raskalo profunda. Studiar profunda.

<k>prognozar</k><ex> (tr., med.)</ex> to prognosticate:
foretell (<k>ulo</k>) from present symptoms; to make a prognosis.

<k>programo</k> program, written outline of entertainment or
ceremony; <ex>(of a theater)</ex> playbill; <ex>(of a political
party)</ex> platform; <ex>(in a university)</ex> syllabus; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
plan, project.

<k>progresar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to progress, make progress; <k>progres(ad)o</k>
progressing, advancement; <k>progresanta</k>, <k>progresiva</k>, <k>progresema</k> progressive; <k>progresemo</k>
a progressive person; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a liberal, radical. Ex.: La
atako kontre l’enemiko progresas. La progreso di incendio,
di inundado, di studiado, di morbo. Ant.: <k>retroirar</k>, <k>regresar.</k>

<k>projektar</k> <ex>(tr., geom. opt.)</ex> to project; <k>projekto</k>, <k>projekturo</k> projection; <k>projektajo</k> that which is projected; <k>projektaparato</k>
a projector. Ex.: Korpo qua projektas sua ombro sur altra.
Projekto di Mercator.

<k>projetar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to plan, scheme, purpose, to form
a project; <k>projeto</k> project; <k>projetata</k>, <k>projetita</k> projected,
contemplated. Ex.: Projetar longa voyajo. Projetar facar ulo. Ca
homo sen-cese projetas, ma ultempe parfinas ulo.? DEFIRS

<k>proklamar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to proclaim, cry out, give out; <k>proklamo</k>, <k>proklamajo</k>, <k>proklamuro</k> proclamation. Ex.: Proklamar ulu kom rejo.
Proklamar la bona agi di uli. Publikigar proklamajo.

<k>prokurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to procure, get, obtain; <k>prokuristo
 di employi</k> keeper of an employment office. Ex.: Prokurar
employeso por ulu. Prokurar manjajo por ulu.

<k>prokuraco</k> procuration: power to act for another, proxy;
the instrument which empowers, warrant, letter of attorney; <k>prokuraciero</k>
one who holds proxy, proxy-holder; <k>prokuracizar</k> to empower (<k>ulu</k>);
<k>agar per prokuraciero</k> to act by proxy.

<k>proletario</k> proletarian, labo(u)rer, worker; <k>proletaria</k>, <k>proletariala</k>
proletarian; <k>proletarieso</k> <ex>(state, condition)</ex> proletariat; <k>proletariaro</k>
<ex>(collect.)</ex> proletariat, laboring class, non-possessing
class.

<k>prolixa</k> prolix, verbose, diffuse (style, discourse,
narrative, etc.); <k>prolixeso</k> prolixity. Ant.: <k>lakonika</k>, <k>kurta.</k>

<k>prolongar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lengthen, extend (by addition,
in space); <k>prolongo</k>, <k>prolonguro</k> prolongation. Def.: Adjuntar ad ula
kozo ulo suplementala, qua konstitucas integrajo kun ol, e qua
nomesas prolonguro; IV-138. V. exp.: <k>Plulongigar</k> relatas
tempo, durado. On <k>prolongas</k> kayo, muro; ma on <k>plulongigas</k>
vivo, voyajo, milito.

<k>promenar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go for a walk, promenade,
walk, stroll (for pleasure); <k>promenigar</k> to take (<k>ulu</k>)
out walking; <k>promen(ad)o</k> (act) walk(ing); <k>promeneyo</k> place
for walking, promenade.

<k>promisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to promise (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ad ulu; facar
 ulo</k>); <ex>(fig., of weather, etc.)</ex> to forebode; <k>promisolando</k>
land of promise; <k>promisar per sua honoro</k> to give his word (cf.
<k>honorpromiso</k>); <k>exekutar (</k>od<k>satisfacar) sua promiso</k>
to keep one’s promise; be as good as one’s word; <k>violacar
 (</k>od<k>faliar) sua promiso</k> violate one’s promise,
break his word.

<k>promocar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to promote: raise, advance
(someone to a higher rank, grade); <k>promoco</k> promotion,
preferment (of officers, learners, etc.).

<k>pronar</k> <ex>(intr., R.C. ch.)</ex> «to pronate». V. exp.:
Prono esas nek prediko nek solena diskurso. Ol kontenas
diversa prego-formuli, rekomendi, konsili, avizi e fine
instrukto-diskurso familiara facata por la parokiani dum la meso.
Dec. 1538, M.XI 67.

<k>pronacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pronate: turn the palm of the
hand downward or backward; <k>pronacanto</k>, <k>pronacanta muskulo</k> pronator
muscle.

<k>pronta</k> ready: prepared, in readiness; willing, disposed;
<k>prontigar</k> to make (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) ready; <k>pronta ad departar</k>
ready to go; <k>pronta por omno</k> ready for anything; <k>la dineo
 esas pronta</k> dinner is ready.

<k>pronuncar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pronounce (words; cf. <k>artikular</k>);
<k>pronuncarodefekto</k> impediment of speech.

<k>propagar</k> to propagate: multiply or continue by
generation; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to spread abroad, diffuse; to make
propaganda; <k>propagesar</k> to be propagated; <k>propaganto</k>, <k>propagero</k>, <k>propagemo</k>
propagator; propagandist; <k>propagemeso</k> proslelytism. Ex.: Esas
necesa propagar la animali e la vejetantaro utila. Propagar lumo,
la evangeligo, lo vera.

<k>proporciono</k> <ex>(also arith.)</ex> proportion: relation,
ratio; <k>proporcionigar</k>, <k>proporcionizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to proportion: adjust
relatively; <k>proporcionala</k> proportional; <k>proporcionalo meza</k> mean
proportional; <k>proporcionaleso</k> proportionality; <k>proporcione</k>, <k>proporcionale</k>
in proportion (<k>ad</k>), pro rata, proportionately; <k>proporcionigita
 bone</k> well proportioned; <k>sen proporciona</k> disproportionate.
Ex.: Proporcionigar la spensi a la recevaji. Proporcionigar la
puniso a la kulpo.

<k>propozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to propose: to offer (<k>ulo</k>)
for consideration; to propound; to move (a resolution or
amendment); <k>propozo</k> <ex>(act)</ex> proposal, offer; <ex>(parl.)</ex>
motion; <k>propozajo</k> what is proposed, proposition; V. exp.: vid.
<k>ofrar.</k>

<k>propra</k> own, belonging to, proper, peculiar to; <k>proprajo</k>
something which belongs to someone or something, peculiarity,
characteristic, attribute, property, one’s own; (cf. <k>singularajo</k>, <k>partikularajo</k>); <k>propreso</k> quality of being
somebody’s own; <k>propre</k> properly, strictly; <k>propra
 dicita</k> properly so-called; <k>propre parolante</k> strictly
speaking; <k>proprigar</k> to appropriate: consign to a particular
person; <k>proprigar a su</k> to appropriate: to one’s own use,
make (<k>ulo</k>) one’s own; <k>propramo</k> self-love,
-esteem, -respect, conceit; «amour-propre»; <k>raciono esas
 propra (</k>od<k>esas proprajo) di la homo</k> reason is
peculiar to man; <k>propra nomo</k> proper name or noun; <k>la
 propra signifiko di vorto</k> the proper meaning of a word; <k>me
 facis omno per mea propra manui</k> I did it all with my own
hands; <k>persono havas karakterizivi propra</k> a person has
his own (or peculiar) characterisics; <k>la proprajo di magneto</k>
the property of a magnet; <k>lua propra filiulo</k> his own
son.? EFIS

<k>proprietar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to own: have legitimate
possesion of (cf. <k>posedar</k>); <k>proprieto</k> ownership; <k>proprietajo</k>
that which is owned, property; <k>proprietanto</k>, <k>proprietero</k> owner,
proprietor; <k>proprieto literaturala</k> copyright; <k>proprieto nuda</k>
bare ownership; <ex>(jur.)</ex> property without usufruct of it,
revisionary interest.

<k>prosektoro</k> prosector: assistant disector or professor of
anatomy.

<k>prospekto</k> prospectus: preliminary statement of a plan,
scheme, or literary work.

<k>prosperar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to prosper, be successful,
thrive; <k>prosperema</k> propitious; <k>havar prosperala mieno</k>
have an air of prosperity, look successful.

<k>prosternar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to prostrate oneself (cf. <k>prostracar</k>);
<k>prosternigar</k> to cause someone to prostrate himself. Def.: Jetar
su avan ulu, ulo, kom signo di adoro o humila respekto (ago o
gesto ceremoniala).

<k>prostitucar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prostitute, make a
prostitute of (<k>ulu</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to degrade (<k>su</k>);
put (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) to a base use; <k>prostituceyo</k> house of
prostitution; <k>prostitucatino</k> a prostitute.

<k>prostracar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in a stare of
prostration (extreme physical weakness) be prostrated; <k>prostraco</k>
<ex>(med. and gen.)</ex> prostration (cf. <k>prosterno</k>). Def.:
Esar en stando di extrema depreso, mentala o korpala.

<k>protagonisto</k> protagonist: <ex>(theater)</ex> chief actor; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
one who takes the lead in any great matter.

<k>proteo</k> <ex>(myth.)</ex> Proteus; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a man who
frequently changes his opinions; <ex>(zool.)</ex> proteida; <k>proteala</k>
protean.

<k>protektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to protect, defend; <k>protektanta</k>, <k>protektiva</k>, <k>protektema</k> protecting, protective, fostering; <k>protektato</k>
person protected; <ex>(fig.)</ex> protégé. Ex.: Protektar lo
febla, la inocenti, la urbo. Protektata kontre la koldeso.?
DEFIRS

<k>protektorato</k> protectorate. Def.: Autoritato asumita da
plu-forta stato super inferiora o dependata stato, partikulare
pri la relati exterlanda.

<k>protestar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to protest (publicly); <ex>(tr.,
com.)</ex> to protest (payment on a bill). Def.: Asertar forte,
solene, publike. Ex.: Protestar kontre abrogo. Il protestas ke
omno esis facata kontre lua volo. Protestar pago.

<k>protezo</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> prosthesis. Def.: Adjunto di
artificala parto por remplas-igar parte o tote korpala defekto
(ex.: artificala gambo).

<k>protokolo</k> <ex>(parl.)</ex> written minutes (of
proceedings); <ex>(diplom.)</ex> protocol; «proces verbal»,
official report (by functionary, as of a crime).

<k>protuberanca</k> protuberant, prominent (cf. <k>salianta</k>);
<k>protuberanco</k> <ex>(anat., astron. and gen.)</ex> protuberance,
prominence: projecting part.

<k>proverbo</k> proverb, adage (cf. <k>sentenco</k>); <k>proverba</k>, <k>proverbatra</k> proverbial; <k>proverbeskar</k> to become a proverb; become
proverbial; <k>proverbokomedio</k> short dramatic composition. Def.:
Kurta, populara precepto o dicajo.

<k>provinco</k> province; <ex>(fig.)</ex> shire, country district
or region outside of a capital city; <k>provincala</k> provincial; <k>provincatra</k>
countrylike;<k>provincano</k> a provincial, a country person; <k>provincestro</k>
<ex>(rel.)</ex> a monastic superior; <k>provincalajo</k> a
provincialism; a provincial idiom; <k>provincalismo</k> provincialism
(system).

<k>provizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to provide, supply, furnish (<k>ulu</k>, <k>per ulo</k>); to victual; <k>provizo</k>, <k>provizuro</k> providing, supply,
stock, store; <k>provizanto</k>, <k>provizero</k>, <k>provizisto</k> provider, supplier,
caterer, purveyor; <ex>(milit.)</ex> sutler, canteen-worker. Ex.:
Provizar armeo per municioni. Provizar ulu per omna necesaji. V
exp.: vid. <k>furnisar.</k>

<k>provizora</k> provisional, temporary, transitory; <k>provizore</k>
provisionally, temporarily; <k>provizorajo</k> provisional measure,
arangement.

<k>provokar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to provoke: call forth; incite,
incense; <k>provokanta</k>, <k>provokiva</k>, <k>provokema</k> provoking, provocative; <k>provokar
 a kombato</k> to call forth to combat. Def.: Agar segun maniero
por produktar reprezalo.

<k>proxeneto</k> panderer, pimp, go-between; <k>proxenetino</k>
procuress; <k>proxeneteso</k> business, position of being a pimp. Def.:
Persono qua agas kom mediacero en shaminda afero.

<k>proxim</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> near, by, close to, nigh to; (of
time and space; for quantities cf. <k>cirkum</k>; cf. <k>apud</k>);
<k>li esis proxim la urbo</k> they were near the city; <k>proxim
 la instanto decidiganta</k> near the decisive moment; <k>proxime</k>
<ex>(adv.)</ex> near, nigh, close; <k>il lojas proxime</k> he
lives close by; <k>proxima</k> near, next, bordering upon; <k>ka vu
 akompanos me a la proxima strado?</k> will you accompany me to
the next street? <k>printempo esas proxima</k> spring is
near; <k>la maxim proxima urbo</k> the nearest city; <k>ta urbo
 esas plu proxima</k> that city is nearer; <k>proximeso</k>
proximity, nearness; <k>proximigar</k> to bring, draw (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>)
near; <k>il proximigas la hundo</k> he made the dog come near
him; <k>proximeskar</k> to draw nigh, approach, to approximate; <k>la
 hundo proximeskas</k>the dog came near; <k>la tempo
 proximeskas;</k> the time draws nigh; <k>to esas nur proxime
 justa</k> that is only approximately right; <k>proximigo ad la
 vereso</k> approximation to the truth.

<k>prozo</k> prose; <k>prozaltra</k> prosaic, dull, matter of
fact; -<k>atreso</k> prosiness; <k>prozajo</k> piece of prose.

<k>pruo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> bow, prow. Def.: L’avana parto
di navo o batelo.

<k>pruda</k> prudish; <k>prudino</k> a prude; <k>prudeso</k>
(quality, characteristic prudishness); <k>prudajo</k> a prudish
act. Def.: Afektacante pudoroza.

<k>prudenta</k> prudent, cautious, politic, discreet, wary; <k>prudent(ul)o</k>
a prudent person; <k>prudenteso</k> prudence; <k>prudente</k> with
prudence, discreetly; <k>ne prudenta</k> imprudent, rash. Def.: Saja
e cirkonspekta en agado e konduto. V. exp.: vid. <k>cirkonspekta.</k>

<k>pruinar</k>, <k>pruinas</k> <ex>(impers.)</ex> there is (or, we are
having) a hoar frost (or, white frost); <k>pruino</k> hoar-frost,
rime; <k>pruinoza</k>, <k>pruinizita</k> white with frost, rimy,
frost-covered.

<k>pruno</k> plum: prune; <k>pruniero</k> plum-, prune-tree
(genus: Prunus); <k>pruniereyo</k> plum-orchard; <k>sika pruno</k>
(dried) prune.
<k>prunelo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> sloe: fruit of the blackthorn; <k>pruneliero</k>sloe-tree, blackthorn-tree (Prunus spinosa).

<k>pruntar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to borrow (<k>ulo</k>, <k>de ulu</k>);
(cf. <k>prestar</k>); <k>pruntajo</k> that which is borrowed, a
loan.

<k>pruritar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to itch; <k>prurit(ad)o</k> itching;
<ex>(med.)</ex> pruritis. Ex.: La skalpajo pruritas.

<k>pruvar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prove, demonstrate by experiment
or argument (<k>ulo</k>, <k>per ulu</k>); <k>pruvo</k> proving, proof,
evidence; <k>pruvanta</k>, <k>pruviva</k> convincing, decisive, conclusive
(arguments); (cf. <k>konkluziva</k>).

<k>psalmo</k> psalm; <k>psalmisto</k> psalmist; <k>psalmlibro</k>, <k>psalmaro</k>
book of psalms; psalter; psalms <ex>(collect.)</ex>; <k>psalmo
 penitencala</k> penitential psalm.

<k>psalmodiar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to psalmodize, to sing psalms;
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to drone out, recite (<k>ulo</k>) in a sing-song
manner; <k>psalmodio</k> psalmody, psalm-singing. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
sing-song. Def.: Psalmodio: maniero kantar la psalmi (aplikebla
ad altro kam psalmi); IV-515.

<k>pseudonima</k> pseudonymous; <k>pseudonimo</k> pseudonym, nom de
plume, alias. Def.: Aganta o skribanta kun falsa nomo.

<k>psiko</k> the conscious, knowing mind; <k>psikala</k>
psychical. Def.: La koncio fenomenala, la objekto di la
«psikologio» (tale psiko esas plu generala kam anmo); V-32.
Ex.: Psikala kauzi, qualesi, dolori.
<k>psikiatrio</k> psyschiatry. Def.: Kuracado di mentala morbi.

<k>psikologio</k> psychology. Def.: Ta parto di filozofio qua
traktas la mentala fakultati ed agado di la psiko.

<k>publicano</k> <ex>(Rom. hist.)</ex> publican. Def.: Recevisto
dil imposto o censo por la Romani (e pro to odiata e desestimata
da la Judi); VII-281.

<k>publicisto</k> publicist. Def.: Persono qua skribis od esas
erudita pri la yuri di nacioni, nacional ekonomiko, e.c.

<k>publika</k> public (opp. to private); <k>publiko</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
the public, the people (indefinately); <k>publike</k> publicly, in
public; <k>publikeso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex> publicity, notoriety; <k>publikigar</k>
to make (<k>ulo</k>) public (cf. <k>editar</k>); <k>publikig(ad)o</k>
<ex>(act)</ex> publication: <k>publikigajo</k> publication: that which
is published; <k>publika deklaro</k> manifesto; <k>publika saneso</k>
public health; <k>la publika prospero</k> the public welfare. Ant.: <k>privata.</k>

<k>pudlar</k> <ex>(tr. metal.)</ex> to puddle; <k>pudlisto</k>
puddler; <k>pudloforno</k> puddling-furnace. Def. : Konvertar
feraji a forjita fero per fuzado.

<k>pudorar</k> <ex>(intr., esp. of women)</ex> to feel a natural
shame, modesty; be modest; <k>pudoro</k> native bashfulness,
modesty, pudency, pudicity; <k>pudoroza</k>, <k>pudorema</k> ashamed, bashful,
chaste, modest, coy; <k>pudoracho</k> pretended modesty; <k>sen pudora</k>
without shame, immodest. Def.: Pudoro: la sexuala modesteso quan
la muliero specale sentas. <k />

<k>pudro</k> powder (for the toilet; cf. <k>pulvero</k>); <k>pudrizar</k>
to powder (the face, etc.); <k>riz pudro</k> rice powder.

<k>puero</k> child (of over seven years); <k>puerino</k> girl; <k>puerulo</k>
boy; <k>puerala</k>, <k>pueratra</k> juvenile, childish, puerile; <k>pueraleso</k>, <k>pueratreso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex> childishness; <k>pueralajo</k>
childish act or object.

<k>pufo</k> large stuffed footstool; round ottoman seat. Def.:
Sidilo (ped-apog-ilo) polsterizita (sen ula dors-apogilo):
II-647.

<k>pugno</k> fist, <k>pugnofrapar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to strike
with the fist; <k>pugnofrapo</k> a punch; <k>pugnofrapeto</k> a
cuff; <k>pugnofrapilo</k> (brass-) knuckle; <k>pugnokombato</k>
fistfight; <k>pugnoforteso</k> gripping power.

<k>pulio</k> pulley; <ex>(nav.)</ex> block; <ex>(tech.)</ex>
sheave; <k>puliaro</k> bock and tackle, hoisting gear, compound
pulley.

<k>pulpo</k> <ex>(of fruits, bot., pharm.)</ex> pulp; (cf. <k>paplo</k>);
<k>pulpoza</k>, <k>pulpatra</k> pulp-y, -ous; <k>pulpigar</k> to reduce (<k>ulo</k>)
to pulp.

<k>pulsar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to push, thrust, drive (by
force or violence); to impel (by pressure); to displace (by
effort); to throb, pulsate, beat (as heart); (cf. <k>shovar</k>);
<k>puls(ad)o</k> pushing, thrusting; pulse, pulsation, throbbing.
Ex.: Pulsar veturo. Pulsar ulu ek chambro. Pulsar per la manuo.
Pulsado di l’arterii. Palpar la pulsado di ulo. La vento
pulsas la navo.

<k>pultro</k> poultry, collective name for all domestic fowls;
(cf. <k>hano</k>); <k>pultruno</k> one fowl; <k>pultreyo</k>
poultry-house, place.

<k>pulular</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to pullulate: gow or germinate
abundantly (cf. <k>multeskar; formikumar</k>); <k>pulul(ad)o</k>
pullulation: rapid increase, swarm. Def.: Multeskar abundege e
rapide. Ex.: La pululado di mikrobi esas tre rapida.

<k>pulvero</k> powder, any dry stuff composed of small
particles, as used in guns, pharmacy (cf. <k>polvo</k>, <k>pudro</k>); <k>pulvera</k>
of powder; <k>pulveroza</k>, <k>pulveratra</k> powdery; <k>pulverigar</k> to reduce (<k>ulo</k>)
to powder, to pulverize; <k>pulverigita</k> pulverized; <k>pulverizar</k>
to cover with p.; <k>pulverifar</k> to make, produce p.; <k>pulveriferio</k>
p.-making establishment; <k>pulvermagazino</k> p.-magazine; <k>pulveruyo</k>
p.-holder, -horn; <k>chas pulvero</k> p. for hunting purposes; <k>min
 pulvero</k> p. for mining, blasting;<k>karbon pulvero</k> coal-dust; <k>fek
 pulvero</k> dried night-soil.

<k>pumpar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pump; <k>pumpilo</k> a pump; <k>pumpisto</k>
pumper; <ex>(fig.)</ex> fireman; <k>aer pumpilo</k> air pump; <k>incendio
 pumpilo</k> fire-engine.

<k>puncar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to punch: indent with pump or die; <k>puncuro</k>
(result) stamp (as of coins, medals, etc.); <k>puncilo</k> punch.
V. exp.: <k>Puncar</k> diferas de la <k>stampo</k> per ke <k>stampar</k>
esas nur imprimar sur surfaco, kontre ke <k>puncar</k> esas
penetrar o mem borar ula korpo; II-357.

<k>puncionar</k> <ex>(tr. surg.)</ex> to puncture, tap (a tumor,
etc.).

<k>punisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to punish, chastise (<k>ulu</k>, <k>por</k>, <k>per</k>); <k>puniso</k> <ex>(act)</ex> punishment; <k>punisuro</k>
penalty; <k>puniseso</k> punishment: state of being punished; <k>punisala</k>
penal; <k>punisanto</k>, <k>punisero</k> punisher, chastiser; <k>punisinda</k>
punishable; <k>punisesar</k> to be punished (<k>da</k>, <k>pro</k>); <k>puniso
 per amendo</k> punishment by fine; <k>punistasko</k> extra task (as
at school); <k>punislaboro</k> hard labo(u)r; <k>punisdomo</k> house of
correction.

<k>punsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pounce (a design). Def.: Kopiar
desegno per pulvero, quan on pasigas tra la trui di papero
perforita segun la linei di la desegno; VI-116.

<k>punto</k> <ex>(geom., astron., typo., play)</ex> point; dot;
position; period; small hole (as made by a needle or awl); <k>puntizar</k>
to dot, prick, mark (<k>ulo</k>) with a point; to punctuate; <k>puntizado</k>, <k>punturo</k> punctuation; dotting; <k>puntizosigno</k> stop; <k>puntizar
 le «i»</k> to dot the i’s; <k>puntokomo</k> semi-colon <k>(;)</k>;
<k>klamo punto</k> exclamation mark <k>(!)</k>; <k>bipunto</k>
colon <k>(:)</k>; <k>question punto</k> question mark <k>(?)</k>; <k>suto
 punto</k> stitch; <k>kontakto punto</k> p. of contact; <k>depart
 punto</k> p. of departure; <k>seko punto</k> p. of intersection; <k>incido
 punto</k> p. of incidence;<k>halto punto</k> stop; <k>vid punto</k>
viewpoint; <k>morto punto</k> p. of death; <k>kardinala punto</k> <ex>(geog.)</ex>
cardinal p.; <k>krizala punto</k> critical p.; <k>repoz punto</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex>
pause.

<k>pupo</k> poop, stern (of a ship, boat). Def.: Dopa parto di
navo, di batelo; III-594.

<k>pupeo</k> doll, puppet; <k>ludar per pupeo</k> to play with a
doll; <k>pupeatra</k> doll-like.

<k>pupitro</k> desk for reading, writing, drawing, etc. (N.B.
not pulpit; cf. <k>katedro</k>); <k>muzik pupitro</k> music-stand.

<k>pura</k> pure (air, water, blood, wine, race, life, style,
intentions, mathematics, etc.); genuine, unmingled, unalloyed;
plain, mere, sheer; downright; <k>pureso</k> purity, pureness; -<k>e</k>
purely, genuinely, merely; <k>purigar</k> to make (<k>ulo</k>)
pure, purify; <k>puriganta</k>, <k>purema</k> purifying; <k>purismo</k> <ex>(rhet.)</ex>
excessive nicety, esp. in choice of words; <k>purista</k>, <k>puristo</k>
purist(ic) (in choice of words); <k>pursanga</k> pure-blooded; <k>pursangulo</k>, <k>purino</k> thoroughbred. Def.: sen intermixuro; ne alterita,
ne-viciizita, ne-koruptita.

<k>pureo</k> purée, a thick soup, as of vegetables,
boiled and strained.

<k>purgar</k> <ex>(tr. lit. and fig.)</ex> to purge (the body,
soul, mind, etc.); <k>purgiva</k>, <k>purgivo</k> purgative; <k>purgilo</k> a
purging instrument. V. exp.: <k>Purgar</k>kuracar per purgivo
(quale purgar intestini); liberigar de nepurajo e stranjeraji
(quale purgar metalo); liberigar de kulpi etikal, intelektala
(quale purgar de prejudiko, misopiniono).

<k>purpuro</k> purple (colored); <k>purpuro</k> purple, (the
colo(u)r, dye); <k>purpuratra</k> purplish; <k>purpurizar</k> to empurple
(<k>ulo</k>).

<k>puso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> pus, purulent matter; <k>pusifar</k>
to produce pus; suppurate; <k>pusoza</k>, <k>pusifanta</k> purulent,
suppurative; <k>pusozeso</k> purulence.

<k>pustulo</k> pustule; <ex>(bot.)</ex> blister; <k>pustuleto</k>
small pustule; pimple (filled with matter). V. exp.: vid. <k>papulo.</k>

<k>putativa*</k> putatative, reputed, supposed. Def.: Quan on
supozas havar legal existo. Ex.: Putativa mariajo.

<k>puteo</k> well: shaft sunk in the ground for water, oil; <k>puteokordo</k>
well-rope; <k>puteoarteza</k> Artesian well.

<k>‹‹Babel››</k> <ex>(lit. and.
fig.)</ex> Babel; <k>‹‹Babel››turmo</k> tower of B.

<k>babilar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to babble, prattle
(as infants); to chatter (as a magpie); to gossip, gabble, prate
(of grown persons); <k>babil(ad)o</k> chit-chat,
gossiping, trifling talk; <k>babilero</k>, <k>babilemo</k> babbler,
tattler, chatter-box; <k>babilera</k>, <k>babilema</k> talkative,
loquacious; <k>babilajo</k> a matter of gossip; <k>babilacho</k>
busy-body.

<k>bachelero</k> bachelor (of a university); <k>bachelereso</k>
bachelorship, b. degree; <k>bachelero pre cienco</k> b. of
science: <k>bachelerokandidato</k> aspirant, candidate for
the b. degree; (cf. <k>celibulo</k>). Def.: l'unesma
(minim alta) universitatala grado; III-72.
