<k>badlano</k>, <k>badlani</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> star or Chinese aniseed; <k>badlaniero</k>
badian: aniseed tree (Illicium anisatum).

<k>badijonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to badigeon; <k>badijonivo</k>
badigeon: a cement or distemper paste of powdered stone and
plaster.

<k>bagajo</k> baggage, luggage; <k>bagajvagono</k> b. car; <k>bilieto
 di bagajo</k> ticket for b.; <k>depozeyo di bagajo</k> b. room; <k>manu
 bagajo</k> hand b.; <k>bagajuyo</k> holder, boot (of a carriage); <k>enskribeyo
 di bagajo</k> b. check-room; <k>portisto di bagaji</k> b. porter.

<k>bagatelo</k> bagatelle, trifle, trash, bauble; <k>bagatelverko</k>
literary trifle. DeFIS

<k>bagno</k> bagnio: convict hulk or prison; <k>bagnano</k>
galley-slave, -convict.

<k>bakar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bake (dry heat); <k>freshe</k>, <k>nove</k>, <k>heme bakita</k> fresh, newly, home baked; <k>bakoforno</k> b.
oven.

<k>Bako</k> Bacchus; <k>Bakala</k> Bacchic; <k>Bakanino</k>
bacchante; <k>Bakano</k> a follower of B.

<k>bakanalo</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> bacchanalia: a drunken
feast or revel.

<k>balo</k> ball (dance); <k>mask baloo</k> masked b.; <k>puer
 baloo</k> children's dance; <k>travesti baloo</k> fancy (dressed)
ball; <k>balochambro</k> ball-room; <k>baloshui</k> pumps; <k>baloacho</k>
public-house dance, shindy.
<k>balado</k> ballad, ballade: epic dance and song.

<k>balanco</k> balance: scales; <k>balanco Romana</k> steelyard; <k>letro
 balanco</k> letter-scale; <k>tordo balanco</k> torsion b.; <k>ponderar
 per balanco</k> to weigh by a b.

<k>balanciero</k> <ex>(of machines)</ex> a balancing body;
fly-wheel; gimbals (of a compass). Def.: Maso (generale
roto-forma) qua ocilas cirkum sua baricentro per risorto; II-641.

<k>balasto</k> ballast (for railways, ships); <k>balasteyo</k> b.
space; <k>balastizar</k> to b.; <k>sen balastigar; des balastizar</k> to
unb.

<k>balayar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sweep; <k>balayilo</k> a broom; <k>balayileto</k>
brush; <k>balayaji</k> sweepings; <k>mancho</k>, <k>shafto di balayilo</k>
broom handle; <k>facisto di balayili</k> b. maker; <k>strado
 balayisto</k> street-sweeper (vehicle).

<k>balbutar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to stutter, stammer (from
emotion); to lisp (as an infant); to boggle; hem and haw, to
hesitate in reading and reciting; (cf. <k>barbuliar</k>). V.
exp.: vid. <k>stoterar</k>.

<k>balde</k> soon, ere long, shortly; <k>balda</k> which will
soon take place; <k>til balde</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> goodbye for the
moment; <k>tam balde kam</k> as soon as; <k>esos balde du kloki</k>
it is near two o'clock. Ex.: Ni venis maxim balde posible. Ni
departos balde.

<k>baldakino</k> baldachin: tester (of a bed); canopy (of a
throne, altar, etc.); <k>lito kun baldakino</k> bed with canopy.

<k>baleno</k> whale; <k>balenyuno</k> young w.; <k>balenpeskisto</k>
whaler; <k>balenonavo</k> w.-ship; <k>balenkanoto</k> w. boat; <k>balenoleo</k>
w. oil.

<k>baliso</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> sea-mark, buoy, beacon; (cf. <k>boyo</k>);
<ex>(land)</ex> signal-pole (on R.R. or towpath); <k>baliseto</k>
(surveyor's) ranging rod; <k>balisizar</k> to buoy, erect beacons.

<k>balkono</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> balcony; <ex>(nav.)</ex> stern
gallery (of a ship); <k>fenestro kun balkono</k> window with b.

<k>balnar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bath, bathe, lave; <k>balnuyo</k>
bath (receptacle); <k>balnala</k> bathing; <k>balneyo</k> bathing
place; <k>balnanto</k>, <k>balnero</k>, <k>balnisto</k> bather, bath-keeper; <k>balnokuvo</k>
b. tub; <k>balnomantelo</k> b. robe; <k>balnoaquo</k> bath water; <k>balnokalsono</k>
bathing-drawers; <k>pedoo</k> foot-b.; <k>sedo balno</k> hip-b.;
<k>mar balno</k> sea-bathing; <k>maria balno</k> <ex>(chem.)</ex>
water-bath; <k>balnochambro</k> b. room; <k>balnoterapio</k> b.
therapeutics; <k>termala balni</k> thermal b.s.

<k>balono</k> ball or sphere filled with air; <k>baloneto</k>
small ball (as for tennis, etc.); <k>balono</k>, <k>balonego</k> air-balloon
(For technical terms cf. IV-330-1). <k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k />

<k>balotar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to elect (ulu) by second ballot, <k>baloto</k>
second-ballot (in Europe; necessary when no candidate has
obtained an absolute majority). <k>balotvoto</k> vote by ballot.

<k>balotear</k> <ex>(intr., med. and gen.)</ex> to wabble, shake,
tremble, quiver <k>(pro)</k>. Def.: La vulgara senco di ica vorto
expresas la movo ocilanta o tremanta di maso solida, ma elastika
o viskoza (quale gelatino). IV-516. Ex.: Lua karno baloteas pro
la shoko.

<k>balustro</k> baluster: upright support for railing. Def.:
Mikra pilastro faasonita.

<k>balustrado</k> balustrade, railing, (cf. <k>pasamano</k>).
Def.: Rango formacita ek balustri, generale horizontala.

<k>balzamo</k> balsam: fragrant resin used as medicine; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
balm, consolation; <k>balzamala</k>, <k>balzamoza</k> balsamic; balmy (odour,
air, etc.); <k>balzamiero</k> <ex>(genus)</ex> balsamodendron; <k>balzamizar</k>
to embalm (a body); <k>balzamizero</k>, <k>balzamisto</k> embalmer; <k>pektoral
 balzamo</k> pectoral b.; <k>balzamo di Gilead</k> balm of Gilead.

<k>bando</k> band (group), company, crew; <ex>(of fish)</ex>
shoal; <k>bandacho</k> gang, clique; <k>bando de furtisti</k> b. of
robbers; <k>rapt bando</k> b. of brigands; <k>haringo bando</k>
shoal of herrings.

<k>bandajo</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> bandage; truss; (of a wheel)
tire; <k>bandajizar</k> to bandage; put a tire on; <k>herniala bandajo</k>
truss for rupture; <k>menton bandajo</k> chin-b.

<k>bandear</k> <ex>(intr. nav.)</ex> to have a list, be lopsided;
<k>bandeigar</k> to cause to list; <k>bandeo</k> listing.

<k>banderolo</k> pennant, streamer, banderole. Def.: Bendo
longa ek stofo, qua flotacas en l'aero; finas ofte per du pinti;
en pikturi, portas surskriburi; II-708.

<k>bandoliero</k> bandolier: cross-, shoulder-belt. Def.:
Rimeno o sharpo pozita sur un shultro e suportanta ula kozo (ex.
espado) sur l'altra latero, do pasanta oblique sur la korpo;
II-708.

<k>banero</k> banner (as used by societies, orders); <k>banerala
 fronto</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> front line of battle, in battle array.
Def.: Speco di rektangula insigno (en stofo) fixigita per
horizontal latero a stango di sama longeso, qua pendas per du
kordi de la stango per qua on portas la insigno; III-31.

<k>banko</k> <ex>(fin.)</ex> bank; <k>bankisto</k> banker; <k>bankobilieto</k>
b. note; <k>bankoaciono</k> bank share, -stock; <k>emiso banko</k>
b. of issue; <k>banko di diskonto</k> discount bank.

<k>bankrotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be (or become) bankrupt; <k>bankrotigar</k>
to bankrupt: cause bankruptcy to: <k>bankroto</k> bankruptcy; <k>bankrotinto</k>, <k>bankrotero</k>
a bankrupt; (cf. <k>nesolventa</k>). Note: this word implies
something disgraceful or criminal; cf. <k>faliar</k>.

<k>baptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to baptize; <k>baptofili(ul)o</k>
godson, godchild; <k>baptomatro</k>, <k>baptopatrino</k> godmother; <k>baptopatrulo</k>
godfather; <k>baptonomo</k> Christian name, first name; <k>baptala
 vasko</k>, <k>kuvo</k> baptismal font, tank; <k>bapteyo</k> baptistery,
place for baptism.

<k>barar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bar to stop up (a way, a door,
etc.); <k>barostango</k>, <k>barotrabo</k> a bar (of wood or metal as for
doors, windows); <k>barilo</k> barrier (in general); <k>baril(o)
 bargardisto</k> gate-keeper; <k>strado barilo</k> street barrier; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
toll-gate; <k>barilo kontreepidemia</k> sanitary cordon; <k>turn
 barilo</k> turnstile, <ex>(surg.)</ex> tourniquet.

<k>barofluxo</k> bore, eger, eddy-tide. Def.: Granda mar-ondo
avane precipitanta, qua avancas ad-monte en ula estuarii; IV-452.

<k>barako</k> shed, hut; temporary wooden building to shelter
soldiers, fishermen, etc.; booth, covered stall (in a fair); <k>barako
 di jonglisto</k> juggler's booth.

<k>baraktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to struggle: strive to get away,
writhe, strive (kontre); (cf. <k>luktar</k>). Ex.: La kaptata
fisho baraktas en l'aquo. Baraktar per manui e pedi. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
La sovaji ne forte baraktas kontre la morto.

<k>baratrio</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> barratry. Def.: Fraudo da la
kapitano o navestro kontre armatori od asekuristi; II-75.

<k>barbo</k> beard: hair on the chin, lips and cheeks of men
and animals; <k>barboza</k> bearded; <k>barbisto</k> barber; <k>barbo
 barbpinselo</k> shaving brush; <k>vango barbo</k> whiskers; <k>menton
 barbo</k> chin -b.; <k>labio barbo</k> mustache; <k>blonda barbo</k>
blond b.; <k>barbo dudia</k> a two-day b.; <k>griz barb(ul)o</k>
grey b.; <k>kapro barbo</k> billy-goat b.; <k>portar barbo</k> to
wear a b.; <k>lanug barbo</k> down (on the face); <k>barbo nivatra</k>, <k>nivea</k> a snow-white b.; <k>sen barba</k> beardless.

<k>barbakano</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> barbican; loop-hole;
escape-hole (in retaining wall for water).

<k>barbara</k>, <k>barbar(ul)o</k> barbarian; <k>barbaratra</k> barbarous; in a
b. manner; <k>barbareso</k> <ex>(state)</ex> barbarism; <k>barbarismo</k> <ex>(linguistic)</ex>
barbarism; <k>barbarigar</k> to barbarize.

<k>barbotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to dabble, paddle, splash,
flounder about (in mud or water).

<k>barbuliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sputter, splutter, mumble;(cf.
<k>balbutar</k>). Def.: Parolar iro rapide e konseque neklare e
konfuze, nekompreneble; III-6.

<k>barelo</k> barrel, cask; <k>bareleto</k> small keg; <k>barelego</k>
hogshead, tun; <k>barelifar</k> to cooper; <k>en bareligar</k> to
barrel <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>vendar barelope</k> to sell by the b.; <k>cherpar
 de la barelo</k> to draw off from the b.; <k>fish barelo</k> fish-b.; <k>bareloboko</k>
bung (-hole); <k>barelorobineto</k> faucet, tap of a b.; <k>vin
 barelo</k> barrel for wine; <k>barelo de vino</k> b. of wine.

<k>barikado</k> barricade; <k>inkluzar su per barikado</k> to b.
oneself; <k>obstruktar per barikado</k>, <k>barikade klozar</k>, <k>barikadizar</k> to b.

<k>barko</k> bark: small boat as wherry, punt, skiff. Def.:
Mikra kanoto senmasta, movanta per remili, e ne generale uzata in
maral aqui; <ex>(mitol.)</ex> la paromo di C(h)aron en la rivero
Styx.

<k>baroka</k> odd, queer-looking, uncouth, baroque, bizarre;
ill-shped, distorted (of pearls); <k>barokeso</k> oddness; <k>barokajo</k>
an oddity. Def.: Qua havas aspekto nereguloza o stranja (ex.
perlo, stilo); IV-2.

<k>baron(ul)o</k> baron; <k>baronino</k> baroness; <k>baroneso</k> <ex>(rank,
dignity)</ex> barony; <k>baronaro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex> baronage; <k>baronio</k>
<ex>(domain)</ex> barony.
<k>barto</k> whalebone; <k>bartizar</k> to stiffen, fit with w.

<k>basa</k> (of dimensions, also pressure, sound) low (cf. <k>alta</k>);
<k>basaigar</k> to make low: shorten the height of (cf. <k>abasar</k>);
to lower (in tone, in pressure); <k>basae</k> below (cf. <k>infre</k>);
<k>basao</k>, <k>basaajo</k>, <k>basaparto</k> the lowers part; <ex>(mus.)</ex> bass; <k>basaeskar</k>
to decline, wane, begin to droop, drop; <k>spekular pri la
 basigo</k> <ex>(fin.)</ex> to bear stocks, speculate for a fall; <k>basaigisto</k>
<ex>(fin.)</ex> bear operator; <k>basavoco</k> bass (voice); <k>basareliefo</k>
bass-relief; <k>basavoco infra</k> counter-bass; <k>basaranga</k>, <k>basaorigina</k>, <k>basaklasa</k> lowly, humble; <k>basaGermana</k> low German
(dialect). V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>alta.</k>

<k>basamento</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> basement. V. exp.: Ne
konfunenda kun <k>fundamento: basamento</k> esas l'infra parto
(bazo) videbla di edifico, qua jacas sur la fundamento; III-670.

<k>baseno</k> <ex>(dock, river, water-works)</ex> basin; <ex>(geog.)</ex>
valley, hollow; <ex>(dish)</ex> deep, wide pan; <k>balno baseno</k>
wash-b.; <k>fish baseno</k> fish-pond; <k>pulver baseno</k> pan (of a
flint-lock).

<k>basko</k> flap, skirt, tail (of a garment); <k>baskorobo</k>
(garment) basquine.

<k>baskular</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to see-saw: sway up and down; <k>baskuligar</k>
to make s.s., to rock back and forward; <k>baskulilo</k> a see-saw;
swing (for play); rocker (of a chiar); sweep (of a well); <ex>(tech.)</ex>
rocking lever; <k>baskulcharioto</k>, <k>baskulveturo</k> dump-cart; tumbril-cart
(for the condemned); <k>baskulstulo</k> rocking chair; <k>levponto
 kun baskulilo</k> draw-bridge with plyer, bascule bridge. Def.:
Baskulilo en teknikal mekaniko esas levero, qua ne ocilas
spontane (pro sua propra pezo), ma falas de un pozeso ad altra,
sub influo di pezo o forco e ne rivenas a l'antea pozeso se altra
(kontrea) pezo o forco ne agas; III-72.

<k>basoto</k> dachshund, basset-hound. Def.: Hundo
karakterizata da gambi tre kurta e tordita; VI-604.

<k>bastarda</k>, <k>bastardo</k> bastard, illegitimate (of children);
mongrel (of animals); hybrid (of animals, plants, etc.).

<k>bastingo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> quarter-netting, waist-cloth; <k>bastingizar</k>
to rig the boarding-nettings.

<k>bastono</k> stick, staff, cane, cudgel; <k>bastoneto</k> baton; <k>bastonagar</k>, <k>bastonbatar</k> to cudgel, cane; <k>bastonago</k>, <k>bastonbato</k> beating,
bastinade; <k>bastonskermisto</k> cudgel-player; <k>biliard bastono</k>
billiard cue; <k>espad bastono</k> sword-cane; <k>komando bastono</k>
staff, baton of command; <k>pesko bastono</k> fishing pole; <k>tambur
 bastono</k> drum-stick; <k>bastonifar</k> to make sticks, canes.

<k>batar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to beat: strike repeatedly <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>bat(ad)o</k> beating, striking, drubbing; <k>batanto</k>, <k>batero</k>, <k>batemo</k> beater <ex>(person)</ex>; <k>batilo</k> beater <ex>(instr.)</ex>;
<k>batita</k> beaten; <ex>(dispute)</ex> <k>interbatar</k>, <k>batar
 reciproke</k> fight, quarrel, exchange of blows; <k>batar la pedo</k>
to beat (the soles of) the feet; <k>batar per vergo</k> to strike
with a ferule; <k>batar sur la glutei</k> to beat on the buttocks;
<k>batar per l'ali</k> to beat the wings; <k>pulso bato</k> beat of
the pulse. V, exp. <k>Frapar</k>, <k>batar: Frapar</k> esas la plu
general termino: ol aplikesas ad omna shoko, korpala o mentala:
»Me frapas me kontre la muro; on frapis la pordo; to frapis mea
okuli, mea atenco, mea spirito«. <k>Batar</k> esas donar ad ulu
od ulo <k>plura frapi</k> sucedante, generale per utensilo: ad
ulu, por dolorigar lu; ad ulo por netigar ol (batar sidili,
tapisi). <k>Bato</k> esas do esnce volata e duranta ago, sempre
korpala; III-349.

<k>batelo</k> launch, barge, lighter; boat(s) (in general); <k>bateleto</k>
small boat, skiff; <k>bateledo</k> boatful; <k>batelisto</k> boatman; <k>batelestro</k>
boat-captain; <k>batelponto</k> bridge of b.s; <k>drag batelo</k>
dredger; <k>exkurs batelo</k> excursion b.; <k>fish batelo</k>
fishing b.; <k>kanal batelo</k> canal-b.; <k>karbon batelo</k>
coal-b.; <k>batelo de karbono</k> boat filled with coal; <k>pilot
 batelo</k> pilot-b.; <k>rem batelo</k> row-boat; <k>seglo batelo</k>
sail-b. Def.: General nomo donita ad omnaspeca naveti, ma
precipue a naveti di pasable granda dimensioni, quale gabari,
e.c.

<k>bavar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to slobber, drool, slaver; <k>bavotuko</k>
bib. V. exp.: <k>Bavar</k> esas lasar fluar la <k>salivo</k> ek
la boko. Do <k>bavajo</k> esas nur salivo ekfluanta (on povas
anke bavar snago, e.c.).

<k>bayoneto</k> bayonet; <k>espado bayoneto</k> sword-b.; <k>prizentar
 la bayoneto</k> to bring the b. to a charge; <k>bayonetagar</k> to b. <k>(ulu)</k>,
to use the b.; <k>skermar per la bayoneto</k> to fence with the b.

<k>bazo</k> base: lowest part of anything, foundation, bottom,
foot; <ex>(fig.)</ex> basis, foundation, grounds; <ex>(chem.)</ex>
base; <k>bazala</k>, <k>bazatra</k> basal, basic; <k>bazajo</k> something
which is basic; basement; <k>bazlineo</k> <ex>(math.)</ex>
base-line; <k>arko bazo</k> springing (of an arch); <k>sen baza</k>
baseless; <k>bazokrusto</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> under crust; Ex.: La
bazo di monto, di piedestalo, di triangulo, di sistemo, di
yusteso, di metalo.

<k>bear</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to open the mouth, to gape <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to yawn; <k>spektadar beante</k> to look gapingly. Def.: Apertar
la boko, anke en figurala senco »beanta truo«; III-386.

<k>bedo</k> <ex>(agri., hort.)</ex> bed; <k>floro bedo</k>
flower-b.; <k>sterko bedo</k> hot bed, forcing-bed; <k>gazon bedo</k>
grass--plot.

<k>bedelo</k> beadle: apparitor; usher. Def.: La nomo di ta qua
preiras o sequas la procesioni (generale religiala); VII-43.

<k>begino</k> beguine: a kind of nun in the Netherlands; <k>beginkofio</k>
b. cap.

<k>beko</k> beak: bill of a bird; <ex>(tech.)</ex> beak, spout
(of a vessel); <k>bekedo</k> a beakful; <k>bekagar</k>, <k>bekpikar</k> to
peck (at); <k>bekagado</k> pecking; <k>bekagar reciproke</k> to
peck at each other; <k>bekforma</k> beak formed; <k>en bekigar</k>, <k>beknutrar</k> to feed (young birds, etc.).

<k>bela</k> beautiful, fine, handsome; <k>beleta</k>, <k>belata</k>
pretty, rather handsome; <k>bel(ul)o</k> a handsome person; <k>belete</k>
prettily; <k>belino</k> a belle; <k>belajo</k> a b. object; <k>beleso</k>
(quality) beauty; <k>belet beleso</k> prettiness; <k>belacho</k>
fop, cox-comb, insipid beauty; <k>beligar</k> to beautify,
embellish; <k>beleskar</k> to become, grow b.; <k>bela stroko</k> a
lucky, fine stroke, hit or happening; <k>lo bela</k> The
Beautiful. Ant.: <k>leda</k>

<k>bendo</k> bank: long, narrow piece of cloth, paper, metal,
etc., strip, stripe, streak; fillet (for head), (hat) band; <k>bendizar</k>
to bind up, place a band on; <k>sen bendigar</k> to take off the
band, unband; <k>agro bendo</k> a strip of field; <k>bordo bendo</k>
piping, welt (of cloth); <k>ledro bendo</k> strip, slip, band of
leather; <k>plat bendo</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> platband; <k>bendosegilo</k>
b. saw; (cf. <k>strio</k>). Def.: Surfaco limitizita per du linei
paralela; IV - 463. Ex. La standardo di Usa kontenas bendi
(alterne reda, blanka), ne strii.

<k>benedikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bless, pronounce a benediction
on.

<k>benediktano*</k> Benedictine (monk or nun); <k>kuvento di
 benediktani</k> B. convent.

<k>benefico</k> <ex>(eccl.)</ex> benefice, living; <k>reprezento
 benefico</k> <ex>(theat.)</ex> benefit performance (where the proceeds
are given to some particular person or purpose); <k>beneficiero</k>
beneficiary: holder of a benfice; recipient of the profits from a
benefit performance.

<k>benigna</k> benign: kind, morally good; mild (of medicines,
diseases).

<k>benko</k> bench, long seat, settle, form; <ex>(in boats)</ex>
thwart; <k>benkoveturo</k> wagonette: wagon with long sets. Def.:
Sidilo longa (ligna ex.) kun o sen dors-apogilo; II-647.

<k>benzoo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> benzoin; resin from the tree Styrax
benzoin.

<k>bero</k> berry; <k>beratra</k> bacciform, berry-like; <k>berportanta</k>, <k>berifanta</k> bacciferous, berry producing; <k>vit bero</k>
grape; <k>sika vit bero</k> raisin; <k>frangul bero</k>
alder-berry; <k>muskat bero</k> muscatel grapes.

<k>Berberia</k>, <k>Berberiala</k> of, relating to Barbary; <k>Berbero</k>
a Berber.

<k>beredo*</k> beret: round, flat cap such as worn by Basque
peasants.

<k>bergamoto</k>, <k>bergamotoranjo</k> bergamot pear, -orange; <k>bergamotiero</k>
b. tree; (Citrus Bargamia, Bergamota); <k>bergamotesenco</k> essence of
b.

<k>berloko</k> trinket, charm (such as attached to watch
chains).

<k>bermo</k> <ex>(fort. and gen.)</ex> berme: narrow shelf. Def.:
Parto horizontal en taluso.

<k>bersar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rock (a child); <k>bers(ant)e
 dormigar</k> to lull to sleep; <k>bersilo</k> cradle; <k>bersokanto</k>
lullaby, cradle-song.

<k>bestio</k> beast, any animal except man, (cf. <k>animalo</k>, <k>bruto</k>) <k>bestiala</k>, <k>bestiatra</k> bestial; <k>bestialeso</k>
bestiality (cf. <k>brutaleso</k>); <k>bestiaro</k> fauna, beasts <ex>(collect.)</ex>;
<k>bestiala debocho</k> bestial debauchery; <k>kargo bestio</k> b. of
burden; <k>tir bestio</k> draught animal; <k>bestioedukado</k>
rearing of animals; <k>bestiokaptisto</k> trapper; <k>bestiokulto</k>
zoolatry, animal worship; <k>bestiotrupo</k> herd, drove, flock.

<k>bestiario*</k> <ex>(rom. antiq.)</ex> bestiarius: person
doomed to fight with wild beasts.

 brasisto</k> company promoter, etc. Ex.: Brasar oro ed arjento en
la kruzelo.

<k>brava</k> brave, valiant, valorous, bold; <k>brav(ul)o</k> a
b. person; <k>braveso</k> (quality) bravery; <k>bravajo</k> a b. act;
<k>bravacho</k> swaggerer, blusterer; <k>brave</k> bravely; <ex>(interj.)</ex>
bravo!

<k>brazar</k> to braze: join with spelter (hard solder). V.
exp.: vid. <k>weldar</k>.

<k>brecho</k> breach, break, gap, opening (in a wall, etc.) <k>dentobrechoza</k>
gap-toothed; <k>brechizar</k> to make a breach, gap in <k>(ulo)</k>.

<k>bretelo</k> strap (to carry a knapsack, pack, etc.) strap,
sling (for a musket, rifle); brace, suspender (to hold up
trousers); <k>breteli</k>, <k>paro</k> a pair of suspenders, braces.

<k>brezo</k> embers, live coals; <k>brezkoquar</k> to broil,
braise (in e.); <k>brezuyo</k>, <k>brezkoquilo</k> broiler, braiser; <k>brezbaseno</k>
brazier, warming-pan. Def.: Ligno konvertita en karbono per
komusto, sive ardoranta, sive extingita; II-708.

<k>brido</k> bridle (of a horse) <ex>(fig.)</ex> check, curb; <k>brideto</k>
snaffle-b.; <k>bridizar</k> to a b. on; <k>bridagar</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to check.

<k>briko</k> brick; <k>briketo</k>, <k>karbon briko</k> briquette, patent
fuel; <k>brikea</k> b. colored; <k>brikizar</k> to b. up; <k>brikifar</k>
to make b.s; <k>brikiferio</k> b.-kiln, -yard; <k>briko polisanta</k>
bathbrick; <k>brikomasonisto</k> brickmason; <k>brikimituro</k> b.
imitation; <k>brikkonstruktado</k>, <k>brikmasonado</k> brick-laying.

<k>brilar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to shine: emit or reflect light; be
luminous, bright, brilliant, radiant; to glitter, glisten (cf. <k>cintilifar</k>);
<k>brilaro</k>, <k>brilareso</k> sheen, shining, brilliancy; <k>brilaregar</k> to be
resplendent, to glare; <k>brilaranta stilo</k> brilliant style; Ex.:
La suno, steli, oro, okuli brilas.

<k>brino</k> short end or bit (of a cord, rope); Def.: Parto
(seciono o segmento) di kordo; V-157.
<k>briocho</k> brioche; a buttered cake or roll.

<k>brizanto</k> sunken-reef, -rock. V. exp.: <k>Rifo</k>
salias super l'aquo, ma <k>brizanto</k> esas rokajo
reze l'aquo, sur qua la ondi ruptesas; V

<k>brodar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to embroider: ornament
with figures, needle-work.

<k>brokantar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to deal in
second-hand goods; <k>brokantisto</k>, <k>brokantero</k> broker:
second-hand dealer.

<k>brokolikaulo*</k> broccoli: a hardy variety of
cauliflower (Brassica oleracea botrytis).

<k>bronzo</k> bronze; <k>bronzea</k> b.
colored; <k>bronzizar</k> to bronze; <k>bronzo gisita</k>
cast in b.

<k>brosar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to brush (the hair,
etc.); <k>brosilo</k> a b.

<k>broshar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stitch, sew (books);
<k>broshuro</k> brochure: pamphlet stitched, with paper
covers; (cf. <k>pamfleto</k>); <k>broshita;</k>
stitched, in paper covers.

<k>brovo</k> eye-brow, brow; <k>brovala</k>
superciliary; <k>brovoza</k> thick-browed; <k>brovagar</k>, <k>brovmovar</k>, <k>brovkontraktar</k> to knit one's b.s to frown, flinch.

<k>bruo</k> husk, shell (of nuts). Def.: Verda shelo
(generale, di nuco); III

<k>brueto</k> wheelbarrow; <k>bruetagar</k>, <k>bruetportar</k>
to wheel in a b.

<k>bruisar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make a noise:
rustle, rattle, rumble, clatter, hum; <k>bruis(ad)o</k>
noise of any kind, but chiefly when loud or disagreeable; rattle,
rumbling, roaring, whistling (of wind); report (of a gun); bang,
slam (of a door), etc; <k>bruisego</k> a loud noise;
crash, din, tumult, uproar; <k>bruisetar</k> to rustle,
murmur; <k>bruisigar</k> to cause <k>(ulo)</k>
to make a noise, to rattle.

<k>brular</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to burn: consume
with fire (wood, coal, oil); to wound or injure with fire; to
scorch, parch, dry up; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to be inflamed (with
passion), to be ardent; <k>brul(ad)o</k> burning (act); <k>bruleso</k>
burning (taste, smell); blight; <k>brulbruloleo</k> lamp
oil, coal oil, kerosene; <k>brulspegulo</k> burning
glass; <k>brulajo</k> a burnt object; <k>brulita</k>
burnt; <k>bruluro</k>, <k>brulvunduro</k> a burn; <k>brulebla</k>
combustible, inflammable; <k>brulodoro</k> smell of
burning; Ex.: La Romani brulis Carthage. La suno brulas la
planti. V. exp.:<k>Brular</k> esas la vulgara, <k>kombustar</k>
esas la ciencala vorto. On uzas <k>brular</k> ne nur
por kombusti videbla, kun flamo, ma anke por la vundi facita da
bolianta aquo. Altraparte, on uzas kombustar por omna oxidigo,
mem nerapida e nevidebla: ex: la respirado esas kombusto; explozo
esas anke kombusto. Nur la vulgara vorta uzesas metafore; on
dicas »Me kordio brulas de amo.« On povas dicar, ke ulo
kombustar sen brular, se ol nek flamifas nek ardoras (t.e.
divenas fairoreda); IV

<k>bruna</k> brown; dusky, swarthy (complexioned),
dark (haired); <k>brunino</k> a dark (dark-haired,
dark-complexioned) woman; <k>brunetino</k> brunette; <k>brunatra</k>
brownish; <k>brunigar</k> to make b., darken; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to sunburn; <k>brunreda</k> red-brown, baycolored; <k>brunora</k>, <k>brunea</k> golden b.; <k>bruneskar</k> to turn b.

<k>brunisar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to burnish
(brass, gold, etc.). Def.: Procedo por polisar metali;
III

<k>bruska</k> brusque: gruff, abrupt, blunt (in
address or manners); <k>bruska departo</k> abrupt
departure; <k>bruska repliko</k> a gruff reply; <k>bruskeso</k>
abruptness, rudeness; <k>bruskajo</k> offensive language, act or
manner.

<k>bruto</k> brute <ex>(animal; fig. of man)</ex>; <k>brutala</k>
brutal; <k>brutaleso</k> brutality (cf. <k>bestialeso</k>); <k>brutalajo</k>
an act of brutality; <k>brutigar</k> to brutalize; <k>bruteskar</k>
to become brutalized; <k>brutatra</k>, <k>brutema</k> brutish; <k>brutiganta</k>
brutalizing; <k>brutale traktar</k> to treat <k>(ulu)</k> brutally.

<k>bub(ul)o</k> a street Arab, gamin; <k>bubino</k> gypsy-like
girl; hoyden; <k>bubacho</k> young scamp, blackguard. Def.:
Mizeroza o malicoza puero vaganta en la stradi; IV-101.

<k>budar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be sulky, sullen, look sour (cf.
<k>facar muzelo</k>); <k>bud(ad)o</k> sulking; <k>budera</k>, <k>budero</k>, <k>budema</k>, <k>budemo</k> sulky (person). Def.: Manifestar nekontenteso,
mala humoro per silenco, agado, expreso di la fizionomio. Ex.: La
puero budas, nam ilua patrino ne permisas ke il ludas.

<k>bufar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to swell, puff out; to distend (as
cheeks by blowing); to stand out (as stout silks, starched
muslin, etc.); <k>bufigar</k> to cause to puff, swell out; <k>stofo
 bufanta</k> stuff that stands out well (does not cling to the
figure).

<k>bufeto</k> buffet: refreshment foom (at balls, R.R.
stations, etc.).

<k>bufono</k> buffoon, jester, clown, merry-andrew; <k>bufonala</k>, <k>bufonatra</k> buffoonlike, facetious; <k>bufonaji</k> buffoonery; <k>bufonesar</k>
to be a b.; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to be jocose; <k>bufonopera</k> opera
bouffe; <k>bufonkantisto</k> comic singer; <k>facar bufonaji</k> to
play the b.; make jests.

<k>bugrano</k> buckram. Def.: Tolo forta e rigida (gumizita);
III-73.

<k>buklo</k> buckle (of girdle, shoe, etc.); <k>buklopinto</k>
tongue of b.; <k>buklagar</k> to b.

<k>bulo</k> ball (as for play in billiards, basseball, etc.); <k>buleto</k>
small ball, marble pellet (<k>not</k> E. bullet, vid. <k>kuglo</k>);
<k>buloludo</k> ball play; <k>aerobul(et)o</k> air-bubble; <k>niv
 bulo</k> snowball. B. exp.: vid. <k>balono</k>.

<k>buletino</k> bulletin. Def.: Mikra jurnalo, revuo, o
periodala raporto; III-199.

<k>bulino</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> bowline. Def.: Kordo qua tensas la
seglo per l'infra angulo; VI-530.

<k>bunta</k> many-colored; motley, streaked, checkered,
piebald, dappled; <k>buntigar</k>, <k>buntizar</k> to varigate (with colors),
to streak (with many colors).

<k>buro</k> short-hair or other materials used in stuffing
saddle-pads, making mortar, etc.; wad, wadding (for guns); <k>burizar</k>
to wad, tamp, pad, stuff; <k>burizilo</k> tamping-bar; ramrod.
Def.: Amaso de pili, sive di animali, sive di ula lana o silka
stolo; to quon on pozas sur la kargajo di la pafili; III-8.

<k>burasko</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> squall; <ex>(fig.)</ex> outburst of
passion. Def.: To ne esas ventego, nek tempesto, ma subita e
neduranta ventobato; III-8.
<k>burelo</k> frieze, baize: a coarse woollen fabric.

<k>burjono</k> burgeon, bud; <k>burjonoza</k> budded, full of buds;
<k>burjonifar</k> to bud.

<k>burso</k> purse, wallet, pocket-book; <k>bursofurtisto</k>, <k>bursero</k>
cut-purse, pick-picket. Def.: Saketo por portar moneti en la
posho; IV-690.

<k>busto</k> bust: head and shoulders of body, or as
represented in sculpture and painting.
<k>bustrofedono</k> boustrophedon; an ancient mode of writing.

<k>butar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to stumble, butt, knock, run,
strike <k>(sur</k>, <k>kontre ulo)</k>; <k>butilo</k>, <k>butbufro</k> buffer:
anything so placed as to act as a stop; <k>butstono</k>, <k>butigilo</k>
stumbling-block; <k>butjuntar</k>, <k>butpozar</k> to butt-joint; adjust
two boards side by side or end for end so as not to overlap (opp.
to clinker-build); (cf. <k>klinar</k> and IV-354); <k>kapo</k>, <k>pedo butar</k> to strike with the head or foot (cf. <k>mispazar</k>).
Ex.: Ca kavalo butas ye singla pazo.

<k>butiko</k> (Eng.) shop; (U.S.) store; <k>butikisto</k>
tradesman, shopkeeper; <k>butikservisto</k> shop-boy, -assistant; <k>butikkomizo</k>
(shop-) clerk.

<k>butonoo</k> button (of a garment); <k>butonoagar</k> to b.; <k>butonoizar</k>
to fasten b. on; <k>butonoifar</k> to make b.s; <k>butonotruo</k> b.hole;
<k>butonotirilo</k> b. hook; <k>kolumo butonoo</k> collar-stud; <k>paramento
 butonoo</k> cuff-link.

<k>butro</k> butter; <k>butrifar</k> to b. <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>butrifeyo</k>
b. dairy; <k>butruyo</k> b. dish, b. holder; <k>butrifilo</k> churn;
<k>butrolakto</k> b. milk; <k>butrizita pano</k> (a slice of bread
and b.).

<k>ja</k> (<ex>adv</ex>.) already; before or by this time or
the time mentioned, even now; <k>ja ne</k> not yet; (<ex>fig</ex>.)
not even; <k>lu ja arivis</k> he has already arrived; <k>il ne
 ja arivis</k> he has not yet arrived; <k>lu ja dormeskis</k> he
has already fallen asleep; <k>kad vu ja asistis kunsido? No</k>, <k>me
 ne ja asistis</k> have you as yet attended a meeting? No, I have
not yet been present; <k>Ka vu ja lektis ta libro? No</k>, <k>me ne ja
 lektis ol</k>, <k>me ne ja trovis la necesa tempo</k> Have you read
that book yet (already)? No, I have not read it yet, I have not
found the necessary time. <k>Il ja ne esas kontenta</k> he is
not yet content; <k>Kad il ja finabis la laboro kande lua patrulo
 vizitas il</k>? Had he already finished the work when his father
visited him? V. exp.: vid. <k>ankore</k>.

<k>jaboto</k> jabot<k /> ruffle on shirt bosom; lace frill
worn on woman’s bodice.

<k>jacar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to lie (position of persons or
things living or dead); <k>jacanta</k> lying (ill, dead),
stretched out; <k>jaceyo</k> layer, bed; <k>hike jacas</k> here
lies (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>).
<k>jaro</k> jar<k /> large earthen jug for water, etc.

<k>jardiniero</k> jardinière; flower stand or receptacle for
plants; a dish of mixed vegetables. – V. exp.: Ne vazo, ma
mobl(et)o por suportar flori o buketo; VI-528.

<k>jargonar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to talk jargon, gibberish, to
jabber, to use unintelligible language; (cf. <k>slango</k>, <k>galimatiaso</k>). Def.: Linguo o dialekto nekorekta, ma ne
esencale od intence diferanta de la ordinara linguo; VII-158.
Ex.: La stranjeri ne parolas la Franca, li nur jargonas. La
jargono di la infanti, di la rurano.

<k>javelino</k> (<ex>weapon</ex>.) javelin. Def.: Speco di
dardolonga e dina.

<k>jelozio</k> Jalousie<k /> Venetian blind, curtain blind.
Def.: Klozilo kompozita ed multa lati (lameni) superpozita, quin
on povas generale inlinar per rotaco cirkum lua longesal axo, e
quin on povas levar o deslevar quale kurteno, per kordo o
kordono. Kande ol esas tote levita, la lati esas aplikita uni sur
altri; III-290.

<k>jemar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to groan, moan, to give forth a
dull, low sound of grief or pain; <k>jemar pro doloro</k> to groan
with pain; <k>jemar pri sua mortinta kompano</k> to bemoan his
dead companion,

<k>jemela</k>, <k>jemelo</k> twin; <k>jemeli</k> (<ex>astron</ex>.) Gemini; <k>jemela
 frati</k> t. brothers; <k>jemela liti</k> t. beds; <k>tri jemeli</k>
triplets.

<k>jenar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to hinder the movments of the body,
(of clothing, etc.) to pinch, be too tight; (<ex>fig</ex>.) to hold
in constraint, prevent, hinder from doing something; <k>jeno</k>
inconvenience, annoyance, trouble; <k>ca shui jenas me</k> these
shoes pinch me; <k>alta dogantaxi jenas l’industrio</k>
high custom dues hinder industry; <k>lua prezenteso jenas me</k>
his presence disturbs me (he is in the way).

<k>jendarmo</k> gendarme<k /> one of a body of military
police, esp. in France.

<k>jenio</k> (<ex>milit</ex>.) corps of engineers; <k>jeniano</k>
e. soldier, a sapper and miner; (cf. <k>injenioro</k>).

<k>jenro</k> (<ex>art</ex>.) genre; <k>jenropikt(ad)o</k>, <k>jenruro</k>
«genre» painting<k /> representing scenes in common life, in
opposition to history and landscape.

<k>jentila</k> (of character) nice, well-bred, courteous, civi;
<k>jentil(ul)o</k> gentleman (in character)<k /> a man of fine
feeling. V. exp.: <k>Jentila</k> relatas la karaktero e la mori
di persono agreabla e plezanta. <k>Polita</k> relatas nur
l’extera formi di la sociala relati, la paroli, gesti,
agad-manieri (maxim ofte konvencionala o simbolatra); II-646.

<k>jerar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to manage, administer, conduct (a
hotel, business (for an owner)); <k>jeranteso</k> managership.
Def.: Administrar por la profito di la proprietero, esante
salariata oficisto. V. exp.: On bezonas ofte distingar tre klare
l’administranto (<ex>who owns</ex>) de la jer-anto, -isto (<ex>manager</ex>),
exp.: jeranto di domeno, kastelo, hotelo, teatro, lugata domi,
e.c.

<k>jermo</k> (<ex>pr. and fig</ex>.) germ; <k>jermifar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.)
to germinate, spring up, sprout; <k>jermifigar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to
cause to germinate, sprout; <k>jermifeyo</k> (brewing) malt-house;
<k>jermifanta plasmo</k> g. plasm; <k>la jermi di vertui</k>, <k>di idei</k>
the g. of virtues, of ideas.

<k>jetar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to throw; <k>for jetar</k> to throw
at a distance, throw away; (cf. <k>lansar</k>, <k>spricar</k>); <k>jetar
 ombro</k> to t. a shadow.

<k>jibeto</k> gibbet. V. exp.: La objekto havas la formo di la
litero Greka G (ne ta di la litero ?); kp. <k>patibulo</k>;
IV-511.

<k>jineto</k> (<ex>zool</ex>.) genet(te)<k /> species of
civets (Viverra Genetta); a Turkish ringcurb, -bit.

<k>jirar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to turn about, gyrate; (<ex>nav</ex>.)
veer around, tack about, put about; <k>jirachar</k> to prowl
around. V. exp.: <k>Turnar</k>, <k>rotacar</k>, <k>jirar</k> La verbo <k>turnar</k>
esas la maxim generala e suficas por l’ordinara uzado. La du
altri esas teknikala. Korpo <k>rotacas</k> kande ol turnas cirkum
axo qua trairas lu (ex. <k>roto</k> cirkum sua axo<k /> to
esas l’etimologiala origino di la verbo<k /> L. <ex>rota,
rotare</ex>). Korpo <k>jiras</k>, kande ol turnas cirkum axo o
punto situita exter lu, plu o min fore (ex. <k>veturo</k>, <k>navo</k>
jiras deskriptante arko di cirklo o di altra kurvo; II-644.

<k>jiravolto</k> (<ex>horsemanship</ex>) volt right and left,
quick turning.

<k>jokar</k> (<ex>tr.. intr</ex>.) to joke, banter (<k>ulu</k>);
to joke, jest (<k>kun ulu</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>); <k>jokema</k>, <k>jokoza</k>
jocular, waggish, facetious; <k>jokante</k>, <k>per jokar</k> by way of a
joke, in jest; <k>jokajo</k> a joke jest (objective); <k>jokmentio</k>
hoax; <k>laciva joko</k> broad jest, coarse joke.

<k>jonglar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to juggle (<k>per</k>)<k /> to
play tricks by sleight of hand.

<k>jorno</k> (<ex>opp. to night</ex>) day, daylight, daytime;
(cf. <k>dio</k>); <k>jornar</k> to be daylight, daytime; <k>jorneskar</k>
it begine to be light, day is coming; <k>jornala</k> diurnal,
daytime; daily; <k>jornomezo</k> midday, noon; <k>en plena jorno</k>
in broad day (light); <k>jorno jornlaboro</k> a day’s work,
day-labor; <k>jorno di ok hori</k> an eight-hour day; <k>jornala
 laboristo</k> a day worker; <k>jornope laborar</k> to work by the
day; <k>jornopago</k> a day’s pay. Ant.: <k>nokto</k>.

<k>joyar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to be joyous, be delighted, be
glad; <k>joyigar</k> to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to rejoice, to fill
with joy; (cf. <k>gayigar</k>); <k>joyegar</k> to jubilate,
exult; <k>joyoza</k> joyful, joyous; <k>joyema</k> jovial, jolly; <k>joyotrublanto</k>, <k>joyero</k> (<ex>fig</ex>.) spoil-sport, damper, wet-blanket.

<k>juar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to enjoy<k /> to have a
satisfaction in, feel with pleasure, revel in; <k>juar bona
 reputo</k> to enoy (have) a good reputation; <k>ca homo juas la
 tempo prezenta sen pensar pri la futuro</k> this man enjoys the
present without troubling himself about the future; <k>juar
 l’embaraseso di ulu</k> to enjoy the embarrassment of
someone.

<k>jubeo</k> jube<k /> a gallery in a church containing the
rood.

<k>jubilear</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to celebrate the jubilee of; <k>jubileo</k>
(R. C. Church and Jewish) jubilee; 50th anniversary, golden
wedding; <k>jubileata</k>, <k>jubileato</k> (person) of 50 years standing.

<k>Judo</k>, <k>Judulo</k>, <k>Judino</k> a Jew; <k>Juda</k>, <k>Judala</k> Jewish; <k>Judismo</k>
Judaism; <k>la migranta judo</k> the wandering Jew; <k>Judeyo</k>, <k>Judaro</k> Ghetto, jewry; (cf. <k>Izraelido</k>, <k>Hebreo</k>) <k>Judo</k>.

<k>judiciar</k> (<ex>tr., jur</ex>.) to judge judicially (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); (cf. <k>judiko</k>); <k>judicio</k> trial, judgment; <k>judicieyo</k>
court of justice; <k>judicianto</k>, <k>judiciero</k>, <k>judiciisto</k> judge, justice,
magistrate; <k>judiciala</k> judicial<k /> relative to the court; <k>judiciistala</k>
judiciary<k /> relative to the judges;<k>judiciisto</k>, <k>judiciaro</k>
judiciary; <k>judiciisteso</k> judicature, magistracy; <k>judiciebla</k>
justiciable; <k>judiciopovo</k> judicial power; <k>judiciisto
 inquestanta</k> examining magistrate; <k>havar judiciala resortiso o
 domeno</k> to have jurisdiction; <k>judiciantaro</k> (<ex>fig</ex>.)
bench of judges; jury; <k>judicianto</k>, <k>judiciano</k> juryman; (cf. <k>juriano</k>, <k>jurinto</k>); <k>enuncar la judicio</k> to pass sentence. Def.: Facar
legala, yurala «judiki»; IV-167.

<k>judikar</k> (<ex>tr., intr</ex>.) to judge<k /> to conclude
or determine by the exercise of judgment (not legal; cf. <k>judiciar</k>);
to exteem, deem, think; <k>judiko</k> judgment; logical opinion; <k>judikopovo</k>
faculty or power of judgment; <k>me judikas il kom honesta</k> I
judge hime to be honest; <k>judikar segun la semblo</k> to judge by
appearances.

<k>julepo</k> (<ex>pharm</ex>.) julep<k /> a sweet demulcent
mixture, used as a vehicle.

<k>jungar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to put to, «inspan» (as horses to
a carriage), to yoke up (oxen); <k>jungo</k> yoking, putting in;
(cf. <k>yugo</k>); <k>jungitaro</k>, <k>jungajo</k> (animal, object yoked)
team, yoke, pair of horses, oxen.

<k>junko</k> (<ex>bot</ex>.) rush, cane, (genus<k /> Juncus); <k>junkizar</k>
to cover with rushes; to cane (chairs, etc.).

<k>juntar</k> (<ex>tr., material sense</ex>) to join<k />
place one thing in contiguity to another; (of hands) to clasp;
(cf. <k>unionar</k>) <k>junturo</k>, <k>junteyo</k> joint, junction; <k>juntita
 pedi</k> with feet together; <k>juntita manui</k> clasped hands; <k>juntostreketo</k>
(<ex>print</ex>.) hyphen; <k>juntar du planki per gluo</k> to glue
two planks together; <k>juntar alo ad la domo</k> to add a wing to
the house; <k>juntar du gardeni</k> to join two gardens. <k /><ex /><k />

<k>jurar</k> (<ex>tr., intr</ex>.) to swear<k /> make solemn
declaration, to give one’s oath; <k>jurigar</k> to swear in (<k>ulu</k>),
administer the oath to (<k>ulu</k>); <k>jurinta</k> sworn; <k>jurinto</k>
person sworn (cf. <k>juriano</k>). Ex.: Jurar dicar la verajo.
Jurar fideleso ad ulu. Jurar amikeso ad ulu.

<k>juriskonsulto</k> jurisconsult<k /> a man learned in law,
esp. Civil law; a jurist; counsellor at law.

<k>jurisprudenco</k> judicature<k /> ordinary method which
tribunals use in judging points of law; <k>jurisprudenci</k> precedents. V.
exp.: Ne en la senco; yuro- (lego-) cienco, ma en la senco;
interpretado di la legi per la verdikti di la judiciisti, o
generale<k /> maiero aplikar la legi a la partikulara kazi;
IV-200.

<k>jurnalo</k> journal, newspaper, gazette; <k>jurnalisto</k>
journalist, newspaperman; <k>jurnalisteso</k> (profession)
journalism; -ista<k /> journalistic; <k>jurnalaro</k> the press.

<k>jus</k> (<ex>adv</ex>.) just<k /> just now, this last
minute, the moment just passed; <k>jusa</k> of a moment ago. Ex.:
Vu venas tro tarde, lu jus mortis. Me jus arivis.

<k>justa</k> conforming to some proper standard (N.B. <ex>not</ex>
legal sense; cf. <k>yusta</k>); right, correct, well grounded,
exact, proper (of measure, time, balance, word, thought, etc.); <k>justeso</k>
rightness, exactness, appositeness, propriety; <k>esar justa</k>
to be right (in opinion, or deed, or fact); <k>justatempe</k>
at the right time, in the nick of time, precise; <k>ta horlojo
 esas justa</k> that clock is right; <k>donar justa mezuro</k> to
give the right measure; <k>to esas tre justa dicajo</k> that is
a very proper saying; <k>havar ideo justa pri ulo</k> to have a
just idea of the thing; <k>havar justa suspekti pri ulu</k> to
have justifiable suspicions.

<k>justifikar</k> to justify<k /> prove or show to be right;
to vindicate, warrant; <k>justifikeble</k> justifiable, warrantable.
Def.: Montrar ke ulu od ulo esas justa. (kp. <k>yustigar</k>);
II-673.

<k>rabatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make a
reduction in (value or price); (cf. <k>diskontar</k>); <k>rabato</k>
reduction, diminution, rebate, abatement (in price); <k>rabate
 vendar</k> to sell at a reduced price; <k>rabate komprar</k> to buy
at a discount; <k>esas granda rabato en la preco di ca vari</k>
there is a great reduction in the price of these goods. Def.:
Rabato: diminuto di preco grantita da la vendisto a la kompranto.
<k />

<k>rabio</k> rabies, canine madness (cf. <k>hidrofobio</k>); <k>rabiala</k>
relating to rabies; <k>rabiika</k>, <k>rabiiko</k> rabid (person or animal).
<k />

<k>rabino</k> (Jewish) rabbi, rabbin; <k>rabinala</k> rabbinical; <k>rabinismo</k>
rabbinism;<k>rabinisto</k> rabbinist, one who adheres to the
tradition of the rabbins. <k />

<k>raboto</k> <ex>(carp.)</ex> plane; <k>rabotagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
plane; <k>rabotospano</k> shaving; <k>rabotmashino</k> a planer; <k>listel
 raboto</k> rabbet plane. <k />

<k>raciono</k> <ex>(faculty)</ex> reason, power of understanding,
intellect; (cf. <k>motivo</k>, <k>expliko</k>, <k>kauzo</k>, <k>rezonar</k>); <k>racionala</k>
rational (act, thing); <k>racionoza</k> rational (person); <k>racionaleso</k>
rationality; <k>racionalismo</k> rationalism; <k>racionalisto</k>
rationalist; <k>evo di raciono</k> age of reason; <k>des</k>, <k>ne</k>, <k>sen</k>, <k>kontreraciona</k> unreasonable, irrational. Def.: La fakultato
per qua on konocas e judikas. <k />

<k>rado</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> roads, roadstead; <k>enirar (la) rado</k>
to go into the road. <k />

<k>radiar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to radiate, irradiate: to emit
rays or beams; <k>radio</k> ray, beam, gleam; <ex>(geom.)</ex>
radius; (of a wheel) spoke; <ex>(ich.)</ex> ray, skate; <k>radiado</k>
radiation, radiance; <k>radianta</k>, <k>radioza</k> beaming, radiant,
radiated; <k>radiozo</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> radiary <ex>(pl.)</ex>
radiata; <k>radiala</k> radial; <k>radiizar</k> to cover (<k>ulo</k>)
with rays; <k>sun radii</k> sun rays; <k>kalor radio</k> ray of
heat; <ex>(fig.)</ex> <k>lua vizajo radias (pro) joyo</k> his
countenance beams with joy. Ex.: Lumo radias. Radiar kaloro. La
radii di Roentgen; La suno radiizas la agri, t.e. kovras li per
sua radii (o radiado). <k />

<k>radiatoro*</k> radiator (of heat); cooling apparatus. Def.:
Aparato destinita cedar kaloro a l’aero cirkondanta (quale
l’aparati, qui <k>varmigas</k> nia domi, e l’aparati,
qui <k>koldigas</k> l’aquo en la motori di automobilo);
V-626-7.<k />

<k>radiko</k><ex>(of plants, etc., also gram., math.)</ex> root; <ex>(gram.)</ex>
root, stem, radix, radical, primitive word or syllable; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
beginning, origin; <k>radikala</k> radical: relating to the root; <k>radikifar</k>
to produce roots, take root (<k>en</k>); <k>radikizar</k> to plant:
fix (<k>ulo</k>) in earth by roots; <k>radikosproso</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex>
sucker, runner; <k>radiketo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> radicle; <k>radikalo</k> <ex>(math.
chem.)</ex> radical; <k>radikal(ul)o</k> <ex>(politics)</ex> radical:
an advocate of radicalism; <k>radikalismo</k> <ex>(polit.)</ex>
radicalism; <k>kina radiko di mil</k> fifth root of a thousand (5&radic1000).
<k />

<k>radiografar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to photograph (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) by
means of x-rays; <k>radiografuro</k> <ex>(photo.)</ex> radiograph. <k />

<k>radioskopar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to view an opaque object by means
of Röntgen rays; <k>radioskop(ad)o</k>radioscopy; <k>radioskopilo</k>
radioscope; (cf. <k>radiografar</k>). <k />

<k>radiotelefonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to phone (<k>ulo</k>) by
wireless; <k>radioo</k>, <k>radiouro</k> wireless telephoning, radiophone; <k>radioilo</k>
a wireless telephone. <k />

<k>radiotelegrafar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to telegraph (<k>ulo</k>) by
radio; <k>radio(ad)o</k>, <k>radiouro</k> radio-telegraphing, radiogram; <k>radioilo</k>
radio-telegraphic apparatus.<k />

<k>radotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in his (or her) dotage, to
talk drivel; nonsense; <k>radoteso</k> (state) dotage; <k>radotanto</k>, <k>radotero</k>, <k>radotemo</k> dotard, driveler. <k />

<k>rafano</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> radish (Raphanus radicula); <k>rafaneto</k>
radish (Raphanus sativus); <k>rafaneyo</k> radish bed. <k />

<k>rafinar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to refine (metal,
sugar, the taste, etc.); (cf. <k>purigar; delikatigar</k>); <k>rafin(ad)o</k>, <k>rafinuro; rafineso</k>, <k>rafinemeso</k> refining; (result) refinement, nicety;
affectation of nicety (cf. <k>subtiligo</k>); <k>rafinito</k>
refined person: one who has a delicate taste, in art, literature;
<k>rafinita sukro</k> refined sugar; <k>rafinanta</k>, <k>rafiniva</k> refining; <k>rafinisto</k>
refiner;<k>rafineyo</k>, <k>rafinerio</k> refinery of sugar, oils, etc. <k />

<k>rafto</k> raft, plank or log float; <k>raftoponto</k> a
bridge-raft; <k>arbor rafto</k> a raft of trees. <k />

<k>rago</k> tatter: cloth torn and hanging (cf. <k>shifono</k>); <k>ragizar</k>
to clothe (<k>ulu</k>) in rags, tatters; <k>ragoza</k>, <k>ragizita</k>
ragged, tattered; <k>ragozeso</k> raggedness. <k />

<k>raguto</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> ragout: a highly seasoned dish; a
stew; hash. <k />

<k>rajuntar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to overtake, catch up to. Def.:
Atinger ulu, ulo, sequinte lu kun plu granda rapideso; III-470.
Ex.: Il jus departis, ma me esperas balde rajuntar il. <k />

<k>rakar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to draw, rack off (wine, etc.) <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to extract, worm out (secrets, money, etc.) V. exp.: To ne esas <k>transvarsar</k>
(varsar ek un vazo en altra per la suprajo), ma pasigar (liquido)
de un vazo en altra, cherpante sube (per robineto o sifono);
III-77. <k />

<k>rakontar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recount, tell (a made up story,
fiction, something which never happened, is not true); <k>rakonto</k>
story, tale, fib, fiction, gossip; <k>rakonto imaginala</k>, <k>fantaziala</k>
fantastic yarn, improbable story; old wife’s tale; <k>rakontanto</k>, <k>rakontero</k> story-teller; <k>rakontachar</k> to tittle-tattle. V. exp.:
vid. <k>naracar.</k><k />

<k>raliar*</k> <ex>(tr., intr., milit. and fig.)</ex> to rally
(troops). Def.: Kunvenigar hazarde soldati dispersita, ne segun
individuala ordino; metafore signifikas adhero (plu or min
bonvoloza) a partiso, a persono, e.c.; V-742. <k />

<k>ramo</k> small bough, twig, small branch (of a tree); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
a subdivision or branch artery, vein; branch of family, etc.; <k>ram(et)oza</k>
branchy, ramous, ramified. <k />

<k>rampo</k> <ex>(upward)</ex> slope, gradient, incline, ramp. V.
exp.: vid. <k>pento.</k><k />

<k>ranca</k> rancid, rank; <k>ranceso</k> rancidity; <k>ranceskar</k>
to turn, become rancid; <k>odorar rance</k> to smell rancid.
<k />

<k>rango</k> row, file, tier, range; <ex>(degree, station)</ex>
rank, order; <k>rangizar</k> to place (<k>ulo</k>) in rows, put (<k>uli</k>)
in ranks; to class (persons, things) (cf. <k>lokizar</k>); <k>en
 la sama rango</k> in the same row; <k>samranga</k> of the same
rank; <k>altaranga</k> of high rank; <k>recevar rango</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to take rank. Def.: Ordino, aranjo di kozi sama o simila, personi
sur lineo o segun digneso o merito. Ex.: Rango di soldati.
Revolucioni konfuzas omna rangi. <k />

<k>rankorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have a grudge, a ranco(u)r,
spite; to feel resentment, animosity (<k>kontre ulu</k>, <k>pri</k>, <k>pro</k>, <k>ulo</k>). <k />

<k>ransono</k> ransom; <k>postular ransono</k> to demand a ransom (<k>de</k>, <k>po</k>, <k>ulu</k>). Def.: Preco postulata po la liberigo di kaptito
(militala o ne); V-676. <k />

<k>ranuro</k> groove: a long, square-cut, sunken channel in wood
or metal; (firearms) rifling; (cf. <k>kanelo</k>). <k />

<k>rapo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> a variety of turnip (Brassica rapa
rapifera). <k />

<k>rapecar</k> <ex>(tr., of clothing)</ex> to piece, put a piece in,
patch; (of shoes) to cobble; (cf. <k>reparar</k>). <k />

<k>rapida</k> <ex>(in space and time)</ex> rapid, swift, quick,
prompt, fleet, speedy, fast (cf. <k>ajila</k>, <k>hastema</k>, <k>alert</k>); <k>rapideso</k>
quickness, celerity, rapidity, velocity; <k>rapidajo</k> a rapid (in
a river); <k>rapida treno</k>, <k>rapido</k> a fast train, express; <k>rapidagema</k>
expeditious. Ant.: <k>lenta.</k><k />

<k>raportar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make a report on, to report (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>); <k>raporto</k> report; <ex>(fig. math.)</ex> ratio,
relation; <k>raportanto</k>, <k>raportero</k>, <k>raportisto</k> reporter. Def.: Facar
raporto, t.e., plu o min longa naraco o deskripto pri kozo od
evento, specale a chefo od autoritato kompetenta, od a societo,
kongreso, quan o devas o volas informar; VI-79; matematikala <k>raporto</k>
equivalas fraciono, kp. <k>relatar</k>. Ex.: Historio reportas
remarkinda fakti. Komercala raporti; La raportisto raportas la
novaji od facas raporto pri ula proceso. La reporto di 2 ad 3
esas la fraciono 2<k>/</k>3. <k />

<k>rapsodio</k> rhapsody: poem recited by a rhapsodist; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
rambling composition. <k />

<k>raptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sieze and carry away by violence,
pillage, kidnap, ravish; <k>rapto</k> rapine, pillage, kidnapping,
highway robbery; <k>raptanto</k>, <k>raptero</k>, <k>raptisto</k> robber, brigand,
bandit, highwayman; <k>raptajo</k> booty, plunder; <k>raptema</k>
rapacious; <k>raptemeso</k> rapacity (cf. <k>avideso</k>); <k>raptocido</k>
murder (attended) with robbery. V. exp.: vid. <k>furtar</k>, <k>extorsar.</k><k />

<k>rara</k> rare, seldom occuring, not frequent, infrequent,
unusual; (cf. <k>skarsa</k>); <k>rare</k> rarely, seldom, not
often; <k>rarega</k> very rare; <k>rareso</k> rareness; <k>rarajo</k>
a rarity, curiosity. Def.: <k>Desofta</k>, <k>desfrequa</k>; V-595.
Ant.: <k>ofta</k>, <k>frequa</k>, <k />cf.<k>skarsa.</k><k />

<k>raso</k> (human, animal) race, stock, breed; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
family, line, ancestry, blood; <ex>(agri.)</ex> variety; <k>rasala</k>
ethnic; <k>(la) rasi futura</k> future races, generations. Def.:
Ensemblo di la ancestri e decendanti di una familio, di un
populo. Ex.: La raso di Abraham. Homala raso. Di pura raso. Hundo
chasas segun sua raso.

<k>raskalo</k> rascal, rogue, knave, scamp, blackguard; <k>raskalala</k>, <k>raskalatra</k> rascally, scoundrelly; <k>raskaleso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>
knavery; <k>raskalajo</k> <ex>(act.)</ex> knavish trick, rascality; <k>raskalaro</k>rabble, riffraff (cf. <k>populacho</k>).

<k>raspar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rasp, grate; <k>raspilo</k> rasp,
grater; <k>raspuri</k> gratings; <k>raspobruiso</k> a rasping noise;
<k>raspita pano</k> grated bread, bread crumbs.

<k>rastar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rake: clean (<k>ulo</k>) with a
rake; <k>rastilo</k> a rake; <k>rastiloedo</k> a rakeful.

<k>rastaquero*</k> a foreigner or stranger travelling without
known means of existence; a fashionably dressed swindler.

<k>rasteliero</k> rack, wooden frame of open work, as for
fodder, for arms, etc.

<k>ratifikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ratify, confirm (a treaty, an
act, etc.). Def.: Autentigar ulo ja facita o promisita.
<k>rauka</k> hoarse, raucous, husky; <k>raukeso</k> hoarseness; <k>raukigar</k>, <k>raukeskar</k> to make, become hoarse.

<k>rauto</k>rout, a fashionable assembly, a large evening
party.

<k>ravino</k> ravine, gully; <k>ravinizar</k> to gully out (by
torrent), to cross (a land) with ravines. Def.: Longa, profunda e
streta exkavuro formacita da torento.

<k>ravisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ravish: enrapture, charm; <k>raviso</k>, <k>raviseso</k> <ex>(act, state)</ex> transport, rapture; <k>ravisanta</k>, <k>ravisiva</k>
ravishing, delightful, charming; <k>ravisante</k> admirably,
wonderfully well. Ex.: Vua kantado ravises me. Me esis en
raviseso (od, ravisata). Il kantas ravisante.

<k>razar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to shave (<k>su</k>, <k>ulu</k>); <k>razilo</k>
razor; <k>raziloledro</k> razor-strop; <k>razero</k>, <k>razisto</k>
barber. Def.: Tranchar raze la pili.

<k>re</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> re, D, the second note of the diatonic
scale.

<k>reaktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to react (<k>ad</k>, <k>kontre</k>); <k>reakto</k>
<ex>(all senses)</ex> reaction; <k>reaktiva</k>, <k>reaktema</k> reactive; <k>reaktivo</k>
<ex>(chem.)</ex> a reagent; <k>reaktemo</k> <ex>(polit.)</ex>
reactionary.

<k>reala</k> real: actually existing, not imaginary, not
fictitious; <k>realajo</k>, <k>lo reala</k> a reality, what is real; <k>realeso</k>
<ex>(quality)</ex> reality; <k>reale</k> in reality, indeed; <k>realigar</k>
to realize: make real, bring (<k>ulo</k>) into being; <ex>(fin.)</ex>
to convert into money; <k>realeskar</k> to become or be realized;
be converted into money; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to come to pass; <k>realig(ad)o</k>, <k>realiguro</k> realization; <k>realigebla</k> realizeable; <k>realismo</k>
<ex>(philos., art)</ex> realism; <k>realismala</k>, <k>realistala</k>
realistic; <k>realisto</k> realist. Ant.: <k>imaginala</k>, <k>realita;
 nevera</k>, <k>falsa.</k>

<k>rebela</k> rebellious, refractory; <k>rebel(ul)o</k> a rebel,
insurgent; <k>rebeleskar</k>, <k>rebelesar</k> to rebel, rise in rebellion (cf.
<k>revoltar</k>); -<k>esko</k>, <k>rebeleso</k> rebellion; <k>rebelaro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex>
rebels. Def.: Qua violente refuzas obediar autoritato yurizita.
Ex.: La rebela anjelo. Rebelo kontre rejo. Ant.: <k>obedianta</k>, <k>rebelema.</k>  ? DEFIS

<k>rebordo</k> a raised edge; brim, rim; <k>rebordizar</k> to put a
raised edge on (<k>ulo</k>). V. exp.: <k>Flanjo</k> existas nur
en tubi. <k>Rebordo</k> ne esas simpla <k>bordo</k>, ma bordo
salianta ofte perpendikla a la chefa parto (quale rebordo di
chapelo); IV-642.

<k>recenta</k> recent; <k>recente</k> recently, lately; <k>tote recente</k>
very recent, new, fresh; <k>til recente</k> until recently. Ex.:
Recenta eventi. Tote recenta memoro. Ant.: <k>anciena.</k>

<k>recepcionar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to take over. V. exp.:<ex>
</ex>Examenar la qualesi di furnisajo e pose decidar pri lua
acepto o refuzo. VII-480.

<k>recepto</k> <ex>(med., cook)</ex> recipe, receipt (cf. <k>preskripto</k>).
Def.: Formulo qua indikas la kompozuro di ula medikamento o la
ingrediento di ulo.

<k>recevar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to receive, accept (something
offered, given, sent); <k>recevo</k> <ex>(act.)</ex> accepting,
receipt; <k>recevajo</k> that which is received; <k>la libro esas
 recevebla de la imprimerio</k>the book is to be had from the
printer’s; <k>recevuyo</k> receptacle; <k>recevilo</k> receiver <ex>(instr.)</ex>;
<k>recevatesto</k> acknowledgement of receipt. V. Exp.: On <k>recevas</k>
simple to, quo donesis o sendesis, mem ne demandita o ne
expektata. On <k>recevas</k> donacajo, pensiono. On <k>aceptas</k>
kande on voluntas recevar (gasto, e.c.). <k>Obtenar</k> esas
recevar kozo, quan on deziras, demandas, por qua on konkursis
(premio) od irge penis; II-647.

<k>recidivar</k> <ex>(intr., jur.)</ex> to repeat the same
offence, to commit the same crime again; <ex>(med.)</ex> to
reappear (said of a former illness);<k>recidivo</k> recidivism:
relapse into crime or illness, second offense; <k>recidivanto</k>, <k>recidivinto</k>, <k>recidivero</k> previously convicted felon, old offender.

<k>recipiento</k> <ex>(chem., phys.)</ex> recipient: receiving
vessel for gases or liquids.

<k>reciproka</k> <ex>(also log., gram.)</ex> reciprocal, mutual; <k>reciproko</k>
<ex>(log.)</ex> converse: reciprocal proposition; <k>reciprokeso</k>
reciprocity, mutuality; <k>agar reciproke</k> to return the like, to
give like for like (<k>ad</k> <k>ulu</k>). V. exp.: vid. <k>mutuala.</k>

<k>recitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recite: repeat out loud
something learned (a lesson, etc.)

<k>recitativo</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> recitative: sort of a musical
declamation used in operas, etc.

<k>reda</k> red (colo(u)red); <k>redo</k>, <k>reda koloro</k> red (the
color); blush; <k>redeso</k> redness; <k>redigar</k>, <k>redizar</k> to make
red (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); to cause to blush; <k>redatra</k> reddish,
ruddy; <k>redvanga</k> red-cheeked, rubicund; <k>(la) redi</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
the reds, republicans, socialists.

<k>redaktar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to draw up, word (a document); to
edit (a newspaper, journal) (cf. <k>editar</k>); <k>redakt(ad)o</k>, <k>redakturo</k> drawing up (deeds, etc.); editing periodicals;
redaction; <k>redakteso</k> manner , style of wording, editing; <k>redaktanto</k>, <k>redaktero</k>, <k>redaktisto</k> writer (of a deed); editor; <k>redaktistala artiklo</k>
an editorial.

<k>redingoto</k> frock coat: double-breasted garment for men,
with long skirts before and behind.

<k>reduito</k> <ex>(fort.)</ex> reduit, inner fortification; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
retreat, refuge. Def.: La senco vulgara e la senco militala esas
identa: «loko, angulo en qua on povas retretar, refujar, celar
su»; IV-706.

<k>reduktar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.; also surg., math.)</ex> to
reduce (to proper, suitable proportions; cf. <k>diminutar</k>); <ex>(jur.)</ex>
to commute (a sentence); <k>reduktebla</k> reducible. Ex.: Reduktar
(la dimensioni di) mapo, tablo. Reduktar ulu a taco. Reduktar ulo
a pulvero. Reduktar frumento a farino. Reduktar rupturo. Reduktar
du fracioni a la sama denominatoro.

<k>refo</k> reef (in a sail); <k>refagar</k> to reef; <k>desrefagar</k>
to let out the reefs in (a sail).

<k>referar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to refer (to): to direct,
send to another; to attribute, ascribe; <k>refero</k> reference; <k>referolibro</k>
book of reference. Ex.: Me referas l’afero a vu. Me referas
Sro. A. a Sro. B. Me referas mea debileso a la morbo. Ica komizo
havas bona referi. On referas ad autoro o libro, e.c. kande on
indikas la loko, en qua on trovos ulo aludata o bezonata (k.p. <k>citar</k>).
V. exp.: <k>Referar</k>, verbo transitiva, havas senco vicina a <k>relatigar</k>,
ma plu preciza. Ol signifikas: establisar relato logikala od
intelektala inter un kozo ed altra, qua esas exemple lua kauzo,
origino, expliko, e.c. Exemple, on <k>referas</k> la marei a la
luno; on <k>referas</k> monumento a lua epoko, autoro, stilo. Per
extenso di ta senco, on <k>referas</k> <k>su</k> a persono, qua
povas atestar o garantiar ulo, ad autoritato, qua povas konfirmar
aserto o protektar ulu; VI-79.

<k>referendario</k> referendary, <ex>(in France)</ex> a former
title of certain public officers; <ex>(in Germany)</ex> young
barrister attending the courts and qualifying for the post of
«Assessor»; <k>referendaria konsilisto</k> <ex>(France)</ex> a magistrate
in audit office.

<k>reflektar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. sense)</ex> to reflect (back),
mirror back (<k>ulo</k>); to turn something back; <ex>(intr., fig.
mental sense)</ex> to reflect, consider, meditate especially on
something past (<k>pri</k>): <k>reflektesar</k> to be reflected (<k>en</k>, <k>sur</k>); <k>reflektita</k> reflected <ex>(of objects)</ex>; <k>reflektanta</k>
reflecting; <k>reflektiva</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> reflective verb etc.; <k>reflektema</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> reflective, meditative, thoughtful; <k>reflektilo</k>
reflector (cf. <k>reflektoro</k>); <k>reflektangulo</k> angle of
relexion; <k>sen reflekta</k> <ex>(of character)</ex> thoughtless,
giddy, heedless. Ex.: Speguli reflektas la imaji di objekti.
Reflektez ante ke vu agos. Il reflektis pri sua pasinta peki.
Agar senreflekte.

<k>refluxar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to ebb (of tides); <k>refluxo</k>
ebb, reflux. Ant. <k>fluxar.</k>

<k>reformar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reform: amend for the better
(laws, customs, morals, etc.); <k>reformo</k> <ex>(also church hist.)</ex>
reform(ing); reformation; <k>reformema</k>, <k>reformemo; reformista</k>, <k>isto</k>
reformer, reformist; <k>reformita</k> reformed (person, church,
etc.); <k>reformito</k> a reformed person; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a
protestant; <k>reformebla</k> reformable.

<k>refraktar</k><ex>(tr., phys.)</ex> to refract; <k>refraktesar</k>
to be refracted; <k>refraktiveso</k> refractive power; <k>refraktebla</k>
refrangible. Ex.: La prismato refraktas la lumo-radii.

<k>refraktara</k> <ex>(of substances)</ex> refractory, not easily
melted, wrought or acted upon; <k>refraktar(ul)o</k> a refractory
person, contumacious person;<k /><ex>(milit.)</ex> rebellious
recruit (who refuses to join his regiment).

<k>refreno</k> refrain, burden of a song; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
constant theme, topic.

<k>refujar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to take refuge, seek shelter (<k>che
 ulu</k>, <k>ad ulo</k>). <ex>(fig.)</ex> to have recourse (to); <k>refujeyo</k>
place of refuge; lair (of beasts); <k>refujtrotuaro</k> a place of
reuge (for pedestrians); <k>refujanto</k>, <k>refujinto</k> refugee.

<k>refutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to refute, confute, disprove. Def.:
Kombatar aserto od opiniono per argumenti, qui nuligas ol o qui
pruvas la kontreajo. (En proceso, en diskuto, singla partiso
penas refutar la aserto o pretendo di l’altra); III-222.

<k>refuzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to decline, refuse; <k>refuzo</k>
refusal; <k>refuzajo</k> what is refused. V. exp.: Vu <k>refuzas</k>,
sive kozo quan on ofras a vu, sive kozo, quan on demandas de vu,
sive irga propozo quan on facas a vu. Do <k>refuzar</k> = ne
aceptar, o ne koncesar (ne volar donar), o ne admisar, o ne
konsentar; III-222.

<k>regalar</k> <ex>(tr., also fig.)</ex> to regale, treat,
entertain, feast; <k>il regalis sua amiki</k> he entertained his
friends; <k>il regalas ni per charmanta rakonto</k> he told us
(treated us with) a charming tale (to amuse us).

<k>regardar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pay regard to: to look at
something attentively, cast the eye on; <k>regardeskar</k>, <k>regardetar</k> to
glance at; <k>regardo</k>, <k>regardado</k> look(ing), gaze, stare, Ex.: Regardar
la homi pasanta. El lansis regardi furioza. Regardar super muro.
La regardi expresas la pensi. V. exp.: <k>Vidar</k> esas nur
perceptar ulo per l’okulo, vole o nevole. <k>Regardar</k>
esas esforcar por vidar, implikas sempre intenco ed atenco, mem
se on fakte ne sucesas vidar: ofte on dicas: «me regardas, e me
vidas nulo»; V-35; kp. <k>spektar</k>, <k>kontemplar.</k>

<k>regenerar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to regenerate: to generate anew; <ex>(theol.)</ex>
to make to be born again; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to reform, amend. Ex.: La
sapto regeneras la aboro-tisui. Bapto esas regenero. Regenerar
naciono dekadanta.

<k>regio</k> regie, direct administration, management of
government properties (as opposed to contract administration),
esp. the excise administration; a government monopoly.

<k>regiono</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> region, part of a country,
of space, of the body, of a science; <k>regionala</k> regional.

<k>registro</k> register, record (of persons); account (of acts
and proceedings); <ex>(com.)</ex> account book; <k>registragar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to register, record; <k>registrag(ad)o</k> registration; <k>registreyo</k>
registration office; <k>registristo</k> registrar; <k>en registrigar</k>
to keep a register of, make a record of, enrol.

<k>regnar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to reign: to rule as king or
sovereign, to hold sway over (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>regno</k> reign;
<ex>(nat. hist.)</ex> kingdom; <k>regnanta</k> reigning; <k>regnato</k>
a subject; <k>animal regno</k> animal kingdom. Ex.: Louis XIV
regnis la lando de 1643 ad 1715. <ex>(fig.)</ex> La regno di
yusteso, di ula modo. La teroro regnis. V. exp.: La rejo di
Anglia regnis ma ne guvernas.

<k>regoliso</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> liquorice, licorice; <k>regolispasto</k>
l. paste; <k>regolisaquo</k> l. water.

<k>regresar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to regress, recede; to recoil; <k>regres(ad)o</k>
regression, retro-gression; <k>regresanta</k>, <k>regresiva</k>, <k>regresema</k> <ex>(lit.
and fig.)</ex> regressive, retrograde. Ant.: <k>avancar.</k>

<k>regretar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to regret, be sorry about (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>regretinda</k> regrettable. Ex.: Regretar la pekunio
spensita, amiko mortinta.

<k>regular</k> <ex>(tr., tech. and fig.)</ex> to regulate
(machines, clocks, etc.); <k>regulo</k> rule (to follow; cf. <k>normo</k>);
<k>regulado</k> regulating; <k>regularo</k> rules <ex>(collect.)</ex>; <k>regulala</k>
relating to regulating; <k>reguloza</k> regular: conformed to rule
or law, uniform, constant; <k>regulozeso</k> regularity; <k>regulozigar</k>
to regularize, make regular, put in order, set right; <k>regulanta</k>, <k>reguliva</k> regulating, regulative; <k>reguloze</k> regularly; <k>regulizar</k>
to make, establish regulations for, impose regulations on; <k>regulizuro</k>
regulation (prescribed); <k>reguliero</k> <ex>(rel.)</ex> regular, a
monk; <k>reguliereskar</k> to become a monk, nun; <k>regulierino</k>
nun. Ex. Segun la regulo. Konformigar su a la reguli. La regulado
di la posh-horlojo. Regular su segun ulu. Regulizar itinerario.
Regul-oz-igar nia aferi, nia dokumenti. On preskriptas regulizuri
por soldati, por karceri. V. exp.: On <k>regulas</k> mashino,
fixigante lua repideso o lua povo ad ula valoro konstanta. <k>Regular</k>
ne esas <k>ajustar</k>. On <k>ajustas</k> peci, on <k>regulas</k>
fenomeno. On <k>regulas</k> horlojo, <k>ajustante</k> lua
pendulo. V-67.

<k>regulatoro*</k> <ex>(mechan.)</ex> regulator, governor. Def.:
Ula parto di mashino qua regulas la movado.

<k>rehabilitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rehabilitate, reinstate; <k>rehabilito</k>
rehabilitation, vindication. Def.: Riestablisar en lua olima
stando, partikulare en yuri. Ex.: Rehabilitar la memoro di
kondamnito. Rehabilitar ulu ad lua olima rango, ulu en
l’estimo di la populo.

<k>rej(ul)o</k> <ex>(also cards and chess)</ex> sovereign king; <k>rejala</k>
regal, royal; <k>rejido</k> royal prince; <k>rejprinculo</k> crown
prince; <k>rejeso</k> royalty: state of being king, kingship; <k>rejino</k>
queen; <k>rejio</k>, <k>rejlando</k>, <k>rejstato</k> kingdom; <k>rejocido;
 rejocidanto</k>, <k>rejinto</k> <ex>(act, person)</ex> regicide; <k>rejala
 aquo</k> aqua regia, nitro-hydrochloric acid.

<k>rejimo</k> <ex>(polit. social, medic.)</ex> regime, regimen;
mode or system of rule or management. Def.: Senco politikala:
formo o maniero di guvernado. Senco teknikala: maniero plu o min
reguloza segun qua ula fenomeno (duranta) eventas. Senco
medicinala: maniero (metodoza) di vivar e di nutrar su (to ne
esas <k>dieto</k>, nek <k>higieno</k>); IV-580. Ex.: Anciena
rejimo. Monarkiala rejimo. Rejimo di karceri.

<k>rekalkar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to upset (metals); to ram
(a gun); <k>rekalk(ad)o</k> compression (endways); <k>rekalkilo</k>
rammer (of a firearm). Def.: Facar preso sur materio
cilindroforma (liquida o solida) sur un de lua bazi en la sinso
di l’axo, tale ke on kurtigas ol; IV-581.

<k>rekamar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to figure or work a fabric with
gold, silver, silk, etc.; <k>rekamita per oro</k> gold-figured,
-worked.

<k>rekapitular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recapitulate; sum up the
principal points. Def.: Rezumar, kurte repetar o rimemorigar per
enumero preciza e kompleta di omna punti, parti, o chapitri;
III-206.

<k>reklamar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to advertise (loudly), to
boom; (cf. <k>avertar</k>); <k>reklam(ad)o</k> advertisement, puffing
up.

<k>reklamacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to (re-)claim, put in a claim
for (compensation, a reward, what is due, one’s rights,
etc.) (cf. <k>postular</k>); <k>reklamaco</k> claim, <ex>(jur.)</ex>
complaint; <k>reklamacanto</k> claimant. Ex.: Reklamacar objekti
pruntita o perdita. Reklamacar sumo debata, salario, honorario
(cf. III-409).

<k>rekolecar</k> <ex>(rel.)</ex> to commune with one’s own
heart, to turn one’s mind from earthly affairs and piously
meditate; <k>rekoleco</k> self-communing, pious meditation; <k>rekolecanta</k>
wrapped in pious meditation.

<k>rekoliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gather in, in order to save
from loss. Def.: Prenar o gardar ulo od ulu abandonita, perdita o
falinta; VI-115. Ex.: Rekoliar fragmenti de la naufrajo. Rekoliar
la perdita infanti. <k />

<k>rekoltar</k> <ex>(tr., also fig.)</ex> to harvest, reap, get in
(crops), gather in (the fruits of the earth); <k>rekolt(ad)o</k>
harvesting, reaping; <k>rekoltajo</k> harvest, crop, vintage.

<k>rekomendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recommend (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>ad
 ulu</k>)<k />(cf. <k>konsilar</k>, <k>exhortar</k>); <k>rekomendo</k> <ex>(act)</ex>
recommendation; <k>rekomendinda</k> worthy of r.; <k>rekomendoletro</k>
letter of r.

<k>rekompensar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recompense, reward, require,
remunerate (<k>ulu</k>, <k>per ulo</k>).

<k>rekordo</k> record (in sports). Def.: Sportala prodajo,
oficale konstatita, e qua ecelas super omna agi di sama genero
entee facita.

<k>rekortar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut, clip; curtail, (the
outside, the edge, the end), to pare, crop, prune, lop (the
nails, a garment, a coin) (cf. <k>tondar</k>); <k>rekort(ad)o</k>, <k>rekorturo</k>
clipping, paring. Def.: Detranchar la bordo, la extremajo di ulo.

<k>rekrutar</k> <ex>(tr., milit. and fig.)</ex> to recruit,
enlist (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ad</k>); <k>rekrutar su</k> to enlist; <k>rekrutito</k> a
recruit; <k>rekrutachar</k> to entice (<k>ulu</k>) into enlisting, to
crimp.

<k>rekta</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> straight; not crooked or curved;
upright, plumb, erect; <k>rekte</k> in a straight line;<k>rekto</k> a
straight line; <k>rekteso</k> straightness, directness;
uprightness; <k>rektigar</k> straighten, align, lay out in line; <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to dress the ranks. Ex.: Stacar rekte. Irar segun rekto. Rekta
kolumo. Rektigar la trupi. V. exp.: vid. <k>direta</k>, <k>erektar.</k>
Ant.: <k>kurva</k>, <k>tordita</k>, <k>sinuoza.</k>

<k>rektifikar</k> <ex>(tr., chem, and fig.)</ex> to rectify
(spirits, errors, etc.). Def.: Purigar per distilado; igar
exakta; korekt-igar.

<k>rektoro</k> rector: headmaster of an acedemy, of a
university, of a Jesuit college; (cf. <k>paroko</k>).

<k>rekuperar</k> to recover, regain, retrieve, get back the
possession or use of, to recoup; <k>rekupero</k> recovery, regaining,
recuperation; <k>rekuperebla</k> <ex>(also fin.)</ex> recoverable. Def.
Ri-aquirar, ri-posedar ulo. ex.: Rekuperar kaloro, sua havaji,
spensi, forteso, parol-povo, vid-povo, bon-san-eso. DeFIS

<k>rekursar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have recourse to (<k>ad ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>), to appeal, to resort (<k>ad</k>); <k>rekurso</k> recourse;
application for assistance or protection; resort (to a source of
aid); <k>rekurso ad indulgo</k> petition for pardon; <k>rekursar a la
 klementeso di la rejo</k> to solicit the clemency of the
sovereign; <k>rekurso a kasaco</k> petition or lodgement of appeal; <k>lakrimi
 esis elua nura rekurso</k> tears were her only recourse. Def.:
Demandar la helpo, la sokurso. Ex.: On rekursas a helpo, a
helpanto, a moyeno, a metodo, a procedo.

<k>rekuzar</k> <ex>(tr., jur. and fig.)</ex> to challenge (a
witness, juror); to take exception to (testimony, statements); <k>rekuzar
 su</k> <ex>(of judges, jurors)</ex> to decline judging or voting,
to beg to be excused; <k>rekuzo</k> challenge, exception, denial; <k>rekuzebla</k>
exceptionable, challengeable, doubtful. V. exp.: <k>Rekuzar</k>
esas teknikal termino di la yurocienco; on <k>rekuzas</k>
judikanto o testo (t.e. on ne aceptas lu, ed on exkluzas lu), en
ula kondicioni determinita da la legi, ex. kande la senpartiseso
di la judikanto o testo esas suspektebla (pro lua relati kun la
judikoti, pro lua personal interesti, e.c.). Judikanto povas <k>rekuzar</k>
su ipsa spontane pro simila motivi, to esas, refuzas funcionar.
Komprenebla, ca vorto povas uzesar kun metafora senco en la
komuna vivo; III-222.

<k>relatar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to have reference to, stand
in some relation to, to be related, to relate to; <ex>(of persons)</ex>
to be connected (by business, etc.; N.B. not family; cf. <k>parenta</k>);
<k>relato</k> relation (<k>di ulo ad ulo</k>, <k>ulu kun ulu</k>); <k>relate</k>
relatively, comparatively (not absolutely); in reference to, with
regard; <k>relatanta</k>, <k>relativa</k> pertaining, relating to; relative to;
<ex>(jur.)</ex> appertaining to; <k>relativeso</k> relativity; <k>relatigar</k>
to put (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) into relation or connection (<k>ad</k>, <k>kun
 ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>relatata</k> correlative. Ex.: «A relatas B»
signifikas ke existas «relato» inter A e B. On povas anke
«relatigar» A ad (od, kun) B. V. exp.: <k>Relato</k> <ex>(matematikala
senco)</ex>: On povas dicar 2 relatas 3, quale 4 relatas 6, od on
darfas parolar pri «relato» di 2 a 3. La nociono <k>relato</k>
esas multe plu general ed ampla kam la nociono <k>raporto</k>. On
bezonas sempre parolar pri relati inter diversa grandaji, e ca
relati esas tante generala, ke ne omni povas expresesar per
equacioni. La <k>relato</k> di <ex>a</ex> ad <ex>b</ex> povas esar
irga funciono; la <k>reporto</k> di <ex>a</ex> ad <ex>b</ex> esas
simple e nur la fraciono <ex>a/b</ex>; VI-296.

<k>relayo</k> <ex>(also elec., teleg.)</ex> relay, fresh supply
of horses, etc.

<k>relegar</k> <ex>(tr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to relegate, send
off, shut up, consign, seclude (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) in a fixed
place; <k>relego</k>, <k>relegeso</k> regulation, banishment. Def.: Enternar en
loko determinita. Ex.: Relegar recidivinto ad kolonio. Relegar
ulu a chambro, portreto ad kelero, ulu ad ruro. V. exp.: vid. <k>exilar.</k>

<k>relevar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to survey, map out, make a plan of;
<ex>(nav.)</ex> take a bearing of (coasts, shores).

<k>reliefo</k> <ex>(paint., sculp., arts)</ex> relief, relievo,
embossment; <k>reliefa mapo</k> map in r.; <k>reliefo alta</k>, <k>basa</k>
high-, base r.; <k>reliefizar</k> to emboss (paper, etc.).

<k>religio</k> religion; <k>religiala</k> religious (war, etc.); <k>religioza</k>
religious (person); <k>religiozeso</k> religiousness; <k>religiano</k>
believer in a religion; faithful, true believer.

<k>reliquio</k> relic (of saints, etc.); <ex>(pl.)</ex> mortal
remains, relics; <k>reliquiuyo</k>, <k>reliquikesto</k> reliquary.

<k>remar</k>, <k>remadar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to row, pull on an oar;
<k>remilo</k> oar; <k>rembatelo</k> rowboat.

<k>remarkar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to remark, to notice, observe; <k>remarkigar</k>
to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to remark, to attract notice to; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to state, to say; <k>remarko</k> notice, observation; <k>remarkinda</k>
worthy of note, remarkable, curious, notable; <k>remarkar la beleso di
 ulo</k> to notice the beauty of something; <k>elua beleso
 remarkigis su da me</k> her beauty attracted my attention; <k>remarkar
 ulu en turbo</k> to observe someone in a crowd; <k>facar remarki
 pri</k> pass remarks upon; <k>me remarkigis</k>, <k>ke pluvas</k> I
remarked (pointed out) that it was raining. (cf. VII-206-7); <k>remarkinda
 evento</k> a remarkable event; <k>verko plena de remarki</k> a
work full of comments. V. exp.: turnar o portar sua atenco sur
ulo od ulu. M. XI-226.

<k>remediar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to remedy (a disease, a sickness);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to redress, repair, set to rights; <k>remediilo</k> a
remedy, cure, specific; <k>remediebla</k> remediable (disease); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
<k>remediar malajo</k> to remedy an evil; <k>remediilo plu mala kam
 la morbo</k> a remedy worse than the disease; <k>tempo remedias
 omno</k> time is a cure for all things. Def.: Supresar, cesigar
la maladeso; V-157. V.exp.:<k>Remediilo</k>esas<k>kuracivo.
 Medikamento esas nur ulo donata por kuracar.</k> Quankam morbo
esas <k>neremediebla</k>, <k />ni ankore aplikas <k>medikamenti.</k>
On <k>risanigas</k> malado, e remedias maladeso.

<k>reminicar*</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reproduce or imitate
(consciously or not) from memory some literary or musical piece.
V. exp.: Reminico ne esas simpla rimemoro: o esas rimemoro di ula
literatural o muzikal peco, quan on imitas nevole o nekoncie: to
esas esence imito o kopio di artala verko en altra, do tote altra
kozo kam la simpla memoro, qua esas nur la kauzo od okaziono di
la reminico. On povas havar rimemoro sen pro to facar reminico;
V-627.

<k>remisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to remit (debts, sins, etc.); <ex>(med.)</ex>
to abate (symptoms); <k>remiso</k> remission; diminution (of a
disease); <k>remisebla</k> remissable: that may be remitted or
forgiven, pardonable; <k>remisanta febro</k> remittent fever. Def.:
(senco ordinara) Dispensar ulu de (parto di) debajo, puniso,
peki, e.c.; (senco medikala) Ceso o diminuto (tempala) di la
simptomi di maladeso; IV-605, VI-210.

<k>remonstrar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to remonstrate. Def.: Expozar
polite (mem a superioro) la nejusteso di la ago; V-25. Ex.: En
l’anciena monarkio, la parlamenti havis la yuro facar
remonstri al rejo . . . qua generale ne egardis oli.

<k>remonto</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> remount(ing): purchase or supply
of fresh horses; <k>remonteyo</k>, <k>remonterio</k> remounting depot.

<k>remorkar</k> <ex>(tr., nav. and gen.)</ex> to tow, take in
tow, tug, haul, drag (a boat, a movable object; cf. <k>tuvar</k>);
<k>remorko</k> towing; <k>remorkokablo</k> tow-rope; <k>remorkobatelo</k>, <k>remorknavo</k> towing-vessel, tow-boat, tug; <k>remorkveturo</k> (hand)
street-cart (as for selling fruit, etc.).

<k>remparo</k> rampart, bulwark; <ex>(fig.)</ex> any means of
defence.

<k>remplasar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to replace: take the place
of, be in the place of (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>remplasigar</k> to
replace (<k>ulu da ulu</k>, <k>ulo per ulo</k>); <k>remplaso</k>, <k>remplasigo</k>
replacing, replacement; <k>remplasanto</k> substitute: one who
replaces another; <k>remplas(ig)ebla</k> replaceable. Ex.: Il
remplasis me dum mea absenteso. On remplasigas la patro da la
filio. Remplasigar la anciena moblaro per nova. V. exp.: vid. <k>substitucar</k>, <k>suplantar.</k>

<k>remulado</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> remo(u)lade, a French salad
dressing somewhat resembling mayonnaise. <k />

<k>rendevuo</k> rendezvous: a meeting appointed, appointment; <k>fixigar
 rendevuo</k> to make an appointment (<k>kun</k> <k>ulu</k>); <k>il
 arivis unesme ye la rendevuo</k> he arrived first at the rendezvous.

<k>rendimento*</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> output, efficiency (of
machines). Def.: Elekto utila (di mashini).

<k>renegar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deny (untruly), to disown,
disavow; <k>renego</k> denying, denial; <k>reneganto</k> <ex>(rel. and
gen.)</ex> renegade: apostate from the faith; backslider. Ex.: St.
Petro trifoye renegis Jesu. Renegar sua familio, sua
religio.Def.: Deklarar nevere ke on ne konocas ulu, ulo; abjurar
(ne-vere); des-agnoskar (ne-vere). V. exp.: vid. <k>renuncar</k>.

<k>renkontrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to meet: meet with accidentally
