when in motion, to fall in with, encounter (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>renkontro</k>
meeting, encounter.

<k>rento</k> (yearly) income, rent, annuity; <k>rentizar</k> to
allow a yearly income to (<k>ulu</k>), to endow (public
institutions); <k>rentifar</k> to bring in revenue, yield an
income; <k>rentifanta</k> income producing; <k>rentiero</k>
fundholder, stockholder, annuitant, person of independent means; <k>sulo
 rento</k> ground rent; <k>monatala</k>, <k>yarala rento</k> monthly, yearly
rent; <k>rento dumviva</k> life annuity; <k>lasar rento</k> (od, <k>interesti</k>)
<k>akumulesar</k> to allow arrears to accumulate (rent,
interest, dividends). Def.: Revenuo (yarala), ordinare personala,
derivita de sulhavaji, domi lugata, o de kapitalo statala o
privata.

<k>renuncar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to renounce, give up, relinquish,
resign (a position, office). Def.: Cesar dezirar o demandar ulo.
Ex.: Me renuncas voyajo, quan me intencas facar; on renuncas
yuro, quan on posedas; e.c. Rejido renuncas la trono o la krono,
kande, nultempe regninte, il refuzas regnor; IV-100. V exp.: Ni <k>renuncas</k>
yuro, precepti o kustumi; ni <k>renegas</k> mastro o nia religio;
ni <k>abjuras</k> eroro, od imaginita eroro. Philip V <k>renuncis</k>
la krono di Francia; St. Petro <k>renegis</k> sua mastro; Henry
IV <k>abjuris</k> la Kalvanismo.

<k>renversar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to overthrow, throw down,
upset (cf. <k>subversar</k>, <k>inversigar</k>); <k>renverse</k> backward; <k>renversebla</k>
that may be overthrown. Def.: Faligar ulo, ulu ad tero. Ex.:
Renversar muro, tablo, inkuyo, veturo, persono, <ex>(fig.)</ex>
esperi. La muro renversis.

<k>reparar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repair, restore, mend a road, a
house, a machine, a picture; to refit (a ship); (cf. <k>rapecar</k>);
<k>repar(ad)o</k>, <k>reparuri</k>repairing, mending, repairs; <k>repardoko</k>
graving-dock, dock for repairs; <k>reparpeci</k> spare parts (for
repairs); <k>reparetar</k> to slightly repair; <k>reparachar</k> to
botch repairs (cf. <k>fushar</k>).

<k>repartisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to divide into due proportion,
portion out, distribute (<k>ulo</k> <k>inter</k> <k>uli</k>); <k>repartis(ad)o</k>
apportionment, repartition; <k>repartisanto</k>, <k>repartisero</k>, <k>repartisisto</k>
distributer. Def.: Dividar segun proporciono oportuna o yusta;
VI-79. V. exp.: Se publika prunto esas suskriptita dekople, on <k>repartisas</k>
ol inter la suskriptinti en la proporciono di 1/10, t.e. on
atribuas a singlu 1/10 de la sumo, quan lu suskriptas. Simile on <k>repartisas</k>
kargajo inter plura porteri o porto-bestii, inter la axi di
veturo o vagono, e.c.; VI-79; kp. <k>disdonar</k>, <k>distributar.</k>

<k>repastar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to take one’s meal, have a
meal (<k>che</k>, <k>kun</k>); <k>repasto</k> meal, repast; (ship’s)
mess; <k>repastetar</k> to lunch; <k>repasteto</k> luncheon, light
repast. Def.: Manjar ye fixa horo, apud tablo (generale kune);
II-74. Ex.: Li repastis che me. La repast-horo. Il manjas quar
repasti omnadie.

<k>repentar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to repent, rue, feel
contrition; <k>sen repenta</k> impenitent. Def.: Havar reala
regreto. Ex.: Il repentas sua kulpi. Me igos il repentar to.

<k>reperar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to put a guiding mark on; <k>reperilo</k>, <k>reperpunto</k> guidemark (as made on a piece of machinery so as to
assemble easily and accurately; mark on a wall, a measuring-rod,
on the ground, in order to indicate alignment, a level, a height,
etc.

<k>reperkutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repercuss: to drive or beat
back; (of sound) to reverberate; <k>reperkutado di l’ondi</k>
surf; <k>reperkuto</k> repercussion, reverberation, rebound (cf. <k>risalto</k>).
Def.: Reperkuto: l’ago di korpo shokata, qua shokas sua-vice
altra; IV-138. Ex.: Reperkuto di (pafita) kanono.

<k>repertorio</k> a table, index, register by which things can
be readily located; <ex>(theat.)</ex> repertoire; stock-pieces,
-plays; <k>alfabetala</k>, <k>repertorio</k> alphabetical index.

<k>repetar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repeat: reiterate, tell or say
again (what has been told before or what another has said); <k>repetachar</k>
to repeat tediously. V. exp.: On <k>repetas</k> nur paroli; on <k>iteras</k>
omna-speca ago; II-80.

<k>repleta</k> <ex>(of living beings)</ex> chubby, plump, stout,
firm-fleshed, replete (from food); <k>repleteso</k> plumpness; <k>repleteskar</k>
to become plump, chubby; (cf. <k>korpulenta</k>, <k>obeza</k>, <k>grasa</k>, <k>plena</k>, <k>ronda</k>). Def.: Qua havas formi ronda e karno ferma, do la pelo
kelke tensita. (Lu povas tote ne esar korpulenta, ex. infanto. La
repleteso esas signo di saneso); VI-601. <k />

<k>replikar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to rejoin, retort: to answer
to a reply; <k>repliko</k> answer, reply: <ex>(jur.)</ex> replication:
the reply of the plaintiff to the defendant’s plea;
rejoinder: the defendant’s answer to the plaintiff’s
replication; <k>repliko: (quika</k>, <k>rapida)</k> repartee, retort. V.
exp.: <k>Replikar</k> ne esas simple <k>respondar</k>, ma
respondar a respondo. En la teknikal terminaro di la diskutado,
on nomizas <k>dupliko</k>, <k>tripliko</k> . . . la duesma,
triesma repliko; II-520. <k />

<k>reportar</k> <ex>(intr., stock exchange)</ex> to allow a
contango; <k>reporto</k> contango, premium or interest paid by a
buyer to a seller to be allowed to defer payment until a future
settlement; cf. VI-603, VII-354. Ant.: <k>diporto.</k><k />

<k>repozar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to rest (repose); (cf. <k>dormar</k>, <k>jacar</k>, <k>apogar</k>, <k>haltar</k>); <k>repozigar</k> to (cause to) rest; <k>repozo</k>
rest, respite, reposing; (cf. <k>intervalo</k>); <k>repozodio</k>
day of rest; <k>repozanta</k> resting; <k>repozeyo</k> resting place; <k>repozaltaro</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> temporary altar (in the street). Ex.: Lua korpo
repozas sub la stono. Il ne dormas, il ne nur repozas. Il
repozigas sua kapo sur kuseno. Havar repozo di koncienco. <k />

<k>represar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repress, check, restrain, put
down, suppress (a revolt, abuses, pride, one’s desires,
etc.); <k>represo</k> repression, coercion; <k>represiva</k> repressive.
Def.: Haltigar l’efekto, la progreso di ulo. <k />

<k>reprezelar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to retaliate, to make reprisals (<k>kontre</k>);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to give tit for tat; <k>reprezelo</k> reprisal,
retaliation; <k>reprezelletri</k> letter of marque and reprisal. V.
exp.: <k>Reprezalar</k> esas plu proxima a <k>venjo</k> kam a <k>revancho</k>.
To konsistas (precipue en milito) facar a l’enemiko exakte
la sama domajo, quan on subisis de lu. To facesas partikulare pri
la agi nekorekta e kruela, qui ecesas la «yuri di la milito»,
exemplo masakro di nekombatanti, incendio di domi e vilaji,
destrukto di monumenti, e.c. <k>Reprezalo</k> nule implikas
revancho, nam ol facesas ofte de la vinkiti, precipue kande li
vinkesas per nekorekta procedi; VI-143; kp. <k>revanchar</k>, <k>venjar.</k><k />

<k>reprezentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to represent, exhibit by
resemblance or action; depict; be the representative of; <k>reprezento</k>
<ex>(aslo theat., polit.)</ex> representation, exhibition; <k>reprezentanta</k>, <k>reprezentiva</k>, <k>reprezentala; reprezentanto</k>, <k>reprezentero</k> representative. Ex.: La ceno
reprezentas palaco. Ambasadisto reprezentas sua stato. Reprezento
di kombato. Il esas reprezentanto di la populo. Guvernado
reprezentiva. <k />

<k>reprimandar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reprimand, admonish, rebuke,
reprove, chide, lecture (<k>ulu pri</k>, <k>pro ulo</k>) (cf. <k>exhortar</k>);
<k>reprimandinda</k> reprehensible, reprovable (cf. <k>blaminda</k>); <k>reprimandachar</k>, <k>reprimandar harde</k> to scold, nag. V. exp.: <k>Reprimandar</k> e <k>reprochar</k>
esas «speci» di la generala ideo <k>blamar</k>. Ma <k>reprocho</k>
vizas kozo od ago; <k>reprimando</k> vizas persono: On reprochas
ulo ad ulu; on reprimandas ulu pri ulo. La nuanco ne esas gravas,
ma ol esas reala ed utila psikologiale; IV-237. <k />

<k>reprochar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reproach, upbraid, taunt, twit (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>); <k>reprochar ad ulu lua vicii</k> to upbraid a person for
his vices (N.B. not: -ar ulu pri lua vicii, as in E.; cf. V.
exp.: under <k>reprimandar</k>); <k>mea koncienco reprochas nulo a me</k>
my conscience is quite clear; <k>il reprochis ad il lua negratitudo</k>
he reproached him with his ingratitiude; <k>il reprochis ad il
 abandonir lua amiko</k> he reproached him for having left his
friend. Def.: Dicar ad ulu ulo qua devas shamigar lu. V. exp.:
vid. <k>reprimandar.</k><k />

<k>repso</k> <ex>(fabric)</ex> rep. Def.: Stofo ek silko o lano tre
forta; III-143. <k />

<k>reptar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to crawl (as a serpent), to creep (as
a child); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to crawl before one (in an abject
manner); <k>reptanta</k> crawling, creeping, reptant; <k>reptero</k>
reptile. <k />

<k>republiko</k> republic; <k>republikala</k> republican (government,
etc.); <k>republikismo</k> republicanism; <k>republikisto</k> believer in,
partisan of a republic. <k />

<k>repudiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repudiate; to put away (one’s
wife). Ex.: Philippe Auguste repudiis sua spozino Ingleburge. V.
exp.: Propre, repudiar esas forsendar spozino, «desspozinigar»
el segun legal formi. Figure, renegar opiniono, kredo. La repudio
diferas de la divorco per ke ol ne bezonas ago di judiciisto o di
extera autoritato; III-206. <k />

<k>repugnar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have or inspire a repugnance to,
to hava an aversion to, to disgust (cf. <k>antipatiar</k>, <k>nauzeigar</k>);
<k>repugnexo</k> disgust, repugnance, dislike; <k>repugnegeso</k>
loathing; <k>repugnanta</k>, <k>repugniva</k> repugnant, repulsive, disgusting.
Ex.: Repugnar facar ulo. Ulo repugnis il. Il repugnesis da ulu,
da ulo. Repugneso kontre ulu, ulo; To esas repugnanta a mea
raciono. <k />

<k>repulsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repel, repulse, rebuff, beat back
(cf. <k>retropulsar</k>); <k>repulsanta</k>, <k>repulsiva</k> <ex>(phys. and
fig.)</ex> repellent, repulsive. Ex.: Repulsar l’asalto di
enemiko. Repulsar tenteso, ula propozajo. La repulso di elektroza
korpi. Repuls-anta, -iva korpo, vizajo. <k />

<k>reputar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to repute, deem; <k>reputesar</k> to be
held (to be so and so); <k>reputo</k>, <k>reputeso</k> reputation, character,
repute (good or bad). Ex.: Reputar ulu kom richa, kom saja.
Reputesar kapabla. Havar bona reputeso. Esar reputata kom bona.
<k />

<k>requizitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to requisition, make demand in the
name of the public or of the law for (persons, animals, thigs,
services); <k>requizit(ad)o</k> requisition(ing); <k>requizitajo</k>
something requisitioned. <k />

<k>resonar*</k> <ex>(intr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to resound: send
back sound, (re-)echo; <k>reson(ad)o</k> resounding, resonance; <k>resonanta</k>
resonant; <k>resonigar</k> to cause to resound; <k>resonilo</k>
resonator. Ex.: Ica audeyo resonas perfekte. Voco klara e
resonanta. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Omna loko resonis pro lua prodajo.
<k />

<k>resorto</k> <ex>(instr. elastic)</ex> spring; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
activity. Energy; <k>resorto granda</k> main s.; <k>resorto laxigita</k>
relaxed s.; <k>resortmatraco</k> s. mattress; (cf. <k>elastika</k>).
Ex.: Resorto di horlojo, di veturo. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Donar resorto a
la spirito. <k />

<k>resortisar</k> <ex>(intr. jur.)</ex> to be under the jurisdiction
(of), belong to the department, to be the province (of), be under
the cognizance; <k>resortiso</k> <ex>(legal)</ex> jurisdiction, resort;
(general) province, department, competence, power; <k>resortisanta</k>
amenable (to), dependant (on); <k>ica afero resortisas ad al
 korto di Paris</k> this affair is cognizable in the court of
Paris; <k>to ne esas mea resortiso</k>that is not within my
province. <k />

<k>respektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to respect: regard with a degree of
reverence or esteem; <k>respektaro</k> respect; <k>respektaroza</k>, <k>respektarema</k>
respectful, deferential; <k>respektarinda</k> respectable; <k>respektarindeso</k>
respectability, dignity; <k>respektarata</k> respected; <k>respektaremacha</k>
obsequious; <k>respektarosigno</k> sign of respect; <k>respektarego</k>
profound respect; <k>respektaregala</k>, <k>respektaroza</k> reverential; <k>des respektaro</k>
irreverence, disrespect; <k>sen respektara</k> disrespectful. Ex.: On
devas respektar la oldi, la legi. <k />

<k>respirar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to respire, breathe (cf. <k>aspirar</k>, <k>expirar</k>); <k>respir(ad)o</k> respiration, breathing; <k>respirajo</k>
what is respired: air, breath; <k>respirala</k> respiratory; <k>respirebla</k>
breathable. Def.: Aspirar l’aero por regenerar la sango e
lore expirar ol. <k />

<k>respondar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to answer, reply, respond (<k>ulo
 ad ulu</k>); <k>respondizar</k> to respond to (<k>ulo</k>); <k>respondar en
 la meso</k> to make the responses in the mass; <k>respondanto</k>
(co-)respondent, answerer; (cf. <k>replikar</k>); <k>respondar
 kurajiganta paroli</k> to answer encouraging words; <k>respondizar
 kurajiganta paroli</k>, <k>respondar a kurajiganta paroli</k> to answer
encouraging words, i.e. to give an answer to encouraging words.
Def.: Parolar o skribar en repliko a questiono, argumento od
adreso. Ex.: Quon vu respondis? Me respondis nur du vorti. Il
respondis tale a mea objeciono, ma me ne replikis ad il.
Respondar ulo a persono, a remarko, a letro. Respondez quik. Me
expektas vua balda respondo. Respondante a vua letro, me informas
vu… V. exp.: Esas regulo en Ido, ke verbo ne povas havar
(mem alterne) du rekta komplementi (ex. on ne povas «instrukar
infanti» ed «instruktar geometrio»). Or la verbo <k>respondar</k>
havas necese kom direta komplimento la paroli, <k>per qui</k> on
respondas, do ol ne povas havar kom direta komplemento la <k>paroli</k>, <k>a qui</k> on respondas. Do on devos sempre dicar: «respondar a
la letro di ulu», o, «respondizar letro», t.e. donar respondo
ad ol, «honorizar» ol per respondo (quale dicas la komercisti);
III-30; VI-297; Talmey’s Text Book, p. 109. <k />

<k>responsar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be responsible, be answerable,
be accountable (<k>pri ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>responso</k> (a particular)
responsibility; liability, <k>responsanta</k>, <k>responsiva</k> responsible,
accountable; <k>responsiveso</k> (general state of being responsible)
responsibility; <k>responsanto</k> one who is responsible; a bondsman;
<k>asumar responso</k> assume responsibility (<k>pri</k>, <k>di ulo</k>); <k>me
 ne responsas (</k>od, <k>esas responsanta) pri la kulpi di altri</k>
I am not responsible for the faults of others. <k />

<k>restar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to remain: to be left, to be left
remaining; to stay, sojourn, tarry (N.B. not lie at rest, repose;
cf. <k>repozar</k>); <k>resto</k> rest, remaining; <k>restajo</k>
that which remains: rest, remainder (of a quantity or sum);
leavings, vestige, scraps (cf. <k>reziduo</k>); <k>restanta</k>
remaining; <k>resteyo</k> place of sojourn. Ex.: Nulo restis de nia
pekunio. Triadek hoteli restas. Il restis en Roma pos nia
departo. Multi restis sur la kombat-agro. Me haltis en la urbo e
restis ibe dum du monati. Me brulos to quo restas (od, la
rest-ajo). V.exp.: <k>Restar</k>: esar dum kelka tempo en la sama
loko o stando, ma ne definitive, t.e. mine kam <k>habitar</k>, ma
pluse kam <k>haltar</k>; III-103. <k />

<k>restaurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to restore. Ex.: Restaurar domo,
pikturo, dinastio, arto, lego. <k />

<k>restitucar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make restitution of, refund (<k>ulo</k>).
V.exp.: Ne simple ridonar, ma ridonar to quon on prenis o gardis
sen yuro, a la legitima proprietero; IV-81. <k />

<k>restorar (su)</k> to take refreshments, food; <k>eyo</k>, <k>erio</k>
restaurant, eating-house; <k>isto</k> dining-room keeper; <k>acheyo</k>
cheap eating-house.

<k>restriktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to restrict, restrain; <k>restriktar
 su</k> to limit, confine oneself (<k>ad</k>); <k>restrikto</k>, <k>restrikturo</k>
restriction, restraint; <k>restriktanta</k>, <k>restriktiva</k> limiting,
restraining, restrictive. Ex.: Restriktar la signifiko di vorto.
Restriktar sua pasioni. Restriktar su a kozi tote necesa. Li
submisis su senrestrikte a la konvenciono (t.e. sen kondicioni
expresita o tacita).

<k>reto</k> net, mesh: object formed by threads or lines
interlaced, network; <ex>(anat.)</ex> plexus (of nerves etc.); <ex>(geom.)</ex>
chain (of triangles); <ex>(arch.)</ex> tracery (of windows); <k>retala</k>, <k>retatra</k> reticular; <k>haro reto</k> hair-net.

<k>retenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to retain, keep, withhold, keep
back, detain (cf. <k>ditenar</k>); <ex>(arith.)</ex> to carry; <k>retenar
 su</k> to restrain, check oneself (<k>per</k>, <k>de</k>); <k>reten(ad)o</k>
retaining, retention; <k>retenajo</k> anything retained; <k>reteneso</k>
<ex>(state of )</ex> retention; <k>reteniva</k>, <k>retenema</k> retentive. Ex.:
Me deziras retenar la pekunio quan me pruntis. On ne povas
retenar amo per koakto. Retenar sua lakrimi. Retenar lojio en
teatro. Retenar memore ulo, od, retenar en memoro ulo. Retenar
ulu en karcero. <ex>(arith.)</ex> Pozar sep e retenar du. Reteniva
memoro.

<k>retoro</k> <ex>(antiq.)</ex> rhetor, rhetorician, (orator); <k>retoracho</k>
one who speaks elegantly but uselessly, word-spinner.

<k>retoriko</k> rhetoric; <k>retorikisto</k> rhetorician, one
skilled in rhetoric.

<k>retraktar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to retract,
withdraw, draw back; <k>retraktamendo</k> forfeit. Ex.: La limako
retraktas sua korni. Retraktar sua promiso, sua erori. <k />

<k>retretar</k> <ex>(intr., milit., rel., and gen.)</ex> to retire,
retreat, seclude, draw off, draw back (from active work, duty,
the world); <k>retreto</k> retreat, retiring, retirement; <ex>(milit.)</ex>
tattoo, taps; <k>retretopensiono</k> retirement pension; <k>retreteyo
 religiala</k> religious retreat (place); <k>sonigar la retreto</k>
to sound the retreat, tattoo, taps; <ex>(hunt.)</ex> to call off
the hounds; <k>retretoficiro</k> retired or «half-pay» officer. V.
exp.: vid. <k>abandonar.</k>

<k>retrocedar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give, cede back again,
return, restore.

<k>retroirar</k>, <k>retromarchar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go back, to
retrograde, fall back (as of troops), retreat, to back (of
carriages); (cf. <k>retretar</k>, <k>regresar</k>); <k>retroirigar</k>, <k>retroiro</k>
retrogression.

<k>retushar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to retouch, touch up (a picture,
etc.).

<k>reumatismo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> rheumatism; <k>reumatismala</k>
rheumatic: relating to r.: <k>reumatismika</k>, <k>reumatismiko</k> rheumatic (person).

<k>revar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to day-dream, muse: to see or fancy
as if in a dream; (cf. <k>sonjar</k>); <k>rev(ad)o</k> reverie,
musing; <k>revajo</k> a fancy; <k>revacho</k> vain fancy, conceit; <k>revema</k>, <k>revachema</k> dreamy. Ex.: Il revis pri la povreso e grandeso di
Roma. Me klozas mea okuli e revas pri feliceso. Ulfoye me vere
meditas, ulfoye nur revas. La projeto esas nur revo (od,
revacho).

<k>revanchar</k> <ex>(intr., in good or bad sense)</ex> to
retaliate, give like for like, get even, requite (<k>su</k>, <k>pri ulu</k>, <k>kontre ulu</k>); to avenge, revenge, take one’s revenge (in
return for an injury); (cf. <k>venjar</k>, <k>reprezalar</k>); <k>revancho</k>
retaliation, revenge, avenging. Def.: Retrodonar similajo a
similajo, sive bona o mala, ma ofte en mala senco. V. exp.: <k>Revanchar</k>
dicesas pri ulu, qua esas vinkata (en milito, konkurso o ludo) e
qua inverse vinkas sua vinkinto. <k>Revancho</k> nule implikas
ideo di venjo nek sentimento di rankoro, ma admaxime satisfaco
propramo. En ludo, jentila ludero, qua vinkis, (ganis), ofras
a sua partenero la revancho, o plu exakte la posibleso
revanchar; nam ica povas vinkesar en la du foyi; VI-143.

<k>revelar</k> <ex>(tr., also theol.)</ex> to reveal; <ex>(photog.)</ex>
to develop; <k>revel(ad)o</k>, <k>reveluro</k> revelation; <k>revelajo</k> that
which is revealed; <k>revelanto</k>, <k>revelero</k> revealer; <k>revelilo</k> <ex>(photog.)</ex>
developing bath. Def.: Konocigar ulo da ulu, quo esis olim
nekonocata, sekreta o celita. Ex.: Revelar la statala sekretaji.
Revelar lua komplico. La latenta imajo esas revelata sur la
klishuro. La revelado di Santa Ioannes.

<k>revendikar</k> <ex>(tr., jur. and fig.)</ex> to claim (as
one’s own), to demand back (<k>ulo</k>); <k>revendikajo</k> object
claimed; (cf. <k>reklamacar</k>). Def.: Reklamacar ulo quo
apartenas a me, e qua esas en la povo di altru. Ex.: Revendikar
sua yuri, ulo perdita, domeno.

<k>reverberar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to send back, radiate
(heat); <k>reverberforno</k> reverberatory furnace. Def.: Absorbar la
kaloro e retrosendar ol radiifante; V-67.

<k>reverencear</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make a bow, on obeisance;
(of women) to courtsey (<k>ad ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>reverenceo profunda</k>
deep bow. Ex.: Kande il pasis, me reverencis ad il. Reverencar a
l’altaro.

<k>reverso</k> the reverse: back side of anything; <k>reverse</k>
inside out, wrong side to; <k>metar sua kalzi reverse</k>, <k>e pose
 metar oli averse</k> to put on one’s stocking wrong side
outwards and afterwards put them on right side to. Def.: Dorsa
latero di stofo, moneto, medalio. Specale, la parto aparanta di
la reverso di frako, di redingoto, di boto, e.c.; Ant.: <k>averso</k>, <k>facio.</k>

<k>reversionar</k> <ex>(intr., jur.)</ex> to revert (<k>ad</k>); <k>reversiono</k>
reversion (of an estate); <k>reversionebleso</k> revertibility.

<k>revizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to revise (a book, a judgement, the
constitution, etc.); Def.: Emendar; ri-examinar por modifikar.

<k>revokar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to revoke, repeal (an edict,
privileges, a law); to recall (an ambassador); to dismiss (a
clerk, officer, official).

<k>revoltar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to rise in revolt, to rebel (<k>kontre
 ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>revolto</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> revolt,
insurrection; <k>revoltanto</k>, <k>revoltinto</k> revolter (cf. <k>rebelo</k>, <k>revolucionero</k>); <k>revoltigar</k> to cause to revolt or rebel; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to stir up, rouse. Ex.: La populo revoltis kontre sua suvereno. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
La raciono revoltas kontre tala absurdeso.

<k>revolucionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to revolutionize, to change
thoroughly (opinions, an art, a country; (cf. <k>perturbar</k>, <k>subversar</k>); <k>revoluciono</k> <ex>(political, social, scientific)</ex>
revolution (cf. <k>revolto</k>, <k>rotaco</k>); <k>revolucionala</k>, <k>revolucionema</k>, <k>revolucionana</k>
revolutionary; <k>revolucionero</k>revolutionist; <k>revolucionano</k> member of
a r. party.

<k>revuar*</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to review, inspect, carefully
examine (troops, books, one’s life, etc.); <k>revuo</k>
review, inspection (of troops); review (magazine, book); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
survey, examination.

<k>revulsar*</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to allay a morbid condition
by counter-irritation or the like; <k>revulso</k> revulsion. Def.:
Lokale iritar por cesigar konjestioneso od inflameso existanta en
altra parto di la korpo.

<k>reza</k>, <k>reze</k> even, level (with); close to (a line, the
surface); <ex>(of hair, etc.) </ex>shorn; <ex>(of a destroyed city,
etc.)</ex> razed; <k>rezapila; rezahara</k> short-haired; <k>reza
 barbo</k> a close shaven beard; <k>reze dil bordo</k>up to the
brim, even with or close to the border; <k>reze dil sulo</k> close
to or on a level with the soil; <ex>(fig.)</ex> <k>reza tabulo</k>
a smoothed tablet, tablet without inscription, tabula rasa; <k>facar
 tabula reza</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to sweep away, reject all previous
notions; <k>rezigar</k> to cut (<k>ulo</k>) close to or even with
a surface; to raze, level (<k>ulo</k>) to the ground; <ex>(nav.)</ex>
to razee: cut down; to hug, keep close to (a coast); <k>rezigar
 hari</k> to cut the hair close; <k>rezigar domo</k> to raze a
house; <k>rezigar navo</k> to cut down a ship; <k>kuglo rezigis
 lua vizajo</k> a shot passed close to his face (cf. <k>frolar</k>);
<k>la navo rezigis la litoro</k> the ship hugged the coast.

<k>rezedo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> reseda: mignonette (Reseda
odorata); dyer’s weed (Reseda luteola); <k>rezedala</k>
resedaceous.

<k>rezervar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reserve, save, set apart, lay
by or up; <k>rezervema</k> <ex>(mental, moral)</ex> reserved; <k>rezervemeso</k>
<ex>(quality)</ex> reserve; <k>rezervajo</k> something reserved; stock,
store; <k>rezervano</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> reservist. Ex.: Rezervar
kelka pekunio por bezoni futura o neprevidebla. Rezervar ula
yuro. Rezervo-armeo. Facar mentala rezervo. Mieno rezervema.

<k>rezidar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to reside, dwell, live, abide
(cf. <k>habitar</k>, <k>lojar</k>); <k>rezid(ad)o</k> <ex>(act)</ex>
residence, residing; <k>rezideyo</k> residence: place of abode; <k>rezidanto</k>
resident. Ex.: Il rezidas en Paris che me. Establisar rezido en
ula loko. Ta domo esas lua rezideyo.

<k>rezidento*</k> resident: diplomatic agent; <k>rezidenteyo</k>
residency; <k>rezidenteso</k> dignity, function of a resident.

<k>reziduo</k> that which remains: <ex>(chem.) </ex>residium;
settlement (of liquids); <ex>(geol.)</ex> debris, detritus; <ex>(com.)</ex>
residue, arrear: that which remains (due); <ex>(arith.)</ex>
remainder; (cf. <k>restajo</k>); <k>reziduachi</k> scraps, odds and
ends.

<k>rezignar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to resign (<k>ulo</k>): to
be resigned, feel resignation (<k>pri</k>); <k>rezignanta</k>, <k>rezignema</k>
resigned. Ex.: Rezignar sua anmo a Deo. Me esas rezignanta (od,
rezignas) pri la perdo di mea yuri. Subisar exilo kun
rezignemeso. V. exp.: <k>Rezignar</k> esas aceptar volunte
desfeliceso, domajo, perdo, quan on «subisis» e generale ne
povis evitar. La <k>rezigno</k> esas pasiva, dum ke <k>l’abnego</k>
esas spontana. On rezignas pri la morto di ulu kara, pri la perdo
di sua havajo, pri maladeso neremediebla; IV-101; kp. II-135, <k>abnego</k>, <k>renuncar.</k>

<k>rezistar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to resist, withstand the shock of
something; to defend (oneself), strive against (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>);
to hold against, oppose; not to succumb to (fatigue, etc.); <k>rezist(ad)o</k>
resistance, opposition; <k>rezistanta</k>, <k>rezistema</k>, <k>rezistiva</k> resistant; <k>rezistivo</k>
<ex>(mechan., phys.)</ex> resistance; <k>rezistemeso</k> <ex>(tendency)</ex>
hindrance, opposition; <k>rezistiveso</k> resistivity, resisting
power. Ex. La kolda fero rezistas la martelagado. Rezistar shoko,
impreso. Rezisto al enemiko. Rezisto a tenteso. Mahagono esas
rezistanta ligno. Ant.: <k>cedar</k>, <k>sukombar.</k>

<k>rezolvar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to resolve: take or come to a
decision (to do something); <k>rezolvo</k>, <k>rezolvuro</k> resolution,
decision; <k>rezolvema</k> resolute; <k>rezolvemeso</k> <ex>(of
character)</ex> resoluteness, determination; <k>rezolvoze</k>
resolutely, stoutly. Ex.: Rezolvar parolar ad ulu. Rezolvar facar
ulo. Ne facez rezolvi dum la unesma ataki di vua iraco. Homo
rezolvema. V. exp.: vid. <k>decidar.</k>

<k>rezonar</k>, <k>rezonadar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to reason (<k>pri</k>); <k>rezonar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to appply one’s reason to (<k>ulo</k>), to
study (<k>ulo</k>); <k>rezon(ad)o</k> reasoning, ratiocination (cf. <k>raciono</k>);
<k>rezonanta</k> reasoning; <k>rezonanto</k>, <k>rezonero</k> reasoner, logician; <k>mis
 rezonar</k> to reason wrongly; <ex>(fig.)</ex> talk nonsense, rave,
wander in mind.

<k>rezultar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to result (from certain
premises, conditions); to follow (from); be the consequence (of);
<k>rezulto</k> result, effect, consequence; <k>rezultajo</k> <ex>(objective)</ex>
result; <k>rezultanto</k> <ex>(mechan.)</ex> resultant (force). Ex.: La
deskonkordo rezultis en civitanala milito. La rezulto esas
nekalkulebla. Ica (objekto) esas la rezultajo.

<k>rezumar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recapitulate, sum up, to
summarize; <k>rezumo</k> recapitulation, summary, resume; <k>rezume</k>
to sum up, upon the whole, in substance; <k>rezuma</k> summary,
compendious. Ex.: La peroraciono rezumas la tota diskurso. Rezumo
di la historio di Francia.

<k>ri</k> Note: many common verbal roots compounded with <k>ri</k>
(again, anew) are omitted.

<k>riabonar</k> to resubscribe (<k>jurnalo</k>); <k>riigar</k>
to renew the subscription of (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>riapertar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to re-open, open
again (a door, wound, theater (theatre), etc.).

<k>richa</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> rich (esp. in money, land,
goods); <k>richega</k> very rich, opulent; <k>rich(ulo)</k> a rich
person; <k>richeso</k> <ex>(condition)</ex> wealthy, richness; <k>richeteso</k>
in comfortable circumstances; <k>richajo</k> wealth (considered
objectively); <k>richigar</k> to enrich (<k>ulu</k>); <k>richeskar</k>
to become, grow rich. Ant.: <k>povra.</k>

<k>«rictus»</k> (wide) grin, grinning. Def.: Kontrakto
muskulala qua deskovras la denti e donas a la boko ridanta
aspekto.

<k>ridar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to laugh (<k>ye</k>); <k>ridetar</k>
to smile; <k>rideto</k> smile, short l.; <k>ridegar</k> to l. much;
<k>rideskar</k> to burst out laughing, commence to l.; <k>ridar
 kontrevole</k> to l. against one’s will; <k>ridinda</k>
laughable, comical, ridiculous; <k>ridind(ul)o</k> ridiculous
person; <k>ridindajo</k> a ridiculous thing; <k>ridema</k>, <k>ridiva</k>
tendency to l., giggly, risible; <k>ridindeso</k> ridiculousness;
<k>ridindigar</k> to ridicule, make (<k>ulu</k>) ridiculous; <k>ridachar</k>
to snigger, giggle; <k>ridachetar</k> to titter.

<k>ridebizar</k> to put (<k>su</k>, <k>ulu</k>) in debt again; <k>rieskar</k>
to run again into debt.

<k>ridelo</k> side pole, rack or board placed on a cart to help
hold the load; cart-rack.

<k>rifo</k> reef; ledge of rocks standing above the level of
the water. V. exp. vid. <k>brizanto.</k>

<k>rifaldar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to turn in or up, take in, make a
pleat, tuck; <k>riuro</k> pleat, tuck.

<k>rigida</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> rigid, stiff, not easily
bent, not pliant; <ex>(of persons) </ex>inflexible, unyielding; <k>rigideso</k>
stiffness, rigidity; <ex>(fig.)</ex> severity; <k>rigidigar</k> to
stiffen, render inflexible. Ex.: Fera stango esas rigida. Stacar
rigida. Koldeso rigidas la fingri. Il esas rigida homo. Ant.: <k>laxa</k>, <k>flexebla</k>, <k>mola.</k>

<k>rigoro</k> rigor; extreme exactness or strictness; <k>rigoroza</k>
rigorous, strict; strict (cf. <k>severa</k>); <k>rigoristo</k>
rigorist, a person rigid or exact to excess; <k>rigorismo</k>
rigorism, strictness, austerity; <k>rigoroza</k>, <k>segun rigoro</k>
rigorously, with rigour. Ex.: La rigoro di la legi, di la reguli.
Rigoroza judiciisto. Rigoroza demonstro.

<k>rikaptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recapture, retake, get hold of
again.

<k>ri</k>, <k>retrokomprar</k> to buy again, buy back; <k>rio</k>
repurchase; <k>riebla</k> repurchaseable, redeemable.

<k>rikonciliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reconcile (again), to
conciliate (anew), make friends again.

<k>rikonocar</k> to recognize, know again, indentify; <k>riebla</k>
recognizable. Ex.: Rikonocar ulu per lua traiti, lua voco.

<k>rikustumigar</k> to reaccustom (<k>ulu</k>); <k>rieskar</k>
to reaccustom, get used to again.

<k>rimo</k> rhyme: accord in sound of words (cf. <k>verso</k>);
<k>rimifar</k> to rhyme; <k>rimizar</k> to put (<k>ulo</k>) into
rhyme. Ex.: Ica du vorti ne rimifas.

<k>rimariajar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to marry again; <k>rio</k> a
second marriage. Ex.: Nepoleon rimariajas su kun Marie-Louise.<k />

<k>rimborsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reimburse, repay, refund (in
money). Ex.: Pagez por me, me rimborsos a vu.

<k>rimemorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to remember again, to recollect;
<k>rio</k> recollection, reminiscence; <k>riigar</k> to remind (<k>ulo
 da ulu</k>).<k />

<k>rimeno</k> <ex>(leather)</ex> strap, belt; <k>sen fina rimeno</k>
endless belt; <k>sub ventra rimeno</k> belly-band (as for horses); <k>tir
 rimeno</k> trace (of a harness); <k>ligo rimeno</k> tether, thong.
<k />

<k>rinaskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be born again; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
spring up again, to reappear; <k>rio</k> new birth, revival; <k>riigar</k>
to regenerate.

<k>rinforcar</k> <ex>(tr., milit.)</ex> to reinforce (a garrison,
etc.); <k>rinforco</k>, <k>rinforcuro</k> reinforcement.

<k>ringo</k> ring, circlet of metal or other substance; <ex>(tech.)</ex>
ferrule, bushing; <k>har ringo</k> ringlet (cf. <k>loklo</k>); <ex>(astron.)</ex>
ring; <k>ringa</k>, <k>ringatra</k>, <k>ringforma</k> ring (-shaped), annular; <k>ringoza</k>
having rings; <ex>(nat. hist.)</ex> annulated; <k>ringego</k> large
ring, hoop; <k>ringizar</k> to place a ring on (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>),
to hoop, ferrule, bush; <k>katen ringo</k> link; <k>ringfingro</k>
the third finger.
<k>rinovigar</k> to renew, make new again, renovate.
<k>rinoplastiko*</k> rhinoplasty, plastic surgery on the nose.

<k>rinsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rinse (a glass, clothes, etc.); <k>rinsaquo</k>
rinse-water.

<k>ripar</k> <ex>(tr., mechan., automobiles and other vehicles)</ex>
to skid: slide sideways (cf. <k>slipo</k>). V. exp.: <k>Ripar</k>
esas glitar skrapante, o kun forta friciono, qua impedas e fine
haltas la funciono di mashino (teknikal vorto): II-648.
<k>ripasar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to repass, pass by again.

<k>ri</k>, <k>retroportar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bring again, to bring
back.<k />

<k>risanigar</k> to cure, make well, heal, (<k>ulu</k>); <k>rieskar</k>
to get well; <k>riigebla</k> curable (of persons; cf. <k>remediebla</k>);
<k>riigiva</k> curative. V. exp.: On <k>risanigas</k> malado.
On <k>remedias</k> maladeso. On povas <k>kuracar</k> ulu sen
ri-san-igar lu.

<k>risidar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to take one’s seat again;
reseat; <k>riigar</k> to reseat (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>riskar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to risk, hazard, venture (cf. <k>aventurar</k>, <k>pariar</k>); <k>risko</k> risk, hazard; <k>riskajo</k> something
risked, a venture, stake; <k>riskoza</k> risky, hazardous; <k>riskema</k>
venturesome, adventurous, bold (person); <k>riskar pekunio</k> to
risk money; <k>riskar su</k> to risk, expose oneself to danger.
V.exp.: Ta qua <k>riskas</k> sua pekunio en hazardal ludo tote ne
<k>audacoza</k> il esas simple … dessajo; II-137.

<k>rismo</k> ream (of paper: Eng.: 480 sheets; foreign: 500
sheets).

<k>risolar</k> <ex>(intr.);</ex> <k>risoligar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
(cook.) to brown, to fry or roast brown.

<k>rispektiva</k> respective: belonging to each; <k>rispektive</k>
respectively. Ex.: La rispektiva yuri di du kunheredanti. Li iris
a sua rispektiva hemi. Konsiderar rispektive la avantaji e
des-avantaji di ulo.

<k>ristornar</k> <ex>(tr., com.)</ex> to cancel (an insurance
policy, esp. maritime); <k>ristorno</k> cancelling; partial refund (of
an insurance).

<k>ritornelo</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> ritornello. Def.: Ario quaze
preliminara qua anuncas ulo; IV-14.

<k>rituo</k> rite; <k>rituala</k> ritual: relating to rites; <k>rituaro</k>, <k>ritulibro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex> rites, ritual (-book); <k>ritualisto</k>
ritualist.

<k>rivo</k> shore, beach, strand; bank (of a river); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
skirt (of a wood); <k>rivnavigar</k> to coast; <k>rivana</k>, <k>rivo</k>, <k>habitanto</k> river- or coast-side (resident). V. exp.: vid. <k>plajo.</k>

<k>rivala</k>, <k>rivalo</k>, <k>rivalulo</k>, <k>rivalino</k> rival; <k>rivaleso</k> rivalry; <k>rivalesar</k>
to be a rival; to vie (<k>kun</k>) (cf. <k>konkursar</k>, <k>konkurencar</k>).

<k>rividar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to see again; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
meet (<k>ulu</k>) again; <k>til rio</k> until we meet again.

<k>rivivigar</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> to revive, reanimate,
resuscitate, bring (<k>ulu</k>) to life again (cf. <k>rinaskar</k>, <k>rifreshigar</k>, <k>rinovigar</k>); <k>rieskar</k> to become
revived, rise from the dead; <k>riigo</k>, <k>riesko</k> revivication.<k />

<k>ri</k>, <k>retrovokar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to call again, call back,
recall.

<k>riyunigar</k> to make (look) young, rejuvenate; <k>rieskar</k>
to grow young again, become restored to youth; <k>riigo</k>, <k>riesko</k>
rejuvenescence.

<k>robo</k> robe:<k />long, loose garment for man or woman; <k>robo
 dekoltita</k> low-necked, -cut gown; <k>chambro robo</k>dressing
gown, morning gown; <k>robo kun trenajo</k> gown with train.
<k>robro</k> rubber (of card games as in whist).

<k>robusta</k> robust, hardy, sturdy; <k>robusto</k>, <k>robustulo</k>, <k>robustino</k> a
robust person; <k>robusteso</k> robustness. Def.: Qua posedas
forteso, vigoro. Ant.: <k>febla</k>, <k>debila.</k>

<k>(de)rodar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gnaw, eat by bits; erode; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to champ <ex>(of horses)</ex>; (cf. <k>mordar</k>); <k>(deanta</k>, <k>(deema</k>
gnawing; <k>(deetar</k> to nibble; <k>(deero</k> <ex>(animal)</ex>
rodent. La hundo rodas osto. La puero rodis sua ungli.

<k>rodomonto</k> rodomont, blusterer, vain boaster, braggart; <k>rodomontoajo</k>
empty blustering, bravado, hectoring. Def.: Fanfaronemo pri
milital agi; falsa brav(ul)o; III-204.

<k>rogo</k> funeral pile, pyre: stack of wood for burning the
dead or a person at the stake. Def.: Lign-amaso por brular ulu od
ulo; III-206.

<k>rogacioni*</k> <ex>(R.C. rel.)</ex> public prayers and
processions held on rogation days.

<k>roko</k> a (large) rock, boulder (cf. <k>petro</k>, <k>stono</k>); <k>rokego</k>
a very large rock; <k>rokajo</k> rocky mass high, steep and rising
or jutting out to a point, as seen in the sea; rocky cliff, crag;
<k>rokoza</k>rocky: full of rocks; <k>rokatra kordio</k> a hard
stony heart. Def.: Granda amaso de petro. Ex.: On povas ruptar
roko e tale facar stoni. Ferma quale roko. Gibraltar esas
konstruktita sur rokajo. <k />

<k>rolo</k> <ex>(theat. and gen.)</ex> rôle: part, character,
impersonation; <k>plear rolo</k> to play a part; <k>roleto</k>
minor rôle.

<k>Romano</k> Roman citizen; <k>Romana balanco</k> Roman
balance, a steelyard; <k>la Romana lingui</k> the Romance
languages.

<k>romano</k> a novel, book of fiction; <k>romanisto</k>, <k>autoro</k>
novelist, romance writer; <k>romanala</k> relating to a novel; <k>romanatra</k>, <k>romanema</k> fanciful, romantic; <k>romanprotagonisto</k> hero of
romance; (cf. <k>novelo</k>).

<k>(la) Romancha (linguo)</k> Romansh (language). Def.: Linguo
romanala parolata en Graubünden: Suisa kantono maxim estala;
V-89.

<k>ronda</k> round, rotund; <k>rondo</k>, <k>rondajo</k> any round figure
or object (cf. <k>cirklo</k>, <k>disko</k>, <k>ringo</k>); <k>rondeta</k>, <k>atra</k>
roundish, rotund, round-like; <k>rondeso</k> roundness, rotundity; <k>rondigar</k>, <k>rondeskar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to make, become round; <k>rondirar</k>
<ex>(intr.)</ex> to go around, circulate; <k>rondiro</k> round,
circuit; <ex>(of a policeman, etc.)</ex> beat.

<k>rostar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to roast (meat); to toast
(bread); <k>rostajo</k>, <k>rostkarno</k> a roast; <k>rostopano</k> toast.

<k>rostro</k> <ex>(in gen.)</ex> any beak-like extension; <ex>(nat.
hist.)</ex> bill, beak <ex>(of an insect);</ex> trunk, proboscis <ex>(as
of an elephant); (bot)</ex> prolonged rigid process; <ex>(Roman
antiq.)</ex> beak of a ship; rostrum in a forum.

<k>roto</k> wheel; <k>rotaro</k> wheels <ex>(collect.)</ex>,
wheel-works, -movement; <k>rotosulko</k>rut;<k>quarrota
 veturo</k> four-wheeled vehicle; <k>rotonabo</k> hub, nave; <k>rotofelgo</k>
felloe, felly, rim; <k>rototormentar</k> to break (on a wheel); <k>rotatre
 marchar</k> to go heels over head; <k>roteskarto</k> (R.R.)
gauge: distance between the wheels. <k />

<k>rotacar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to rotate, revolve: turn on axis; <k>rotac(ad)o</k>
rotating, rotation; <k>rotaca</k>, <k>rotacala</k> rotary; <k>rotacokubo</k>
teetotum, spinning top. Ex.: La planeti rotacas cirkum sua axi;
li jiras cirkum la suno. Rotacado di roto. V. exp.: vid. <k>jirar.</k>

<k>rotolar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to rumble, roll (with noise).
Ex.: Veturo rotolas kande ol rulas alonge la strado. La rotolado
di tondro, di tamburo. V. exp.: L’ideo expresenda esas ta di
bruiso produktata per frapi rapide sucedanta; V-493.

<k>rovo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> bramble, brier, thorn-bush; <k>roveyo</k>
brake, brier-patch; <k>rovbero</k> a brier berry; blackberry.

<k>royalismo</k> royalism: attachment to the cause of royalty;
<k>royalista</k>, <k>royalo</k> royalist.

<k>rozo</k> rose; <k>rozoza</k> full of roses; <k>rozatrajo</k>
rosette; <k>roziero</k> r. bush; <k>roziereyo</k> r. garden; <k>rozea</k>
r. colo(u)red; <k>rozkoloro</k> r. colo(u)r; <k>rozaquo</k> r.
water; <k>rozbuketo</k> bouquet of r.s; <k>rozburjono</k> r. bud; <k>rozfenestro</k>
<ex>(arch.)</ex> r. window; <k>rozligno</k> rosewood; <k>rozmielo</k>
honey of r.s; <k>vento rozo</k> (mariner’s) compass-card.

<k>rozeolo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> roseola, a rose colo(u)red rash;
scarlet rash, rose rash; (cf. <k>morbilo</k>).

<k>rubando</k> ribbon; tape; <k>rubandizar</k> to trim with
ribbons.

<k>rubriko</k> rubric. V. exp.: <k>Rubriko</k> esas <ex>generala</ex>
titulo. Ex. en <ex>Progreso</ex> esas: la <ex>Lingual questioni,
Kroniko, Bibliografio, Diversaji,</ex> sub qui singla artiklo
havas sua <ex>titulo;</ex> VII-412.

<k>ruda</k> rude, <ex>(of things)</ex> rough, unformed by art; <ex>(of
persons)</ex> rough, uncultured, uneducated; <ex>(of manners)</ex>
coarse, unpolished; <k>rudeso</k> roughness, rudeness; <k>traktar
 rude</k> to use roughly, harshly, to ill-treat.

<k>rudimenta</k> rudiment-al, -ary: little developed; <k>rudimento</k>
rudiment, element. Ex.: Rudimenta organo. Rudimenti di gramatiko.
La rudimenti di planti.

<k>rufa</k>russet, sandy, reddish-brown, -yellow;
ginger-colo(u)red; <k>ruf(ul)o</k>red-haired, sandy-haired
person; <k>rufeso</k> russet-colo(u)r; <k>rufatra</k> reddish,
russet; <k>rufigar</k>, <k>rufeskar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to make, become
russet-colo(u)red, brown. Ex.: La tro varma glatigilo povas
rufigar la linjo.

<k>rugo</k> wrinkle (on the face); ripple (on the water); <k>rugoza</k>
wrinkled, full of wrinkles; corrugated; <ex>(bot.)</ex> rugose; <k>rugizar</k>
to wrinkle; <k>rugizeskar</k> to be wrinkled; <k>rugozeskar</k>
to become wrinkled. ?FIS

<k>ruinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ruin; <k>ruino</k>, <k>ruineso</k>, <k>ruinajo</k> <ex>(act,
state, object)</ex> ruination; a ruin; <k>ruinanta</k>, <k>ruiniva</k> falling
to ruin; ruinous; <k>par ruinar</k> to ruin completely. Ex.:
Ruinar ulu, viti. Esar ruinita da ludo-pasiono. Ruino di la
stato, di lua bona reputo. La domo falis en ruineso, e tale esis
ruinajo. <k />

<k>rular</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to roll (by turning over, as a
wheel, also from side to side, as a ship), roll along, wheel
along; <k>rular su</k> to roll one’s body, wallow, welter; <k>rulachar
 su</k> to sprawl; <k>rulaplastar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to crush
with a roller; <k>rulfalar</k> to tumble, topple down; <k>rulilo</k>, <k>rulbloko</k> <ex>(instr.)</ex> roller; <k>rulkurteno</k> roller
blind; <k>rulsketar</k> to skate (on rollers). Ex.: Rular bulo,
roko, okuli. La lakrimi rulis adinfre sur la vangi. La ondi di la
rivero rulas vers la maro.

<k>ruminar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to ruminate: chew over again,
chew the cud (cf. <k>meditar</k>); <k>ruminanto</k>, <k>ruminero</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex>
ruminant.

<k>runo</k>, <k>runi</k> rune(s), Runic character(s) or letter(s); <k>runala</k>
Runic.

<k>ruptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to break (asunder, up, open, by
violence, or stress), to snap, rupture, shatter; <k>rupto</k>, <k>rupturo</k>
break(ing), rupture, fracture; <k>ruptajo</k> what is broken; <k>ruptebla</k>
breakable (cf. <k>frajila</k>); <k>ruptesar</k> to be broken; <k>ruptopeco</k>
piece broken off, fragment.

<k>ruro</k> country; rural district as opp. to town; <k>rurala</k>rural;
<k>rurana</k>, <k>rurano</k> peasant, rustic, country person (not in a
depreciatory sense); <k>rurdomo</k> country house.

<k>rusto</k> <ex>(of metals)</ex> rust; <k>rustoza</k>, <k>rustizita</k>
rusted; blighted; <k>rustizar</k>, <k>rustigar</k> to rust (metals); <k>rustozeso</k>, <k>rustizeso</k>, <k>rustozajo</k> rustiness.

<k>rutino</k> routine, rote, habit; <k>rutinacho</k> red-tape,
rut; <k>rutine</k> by routine; <k>rutinema</k>, <k>rutinemo</k> (one) who acts by
routine; red-tapist. Def.: Kustumo sequata sen judiko; kustumal
ago facita sen reflektar.

<k>zelar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to be zealous; <k>zelo</k> zeal; <k>zelanta</k>, <k>zeloza</k> zealous, 
sedulous; <k>zelanto</k>, <k>zelozo</k> zealot; <k>ne zeloza</k> lukewarm.

<k>zero</k> (<ex>temperature</ex>) zero; (<ex>arith.</ex>) cipher, nought; <k>super</k>, <k>sub zero</k> 
above, below z.
<k>zesto</k> the woody skin quartering the kernel of a walnut.
<k>zezear</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to lisp. Def.: Pronunciar <ex>j</ex> quale <ex>z</ex> e <ex>sh</ex> quale <ex>s</ex>; IV-647.
<k>zinko</k> zinc; <k>zinka</k> (made of) z.; <k>zinklaboristo</k> z. worker; <k>zinkizar</k> to cover with z.

<k>zono</k> (<ex>geog., geom.</ex>) zone; (<ex>for body</ex>) girdle, belt, sash, waist-band (cf. 
<k>tayo</k>); <k>zonizar</k> to girdle, girt; inclose in a z.; -o torida: torrid z.; 
<k>zono militala</k> military z.; <k>zonokateno</k> chatelaine; <k>espado zono</k> sword-belt; 
<k>kordo zonizis lumbo</k> (od, <k>tayo</k>): his loins were girt with a cord.
<k>zumar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to buzz (as flying insects), to drone: make a humming or buzzing noise.

<k>ebeno</k>, <k>ebenligno</k> ebony; <k>ebeniero</k>, <k>ebenarboro</k> e. tree; <k>ebenisto</k>
a worker in ebony: <ex>(fig.)</ex> an inlayer (of wood), cabinet
maker (vid.: V. exp. <k>karpentisto</k>).

<k>ebria</k>, <k>ebriega</k>, <k>ebriema</k>, <k>ebrieta</k> drunken, intoxicated; <k>ebrieso</k>, <k>ebriemeso</k> inebrity, drunkenness, intoxication; <k>ebriigar</k>
to intoxicate; <k>par ebriigar</k> to make dead drunk.

<k>ebuliar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to form bubbles, to bubble up or
froth (as water from a spring, blood from a vein; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to be boiling from anger or passion); (cf. <k>efervecar</k>, <k>boliar</k>);
<k>ebulio</k>, <k>ebulieso</k> bubbling, ebulition.

<k>ecelar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to excel; be excellent, be
eminent, be superior (<k>en</k>, <k>pri</k>). Ex.: Ca homulo ecelas en
omno quon il entraprezas. Ecelar pri natado; ecelanta libro,
homo. Ecelo di frukto.

<k>ecelenco</k> <ex>(title)</ex> excellency. Ex.: Lua ecelenco,
la ambasadisto di …

<k>eceptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to except; leave out, exempt,
exclude; <k>ecept(ad)o</k>, <k>eceptajo</k> (act, object) exception; <k>ecepte</k>
save, unless, except; <k>ecepte ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> except (that),
with the exception that; <k>ecepta</k>, <k>eceptala</k> exceptional; <k>eceptale</k>
by way of exception. Def.: Ne inkluzar en, exkluzar de ula
nombro. Ex.: Eceptar ula kondamniti de amnestio. Existas nula
regulo sen eceptajo. Ecepte ica personi, omni iros. Me ne
permisos ke vu iros, ecepte ke vu pagos la domaji.

<k>ecesar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to exceed; go beyond the
proper limits; be guilty of excesses (in eating, drinking, etc.);
<k>eceso</k>, <k>ecesajo</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> difference by which one number
exceeds another; transgression of due limits; abuse, waste; <k>ecesanta</k>, <k>ecesiva</k> excessive; <ex>(fig.)</ex> exorbitant; <k>ecese</k> to
excess, immoderately. Ex.: La debajo ecesas mil franki. Mea
spensi ne ecesas mea recevaji. Ecesar pri manjado. Eceso en
laborado. Koldeso ecesanta. Ecesanta superbeso. Preco ecesiva.
DEFIS

<k>ecitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to excite: arouse, impel, incite,
urge, provoke, prompt. Ex.: Ecitar ulu laborar, revoltar. Ecitar
l'iraco, la jaluzeso. La novaji efektigas granda eciteso. Ecito
di la nervi. Vivo ecitanta. Ecitiva medikamento. Ecitema homo.

<k>edifico</k> edifice; large building. Def.: Expresas ulo plu
general kam domo, kastelo; palaco; edifico esas quaze meza inter
ta tri vorti; III-200.

<k>edifikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to edify: instruct, improve
morally. Ex.: Edifikar ulu per prediko, per exemplo. Konduto,
paroli edifik-anta, -ema, -iva.

<k>ediktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to enact: to order (by an edict);
(cf. <k>dekretar</k>). Ex.: Draco(n) ediktis punisala legi di
senkompata severeso.

<k>editar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to publish (a book, a paper) (not E.
«edit» cf. <k>redaktar</k>): <k>edit(ad)o</k> publishing; <k>edituro</k>, <k>editajo</k> edition, publication; <k>editanto</k>, <k>editero</k>, <k>editisto</k>
publisher. Def.: Imprimar (libro, jurnalo, e.c. por vendar);
imprimar la texto di ula autoro; V-405.

<k>edro</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> face, outer surface of, superfice;
outer configuration of a regularly crystalizing mineral, as a
dodecahedron.

<k>edukar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to educate (children, people); to
develop and cultivate the physical, intellectual and moral
faculties; to form the manners of; to rear, raise, breed (cattle
and other animals); to train, rear (plants); <k>il esas yunulo
 male edukita</k> he is an ill-bred young man. V. exp.: La general
ideo kovrata da "edukar" esas multe plu larja kam la
intelektala edukado (di homi, infanti), qua koincidas preske kun
l'instruktado; (kp. VI-383, anke <k>dresar</k>).

<k>efacar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to efface: erase, rub
out, expunge; <k>efacesar</k> to be effaced, obliterated. (cf. <k>obliterar</k>),
<k>efacilo</k> eraser. rubber. Ex.: Efacar la skriburo qua esas sur
tabelo. Esas neposibla efacar la impreso de mea mento.

<k>efekto</k> effect; <k>efektigar</k> to effect, effectuate,
produce, bring about, cause; (cf. <k>produktar</k>, <k>enduktar</k>, <k>efikar</k>);
<k>efektigo</k> effecting, execution, action, causation. Ant.: <k>kauzo</k>, <k>motivo.</k>

<k>efektivo</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> effective force, strength.
Def.: Vorto militala por expresar la fakte existanta nombro di la
trupi de homi, kavali, kanoni e vehili; V-420.

<k>efemera</k> ephemeral, short-lived; <k>efemero</k>, <k>efemera insekto</k> <ex>(ent.)</ex>
ephemerid, dayfly. Ex.: Efemera floro, febro, feliceso.

<k>efervecar</k> <ex>(intr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to effervesce, be
effervescent. Def.: Ebuliado di gaso tra liquido; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
emocar vivace, ma nedurante (ex. la eferveco dil pasioni).

<k>efikar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be efficient, be effectual, be
efficacious; <k>efikeskar</k> to come into play, begin to take
effect; <k>efiko</k> efficacy (action); <k>efikanta</k>, <k>efikema</k>, <k>efikiva</k>
efficient, efficacious, effectual, effective; <k>efikiveso</k>, <k>efikemeso</k> efficiency; <k>ne efikanta</k>, <k>efikiva; sen efika</k>
inefficient. Ex.: La moyeni efikas por la skopo. Efikiva remedio,
kauzo.

<k>eflorecar</k> <ex>(intr., chem.)</ex> to effloresce; (cf. <k>florifar</k>);
<ex>(med.)</ex> to come out in a rash, break out in pimples. Def.:
Indikas fenomeno kemiala (formaco di kristali ye surfaco di
solido o liquido), e fenomeno fiziologiala (mikra influro di la
pelo); III-74.

<k>egala</k> equal; <k>egalesar</k> to be equal to (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>);
<k>egaligar</k> to equalize (<k>ulo ad ulo</k>); <k>egal(ul)o</k> an
equal; <k>egaleso</k> equality; <k>egalesala</k>, <k>egalema</k> seeking or
fond of equality, levelling: <k>ne egala</k> unequal; Ex.: Egala
pezaji, korpi, yuri. Egalesar ulu en merito. La morto egaligas
omni. Egaleso di preco, di evo, di forteso.

<k>egarar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to mislay: lose for the moment; <k>egaresar</k>
to be mislaid, missing. V. exp.: One ofte <k>egaras</k> kozi sen <k>perdar</k>
oli. «Me <k>mispozis</k> mea plumiero sur la tablo; ol falis en
la paperkorbo, e tale <k>egaresis</k>: ma ol ne esis <k>perdita</k>».

<k>egardar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pay regard to, take (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>)
into account; <k>egardo</k> regard, consideration, respect; <k>egarde</k>
regard being had to; <k>egarde sua yuneso</k> in consideration
of his youth. Ex.: L'autoro di ta pikturo ne egardis la neceseso
di la perspektivo. Bona judiciisto judicias sen egardo ad la
persono, il nur egardas lo bona di la stato.

<k>ego</k> ego; the self; «das Ich»; <k>egismo</k> egoism; <k>egisto</k>
egotist; <k>egista</k> egoistic; selfish; <k>mea altra ego</k>
my other self; <k>mea propra ego</k> my own self.

<k>egorjar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut the throat of (<k>ulu</k>).
Def.: Ocidar per kultel-frapo en la kolo (fauco); III-698.

<k>ejektar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to eject, cast out, expel,
discharge, void.

<k>ek</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> (general sense) out; <ex>(indicating
motion)</ex> <k>adportez stulo ek ta chambro</k> bring a chair
out of that room; <k>lu prenis ca folio ek la tirkesto</k> he
took this leaf from the drawer (N.B. not to be confounded with <k>de</k>
where point of departure is to be indicated: <k>letro de Boston</k>, <k />
letter from Boston); <ex>(indicating the material a thing is made
of, extracted from)</ex> <k>vazo ek oro</k> a gold vase; <k>ek
 quo esas ta tasi? li esas ek porcelano</k> what are the cups
made of? they are made of china; <ex>(indicating fractional parts)</ex>
<k>nonadek ek cent</k> 90 out of 100 (90%); <k>en ca armeo</k>, <k>5 ek
 100 esas ocidita</k>, <k>10 ek 100 vundita</k> in this army, five out
of (every) 100 were killed, and ten per cent were wounded.

<k>eko</k> echo; <k>ekigar</k> to echo. Ex.: La vakua chambri
ekigis nia pedopazi. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Kelki ekigas stultaji di
altri.

<k>ekidno</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> echidna (genus: Echidna, sp.
Hystrix). Def.: Australiana mamifero sendenta, qui ovifas, nutras
su per insekti; V-484.

<k>ekirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go out, get out, walk out; <k>ekigar</k>
to make (<k>ulu</k>) go out from; to remove (<k>ulu</k>) from one
place to another.

<k>eklampsio</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> eclampsia. Def.: Specala
konvulso dum infanteso, uremio o parturo-stando; VI-480.

<k>ekmodigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cause to go out of fashion; <k>ekeskar</k>
to become out of fashion; <k>eka</k> old-fashioned.

<k>ekonomio</k> economy; pecuniary management, administration;
(not saving, cf. <k>sparo</k>). Def.: La administrado financala
di domo, societo o stato; metafore on parolas pri l'ekonomio di
organismo, konsiderante lua gani (nutrado) e spensi (perdi di
materio e di energio); VII-399. Ex.: On parolas pri ekonomio
hemala (menajala), urbala, rurala, nacionala.

<k>ekonomiko*</k> economics (science of); <k>ekonomikala</k> economic
(theory); <k>ekonomikisto</k> (political) economist; <k>nacionala ekonomiko</k>
political economy. Def.: La cienco o teorio dil ekonomio. La
ciencisti qui okupas su pri la teorio nomesas
"ekonomisti"; VII-398.

<k>ekpulsar</k> to expel, thrust out, turn out; <k>ekala</k>, <k>ekanta</k> expulsive, expelling; <k>ekar de la patrio</k> to
expatriate; (cf. <k>expirar</k>)
<k>ekreligar</k> to derail; <k>ekirar</k> to go off the track
<k>ekterigar</k> to exhume, dig out, disinter, unearth
<k>ektranchar</k> to cut off, amputate, cut off, excise (cf. <k>amputar</k>)
<k>ekvarsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to empty out, pour off, spill.

<k>el(u)</k> she, her; <k>el(u)i</k> they <ex>(fem.)</ex>; <k>el(u)ua</k>
<ex>(sing.)</ex> her(s); <k>el(u)ia</k> <ex>(pl.)</ex> their <ex>(fem.)</ex>;
<k>pro quo vu prenas elua libri?</k> why do you take her books? <k>lektez
 la vui e lasez la elui</k> read your own and let hers alone; <k>il
 ritrovis elua libri</k> he (re-)found her books; <k>prenez elia
 manteli kun la vii</k> take their coats with your own.

<k>elastika</k> elastic, springy, rebounding; <k>elastikeso</k>
elasticity; <k>elastiko</k>, <k>elastikajo</k> an elastic object.

<k>eleganta</k> elegant; fashionable (cf. <k>segunmoda</k>); <k>elegant(ul)o</k>
person of fashion or elegance; <k>elegant(eg)ajo</k> exquisite object;
<k>eleganta mondumo</k> the fashionable world.

<k>elektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to elect (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ek</k>, <k>inter</k>); <k>elekt(ad)o</k>
election, polling; <k>elektiva</k> elective; <k>elektanto</k>, <k>elektero</k>
elector, constituent; <k>elektala</k>, <k>elekterala</k> electoral; <k>elekteraro</k>
electorate; <k>elektito</k> person elected; <k>elektoyuro</k> right to
or of election.

<k>elektro</k> electricity; <k>elektrala</k>, <k>elektroza</k> electric; <k>elektrizar</k>
to electrify; <k>elektristo</k> electrician; <k>elektrala baterio</k> e.
battery; <k>elektrala klosh(et)o</k> e. bell; <k>mortigar (ulu) per
 elektroskoko</k> (od, <k>elektromortigar</k>): to electrocute;
<k>elektrolumo</k> e. light; <k>elektromagnetala</k> e.magnetic.

<k>elevar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to elevate, raise on high; (<k>not</k>
to make higher in dimension; cf. <k>plualtigar</k>); <k>elev(ad)o</k>
elevation (act; cf. <k>altajo; elevaciono</k>); <k>elevanta</k> <ex>(phys.
sense)</ex> elevating; <k>elevilo</k> elevator. V. exp.: <k>Elevar</k>
adjuntas a <k>levar</k> ideo di alteso, di supera nivelo. On
levas de tero (til su) ulo falinta; on elevas aquo, stoni a la
supro di domo konstruktata; II-648. EFIRS

<k>elevaciono</k> <ex>(design)</ex> elevation, raised-plan,
side-view. Def.: Desegno di l'extera formi di ula korpo vidata en
horizontal direciono; III-81.

<k>eliminar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to eliminate. Ex.: Eliminar nomo
de la listo di kandidati. Eliminar toxikaji de la korpo. Eliminar
de equaciono.

<k>elito</k> <ex>(milit. and fig.)</ex> the elite (of any army);
choice troops, best men, flower (of army); (cf. <k>eminentaro</k>).

<k>Elizeo*</k> <ex>(myth. and fig.)</ex> Elysium; <k>Elizeala agri</k>
Elysian fields.

<k>eloquenta</k> eloquent; <ex>(fig.)</ex> which produces the
same effect as an eloquent speech. Ex.: Eloquenta parolanto,
stilo. Lakrimi, silenco eloquenta.

<k>eludar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to elude, evade; <k>eludema</k>, <k>eludiva</k>
elusive, evasive. Def.: Evitar habile, rapide, ruzoze: III-324.
Ex.: On eludas la frapo di espado; on eludas vizito, invito,
obligo, tasko, questiono. Eludema respondo.

<k>emanar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to emanate (<k>de</k>, <k>ek</k>). Ex.:
Lumo emanas de la suno. Odori esas emani.

<k>emancipar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to emancipate (<k>ulu</k>, <k>de</k>).
Ex. Emancipar sklavo, populo, <ex>(fig.)</ex> emancipar la mento.

<k>embarasar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to embarrass; to obstruct, clog
up; to encumber, hamper, hinder; <ex>(in gen.)</ex> to hinder
movement (physical, mental); <k>ca veturi embarasas la voyo</k>these
vehicles block up the street; <k>mea mantelo embarasas me</k>my
cloak encumbers me; <k>mea aferi esas en embarasita stando</k>my
affairs (business) are in an embarrassed state; <k>questiono
 embarasanta</k>embarrassing question; <k>bagajo embarasanta</k>cumbersome
baggage; (kp. <k>intrikar</k>).

<k>embargar</k> <ex>(tr., naut. and fig.)</ex> to embargo, lay an
e. on: prohibit to leave port; <ex>(jur.)</ex> to distrain, to levy
a distress or execution, to garnishee or attack (for debt); <k>pago
 embargo</k> lien. Def.: Embargo: (1) interdikto a stranjera navo
en-irar od ek-irar portuo; (2) legal sequestro di mobli od imobli
di debanto por garantiar pago di debo; (3) pag-embargo: legal
sequestro, di
un kreditanto A., di sumo debata da un debanto B., ad altra
persono C. por pagar debo di C. ad A.; II-75.

<k>embarkar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to embark: go or put on
board (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>en</k>); Def.: Enirar navo; pozar en navo;
II-75.

<k>emblemo</k> emblem. Ex.: La hanulo esas emblemo (E. symbol)
di vigilemeso. Emblemi di rejeso.

<k>embotar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to cold-roll, to stamp, bend
or beat out (sheet metal); <k>embotar kasrolo ek kupro</k> to
cold-roll or beat out a copper saucepan. Def.: Kurvigar duktila
metali, en kolda stando, por konvexigar un latero e konkavigar
l'altra.

<k>embracar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to embrace, clasp, hug (in arms);
to bracket; <k>embracilo</k> <ex>(typog.)</ex> brace ( { } )

<k>embragar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., tech.)</ex> to clutch, put in
gear; establish contact between the motive power and that which
starts the movement. Def.: Solidigar (en un instanto, e por irga
duro) du axi per diversa mediata instrumenti ed organi; III-87.
Ex.: Rimen-transmiso "embragas", kande on igas la
rimeno pasar de libera pulio sur fixa pulio sam-axa e
sam-periferia; (kp. <k>ingranar</k>, <k>kuplar</k>).

<k>embrokar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to embrocate; rub with a
lotion.

<k>embuskar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ambush; lie in concealment for;
<k>embuskar su</k> to hide oneself; <k>embusko</k>, <k>embuskeyo</k> ambuscade.

<k>emendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to emend (a fault), rectify, free
from error; <ex>(leg.)</ex> to amend (a law). V. exp.: On <k>plubonigas</k>o <k>korektigas</k>kozo, verko, ma ne defekto; on ne povas
igar defekto "bona" o korekta, on simple supresas ol.
Konseque on devas dicar: <k>emendar</k>defekto. On <k>korektigas</k>la kozo, <k>emendante</k>lua defekti; V-282.

<k>emersar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to emerge (from a liquid); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to rise into view. Ant.: <k>imersar</k>, <k>submersar.</k>

<k>eminenco</k> <ex>(title)</ex> Eminence. Ex.: Lua eminenco, la
kardinalo.

<k>eminenta</k> <ex>(quality)</ex> eminent, superior; <ex>(of
place)</ex> conspicuous; (cf. <k>remarkinda</k>); <k>eminent(ul)o</k>
e. person, notability; <k>eminenteso</k> eminence: superiority,
excellence (cf. <k>ecelo</k>, <k>altajo</k>); <k>eminentaro</k> the elite,
pick of a group; <k>eminentega</k> most e. Ex.: Eminenta homulo,
ofico, rango. Vertuo, servo eminenta.

<k>emisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to emit: send forth, give out; <ex>(finan.)</ex>
to issue (for circulation). Ex.: La kalor-radii quin la suno
emisas. Emiso di monet-papero.

<k>emocar</k>, <k>emoceskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel emotion, be
agitated, moved; <k>emocigar</k> to cause e. to. Ex.: El parolis
tote sen emoco. Lua aspekto emocigis me. Quik kande me vidis il,
me emocis.
<k>emperialo</k> top, roof, outside (of a coach with seats).

<k>empireo</k> empyrean. Def.: Maxim alta cielo di antiqua
mitologio e kosmologio; <ex>(poet.)</ex> la cielo.

<k>employar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to employ (<k>ulu</k>); (cf. <k>uzar</k>);
<k>employato</k> employee, <k>employanto</k>, <k>employero</k>, <k>employisto</k> employer; <k>employokontoro</k>
employment-office. Def.: Expresas la relato di patrono a
salariato; III-468.

<k>emula</k> emulous. Def.: Qua penas egalesar od superesar la
ceteri en laudinda kozi o loyala konkurso; III-468. Ex.: On
kurajigas la emuleso inter la lernanti.

<k>emundar</k> <ex>(tr., hort.)</ex> to lop, prune, trim; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to remove anything useless, noxious or inferior. Def.:
Branchotaliar; <ex>(vulgarasenco)</ex> netigar, beligar o preparar
kozo per depreno di omna parti o peci neutila, nebona o nebela;
(IV-106). Ex.: Emundar arboro. Emundar legumi, salado, ucelo,
fisho (por koquar oli). Metafore, on emundas kalkulo, la konduto
di ulu, verko literatural od artal, e.c.

<k>en</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> in, of time and place; when really
necessary to indicate motion into a place (into) <k>ad</k> should
be prefixed: <k>la ucelo flugis aden la kajo</k> the bird flew
into the cage. (<k>En la kajo</k> may mean that the bird was
flying about the cage); <k>en la vintro</k> in the winter; <k>en
 la urbo</k> in the city: <k>il venis aden la laboratorio</k>
he came into the laboratory.
<k>enabismigar</k> to cast into the abyss, swallow up, ingulf.
<k>enanguligar</k> to drive or put into a corner.

<k>enbekigar</k> to put <k>(ulo)</k> into the beak of; to feed
(a bird).
<k>enbursigar</k> to put into one's purse, to pocket (money).
<k>enceluligar</k> to put into a cell, into cells.

<k>enciklika</k> encyclical: circular; <k>encikliko</k> e. letter:
papal letter.

<k>enduktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lead <k>(ulu)</k> into <k>(ulo)</k>,
to introduce; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to involve (in a plot, etc.).

<k>enemik(ul)o</k> an enemy, foe; <k>enemik(ul)ala</k> hostile,
inimical; <k>enemik(ul)alajo</k>: hostile act or object; <k>enemik(ul)eso</k>
enmity, hostility; <k>enemik(ul)igar</k> to render hostile; Def.: Persono
qua havas des-amikala sentimento. Ant.: <k>amiko.</k>
<k>energetiko</k> energetics : theory or science of energy.
<k>enfangigar</k> to bemire, to sink <k>(ulo)</k> in the mud.

<k>enfluar</k> <ex>(tr. intr.)</ex> to flow in; <k>eneyo</k>
place of inflow; <k>enanto</k> affluent, tributary (stream).
<k>enfornigar</k> to put into an oven or a kiln.

<k>engajar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to engage: to hire <k>(ulu)</k>; <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to enlist <k>(ulu</k>, <k>su)</k>.

<k>enirar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to enter, come in; <k>eno</k>
entering, entree; <k>eneyo</k> entrance, <k>enigar</k> to cause
to enter.

<k>enkasigar</k> to collect or put away (money, etc. in a
treasury).
<k>enkofrigar</k> to put <k>(ulo)</k> in a coffer, trunk.

<k>enkorpigar</k> to incorporate: mix into one substance or
mass <ex>(also fig.)</ex> Ex.: Enkorpigar oro e arjento.
Enkorpigar legi en kodexo. Enkorpigar teritorio stranjera.
Enkorpigo di komercal societo.

<k>enlitigar</k> to confine <k>(ulu)</k> to bed; <k>enar su</k>
to take to one's bed.

<k>enluminar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to illuminate (a book); <ex>(cf.
ascendar, lum-izar, iluminar)</ex>; to color (an engraving, map).

<k>enorma</k> enormous. Def. grandega, grosega, kolos(atr)a,
monstr(atr)a.

<k>enoyar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel dull, be bored, be weary
(because of inaction or monotony); <k>enoyiganta</k>, <k>enoyiva</k>: boring,
irksome; <k>enoyigar</k>: to bore <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>me enoyas pro la
 manko di amuzo</k> I am dull for lack of amusement; <k>la
 monotoneso enoyigas me</k> the monotony wearies me; <k>la longa
 vartado esas enoyiganta</k> the long wait is wearisome; (cf. <k>tedar</k>, <k>iritar</k>).
<k>enpakigar</k> to pack up, make into a bundle.

<k>ensemblo</k> the whole, ensemble; all parts taken together;
general effect, collectivity, aggregate, totality; (cf. <k>kune</k>,
<k>entote</k>); <k>omna parti kune efektigas bela ensemblo</k>
all parts taken together produce a fine general effect; <k>kantar
 ensemble</k> to sing all together, <k>ensembla movi</k> mass
movements.

<k>entaliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut into (so as to produce a
certain form); <ex>(carp.)</ex> <k>enartrabo</k> to mortise a
beam. Ex.: On entalias roko, tero por facar trancheo, tunelo,
min-truo, e.c.; (IV-102).

<k>entamar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut the first piece of, make a
first cut, incision; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to encroach upon, begin
upon, open up. Def.: Facar l'unesma trancho, l'unesma frapo,
brecho, nocho, e figurale komencar; iniciar od inaugurar ulo;
IV-102. Ex.: Entamar pano, botelo, pasteto, poto de konfituri;
frapo (stroko di kultelo, o spado). Entamar (E. incise, cut) la
pelo, la muskuli, la osto. Prodigemo entamas sua kapitalo.

<k>enternar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to intern: confine in a place or
country.
<k>entote</k> on the whole, in all, altogether.

<k>entraprezar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to undertake, engage to
perform, take in hand, contract for; (cf. <k>asumar</k>); <k>entraprez(ad)o</k>
undertaking (act); <k>entraprezajo</k> what is u.; the enterprise,
contract; <k>entraprezisto</k> contractor, undertaker, masterbuilder; <k>entraprezema</k>
enterprising. Ex.: Columbus entraprezis la deskovro di la
kontinento ocidental. Entraprezar voyajo, konquesto. Me
entraprezis la feliceso di mil homi desfortunoza: (E. I undertook
to make a thousand unfortunate beings happy.) Ta firmo entrapezis
la furniso di liti ad la armeo. La entraprezo di la kanalo di
Suez esis laboro kolosala. Homulo entraprezema.

<k>entratenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to support, keep (with the needs
of life) <k>(ulu); entrateno</k> maintenance, livelihood.

<k>entravar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to shackle, fetter, trammel (a
horse); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to clog, impede, embarrass. Def.: Impedar o
jenar la marcho di animalo per irga moyeno; III-468.

<k>entreo</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> entrée, side-dish. Def.: Disho
qua venas pos la fisho ed ante la rostajo; V-621.

<k>entremeso</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> entremets, side dish. Def.:
Disho inter la repasto propre dicita e la desero; V-621.
<k>entrenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to train (horses for racing); <k>entrenero</k>, <k>entrenisto</k> horsetrainer, pacemaker.

<k>entuziasmar</k>, <k>entuziasmeskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be, become
enthusiastic<k>(por</k>, <k>pri); entuziasmigar</k> to enthuse <k>(ulu)</k>.
V.exp.: On<k>entuziasmas</k> pri granda ideo o pri bela verko,
quan on admiras; <k>entuziasmo</k> implikas nula specala
kapableso, quankam ol incitas ad agado. On esas <k>inspirata</k>
(tacite e metafore: da la dei, la Muzi, e.c.) kande on trovas
bona idei ed expresi, en literatural od artal kompozado. On havas
<k>vervo</k>, <k /> kande on parolas kun facileso, inventemeso ed
agreabla vivaceso; II-648.

<k>enumerar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to enumerate; reckon up singly,
count or tell off.

<k>enuncar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to enunciate: express by speech or
by writing: <k>enuncuro</k>, <k>enuncajo</k> enunciation, statement. Ex.:
Enuncar sua idei, opinioni, problemo.

<k>envelopar</k> <ex>(tr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to envelop; cover
up <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>su); envelopilo</k> covering, wrap, casing (not of
letter-envelope; cf. <k>kuverto</k>). V. exp.: <k>Envelopar</k>
signifikas nur: tegar omna parti di l’objekto, enklozar ol
en tegilo. <k>Envolvar</k> implikas la ideo di <k>volvar</k>, <k /> qua
ipsa implikas ideo analoga a <k>rular</k> <k>volvar</k> esas
pozar ula objekto sur altra, turnante ol cirkum ica; <k>envolvar</k>
esas envelopar la duesma per l’unesma, volvante; III-221.
DEFI

<k>enverguro</k> span, extent of wing or sail spread. Def.:
Dimensiono di ucelo, o di flugilo (o di seglo) inter la extremaji
di la ali extensita.

<k>envidiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to envy, (be)grudge, be envious of
<k>(ulu</k>, <k>pri ulo; ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu)</k>. Ex.: Il sempre envidias la
suceso di sua frato. Envidio esas kompozita de jaluzeso e de
odio. Il havas envidi-ema, -oza mento.

<k>envolvar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to wrap, fold up in; <k>enar
 varme</k> to muffle, wrap warmly. V. exp. vid. <k>envelopar.</k>
<k>epigono*</k> epigone; a successor, ordinarily an inferior one.

<k>epigrafo</k> epigraph, inscription. Def.: La skriburo quan
on trovas o pozas sur la monumenti; VII-155.

<k>epigrafio*</k> epigraphy. Def.: La cienco dil epigrafi;
VII-155.

<k>epilepsio</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> epilepsy; <k>epilepsiala</k>
epileptic: relating to the disease; <k>epilepsiika</k>, <k>epilepsiiko</k> epileptic
(person).

<k>episkopo</k> bishop (also in chess); <k>episkoparo</k> episcopate
(collect.); <k>episkopala</k> episcopal; <k>episkopio</k> bishopric
(jurisdiction); <k>episkopeso</k> episcopacy (office, dignity); <k>episkopeyo</k>
b. palace.

<k>epiteto</k> epithet. Def. Vorto adjuntata a substantivo por
qualifikar ol.

<k>epitomo</k> epitomy, compendium, abridgment (of a book); <k>epitomigar</k>
to epitomize.

<k>epizodo</k> episode; an incidental narrative or digression;
an event.

<k>equilibrar</k> <ex>(intr., tr.)</ex> to be in state of
equilibrium, balance, counterpoise; <k>equilibrigar</k> to equilibrate;
to put in balance equilibrium (ulo); <k>equilibro</k> equilibrium,
equipoise, balance; <k>equilibroza</k> well-balanced; <k>equilibristo</k>
equilibrist, juggler. Ex.: "A equilibras B", o: "A
e B equilibras" = "Existas relato di equilibro inter A
e B". "X (aganto) equilibrigas A e B", o "A
per B". On uzas <k>equilibrigar</k> nur por <k>l'extera
 aganto</k>, qua pozas la forci (pezi, e.c.) en equilibro, qua
efektigas l'equilibro sen partoprenar ol; IV-171.

<k>equipar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to equip, fit out (a ship, an
expedition, a soldier); (cf. <k>provizar</k>).

<k>equitato</k> equity; natural justice. Def.: Yusteso natural,
segun la komuna raciono, quan on opozas a la yusteso legal, a la
yuro; IV-9.

<k>eratika</k> <ex>(geol.)</ex> transported from its original
location or bed (stones, etc.); <ex>(fig.)</ex> erratic; deviating
from the common course.

<k>erektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to erect; stand <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>
straight up, set up <k>(u1o)</k>. V. exp.: On erektas monumento,
statuo, kolono, masto. Persona anke erektas su, mem kande lu ja
stacas. "Il levis su, stacas senmova dum kelka instanti, e
pose erektas su sur la pedo-pinti (por regardar super la
muro)". On ne povas dicar <k>rektigar</k>, nam on ne <k>rektigas</k>
masto ja rekta; pluse on rekt-igas en omna direcioni, ma on <k>erektas</k>
nur vertikale, ad-supre; VI-383.

<k>ergotismo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> ergotism, state of health
caused by eating ergot.

<k>erodar</k> <ex>(tr., geol., med. etc.)</ex> to erode,
corrode, eat away.

<k>erorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to err, be mistaken; <k>erorego</k>, <k>eroracho</k> blunder, egregious mistake; <k>erora</k>, <k>eroroza</k>
erroneous, mistaken; <k>eroriva</k> fallible; <k>erorigar</k> to cause
<k>(ulu)</k> to err, lead astray, deceive (without bad intention;
cf. <k>trompar</k>); <k>eroriganta</k> improper; causing to err.
– EFIS

<k>erste</k> <ex>(of time)</ex> not before, not until (then),
only (not earlier than), for the first time; <k>erste hiere</k>
not before yesterday, yesterday for the first time. Def.: Tam
tarde kam (referas preciza instanto, adjuntante la penso: ne plu
frue); IV-525. Ex.: Me venos erste morge = me venos morge, ne
ante. La proxima numero di ca jurnalo aparos erste komence di
agosto. Ja en la printempo me suspektis il, ma erste dum lua
somervakanco me recevis certeso. Il remarkis l'eroro erste ye la
sequanta matino.

<k>erudar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make erudite <k>(ulu</k>, <k>su)</k>; <k>erudesar</k>
to be e.; <k>erudita</k> learned; <k>erudito</k> e. person; <k>eruditeso</k>
erudition, scholarship.

<k>eruptar</k> <ex>(intr. geol. and gen.)</ex> to erupt: to
break forth from an inclosure, to make an outburst; <ex>(med.)</ex>
to break out in pimples, pustules, rash; <k>eruptigar</k> to cause
an e. in <k>(ulo</k>, <k>ulu)</k>; <k>eruptar per insulti</k> to burst
forth into abuse; <k>la erupto di volkano</k> the eruption of a
volcano.

<k>esamo</k> swarm (of bees, etc.); <k>esamifar</k> to swarm:
collect in a s.

<k>esbosar</k> <ex>(tr., of plastic arts and fig.)</ex> to
rough-hew, cut, to boast (in order to make the outline of a
figure); <k>esbosuro</k> rude outline; <ex>(fig.)</ex> first draft
(of a plan, etc.), <k>esbosilo</k> <ex>(sculp.)</ex> boasting tool;
mortise chisel. V. exp.: <k>Skisar</k> relatas la desegnal arti; <k>esbosar</k>
la plastikal arti (la modlado); III-469.

<k>esenco</k> <ex>(phys. and metaphys.)</ex> essence; <k>esenca</k>, <k>esencala</k> essential. Ex.: La esenco deala. Esenco di citrono.
Inerteso esas la esenco di materio. Esenco di rozi (E. attar of
roses). Esencala principi, reguli. La homo esas esence sociema.
Ant. <k>acesorajo.</k>

<k>esforcar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make an effort, strive,
strain, exert oneself; <k>esforco</k> endeavor, effort, exertion; <k>esforcovunduro</k>
lesion, strain, (cf. <k>penar</k>, <k>demarshar</k>) Ex. Esforcar levar
pezajo. Esforcar kurar, kombatar, obtenar employeso. Konsumar la
forteso per nepovanta esforci. V. exp.: vid. <k>demarshar</k>.

<k>eshafodo</k> scaffold(ing); staging (for a mason, etc.);
frame-work of timbers for a spectator's stand, for execution of
criminals; <k>eshafodala stango</k>putlog; (cf. <k>jibeto</k>).

<k>eskalar</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to touch (or call) at (a
port); <k>eskaleyo</k> port of call. Def.: Haltar en portuo dum
voyajo por embarkar o desembarkar pasajanti o vari; II-75.

<k>eskaldar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scald; injure the skin with hot
liquid; to expose to the action of boiling water (a jug, etc).

<k>eskamotar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to perform conjuring tricks,
cause (<k>ulo</k>) disappear by legerdemain. Def.: Habile
desaparigar objekto, por ludo; II-647. V. exp. vid. <k>furtar.</k>

<k>eskapar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to escape, find a way out (<k>ek</k>, <k>de</k>) <ex>(tr.)</ex> to e. from, get away from, slip away from,
avoid (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); (cf. <k>fugar</k>); <k>eskapilo</k>
escapement (of a clock or watch); <k>eskapmoyeno</k> any means of
e.; <ex>(fig.)</ex> shift, subterfuge, means of evasion; <k>eskapema</k>
evasive; <k>eskapotubo</k> delivery or escape pipe. Ex.: Eskapar
(de) karcero, danjero, malajo, de la furio di la tempesto, la
morto, e.c. Eskapo di vaporo.

<k>eskaro</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> eschar: a dry slough, crust, or
scab.

<k>eskarpa</k> steep (of slopes); <k>eskarpigar</k> to make slope
sharply. V. exp.: <k>Eskarpa</k> indikas granda inklineso (o
prefere rampo); <k>abrupta</k> indikas formo preske vertikal. On
povas ankore acensar sur eskarpajo; on ne povas (o nur per granda
peno) acensar abruptajo. Eskalero povas esar <k>eskarpa</k>, ne <k>abrupta</k>;
II-645.

<k>eskartar</k> <ex>(gen. sense, tr.)</ex> to put aside, apart (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>); to go aside, apart, swerve, turn aside (<k>de</k>); <k>eskartar
 ulu de la justa voyo</k> to lead a person astray; <k>eskartar infanto
 de la rivo</k> to keep a child from the bank; <k>eskartar velo</k>
to put aside a veil; <k>eskartar suspekto</k> to remove suspicion; <k>eskartar
 frapo</k> to ward off a blow; <k>eskartar la brakii</k>, <k>la gambi</k> to
spread the arms, the legs; <k>eskarto</k> putting aside, digression; <k>eskarteso</k>
being aside, isolation, aloofness, loneliness; <k>pavorema kavalo
 facas eskarto</k> a frightened horse makes a step aside; <k>eskarteso
 di persono</k> the aloofness of a person; <k>stacar eskarte</k>
to stand apart, aside, by oneself.

<k>eskopeto</k> blunderbuss. Def.: Speco di karabino (anciena);
V-219.

<k>eskorto</k> escort, guard; <ex>(nav.)</ex> convoy; <k>eskortesar ad
 ulu</k> to be escorted to someone; (cf. <k>akompanar</k>).

<k>eskrokar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to swindle, cheat (<k>ulu</k>); to
cheat out of (<k>ulo</k>). Def: Speco di furto per trompo o ruzo;
III-200.

<k>eskupar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bail (water out of a boat,
etc.); <k>eskupilo</k> scoop (for bailing).

<k>espado</k> sword; <k>espadagar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to use,
wield the s.; to put (<k>ulu</k>) to the sword; <k>espadostroko</k>
s. stroke; <k>espadpinto</k> s. point; <k>espadzono</k> s. belt; <k>dumanua
 espado</k> two handed s.; <k>bayonet espado</k> s. bayonet; <k>espadagar
 pinte e tranche</k> to cut and thrust; (cf. <k>pinte frapar</k>);
<k>espadego</k> broad-s.

<k>espalero</k> <ex>(hort.)</ex> espalier; a row of fruit-trees
trained up to a lattice or wall; the trellis or wall on which
trained.

<k>esparo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> spar: a timber used for masts,
yards, booms etc.

<k>esparto</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> esparto (grass); a Spanish grass
(Stipa tenacissima) used in making cordage, papar, shoes,
baskets, etc.; <k>espartajo</k> an article made from e.; <k>espartoshuo</k>
grass-shoe, -sandle.

<k>espelar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to spell (words); <k>espellibro</k>
spelling-book. Def.: Lektar la vorti literope e formacante la
silabi; II-582.

<k>esperar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hope for, to expect with desire <k>(ulo);</k>
<ex>(intr.)</ex> to hope: have confidence, trust <k>(de</k>, <k>en); esperajo</k>
thing hoped for;<k>esperema</k>, <k>esperoza</k> hopeful. Ex.: Esperar suceso.
Esperar de od en Deo. Espero esas granda konsolaco.

<k>espino</k> thorn-bush, -tree; <k>espino blanka</k> whitethorn,
hawthorn; <k>espino nigra</k> blackthorn. Def.: Arbor(et)o dornoza.

<k>esprito</k> wit, cleverness; <k>espritoza</k> witty; <k>espritajo</k>
witticism; <k>afektacar –o</k> to play the wit; <k>espritoludo</k>
play of w. DF

<k>espruva</k> proof <k>(kontre) –igar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to make (water-, lire-, etc.) proof <k>(ulo); aquespruva</k>
water-proof, -tight.

<k>esquado</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> (corporal’s) squad; gang
(of workmen); <k>esquadano</k> member of a squad, of a gang.

<k>esto</k> east; <k>este</k> eastward; <k>ad este</k> to the
east (with motion); <k>estala longitudo</k> e. longitude; <k>de
 esto</k> from the e.

<k>establisar</k>to establish; to settle or fix firmly; place
on a permanent footing; make firm, stable or constant; (cf. <k>instalar</k>, <k>pruvar)</k>. Ex.: Establisar la fundamento di edifico. Establisar
komercal societo, fabrikerio, kolonio. Establisar su en urbo. La
establiso di banko. Note “Establishment in the sense of
“institution” is translated by the suffix<k>–erio;</k> educational establishment: <k>edukerio)</k>.

<k>estakado</k> boom, chain or row of piles across a harbor for
defense; (cf. <k>palisado</k>).
