<k>estalar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to display, show (goods, etc.); <k>estalajo</k>
display-goods; <k>estaleyo</k> show-place; <k>estalar mapo</k> to
spread out a map; <k>estalar robo</k> to lay out a gown; <k>estalar
 ludkarti;</k> to show one’s hand.

<k>estampar</k> <ex>(tr. tech.)</ex> to make an impress, imprint,
in relief of a mark or figure; <k>estampuro</k> stamp (on a coin,
etc.); <k>estampilo</k> stamp, die. Def. Estampilo esas utensilo
uzata ye la forjo. Ol esas facita ek harda materio ed havas la
negativa formo di la forjenda peco, tale ke per simpla preso la
dezirata formo obtenesas; III-81.

<k>estanchar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stanch, (blood), stop (a leak,
tears, etc.). Def.: Haltigar la fluo di liquido (ne sikigar);
IV-9.

<k>estimar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to esteem, have e. for; hold <k>(ulu)</k>
in high regard; <k>estimo</k> e., consideration; <k>estiminda</k>
estimable, honorable; <k>estimindeso</k> respectability; (cf. <k>evaluar</k>, <k>prizar)</k>. Ex.: Estimar la vertuo di ulu, Il perdis sua
estimeso e bona reputeso.

<k>estivar</k><ex>(intr.)</ex> to be torpid (in summer); <k>estiv(ad)o</k>
torpidity, estivation; (cf. <k>hivernar)</k>. Def.: Indikas la
stando di torporo, en qua ula animali pasas la somero; IV-173.

<k>estompar</k> <ex>(tr., draw.)</ex> to stump; shade, shadow
with a stump; <k>estompilo</k> stump: artist’s soft pencil or
rubber.

<k>esvanar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to faint, swoon away; <k>esvaninto</k>
a swooned person.

<k>etajo</k> story, floor (of a house, etc.); tier; <k>trietaja
 domo</k> three story house; <k>dispozar etajope</k>, <k>etajatre</k> to
taper, put in tiers.

<k>etajero</k> what-not, set of selves. Def. Tabuli dispozita
erajatre.

<k>etapar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to halt at a stage (in travel); <k>etapeyo</k>
halting place; station, stage; <k>transirar etapo</k> to pass
through without stopping.

<k>etato</k> statement, account (receipts and expenditures);
roll; <k>etato di spensi</k> account of expenses; <k>pre etato</k>
estimate (of outlay, etc.).

<k>etero</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> ether; <k>eterala</k>, <k>eteroza</k>, <k>eteratra</k>
etherial; <k>eterigar</k>, <k>eterifar</k> to etherialize <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>eterizar</k>
<ex>(med.)</ex> to etherize <k>(ulu)</k>.

<k>eterna</k> eternal, everlasting; <k>eterno</k> eternity:
(duration); <k>la eterno</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> Eternal God; <k>eterneso</k>
eternity; quality of being e.; <k>eternigar</k> to eternalize.

<k>etiko</k> (bon-) morality; ethics; moral science; <k>etika</k>, <k>etikala</k>, <k>etikoza</k> moral, ethical; <k>etikaleso</k>, <k>etikozeso</k>
morality; <k>sena</k> immoral; <k>sen etikeso</k> immorality; <k>kontreetikajo</k>
immoral act. (N.B. The adj. form translates the E.
"moral" <k>Morala</k> refers to the <k>mori</k> of a
country, cf. <k>moro.</k>

<k>etiketo</k> <ex>(on bottles, etc.)</ex> label; (on goods,
parcels) ticket; <k>etiketizar</k> to label, ticket.

<k>etiolar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to etiolate; blanch. Def.: Privicar
vivanti (precipue planti) de lumo ed aero, de quo lia feblesko,
palesko o senkoloresko; III-603.

<k>etuyo</k> case: flat box, opening sideways or from the top; <k>violin
 etuyo</k> violin c.; <k>ciz</k>, <k>agul etuyo</k> scissors-, needle-case;
<k>chapel etuyo</k> hat-box. V. exp.: <k>Gaino</k> esas etuyo tre
longa e streta, en qua l'objekto eniras tra l'extremajo (kontre
ke etuyo apertesas laterale): on ofras ex. espado (luxoza,
honorala) kun lua <k>gaino</k> (E. sheath), en <k>etuyo</k> (box,
case); IV-11, V-722.

<k>eufonio</k> euphony. Def.: Agreabla e facila kombinado di la
soni en linguo; III-138.

<k>evar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to be so many years old; to be
aged (so many years); <k>evo</k> age, years; <k>evanta</k> aged
(so many years); <k>evoza</k>, <k>grandeva</k> aged, elderly; <k>grandeveso</k>
longevity, agedness; <k>quante vu evas?</k> how old are you? <k>sat
 evar por</k> to be old enough to; <k>il esas granda relate sua
 evo</k> he is large for his years; <k>evanta 40 yari</k> forty
years old; <k>muliero mezeva</k> a middle-aged woman <k />

<k>evakuar</k> <ex>(tr., milit., med., tech.)</ex> to evacuate,
empty (N. B. not to empty a vessel, etc., cf. <k>vakuigar</k>evacuation;
<ex>(med.)</ex> discharge of matter by natural passage or
artificial opening. Ex.: Evakuar ); <k>evaku(ad)o</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex>
trupi, puso.

<k>evaluar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to evaluate, value; to estimate the
worth of, to rate at a certain price; to reckon the amount of; to
appraise; (cf. <k>expertisar</k>); <k>evalu(ad)o</k> valuation,
estimate; <k>evaluebla</k> ratable; appreciable: that may be
estimated, appreciated. V. exp.: <k>Evaluar</k> esas determinar
valoro o quanto, per kalkulo o per konjekto (se on uzas mezurilo,
on dicus <k>mezurar</k>). <k>Taxar</k> esas fixigar la quanto de
imposto o kontributo, quan on debas pri ulo. Exemple (en la
hipotezo di imposto pri revenuo): "on evaluas la revenuo di
ta sioro a 10000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki, segun la
proporciono di 4 po 100;" V-221.

<k>evangelio</k> gospel, evangel; <k>evangeliala</k>, <k>evangeliatra</k>
evangelical; <k>evangeliisto</k> evangelist; <k>evangeliizar</k> to
evangelize <k>(ulu);</k> <k>evangeliolibro</k> Book of the Gospel; <k>predikar
 la evangelio</k> to preach the g.

<k>eventar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to happen, occur, come about,
befall; <k>evento</k>, <k>eventajo</k> occurrence, event; <k>irgo quo eventos</k>
whatever may happen; <k>to povas eventar ad irgu</k> that may
befall anyone; <k>neexpektata evento</k> unexpected event;

<k>eventuala</k> eventual: dependent upon events, contingent; <k>eventualo</k>
contingency; <k>eventuali</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> perquisites, extra fees; <k>eventualeso</k>
fortuitousness; <k>eventuale</k> eventually, in that case; <k>eventuala
 profiti</k> casual profits, perquisites; <k>ni esas pronta por
 irga eventualaji</k> we are prepared for contingencies. Def.:
Qua dependas de ula evento necerta. Ant.: <k>certa</k>, <k>necesa.</k>

<k>evidenta</k> evident, obvious, plain, manifest, patent; <k>evidento</k>, <k>evidentajo</k> evidence: obvious fact; (cf. <k>atesto</k>, <k>pruvo</k>) <k>evidenteso</k>
obviousness; <k>per su evidenta</k> self-evident; <k>igar evidenta</k> to
make clear; <k>evidenta verajo</k> an e. truth; <k>la evidenteso di
 propoziciono</k> the clearness of a proposition. Ant.: <k>dubebla</k>, <k>evidentinda;</k> <k>necerta</k>, <k>neprobabla.</k>

<k>eviero</k> (kitchen-) sink. Def.: Speco di tablo kava, o
kuvo ek lapido o ceramikajo, sur qua on lavas (generale en
koqueyo); IV-9.

<k>evitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to avoid, shun, evade, obviate, (cf.
<k>eludar</k>). Ex.: El evitas (E. shuns) me. Evitar frapo,
danjero, disputo. Evitar (E. obviate; prevent) skandalo. Ant.: <k>serchar.</k>

<k>evolucionar</k> <ex>(intr., philos.)</ex> to evolve; <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to perform evolutions; <k>evoluciona</k>, <k>evolucionala</k> evolutional; <k>evolucionismo</k>
evolutionism; <k>evolucionisto</k> evolutionist. V. exp. vid. <k>developar.</k>

<k>exajerar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to exaggerate. Ex.:
Exajerar vinko, la meriti di amiko.

<k>exakta</k> exact, accurate (not used of persons; cf. <k>akurata</k>, <k>preciza</k>); <k>exakteso</k> exactness, fidelity (of a copy); <k>exakte</k>
exactly. Def.: Qua esas konforma a la verajo, a la realajo, a la
normo; IV-101. Ex.: Kalkulo exakta. Sequar exakta dieto.
Matematiko esas exakta cienco. Verifikar la exakteso di kalkulo.
V. exp.: Mezuro <k>preciza</k> povas ne esar <k>exakta</k> (se
l'instrumento, quankam subtila, esas nejusta).

<k>exaltar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exalt: raise the spirits of
(ulu), to carry (the senses) to a high degree: (<ex>not</ex> to
praise, cf. <k>laudegar</k>). Def.: Ecitar sentimento (precipue
nobla, religiala) til extrema grado; IV-9.

<k>examenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to examine <k>(ulu)</k> (not used
with things, cf. <k>explorar</k>); <k>examenato</k> person examined; <k>exameno
 skribita</k> written examination; <k>examenoquestioni</k> e.
questions; <k>subisar exameno</k> to undergo e.

<k>exaucar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hear and grant (a prayer, a
request); to hearken favorably or willingly to <k>(ulu)</k>.
Ant.: <k>repulsar</k>, <k>refuzar.</k>

<k>exekutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to execute, to perform, to do <k>(ulo);</k>
to e. a criminal, cf. <k>mortigar; exekut(ad)o</k> execution;
performance, carrying into effect; <k>exekutanto</k>, <k>exekutero</k> executor,
doer; <k>exekutantino testamentala</k> executrix; <k>exekutisto</k>
executive, manager; <k>exekutebla</k> feasible, practicable; <k>exekutala</k>, <k>exekutenda</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> executory. Ex.: Exekutar impero, lego,
projeto, kriminero. Exekuto di verdikto.

<k>exemplo</k> example; <k>exempla</k>, <k>exemplatra</k> exemplary; <k>exemple</k>
for example, for instance; <ex>(abbr.:</ex> <k>ex.); segun la exemplo</k>
following the e. <k>(di ulu); punisar ulu kom exemplo</k> to make an
e. of someone; <k>exempla puniso</k> exemplary punishment.
<k>exemplero</k> copy (of a book, paper, engraving, etc.).

<k>exercar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exercise (the legs, the body,
one's senses), to exert (strength, one's memory, eloquence); <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to drill; <k>exerceyo</k> drilling place; <k>exercolibro</k> e. book.;
(cf. <k>praktikar</k> and III-225).

<k>exergo</k> <ex>(numis.)</ex> exergue. Def.: Infra feldo di
medalio; III-672.

<k>exfoliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exfoliate, scale (off). Def.:
Forprenar foliope, deprenar folii, t. e. strati sucedanta;
III-603

<k>exhalar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exhale, send forth, emit (odors,
etc.; cf. <k>expirar</k>). Ex.: Ca marshi exhalas vapori
pestizanta. La exhalo di rozo.

<k>exhaustar</k> <ex>(tr., also fig.)</ex> to exhaust: drain,
spend; <k>exhaustilo</k>, <k>exhausttubo</k>, <k>exhaustrobineto</k> an e.; <k>exhaustar cisterno</k>
to drain a cistern. Ex.: Exhaustar mineyo, sulo, forteso, Il
falis en (pro) exhausteso, kp.: <k>fatigar</k>). Ne exhaustebla
furnisaji. Ant.: <k>restaurar</k>.

<k>exhortar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exhort. Ex.: Exhortar ulu
reformar sua konduto. Ant.: <k>deskonsilar</k>, <k>despersuadar.</k>

<k>exilar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exile, banish <k>(ulu</k>, <k>su de);</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to expatriate; <k>exilito</k> an exile, V. exp.: On <k>exilas</k>
ulu, interdiktante a lu restar en la lando: lu esas tote libera
extere; e se lu rieniras sen permiso, on simple ekpulsas lu. <k>Proskriptar</k>
esas serchar la kondamnito (mem po premio por la denuncanti) e
punisar lu severe (generale per morto), se on povas trovar e
kaptar lu en la lando (ex. la proskripti da Marius e Sylla). <k>Relegar</k>
esas enkarcerigar en fora lando (kolonio); <k>Deportar</k> esas
transportar la kondamito en fora lando (kolonio), ube lu restas
plu o min libera, en ula distrikto; II-648; (cf. <k>extradar</k>).

<k>existar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to exist, be in existence; <k>existanta</k>, <k>existanto</k> existing, existent, extant (being); Ex. Traci ankore
existas. Existanta homi.

<k>exkluzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exclude, drive or shut out,
debar, deny admission; <k>exkluzite</k> to the exclusion of; <k>exkluzemeso</k>
exclusiveness; <k>exkluzive</k> exclusively. Ex.: Exkluzar ulu de la
Akademio. La bonfacemeso exkluzas la avareso. La exkluzo di
homini. Exkluzite altra yuri, devi. Exkluziva yuro. La spirito di
exkluzemeso. Ant.: <k>admisar</k>, <k>inkluzar</k>, <k>recevar.</k>

<k>exkoriar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to excoriate, to rub off, abrade,
scratch, gall (the skin) Def.: Lacerar la polo (ne sen-pel-igar),
deprenar peco de la pelo; IV-136

<k>exkursar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make an excursion, take a
trip; <k>exkursobatelo</k> e. boat; <k>exkursanto</k>, <k>exkursero</k>
excursionist.

<k>exkuzar</k> <ex>(refl.)</ex> to apologize, make excuses, beg
pardon (<k>su pri ulo</k>); <k>exkuzo</k> apology, excuse; <k>exkuzebla</k>
excusable (of persons, cf. <k>pardonebla</k>). V. exp.: Se vu
facis kulpo relate ulu, vu <k>exkuzas</k> vu avan lu, e lu povas <k>pardonar</k>
ol a vu. La persono ofensinta facas <k>exkuzo</k>, e la persono
ofensita facas pardono; IV-100.

<k>exorcisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exorcise, cast out evil
spirits.

<k>exordio</k> exordium; <k>exordiar</k> to make an e. Def.: Unesma
parto di diskurso. Ant.: <k>peroraciono.</k>

<k>exotika</k> exotic. Def. Qua venas de fora landi, e konseque
havas karaktero di rareso o stranjeso; III-603. Ex.: Flori
exotika.

<k>expansar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., also fig.)</ex> to expand, to
develop in volume or surface, spread, widen; <k>expansema</k>
expansive; <ex>(fig.)</ex> unreserved (of persons). Ex.: Expansar
aero per kaloro. Expanso di autoritato. Forco expansiva. Naturo
expansema. Ant.: <k>kontraktar.</k>

<k>expediar</k> <ex>(tr., com.)</ex> to despatch, send off,
forward (goods); <k>expediajo</k> shipment; <k>expedianto</k>, <k>expediero</k>
sender; <ex>(nav.)</ex> shipper; <k>expediisto</k> shipping agent; <k>expediar
 komercaji per fervoyo</k> to forward goods by railroad. Def.:
Sendar ulo (ordinare komercaji) a destineyo.

<k>expediciono</k> <ex>(milit., nav.)</ex> expedition. Def.:
Sendo di homi por militar, o por explorar regiono; IV-706. Ex.:
Naval, ciencala expediciono a la suda polo.

<k>expektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to expect, be in expectation of,
look forward to; <k>expekto</k> expectation, presumption (cf. <k>konjekto</k>);
<k>expekteso</k> expectancy; <k>ne expektita</k> unexpected. Def.: Mente
anticipar ula evento. Ex.: Me expektos nulo de ilu. Il vivas en
expekteso. V. exp.: <k>Varto</k> esas ago prefere fizikal, <k>expekto</k>
esas pure mental; (III-423) Me <k>expektas</k> vizito camatine
ma, pro ke me nun devas ekirar, me neplus <k>vartos</k>.

<k>expektorar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to expectorate, discharge
phlegm, mucus from the lungs, to cough up. V. exp.: <k>Expektorar</k>
ne esas <k>sputar</k>; l'expektorajo venas de la <k>pektoro</k>,
t.e. de la pulmono, quale indikas l'etimologio.

<k>experiencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to experience (<k>ulo</k>): to
have the lot or fortune of, to undergo; <k>experiencoza</k> experienced;
<k>sen experienca</k> inexperienced (cf. <k>neexperta</k>). Ex.:
Experiencar plezuro, desfortuno. Per experienco on sajeskas.

<k>experimentar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to experiment (per); <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to test, try (<k>ulo</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>); <k>experimentala</k> experimental.

<k>expertizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to survey (professionally); <k>expertizero</k>, <k>expertizisto</k> surveyor, person officially appointed to examine an
affair and report on it.
<k>expiacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to expiate, to atone for; <k>expiacanta</k>, <k>expiacala.</k> Ex.: Expiacar krimino, kulpo.

<k>expirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to expire: to breath out (cf. <k>respirar</k>);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to come to an end (of time), terminate; <k>expiro</k>
expiration; <ex>(fig.)</ex> falling due; <k>expirinta</k> expiring
(breath); expired (account); <k>expirodato</k> date of expiration,
maturity. Def.: Indikas l'ekiro di l'aero ek la pulmoni;
figurale, la «lasta expiro», la morto; e per extenso: fino di
ula temp-intervalo, di kontrato, di puniso, e.c.; III-34. V.
exp.: La teknikal senco di l'ago <k>inversa dil aspiro</k>
nomesas simple <k>ekpulso</k>. Ant.: <k>aspirar</k>.

<k>explicita</k> explicit: clear, not obscure; <k>explicitigar</k> to
make (<k>ulo</k>) e.

<k>explikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to explain, make plain what is
obscure, elucidate, expound; (cf. <k>klarigar</k>). Ex.:
Explikar signifiko, sua desfacilaji, doktrino, sua intenco. V.
exp. vid. <k>definar.</k>

<k>explorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to explore (a country); to
investigate, examine, search into (things, cf. <k>examenar</k>, <k>inquestar</k>); <ex>(milit.)</ex> to reconnoiter, scout; Ex.:
Explorar lando nekonocata. Explorar (E. examine) libro. Exploro,
exploranto di subjekto, objekto.

<k>explotar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exploit, to get the value out
of, as to e. a mine; to work, cultivate (a farm, estate with
intent of profit); <k>explotachar</k> to exploit, to draw an
illegitimate profit from, as to e. workers (by underpayment); <k>explot(ad)o</k>
exploiting: utilization for profit, working (of mines, farms),
execution of work: <k>explotacho</k> profiteering, sweating; <k>explotajo</k>
what is exploited; <k>explotebla</k> workable.

<k>explozar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> <k>explozigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
explode; <k>exploziva</k>, <k>explozivo</k> explosive; <k>exploziva gaso</k>
explosive gas; (mine) fire-damp.

<k>expozar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to expose, set in
public view; <ex>(of houses, etc.)</ex> to turn toward, present a
side to; to set forth (a situation); explain (a doctrine); <k>expozar
 pikturo</k> to exhibit a painting; <k>domo expozita a sudo</k>
a house having a southerly prospect; <k>vivo expozesis a danjero</k>
a life was e. to danger; <k>expozar sistemo</k> to set forth,
explain a system; <k>expozo di komercajo</k> exhibition of
merchandise; <k>expozo di fotografala plako</k> exposure of
photographic plate; <k>expozeyo di la mortinti</k> the morgue.

<k>expresar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to express (by symbols, gestures,
words, etc.); Ex.: Vorti expresas la penso. Lakrimi esas la
expreso di doloro. Aspekto expres-oza, -iva, -ema.

<k>extazar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in ecstacies, be
enraptured; <ex>(med.)</ex> to be in a trance (cf. <k>katalepsio</k>).

<k>extensar</k> to extend, stretch, draw out, spread; <k>extensebla</k>
extensible, tensile; <k>extensanto</k>, <k>extensivo</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> extensor.
Ex. Extensar brakio, tapiso, mantelo. Extensar povo, autoritato,
domeno. Kauchuko esas tre extensebla.

<k>extenuar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to extenuate, palliate. Def. Igar
min grava (kulpo, krimino, aserto, e. c.) II-707.

<k>exter</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> without, outside (without motion;
cf. <k>ek</k>); except, besides; <k>li stacis exter la domo</k>
they stood outside the house; <k>exter la dicita decidi</k>
besides the decisions named; <k>extere</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> outside,
externally; <k>il uzas extere la oleo</k> he uses the oil
externally; <k>extera</k> outside, external; <k>extera apliko</k>
external application; <k>la exterajo di domo</k> the outside of
a house (considered objectively); <k>extereso</k> exterior (geom.
sense); <k>de extere</k> from without (with movement); <k>ad extere</k>
outwardly (with movement); <k>il kuris adextere</k> he ran
outside. Ant.: <k>en</k>, <k>interne.</k>

<k>externo</k> day-scholar; <k>externerio</k> day-school. Def.
Skolano (lernanto) qua ne habitas la lerneyo; III-672.

<k>extingar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to extinguish, put out,
quench (a fire, a light; <ex>also used fig.</ex>); <k>extingar kandelo</k>
to put out a candle; <k>extingar dursto</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to quench
the thirst; <k>la fairo extingeskas</k> the fire is going out; <k>extingar
 la kalko</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to slack lime; <k>extingar debo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to cancel a debt; <k>extingo</k> <k>di raso</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> the
extinction, the extermination of a race. Ant.: Acendar.

<k>extirpar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to extirpate, uproot; <ex>(surg.)</ex>
to cut out, remove totally; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to destroy wholly,
eradicate, weed out; (cf. <k>arachar</k>). Ex.: Extirpar la mala
herbi, kancero, dento, raso.

<k>extorsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to extort, wrest; to blackmail <k>(ulu)</k>
<k>extors(ad)o</k>, <k>extorsajo</k> extortion, exaction; <k>extorsanto</k>, <k>extorsero</k>
extortioner; <k>extorsoprobo</k> attempt at e. V. exp.: To ne esas
raptar, t. e. furtar per materiala violento, ma koaktar ulu cedar
ulo (generale pekunio) per minaco, per morala violento; III-200.

<k>extra</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> extra; <k>extradisho</k> an extra dish; <k>extraspenso</k>
extra (additional) expense; <k>extraajo</k> something extra: <k>extraedituro</k>
extra edition; <k>extra bona</k> extra good.

<k>extradar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to extradite. Def.: livrar
stranjera kulpozo (akuzato) a la guvernerio di lua patrio;
III-672; kp. <k>exilar</k>.

<k>extraktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to extract: to draw from, out.
Ex.: Extraktar frazo de libro, dento, kugleto de la korpo.
Extraktar radiko dua (<ex>math.:</ex> to extract the square root).
Extraktado di sukro de betravi. Extrakt-uri opiumo.

<k>extravagar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to talk extravagantly, wildly,
to rave; (in fever) to be delirious; to act extravagantly,
wildly, unreasonably, eccentricly; <k>la febro igas il
 extravagar</k> the fever makes him delirious; <k>extravago</k>, <k>extravagemeso di
 konduto</k>, <k>di parolado</k> wildness of conduct, talk; <k>esas
 extravaganta spensar pekunio ante recevar ol</k> it is
extravagant to spend money before receiving it. Def.: Pensar,
parolar, agar sen raciono nek bonsenco.

<k>extrema</k> extreme, utmost, outermost; <k>extremajo</k>
extremity, butt-end; <k>extreme</k> extremely; <k>extrema unciono</k> e.
unction; <k>extrema frontiero</k> e. boundary; <k>extrema plezuro</k> e.
pleasure; <k>la extremi esas la unesma e lasta termino en ula
 proporciono</k> the extremes are the first and last terms in a
proportion; <k>il esas extreme richa</k> he is extremely rich.

<k>exudar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to exude, ooze out. Def.:
Ekiro di liquido ek korpo, analoga (e tam lenta) kam sudorifo
(N.B. sen gutifar); III-672.

<k>exultar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to exult. Def.: Esar kaptata da
profunda joyo o sentimento (amo), qua expresas su per movi,
kanti, e.c.: III-324.

<k>da</k> <ex>(indicating agent after passive verb)</ex> <k>la
 patri esas amata da sua filii</k> the parents are loved by their
children; <k>sendita da Deo</k> sent by God; <k>trapikita da
 kuglo</k> pierced by a bullet; <ex>(agent)</ex> <k>l'ocido di
 Caesar da Brutus</k> the murder of Caesar by Brutus; <ex>(authorship</ex>)
<k>dramati da Shakespeare</k> dramas by Shakespeare; <k>Da qua
 esas ta libro? Ol esas da Petro</k> By whom is that book? It is
by Peter. (object of a transitive verb compounded with -igar) <k>me
 manjigas l'aveno manjesas da la kavalo = l'aveno manjesas da la
 kavalo</k> I make my horse eat oats; <k>lu kredigis ita rakonto
 da l'dupo</k>he palmed this tale off on the dupe <k>(la dupo
 kredis la rakonto)</k>; <k>me sendigas mea letri da mea spozino =
 igar la spozino sendar mea letri</k> I make my wife send my
letters. Def.: Montras individuo, objekto, kozo o kauzo qua igas,
facas od efektigas ulo, II-731. V. exp.: vid <k>de.</k>
<k>dago</k> dirk: a short shord or kind of poniard.

<k>damo</k> married or widowed woman; dame; <ex>(in cards, chess,
checkers)</ex> a queen; <k>damoi</k> <ex>(game)</ex> draughts,
checkers; <k>ludar per damoi</k> to play checkers; <k>damooplanko</k>
checker-, draught-board; <k>damoigar</k> <ex>(chess, checkers)</ex>
to crown; <k>damoifar</k> <ex>(checkers)</ex> to go to king, <ex>(at
chess)</ex> to go to queen.

<k>damnar</k> <ex>(tr., theol., fig.)</ex> to damn; <k>damnito</k>
person damned, a lost soul. (cf. <k>maledikar</k>, <k>blasfemar</k>)
Ex.: Deo damnas la maligni. Doktrino damninda.

<k>damzelo</k> young lady, miss, maid, damsel; unmarried woman,
spinster; (before a proper name) Miss; <k>damzelacho</k> wench; <k>honor
 damzelo</k> maid of honor; <k>kontor damzelo</k> office-girl, -woman; <k>du
 damzeli di kinadek yari</k> two maiden ladies of fifty.

<k>dandio</k> dandy: fop; coxcomb. Def.: Homulo eleganta, segun
la modo.

<k>danjero</k> danger, peril, jeopardy; <k>danjerigar</k>, <k>pozar en danjero</k>
to endanger, jeopardize; <k>danjeroza</k> dangerous.

<k>darfar</k> may, to have a right to, be permitted; <k>me
 darfas</k> I have the (legal) right or permission, or, it is not
forbidden to me; <k>on devas ne mentiar (o</k>, <k>on ne darfas
 mentiar)</k> one should not (or, ought not to) lie. Def.: Havar
la yuro o permiso; ol havas la senco legala, kontrea a l'ideo di
interdikto; VI-487. Ex.: On darfas uzar darfar nur pri la kozi,
qui dependas de lego o regulo, do de la volo, altravorte, nur
kande on povas imaginar permiso od interkikto. On povas ya facar
multa agi, quin on ne darfas facar. V. exp.: <k>darfar</k> =
permisebleso, posibleso; <k>devar</k> = obligo morala; <k>povar</k>
= povo; <k>mustar</k> = obligo fizikal, absoluta; expresas kurte
l'ideo «oportas ke» o «necesa esas ke» (vid. <k>oportar</k>);
II-166.

<k>darnar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to darn (garments).
Def.: Specala modo di rapecar stofi, vesti, ne pozante peco, ma
imitante la texuro; III

<k>daturo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> datura (genus: Datura);
thorn-apple, Jimson weed (Datura stramonium).

<k>dazlar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dazzle: to overpower
by bright or moving lights; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to blind; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to excite to admiration by brilliancy, display (of beauty, money,
honors, etc.) (cf. <k>facinar</k>). Def.: Trublar
instantale la vid-povo per tro brilanta lumo, o per tro rapida
movado, agitado, e.c. VI

<k>de</k> <ex>(prep)</ex> <ex>(starting point, origin,
derivation)</ex> <k>la treno de Lyon</k> the train
from Lyons: <k>blinda de nasko</k> blind from birth; <k>de
 omna lateri</k> from all sides; <k>de supre ad infre;</k>
from top to bottom; <k>de ta vidpunto</k> from that
viewpoint; <k>komprar de ulu</k> to buy of someone; <k>arachar
 de la morto</k> to snatch from death;<k>malada de
 febro</k> sick with (from) fever; <ex>(measure, quantity)</ex>
<k>unu de li</k> one of them; <k>un horo de
 marcho</k> an hour's walk; <k>dekeduo de ovi</k>
a dozen eggs; <k>tri metri de rubando</k> three meters
of ribbon; <k>glaso de aquo</k> a glass of water; <k>peco
 de pano</k> a piece of bread; <k>el esas la maxim bela
 de la fratini</k> she is the most beautiful of the sisters;
<k>duo de rejini</k> a pair of queens; <ex>(after
adjectives denoting dimenions, size, contents):</ex> <k>ponto
 longa de du Angla milii</k> a bridge two English miles
long; <k>barelo plena de vino</k> a barrel full of
wine; <k>konstrukturo alta de duadek etaji</k> a
building twenty stories high; <ex>(«since», duration of time).</ex>
N. B. in this sense <k>depos</k> is preferable to <k>de</k>
alone: <k>me savas lo de(pos) quar dii</k> I have
known it these (since, from) four days; <k>me esas hike de
 du monati</k> I have been here for two months; <k>de(pos)
 la morto di sua spozino</k> since the death of his wife; <k>de
 kande vu lojas hike? me lojas hike de un monato</k> How
long (from when) have you lived here? I have lived here one month
(I am living here from one month). <k>de pos</k>
since, after; <k>de longe</k> for a long time past; <k>de
 kande</k> since when, how long since; <k>de lore</k>
from that time, since then; <k>de pose</k> from that
time, afterwards; <k>de pos ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex>
since (that); <k>de nun</k> from now, henceforth,
hereafter; <k>de sub</k> from under; <k>de dop</k>
from behind. V. exp.: <k>da</k>, <k>de</k>, <k>di</k> Praktikal
regulo por selektar inter ta tri prepozicioni esas la sequanta:
Se la senco postulas klare l'ideo di l'agento od autoro, uzez <k>da</k>;
se ol postulas klare l'ideo di deveno, o di konteno o di quanto,
uzez <k>de</k>; en cetera kazi (do en omna <k>dubebla)</k>
uzez audace <k>di</k>; nam olca esas la maxim <k>generala</k>
de la tri, korespondanta a la genitivo; II<k /><k /><k /><k />

<k>deo</k> God, a god; <k>deino</k>
goddess; <k>dea</k>, <k>deala</k> divine: of or relating to
God; <k>deajo</k> a divinity: divine object; <k>deeso</k>
godhead; <k>deigar</k> to deify; <k>deismo</k>
deism; <k>deatra</k> godlike; <k>deo bona! ho Deo</k>
good God! oh God! <k>danko a Deo</k> thank God; <k>Deo
 pardonez</k>may God pardon; <k>Se plezos a Deo</k>, <k>se
 Deo volos</k> if God wills.

<k>debar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to owe <k>(ulo</k>, <k>ad
 ulu)</k>; <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be under obligation <k>(ad
 ulu</k>, <k>por ulo)</k>; <k>debajo</k> a debt; <k>debizar</k>
to get <k>(ulu)</k> into debt; <k>debo honorala
 (honor debo)</k> a debt of honor; <k>charjar su per
 debi</k> to run into debt; <k>debrestajo</k>
balance due. Ex.: Pagez to quon vu debas. Me debas a lu mea vivo.
Donar deb-atesto.

<k>debatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to debate. Def.:
Diskutar kun un o plura konversanti en ordinoza ed atencoza
maniero, singlu prizentante l'argumenti servanta sua propra
interesto o prefero; V

<k>debeto</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> debit (after the
balance of an account), debit-balance; <k>debetigar</k> to
d. (a sum to somebody's account); <k>debetkonto</k> d.
account.

<k>debila</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> weak, feeble;
(cf. <k>frajila</k>), <k>debiligar</k> to
debilitate, enfeeble; <k>debiliganta</k>, <k>debiligiva</k>
debilitating; <k>debilach(ul)o</k> a puny person. Def.:
Febla per naturo, temperamento; III<k />

<k>debitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sell (goods,
supplies, ordinarily at retail); <k>debito</k>, <k>debitajo</k> sale,
supply, retail; <k>debitar engrose</k>, <k>endetale</k> to sell
wholesale, by retail; <k>vari di bona debito</k> goods
that have a ready sale.

<k>debochar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go to excess in
sensual pleasures, to live dissolutely, to revel, carouse; <k>debochigar</k>
to debauch: entice to debauchery, to corrupt with lewdness; <k>debocheskar</k>
to become profligate; <k>debochanta</k>, <k>debochema</k> dissolute,
profligate (cf. <k>laciva</k>); <k>debochistino</k>
harlot; <k>debochanto</k>, <k>debochero</k> debauchee, rake: <k>debochiganto</k>
debaucher. V. exp.: <k>Krapulo</k> esas nur maxim
desnobla e vulgara debocho. <k>Debochanto</k> povas
esar (restar) eleganta. Pro to <k>debocho</k> koncernas
prefere la sexuala ne-etikaleso, <k>krapulo</k> la
trouzo di manjado e drinkado, l'ebrieso kustumal, e.c. On povas
parolar pri <k>debaucho krapuloza;</k> III

<k>debutar</k> <ex>(intr., theat.)</ex> to make one's
debut, first appearance; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to start, set out: take
one's first steps; <k>debutanto</k>, <k>debutantino</k> debutant,
debutante; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a beginner.

<k>decar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be decent, suitable,
correct, proper; (cf. <k>esar justa</k>); <k>deco</k>
decency, propriety; <k>decanta</k>, <k>decoza</k> decent,
becoming, decorous; <k>decante</k> decently, with
decency; <k>decas</k> <ex>(imper.s)</ex> it is proper.

<k>decendar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to descend (<k>de</k>,
of race); <k>decend(ad)o</k> descent, lineage, pedigree; <k>decendanto</k>
descendant, offspring; <k>decendantaro</k> progeny,
posterity (collect.).

<k>decensar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to go down,
descend: to move or pass from a higher to a lower plane; <k>decenseyo</k>
descent (place). Ex.: Decensar (de) monto en valo. Decensar (de)
arboro. Decensar eskalero. La mareo, la temperaturo decensas.
Ant.: <k>acensar.</k>

<k>deceptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disappoint, to
defeat (the hopes, expectations of someone); <k>deceptanta</k>, <k>deceptiva</k>
disappointing.

<k>dechifrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to decipher: to
discover the key to a secret writing. V. exp.: vid. <k>chifrar</k>.

<k>decidar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to decide,
settle, determine; <k>decidoza</k>, <k>decidema</k> (of persons)
strong-minded, determined; <k>decidita</k> (of things)
decided; <k>decidite</k>, <k>decideme</k> decidedly, positively; <k>decidemeso</k>
determination (of character); <k>decidiganta</k>, <k>decidiva</k>
decisive, conclusive; <k>facar decido</k> to make a
decision; <k>agar decidoze</k>, <k>decideme</k> to act with decision.
Ex.: Decidar afero, problemo, debato. Judicial decido. Ad il
mankas decidemeso (di karaktero). Il esas homulo decidema. Il
uzas decidoza tono. La kozo esas decidita. Kauzo, motivo
decidiganta. Bataliodecidiva. V. exp.: <k>On decidas</k> teoriala
questioni, on <k>rezolvas</k> agi facenda. Ni <k>decidas</k>, ke
l'akuzato esas la sola autoro dil krimino. Ni <k>rezolvas</k>
facar turo en la urbo; VII-98.
<k>decilitro</k> deciliter: tenth part of a liter: 6.1 cu. in.

<k>decimo</k> decime. Def.: Dekimo di franko, o 10 centimi;
III-324.
<k>decimetro</k> decimeter: tenth of a meter: 3.937 in.

<k>dedikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dedicate: consecrate to a Divine
Being; to devote to a sacred use; to inscribe or address to a
patron or friend; (cf. <k>konsakrar</k>).

<k>deduktar</k> <ex>(tr., log.)</ex> to deduce, infer; <k>dedukt(ad)o</k>, <k>deduktajo</k>, <k>dedukturo</k> deduction, inference; <k>deduktala</k>, <k>deduktiva</k>, <k>deduktema</k>
deductive; <k>deduktebla</k> deducible.

<k>defensar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to defend, protect <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>su</k>, <k>kontre)</k>; <k>defensebla</k> defensible, tenable; <k>defensilo</k>
a means, instrument of defense; <k>defensiva</k> defensive. Ex.:
Defensar sua patrio, sua honoro, sua opiniono.

<k>deferencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to defer to, show deference to; <k>deferenco</k>
deference, regard, respect. Def.: <k>Deferenco</k> Respekto qun
on manifestas ad ulu exekutante lua volo o deziro. Nociono
komplexa, qua ne esas simpla respekto. III-323. Ex.: On devas
deferencar sua patri. Kun omna deferenceo qua esas debata a vu.
Ant.: <k>(deferenco) desprizo</k>, <k>aarogemeso.</k>
<k>defiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to defy, challenge, dare <k>(ulu</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>, <k>o facar ulo); defio</k> challenge, defying, defiance.

<k>defilar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to defile, file off, march past <k>(avan
 ulu).</k>

<k>definar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to define: give the definition of; <k>defino</k>
definition; <k>definita</k> defined; definite (article); <k>sen defina</k>, <k>ne definita</k> indefinite. V. exp.: <k>Definar</k> esas indikar,
enunciar la senco di vorto. <k>Determinar</k> esas fixigar o
precizigar ula konocajo: on <k>determinas</k> la alteso di la
suno, la disto di du loki, per astronomial o geografial operaci
(mezuri e kalkuli). Kozo povas esar tre determinita, e nule
definita o definebla: ex.: ula partikulara koloro. On <k>definas</k>
vorto; on <k>deklaras</k> sua opiniono; on <k>explikas</k> fakto,
libro, frazo; IV-464, 465.

<k>definitiva</k> definitive: final, ending; <k>definitive</k>
definitely. Ex.: Aranjo, judiko definitiva.

<k>deflexar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deflect, bend from; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to swerve, deviate.

<k>deformar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deform, put out of shape; <ex>-it(ul)o:</ex>
a deformed person; <k>deformesar</k> to be deformed.

<k>degradar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to degrade: reduce in rank, remove
from office.

<k>dejunar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to breakfast: (the first repast
of the day); have b., <k>dejuneto</k> a light b., <k>frua dejuno</k>
early b. Def.: Dejuno esas repasto di dimezo, VI-162.

<k>dejurar</k> <ex>(intr., milit.)</ex> to be on
duty; <k>dejuranta oficiro</k> officer-of-the-day;
orderly officer.

<k>dek</k> ten; <k>dekimo</k> a tenth part; <k>dekesma</k>, <k>dekesmo</k> <ex>(ordinal)</ex> tenth; <k>dekopla</k>, <k>dekoplo</k>
tenfold; <k>dekopligar</k> to increase tenfold; <k>dekope</k>
by tens; <k>du deki</k> two tens; <k>dekfoye</k>
ten times; <k>yar deko</k> decade; <k>dekedu</k>
twelve, a dozen; <k>dekeduesma</k> twelfth; <k>dekeduimo;</k>
<ex>(fraction)</ex> one twelfth.

<k>dekadar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be decadent, be in
state of decay, decline (physical or moral); <k>dekado</k>
decadence: decline to a worse or less perfect state, tendency
towards dissolution or extinction. Ex.: La dekado di l'imperio
Romana. La dekado di arti. Ni vivas en dekandanta epoko.

<k>dekalmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to declaim; to speak
or deliver rhetorically; <k>dekalmacha</k> bombastic; <k>dekalmach(er)o</k>
haranguer, stump-orator, ranter.

<k>deklarar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to declare <k>(ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu)</k>. Ex.: Deklarar sua intenci, sua opinioni,
Deklaro di milito.

<k>deklinar</k> <ex>(tr., gram.)</ex> to decline,
inflect; <ex>(intr., phys.)</ex> to deviate from the true north,
as magnetic needle; <ex>(astron.)</ex> to remove from the
equator, as a heavenly body.
<k>dekoktar</k> <ex>(tr., pharm.)</ex> to decoct; <k>dekokto</k>, <k>dekokturo</k> decoction, extract from a body boiled in water.

<k>dekoltar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut low (a dress);
to bare the neck and shoulders; <k>dekoltita</k>
décolletté, in a low dress; <ex>(n.)</ex> <k>dekolturo;
 dekoltachita</k> uncovered to an improper degress.

<k>dekubitar</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> to like down in bed,
decubation.

<k>delegar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to delegate (someone as
agent); <k>delegato</k>, <k>delegito</k> delegate; <k>delegitaro</k>
delegation; (cf. <k>prokuraco</k>).

<k>delektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to delight <k>(ulu)</k>;
<k>delektesar</k> to be delighted; <k>delekt(ad)o</k>, <k>eso</k>
delight(ing); <k>delektanta</k>, <k>delektiva</k>, <k>delektoza</k> delightful,
delectable.

<k>deliberar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to deliberate.
Def.: Ponderar en su ipsa o kun altri, pri questiono solvenda o
rezolvo facenda, la motivi por e la motivi kontre la decido;
V

<k>delico</k> delight; high degree of pleasure or
enjoyment; the cause of the pleasure; <k>la delici di Paris</k>
the delights, the charms of Paris; <k>delicoza</k>
delicious, delightful.

<k>delikata</k> delicate, refined; <k>delikat(ul)o</k>
a d. person; <k>delikatajo</k>, <k>delikateso</k> delicacy; <k>delikatega</k>
exquisite, superfine. Ex.:Delikata infanto, organi. La delikateso
di la pelo, di linguo, di gusto.

<k>deliktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to commit an offence
(against law and order); (cf. <k>kontravencar</k>); <k>delikto</k>
offense; <ex>(jur.)</ex> misdemeanor: offense punishable by fine
or imprisonment; (cf. <k>krimino</k>); <k>delikt(al)a</k>
unlawful, felonious, punishable; <k>deliktanta</k>, <k>deliktatra</k> delinquent;
<k>deliktanto</k>, <k>deliktinto</k> offender, malefactor; <k>en flagranta delikto</k>
in the very act; <k>materio di la delikto</k> corpus delicti:
substance of the offence.

<k>delirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be delirious, to rave; <k>deliro</k>, <k>delireso</k> delirium; <ex>(fig.)</ex> nightmare; <k>deliranta</k>, <k>delirema</k>, <k>deliratra</k> delirious, frenzied, frantic; <k>deliranto</k> d. person.

<k>demandar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ask for <k>(ulo)</k>; (N.B. Not
the E. «demand», (cf. <k>postular</k>); <k>demando</k> request,
asking; <ex>(polit., econ.)</ex> demand (cf. <k>ofro</k>); <k>demandanto</k>
asker, applicant; <k>me demandas pardono</k> I beg (ask) your pardon;
<k>quon vu demandas pro facar l'operaco</k> What do you ask to
perform the operation; <k>ni ne recevos la permiso demandita</k>
we shall not receive the permit asked for. V. exp.: On <k>demandas</k>
de ni la difero di la sequanta vorti. On <k>demandas</k> e <k>postulas</k>
nur kozi; on <k>pregas</k> e <k>solicitas</k> nur personi. <k>Demandar</k>
ulo de ulu, esas <k>pregar</k> ta «ulu», ke lu donez ta
«ulo». <k>Postular</k> ulo esas <k>demandar</k> ulo, a qua on
havas yuro; tala demando esas do insistanta, obliganta e kelke
imperema. <k>Solicitar</k> esas pregar ulu autoritoza o potenta
per obtenar ulo, qua havas plu o min karaktero di favoro;
III-224. On <k>demandas</k> kozo quan on deziras havar; on <k>questionas</k>
persono pri ulo, quon on deziras savar; II-78. En la ekonomiko,
on traktas pri la lego di <k>l'ofro</k> e di la <k>demando</k>,
qua determinas la preco di la vari sur ula merkato; II-167.

<k>demarshar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to take steps, measures (to
obtain something); <k>demarsho</k> step, proceeding; act, measure
taken in business; Def.: Demarshar implikas sempre l'ideo di
«pazi» facata extere, en la socio, port atingar ula skopo, por
obtener irga helpo, favoro, e.c.; IV-100. V. exp.: <k>Esforco</k>
esas propre ago muskulala, o generale, mekanikala; <k>demarsho</k>
esas social ago, per qua un persono volas influaar altra por
obtener ulo; IV-204.

<k>dementa</k> demented, insane; <k>dement(ul)o</k> a d. person; <k>dementeskar</k>
to become d.; <k>dementeso</k> dementia; <k>dementerio</k> insane asylum;
<k>dementajo</k> insane act. (cf. <k>fola</k>)

<k>dementiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give the lie to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>pri
 ulo)</k>; to deny (flatly, publicly); <k>dementio</k> flat
contradiction, denial.

<k>demisionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to resign: give in one's
rsignation; <ex>(milit.)</ex> to throw up one's commission; <ex>(parl.)</ex>
to vacate one's seat. V. exp. vid. abdikar.

<k>demokrata</k>, <k>demokratala</k> democratic; <k>demokrat(ul)o</k> a democrat.
Def.: Demokraato esas partisano di la demokratio, e plu generale,
ta qua havas la mento demokratiala o demokratiema; VII-154.

<k>demokratio</k> democracy; <k>demokratiala</k> relating to a d.; <k>demokratiigar</k>
to democratize. Def.: La rejimo en qua la populo guvernesas da su
ipsa (t.e. da sua elektiti); lua principo esas la suvereneso dil
populo; VII-154.

<k>demolisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to demolish, pull down, break up
(a house, a fortification, an old ship); <k>demoliso</k> demolition; <k>demolisar
 bona reputeso</k> to ruin a reputation; <k>demolisar doktrino</k> to
overthrow a doctrine.

<k>demono</k> <ex>(myth. and fig.)</ex> demon, evil spirit,
genius; <k>demonala</k>, <k>demonatra</k>, <k>demonoza</k>, <k>demonika; demonozo</k>, <k>demoniko</k> demoniac(al).

<k>demonstrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to demonstrate: prove by
arguments; to make evident; <k>demonstro</k> <ex>(lig., polit., milit.,
naval)</ex> demonstration. Ex.: Demonstrar propoziciono. Lua
redesko demonstas lua shamo. Demonstri enemikala.

<k>denigrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disparage <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>: run down, decry, depreciate, vilify, blacken the
record of; (cf. <k>difamar</k>, <k>kalumniar</k>, <k>maldicensar</k>).
Def.: Inspirar mala opiniono pri ulu (o ulo) per severa o nejusta
aserti e judiki; IV<k />

<k>densa</k> dense: having its parts crowded
together; compact, close: (cf. <k>dika</k>); <k>densigar</k>
to thicken (liquids); (cf. <k>pludikigar</k>). Ex.: <k>Densa
 turbo</k>, <k>vaporo.</k> Platino havas la maxim granda denso de
omna metali. Ant.: <k>skarsa</k>, <k>dissemita</k>, <k>ne</k>, <k>desdensa.</k>

<k>dento</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> tooth; <k>dentala</k>
dental; <k>dentosono</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> dental; <k>dentoza</k>, <k>dentizita</k> toothed, notched, denticulated; <k>dentizar</k>
to furnish with teeth; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to cog; indent; to put
scallops in; <k>dentifar</k> to make teeth; to cut teeth;
<k>dentaro</k> set of teeth; <k>dentisto</k>, <k>dentifisto</k>
dentist; <k>dentego</k> tusk; <k>dentostumpo</k>
stump of a t.; <k>dentextirpisto</k> tooth puller; <k>dento
 di sajeso</k> wisdom tooth; <k>dentoroto</k>
cog-wheel; <k>dentopikilo</k> t. pick; <k>dentotenalio</k>
dentist's forceps; <k>dentetroto</k> pinion, small gear
wheel; <k>dentokolo</k> neck of a t.; <k>dentifuro</k>
<ex>(result)</ex> dentition; <k>sen denta</k> toothless;
<k>sen dentigar</k> to break, knock out the teeth of <k>(ulu)</k>;
<k>sen denteskar</k> to lose one's teeth.

<k>dentelo</k> lace (-work); <k>dentelifistino</k>
female l. maker; <k>dentela naztuko</k> lace handkerchief.

<k>denuncar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inform against,
denounce (a guilty person).

<k>departar</k> <ex>(intr., also fig.)</ex> to depart
<k>(ek</k>, <k>de)</k>; <k>departopunto</k> point of
departure; <k>esar departonta</k> to be on the eve of
setting out, be about to start; <k>departopreparo</k>
preparations for a start; <ex>(nav.)</ex> getting underway. Ant.:
<k>arivar.</k>

<k>departmento</k> <ex>(territorial)</ex> department,
province, (cf. <k>ministerio</k>); <k>departmentala</k>
departmental. Def.: Teritoriala dividuro or resortiso;
VI

<k>dependar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to depend: be
conditioned or contingent <k>(de)</k>; to rely on for
support; to be a dependency <k>(di)</k>; <k>ne
 dependo</k> independence; <k>ne dependante</k>, <k>sen depende</k>
independently. Ex.: L'efekto dependas de la kauzo. Omno dependas
de la maniero segun qua on komencas. Ca teritorio ne dependas de
Francia, o, ca teritorio esas nedependanta de Francia.

<k>deperisar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to pine away,
gradually lose strength; wither; slowly decline or perish. Def.:
Debilesko duktanta ad (se ne til) la morto; III

<k>deplorar</k> to deplore: to feel or express deep
grief; <k>deplorinda</k> deplorable, lamentable, wretched.
Ex.: Deplorar la desfortunaji di ulu, la morto di ulu.

<k>deportar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to depart: to
transport into banishment; to convey to a penal colony. V. exp.:
vid exilar.

<k>depozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to depost: to lay, set or put down;
to lodge for safekeeping; to bond (in warehouses); <k>depoz(ad)o</k>
depositing (act); <k>depozite</k> on deposit; <k>depozanto</k>, <k>depozero</k>
depositor; <k>depozajo</k> deposit; <k>depozeyo</k> place of deposit,
as a depot, depository, warehouse; <k>depozario</k> trustee,
depositary, guardian, warehouse-keeper. Ex.: Depozar portajo.
Nil(e) depozas omnayare slamo fekunda. Depozanto di pekunio en
panko.

<k>depresar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. and moral)</ex> to depress: to
press down; to deject; <k>depres(ad)o</k>, <k>depreseso</k>, <k>depresuro</k> depression.

<k>deputar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to depute, deputize, send <k>(ulu)</k>
as a deputy; <k>deputataro</k> deputation (delegation); <k>chambro
 di deputati</k> <ex>(parl.)</ex> chamber of deputies (cf. <k>suplear</k>).

<k>derivar</k> <ex>(tr., math., gram.)</ex> to derive <k>(ulo de)</k>;
have its root (de); <k>derivo</k> derivation <ex>(gram.)</ex>; <k>derivito</k>, <k>derivajo</k> derivative; <k>de qua vu derivas ca vorto? La vorto
 derivesas de</k> Whence do you derive this word? The word is
derived from.

<k>derogar</k> <ex>(intr., jur.)</ex> to derogate: to act
contrary, invalidate, annul (in part), to depart from (a custom);
<k>deroganta</k>, <k>derogiva</k> derogatory. Def.: Teknikala termino di
yuro-cienco: facar ecepto, violaco instantala di ula lego,
regulo; III-329. Ex.: Ica du partisi derogis de lia kontrato (E.
both parties have invalidated some part of (or, have departed
from) their contract). Derogar de la lego, de kustumo
establisita.

<k>desabonar (su)</k> to withdraw one's subscription (from a
periodical).

<k>desafabla</k> crabbed, cross, churlish, surly, ungracious,
uncivil.

<k>desagreabla</k> disagreeable, unpleasaant <k>(ad)</k>; <k>desajo</k>
a d. thing or experience.

<k>desajustar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to to put out of adjustment, to
derange.

<k>desakordar</k> <ex>(intr., mus.)</ex> to be out of tune; <ex>(gram.)</ex>
not to agree; <k>deso</k> discord; <k>desanta</k> discordant.

<k>desankragar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to weigh anchor, get up
a. on.

<k>desartikizar</k> to disarticulate, unjoint; <k>desizo</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex>
disarticulation: amputation, excision of a joint.

<k>desasemblar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disassemble, take to
pieces, separate.

<k>desasimilar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. and fig.)</ex> not to
assimilate <k>(ulo).</k>

<k>desasociar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disassociate, dissociate; to
dissolve (a partnership).

<k>desasortar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unmaatch, break the set of,
spoil a collection of <k>(ulo).</k>

<k>desbalastizar (o</k>, <k>senbalastigar)</k> to unballast:
discharge or unload a ship from ballast.

<k>desbeligar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disfigure, take away the
beauty of.

<k>desblindigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to open the eyes
of, make to see; <ex>(fig.)</ex> undeceive.

<k>desbotizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pull or take off
the boots.

<k>desbutonagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unbutton; <k>desizar</k>
to remove the buttons from.

<k>descharjar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to discharge:
unload, take away the burden of <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>de)</k>; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to ease, free, throw off the care of (a thing): <k>deseyo</k>
unloading place; <k>quanta deso</k> good riddance; <k>desar
 sua koncienco</k> to clear one's conscience.

<k>desdensigar</k> to loosen, make less compact,
rarefy, to open up (ranks, a crowd).

<k>desebriigar</k> to sober; <k>deseskar</k>
to sober down; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to come to one's senses.

<k>desegnar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to draw, design,
delineate, sketch, (cf. <k>esbosar</k>, <k>skisar</k>); <k>desegn(ad)o</k>, <k>desegnuro</k> drawing; <k>desegnarto</k> art of drawing; <k>desegnanto</k>, <k>desegnero</k>, <k>desegnisto</k> drawer, draughtsman; <k>desegnoplanko</k>
drawing-board. Def.: Riproduktar, per krayono o plumo, la formo
di objekti.

<k>desembragar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to throw out of
gear, disengage <ex>(tech.).</ex>

<k>desengajar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disengage:
discharge, free from service.

<k>desenoyigar</k> to cheer up, divert, bring out of
the dumps.

<k>desentravar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to
unshackle, unfetter.

<k>desequilibrigar</k> to upset the equilibrium of,
unpoise, unbalance.

<k>desertar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., milit. and gen.)</ex>
to desert, abandon, quit, forsake.

<k>deservar*</k> <ex>(tr., intr., eccl.)</ex> to
serve (a living), have the parochial duties of (a chapel,
hamlet); (cf. <k>oficiar</k>).

<k>desesperar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to despair, to be
in d.; <k>desigar</k> to drive to d.; to dishearten; <k>desanta</k>
despairing, desperate; <k>desanto</k> one who despairs; <k>desato</k>
one of whom one d.; <k>kom desala remedio</k> as a last
resource, shift.

<k>desestalar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to take in goods
(exposed for sale); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to shut up shop, stop the
display.

<k>desestimar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to contemn, despise
<k>(ulu)</k>; <k>desigar</k> to bring into
disrepute, discredit, contempt; <k>desanta</k>, <k>desema</k>
contemptuous, scornful; <k>desinda</k> contemptible,
despicable.

<k>desfacila</k> difficult; <k>desajo</k> a
d. thing; <k>deseso</k> <ex>(state, condition)</ex>
difficulty; <k>desigar</k> to render d. <k>(ulo)</k>.

<k>desfangizar</k> to rub off the dirt, clean,
scavenge; <k>desizilo</k> scraper (as for shoes).

<k>desfavorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disfavor,
withhold favor from, to put out of favor; to disadvantage; <k>desoza</k>
unfavorable, disadvantageous; <k>desizar</k> to
disgrace; <k>desizita</k> disgraced.

<k>desfelica</k> miserable, unhappy; <k>des(ul)o</k>
an u. person; <k>desajo</k> u. event, mischance.

<k>desferizar</k> to take the iron from, to unshoe
(a horse).
<k>desforestizar</k> to clear, denude of forest, disafforest.

<k>desfortuno</k> misfortune, reverses, run of ill-luck; <k>desoza</k>
unfortunate; <k>desajo</k> calamity, mischance (the event); <k>dese</k>
unluckily.

<k>desfrenagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unlock or take off the
brake.
<k>desgantizar</k> to pull off the gloves from.

<k>desgibizar</k> to take out the bumps; the humps from; to
smooth out.
<k>desgluizar</k> to remove the paste, glue from.

<k>desgrasizar</k> to remove the grease or fat; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to scour.
<k>desgrosigar</k> to thin, reduce; remove the grosser parts.

<k>deshonoro</k> dishonor, opprobium, disgrace; <k>desizar</k>
to dishonor, bring d. upon; <k>desiziva</k> dishonorable.

<k>desinflar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deflate; reduce the swelling
of.

<k>desinkombrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deobstruct, disencumber,
clear from impediments.

<k>desintrikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disentangle, unravel; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to extricate, free.

<k>desjungar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unyoke (oxen); take out
horses from (a carriage).

<k>desjuntar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disjoin, take to pieces,
separate; <k>desiva</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> disjunctive.
<k>deskolorizar</k> to lose color, fade, come off (of colors).

<k>deskonfesar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to recant; unsay: take back
what one has said.
<k>deskonkordigar</k> to cause disagreement, set at variance.

<k>deskovrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to uncover: take the cover off;
to discover, disclose, detect (what was not known before); <k>desar
 disho</k>, <k>korbo</k> to uncover a dish, a basket; <k>desar trezoro</k>, <k>fonto</k> to discover a treasure, a spring.

<k>deskrasizar</k> to remove the (surface) dirt from, to
clean.

<k>deskreditizar</k> to discredit: to deprive of
credit, bring into disrepute.

<k>deskreskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to cease to grow,
to wane, fall off.

<k>deskriptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to describe (by
words); <k>deskripto</k>, <k>deskripturo</k> description; <k>deskriptiva</k>
<ex>(also geom.)</ex> descriptive.

<k>deskuafar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dishevel, undress
the hair of.

<k>deskustumigar</k> to break the habit of <k>(ulu</k>, <k>pri ulo)</k>; <k>deseskar</k> to break oneself of,
lose the habit of; <k>desinta</k> unaccustomed.

<k>desmakulizar</k> to clean spots from, remove the
stains from.
<k>desmanchizar</k> to take off the handle of.

<k>desmariajar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unmarry, annul
the marriage of.

<k>desmeritar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be
undeserving; to forfeit the esteem (<k>de ulu</k>, <k>per ulo</k>).

<k>desneta</k> dirty, unclean, untidy; <k>desigar</k>
to dirty; <k>desiganta</k> soiling; (cf. <k>sordida</k>).

<k>desnobligar</k> to debase, <k>deseso</k>
ignominy, meanness; <k>desigo</k> debasing; <k>desiganta</k>
debasing, ignominious.

<k>desorientizar</k> <ex>(lit.)</ex> to turn from
the east; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to put out of one's element; to put on
the wrong scent, to lose one's bearings.

<k>desostizar</k> to bone, to fillet (fish); <k>desizita
 dindo</k> boned turkey.
<k>despavizar</k> to unpave, take up the pavement.

<k>despendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to take down, unhang
(a chandelier, etc.).

<k>despenso</k> pantry, larder, buttery, steward's
office; <k>despensisto</k> steward.

<k>despersuadar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dissuade,
persuade to the contrary of <k>(ulu pri ulo</k>, <k>ulu per ulo).</k>

<k>despitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be vexed; to
fret. Def.: <k>Despito</k> chagreno mixita kun iraco.
Ex.: Ilua agi despitigas me (E. his acts vex me); Quo importas,
sive il esas joyoza sive il esas despitoza (E. what do you care
whether he is joyous or vexed). Lasar eruptar sua despito; (E. to
vent one's ill humor).

<k>desplanigar</k> to put out of true, (of wood) to
warp.

<k>desplenigar</k> to diminish the contents of, to
empty; <k>deseskar</k> to get low.

<k>desplezar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be displeasing
(<k>ad ulu</k>); <ex>(tr.)</ex> to displease (<k>ulu</k>).
<k>despolisar</k> to remove the polish, to rough.

<k>desprizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disdain, scorn,
despise; <k>desigar</k> to bring into disrepute,
discredit (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>desspular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unwind (from a
bobbin or spool).

<k>dessuolizar</k> to take soles from; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to wear off the soles of.

<k>destinar</k> to destine (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>, <k>ad ulo</k>).
Ex.: Destinar sua filiulo esar advokato. Esar kontenta pri sua
destino (E. to be content with one's lot).

<k>destorporigar</k> to remove the numbness from, to
quicken.

<k>desvarmigar</k> to cool or make cold (a hot
body).

<k>desvestizar</k> to take the clothing from,
undress, divest.

<k>detachar*</k> <ex>(tr., milit., nav.)</ex> to
draft: to send away, to send off for a particular service (from
the main body).

<k>detalo</k> detail, particular: a minute or
distinct part; <k>detala</k>, <k>detaloza</k> detailed; <k>detale</k>
in, with d.s, minutely, piece-meal, bit by bit; <k>detaligar</k>
to particularlize, state circumstantially, give the d.s of; <k>sen
 detale</k> briefly, in a few words. Ex.: La detali di afero, di
listo. Detaloza kalkulo. Il detale naracis sua historio. Il
detaligas sua historio.

<k>determinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to determine: to fix the limits
of; to ascertain or settle the exact truth about <k>(ulo)</k>; <ex>(gram.)</ex>
to fix the extent, the meaning of a word or sentence; <k>determino</k>
determination (not resolution, cf. <k>rezolvo</k>). Ex.:
Lavoisier determinis la kompozuro di l'aero. Determinar disto de
la tero a la suno. La determino di la volo. Determinita nombro.
La doktrino di determinismo. V. exp.: vid. <k>definar.</k>

<k>detersar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deterge: to cleanse, purge away
(as foul matter); <k>detersanta</k>, <k>detersiva</k>, <k>detersivo</k> detergent. Ex.:
Detersar la intestini.

<k>detrimentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prove detrimental to, be
prejudicial to; Ex.: Ica fakto detrimentis mea reputeso. Ica
aranjo esas facita a mea detrimento, lo detrimentas me. V. exp.: <k>Detrimentar</k>
e <k>domajar</k> esas diversa speci di <k>nocar. Domajar</k>
(ulo) esas facar material altero, qua minbonigas kozo (o la korpo
di persono). <k>Detrimentar</k> (ulu) esas efektigar a lu ula
perdo, mem nerekte e nevole; IV-237-8.

<k>devar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have the obligation of, have the
duty of, ought, should; <k>devo</k> duty, obligation. Def.: <k>«Devar»</k>
konvenas ad omna ed omnaspeca obligesi (moral od altra), do <k>devas</k>
uzesar en omna imperi, preskripti e konsili. Ex.: Se vu volas
bone standar, vu devas esar sobra. Vu devas ne adulterar, furtar.
V. exp.: vid. <k>darfar</k>; kp. <k>mustar</k>.

<k>devancar</k> <k>(tr.)</k> to out-run, out-strip, out-do, to
distance. V. exp.: On <k>preteriras</k> kozo senmova, ma
devancar implikas ke la objekto movas, e movas en sama sinco kam
la subjekto; IV-137.

<k>devastar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to devastate, lay waste, ravage,
desolate. Ex.: Ula uragano, ula pesto devastis la lando, la urbo.

<k>developar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to develop: make larger, fuller;
to unfold (a plot, etc.); <k>develop(ad)o</k>, <k>developeso</k> development;
growth, increase, progress. Ex.: Gimnastiko developas la korpo.
Developar la mento di infanto. Developo di arboro. V. exp.: <k>Developar</k>
indikas generale la kreskado gradoza e reguloza, sive di
l'organismi, sive di omna kozi simila od analoga ad organismi. <k>Evolucionar</k>
expresas la preciza ciencala (e filozofiala) ideo di <k>evoluciono</k>,
enduktita la Lamarck, Darwin, e.c.; ol karakterizas ula speco di <k>developo</k>,
ed implikas <k>transformo</k> (ol opozesas a la dissolvo, qua
esas l'inversa fenomeno). Singla organismo, ento «developas
su»; nur spci «evolcionas» tra la longa serio de yarcenti,
chanjante sua formo, adaptante su ad altra kondicion ai di vivo,
e.c.; III-221.

<k>deviacar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to deviate, swerve <k>(de)</k>.
Ex.: La deviaco di magneta agulo.

<k>devizo</k> device: emblematic design; <k>blazon devizo</k>
heraldic bearing.

<k>devoco</k> devotion: act of religion, external worship (cf. <k>pieso</k>);
<k>devocoza</k>, <k>devoc(ul)o</k> a devout (person); <k>devocala</k> devotional;
<k>facar devocaji</k> to perform one's devotions.

<k>devorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to devour, eat greedily; <k>devoranta</k>, <k>devorema</k> devouring, ravenous, voracious; <k>devoremeso</k>
voracity.

<k>devota</k> devoted; <k>devoteso</k>
devotedness, devotion; <k>devotesar</k>, <k>devotigar su</k> to be
d., to devote oneself. Ex.: Esar tote devota ad ulu, ad ulo.
Devoteso a sua patrio. Devotigar su ad ula skopo.

<k>dextra</k> right (handside); <k>dextre</k>
on the r.; <k>dextra manuo</k> r. hand; <k>dextruzero</k>a
r. handed person; <k>dextrano</k> <ex>(parl.)</ex> member
of party on right (a conservative); <k>turnar addextre</k>
to turn to the r. Ant. <k>sinistra</k>.

<k>dezerta</k> desert, deserted; <k>dezerto</k>
a desert, wilderness; <k>dezertigar</k> to make a d. of (<k>ulo</k>).
Def.: Qua esas sovaja (od arida) e ne habitata. Ex.: Insulo
dezerta. Sahara esas dezerto. Lando dezerta e nehabitata (E. a
wild and uninhabited country).

<k>dezinenco</k> desinence: formative suffix,
word-ending. Def.: Finalo di vorto, precipue por indikar la
flexiono.

<k>dezirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to desire: to wish for
earnestly, long for, hanker for, covet; <k>deziregar</k>
to greatly covet, lust after; <k>dezirinda</k> desirable; <k>dezirajo</k>
a desirable object, a desideratum; <k>il ardoroze deziris
 richaji</k> he ardently desired wealth; <k>me deziras
 ke vu parolez</k> I wish you to speak; <k>me desiras a
 vu omna feliceso</k> I wish to you all happiness.

<k>dezolar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make disconsolate,
distress, grieve (<k>ulu</k>); <k>dezoleso</k>
affliction, desolation (mental); <k>dezolanta</k>, <k>dezoliva</k>
grievious, disheartening. Ex.: La morto di mea amiko dezolas me.

<k>di</k> (marks the genitive, possession, belonging
to) <k>la domo di mea patrulo</k> my father's house; <k>en
 la tempi di la Romani</k> in the time of the Romans; <k>la
 rejo di Anglia</k> the king of England; <k>la fenestri
 di la domo</k> the windows of the house; <k>di qua</k>, <k>di
 qui</k> whose, of which; <k>la puero di qua me vidis
 la libro</k> the boy whose book I saw; <k>la libri di
 qui vu prizis la binduro</k> the books, the binding of
which you liked; <k>di qua esas ica granda fabrikerio</k>
whose is this great factory? V. exp.: vid. <k>de</k>

<k>dio</k> day (of 24 hours; cf. <k>jorno</k>);
<k>diala</k> daily; <k>de un dio a l'altra</k>
from one day to another; <k>la dii dil semano</k> the
days of the week.

<k>diabl(ul)o</k> <ex>(theol. and fig.)</ex> devil,
fiend; <k>diablala</k>, <k>diablatra</k> diabolic, devilish; <k>diableto</k>
little d., imp; <k>diablino</k> she d.; <k>diablajo</k>
act of devil(t)ry; <k>per la diablo</k> what the devil; <k>diablatra
 infanto</k> a little demon (child); <k>facar diablatra
 tumulto</k> to make a devlish uproar.

<k>diachilono*</k> diachylon: a kind of a plaster for
wounds.

<k>diafana</k> diaphaneous, transparent, pellucid;
(cf. <k>translucida</k>); <k>diafana marko</k>
watermark (on paper). Def.: Qua lasas pasar la lum-radii, tale ke
on povas klare dicernar objekti tra ol. Ex.: Aquo, polisita
vitro, esas diafana. Ant. <k>opaka.</k>

<k>diafizo*</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> diaphysis: the shaft
or main part of a long bone.

<k>diakritika</k>, <k>diakritiko</k> diacritic. Def.: Teknikala
termino por omna signi adjuntita a literi (supersigni, subsigni,
e.c.); III

<k>dialekto</k> dialect. Def. Vario regionala di
linguo.

<k>dialogar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to dialogue: take
part in a dialogue (<k>kun</k>); <k>dialogizar</k>
to put in form of a d. (<k>ulo</k>).

<k>diamanto</k> <ex>(stone)</ex> diamond; <k>diamantatra</k>
d. like, <k>diamantoforma</k> d. shaped; <k>diamantizar</k>
to cover with d.s (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>diamanto
 taliita</k> cut-d.; <k>diamanto kruda</k> rough d.; <k>diamantogarnituro</k>
set of d.s; <k>diamanto(frot)polvo</k> d. dust; <k>muntar
 diamanto</k> to set a d.

<k>dicar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to say, tell, (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>): <k>dico</k>, <k>dicajo</k> saying, what one
says; <k>sudicanta</k> so-called, self-styled. V.
exp.: Gramatikale, <k>dicar</k> esas transitiva, <k>parolar</k>
netransitivia: co konstitucas granda, esencala difero. <k>Dicar</k>
sempre relatas ula objekto, t.e. la kozi (frazi) quin on dicas; <k>parolar</k>
expresas la <k>pura</k> ago di la voco. «On devas
parolar por dicar ulo; ma existas multa homi, qui parolas por
dicar nulo»; V

<k>dicernar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to discern: to see and
identify by noting differences; <k>dicern(ad)o</k>, <k>dicernuro</k>
discernment, discrimination; <k>dicerniveso</k>
discernment (faculty); <k>dicernebla</k> distinguishable.
Def.: Vidar o komprenar la difero di du kozi (t.e. ke li
diferas); III<k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k />

<k>diciono</k>, <k>dicionarto</k> elocution, delivery (utterance;
N.B. <k>not</k> «diction»: choice of words; cf. <k>stilo</k>);
<k>dicionisto</k> elocutionist. Def.: Arto, maniero parolar
o deklamar; III

<k>diciplinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to discipline
(children, soldiers, etc.); <k>sen diciplina</k>, <k>n diciplinita</k>
undisciplined.

<k>dieto</k> <ex>(med., also legislative)</ex> diet; <k>dietala</k>
dietary; <k>dietigar</k> to d. <k>(ulu); impozar dieto
 ad ulu</k> to place someone on a d.; <k>esar en dieto</k>
to be on a d. Def. (Nutranta) rejimo sequenda; parlamentatra
kunveno. VI

<k>difamar</k> <ex>(tr., jur.)</ex> to defame,
traduce, libel, asperse; <k>difamanta</k>, <k>difamiva</k>, <k>difamema</k>
defamatory; (cf. <k>maldicensar</k>, <k>kalumniar</k>, <k>denigrar</k>).
Def.: Dicar ulo vera o nevera qua atakas la honoro or reputeso;
ago, punisebla da la civila lego; II

<k>diferar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to differ: be
different, be unlike; <ex>(of opinion)</ex> to disagree; <k>difero</k>
<ex>(math.)</ex> difference; <k>diferanta</k> different.
Ex.: La sentimenti, la interesti di homi diferas. Diferar
opinione de ulu. La difero inter tri e un esas du. V. exp.: <k>Diferanta</k>
esence des-simila (per speco); <k>diversa</k> plu
multa kam un. Ex.: La diversa dezinenci di vorto havas senci
diferanta: (E. the various terminations of a word have different
meanings).

<k>diferenciar</k> <ex>(tr., intr., biol., sociol.)</ex>
to differentiate, to acquire or give a distinct or separate
character (cf. <k>diferencialigar</k>); <k>diferenci(ad)o</k>
differentiation, the modification or specialization of parts or
organs.

<k>diferencialo</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> differential; <ex>(tech.)</ex>
d. gear; <k>diferencialigar</k> <ex>(math).</ex> to
differentiate; <k>diferencialig(ad)o</k> differentiation.

<k>difuzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to diffuse: to spread,
disperse widely.

<k>digo</k> dike, dam, coffer-dam; <k>digizar</k>
to dike, dam. Def.: Konstrukturo por preventar indundado.

<k>digna</k> worthy; meriting, deserving; having
merit, worth, virtue; <k>digneso</k> worthiness; (cf. <k>respektindeso</k>).
Ex.: Digna de rekompenso, de laudo, de puniso.

<k>digramo</k> digraph; a combination of two or more
letters to represent one sound, as <k>ch</k>, <k>sh</k>.

<k>digresar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to digress (<k>de</k>);
<k>digreso</k> <ex>(also astron.)</ex> digression:
departure from main subject.

<k>dika</k> <ex>(dimension)</ex> thick; <k>(plu)
 dikigar</k> to thicken (cf. <k>pludensigar</k>); <k>vitro
 dika de un centimetro</k> glass one centimeter thick. Def.:
Relatas nur un dimensiono (di geometriala solido), la 3a (pos
longeso e larjeso); III<k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k /><k />

<k>diktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dictate; utter
sentences to be written down; (cf. <k>imperar</k>, <k>impozar</k>).

<k>dilatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dilate. Ex. Kaloro
dilatas korpi.

<k>diletar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have a great liking
for, be partial to, be an amateur in (music, etc.); <k>diletanta</k>, <k>diletanto</k> diletante.

<k>diligenta</k> diligent. Def.: Qua agas kun zelo e
rapideso. V. exp.: vid. <k>asidua.</k> Ant. <k>lenta</k>, <k>indolenta</k>, <k>neagema.</k>

<k>dilutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dilute; thin by
admixture of a liquid; <k>dilutanta</k>, <k>dilutema</k> <ex>(of
style, etc.)</ex> diffuse.

<k>diminutar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to diminish,
lessen, <k>diminutiva</k>, <k>ivo</k> dimunutive; (cf. <k>mingrandigar</k>, <k>mingrosigar</k>). Ant. <k>Augmentar</k>, <k>kreskar</k>, <k>ampligar; developar</k>.

<k>dina</k> thin; on dimension of a paper, plank,
etc.; <k>(plu)dinigar</k> to make t.; <k>dine
 taliar</k> to mince, cut thin (meat, etc.) V. exp.: vid. <k>dika</k>.
Ant.: <k>dika</k>.

<k>dinamismo</k> dynamism; the doctrine that all
substance involves force.

<k>dinear</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to dine, to be at
dinner; <k>dineohoro</k> d. time; <k>frua dineo</k>
early d. Def.: Dineo esas la repasto dil vespero; VI

<k>dioptro</k> <ex>(opt.)</ex> diopter: sight-vane.
Def.: La fesnestreto tra qua on regardas por vizar punto per
l'instrumento nomata alidado; IV

<k>dioptrio</k> <ex>(opt.)</ex> diopter; unit of
refractive power. Def.: Uneso di mezuro por la «okulvitri»;
IV

<k>dioptriko</k> dioptrics. Def.: Teorio di la
optikala vitri (kp. <k>katoptriko</k>); IV

<k>diplasar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to displace; to change
the place of (<k>ulo</k>); to misplace; put out of
place (<k>ulo</k>); <k>diplasar su</k> to change
one's place or residence; <k>diplasopezo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex>
displacement (of a ship); <k>il diplasas omno en sua
 chambro</k> he puts everything out of place in his room; <k>diplasar
 libro</k> to misplace a book; (cf. <k>egarar</k>).

<k>diplomo</k> diploma; <k>diplomizar</k> to
confer a d. upon (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>diplomaco</k> diplomacy, diplomatics; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
tact, shrewdness; skill in conducting any kind of negotiation or
social matter; <k>diplomacema</k>, <k>diplomacatra</k> diplomatic; <k>diplomacisto</k>
diplomat.

<k>diporto</k> <ex>(stock exchange)</ex>
backwardation. Def.: Ajorno til proxima borsal liquidaco di la
livro di valori vendita, pagante premio; la premio pagata por ta
ajorno; II
<k>diptiko</k> diptych: ancient tablet of two leaves.

<k>direciono</k> (line of) direction, bearing (both
ways). Ex.: Du paraleli havas la sama direciono; IV<k />

<k>direktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to direct; manage,
conduct; put in a direction, (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>ad</k>); <k>direkt(ad)o</k>
direction, management; <k>direkteyo</k>, <k>direkterio</k> manager's
house or office; <k>direktanta</k>, <k>iva</k> directive,
managing; <k>direktanto</k>, <k>direktero</k>, <k>direktisto</k> director, manager;
<k>direktisteso</k>, <k>direktereso</k> directorship; <k>direktistala</k>, <k>direkterala</k> directorial <k>direktebla</k> dirigible; <k>mis
 direktar</k> to mismanage. Ex.: Direktar veturo, navo, armeo,
teatro. Direktisto di fabrikerio. Direktar sua regardi vers
objekto. Direktar la studiado di ulu. Direktebla balono esas
aer-navo. V. exp.: vid. <k>guidar</k>.

<k>direta</k> direct (opposite to indirect, as:
direct way, discourse, method); <k>direta treno</k>
through train. Ex.: La Suez-kanalo esas la voyo maxim direta de
Europa a la extrema oriento. V. exp.: La voyo <k>direta</k>
de A a B povas ne esar <k>rekta</k> (E. straight).
Ant.: <k>nedireta</k>.

<k>disdonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to distribute
promiscuously, deal out; <k>dis(ad)o</k> distribution,
giving (gifts, etc.), deal (at cards); (cf. <k>distributar</k>, <k>repartisar</k>). Def.: Donar hike ed ibe (ordinare hazarde);
VI

<k>disertar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to dissertate; <k>diserto</k>, <k>uro</k> dissertation; oral or written examination on a
question; disquisition; (college) theme.

<k>disho</k> dish (of food), viand, mess; <k>disho
 frianda</k> a toothsome d.; <k>karno disho</k>
meat dish, dish of meat.

<k>disidenta</k> <ex>(rel.)</ex> dissident,
dissenting; <k>disident(ul)o</k> dissenter; <k>disidenteso</k>
dissent. Def.: (Teknikala termino di religiala historio): qua ne
konsentas kun la maxim multa samreligiani pri ula punto, dogmato;
III

<k>disimular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dissimulate,
dissemble; hide under a false appearance; <k>disimulanta</k>
two-, double-faced, artful, sly. Def.: Celar sua pensi, opinioni,
sentimeni, o fingar altri; III<k />

<k>disipar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to waste, squander;
(cf. <k>extravagar</k>, <k>prodigar</k>); <k>disip(ad)o</k>, <k>disipeso</k> dissipation, waste; <k>disipanto</k>, <k>disipero</k>, <k>disipemo</k>
squanderer, spendthrift, prodigal, waster. Def.: Spensar abunde
ed ecese sua havaji en multa frivola o sterila spensi, e havas
prefere blamanta senco. Figurale, on disipas sua forteso, sua
atenco inter multa objekti e skopi; IV<k />

<k>disko</k> disc, disk; <ex>(games)</ex> quoit,
discus; <k>disko di luno</k> d. of the moon; <k>signal
 disko</k> signal d. (as on R.R.).

<k>diskontar</k> <ex>(tr., com.)</ex> to discount:
advance money on a bill, deducting the interest; <k>diskontisto</k>
bill-broker.

<k>diskreta</k> discreet, <k>diskreteso</k>
discretion. Ex. Il esas saja e diskreta persono. Atingar la evo
di diskreteso. Fidar a la diskreteso di ulu. V. exp.: <k>Modesta</k>
esas ta qua havas pri su opiniono moderata, ne exajerata, e ne
havas ecesa pretendi; <k>humila</k> esas ta, qua havas
pri su basa opiniono, e qua pozas su base, sub la ceteri; <k>diskreta</k>
esas ta qua evitas jenar or tedar la ceteri per sua demandi, o
nocar li per ne-prudenta agi, exemple revelanta la sekretaji;
IV<k />

<k>diskursar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make a speech,
deliver a discourse, an address to discant (<k>pri</k>);
<k>diskursachar</k> to rant.

<k>diskursiva*</k> <ex>(phil.)</ex> discursive:
proceeding regularly from premises to conclusion.

<k>diskutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to discuss (a
questoin, project, point of law, etc); <k>diskutachar</k>
to wrangle, dispute, cavil; <k>diskutebla</k>, <k>diskutinda</k>:
discussable, debatable. Def.: Examenar questiono ponderante la
«por» el la «kontre». Parolante pri personi ne havanta la
sama opiniono, kambiar argumenti pri ula temo; V

<k>dislokar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dislocate:
disarrange, put out of order or place; <ex>(milit.)</ex> to break
up (an army); to dismember (a state). Ex.: On dislokas, sive
mobili, utensili, mashini, sive armeo od armeo-korpo;
III<k />

<k>dismo</k> tithe; <k>impozar la dismo</k>
to t., levy t.s.

<k>disociar</k> <ex>(tr., chem.)</ex> to dissociate;
break up into consitutents.

<k>disonancar</k> <ex>(intr., mus.)</ex> to make a
dissonance, discord; (cf. <k>des</k>, <k>mis</k>, <k>neakordar</k>).

<k>dispacho</k> <ex>(mar. insur.)</ex> adjustment of
averages; <k>dispachisto</k> nautical assessor.

<k>disparata</k> <ex>(log.)</ex> disparate; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
incongruous; <k>disparatajo</k>, <k>disparateso</k> disparity. Def.:
Teknike e precize, aplikesas a du nocioni, qui ne apartenas a la
sama genero, nek esas genero l'una di l'altra. Vulgare e laxe,
dicenas pri omno quo esas tre nesimila, nekoheranta,
neharmonianta; III

<k>dispartigar</k> to dismember; take part from
part, take limb from limb.

<k>dispecigar</k> to dismember; take piece from
piece, carve up.

<k>dispensar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dispense (<k>ulu
 de ulo</k>) to exempt, excuse from, give leave not to do or
observe (<k>ulo</k>); <k>dispenso</k>
dispensation; (cf. <k>permisar</k>). Ex.: Dispensar de
la fasto. La granda evo dispensas la oldi militar. Ant.: <k>obligar</k>, <k>koaktar</k>.

<k>dispensario</k> dispensatory, dispensary <ex>(med.)</ex>
Def.: Loko en qua la povri povas konsultar medicinisti e recevar
flegi o medikamenti (sen lojar en ol); III

<k>dispersar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disperse, scatter.
Ex.: La vento dispersas la nubi, la folii. Armeo vinkinta
dispersas l'enemiki. Disperso di la Judi. V. exp.: <k>Dispersar</k>
esas preske sinonima di <k>dissemar</k>, ma kun ideo
plu agema, ideo di lanso, pulso ad fore; IV

<k>disponar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have the disposal
of, have (<k>ulo</k>) at one's disposal; to dispose of
(<k>ulo</k>); <k>disponebla</k> disposable,
available; <ex>(milit.)</ex> unattached; <k>disponebleso</k>
disposability: <ex>(milit.)</ex> state of being unattached; Ex.:
Ca homo disponas sua domo, sua havaji. (power of disposal). La
libri esas en vua dispono. Me havas cento de franki disponebla
por komprar. Oficiro, trupi disponebla. Me donas a vu la
disponebleso di mea havaji. Esar sub la dispono di ulu. (E. to be
at a person's beck and call).

<k>dispozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dispose, lay out,
parcel out; <k>dis(ad)o</k>, <k>diseso</k> disposition,
arrangement.

<k>disputar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have a dispute,
to quarrel, wrangle, bicker; <k>disputo</k> quarrel,
altercation; <k>disputachar</k> to squabble, brawl, wrangle
about trifles; <k>disputebla</k> disputable, contentable; <k>disputema</k>
disputatious, quarrelsome; <k>inter disputar</k> to
mutally quarrel. Def.: Diskutar senordine e grosiere; V

<k>dissemar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to disseminate: sow,
scatter (seed); to strew, (things); spread abroad (ideas, error,
truth, etc.).

<k>dissendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to spread, send in
different directions.

<k>dissolvar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to
dissolve, liquify; <ex>(fin.)</ex> liquidate, wind up; <k>diso</k>, <k>diseso</k>, <k>disuro</k> dissolution, solution; <k>disema</k>, <k>disiva</k>, <k>disivo</k> solvent, dissolvent. Ex.: Aquo dissolvas sukro.
Dissolvar societo. Dissolvo di parlamento, di mariajo.

<k>distar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be distant, be
remote; <k>disto</k> distance; <k>distanta de Paris
 per 5 km.</k> to be 5 km distant from Paris.

<k>distingar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to distinguish; set
apart; to characterize; to make distinct or different by sign,
mark or characteristic; <k>distingo</k> distinction: making
different; <k>distingeso</k> distinctness,
characteristicness; <k>distinganta</k>, <k>distingebla</k> distinct,
characteristic; <k>distingita</k> distinguished (person,
object); <k>distingiva</k> distinctive. Def.: Facar ulo por
ke altru povez discernar; III<k /><k />

<k>distraktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to distract, divert;
<k>distrakt(ad)o</k>, <k>distrakteso</k> distraction, diversion,
recreation; <ex>(fig.)</ex> absence of mind; <k>distraktita</k>
diverted; <ex>(fig.)</ex> absent-minded; <k>distraktanta:</k>, <k>distraktiva</k>
diverting entertaining. Def.: Deturnar la mento, l'atenco de sua
objekto per amuzivo, sive per irg altra moyeno. Existas menti
naturale distrakata o distraktebla, qui distraktesas da irga
extera kauzo, o mem da nula; IV<k /><k />

<k>distributar</k> <ex>(tr., gen. and tech.)</ex> to
distribute; to deal out, apportion, dispense; (cf. <k>disdonar</k>, <k>repartisar</k>). V. exp.: Distributar esas donar (o sendar)
a siversa personi o loki, ma kun dicerno, ne hazarde. Exemple, on
distributas premii a la skolani. Teknikale, on distributas la
vaporo a la du parti di cilindro en oportuna tempo; VI

<k>distrikto</k> district. Def.: Limitizita teritorio
sub un judicial resortiso.

<k>ditenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to detain; withhold,
keep back (what belongs to another); <k>diteno</k>
detention: withholding; <k>ditenanto</k>, <k>ditenero</k> holder,
possessor (of public property); one who withholds from another.
(N.B. not used in sense of imprison, cf. <k>enkarcerigar</k>).
Def.: Konservar til ula evento; II

<k>distreso</k> distress; <k>distreskrio</k> cry
of d.; <k>distresala signalo</k> signal of d.

<k>divagar</k> <ex>(intr., lit. and fig)</ex> to
ramble, wander, rove, stray, divagate. Ex.: Bestii divigas. La
divagi di aquofluo. Alkoholiko divagas en sua parolado, t.e.
vagas en sua parolado o mem sua pensado, sen ordino nek raciono;
III

<k>divano</k> divan. V. exp.: <k>Divano</k>
ne havas dors-apogilo, ma nur movebla kuseni. <k>Sofao</k>
havas dors-apogilo (esas quaze repozlito). <k>Kanapeo</k>
esas quaze larja stulego por plura personi, kun dors-apogilo e
brakio-apogili; II

<k>divenar</k> <ex>(intr., tr.)</ex> to become; to
get, grow, pass into some new state or condition; to become of;
be the final condition of; <k>quo il divenos?</k> what
will he become? or what will become of him? (cf. <k>divenesk</k>).
Ex.: Divenar malada, povro, richa, grasa. La homo, diveninta plu
saja, agas plu bone.

<k>divergar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to diverge (<k>de</k>, <k>ek</k>). Def.: Deviacar, dispersar di un punto a diferanta
direcion-o, -i; <ex>(fig.)</ex> esar ne-konkordanta. Ex.:
Lumradii divergas. Divergo di opinioni. Ant.: <k>konvergar</k>.

<k>diversa</k> sundry, diverse, several, various; <k>diversaji</k>
sundry articles: distinct things, not necessarily different in
kind; <k>diverseso</k> diversity; variety, multiplicity.
Def.: Qua esas plu multa kam un, ma ne granda nombro. Ex.:
Diversa personi. La diversa interesti di la nacioni. La diversa
senci di vorto.

<k>diversiono</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> diversion;
turning aside; <k>diversionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make,
cause a d. Def.: Atako (en kombato) por deturnar l'atenco e la
fortaji di la enemiko; simila taktiko en la konversado, por
deturnar ol de temo jenanta, desagreabla, nekonvenanta, e.c. (Ne
konfundenda kun <k>digreso</k>); III

<k>dividar</k> <ex>(tr., math. and gen.)</ex> to
divide (<k>ulo</k>, <k>per ulo</k>); <k>maxim granda
 komuna dividanto</k> greatest common divisor; <k>dividebla</k>
divisible (<k>per</k>); <k>dividendo</k> <ex>(math.,
fin.)</ex> dividend.

<k>divinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to divine: guess (by
any means); <k>divinajo</k>, <k>divinendo</k> puzzle, poser, riddle;
(cf. <k>konjektar</k>, <k>predicar</k>). Ex.: Divinar la
intenci di ulu. Divinar engimato. Me donas a vu di foyi divinar
ol. Divino di la futuro.

<k>divorcar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be divorced (<k>de</k>);
<k>divorcigar</k> to divorce; <k>divorcinta</k>, <k>divorcinto</k>
divorced (person).

<k>divulgar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to divulge; reveal,
make known (a secret, news, etc.).

<k>dizastro</k> disaster. Def.: Desfortuno tre granda
e subita, generale koncernanta multa homi o tota socio, ex. grava
vinkeso, granda incendio, naufrajo; III

<k>do</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> do: first tone of diatonic
scale.

<k>do</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> therefore, then, so,
consequently, (introduces a conclusion). Ex.: Me pensas, do me
existas. Il esas vua patro, do vu devas respektar il. L'alkoholo
foligas, do ol esas veneno.

<k>doario</k> jointure, dower, marriage-settlement
