(provided by the bride-groom or his family; cf. <k>dotar</k>);
<k>doariierino</k> dowager.

<k>docento</k> private docent; private teacher or
lecturer (university).

<k>docila</k> docile, tractable. Def.: Facile docebla
e duktebla; II-19. Ex.: Skolano docila. Docila kavalo.

<k>dogano</k> <ex>(institution)</ex> customs; <k>doganeyo</k>
custom-house, place; <k>doganpago</k>, <k>dogantaxo</k> custom-duty; <k>doganuniono</k>
c. union.

<k>doko</k> dock. Def.: Mar-baseno por konstruktar o
reparar navi; baseno cirkondita da kayi o warfi por charjar o
descharjar navi.

<k>doktoro</k> doctor; holder of a doctorate; <k>doktoreso</k>
doctorate; <k>doktoro pri yurcienco</k> d. of laws; <k>doktoro
 pri literaturo</k> d. of letters.

<k>dokumento</k> document; <k>dokumentizar</k> to
document; supply with d.s.

<k>dolo</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> fraud, deception, malice;
evil or criminal intent; <k>doloza trompo</k> fraudulent
deception; <k>doloza krimino</k> malicious crime. Def.:
En la kriminal yuro, ol signifikas la kontrelega volo vizanta
l'exekuto di krimino (doloza krimino); en la civila yuro: l' ago
intence kontrelega, ex. pri kontrati; VI

<k>dolca</k> pleasing to the taste: <k>dolca
 oranjo</k>, <k>vino</k> sweet orange, wine; <k>dolca odoro</k>, <k>(ek)sufluro</k> a sweet smell, breath; pleasing to the
ear: <k>dolca voco</k>, <k>murmuro</k> a sweet voice, a gentle
murmur; pleasing to the mind; <k>dolca influeso</k> a
gentle influence; <k>dolca memoro</k> a pleasant
remembrance; <k>dolca koloro</k>, <k>lumo</k> a soft (or
pleasing) color, light; <ex>(miscel.)</ex> <k>dolca vetero</k>
mild weather; <k>dolca dormo</k> a soft slumber; <k>dolca
 humoro</k> a gentle humour; <k>dolca kiso</k> a
sweet kiss; (cf. <k>sukroza</k>).

<k>dolio</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> dolly-end; <k>doliiero</k>
dolly, holding-on-tool. Def.: Doliiero esas specala instrumento,
qua uzesas en la rivetago pro impedar la riveto ekbatesar per la
martelagi. Dolio esas la kavajo, qua esas ye l'extremajo di la
doliiero; III

<k>dolmeno</k> domen, cromlech: table-stone. Def.:
Speco di megalita monumento; VI

<k>dolorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel a pain, to
suffer (physically; cf. <k>chagrenar</k>); <k>doloro</k>
physical suffering: pain, ache; <k>dolori</k> throes,
pangs; <k>doloranta</k>, <k>doloroza</k> painful, sore; <k>dolorigar</k>
to cause pain to (<k>ulu</k>), to make sore, make
suffer; <k>doloriganta</k> which causes pain, painful; <k>havar
 reumatismala dolori</k> to have rheumatic pains.

<k>domo</k> house; <k>domala</k> domestic;
relating to a house; <k>dometo</k> small h., cottage; <k>domestro</k>, <k>dommastro</k> head of h.; <k>domochefo</k>
major-domo; <k>domoguvernistino</k> house-keeper; <k>domkorpo</k>
main building.

<k>domajar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. sense)</ex> to damage;
to injure, harm, impair, spoil; <k>domajiva</k> injurious,
hurtful; <k>ye lua domajo</k> to his injury, cost; <k>sen
 domaja</k>, <k>ne domajata</k> undamaged. Ex.: La pluvo domajas la
rekoltajo. La kanono domajis ta edifico. V. exp.: vid. <k>detrimentar</k>.

<k>domicilo</k> domicile; residence, place of abode; <k>domicilala</k>
domiciliary; <k>domicilizar</k> to d., settle (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>dominacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have dominion
over, sovereign authority, sway over; <ex>(fig.)</ex> tower, rise
above, command, control; <k>dominaco</k> domination,
dominion; <k>dominacanta</k>, <k>dominacema</k> dominant, predominant,
prevailing; <k>dominacachanta</k> domineering. Ex.:
Napoleon deziris dominacar Europa. Dominacar la pasioni. Monto
dominacanta la maro. Fuorto dominacas la urbo. Religio
dominacanta.

<k>domtar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to subdue, subjugate,
quell. V. exp.: On <k>domtas</k> propre la sovaja
bestii (sen vere <k>amansar</k> oli, nek igar oli <k>domestika</k>).
On <k>domtas</k> figurale la pasioni, la furioza amaso
(turbo), e.c.; III

<k>donar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give; <k>dono</k>
giving; <k>donajo</k> what is given; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
gift (cf. <k>donacajo</k>); <k>donema</k>
generous; <k>don(at)ajo</k>, <k>donaji</k> datum, data. Ex.:
Donar manjajo. Donar donacajo. Donar sua filiino en mariajo.
Donar signo di vivo. Donar la manuo. Donar puniso, apetito, letro
ad ulo. V. exp.: Me <k>donas</k> manjajo ad ulu, ma me
ne donacas la manjajo, nam me postulas pekunio por ol. Ant.: <k>aceptar</k>, <k>recevar</k>.

<k>donacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give: make a
donation, a gift, a present of (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>), to
give away, bestow; <k>donacajo</k> gift; <k>donacario</k>donee;
<k>donacanto</k>, <k>donacinto</k>, <k>donacero</k> donor. Ex. Donacar almono.
Donacar (senrekompense) manjaji a la povri. V. exp.: vid <k>donar</k>.

<k>dop</k> <ex>(prep., in space)</ex> behind, back of,
after, posterior; (cf. <k>pos</k>); <k>dope</k>
from behind, in back; <k>dopa</k> rear, back, hinder; <k>dopajo</k>
object or part behind; <k>dop la domo</k> behind the
house; <k>dopa butiko</k> back-shop; <k>dopa korto</k>
back-yard; <k>dopa masto</k> after mast; mizzenmast; <k>dopirar</k>
to come after (not necessarily «to follow»); <k>doplando</k>
hinterland; <k>dopremar</k> to scull; <k>dopremilo</k>
sculling oar. Ant. <k>avan</k>.

<k>dorado</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> dorado: a species of
dolphin (Coryphaena hippurus).

<k>dorlotar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to coddle, pet; (<ex>fig.</ex>
to nurse); <k>dorlotachar</k> to pamper (a child, a
person); <k>me prizas dorlotar me</k> I love to take
my ease, to coddle myself. Def.: Traktar delikat-ege, -ache.

<k>dormar</k> <ex>(intr., tr.)</ex> to sleep, be
asleep, slumber; <k>dormanta</k> sleeping, dormant; <k>dormetar</k>
to doze; <k>dormema</k> (momentarily) sleepy (cf. <k>somnolar</k>);
<k>dormemo</k> sleepyhead; <k>dormeyo</k>
sleeping place, dormitory; <k>dormeskar</k> to fall
asleep; <k>dormigar</k> to lull, send (<k>ulu</k>)
to sleep; <k>dormigiva</k>, <k>dormo</k> soporific; <k>dormetigar</k>
to make drowsy; <k>la infanto dormas dolce</k> the
child sleeps a sweet sleep; <k>dormochambro</k> sleeping
chamber, cubicle.

<k>dorso</k> <ex>(anat. and of knife, book, hand,
etc.)</ex> back; <k>dorsala</k> relating to the back;
dorsal; <k>dorso an dorso</k> back to back; <k>dorsapogilo</k>
back of a seat; <k>dorsokorbo</k> basket (carried on
b.); <k>dorsokurva</k> round-shouldered; <k>dorsosako</k>
knapsack.

<k>doselo</k> dais; raised, canopied seat, fixed or
portable.

<k>dotar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to endow: furnish a
dowry, dower, marriage-portion to (<k>ulu</k>); supply
(some public institution with a permanent fund); <k>doto</k>, <k>doturo</k> dowry (provided by father or family of the bride),
(cf. <k>doario</k>) endowment; <ex>(fig.)</ex> gift,
talent; <k>sen dota puerino</k> a portionless girl; <k>la
 talento esas la maxim bona doturo quan on povas donar a sua
 filii</k> talent is the best dowry one can give his
children; <k>havar la doto plezar</k> to have the gift
of pleasing.

<k>dozo</k> <ex>(med., pharm.)</ex> dose; <k>dozigar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to put up a doze of, to apportion a dose of (<k>ulo</k>).

<k>dragar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dredge (out) (a
river, etc.), to explore with a drag; <k>dragilo</k>, <k>dragmashino</k>, <k>dragbatelo</k>, <k>dragnavo</k> dredge.

<k>dragomano</k> dragoman. Def.: Interpretisto en
Oriento; IV

<k>drajeo</k> sugar-plum. Def.: Mandelo od altra kozo
kovrita per harda sukrajo; V

<k>drakmo</k> <ex>(Gr. money)</ex> drachma; <ex>(weight)</ex>
dram: eighth part of a troy ounce.

<k>drapirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to drape: to cover
with drapery, hang in folds.

<k>drenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to drain (a field, a
wound, etc.); <k>drentubo</k> drainage pipe.

<k>dresar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to train, break in
(animals). V. exp.: On <k>dresas</k> l'animali por igar
li exekutar ula determinita (ofte ne naturala) movi, sive por
servar la homo (ex. kavalkado), sive por facar irga prodaji. Omna
domestika animalo esas <k>edukata</k> da sua mastro; ma
ne omni esas <k>dresita</k>. Me povas edukar chasokundo
(t.e. hundo de chasala raso) sen ule dresar lu (por la chaso o
por irga altra agado); VI

<k>driftar</k> <ex>(intr., nav.)</ex> to drift. Def.:
Esar pulsata da vento o mar-fluo exter sua voyo; II

<k>drilo</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> drill-handle, holder;
(cf. <k>borilo</k>, <k>trepano</k>). Def.: La instrumento qua
portas e movas la borilo (en metalo).

<k>drinkar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to drink; <k>drinkeyo</k>, <k>drinkerio</k> bar,
public house; <k>drinkopekunio</k> drink-money, tip; <k>drinkkansono</k>
drinking song; <k>drinkofumeyo</k> tap-room (lit. drink and smoke
place); <k>ne drinkebla</k> undrinkable.

<k>drogo</k> drug; <k>drogerio</k> druggist's establ.; <k>drogizar</k>
to physic, give a d. to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>su)</k>.

<k>dronar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to drown; <ex>(of ships)</ex> to
founder, go to the bottom; <k>dronito</k> a d.ed person. Def.:
Mortigar ulu, su per asfixio en liquido. V. exp.: La navisti ne <k>dronesis</k>, <k />
nam la navo ne dronesis, ma nur <k>sinkis</k> til la bordo; (cf.
II

<k>du</k> two; <k>duo</k> a couple, pair, dyad; <k>duima</k>, <k>duimo</k>
half (N.B. but «half» in composition is translated by <k>mi</k>
as, <k>mihoro</k>, <k>micirklo</k>); <k>duimigar</k> to divide in
half; <k>duopla</k>, <k>duoplo</k> double; <k>duopligar</k> to double,
to duplicate; <k>dufoye</k> two times, twice; <k>duala</k> dual; <k>dualo</k>
dual; number in gram.; <k>dualismo</k> dualism; <k>dekedu</k>
twelve; <k>duadek e tri</k> twenty-three; <k>dekeduo</k> a
dozen; <k>duadeko</k> a score; <k>duacenteun</k> two hundred
and one; <k>duacenteokadekesis</k> 286; <k>dekeduamil</k>
12,000; <k>duople kin esas dek</k> twice five is ten; <k>duima
 litro</k> half a liter; <k>duime aquo</k>, <k>duime vino</k> half
water, half wine; <k>duime fola</k> half foolish; <k>ye duima
 voyo</k> (at) half way, midway; <k>dividar duime (kun ulu)</k>
to go halves; <k>la soldati marchis duope</k> the soldiers
marched by twos; <k>omna duesma dio</k> every second day, every
other day; <k>la du</k> both (adjectively); <k>due</k> both
(adverbially); <k>li du iris a la staciono</k> they both went to
the station; <k>ni du konkordis</k> we were both agreed; <k>omna
 du esis ebria</k> both men were drunk; <k>dumasta navo</k>
two-masted ship; <k>plu kam duime</k> more than half; <k>il
 arivis ye du kloki</k> he arrived at two o'clock; <k>dumanua</k>
two-handed; <k>dupartigo</k> bipartition; <k>dupartisana</k>, <k>duala</k> bipartisan; <k>dusenca</k> double meaning;
equivocal; <k>duajo</k> equivocation; <k>duyarala</k> biennial
(cf. <k>miyarala</k>). DEFIRS

<k>dubar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to doubt; waver in opinion,
hesitate to believe; <k>dubala</k>, <k>dubanta</k> dubative; <k>dubema</k>, <k>dubinda</k>, <k>dubebla</k> doubtful, dubious, ambiguous, questionable; <k>dubanto</k>, <k>dubemo</k> doubter; <k>dubemeso</k> distrustfulness; <k>sen dube</k>
without doubt, undoubtedly. Ex.: Me ne dubas, ke il venos. Dubar
pri ulo. Solvar dubo.

<k>duk(ul)o</k> duke <k>(de)</k>; <k>dukino</k> duchess; <k>dukala</k>
ducal; <k>dukeso</k> (rank, dignity) dukedom; <k>dukio</k> duchy.
<k>duktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lead, conduct, bring along <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo).</k> V. exp.: vid. <k>guidar.</k>

<k>dum</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> during (the whole period spoken of);
marks interval of time an event has taken place in; <k>dume</k>
meanwhile, in the mean time, yet, still; <k>dum ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex>
while, whilst, during the time when. Ex.: Dum la nokto. Il
habitis dum plura yari en mikra vilajo. La mesajo arivis dum lua
absenteso. Dum ke vu repozos, me skribos. Dume la vetero esis
varma.

<k>dungo</k> manure, compost (artificial manure); <k>dungizar</k>
to m.; <k>dungotero</k> vegetable mold; (cf. <k>sterko</k>). Def.
Omno quon on mixas a la tero por igar ol plu fertila. On uzas
multa minerala dungi, qui ne esas sterko; VI

<k>dup(ul)o</k> dupe; <k>dupigar</k> to dupe, take in, make a
person believe a falsehood; <k>dupiganto</k>, <k>dupero</k> cheat,
trickster; <k>dupospozulo</k> cuckold. Ex. Il lasis su dupigesar
(da ulu) quale stultulo.

<k>durar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to last, endure, remain, continue,
hold out; (cf. <k>permanar</k>, <k>kontinua</k>); <k>duronta</k> to be
continued (cf. <k>pluso sequos</k>). Ex.: La piramidi di Egiptia
ankore duras. La skribado duras. Durigar diskurso, letro. Spaco e
duro. Dur-iva stofi, instrumenti. Duranta joyi, chagreni.

<k>durstar</k> <ex>(intr., also fig.)</ex> to thirst, be thirsty;
<k>durstigar</k> to cause t. to; <k>sen durstigar</k> to quench the t.
of.
<k>dushar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to douche: give a shower bath to.

<k>duvo</k> (barrel-) stave. Def. Duvi esas planki di specala
formo, ek qui on kompozas la bareli; III

<k>duyongo</k> dugong (Halicore dugong). Def.: Mar-hundo di la
Malayal insularo (India-oceano, e.c.); III

<k>habila</k> <ex>(physical, intellectual)</ex> able, clever,
skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy; <k>habila horlogifisto</k> a
clever clock-maker; <k>il esas habila en sua arto</k> he is clever
in his art; <k>habila fripono</k> a sharp rogue. V. exp.: On povas
divenar <k>"habila"</k> ne nur per studiado ma per
aktual experienco; on povas divenar <k>kapabla</k> per lernado
sen praktike aplikar sua savado. <ex>Ant.</ex>: <k>nehabila</k>, <k>neapta</k>.

<k>habilitar</k> <ex>(tr.; esp. juris.)</ex> to habilitate, to
qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar
minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso
heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.

<k>habitar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to inhabit, to live (in)
(permanently); (cf. <k>rezidar</k>); <k>habit(ad)o</k> habitation,
residing; <k>habiteyo</k> (place) habitation, abode, dwelling-place;
<ex>(zool.)</ex> haunt, habitat; <k>habitanto</k>, <k>habitero</k> inhabitant,
denizen; <k>habitebla</k> (in)habitable. V. exp.: <k>Habitar</k>
esas <k>rezidar</k> permanante en propra o fixa domo; <k>lojar</k>
esas <k>rezidar</k> tempe (kurte) che altra persono od en
gasteyo. La soldati lojas che la habitanti dil urbo. On <k>habitas</k>
urbo, lando, dum ke on <k>lojas</k> en hotelo, che amiko,
parento, en apartamento, en chambro, e.c.; I-410.

<k>hachar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hatch, shade by lines cut or
drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts; <k>hachajo</k>, <k>hachita karno</k> mince-meat; <k>hachuro</k> hatching; <k>hachilo</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex>
chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On
hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on
hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.

<k>hakar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an
axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. <k>hachar</k>); <k>hakachar</k>
to hack; <k>hak(ad)o</k>, <k>hakuro</k> chopping,hewing; a chop, cut; <k>hakisto</k>
chopper, hewer; <k>hakilo</k> a chopping instr. (as an axe); <k>hakileto</k>
a small cutting instr.; hatchet; <k>hakilostroko</k> stroke of an
axe; <k>hakiluyo</k> axe-holder, -case; <k>hakokultelo</k>
cleaver, chopping-knife.

<k>halo</k> a large room of considerable size; (<k>merkato</k>)
market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is
carried on; <k>halvendisto</k> market-, stall-keeper; <k>halotaxo</k>
market-dues; <k>linguo di la hali</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> Billingsgate
(language).

<k>haltar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to (make a) halt, stop; <k>haltigar</k>
to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to halt; to stop (<k>ulo</k>); <k>haltigilo</k>
a stopping instr., a catch; <k>haltez</k> <ex>(command.)</ex> halt!
stop there! that will do!

<k>haltero</k> dumb-bell; <k>halteragar</k>, <k>exercar su per halteri</k> to
do d. b. exercises.

<k>halucinar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have hallucinations, to
delude (<k>su</k>); <k>halucinigar</k> to cause h.s in (ulu); to
affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.

<k>hano</k> a fowl, hen or cock; <k>(fusil)</k> cock (of a gun
or pistol); <k>hanulo</k> cock, rooster (cf. <k>pultro</k>); <k>hanino</k>
hen; <k>hanyuno</k> pullet; <k>hanyuneto</k> chicken; <k>hanulokresto</k>
comb of a cock.

<k>hanolakto</k> mulled-egg, egg-flip. Def.: Drinkajo ek
vitelo quirlita en varma aquo sukrizita; V-621.

<k>hancho</k> hip (of persons), haunch, hind-quarter (of
animals); <k>hanchoflexar</k> to bend at the hips.
<k>handikapar</k> <ex>(tr., in sports and fig.)</ex> to handicap.

<k>hangaro</k> shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; <ex>(aviation)</ex>
hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.

<k>haro</k> a hair (of a person's head; cf. <k>pilo</k>); <k>hararo</k>
hair <ex>(collect.)</ex>; <k>haroza</k> hairy; <k>hartreso</k>
hair-plait, pigtail, queue; <k>haropelo</k> scalp; <k>hararacho</k>
mop, shock of hair; <k>hardikeso</k> a hair's breadth; <k>longhara</k>;
long haired.

<k>harda</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> hard, tough, indurate; <k>hardigar</k>
to harden <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; to temper (iron, etc.); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to indurate, toughen, inure; <k>hardiguro</k> temper (of metals); <k>hardeso</k>
hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita.
Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio <ex>(fig.)</ex>.
Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: <k>mola</k>.

<k>haringo</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> herring; <k>haringo fumizita</k>
smoked h.; <k>haringobando</k> shoal of h.

<k>harmoniar</k> <ex>(intr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to be in harmony
<k>(kun)</k>; <k>harmoniigar</k> to harmonize <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>harmoniala</k>, <k>harmonialo</k> harmonic (sound).

<k>harneso</k> harness (as of a horse); <k>harnesizar</k> to
harness; <k>harnesaro</k> (horse-) trappings, <k>sen harnesigar</k> to
unharness.

<k>hastar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to hasten, make haste; <k>hastigar</k>
to hurry <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>su)</k>; to press, push forward expedite;
(cf. <k>acelerar</k>, <k>plurapidigar</k>, <k>avancar</k>); <k>hastozege</k>
precipitously. Ex.: hastigar la pazo, la progreso di ulo. Il
departis hastoze. Il ekiris, ma sen hasto.

<k>hauo</k> <ex>(agri.)</ex> hoe; <k>hauagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
h.; <k>haueto</k>, <k>plata hauo</k> mattock. Def.: Instrumento fera kun
ligna mancho, por exkavar la tero; la fera parto esas larja,
plata e tranchanta, kun aristo en plano perpendikla a la mancho;
VI-533.

<k>haular</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to haul, heave in (cf. <k>tirar</k>);
to tow; <k>haulvoyo</k> tow-path; <k>haular la kanoto ye bordo</k>
haul the boat on board; <k>haular sur kord(eg)o</k> to haul, pull
upon a rope; <k>haular navo</k> to tow a ship; <k>haular kord(eg)o ad
 su</k>, <k>ad ulu</k> to haul in a rope.

<k>havar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have (<k>ulo</k> money, occasion,
motive, time, etc.; N.B. not to be used as verbal auxiliary); <k>havajo</k>, <k>havi</k> property, possessions, what one is worth.

<k>hazardo</k> (hap-)hazard, luck, chance, something uncertain
and unplanned; <k>hazarde</k> by chance, casually, accidentally,
perchance; <k>hazardala</k> accidental, fortuitous; <k>hazardoludo</k>
game of chance; <k>hazarde trovar</k> to find or meet unexpectedly; <k>ye
 la hazardo di la menuo</k> pot-luck; <k>ne fidez a hazardo</k> do not
trust to chance; <k>se vu hazarde trovos il bonhumora</k> if
perchance you find him in good humour.

<k>(la) Hebrea</k> (linguo): the Hebrew (language); <k>a</k>, <k>ala</k>
Hebrew, Hebraic; <k>ismo</k>, <k>ajo</k> Hebraism; <k>isto</k>
Hebraist; (cf. <k>Izraelido</k>, <k>Judo</k>).

<k>hego</k> hedge, hedgerow. Def.: Barilo o klozilo (cirkum
agro) formacita ek arbusti; IV-204.

<k>hegemonio</k> hegemony. Def.: Speco di dominaco o prepondero
di un naciono inter altri (historial e politikal termino);
III-603.

<k>heleboro</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> hellebore (genus: Helleborus); <k>heleboro
 verda</k>, <k>fetida</k>, <k>nigra</k> green, stinking, black (species of) h.

<k>helico</k> <ex>(arch., geom.)</ex> helix; (of a ship)
propeller; <ex>(bot.)</ex> tendril; <k>heliconavo</k> screw-ship; <k>helicatra</k>
helicoid, winding, spiral; (cf. <k>helicoida</k>); <k>helicoresorto</k>
spiral spring, coiled spring.

<k>helmo</k> <ex>(ancient)</ex> helmet. Def.: Specala formo di
kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.

<k>helpar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to help, aid, assist <k>(ulu</k>, <k>pri</k>, <k>por</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>helpo</k> help, assistance (cf. <k>sokursar</k>);
<k>helpanto</k>, <k>helpero</k>, <k>helpisto</k> assistant, helper; <ex>(in composition)</ex>
assistant-, under-; <ex>(on ships)</ex> mate; aide; <k>helpokirurgiisto</k>
assistant surgeon; <k>helpilo</k>, <k>helpivo</k> (instrument, object which
aids) aid, help, relief, assistance, auxiliary; <k>helpoverbo</k>
auxiliary verb; <k>helpar ulu levar su (staceskar)</k> to help
someone to lift himself (to rise); <k>kun la helpo di Deo</k> with
the help of God.

<k>hemo</k> home; <k>esar heme</k> to be at home; <k>hemodei</k>
lares, home-gods; <k>hemrestema persono</k> domesticated,
home-loving person; <k>hemfacita</k>, <k>hembakita</k> home-made, -baked.
V. exp.: La hemo povas esar ne kompleta domo, ma apartamento
mikra e mem nur un chambro; lo esencala esas, ke on sentas ke ol
esas personala "eseyo" (rezideyo), tote diferanta de
chambri di hotelo o di lojeyo; I-411.

<k>hepato</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> liver; <k>hepatala</k> hepatic; <k>pasteto
 de grasa hepati</k> pate de foie gras, potted goose livers.

<k>hepatito*</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> hepatitis, inflammation of the
liver; <ex>(min.)</ex> hepatite, liver stone.

<k>herbo</k> herb, a plant which does not have a woody stem
(cf. <k>herboro</k>); <k>herbaji</k> herbage; <ex>(fig.)</ex> grass
(cf. <k>gazono</k>); <k>herbala</k>, <k>herbatra</k>, <k>herboza</k> herbaceous, herby,
grassy; <k>herbostipeto</k> a blade of grass; <k>mala herbo</k>
weed.

<k>herbario</k> herbarium, classified collection of dried
plants.

<k>herboro</k> (medicinal) herb; <k>herboristo</k> herbalist. Def.:
Medicinala planto sikigita o preparita (en la formo en qua ol
vendesas da herboristo); VI-213.

<k>herdo</k> hearth, fireplace, hearthstone; floor or bottom of
an oven.

<k>heredar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inherit, be the heir to <k>(ulo</k>, <k>de ulu)</k>; <k>heredo</k> (act) inheriting; <k>heredajo</k> heritage
(estate), inheritance, heirloom, legacy; <k>heredanto</k>, <k>heredinto</k>
inheritor; heir; <k>heredala</k>, <k>heredita</k> hereditary; <k>sen heredanteso</k>
escheat (cf. <k>reversionar</k>). Ex.: Heredar havajo de
gepatri; Lua sola heredajo esis nobla nomo.

<k>herisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bristle (up) (of hair, feathers,
etc.); <k>heriso</k> bristling; <ex>(med.)</ex> horripilation; <k>herisita</k>
bristled, bristly; <ex>(fig.)</ex> hirsute, prickly; <k>herisigar la
 hari</k> to make one's hair stand on end.

<k>herso</k> <ex>(agri.)</ex> harrow; <ex>(fort.)</ex> portcullis
(set with spikes); <k>hersagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to h.

<k>hezitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to hesitate, falter, be doubtful;
<k>hezitigar</k> to cause <k>(ulu)</k> to h.; <k>hezitanta</k>, <k>hezitema</k>
hesitant, irresolute, faltering. Ex.: Il hezitas inter deziro e
shamo. Hezitar avan danjero. Karaktero hezitema. Hezitanta voco,
respondo.

<k>hibrida</k>, <k>hibrido</k> hybrid, mongrel (cf. <k>mestica</k>, <k>mulata</k>);
<k>hibridifar</k> to produce h. offspring; <k>hibridigo</k>
hybridization. Def.: Animali e planti qui venas de mixo di du
speci; V-33. Ex.: Mulo esas hibrido de kavalino ed asnulo.

<k>"hidalgo"</k> hidalgo: Spanish nobleman of lower
class.

<k>hidro</k> <ex>(myth., astron.)</ex> Hydra; <ex>(zool.)</ex>
hydrophis, a genus of fresh water polyps.

<k>hidrocefaleso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> hydrocephalus, water on the
brain; <k>hidrocefalo</k> (person) afflicted with h.

<k>hidroskopio</k> bletonism, art of finding under-water
sources.

<k>hiere</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> yesterday; <k>hiera</k> of y.; <k>hiere
 matine</k> yesterday (in the) morning; <k>la hiera dio</k>
yesterday; <k>prehiere</k> (on the) day before yesterday; <k>sep
 dii pos hiere</k> in a week.

<k>"high life"*</k> high life, life among the
aristocracy or the rich.

<k>hike</k> here, in this place; <k>hika</k>, <k>hikala</k> here, this; <k>hike
 ube</k> here where; <k>ad exter hike!</k> out of here! away with
you! <k>for hike</k> far distant from here; <k>tra hike</k>
through here, this way; <k>venez adhike</k> come here, hither; <k>til
 hike</k> (un)to here; <k>hike apude</k> near here; <k>hike
 interne</k> here within.
<k>hipar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have the hiccoughs, to hiccup.

<k>hiperbato</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> hyperbaton. Def.: Figuro di
retoriko konsistanta en renverso di l'ordino dil vorti; VI-135.

<k>hipertrofiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cause hypertrophy to; to
develop to an unusual or abnormal degree; <k>hipertrofio</k>, <k>hipertrofieso</k>
hypertrophy. Ant.: <k>atrofiar</k>.

<k>hipnotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in a hypnotic state; <k>hipnoto</k>
(state) hypnosis; <k>hipnotigar</k> to hypnotize <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>hipnotigo</k>
hypnotization; <k>hipnotismo</k> hypnotism (doctrine); <k>hipnotigato</k>
person hypnotized.

<k>hipokrita</k> hypocritical; <k>hipokrit(ul)o</k> hypocrite,
dissembler; <k>hipokriteso</k> hypocrisy; <k>hipokritajo</k> act of h.,
imposture; <k>hipokritesar</k> to be a h.; <k>hipokritagar</k> to act the h.;
<k>(dolce)</k> to wheedle.

<k>hipoteko</k> mortgage, hypothec; <k>hipotekizar</k> to m. <k>(ulo)</k>,
to hypothecate.

<k>hisar</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to hoist, raise, haul up
(sails), to run up (a signal, a flag); <k>hisar su</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to raise oneself, hoist oneself, get up.

<k>histerotomio*</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> dissection of the womb;
Caesarian operation.

<k>historiografo*</k> historiographer: official historian of a
prince or state.

<k>hivernar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex> of animals and persons) to
hibernate, to winter (cf. <k>estivar</k>); <ex>(milit.)</ex> to go
into winter quarters.

<k>ho!</k> Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there!
holla! <ex>(nav.)</ex> ahoy; <k>ho! ho!</k> heyday! dear me! bless
my soul! <k>ho la rejino desfortunoza!</k> oh, unfortunate queen!

<k>hodometro</k> <ex>(vehicle)</ex> hodometer, speedometer; <ex>(for
persons)</ex> pedometer; <k>(pazokontilo)</k>. Def.: Instrumento
por mezurar la disti paririta da (1) rotvehilo, (2) marchanto.

<k>hoko</k> hook; <k>hokoza</k>, <k>hokatra</k> curved, crooked, hooked,
bent; <k>portohoko</k> porter's h., cargo-handler's h.; <k>labiobarbo
 hokoza</k> curling mustache; <k>hoke forsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
pick (a lock).

<k>holografa</k> holographic: <k>holografa testamento</k> will
written in testators own hand.

<k>holokausto</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> holocaust, burnt offering.
Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79

<k>holoturio</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> holothurian: a kind of water
polyp (genus: Holothuria), trepang, beche de mer.

<k>homo</k> (species, inclusive of both sexes) man, a human
being, person; <k>homi</k> people, men and women; <k>homaro</k>
mankind, humanity (collect.); <k>homulo</k> a male (cf. <k>viro</k>,
<k>maskulo</k>); <k>homino</k> woman (cf. <k>muliero</k>); <k>homa</k>, <k>homala</k> human; <k>homeso</k> humanity, quality or condition of
being human (cf. <k>humaneso</k>); <k>homale</k> humanely
(possible, etc.); <k>homigar</k> to humanize, to make human; <k>homachulo</k>
a sorry fellow, wretch, a nobody; <k>homocidar</k> to murder; <k>hominodianto</k>
misogynist.

<k>homajar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to do (or pay, render) homage to (a
prince, a sovereign); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to pay one's respects to <k>(ulu)</k>;
<k>homajar la vertuo</k> to pay h. to virtue; <k>facar homajo a
 la mortinti</k> to render honor to the dead.

<k>honesta</k> honest, fair and straightforward in conduct,
thought, etc., free from deceit or fraud, upright, worthy; <k>honesteso</k>
honesty, probity, integrity, uprightness.

<k>honoro</k> honor; <k>honorala</k> honorary (guard, etc.); <k>honorinda</k>
worthy of h.; <k>honoroza</k> honorable, full of h.; <k>honorizanta</k>, <k>honoriva</k> honorary, honorific; <k>honorizar</k> to h., pay h. to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>per ulo)</k>; <k>honorizar su</k> to do oneself the h., esteem it an
h., take pride in; <k>honorpromiso</k>, <k>honorparolo</k>, <k>honorjuro</k> word of
h.; <ex>(milit.)</ex> parole; <k>honorlegiono</k> Legion of Honor; <k>honorkazo</k>, <k>honorskrupulo</k> a point of honor; <k>honorafero</k> an affair of h.; <k>honormenciono</k>
honorable mention; <k>honorumala</k> honorary: intended merely to
confer h.; possessing a title or place without performing the
duties of the position, IV-163; as <k>honorumala profesoro</k>
honorary (titular) professor; <k>senhonorigar</k> to dishonor,
deprive of h.

<k>honorario</k> honorarium, fee, emolument. Def.: Salario di
la "liberal arti" (advokato, medicinisto, e.c.);
IV-163.

<k>horo</k> hour, the twenty-fourth part of a day; (cf. <k>kloko</k>);
<k>horala</k> horal; <k>horope</k> hourly, by the h.; <k>horquarimo</k>
a quarter of an h.

<k>Hori</k> <ex>(Gr. rel.)</ex> Horæ, the three goddesses of the
seasons.

<k>hordo</k> horde, a nomadic group; <ex>(fig.)</ex> crowd, band,
pack.

<k>hordeo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> barley (Hordeum); <k>hordegrano</k> a
grain of b.; <ex>(fig., med.)</ex> stye; <k>hordesukro</k> b. sugar.

<k>horlojo</k> clock, time-piece; <k>horlojala</k> horologic; <k>horlojeto</k>, <k>poshhorlojo</k> a watch; <k>(ri) tensar horlojo</k> to wind the
c.; <k>kontrehorloje</k> backwards (on a dial); against the
clock.

<k>hororar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel dread mixed with
detestation, to abhor, detest, loath, dread, have a horror of <k>(pri</k>, <k>pro</k>, <k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>hororigar</k> to horrify, cause aversion to; <k>hororinda</k>
horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. <k>pavorar</k>.

<k>horoskopo</k> horoscope; <k>facar la horoskopo</k> to cast a
person's nativity.

<k>hospico</k> asylum, convalescent hospital, refuge (for the
infirm, poor, aged, etc.); (as in the Alps) hospice, inn for
travelers (kept by religious order). V. exp.: En <k>hospitalo</k>
on kuracas maladi; en <k>hospico</k> on mantenas (longe, o mem
por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado
konvalecanta povas ekirar <k>hospitalo</k> por enirar <k>hospico</k>;
IV-136.
<k>hosto</k> host, one who receives or entertains a guest.

<k>huo</k> <ex>(orni.)</ex> owl, particularly the white owl
(Athene noctua); <k>hueto</k> owlet; tawny owl, brown owl
(Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco); <k>huo nivea</k> snowy owl (Nyctea
nivea); <k>paserhuo</k> little owl (Glaucidium passerinum); <k>sparvierhuo</k>
hawk owl (Surnia ulula). (cf. IV-296).

<k>humana</k> humane, kind, compassionate, merciful; <k>human(ul)o</k>
a h. person, humanitarian; <k>humaneso</k> humaneness, humanity; <k>humanisto</k>
humanist, a student of the humanities; <k>humanala</k>, <k>humanema</k>
humanitarian; <k>humanismo</k> humanism; <k>humane</k> humanely; <k>humanigar</k>
to humanize, render humane (cf. <k>homigar</k>).

<k>humida</k> humid, wet, damp, moist; <k>humideso</k> (condition)
humidity; <k>humidajo</k> (object) the damp; <k>humidigar</k> to damp,
moisten, wet.

<k>humila</k> humble, meek, lowly; <k>humiligar</k> to humble,
humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o
submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri
gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta;
III-226. V. exp. vid. <k>diskreta</k>. Ant.: <k>superba</k>.

<k>humoro</k> <k>(bona</k>, <k>mala)</k> humor, temper, mood,
disposition; <ex>(old physiol.)</ex> one of the four bodily fluids
determining the temperament; <k>nekonkordo di humori</k>
incompatibility of temper(s); <k>havar dolca humoro</k> to have a
sweet temper; <k>esar en humoro laborar</k> to be in a working h. V.
Exp.: Humoro signifikas propre e primitive la liquidi di
l'organismo, qui pleis tanta rolo en l'antiqua medicino; konseque
e metafore la (bona o mala) mentala stando o tendenco
(instantala, per qua ol distingesas de <k>karaktero</k>). <k>Humuro</k>
esas speco di esprito, di ironio, qua expresas su en konversado
ed en la rakonti; III-416.

<k>humuro</k> humor, humour, jocose imagination (less
intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. <k>humoro</k>.

<k>hundo</k>, <k>hundulo</k>, <k>hundino</k> dog; <k>hundala</k> canine; <k>hundyunaro</k>
litter of pups; <k>parturar hundyuni</k> to whelp, to pup.

<k>hungrar</k>, <k>hungreskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be hungry (cf. <k>apetitar</k>);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to be eager, greedy; <k>hungroza</k> hungry; <k>hungregoza</k>
famished; <k>hungrigar</k> to make hungry, cause hunger; <k>hungregigar</k>
to starve <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>hungranta la glorio</k> greedy or eager
of glory.

<k>hurdo</k> hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for
folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be
leaped.

<k>habila</k> <ex>(physical, intellectual)</ex> able, clever,
skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy; <k>habila horlogifisto</k> a
clever clock-maker; <k>il esas habila en sua arto</k> he is clever
in his art; <k>habila fripono</k> a sharp rogue. V. exp.: On povas
divenar <k>"habila"</k> ne nur per studiado ma per
aktual experienco; on povas divenar <k>kapabla</k> per lernado
sen praktike aplikar sua savado. <ex>Ant.</ex>: <k>nehabila</k>, <k>neapta</k>.

<k>habilitar</k> <ex>(tr.; esp. juris.)</ex> to habilitate, to
qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar
minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso
heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.

<k>habitar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to inhabit, to live (in)
(permanently); (cf. <k>rezidar</k>); <k>habit(ad)o</k> habitation,
residing; <k>habiteyo</k> (place) habitation, abode, dwelling-place;
<ex>(zool.)</ex> haunt, habitat; <k>habitanto</k>, <k>habitero</k> inhabitant,
denizen; <k>habitebla</k> (in)habitable. V. exp.: <k>Habitar</k>
esas <k>rezidar</k> permanante en propra o fixa domo; <k>lojar</k>
esas <k>rezidar</k> tempe (kurte) che altra persono od en
gasteyo. La soldati lojas che la habitanti dil urbo. On <k>habitas</k>
urbo, lando, dum ke on <k>lojas</k> en hotelo, che amiko,
parento, en apartamento, en chambro, e.c.; I-410.

<k>hachar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hatch, shade by lines cut or
drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts; <k>hachajo</k>, <k>hachita karno</k> mince-meat; <k>hachuro</k> hatching; <k>hachilo</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex>
chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On
hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on
hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.

<k>hakar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an
axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. <k>hachar</k>); <k>hakachar</k>
to hack; <k>hak(ad)o</k>, <k>hakuro</k> chopping,hewing; a chop, cut; <k>hakisto</k>
chopper, hewer; <k>hakilo</k> a chopping instr. (as an axe); <k>hakileto</k>
a small cutting instr.; hatchet; <k>hakilostroko</k> stroke of an
axe; <k>hakiluyo</k> axe-holder, -case; <k>hakokultelo</k>
cleaver, chopping-knife.

<k>halo</k> a large room of considerable size; (<k>merkato</k>)
market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is
carried on; <k>halvendisto</k> market-, stall-keeper; <k>halotaxo</k>
market-dues; <k>linguo di la hali</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> Billingsgate
(language).

<k>haltar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to (make a) halt, stop; <k>haltigar</k>
to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to halt; to stop (<k>ulo</k>); <k>haltigilo</k>
a stopping instr., a catch; <k>haltez</k> <ex>(command.)</ex> halt!
stop there! that will do!

<k>haltero</k> dumb-bell; <k>halteragar</k>, <k>exercar su per halteri</k> to
do d. b. exercises.

<k>halucinar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have hallucinations, to
delude (<k>su</k>); <k>halucinigar</k> to cause h.s in (ulu); to
affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.

<k>hano</k> a fowl, hen or cock; <k>(fusil)</k> cock (of a gun
or pistol); <k>hanulo</k> cock, rooster (cf. <k>pultro</k>); <k>hanino</k>
hen; <k>hanyuno</k> pullet; <k>hanyuneto</k> chicken; <k>hanulokresto</k>
comb of a cock.

<k>hanolakto</k> mulled-egg, egg-flip. Def.: Drinkajo ek
vitelo quirlita en varma aquo sukrizita; V-621.

<k>hancho</k> hip (of persons), haunch, hind-quarter (of
animals); <k>hanchoflexar</k> to bend at the hips.
<k>handikapar</k> <ex>(tr., in sports and fig.)</ex> to handicap.

<k>hangaro</k> shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; <ex>(aviation)</ex>
hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.

<k>haro</k> a hair (of a person's head; cf. <k>pilo</k>); <k>hararo</k>
hair <ex>(collect.)</ex>; <k>haroza</k> hairy; <k>hartreso</k>
hair-plait, pigtail, queue; <k>haropelo</k> scalp; <k>hararacho</k>
mop, shock of hair; <k>hardikeso</k> a hair's breadth; <k>longhara</k>;
long haired.

<k>harda</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> hard, tough, indurate; <k>hardigar</k>
to harden <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; to temper (iron, etc.); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to indurate, toughen, inure; <k>hardiguro</k> temper (of metals); <k>hardeso</k>
hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita.
Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio <ex>(fig.)</ex>.
Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: <k>mola</k>.

<k>haringo</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> herring; <k>haringo fumizita</k>
smoked h.; <k>haringobando</k> shoal of h.

<k>harmoniar</k> <ex>(intr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to be in harmony
<k>(kun)</k>; <k>harmoniigar</k> to harmonize <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>harmoniala</k>, <k>harmonialo</k> harmonic (sound).

<k>harneso</k> harness (as of a horse); <k>harnesizar</k> to
harness; <k>harnesaro</k> (horse-) trappings, <k>sen harnesigar</k> to
unharness.

<k>hastar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to hasten, make haste; <k>hastigar</k>
to hurry <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>su)</k>; to press, push forward expedite;
(cf. <k>acelerar</k>, <k>plurapidigar</k>, <k>avancar</k>); <k>hastozege</k>
precipitously. Ex.: hastigar la pazo, la progreso di ulo. Il
departis hastoze. Il ekiris, ma sen hasto.

<k>hauo</k> <ex>(agri.)</ex> hoe; <k>hauagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
h.; <k>haueto</k>, <k>plata hauo</k> mattock. Def.: Instrumento fera kun
ligna mancho, por exkavar la tero; la fera parto esas larja,
plata e tranchanta, kun aristo en plano perpendikla a la mancho;
VI-533.

<k>haular</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to haul, heave in (cf. <k>tirar</k>);
to tow; <k>haulvoyo</k> tow-path; <k>haular la kanoto ye bordo</k>
haul the boat on board; <k>haular sur kord(eg)o</k> to haul, pull
upon a rope; <k>haular navo</k> to tow a ship; <k>haular kord(eg)o ad
 su</k>, <k>ad ulu</k> to haul in a rope.

<k>havar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have (<k>ulo</k> money, occasion,
motive, time, etc.; N.B. not to be used as verbal auxiliary); <k>havajo</k>, <k>havi</k> property, possessions, what one is worth.

<k>hazardo</k> (hap-)hazard, luck, chance, something uncertain
and unplanned; <k>hazarde</k> by chance, casually, accidentally,
perchance; <k>hazardala</k> accidental, fortuitous; <k>hazardoludo</k>
game of chance; <k>hazarde trovar</k> to find or meet unexpectedly; <k>ye
 la hazardo di la menuo</k> pot-luck; <k>ne fidez a hazardo</k> do not
trust to chance; <k>se vu hazarde trovos il bonhumora</k> if
perchance you find him in good humour.

<k>(la) Hebrea</k> (linguo): the Hebrew (language); <k>a</k>, <k>ala</k>
Hebrew, Hebraic; <k>ismo</k>, <k>ajo</k> Hebraism; <k>isto</k>
Hebraist; (cf. <k>Izraelido</k>, <k>Judo</k>).

<k>hego</k> hedge, hedgerow. Def.: Barilo o klozilo (cirkum
agro) formacita ek arbusti; IV-204.

<k>hegemonio</k> hegemony. Def.: Speco di dominaco o prepondero
di un naciono inter altri (historial e politikal termino);
III-603.

<k>heleboro</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> hellebore (genus: Helleborus); <k>heleboro
 verda</k>, <k>fetida</k>, <k>nigra</k> green, stinking, black (species of) h.

<k>helico</k> <ex>(arch., geom.)</ex> helix; (of a ship)
propeller; <ex>(bot.)</ex> tendril; <k>heliconavo</k> screw-ship; <k>helicatra</k>
helicoid, winding, spiral; (cf. <k>helicoida</k>); <k>helicoresorto</k>
spiral spring, coiled spring.

<k>helmo</k> <ex>(ancient)</ex> helmet. Def.: Specala formo di
kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.

<k>helpar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to help, aid, assist <k>(ulu</k>, <k>pri</k>, <k>por</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>helpo</k> help, assistance (cf. <k>sokursar</k>);
<k>helpanto</k>, <k>helpero</k>, <k>helpisto</k> assistant, helper; <ex>(in composition)</ex>
assistant-, under-; <ex>(on ships)</ex> mate; aide; <k>helpokirurgiisto</k>
assistant surgeon; <k>helpilo</k>, <k>helpivo</k> (instrument, object which
aids) aid, help, relief, assistance, auxiliary; <k>helpoverbo</k>
auxiliary verb; <k>helpar ulu levar su (staceskar)</k> to help
someone to lift himself (to rise); <k>kun la helpo di Deo</k> with
the help of God.

<k>hemo</k> home; <k>esar heme</k> to be at home; <k>hemodei</k>
lares, home-gods; <k>hemrestema persono</k> domesticated,
home-loving person; <k>hemfacita</k>, <k>hembakita</k> home-made, -baked.
V. exp.: La hemo povas esar ne kompleta domo, ma apartamento
mikra e mem nur un chambro; lo esencala esas, ke on sentas ke ol
esas personala "eseyo" (rezideyo), tote diferanta de
chambri di hotelo o di lojeyo; I-411.

<k>hepato</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> liver; <k>hepatala</k> hepatic; <k>pasteto
 de grasa hepati</k> pate de foie gras, potted goose livers.

<k>hepatito*</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> hepatitis, inflammation of the
liver; <ex>(min.)</ex> hepatite, liver stone.

<k>herbo</k> herb, a plant which does not have a woody stem
(cf. <k>herboro</k>); <k>herbaji</k> herbage; <ex>(fig.)</ex> grass
(cf. <k>gazono</k>); <k>herbala</k>, <k>herbatra</k>, <k>herboza</k> herbaceous, herby,
grassy; <k>herbostipeto</k> a blade of grass; <k>mala herbo</k>
weed.

<k>herbario</k> herbarium, classified collection of dried
plants.

<k>herboro</k> (medicinal) herb; <k>herboristo</k> herbalist. Def.:
Medicinala planto sikigita o preparita (en la formo en qua ol
vendesas da herboristo); VI-213.

<k>herdo</k> hearth, fireplace, hearthstone; floor or bottom of
an oven.

<k>heredar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inherit, be the heir to <k>(ulo</k>, <k>de ulu)</k>; <k>heredo</k> (act) inheriting; <k>heredajo</k> heritage
(estate), inheritance, heirloom, legacy; <k>heredanto</k>, <k>heredinto</k>
inheritor; heir; <k>heredala</k>, <k>heredita</k> hereditary; <k>sen heredanteso</k>
escheat (cf. <k>reversionar</k>). Ex.: Heredar havajo de
gepatri; Lua sola heredajo esis nobla nomo.

<k>herisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bristle (up) (of hair, feathers,
etc.); <k>heriso</k> bristling; <ex>(med.)</ex> horripilation; <k>herisita</k>
bristled, bristly; <ex>(fig.)</ex> hirsute, prickly; <k>herisigar la
 hari</k> to make one's hair stand on end.

<k>herso</k> <ex>(agri.)</ex> harrow; <ex>(fort.)</ex> portcullis
(set with spikes); <k>hersagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to h.

<k>hezitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to hesitate, falter, be doubtful;
<k>hezitigar</k> to cause <k>(ulu)</k> to h.; <k>hezitanta</k>, <k>hezitema</k>
hesitant, irresolute, faltering. Ex.: Il hezitas inter deziro e
shamo. Hezitar avan danjero. Karaktero hezitema. Hezitanta voco,
respondo.

<k>hibrida</k>, <k>hibrido</k> hybrid, mongrel (cf. <k>mestica</k>, <k>mulata</k>);
<k>hibridifar</k> to produce h. offspring; <k>hibridigo</k>
hybridization. Def.: Animali e planti qui venas de mixo di du
speci; V-33. Ex.: Mulo esas hibrido de kavalino ed asnulo.

<k>"hidalgo"</k> hidalgo: Spanish nobleman of lower
class.

<k>hidro</k> <ex>(myth., astron.)</ex> Hydra; <ex>(zool.)</ex>
hydrophis, a genus of fresh water polyps.

<k>hidrocefaleso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> hydrocephalus, water on the
brain; <k>hidrocefalo</k> (person) afflicted with h.

<k>hidroskopio</k> bletonism, art of finding under-water
sources.

<k>hiere</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> yesterday; <k>hiera</k> of y.; <k>hiere
 matine</k> yesterday (in the) morning; <k>la hiera dio</k>
yesterday; <k>prehiere</k> (on the) day before yesterday; <k>sep
 dii pos hiere</k> in a week.

<k>"high life"*</k> high life, life among the
aristocracy or the rich.

<k>hike</k> here, in this place; <k>hika</k>, <k>hikala</k> here, this; <k>hike
 ube</k> here where; <k>ad exter hike!</k> out of here! away with
you! <k>for hike</k> far distant from here; <k>tra hike</k>
through here, this way; <k>venez adhike</k> come here, hither; <k>til
 hike</k> (un)to here; <k>hike apude</k> near here; <k>hike
 interne</k> here within.
<k>hipar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have the hiccoughs, to hiccup.

<k>hiperbato</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> hyperbaton. Def.: Figuro di
retoriko konsistanta en renverso di l'ordino dil vorti; VI-135.

<k>hipertrofiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cause hypertrophy to; to
develop to an unusual or abnormal degree; <k>hipertrofio</k>, <k>hipertrofieso</k>
hypertrophy. Ant.: <k>atrofiar</k>.

<k>hipnotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in a hypnotic state; <k>hipnoto</k>
(state) hypnosis; <k>hipnotigar</k> to hypnotize <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>hipnotigo</k>
hypnotization; <k>hipnotismo</k> hypnotism (doctrine); <k>hipnotigato</k>
person hypnotized.

<k>hipokrita</k> hypocritical; <k>hipokrit(ul)o</k> hypocrite,
dissembler; <k>hipokriteso</k> hypocrisy; <k>hipokritajo</k> act of h.,
imposture; <k>hipokritesar</k> to be a h.; <k>hipokritagar</k> to act the h.;
<k>(dolce)</k> to wheedle.

<k>hipoteko</k> mortgage, hypothec; <k>hipotekizar</k> to m. <k>(ulo)</k>,
to hypothecate.

<k>hisar</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to hoist, raise, haul up
(sails), to run up (a signal, a flag); <k>hisar su</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to raise oneself, hoist oneself, get up.

<k>histerotomio*</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> dissection of the womb;
Caesarian operation.

<k>historiografo*</k> historiographer: official historian of a
prince or state.

<k>hivernar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex> of animals and persons) to
hibernate, to winter (cf. <k>estivar</k>); <ex>(milit.)</ex> to go
into winter quarters.

<k>ho!</k> Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there!
holla! <ex>(nav.)</ex> ahoy; <k>ho! ho!</k> heyday! dear me! bless
my soul! <k>ho la rejino desfortunoza!</k> oh, unfortunate queen!

<k>hodometro</k> <ex>(vehicle)</ex> hodometer, speedometer; <ex>(for
persons)</ex> pedometer; <k>(pazokontilo)</k>. Def.: Instrumento
por mezurar la disti paririta da (1) rotvehilo, (2) marchanto.

<k>hoko</k> hook; <k>hokoza</k>, <k>hokatra</k> curved, crooked, hooked,
bent; <k>portohoko</k> porter's h., cargo-handler's h.; <k>labiobarbo
 hokoza</k> curling mustache; <k>hoke forsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
pick (a lock).

<k>holografa</k> holographic: <k>holografa testamento</k> will
written in testators own hand.

<k>holokausto</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> holocaust, burnt offering.
Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79

<k>holoturio</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> holothurian: a kind of water
polyp (genus: Holothuria), trepang, beche de mer.

<k>homo</k> (species, inclusive of both sexes) man, a human
being, person; <k>homi</k> people, men and women; <k>homaro</k>
mankind, humanity (collect.); <k>homulo</k> a male (cf. <k>viro</k>,
<k>maskulo</k>); <k>homino</k> woman (cf. <k>muliero</k>); <k>homa</k>, <k>homala</k> human; <k>homeso</k> humanity, quality or condition of
being human (cf. <k>humaneso</k>); <k>homale</k> humanely
(possible, etc.); <k>homigar</k> to humanize, to make human; <k>homachulo</k>
a sorry fellow, wretch, a nobody; <k>homocidar</k> to murder; <k>hominodianto</k>
misogynist.

<k>homajar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to do (or pay, render) homage to (a
prince, a sovereign); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to pay one's respects to <k>(ulu)</k>;
<k>homajar la vertuo</k> to pay h. to virtue; <k>facar homajo a
 la mortinti</k> to render honor to the dead.

<k>honesta</k> honest, fair and straightforward in conduct,
thought, etc., free from deceit or fraud, upright, worthy; <k>honesteso</k>
honesty, probity, integrity, uprightness.

<k>honoro</k> honor; <k>honorala</k> honorary (guard, etc.); <k>honorinda</k>
worthy of h.; <k>honoroza</k> honorable, full of h.; <k>honorizanta</k>, <k>honoriva</k> honorary, honorific; <k>honorizar</k> to h., pay h. to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>per ulo)</k>; <k>honorizar su</k> to do oneself the h., esteem it an
h., take pride in; <k>honorpromiso</k>, <k>honorparolo</k>, <k>honorjuro</k> word of
h.; <ex>(milit.)</ex> parole; <k>honorlegiono</k> Legion of Honor; <k>honorkazo</k>, <k>honorskrupulo</k> a point of honor; <k>honorafero</k> an affair of h.; <k>honormenciono</k>
honorable mention; <k>honorumala</k> honorary: intended merely to
confer h.; possessing a title or place without performing the
duties of the position, IV-163; as <k>honorumala profesoro</k>
honorary (titular) professor; <k>senhonorigar</k> to dishonor,
deprive of h.

<k>honorario</k> honorarium, fee, emolument. Def.: Salario di
la "liberal arti" (advokato, medicinisto, e.c.);
IV-163.

<k>horo</k> hour, the twenty-fourth part of a day; (cf. <k>kloko</k>);
<k>horala</k> horal; <k>horope</k> hourly, by the h.; <k>horquarimo</k>
a quarter of an h.

<k>Hori</k> <ex>(Gr. rel.)</ex> Horæ, the three goddesses of the
seasons.

<k>hordo</k> horde, a nomadic group; <ex>(fig.)</ex> crowd, band,
pack.

<k>hordeo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> barley (Hordeum); <k>hordegrano</k> a
grain of b.; <ex>(fig., med.)</ex> stye; <k>hordesukro</k> b. sugar.

<k>horlojo</k> clock, time-piece; <k>horlojala</k> horologic; <k>horlojeto</k>, <k>poshhorlojo</k> a watch; <k>(ri) tensar horlojo</k> to wind the
c.; <k>kontrehorloje</k> backwards (on a dial); against the
clock.

<k>hororar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel dread mixed with
detestation, to abhor, detest, loath, dread, have a horror of <k>(pri</k>, <k>pro</k>, <k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>hororigar</k> to horrify, cause aversion to; <k>hororinda</k>
horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. <k>pavorar</k>.

<k>horoskopo</k> horoscope; <k>facar la horoskopo</k> to cast a
person's nativity.

<k>hospico</k> asylum, convalescent hospital, refuge (for the
infirm, poor, aged, etc.); (as in the Alps) hospice, inn for
travelers (kept by religious order). V. exp.: En <k>hospitalo</k>
on kuracas maladi; en <k>hospico</k> on mantenas (longe, o mem
por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado
konvalecanta povas ekirar <k>hospitalo</k> por enirar <k>hospico</k>;
IV-136.
<k>hosto</k> host, one who receives or entertains a guest.

<k>huo</k> <ex>(orni.)</ex> owl, particularly the white owl
(Athene noctua); <k>hueto</k> owlet; tawny owl, brown owl
(Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco); <k>huo nivea</k> snowy owl (Nyctea
nivea); <k>paserhuo</k> little owl (Glaucidium passerinum); <k>sparvierhuo</k>
hawk owl (Surnia ulula). (cf. IV-296).

<k>humana</k> humane, kind, compassionate, merciful; <k>human(ul)o</k>
a h. person, humanitarian; <k>humaneso</k> humaneness, humanity; <k>humanisto</k>
humanist, a student of the humanities; <k>humanala</k>, <k>humanema</k>
humanitarian; <k>humanismo</k> humanism; <k>humane</k> humanely; <k>humanigar</k>
to humanize, render humane (cf. <k>homigar</k>).

<k>humida</k> humid, wet, damp, moist; <k>humideso</k> (condition)
humidity; <k>humidajo</k> (object) the damp; <k>humidigar</k> to damp,
moisten, wet.

<k>humila</k> humble, meek, lowly; <k>humiligar</k> to humble,
humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o
submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri
gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta;
III-226. V. exp. vid. <k>diskreta</k>. Ant.: <k>superba</k>.

<k>humoro</k> <k>(bona</k>, <k>mala)</k> humor, temper, mood,
disposition; <ex>(old physiol.)</ex> one of the four bodily fluids
determining the temperament; <k>nekonkordo di humori</k>
incompatibility of temper(s); <k>havar dolca humoro</k> to have a
sweet temper; <k>esar en humoro laborar</k> to be in a working h. V.
Exp.: Humoro signifikas propre e primitive la liquidi di
l'organismo, qui pleis tanta rolo en l'antiqua medicino; konseque
e metafore la (bona o mala) mentala stando o tendenco
(instantala, per qua ol distingesas de <k>karaktero</k>). <k>Humuro</k>
esas speco di esprito, di ironio, qua expresas su en konversado
ed en la rakonti; III-416.

<k>humuro</k> humor, humour, jocose imagination (less
intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. <k>humoro</k>.

<k>hundo</k>, <k>hundulo</k>, <k>hundino</k> dog; <k>hundala</k> canine; <k>hundyunaro</k>
litter of pups; <k>parturar hundyuni</k> to whelp, to pup.

<k>hungrar</k>, <k>hungreskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be hungry (cf. <k>apetitar</k>);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to be eager, greedy; <k>hungroza</k> hungry; <k>hungregoza</k>
famished; <k>hungrigar</k> to make hungry, cause hunger; <k>hungregigar</k>
to starve <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>hungranta la glorio</k> greedy or eager
of glory.

<k>hurdo</k> hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for
folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be
leaped.

<k>ya</k> indeed, most certainly, truly (used in a sentence to lend emphasis, to confirm a statement); 
<k>esis ya mea kulpa</k> it was truly my fault; <k>me ya facis to</k> it was I indeed who did it.

<k>yaro</k> year, twelvemonth; <k>yarala</k> yearly, annual; relating to y.; -ala (od, 
<k>unyara</k>) <k>planti</k> annual plants; <k>yarlibro</k> yearbook, annual (cf. 
<k>almanako</k>); <k>singla</k>, <k>omnayara</k>, <k>yare</k> yearly; which takes place every year; 
<k>yardeko</k> decade; <k>yardeka</k> happening every ten years (cf. <k>dekyara</k>); 
<k>yarcento</k> century; <k>miyara</k> twice a year; <k>yarrento</k> annuity; 
<k>cayare</k>, <k>yara</k> this year; <k>ante un yaro</k> one year ago; <k>en yaro mezvalora</k> 
in the average year, one year with another.
<k>yardo</k> (<ex>nav.</ex>) yard (for a sail), yardarm; <k>yardo granda</k> main y.

<k>ye</k> preposition of indefinite meaning to be used when no other preposition covers the meaning; 
especially denoting position, place, precise situation, time: <k>ye la fino di la libro</k> 
at the end of the book; <k>il prenis il ye la manuo</k> he took him by the hand; <k>ye ca vorti</k> 
at these words; <k>ye la dimezo</k> at midday; y<k>e dek metri de me</k> at (or, within) ten meters of me.

<k>yen</k> (conjunction with an interjectional character) (with or without <k>hike</k>, <k>ibe</k>) here is, there is; 
(<ex>interj. meaning</ex>) look here! behold! lo! <k>yen la volfo</k> here is the wolf; look, the wolf! 
<k>yen (hike) me</k> here I am; <k>yen (ibe) lu</k> there he is; <k>yen me</k> behold, it is I! 
<k>yen lu</k> there he comes; <k>yen pomi</k>, <k>prenez le bona</k> here are apples, take the good ones; 
<k>yen (ke) la treno arivas</k> here comes the train; <k>yen quale la kozi eventis</k> 
this is how things happened; <k>yen me itere</k> here I am again.
<k>yolo</k> jolly-boat; a ships boat of medium size; yawl.

<k>yuna</k> young; <k>yunesala</k> juvenile, youthful; <k>yuno</k>, <k>yunulo</k>, <k>yunino</k> a young person; 
<k>yuneso</k> (<ex>time</ex>) youth; <k>yunaro</k> (<ex>collect.</ex>) youth; <k>yunesala stroko</k> prank, frolic; 
<k>yunesala aspekto</k> youthfulness (in appearance). Note: The suffix <k>yunid</k> denotes the descendant, offspring of persons: 
<k>Izraelido</k>, <k>Napoleonido.</k> For progeny other than of persons <k>yunyuno</k> is used: 
<k>bovyuno</k>, <k>kavalyuno</k>, <k /> etc. V. exp.: vid. <k>anciena.</k> Ant.: <k>olda.</k>

<k>yuro</k> right (founded on law, property, vested interest) legal-right, -title, -authority; right (moral claim founded on justice, equity); (cf. 
<k>lego</k>, <k>yusteso</k>); <k>yurocienco</k> law (as a science); jurisprudence; <k>yuristo</k> jurist; 
<k>yurizar</k> to entitle, authorize, give the (legal) right to; (cf. <k>darfar</k>); 
<k>yurizita</k> entitled, legitimate, lawful; <k>yurizo</k> authorization; <k>yuriziti</k> (<ex>jur.</ex>) assigns. 
Ex.: La legi definas la yuri di la homi. La yuro votar esas civitanala yuro. Yuro naturala. 
Yuro defensar su, parolar (pri), laborar.

<k>yusta</k> just, equitable, rightful, fair, justifiable (cf. <k>yurizita</k>, <k>equitatoza</k>, <k>justa</k>); 
<k>yust(ul)o</k> a just act; <k>yusteso</k> (moral) justness, justice, fairness, uprightness, integrity (cf. <k>equitato</k>, <k>yuro</k>); 
<k>yustigar</k> to make just (cf. <k>justifikar</k>); <k>esez yusta e ne timez</k> be just and fear not. 
Def.: Konforma a personala justeso, a la yuro, a la raciono.

<k>gabano</k> water proof cloak with hood and sleeves; <ex>(naut.)</ex>
pilot-coat.
<k>gabaro</k> lighter, barge (for loading and unloading ships).

<k>gafo</k> boat-hook; <ex>(fig.)</ex> gaff (as used to secure
heavy fish).

<k>gaino</k> a long narrow vertical holder, sheath, scabbard
(as for a sword, bayonet, etc.: <k>en gainigar</k> to sheath) a
sword, etc. V. exp: vid. <k>etuyo.</k>

<k>gajo</k> pledge, pawn, deposit, gage; something given as
security for repayment of money borrowed; <k>gajopekunio</k>
earnest money; <k>gajohomo</k> hostage; <k>gajizar</k> to give as
a pledge, secure; <k>depozar (ulo) gaje o kom gajo</k> to pawn; <k>prenar
 kom gajo</k> to hold as pledge; <k>pagar (o donar) gajo
 (pekunio)</k> to pay a deposit.

<k>gala</k> <ex>(adj.)</ex> gala; <k>galadineo</k> gala dinner; <k>galafesto</k>
gala festival; <k>galarobo</k> a gala robe, festive dress. V. exp.:
Ica vorto uzesas precipue adjektive, por qualifikar festo, dineo,
reprezento, e.c. On uzos do ol kom unesma elemento di kompozita
vorti; IV-11.

<k>galanta</k> gallant; polite and attentive to ladies; <k>galantajo</k>
act of gallantry, courteous act (to ladies).

<k>galero</k> <ex>(antiq. vessel)</ex> galley; <k>galerano</k> one
of the crew of the g.; <ex>(fig.)</ex> g.slave (cf. <k>bagnano</k>).

<k>galerio</k> gallery, a long narrow room, hall or passageway;
highest balcony <ex>(in theaters, churches)</ex>; balcony on stern
of ship; drift tunnel, <ex>(in mining or fortification)</ex> <k>galerispektanti</k>,
<k>galeriantaro</k> the gallery, people seated in g.

<k>galimatiaso</k> galimatias, jargon, gibberish. V. exp.:
Galimatiaso ne estas linguo, ma diskurso o parolado qua estas
gramatikale korekta ma konfuza ed obskura per la stilo; VII-158.

<k>galono</k> galoon, a narrow trimming, lace of gold, silver,
silk, etc.; <k>galonizita</k> galooned.

<k>galopar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> <k>galopigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>: to
gallop; <k>galopetar</k> to canter; <k>galopegante</k> at full gallop;
<k>galopanta ftizio</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> galloping consumption.
<k>galosho</k> galosh: a shoe with a wooden sole.

<k>galvanala</k> galvanic, related to galvanism; <k>galvanismo</k>
galvanism, galvanic (or voltaic) electricity.

<k>galvanizar</k> <ex>(tr. elec., and fig.)</ex> to
galvanize, electrify; (cf. <k>galvanoplastar</k>).

<k>gamo</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> gamut, scale. Def.: Sequo
di la soni di ula tono en l'ordino di alteso (ex.: c, d, e, f, g,
a, b esas la gamo di la tono di C); IV-467.

<k>gambo</k> leg, shank; <k>gamboza</k>, <k>gambizita</k>
legged; <k>bon</k>, <k>belgamboza</k>well made about the
legs; <k>gambo ligna o artificala</k> wooden, artificial
leg; <k>gambalo</k> boot-leg; <k>gambarmo</k>
leg-guard; <k>sen gamba</k> legless.

<k>gambitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to trip up (ulu); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
(in chess) to play a gambit.

<k>gambolar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to gambol, skip
about in frolic, romp.

<k>gamelo</k> <ex>(milit., nav.)</ex> mess-bowl,
-platter; <ex>(fig.)</ex> mess; <k>gamelokamarado</k>
messmate; <k>manjar gamele</k> to mess to-gether.

<k>ganar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gain, to earn, to win;
<k>ganajo</k> what is gained; <k>ganiganta</k>
lucrative, profitable; <k>ganema</k> covetous, greedy
(cf. <k>avida</k>); <k>ganemeso</k> cupidity;
<k>ganar sua nutrivi</k> to make one's living; <k>ganar
 sua proceso</k> to win one's case; <k>ganar dek franki</k>
to earn (or make) ten francs; <k>ganar premio</k> to win
a prize; <k>ganar batalio</k> gain a battle; <k>ganar
 l'amo</k> gain the love.

<k>gangrenar</k> <ex>(intr. med.)</ex> to be affected
with gangrene; <k>gangrenigar</k>, <k>gangrenifar</k><ex>(tr., intr.)</ex>
to g., to produce mortification; <k>gangreno</k> g., <ex>(fig.)</ex>
corruption.

<k>ganso</k> <ex>(orni.)</ex> goose; <k>gansulo</k>
gander; <k>gansoyuno</k> gosling; <k>gansoplumo</k>
quill pen; <k>gansopedo</k> foot of a g.; <k>gansopelo</k>gooseflesh, creeping of the flesh; <k>gansomarcho</k>
Indian file, single file; <k>gansopazo</k> goose-step
(milit.)

<k>ganto</k> glove; <k>gantizar</k> to g.,
fit with g.; <k>armo ganto</k>, <k>fera ganto</k>gantlet,
gauntlet.

<k>gapar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to gape with wonder or
curiosity (like a simpleton).

<k>garar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to put or place to one
side of a road or way (temporarily for protective purposes); to
shunt, switch, (trains on a siding); <k>garar su</k> to
turn aside (as to allow another to pass), to give way (as a
fencer to protect himself); <k>garvoyo</k> (R.R.)
siding, shunt-line; <k>gareyo</k> a side place; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
a garage (for autos). Def.: Pozar latere ad ula voyo, en halto o
rezervo, quaze depozita o shirmata; IV-103. Ex.: On garas treni
sur gar-voyi (N.B. gareyo ne esas staciono). On garas bateli en
la protui o gareyi (larjigita parti) di kanalo. La pasanti en la
stradi garas su de la veturi o por lasar altru pasar. La
skermanto garas su por «kovrar» (protektar) sua korpo ed evitar
la stroki di espado.

<k>garantiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to guarantee,
warrant; (cf. <k>certigar</k>, <k>responsar</k>, <k>kaucionigar</k>).
Ex.: Garantiar la pago di debajo. Me garantias ca posh-horlojo
pur un yaro. Me ne povas garantiar la vereso di ta aserto.

<k>garbo</k> sheaf (of wheat, etc.); <k>aquo
 garbo</k> sheaf-like cluster of jets; <k>fairo garbo</k>
fireworks resembling a sheaf; <k>garbamaso</k> cock,
stack, rick.

<k>gardar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gaurd (persons); to
tend (beasts); <k>gardar su</k> to beware, take heed; <k>gardisto</k>
a guard; <k>gardar per la okuli</k> not to lose sight of;
<k>gardohundo</k> watch-dog; <k>gardonavo</k>
g. ship; <k>gardez vu por ke on ne videz vu</k> beware
that no one sees you; <k>gardar la karcerani</k> to
guard prisoners; <k>gardar la mutoni</k> to take care of
the sheep.

<k>gardeno</k> garden; <k>gardenkultivar</k> to g.; <k>gardenkultiv(ad)o</k>
horticulture; <k>gardenfesto</k>, <k>gardenpartio</k> g. party.

<k>gareno</k> warren; <k>garenkuniklo</k> rabbit of a w.; <k>kuniklo
 gareno</k> rabbit w.

<k>gargarar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gargarize, to gargle (the
throat) <k>(ulu</k>, <k>su)</k>; <k>gargarivo</k> a gargle, gargative.

<k>garnisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to furnish with things necessary
to complete or embellish; <k>garnisar biblioteko</k>, <k>butiko</k> to stock
a library, a shop; <k>garnisar fortreso</k> to supply a fortress with
provisions, ordnance, ammunition and stores; <k>elua bela denti
 garnisas lua boko</k> her beautiful teeth set off her mouth; <k>garnisar
 disho</k> to garnish a dish; <k>garnisar chapelo per flori</k> to
trim a hat with flowers.

<k>garnituro</k> garniture, ornamental appendages,
embellishment, furniture, dress.

<k>garoto</k> short piece of wood used to tighten anything,
especially cords by twisting around; packing-stick; <k>garotagar</k>
to garrote, strangle (as in Spain); <k>garotligar</k> to make fast,
with or in a garrote; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to pinion, strangle.

<k>gaso</k> gas; <k>gasa</k> gaseous, which is g.; <k>gasala</k>, <k>gasatra</k> gaseous, relating to g., gasiform ; <k>gasoza</k>
gaseous: full of g.; <k>gasifar</k> to produce, make g.; <k>gasiferio</k>
g. works; <k>gasbrutilo</k> g. burner; <k>gaskontilo</k>
gas-meter; <k>gasigar</k> to gasify.

<k>gasto</k> guest; <k>gastesar</k> to be a g., to stay, lodge (<k>che
 ulu</k>); <k>gastigar</k> to receive (<k>ulu</k>) as a g.; to lodge
(<k>ulu</k>); <k>gastigo</k> lodging, putting up (a g.); <k>gastigema</k>
hospitable; <k>gasteyo</k> g. place. - DER

<k>gastralgio*</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> gastralgia: gastric neuralgia,
pain in the abdomen; belly-ache.

<k>gastronomo</k> gastronome, epicure. Def.: Homo qua havas
subtila gusto e savas dicernar la qualesi di la manjaji e
drinkaji; VII-155. V. exp.: vid. <k>gurmando</k>.

<k>gastronomio</k> gastronomy. Def.: Quaza arto di la
gastronomo.

<k>gaujar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gauge, measure (the capacity of),
to take the g. of. Def.: Mezurar la konteno (interna volumino) di
navo, barelo. e.c.; III-75.

<k>gavar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cram, gorge (with food),
(artificially) to fatten (animals).

<k>gavoto</k> gavot(te): a kind of lively dance or tune
(French).

<k>gaya</k> gay, lively, merry, cheerful; <k>gayeso</k> gaiety,
merriment, hilarity, mirth, glee; <k>gayesar</k> to be g.; <k>gayigar</k>
to make (ulu) merry, cheer, enliven, gladden; <k>gayiganta</k>, <k>gayiva</k>
exhilarating; (cf. <k>joyo</k>). Ant.: <k>trista</k>.
<k>gazono</k> grass-sod, turf; <k>gazonizar</k> to turf, sod; <k>gazoneyo</k>, <k>gazonagro</k>, <k>gazonbedo</k> lawn, greensward, grass plot.
<k>«geisha»</k> geisha, Japanese singing or dancing girl.

<k>gelto</k> commission money, percentage on sales, bonus.
Def.: Sumo po cento pagata a komizi, vendisti, e.c. ek lia vendi;
II-75.

<k>genero</k> genus; <k>generala</k> general, generic; <k>generale</k>
generally, in general; <k>generaleso</k> <ex>(character)</ex>
generality; <k>generalajo (la)</k> <ex>(objective)</ex> generality; <k>generaligar</k>
to generalize; <k>generalig(ad)o</k>, <k>generuro</k> generaliz-ing, -ation.

<k>genio</k> genius, particular natural talent, uncommon
intellectual power; <ex>(fig)</ex> attendant spirit; <k>genioza</k>
full of g.; <k>havar genio por aferi</k>, <k>por muziko</k> to have a g.
for business, for music; <k>il havas la doto di granda genio</k> he
has the gift (natural endowment) of great g.; <k>la genio di la
 Franca esas klareso</k> the g. of the French language is
clearness; <k>il esas mea mala genio</k> he is my evil g.; <k>1a genio
 di Roma</k> the g. of Rome.

<k>genitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to beget, breed, generate,
procreate (living beings); cf. <k>produktar (ulo)</k>; <ex>(geom.)</ex>
to generate; <k>genit(ad)o</k> begetting, reproduction <k>(di ulu);</k>
<k>genitala</k>, <k>genitanta</k>, <k>genitiva</k> genital, generating, reproductive; <k>genituro</k>
offspring, a progeny; (of animals) a litter; -<k>ema</k>
prolific; V. exp.: On <k>genitas</k> filio; luxo <k>produktas</k>
vicio.

<k>genuo</k>, <k>genuala</k> knee; <k>genupozar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to kneel
(down); <k>genupozinte</k> on bended knee(s); <k>genuflexar</k> to
bend the k.; <k>genuflexo</k> genuflexion; <k>genushirmilo</k> any
screen for k., as knee-piece (armor), top of boot, etc.

<k>Germania</k> Germany; <k>Germana</k>, <k>Germanala</k> German, Germanic; <k>Germano</k>
a German; <k>Germanismo</k>, <k>Germanajo</k> Germanism; <k>Germanigar</k> to
Germanize; <k>Germanamanta</k>, <k>Germano</k> Germanophil; <k>Germanodianta</k>, <k>Germano</k>
German-hating, -hater; <k>la Germana (linguo)</k> German language.

<k>gestar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to gesticulate (as in speaking); <k>gesto</k>
gesticulation, gesture, deaf and dumb sign; <k>gestadema</k>
gesticulative; <k>geste</k> by gesticulating.

<k>getro</k> gaiter, leggings; <k>getreti</k> spats; <k>getrizar</k>
to put leggings on <k>(su</k>, <k>ulu)</k>.

<k>gibo; ozeso</k> rounded protuberance: bump, hump, knob,
hunch, boss, gibbosity; <k>oza</k> gibbous, hunched,
humpbacked: <k>ier(ul</k>, <k>in)o</k> hunch-back; <k>izar</k>
to put a bump, boss on <k>(sulu</k>, <k>ulo).</k>

<k>gicheto</k> wicket, small gatelike window in
ticket-offices, etc.; also as in game or cricket.

<k>gildo</k> guild, gild. Def.: Ensemblo di samspeca
mestieristi. M.-X.132.

<k>gilochar</k> <ex>(tr., arch.)</ex> to furnish or
decorate with a guilloche; <k>gilochuro</k> ornament of
interlaced curved lines.

<k>gimnazio</k> gymnasium, classical preparatory
school (esp. in Germany); (cf.<k>kolegio; liceo</k>).

<k>gipso</k> gypsum, plaster-of-paris; ordinary
plaster (as used for house interiors); (cf. <k>mortero</k>);
<k>gipsizar</k> to plaster; (cf. <k>krepisar</k>);
<k>gipsoza</k> gypseous, chalky; <k>gipsomineyo</k>
plaster-mine, chalk-pit; <k>gipsajo</k> plaster cast (cf.
<k>stuko</k>); <k>gipseskombri</k>, <k>gipsorezidui</k>
pieces of old plaster work.

<k>girlando</k> garland: wreath of flowers, leaves,
etc.

<k>gisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cast: found molten
metal; (cf. <k>muldar</k>); <k>gisfero</k> c.
iron; <k>gisfera lingoto</k> pig-iron; <k>gisdefekto</k>
defect in casting, blow-hole. Ex.: Gisar kanono en mulduro.
III-82.

<k>gizardo</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> gizzard. Def.:
Triesma stomako di l'uceli; V-87.

<k>glacar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to gloss, glaze
(paper, leather, etc.) (cf. <k>glezar</k>); to calender
(fabrics).

<k>glacio</k> ice; <ex>(fig.)</ex> ice-cream;
coldness; <k>glaciala</k> relating to ice, <k>glaciigar</k>
to freeze <k>(ulo)</k> into ice (cf. <k>konjelar</k>, <k>frostigar</k>, <k>frigorizar</k>); <k>glacieskar;</k> to
freeze, become ice; <k>glaciarmoro</k> ice-box; <k>glaciamaso</k>, <k>glacipeco</k> mass of ice, floe; <k>glacieto</k> icicle;
<k>glaciostrado</k> ice-bed; <k>glaciruptado</k>, <k>glacidissolvado</k> the breaking up, the melting of ice; <k>glaciiganta</k>
freezing.

<k>glano</k><ex>(bot.)</ex> acorn; <ex>(anat.)</ex>
glans; <k>glanrekolto</k> crop of acorns; <k>penisglano</k>
extremity of penis, glans penis.

<k>glaso</k> a drinking glass; <k>glasedo de vino</k>
a glass(ful) of wine; <k>glasshokar (kun ulu)</k> to
touch, or clink glasses as in drinking; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
hobnob. Def.: L'ordinara vazo, en qua on drinkas vino od aquo:
II-645.

<k>glata</k> smooth, sleek; <k>glatigar</k>
to s.; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to iron (clothes); <k>glatigilo</k>
a smoothing instr., an iron (for ironing) (cf. <k>repasar</k>);
Ant.: <k>aspera.</k>

<k>glavo</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> sword; -di yusteso: (fig.) the
s. of justice. Def.: Espado tranchanta.

<k>glezar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to glaze, apply a vitreous coating
to pottery. Def: Aplikar vitra strato sur ceramikajo; IV-579.

<k>glinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to glean (ears of grain); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to gather (things thinly scattered). Ex.: Glinar la spiki pos la
rekolto. Li studiabis ta epoko tante komplete, ke nun ni povas
nur glinar poka fakti nova.

<k>gliptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to carve, engrave, grave (precious
stones); <k>gliptarto</k> glyptography. Def.: Skultar medali e
lapidi; IV-291.

<k>glitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>, <k>glitigar</k> <ex>(tr.):</ex> to
glide, slide, slip, slur (over); <k>gliteyo</k>, <k>glitvoyo</k> a slide; <k>glitiganta</k>, <k>glitiva</k> slippery; <k>glitnodo</k> slip-knot, running knot, noose <k>(cf.
 slingo);</k> <k>glitveturo</k> sleigh, sledge, sled; <k>glitflugar</k>
<ex>(aviation)</ex> to plane; -shuo: snow-shoe. Ex.: On glitas sur
voyi kovrita per frosto-pluvo. Il sizis la kordo e glitis til la
tero. La batelo glitas sur la kalma maro. La taso glitis de mea
manuo. Glitigar sua manuo en la posho di ulu. Vua remonstri
glitas de lua mento.
<k>globo</k> globe, orb, ball; <k>okul globo</k> eye-ball; <k>globatra</k>, <k>globforma</k> globular. V.exp.: vid. <k>balono.</k>

<k>glorio</k> glory; <k>gloriachoza</k> vainglorious; <k>gloriizar</k>
to glorify; <k>gloriizar su: (per o pri ulo)</k> to g. in anything,
pride oneself upon; <k>sen gloria</k> inglorious.

<k>glosario</k> glossary: partial dictionary explaining the
harder words.

<k>gluo</k> glue; <k>gelatin gluo</k> glue made from clippings
of hoofs, hides, etc.; <k>pasto gluo</k> paste (made with flour
and water); <k>gluizar</k> to put g. on, glue <k>(ulo)</k> (cf.
<k>gumizar).</k>
<k>gluglar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to gurgle (cf. <k>gorgolar</k>, <k>klukar</k>). Def.: Bruiso di liquido ekiranta botelo; IV-11.

<k>glutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to swallow, gulp, gobble up (food,
etc.); to quaff, swill (liquids); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to take in, to
look at, with eagerness, avidity; <k>glutajo</k> a draught, a gulp;
<k>glutedo</k> mouthful, gulp; <k>glutema</k> gluttonouse, greedy; <k>englutado</k>
deglutination. Ex.: Glutar tasedo de kafeo, pinglo, ostro. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Il glutas el per la okuli.

<k>gluteo</k> (of persons): buttock, breech, bottom; <k>gluteala</k>
gluteal; <k>glutealo</k>, <k>gluteala muskulo</k> gluteal muscle; <k>glutee batar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to spank, flog (on the backsides). V.exp. vid. <k>sedo.</k>

<k>glutinar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to stick, fasten or be
fastened by adhesion; adhere, paste, glue, agglutinate; (cf. <k>adherar</k>)
<k>kun glutinar du kozi</k> to stick two things together; <k>glutinar
 papero sur maro</k> to paste paper on a wall; <k>glutiniva</k>, <k>glutinema</k>
agglutinative, glutinous (cf. <k>viskoza</k>); <k>glutinisto</k>
paster, sizer, paper-hanger, bill-sticker. (cf. <k>gluizar</k>, <k>gumizar</k>).

<k>gnomiko*</k> gnome, aphorism, brief maxim; <k>gnomikala</k>
gnomical, sententious.

<k>gobleto</k> goblet, mug; <k>gobleto gradizita</k> graduate (d)
cup, flask. Def.: Glaso sen pedo, quaze cilindra, ofte ek metalo;
II-645.

<k>godrono</k> <ex>(arch. and ornamental) </ex>godroon, a kind of
edge molding or fluting.

<k>golpo</k> smut, blight (of grain) (Ustilago carbo). Def.:
Fungo parazita dil frumento; VI-540

<k>gondo</k> door-, gate-, rudder-pintle; <k>gondbendo</k>
pintle-brace, iron-work clamped on a door to sustain the
pintle.  V.exp.: <k>Charniro</k> kompozesas ek du metal peci
ocilanta sur un axo komuna, e quan on skrubagas sur pordo, kesto,
e.c. por apertar o klozar. <k>Gondo</k> esas axala fer-peco
kudatra e pivotoza, sustenanta la gondobendo, sur qua rotacas la
pordo, e.c.

<k>gondolo</k> (boat) gondola; (of air-ship) g. car; <k>gondolisto</k>
gondolier. Def.: Vehilo suspendita ad aerostato (direktebla o
ne); speco di batelo uzata en la laguni, aparte en Venezia (E.
Venice); VI-26.

<k>gorgear</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to chirp, twitter; <k>gorgeetar</k>
to cheep, peep. Def.: La specala kanto di mikra uceli; VI-27.

<k>gorgolar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to gurgle, to fall with a
purling, splashing noise (as noise of brooks); to rattle, rumble
(of water in stomach); cf. gluglar).

<k>gorjereto</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> gorget, a cutting instrument
used in lithotomy.

<k>grabar</k> to engrave (lines), to etch; <k>nigra graburo</k>
mezzotint; (cf. <k>gliptar</k>, <k>xilografar</k>). Def.: Trasar linei
kava sur metal plako; VII-413. Ex.: On grabas figuro sur plako
(per linei, per aquaforto).

<k>graco</k> <ex>(theol.)</ex> grace; <k>per la graco di Deo</k> by
the g. of God.

<k>gracio</k> gracefullness, charm, elegance of manner or form;
<k>Gracio</k> one of the (three) Graces; <k>ne graci oza</k>
ungraceful, ungracious, awkward, ungainly, uncouth; <k>afektacar
 gracio</k> to put on airs.

<k>gracila</k> gracile, slender and graceful, svelte, lithe.
Def.: Gracioze tenua ed alta; VI-569.

<k>grado</k> step (of stairs); degree (as of temperature);
degree (in university); grade, rank (in order of dignity); step
(in progress); size (of shoes, gloves, etc.); <k>gradego</k> tier,
high step; <k>gradizar</k> to put steps into <k>(ulo)</k>; to
graduate (an instrument); <ex>(university)</ex> to confer a degree
on <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>gradizo</k>, <k>graduro</k> graduating, gradation,
scale; <k>gradoza</k>, <k>gradopa</k> gradual: proceeding by steps or
degrees; <k>gradoze</k>, <k>gradope</k> gradually; <k>gradaro</k> degrees,
steps (collect.); <k>gradizita</k> graded, graduated; <k>gradope</k>
by degrees; <k>gradizito</k> (university) graduate; <k>universitatala
 grado</k> university degree; <k>me obtenis mea grado ye Oxford</k>
I graduated at Oxford.

<k>grafika</k> graphic; <k>grafiko</k> a graph; <k>grafikarti</k> g.
arts (as opposed to plastic arts); (N.B. «a g. account» =
pitoreska deskripto).

<k>grano: eto</k> any very small, hard mass; as, a grain of
seed (cf. <k>semino</k>), of sand, of sugar, etc., kernel (of
corn); the composite particles of any substance; rough exterior
texture, as grain in leather, in metals, in wood; pellet; <ex>(bot.)</ex>
granule; <k>seminoala</k>, <k>seminoatra</k>, <k>seminooforma</k> granular; <k>semino(et)igar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex>, <k>semino(et)eskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to granulate, to
form or collect into grains or granules (N.B. not med. sense, cf.
<k>granuligar</k>); <k>seminoifar</k> to produce grains; <k>seminoizar</k>
to grain (leather), put a grain on <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>seminooza</k>
full of grains, seedy; <k>seminoizita</k> grained; <k>seminovendisto</k>
seedsman, g. seller; <k>seminoeyo</k> granary; <k>seminoifanta</k> g.
bearing; <k>seminoachi</k> refuse grains; <k>kafe seminoo</k>
coffee-berry; <k>lin seminoo</k> linseed; <k>seminoomanjanta</k>, <k>seminoo</k>
granivorous (animal; cf. <k>granivora</k>).

<k>granario</k> loft, attic (in country houses for grains,
hay).

<k>granda</k> a term of comparison denoting more magnitude than
something else, or beyond what is usual; as great, large, big;
also used fig. in the sense of the E. «grand» apart from
material dimensions: <k>granda vazo</k>, <k>domo</k> a large vase, house; <k>granda
 urbo</k> a great city; <k>granda bruiso</k>, <k>forteso</k> a great noise,
strength; <k>granda festo</k> a great holiday; <k>granda duk(ul)o</k>
grand-duke; <k>Alexandro la granda</k> Alexander the Great; <k>grandanma</k>
magnanimous, noble-minded; <k>grandeveso</k> longevity; <k>grandeta</k>
biggish; <k>grandulo</k> a large man; a great man (in power,
dignity), grandee (Spain); <k>grande</k> greatly, grandly; <k>grandeso</k>
<ex>(quality)</ex> magnitude, largeness of bulk or dimensions,
bigness, bulk; <ex>(fig.)</ex> high degree, grandness; <k>grandajo</k>
a large object; <k>grandeso di urbo</k> extent of a city; greatness
of a city; <k>grandeso di krimino</k> greatness of a crime; <k>grandega</k>
enormous, immense, bulky; <k>(plu) grandigar</k> to enlarge,
magnify, make big.

<k>grantar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to grant, allow, concede, confer
(demands, favors, privileges, etc.); to award (damages); <k>granto</k>, <k>grantajo</k> grant, concession, award. (cf. <k>exaucar</k>). Def.:
Donar o koncesar ulo kom favoro, konseque ulo demandita o
dezirata; II-709.

<k>granulo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> granule (of a granulation, as from
wounds, ulcers); <k>granularo</k>, <k>granuligo</k>, <k>granulesko</k> granulation; <k>granulala</k>, <k>granuloza</k> granular, granulated.

<k>grapo</k> cluster, bunch, a number of fruits or flowers
growing along a common stalk.

<k>graso</k> fat, grease; <k>grasa</k>, <k>grasoza</k>, <k>grasatra</k> fat, greasy,
adipose; <k>grasizar</k> to grease (ulo); <k>grasigar</k> to fatten
(ulu); <k>grasmakulo</k> grease spot. Ant.: (adj.) <k>magra</k>.

<k>gratar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scratch (so as to allay itching);
(<ex>of animals</ex>) to claw; (of noise) to scrape, grate. (cf. <k>skrachar</k>).

<k>gratifikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bestow (money) on; to tip (<k>ulu
 per ulo</k>); <k>gratifikuro</k> bounty, gratuity, tip. Def.: Donar
pekuniala rekompenso exter la salario o preco debata; IV-12. Ex.:
La rejo gratifikas il per pensiono. Ni donis drink-moneto a la
garsono kom gratifikuro.

<k>gratino</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> gratin, brown crust, burnt
crumbs; <k>gratinizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>, <k>gratinifar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>:
to gratinate, to cook, as with a covering of buttered crumbs,
until a crust or crisp surface forms; <k>gratinizita</k> gratinated,
«au gratin.»
<k>gratitudar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to be grateful, thankful to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>pro</k>, <k>pri ulo)</k>; <k>gratitudo</k> gratitude. (cf. <k>dankar</k>).

<k>gratuita</k> gratuitous, free, gratis (cf. <k>senpaga</k>); <k>gratuite</k>
gratis, for nothing. Def.: (<ex>adj.</ex>) recevata sen pago; (<ex>adv.</ex>)
sen demander pago; II-75, III-322.

<k>gratular</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to congratulate, felicitate. Ex.:
Gratular ulu pri lua vinko.

<k>grava</k> (<ex>phys.</ex>) heavy, ponderous; (<ex>fig.</ex>)
weighty, momentous, not frivolous, grave, (cf. <k>importanta</k>, <k>serioza</k>); (<ex>mus.</ex>) low (note), deep (tone); (<ex>gram.</ex>)
grave (accent); <k>graveso</k> gravity; <k>(plu)gravigar</k> to
make (more) heavy, serious; <k>gravigo</k>, <k>gravesko</k> aggravation; <k>graveskar</k>
to become weighed down, serious; <k>mingravigar</k> to make
less heavy, serious; to extenuate, mitigate. V. exp.: <k>Grava</k>
equivalas ne-frivola; <k>serioza</k> equivalas ne-vivaca,
ne-gaya. On parolas pri grava afero, serioza mieno. Ant.: <k>lejera</k>.

<k>gravelo</k> (<ex>med.</ex>) gravel, stone in the kidneys or
bladder; <k>gravelika</k>, <k>graveliko</k> (person) afflicted with g.

<k>gravio</k> gravel, small stones or pebbles intermixed with
