esas la ordinara vorto; <k>oxo</k> nur la ciencala vorto,
partikulare utila en kemiala terminaro.

<k>nabobo*</k> nabob. Def.: Princo di India; metafore, richega
viro; VII-280.

<k>naciono</k> nation; <k>nacionala</k> national; <k>nacionano</k> a
native, national; member of a nation; <k>nacionaligar</k> to
nationalize (an industry, etc.); <k>nacionanigar</k> to naturalize
(cf. <k>civitanigar</k>); <k>nacionalismo</k> devotion to or
advocacy of a nation; national interest or unity; <k>nacioneso</k>
nationality (of a nation as a whole); <k>nacionaleso</k>, <k>nacionaneso</k>
nationality (of an individual); <k>nacionalista</k>, <k>nacionisto</k>
nationalist(ic).

<k>naiva</k> naïve: unaffectedly simple: ingenuous; artless; <k>naivajo</k>
act of native simplicity; <k>naivacha</k> silly.

<k>nam</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> for (= because, but in a less
immediate and explicit way than <k>pro ke.</k> Introduces a
sentence or subordinate clause which adduces reason, proof or
justification). <k>Esas matino</k>, <k>nam la uceli kantas</k> it is
morning for (not <ex>because:</ex> <k>pro ke</k>) the birds are
singing. Ex.: Vu ne trovos il en la domo, nam me jus vidis il en
la strado. Vu ne povas vidar il, nam il esas departinta de longe.
Lavez vua manui, nam li esas sordida. Me ne povas amar ilu, nam
il odias me. Ni irez lente adheme, nam balde esos nokto. V. exp.:
<k>Nam</k>, <k>pro ke: Pro ke</k> introduktas dependanta propoziciono,
qua kontenas motivo o pruvo por la <ex>chefa</ex> propoziciono
prieranta o sequanta: <k>nam</k> introduktas chefa frazo, qua
kontenas anke motivo o pruvo, ma nur por preiranta frazo, o
tacita penso. Ex.: Pro ke pluvas, me ne ekiros. Me ne ekiros nam
pluvas; III-223; cf. <k>or.</k> Ta du konjuncioni
interdistingesas precize quale Angla <ex>for </ex>e<ex> because</ex>.
La Angla linguisto Sweet skribas pri li tale: «La du precipua
konjuncioni kauzala esas <k>pro ke</k>, <k /> qua konstatas nemediata e
direte aganta kauzo, e <k>nam</k>, <k />qua ajuntas expliko o motivo,
ofte kom quaza posa penso; ex.: ni kunprenis nia parapluvi, pro
ke ni timas ke pluvos; nam la barametro falis de kelka tempo.
Konseque, <k>nam</k> uzesas libere pos pauzo ed esas do nur
mi-konjunciono (konjunciono koordinanta); IV-524; kp.
Talmey’s Text Book, p. 113.

<k>naracar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to narrate, relate, tell (something
that happened, a true incident); <k>naracar sua historio</k> to tell
one’s history; <k>naraco pri batalio*</k> narrative of (or,
about) a battle. V. exp.: <k>Naracar</k> ne esas samsenca kam <k>rakontar</k>;
<k>naraco</k> esas prefere historiala, do vera; <k>rakonto</k>
esas prefere imaginala, do desvera o fingita; ex.: «il naracis
lua historio, qua semblas feala rakonto»; II-485-6.

<k>narkotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in a state of narcosis; <k>narkoto</k>
narcosis; <k>narkotigar</k> to narcotize; <k>narkotigiva</k>, <k>narkotivo</k>
narcotic.

<k>naskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be born; <k>nasko</k>, <k>naskepoko</k>
birth, nativity; <k>naskala</k> natal; <k>naskigar</k> to give birth
to (cf. <k>genitar</k>); <k>naske blinda</k> blind from birth; <k>naskanta</k>
nascent; <k>naskala yuro (</k>od,<k>naskoyuro)</k> birthright; <k>naskinta
 nove</k> new-born (child, etc.); -<k>into unesma</k>
first-born child; (cf. <k>seniora</k>); <k>naske poeto</k> a poet
by birth, a born poet; <k>naskolando</k> land of birth, fatherland
(cf. <k>patrio</k>); <k>naskoloko</k> birthplace; <k>naskennaskinto</k>
a native; <k>kunnaskinto</k> congenital.

<k>naturo</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> nature; <k>naturala</k> <ex>(also
mus.)</ex> natural; <k>naturale</k> naturally; <k>naturala lego</k>
natural law; <k>naturalismo</k> <ex>(philos., art)</ex> naturalism; <k>naturalisto</k>
<ex>(philos., art)</ex> naturalist; <k>naturciencisto</k> naturalist:
one versed in natural history; <k>naturkolora</k> <ex>(of wood, etc.)</ex>
not colored, of natural colo(u)r.

<k>naufrajar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be shipwrecked; <k>naufrajo</k>
(ship)wreck; <k>naufrajanto</k>, <k>naufrajinto</k> shipwrecked person, castaway.

<k>nauzear</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to feel nauseated, be sick to the
stomach, be qualmish; <k>nauze(ad)o</k> nausea, qualm, retching; <k>nauzeigar</k>
to nauseate (cf. <k>insipidigar</k>, <k>repugnar</k>, <k>vomar</k>); <k>nauzeiganta</k>
nauseous; <ex>(fig.)</ex> loathsome, disgusting.

<k>navo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> vessel: (merchant-) ship (cf. <k>militnavo</k>);
nave (of a church); <k>navaro</k> shipping <ex>(collect.),</ex>
fleet; <k>naveto</k> <ex>(fig. eccl.)</ex> incense-box;
(weaver’s) shuttle; <k>navala</k> nautical; <k>navano</k>
member of a ship’s company; <k>navero</k>, <k>navisto</k> seaman,
mariner, sailor; <k>navestro</k> master of a (merchant-) ship; <k>navo
 triferdeka</k> a three decker (ship); <k>komercnavo</k>, <k>varnavo</k>
merchant-man; <k>vapor navo</k> steamer; <k>me iris nave (de
 Hamburg ad Bordeaux)</k> I went by ship (from H. to B.); <k>la
 kapitano restis ennave</k> the captain (of a warship) remained
on board; <k>navatra osto</k> scaphoid bone (cf. <k>tarso</k>); <k>navoida
 osto</k> scaphoid bone (of carpal bones).

<k>navigar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to navigate, sail (on); <k>navigarto</k>
(art of) navigation, seamanship; <k>naviganta viro</k> seafaring
man; <k>navigala</k> nautical: relating to navigation;<k>navigebla</k>
navigable; <k>fora navigado</k> foreign trade; <k>rivo navigo</k>
coasting;.

<k>nazo</k> nose; <k>nazala</k> nasal; <k>nazalo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex>
a nasal (sound, letter); <k>nazaligar</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> to
nasalize; <k>nazfetida</k> a stinking nose; <ex>(med.)</ex> affected
with ozaena; <k>nazguto</k> a nose-drop, snot, snivel; <k>nazkataro</k>
cold in the head; <k>nazpeco</k> nose-piece (serving as
protection); <k>nazparolar</k> to speak through the nose; <k>naztruo</k>
nostril; <ex>(of whales)</ex> blow-hole; <k>naztuko</k>
handkerchief; <k>nazbinoklo</k> nose glasses; <k>facar longa nazo
 (ad</k>, <k>kontre)</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to laugh at; <k>nazo kontre nazo</k>
nose to nose <ex>(fig.)</ex> face to face.

<k>ne</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> not; <k>ne plus</k> no more; <k>ne
 multo</k> not much; <k>tote ne</k> not at all, by no means, not
in the least; <k>ne tam multe</k> not so much; <k>me anke ne</k>
nor I also; <k>ne for</k> not far from; <k>ne nur</k> not only;
<k>ne tante stupida</k> not so stupid; <k>ne male</k> not
badly; <k>ne ja</k> not yet. Note: As distinguishable from <k>des</k>
in word composition, <k>ne</k> carries a less forceful sense of
negation, implying merely absence of the positive quality rather
than the absolute negation; ex.: <k>nefacila</k> difficult =
not easy; <k>desfacila</k> difficult = arduous, laborious.

<k>nebular</k> <ex>(impers.)</ex> to be foggy, misty, hazy; <k>nebuloza</k>, <k>nebulatra</k> foggy, misty, nebulous (cf. <k>nebuloza</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
obscure, not intelligible; <k>nebulizar</k> to cover with fog; <k>nebulpluvar</k>
to drizzle.

<k>necesa</k> necessary, indispensable requisite (cf. <k>bezonata</k>);
<k>necesajo</k> a necessary thing, the needful; <k>necesigar</k>
necessitate. Ex.: Esas necesa konsequajo. Respirado esas necesa
por la vivo. Ne esas necesa parolar pri to. Ant.: <k>superflua</k>, <k>neutila.</k>

<k>neeroriva</k> infallible (church, etc.); not capable of
erring (cf. <k>infalibla</k>, <k>nefaliiva</k>).

<k>neexakta</k> <ex>(of objects)</ex> inaccurate, incorrect,
inexact (calculation, news, etc.); <k>neajo</k> an inaccuracy.

<k>neexplotata</k>, <k>neita</k><ex>(of mines, etc.)</ex> unexploited,
unworked; <ex>(land)</ex> untilled, uncultivated.

<k>negar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deny: declare untrue or
non-existing; (cf. <k>renegar</k>); <k>neg(ad)o</k>denial,
denying, negation; <k>negilo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> a negative (word);
<k>negala</k> negative: relation to negation; <k>neganta</k>, <k>negiva</k>
denying; expressing negation, negatory; <k>negebla</k> deniable; <k>kad
 vu negas ke vu dicis to</k> do you deny that you said that?
Ant.: <k>afirmar.</k>

<k>neglijar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to neglect: to treat carelessly,
slight, be remiss (in the performance of a duty, task, care of
health, peson, etc.); <k>neglijo</k> negligence; <k>neglijado</k> <ex>(habitual)</ex>
neglect; <k>neglijeso</k> (state of) neglect; <k>neglijanta</k>, <k>neglijema</k>
negligent, neglectful, remiss, careless; <k>neglijebla</k>
negligible, trifling, unimportant. Ant.: <k>sorgar.</k>

<k>negociar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to negotiate: to procure, or
arrange for, by negotiating. Ex.: Negociar ligo atakala e
defensala; Negociado pri ula afero grava, pri mariajo.

<k>negra</k> <k>negr(ul)o</k> negro; <k>negrino</k> negress; <k>negracha</k>
nigger; <k>negrovendado</k> slave trade; <k>negrovendisto</k>
slaver. Ant.: <k>(negr(ul)o)</k>, <k>blank(ul)o</k>

<k>nek … nek</k> neither … nor; <k>me povas nek enirar
 nek ekirar</k> I can get neither in nor out; <k>il drinkas nek
 biro nek vino</k> he drinks neither beer nor wine.

<k>nekrologo</k> necrology: obituary review of (distinguished)
persons who have died within a certain length of time.

<k>nekromancio</k> necromancy: pretended divination by aid of
spirits; black art; <ex>(fig.)</ex> magic; <k>nekromanciar</k> to practise
necromancy.
<k>nekropolo</k>necropolis, city of the dead, large cemetery.

<k>nekustumala</k> uncustomed, uwonted (hono(u)r, etc.)
unusual, unfamiliar (object); <k>neanta</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex>
unaccustomed.

<k>nemediata</k> immediate: proximate; direct (without
intervention of another object, cause or agency); <k>nee</k>
directly (cf. <k>quik</k>, <k>direta</k>).

<k>nenio*</k> nenia. Def.: Kanto o lamento funerala, en
l’antiqua mori.

<k>nenufaro</k> nenuphar: nenuphär: the great white water-lily
of Europa (Nymphaea albl <ex>or, </ex>Nuphar).
<k>nepacienta</k> impatient; <k>neeso</k>impatience; <k>neigar</k>, <k>neeskar</k> to make, to become impatient.

<k>neprevido</k>, <k>neemeso</k> wanting foresight, improvidence; <k>neanta</k>, <k>neema</k> improvident (person); <k>neita</k> unforeseen, unlooked
for (thing); <k>neite</k> unawares, napping.

<k>nereflektita</k> <ex>(phys., mental)</ex> unreflected;
thoughtless, unconsidered (act); <k>neema</k> thoughtless,
heedless (person).

<k>nervo</k> nerve; <k>nervaro</k> nervous system; <k>nervala</k>
nervous: relating to the nerves; <k>nervoza</k>, <k>nervoz(ul)o</k> nervous
(person); <k>nervozeso</k> nervousness; <k>nervozigar</k> to excite
the nerves of (<k>ulu</k>); <k>nervozeskar</k> to grow, become
nervous; <k>sen nervigar</k> to unnerve.

<k>nesavar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to be ignorant of, not to know (<k>ulo</k>);
<k>neo</k> ignorance (of a fact; cf. <k>nulsavo</k>); <k>neante</k>
unwittingly, unknowingly.

<k>neshanceligebla</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> unshakable,
immovable, resolute, steady, firm.

<k>nesto</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> (bird-) nest; <k>nestifar</k> to
build a nest.

<k>neta</k> clean, spotless, neat, tidy, natty: without spot,
stain, blot, impurity; <ex>(of price)</ex> net (cf. <k>sentara</k>);
<k>netigar</k> to clean, cleanse; <k>nete kopiar</k> to make a fair
copy of. Ex.: Neta aquo, plado, denti, manui, <ex>(fig.)</ex>
koncienco. Ant.: <k>sordida</k>, <k>neneta</k> (cf. <k>pura</k>).

<k>netranquila</k> <ex>(phys., mental)</ex> untranquil, unquiet,
unagitated, uneasy, restless.<k />

<k>netransaktema</k> intransigent, (esp. in politics: refusing
compromise); irreconcilable, uncompromising.

<k>neutra</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> neutral, neuter; <k>(la) neutro</k>
<ex>(gram.)</ex> a neuter; <k>(la) neutri</k> <ex>(polit.)</ex> the
neutral powers; <k>neutreso</k> neutrality; <k>neutrigar</k> to
neutralize (cf. <k>equalibrar</k>, <k>kompensar</k>). Ex.: Neutra vorto,
sexuo, naciono, persono, <ex>(chem.)</ex> salo.

<k>neuz(ad)o</k> disuse; <k>neata</k>, <k>neita</k> unused, not in
use, unutilized, obsolete.

<k>nevinkebla</k> unconquerable, invincible, insuperable,
insurmountable, overwhelming; <k>neita</k> unvanquished.

<k>nevuso</k> nævus: pigmented place on skin, usually
congenital; birthmark, mole; <k>nevuso flamea</k> burnt mark, scar
of burn.

<k>ni</k> we, us (<k>a ni</k>, <k>nin</k>); <k>nia</k> our(s) «Nia
Patro»: the Lord’s Prayer, (cf. note under <k>on</k>).

<k>nicho</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> niche, nook: recess in a wall (as
for a statue or a bed)

<k>nigra</k> black (cf. <k>obskura</k>); <k>nigro</k> black, the
colo(u)r itself (cf. <k>negro</k>); <k>nigreso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>
blackness; <k>nigrigar</k> to blacken, smut; <k>nigreskar</k> to turn
black. Ant.: <k>blanka.</k>

<k>nihilo</k> naught, nothing, something non-existent, nonenity
(cf. <k>nulo</k>); <k>nihila</k> void; <k>nihileso</k> nothingness,
inexistence, nihility; <k>nihilajo</k> a nullity; <k>nihiligar; nihileskar</k>
<ex>(jur.)</ex> to annul, become void; to rescind, cancel; <k>nihiligebla</k>
voidable; <k>nihilismo</k> nihilism; <k>nihilisto</k>, <k>nihila</k>
nihilist(ic); <k>nihileso di grandeso homala</k>nothingness of
human greatness. V. exp: <k>Destruktar</k>, <k>nihiligar</k> por la
destrukto materiala e kontreyura di dokumento, ni havas la verbo:
<k>destruktar</k>. Do ni darfas rezervar <k>nihiligar</k> a la
yurala senco (igar tote ne-valida o sen-valora). Remarkez, ke
propre dicite on povas <k>nihiligar</k> nulo materiale, pro ke la
materio esas permananta; on povas nur <k>destruktar</k> (quaze
des-konstruktar) la material objekti; VI-537.

<k>niktalopa</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> nyctalopic: part blind by day; <k>niktalopeso</k>
nyctalopia: day blindness.

<k>nimbo</k> <ex>(meteor.)</ex> nimbus: a large rain-cloud of
uniform greyness (N.B. not halo; cf. <k>aureolo</k>).

<k>nipelo</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> nipple. Def.: Interna junto-tubeto
kun filetoza extremaji.

<k>nivar</k> <ex>(impers.)</ex> to snow; <k>niveskar</k>to
commence to snow; <k>nivoza</k>, <k>nivatra</k>, <k>nivea</k> snowy; <k>nivo bulo</k>
snowball; <k>nivfloko</k> snowflake; <k>nivea barbo</k> snow-white
beard.

<k>nivelo</k> level: horizontal surface; (cf. <k>plano</k>, <k>plata</k>);
<k>nivelizar</k> to measure the level of, to find the height of (by
a surveyor’s level); <k>nivelizilo</k> level instrument which
shows the level.

<k>nobela</k> noble (by birth); <k>nobelo</k>, <k>nobelulo</k>, <k>nobelino</k> a noble;
<k>nobelaro</k> nobility <ex>(collect.)</ex> <k>–eso</k> <ex>(rank)</ex>
nobility; <k>nobeligar</k> to ennoble: raise to nobility (<k>ulu</k>).
V. exp.: <k>Nobela</k>, <k>nobla</k> La <k>nobeli</k> esas sociala
klaso, qua formacesis per la reputeso heredita de la ancestri da
la decendanti. <k>Nobleso</k> esas etikal traito. <k>Nobelo</k>
tote ne bezonas esar <k>nobla</k>, ed inversa nobla homo ne
bezonas esas nobela.

<k>nobla</k> noble (morally); <k>nobleso</k> nobility (of
character); <k>nobligar</k> to ennoble: to make noble. V. exp.:
vid. <k>nobela.</k> Ant.: <k>abjekta</k>, <k>vulgara</k>, <k>infama.</k>

<k>nocar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to harm, injure, hurt, wrong, be
injurious (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>noceso</k> <ex>(state)</ex> damage; <k>nociva</k>
noxious, nocive, harmful, detrimental. V.exp.: vid. <k>detrimentar.</k>

<k>nocho</k> notch, nick, dent, indentation; <k>nochizar</k> to
notch, dent. Def.: V-forma dentizuro (quale en flecho,
dento-roto; l’intervalo o lakuno inter du denti di
ingranajo, do l’inverso di dento; (kp. III-142). Mikra
kavajo produktita per instrumento o frapo.

<k>nociono</k> notion. Def.: Ideo quan on havas pri ulo. Ex. La
koncienco direte donas al homo nociono pri la bono e lo mala. Il
donos a vu nociono pri ca afero.

<k>nodo</k> knot (in thread, cord, rope, etc.); <ex>(nav.)</ex>
knot: nautical mile: 6080.27 ft., 1852 meters (metres); <k>nodigar</k>
to tie a knot in (<k>ulo</k>); <k>nodifar</k> to knot: produce
knots; <k>nodo Gordiala</k> Gordian knot.

<k>noktar</k> <ex>(impers.)</ex> to be night; <k>noktas</k> it is
night; <k>nokteskar</k> night is coming on; <k>noktala</k> nocturnal.
<k>(ye) noktesko</k> (at) nightfall; <k>nokto</k> night
(cf. <k>tenebro</k>,<k>obskuro</k>); <k>noktomezo</k>
midnight; <k>noktovaganto</k>, <k>noktero</k> night prowler; <k>noktovazo</k>
chamber-pot; <k>noktolampo</k>, <k>noktbujio</k> night-light; <k>noktomarvelo</k>
<ex>(bot.)</ex> marvel of Peru (Mirabilis).

<k>nomar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to name: call (<k>ulu</k>) by name,
to say the name of (<k>ulu</k>); <k>nomesar</k> to be named, to be
called; <k>nomo</k> name; (gram.) noun; <k>nomizar</k> to name:
give a name to (<k>ulo</k>); <k>nomizo</k>, <k>nomuro</k> naming;
appelation; <k>nomizado</k> nomenclature (cf. <k>nomenklaturo</k>);
<k>nome</k> namely (viz.); <k>bapto nomo</k> Christian name; <k>pre
 nomo</k> first name; <k>ye la nomo di</k> in the name of; <k>ye mea
 nomo (vice me)</k> in my name; <k>propra nomo</k> own name; proper
noun; <k>sen noma</k> nameless. Def.: Dicar, lektar o pensar la
nomo; «nom-izar» esas donar nomo (nova); IV-164. Ex.: Ka vu
nomas ta persono? La persono nomesas S.X. Lua gepatri nomizis il
Jean X. <ex>(gram.)</ex> Propra, komuna nomo; nomo-substantivo;
nom-adjektivo.

<k>nombro</k> (cardinal) number, numeral (i.e. numbers used in
simple counting: 1, 2, 3, etc. cf. <k>numero</k>); <ex>(gram.)</ex>
number; <k>nombrizar</k> to give numbers to; to count, take census
of; <k>nombro prima</k> prime number; <k>nombrala</k> numerical; <k>granda
 nombra</k> numerous; <k>sen nombra</k> numberless (cf. <k>nekontebla</k>).

<k>nominar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to nominate: to name as a canditate
for election or appointment to an office or title; <k>nomino</k>, <k>nomineso</k>
<ex>(act. condition)</ex> nomination, appointment, designation; <k>nominala</k>
<ex>(of price, value)</ex> nominal; <k>nominanto</k>, <k>nominero</k> nominator,
presenter; <k>nominato</k>, <k>nominario</k> nominee; <k>nominalismo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex>
nominalism.

<k>non</k> nine; <k>nono</k> the ninth; <k>nonesma</k>, <k>nonesmo</k> <ex>(ordinal)</ex>
ninth, <ex>(rel.)</ex> novena (nine days devotion); <k>nonimo</k>
(fraction) a ninth part; <k>nonopla</k> ninefold; <k>nonadekyara</k>, <k>nono</k> nonogenarian; <k>nonadek</k> ninety; (cf. <k>du</k>).

<k>nordo</k> north; <k>nordala</k> nothern; <k>norde</k> northerly,
in the north (with movement: <k>ad –e</k>); <k>nordesto</k>
north-east.

<k>norio*</k> noria: a machine for raising water by buckets on
an endless chain.

<k>normo</k> norm: authoritative standard or model; <k>norma</k>
of or constituting a norm, rule, or principle; <k>normala</k>
ordinary, regular, normal: relating to an authoritative standard,
as in speaking of health, etc.; <ex>(goem.)</ex> -<k>ala</k>, <k>normalo</k>
normal: perpendicular to a tangent; <k>normigar</k> to establish (<k>ulo</k>)
as a norm, to make a standard of (<k>ulo</k>); <k>normizar</k> to
furnish with a standard, norm; <k>normaligar</k> to standardize;
to seal (weights, measures); <k>pezo normo</k> standard of
weights. V. exp.: <k>Regulo</k> esas precepto o preskripto
generala, enuncita per vorti. <k>Normo</k> esas kozo konkreta,
qua servas quale modelo o tipo a qua on komparas la
ceteri por evaluar lia justeso; III-410. <k />

<k>nostoko*</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> nostoc: a plant of blue-green
algæ (genus: Nostoc).

<k>notar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to note down, set down in writing,
make memo of; (cf. <k>remarkar</k>); <k>notizar</k> to annotate,
make notes in (a book); <ex>(mus.)</ex> to write down the notes;
(N.B. <k>on notas remarki en libro; on notizas libro per remarki;</k>
cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 109); <k>noto</k> noting; note,
mark, memo, minute (to assist the memory); <ex>(mus.)</ex> note
(written or sounded); <ex>(diplom.)</ex> note; <k>notiz(ad)o</k>, <k>notizuro</k>
annotation, notation (musical, chemical, etc.); inventory; <k>notiziva</k>
annotative; <k>notizanto</k>, <k>notero</k> annotator; <k>notlibreto</k>
memorandum book (cf. <k>poshkayero</k>); <k>notoreferi</k>
reference marks (signs, numbers), etc.).

<k>notario</k> notary <ex>(public)</ex>; <k>koram notario</k> in the
presence of a notary.

<k>notico</k> (short) notice, note, or account (instructive or
informative as on bottle labels, or in a museum, etc.); <k>notico
 biografiala</k> biographical sketch. Def.: Nelonga skribajo
instruktiva o informiva pri partikulara temo od objektivo;
III-204. V. exp.: <k>avizo.</k>

<k>notifikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to notify (formally), give notice
of (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>). V. exp.: <k>savigar.</k>

<k>notora</k> manifest, well-known, known generally, notorious
(N.B. but not in a bad sense); <k>notoreso</k> notoriety,
notoriousness.

<k>nova</k> <ex>(of things)</ex> new, novel; <ex>(of persons)</ex>
new (in service, office); <k>nov(ul)o</k> a newcomer; <k>novajo</k>
a new thing, novelty; <k>nove</k> newly , freshly (cf. <k>recente</k>);
<k>nove naskinto</k> a new-born child; <k>novyaro</k>, <k>nova</k> New
Year; <k>novigar</k> to innovate (<k>ulo</k>) (<ex>intr.:</ex> <k>enduktar
 novajo</k>); <k>noviganto</k>, <k>novero</k> innovator; V. exp.: vid. <k>anciena.</k>

<k>novelo</k> short story, novelette; <k>novelisto</k> short-story
writer. V. exp.: <k>Romano</k> esas generale libro kontenanta
fingita historio di un o plura personi. <k>Novelo</k> signifikas
nur rakonto de kelka pagini, qua havas la naturo di romano, me
esas romano tre kurta, tam per l’ampleso kam per la duro
(generale on rakontas nur aventuro, epizodo, fakto); IV-291-2.

<k>novic(ul)o</k> novice, probationer, tyro, neophyte,
apprentice; <k>novica</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> novice: inexperienced,
green, raw <ex>(of persons)</ex>; <k>noviceso</k> novitiate,
probationship.
<k>nu</k> <ex>(interj.)</ex> well! now then! come now! well now!

<k>nuanco</k> nuance: a slight shade, gradation, as of tone,
colo(u)r, meaning, etc.; <k>nuancoza</k> full of shades, tints,
slight gradations or distinctions; <k>nuancizar</k> to shade,
variegate, express the nuances; <k>la nuanci inter sinonimi</k> the
shades of difference between synonyms.

<k>nubo</k> cloud; <ex>(fig.)</ex> gloom, darkness, shadow; <k>nubaro</k>
(a mass of) clouds; <k>nuboza</k> cloudy, nubilous; <k>nubizar</k>
to cloud, cover with clouds.

<k>nuco</k> a walnut; <ex>(fig,)</ex> nut: any hard shell
enclosing a kernel; <k>nuciero</k> (wal)nut tree; <k>nucierligno</k>
walnut (wood); <k>nucruptilo</k> nut-cracker.

<k>nuda</k> nude, naked, bare; <k>nudigar</k> to strip, undress,
lay bare, denude; <k>nudkapa</k> bare-headed; <k>nudpeda</k>
bare-footed; <k>lo nuda</k> <ex>(abstract)</ex> the nude.
<k>nugato</k> nougat, a kind of almond cake.

<k>nuko</k> nape of the neck; <k>nukumo</k>, <k>nukkovrilo</k>
neck-covering, -flap (as to protect against sun or rain); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
muffler. Def.: Nuk-umo esas acesoro o peco di kasqueto; IV-337.

<k>nula</k> no, not any none; <k>nule</k>, <k>nulmaniere</k> nowise, in
no way, not at all; <k>nulo</k> nothing; <ex>(interj.)</ex> no use!
no go! not a bit of it! -<k>u</k> no one, nobody; <k>nulajo</k>
nullity (cf. <k>nihilo</k>); <k>nulo pluse</k> nothing more; <k>nulkaze</k>
in no case; <k>nulloke</k> nowhere; <k>nultempe</k> never; <k>nulaganta</k>, <k>nulema; nulfacanta</k>, <k>nulemo</k> do-nothing, idle (person) (cf. <k>indolenta</k>);
<k>nulsavanta</k> ignorant; (cf. <k>nesavo</k>); <k>nulvaloranta</k>
of no value, worthless, invalid. Ant.: <k>kelka</k>

<k>numero</k> (ordinal) number (i.e. indicative of order or
succession; as 1st, 2nd, 3rd,
etc.); <k>numerala</k> numerical (order); <k>numerizar</k> to give
successive numbers (to houses, journals, etc.).

<k>nun</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> now, at present, at this time; <k>nuna</k>
<ex>(time)</ex> present, actual, current, now occurring (cf. <k>prezenta</k>);
<k>nuntempa</k> present day, time; <k>nuntempe</k> at the present
time; <k>nuna stando</k> the existing condition, status quo; <k>nuna
 evento</k> a present, current event; <k>nun kande</k> now when,
now that (N.B. not <k>nun ke</k>). Ex.: Me lernas nun la
internaciona linguo. Nun kande il venis, ni iros.

<k>nur</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> only; <k>nura</k> indicates exclusion
(of all else) only, sole (cf. <k>sola</k>, <k>unika</k>); <k>ne nur</k>
not only; <k>se nur</k> if only, providing that; <k>nur ed
 unike</k> purely and simply. Ex.: Nur l’amo inspiras il. Il
drinkas nur vino. Me donas ol a vu, se nur vu venos. Il nura (od,
sola) esas kulpoza.

<k>qua</k> (<ex>relative and interrogative pronoun; acc.</ex> <k>quan</k>) 
who, what, which (person) (Note: 
<k>qua</k> used as an interrogative adjective has the same form in the plural as 
in singular; ex.: 
<k>qua membri ne pagis ankore</k> which members have not paid yet?; used 
substantively it takes the form 
<k>qui</k>; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 26); <k>qua esas ibe</k> who is there; 
<k>qua viro venis</k> which man came? <k>qua kloko esas</k> what time is it? 
(or, what is the hour?); 
<k>la pluvo qua falis</k> the rain which fell; <k>la libro quan me donis a vu</k> 
the book which I gave you; 
<k>la puerino quan me amas</k> the girl whom I love; <k>qua iras hike</k> (<ex>milit</ex>.) 
who goes there? 
<k>quo</k> (<ex>acc</ex>. <k>quon</k>): what, which (thing, fact); (Note: The 
forms 
<k>quo</k>, <k>quon</k> are also used adjectively when referring to othr pronouns 
ending in 
<k>quao</k>; as, <k>to quo</k>, <k>co quo</k>, <k>omno quo</k>, <k>nulo quo</k> cf. Talmey ibid. p. 
95); 
<k>quo</k> used as an interrogative refers to something indefinite; as, <k>quo 
 eventis?</k> what happened; 
<k>quo esas plu bona</k> which (thing) is better? <k>quon il dicis?</k> what 
did he say? 
<k>quo</k>, <k>ka vera?</k> what! is it true? <k>quon (me devas) facar?</k> what is 
to be done? (used adjectively) 
<k>prenez to quon vu volas</k> take what you will. <k>Qui</k> (<ex>acc</ex>. <k>quin</k>) (<ex>pl. form of</ex>
<k>qua</k> <ex>and</ex> <k>quo</k>) who, what, which; <k>qui parolis</k> who (<ex>plural</ex>) 
spoke? 
<k>la personi qui parolis</k> the persons who spoke; <k>ti quin me amas</k> 
those whom I love.
<k>quadro</k> freestone, ashlar, hewn or squared stone; opp. of kruda stono.

<k>quadranto</k> (<ex>instrument</ex>) quadrant; (<ex>geom</ex>.) quadrant: 
quarter of a circumference of a circle; (cf. VI-322).

<k>quadrata</k> square; <k>quadrata peco de papero</k> a s. piece of paper; <k>quadrata 
 nombro</k> a s. number: product of two equal factors; 
<k>quadrato</k> a square; <k>quadratala</k> quadratic (equation, etc.); <k>quadratigar</k> to 
s. (<k>ulo</k>), to form in s.s (<k>uli</k>); <k>quadratigo</k> squaring, quadrature; <k>quadratigebla</k> which can be squared; 
<k>quadratizar</k> to cover (<k>ulo</k>) with s.s, to checker; <k>quadratizo</k>, <k>quadraturo</k>
checker-work; 
<k>quadratope</k>, <k>quadratizita</k> by s.s, checkerwise; checkered; <k>areo de du 
 quadratometri</k> area of two s. meters; 
<k>areo de du metri quadrate</k> (od, <k>areo de quar quadratometri</k>): an 
area of two meters square, i.e., of four square meters (cf. Talmey, Text Book, 
p. 111). Def.: Quadriangulo equilatera ed ortangula.

<k>quadraturo</k> (<ex>astron</ex>.) quadrature, quartile (aspect or relation of 
90 degrees).
<k>quadriangula</k> quadrangular, four-cornered, four-square, four-angled; <k>quadrio</k> (<ex>geom. and bldg</ex>.) quadrangle.

<k>quadrilo</k> quadrille (<ex>dance and music</ex>); troop of horsemen (at a 
tournament); a game of cards played by four persons.
<k>quadriremo</k> (<ex>antiq</ex>.) quadrireme: galley with four banks of oars.

<k>quala</k> what (= what sort of, of what kind, what quality; indicating 
comparison); 
<k>quala esas la vetero</k> what sort of weather is it?; <k>quala viro il 
 esas?</k> what kind of a man is he?; 
<k>quala vento!</k> what a wind!; <k>quala genio!</k> what genius!; <k>quale</k> 
how; (in comparison) as, like; 
<k>quale se</k> as though, as if; <k>quale</k> (od, <k>qualmaniere</k>) <k>il 
 facas ol?</k> how did he do it?; 
<k>quale standas la malada infanti?</k> how are the sick children?; <k>explikez 
 quale vu facis ol</k> explain how you did it; 
<k>quale vu standas?</k> how do you do?; <k>se vu ne savas quale</k>, <k>ne facez ol</k> 
if you do not know how, do not do it; 
<k>en ta loko</k>, <k>quale la texti dicas</k>, <k>erektesis franda monumento</k> in that 
place, as the texts say, was erected a great monument; 
<k>Qualeso</k> quality; the relative nature of something, good or bad; <k>qualeso 
 prima</k> first or prime quality; 
<k>qualesala analizo</k> qualitative analysis. V. exp.: vid. <k>kom</k>.

<k>qualifikar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to qualify: to ascribe the quality of; (<ex>gram</ex>.) 
to express a quality; to style, term; 
<k>qualifiko</k> qualification: attribution of a quality or title; <k>qualifikanta</k> 
qualifying; 
<k>qualifikilo</k> (<ex>gram</ex>.) a qualificative; <k>qualifikanto</k> (<ex>R.C. rel</ex>.) a 
qualificator. Def.: Expresar la qualeso di, atribuar qualeso ad ulu, ulo. Ex.: 
L’adjektivo qualifikas la nomo. Qualifikar ulu kom fripono. La verko esas 
qualifikita kom herezioza.

<k>quankam</k> (<ex>conj</ex>.) although, though. Ex.: Il esas jeneroza, quankam 
il ne esas richa. Quankam il esas mea amiko.

<k>quanta</k>, <k>quante</k> (<ex>of quantity, price</ex>) how much (ex.: <k>quanta multo</k> 
(od <k>quanto</k>) de ta stofo: 
<k>quante to kustas?</k>); (<ex>of numbers</ex>) how many (ex.: <k>quanta homi 
 mortis?</k>) (of time) how long (ex.: 
<k>dum quanta tempo il restis</k>); <k>quantafoye</k> how many times; <k>quante 
 poka</k>, <k>quante</k> how little, how few; 
<k>quante granda</k> how great, how big; <k>quanto</k> (<ex>concrete</ex>) quantity; <k>quanteso</k> (<ex>an abstract</ex>) quantity (as in math., physics, music, etc.); <k>quantesi imaginara</k> imaginary quantities; 
<k>quantesma dio di la monato</k> which day of the month; <k>quantesala</k> 
quantitative (analysis, etc.); 
<k>quanto esas du plus tri?</k> how much is two plus three?; <k>quanton</k> 
(od, <k>quante vu evas?</k>): how old are you?; 
<k>segun quante</k> in the measure as, as in so far as; <k>quante min me 
 manjas</k>, <k>tante min me drinkas</k> 
the less I eat, the less I drink; <k>quante plu la homi posedas</k>, <k>tante plu li 
 volas posedar</k> 
the more a man has, the more (or, so much the more) he wants.

<k>quar</k> four; <k>quaropla</k>, <k>quaro</k> quadruple, four-fold; <k>quaropligar</k> to 
quadruplicate; 
<k>quaropa</k> quaternate, disposed by fours; <k>quaradek</k> forty; <k>quaradekesma</k> (<ex>ordinal</ex>) fortieth; 
<k>quaradekimo</k> (<ex>fraction</ex>) a fortieth; <k>quarpecigar</k> to divide 
(<k>ulo</k>) into four pieces; (for other derivative forms, cf. 
<k>du</k>).
<k>quaranteno</k> quarantine; <k>impozar quaranteno ad ulu</k> to q. (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>quarto</k> (<ex>mus</ex>.) fourth; (<ex>fencing</ex>) quarte; (<ex>piquet</ex>) 
quart; (<ex>nav</ex>.) a four (or two) hour watch; 
<k>quartesar</k> to be on watch; <k>prenar la quarto</k> to take the watch.

<k>quartana</k> quartan: occurring every fourth day; <k>quartana febro</k> q. 
fever.
<k>quartero</k> quarter, district, ward, section of a city.

<k>quartermastro</k> (<ex>milit</ex>.) quartermaster, one who provides quarters, 
provisions, etc.; (<ex>nav</ex>.) quartermaster, a petty officer rating.

<k>quarterona</k>, <k>quarteron(ul)o</k> quadroon. Def.: Genitito da blanko e da mulato; 
V-25.
<k>quatreno</k> quatrain. Def.: Poemeto di quar versi; III-143.

<k>quaze</k>, <k>quaza</k> as it were, so to speak; (<ex>jur</ex>.) quasi; <k>quaza diftongo</k> 
a quasi-diphthong. Def.: En ula grado simila, ma ne tote tala; III-153. V. exp.: 
<k>Quaze</k> indikas nur semblo o simileso e ke esas poka difero inter du 
objekti. 
<k>Preske</k> indikas stando o grado proxima e esas termino di mezuro indikanta 
proximeso, kurta disto, tempo, grado. Ex.: 
<k>quaze</k> nigra; <k>preske</k> parfinita; il esis <k>preske</k> mortinta (il 
esis tre grave malada, vindita, e.c.); il esis 
<k>quaze</k> mortinta (il esis senmova, o simulis mortinto, ma esis forsan tote 
sana).

<k>querar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to fetch; <k>querigar</k> to casue (<k>ulu</k>) to 
fetch (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); 
<k>querigez la mediko</k> send for the doctor. Ex.: Irar por querar ulu, ulo. 
Sendar ulu por querar ulu, ulo. Venar por querar ulu, ulo.

<k>querko</k> oak-tree (genus: Quercus); (cf. <k>rovro</k>); <k>querkoligna 
 tablo</k> oaken table; 
<k>querko sempreverda</k> evergreen oak, holm oak (Quercus Ilex). <k /><ex /><k />

<k>questionar</k>, <k>questionadar</k> (<ex>tr., intr</ex>.) to question, ask questions of, 
interrogate (<k>ulu</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>); 
<k>questiono</k>, <k>questionado</k> query, question(ing), interrogation; (<ex>fig</ex>.) problem; <k>questionaro</k> set of questions (as for an examination, etc.); 
<k>questionala</k>, <k>questioniva</k> interrogative; <k>questionema</k> inquisitive; <k>questionpunto</k> q. 
point. V. exp.: vid. 
<k>demandar</k>, <k>inquestar</k>.

<k>quieta</k> (<ex>mental condition</ex>) quiet, peaceful, tranquil (cf. <k>tranquila</k>); 
<k>quieteso</k> quietude, quietness, calmness; <k>quietigar</k> to tranquilize, 
comfort, calm, reassure, quiet down (<k>ulu</k>); 
<k>quieteskar</k> to become quiet, calm; <k>quietismo</k> quietism: a theological 
doctrine; 
<k>quietiganta</k> reassuring, comforting; <k>ne quieta</k> uneasy (cf. <k>anxioza</k>). 
V. exp.: vid. 
<k>kalma</k>.

<k>quik</k> (<ex>adv.; of time</ex>) immediately, at once, directly, forthwith 
(N.B. not the E. «quick»; cf. <k>rapide</k>, <k>balde</k>, <k>subite</k>); 
<k>quika</k> done or happening at once, instantaneous, immediate; <k>quik pos vua 
 departo</k> immediately after your departure; 
<k>irez quik</k> go immediately; <k>me quik manjis ol</k> I ate it at once; <k>quika halto</k> quick (immediate) stop; 
<k>quika komprenebleso</k> immediate understanding; <k>quik kande</k> as soon 
as (lit.: immediately when). Def.: Ye la sama instanto; exakte ye sam-tempo.
<k>quino</k> quinquina, cinchona, Peruvian bark; (cf. <k>quinino</k>); <k>quiniero</k> cinchona tree (Cinchona).

<k>quinino</k> (<ex>chem</ex>.) quinine, quinia. Def.: Alkaloido extrakta di 
quino.

<k>quinkunco</k> quincunx. Def.: Kinopa dispozo di kozi (un en omna angulo e 
un meze di quadrato).

<k>quinto</k> (<ex>mus</ex>.) quint: interval of five consecutive notes; (<ex>fig</ex>.) 
a tenor violin; (<ex>piquet</ex>) quint, a sequence of five cards; (<ex>fencing</ex>) 
quinte, fifth guard.

<k>quintesenco</k> (<ex>lit. and fig</ex>.) quintessence, essential thing, pith 
(of a matter).

<k>quiproquo</k> quid pro quo, mistake, blunder. Def.: Intermixo di du personi 
o kozi; V-25.
<k>quirito</k> quirite, a citizen of ancient Rome in his civil capacity.

<k>quirlar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to twirl, querl; turn or wind (<k>ulo</k>) around. 
V. exp.: Agitar liquido, ex. kremo, per quirl-ilo.

<k>quita</k> quit(s), clear; rid, free (<k>de</k>, <k>pre ulo</k>); discharged (from 
debt); <k>quitigar</k> to receipt (a bill, etc.); to give a receipt to (<k>ulu</k>); 
to pay off, clear up; <k>quitigo</k> receipt; quittance, discharge (from debt); 
<k>quitesar ye ulu</k> to be quits with someone, to owe one nothing; <k>quitigo o 
 duopligo</k> (to play) quits of double; 
<k>quita reciproke</k> (to be) mutually quits; <k>il quitigis la recevo di mea 
 letro</k> he acknowledged the receipt of my letter.

<k>quoto</k> quota, portion, share, contribution. Def.: Parto quan on devas 
pagar o recevar, en repartiso di ula sumo totala.

<k>ka(d)</k> <ex>Question word, not always translated; in
indirect questions:</ex> whether if; <k>ka la vetero ne esas bela
 cadie?</k> is the weather not beautiful to-day? <k>kad il esas
 hike?</k> is he here? <k>me prizas savar kad il retrovenos?</k> I
would like to know whether he will come back? (N.B. whehter . .
whether is translated by <k>sive .. sive</k>); <k>vu esas
 fatigita</k>, <k>ka ne?</k> you are tired, aren't you? <k>vu ne esas
 fatigita</k>, <k>ka yes?</k> you aren't tired, are you? (cf. <ex>Complete
Manual</ex>, p. 26) <k>il komencis dubar kad il devas promulgar
 sua doktrino</k> he commenced to doubt whether he should
promulgate his doctrine.

<k>kabo</k> <ex>(geog.)</ex> cape; <k>preterirar kabo</k> <ex>(naut.)</ex>
to double a cape.

<k>kabano</k> cabin, hut; <k>kabaneto</k> (as for rabbits) hutch; <k>kabano
 montala</k> chalet.

<k>kabino</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> cabin; <k>kabineto</k> small cabin,
closed-like room, <ex>(nav.)</ex> state-room; <ex>(fig., furniture)</ex>
cabinet (as for curiosities).

<k>kablo</k> <ex>(of rope)</ex> cable, hawser (cf. <k>kordego</k>);
<ex>(of wire, also elec.)</ex> cable, <k>kableto</k> small cable,
mooring-rope, painter; <k>kabligar</k>, <k>kablifar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex>
to make a c. (out of) <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>kable telegrafar</k> to c.; <k>kablotelegramo</k>
cablegram.

<k>kabrar</k> <ex>(intr., of animals)</ex> to rear, prance; (cf. <k>kurbetar</k>);
<k>kabrigar</k> to make (a horse, etc.) rear; <k>kabretar</k> to
stand on the hind legs. <k>Kabretar</k> = Sideskar sur la dopa
gambi, elevante la avana; VI-76.

<k>kadastro</k> cadastre: register of real estate for taxing
purposes; <k>kadastrizar</k> to make a c. of: to survey and value
(lands).

<k>kadavro</k> cadaver, corpse, dead body; <k>kadavratra</k>
cadaverous; <k>kadavro marchanta</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> a walking ghost; <k>bestio
 kadavro</k> carcass, carrion (of animals).

<k>kadro</k> frame (of a picture, looking-glass, etc.; cf. <k>framo</k>);
<ex>(milit.)</ex> cadre: sekeleton, staff (of a regiment),
complement or list of officers (commissioned and
non-commissioned); <ex>(fig.)</ex> outline, plan, arrangement of
work, <ex>-izar:</ex> to frame (a picture, etc.).

<k>kaduka</k> caducous: decaying, falling, crumbling
tumble-down (of houses, etc.); decrepit, frail, worn-out (of
persons, animals, health, etc.); <ex>(bot.)</ex> falling off early.
Ant.: forta, yuna, robusta, vigor-oza, en bona stando.

<k>kafeo</k> coffee; <k>kafeiero</k> c. tree; <k>kafetaso</k> c.
cup; <k>kafekuliero</k> teaspoon; <k>kafekultivisto</k> c. planter; <k>kafeplantacerio</k>
c. plantation; <k>tas(ed)o (de) kafeo</k> cup of c.

<k>kagulo</k> a kind of monk's cloak with cowl. Def.:
Sen-manika mantelo di monakulo kun kapuco. Kapuco perforita per
okulo-trui.

<k>kakar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to defecate, void excrement, empty
the bowels, shite.

<k>kakao</k> <ex>(beans and drink)</ex> cocoa; <k>kakaiero</k>
cacao-tree (Theobroma cacao); <k>kakabutro</k> c. butter.

<k>kakofonio</k><k /> cacophony. Def.: Desagreabla
kunligo di soni, sive en parolo, sive en muziko; III

<k>kalo</k>, <k>kalajo</k><k /> <ex>(also bot.)</ex> callus,
callosity; <ex>(on foot)</ex> corn; <k>kaloza</k>, <k>kalatra</k><k />
callous.

<k>kalamo*</k><k /> <ex>(ant.)</ex> a reed pen used
in the East.

<k>kalamito</k><k /> calamite: a gum-resin; a
fossil plant. Def.: Speco de gumo (Styrax calamita); fosila
planto.

<k>kalamitato</k><k /> calamity. Ex.: La famino, la
milito esas kalamitati.

<k>kalandrar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to calender
(paper, cloth); to mangle (household linen).

<k>kalcinar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to calcine: to
oxidize (as by heat); to roast (ores).

<k>kaldiero</k><k /> boiler (steam generator);
copper: large boiler for brewing, washing, etc. Def.: Klozita
vazo (apartenanta generale a vapor-mashino), en qua on boliigas
aquo e konservas la vaporo sub preso; III

<k>kaldrono</k><k /> caldron: kettle for cooking.
Def.: Apertita vazo uzata en koqueyo; III

<k>kalemburo</k><k /> pun, play on words; <k>kalemburisto</k><k />
punster. Def.: Speco di vortoludo, en qua vorto o serio de vorti
prizentas du senci; III

<k>kalenturo</k><k /> <ex>(med.)</ex> calenture: a
tropical fever attributed to heat

<k>kalesho</k><k /> calash, open barouche, open
buggy. V. exp.: <k>Kalesho</k>, <k>karoso</k><k /> La du
esas veturi kun quar roli e quar plasi, ma kalesho esas apertita,
karoso esas klozita (kun plafono). Pluse, karoso esas generale
suspendita per specala modo (per rimeni); II

<k>kalio*</k><k /> <ex>(chem.)</ex> potassium; <k>kalibromo</k><k />
bromide of p.; <k>kalipermanganato</k><k />
permanganate of p.; <k>kalinitrato</k><k /> niter, p.
nitrate (cf. <k>salpetro</k>).

<k>kalibro</k><k /> caliber, bore (of a gun, etc.);
<k>kalibrkompaso</k><k /> callipers; <k>kalibrkompasagar</k><k />
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to calibrate.

<k>kalico</k><k /> chalice, communion-cup; <ex>(bot.)</ex>
calyx. Def.: Granda kupo, uzata precipue en religiala ceremonii;
II

<k>kaligrafar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to put <k>(ulo)</k>
into fine handwriting; <k>kaligraf(ad)o</k><k />
caligraphy.

<k>kalko</k><k /> lime; <ex>(chem.)</ex> calx; <k>kalkoza</k>:
calcareus; <k>kalkigar</k><k /> to calcify; <k>kalkizar</k><k />
to cover with l.; <k>kalkforno</k><k /> lime kiln; <k>kalkfornisto</k><k />
l. burner; <k>kalko kaustika</k><k /> quicklime.

<k>kalkaneo*</k><k /> <ex>(anat.)</ex> calcaneum: the
great bone of the heel.

<k>kalkolo</k><k /> <ex>(med.)</ex> calculus: stone
in bladder, kidneys, gall-ducts.

<k>kalkular</k><k /> <ex>(tr., math.)</ex> to
calculate, reckon, compute; <k>kalkulo</k><k />
calculation; <ex>(higher math.)</ex> calculus; <k>kalkuleroro</k><k />
error in c.; <k>kalkullibro</k><k /> ready reckoner
(book).

<k>kalma</k><k /> <ex>(of objects, fig. or persons)</ex>
calm, unagitated, quiet, still, placid; serene (of the elements,
passions, etc.); unruffled, composed, sedate (in manner and
deportment); <k>kalmigar</k><k /> to calm; <k>kalmigiva</k>, <k>kalmivo</k><k /> anodyne, sedative; <k>kalmesko</k>, <k>kalma
 intervalo</k> lull. V. exp.: <k>Kalma</k> signifikas tote pasiva
e materiala stando di kozi, qua ne movas: aero, aquo, maro kalma
(t.e. ne agitata da la vento). <k>Tranquila</k> havas senco
samtempe material e mentala, ma prefere aktiva: qui ne agitas su,
ne movas su sen utileso o skopo; on dicas ad infanto: restez
tranquila! on parolas pri vicini tranquila (qui ne lacas bruiso).
<k>Quieta</k> expresas stando mentala, qua plu klare definesas
per lua kontreajo, desquieta; I-713.

<k>kalmaro</k> calamar, calamary, cuttlefish, squid, (genus:
Loligo vulgaris). Def.: Genero di molusko cefalopoda kun dek
brakii; V-420.

<k>kalora</k> <ex>(tech., physical quantity)</ex> heat; <k>kalorala</k>, <k>kaloriziva</k>, <k>kaloranta</k>, <k>kalorifanta</k> caloric, thermic, calorific; <k>kalorizar</k>
to heat (by an apparatus); (cf. <k>varmigar</k>); <k>kalorizilo</k>
heat producer; <ex>(fig.)</ex> hot-air stove or pipe); <k>kalorareo</k>
heating surface.

<k>kalorio</k> <ex>(thermal unit)</ex> calory. Def.: Unajo di
kalor-quanto. On distingas la <k>granda kalorio</k>, <k /> qua
korespondas ad un kilogramo de aquo, e la <k>mikra kalorio</k>, <k />
qua korespondas ad un gramo; V-420.

<k>kaloriko</k> <ex>(hist.)</ex> caloric. Def.: Historiala
koncepto di la kaloro, kom material substanco.

<k>kaloto</k> callotte; <ex>(soldier's)</ex> rimless cap; <ex>(eccl.)</ex>
skull-cap; <ex>(math.)</ex> segment of a sphere divided by a plane.

<k>kalquar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to counter-draw: to trace (a design
through transparent paper); <k>kalquopapero</k> tracing-paper.
Def.: Kopiar desegno tra diafana papero per kontinua streki;
VI-116.
<k>kalumniar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to calumniate; (cf. <k>difamar</k>, <k>maldicensar</k>, <k>denigrar</k>). Def.: Dicar mala neveraji pri ulu.

<k>kalva</k> bald: having but little hair. V. exp.: Kalveso ne
esas kompleta senhareso; III-201.

<k>kalvario</k> Mount Calvary; a calvary: hill with a cross on
top; <ex>(fig.)</ex> punishment, expiation.

<k>kalzo</k> stocking, hose; <k>kalzeto</k> sock; <k>kalzego</k>
tights (as of a ballet girl); <k>kalzifar</k> to make s.; <k>kalzumo</k>
a socklike shoe (without heels); <k>kalzoligilo</k> stocking
suspender; lengthwise garter (cf. <k>gartero</k>).

<k>kam</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> than, as, to (in comparison, degree);
(cf. <k>tam</k>); <k>plu . . kam</k> more . . than; <k>tam . .
 kam</k> as . . as; <k>min . kam</k> less . . than; <k>ne tam .
 . kam</k> not so . . as; <k>me preferas ico kam ito</k> I
prefer this to that; <k>same . . kam</k> same as, in the same
manner as. Ex.: El esas plu afabla kam vu. Altru kam me. Me donos
a vi la sama rekompenso kam a li. Venez tam rapide kam posible.

<k>kamalio*</k> <ex>(ancient armor)</ex> camail: chain mail guard
for neck; a hooded cloak or mantle (esp. worn by bishops).

<k>kambiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to exchange (money, goods), to
barter <k>(ulo por ulo); kambio</k>, <k>kambieyo</k>, <k>kambierio</k> money or goods
exchange; <k>kambiisto</k> (money) exchanger; <k>kambiebla</k>
exchangeable, convertible; <k>kambie</k> in exchange; <k>kambioletro</k>
letter of e.; <k>kambio libera</k> od, <k>liberkambio</k>
free-trade. V. exp.: Kambiar esas esence komercal ago, per qua on
donas ulo por recevar altro. Omna kompro e vendo esas definitiva
kambio di la kozo komprata o vendata po ula sumo de pekunio.
Kambio sempre implikas du kozi e du personi; VII

<k>kambrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to camber: make slightly convex (a
piece of wood, a road, a ship's deck, etc.); to throw out one's
chest.

<k>kameno</k> chimney; <k>kamentubo</k> c. flue; <k>korpo di kameno</k>
c. stack; <k>kamenmantelo</k> c. piece; <k>kamensharpero: kamenisto</k> c.
sweep.

<k>kamiono</k> dray, truck, lorry: long sideless four-wheeled,
goods vehicle; <k>kamioneto</k> small dray; two wheeled hand truck.
Def.: Kargo-veturo konstitucita ek platformo sur qua on pozas la
vari; IV

<k>kamizo</k> <ex>(for men)</ex> shirt; <ex>(for women)</ex>
chemise; <k>kamizifisto</k> s. maker;<k>nokto kamizo</k> night s.

<k>kampar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to camp out, encamp; <k>kampeyo</k>
camping place; <k>kampolito</k> c. bed; <k>kamputensili</k> c.
utensils. V. exp.: vid. <k>bivakar.</k>

<k>kampaniar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make a campaign; <k>kampani(ad)o</k>
campaign(ing). V. exp.: En la milital senco, la vorto signifikas
periodo di milital operaci. Ma ol havas anke altra senci,
derivata o figurala: on parolas anke pri la (tote pacoza)
kampanii di navigado di maristo o  di navo, kampanii di
explorado, di peskado, di laborado, di propagado; kampanii
«elektala» di la kandidati ad elektala funcioni; kampanii di
jurnali por o contre ulu od ulo, e.c.; I

<k>kanalo</k> canal; <k>kanaleto</k> channel, gutter, small
trench; <k>kanaligar</k> to canalize: make like a c.; <k>kanalizar</k>
to canalize: to provide with c.s (a field); <k>kanalbatelo</k> c.
boat.

<k>kanalia</k>, <k>kanaliala</k> of the lowest class of people, rascally; <k>kanali(ul)o</k>
rascal, scoundrel, scamp; <k>kanaliaro</k> rabble, canaille,
riff-raff, roughs; <k>kanalieso</k>, <k>kanaliajo</k> blackgardism, rascality.
<k>kanapeo</k> sofa; <k>lit kanapeo</k> sofa-couch. V. exp.: vid. <k>divano</k>.

<k>kancelero</k> chancellor. (N.B. not a secretary); <k>granda
 kancelero</k> High C.

<k>kande</k> <ex>(adv., conj.)</ex> when; <k>de kande</k> since
when? how long since? <k>quik kande</k> immediately when, as
soon as; <k>kande</k> until when? <k>igre</k><k>kande</k>
no matter when. Ex.: Kande vu pagos vua debaji? Irge kande me
audas la uceli kantar. De kande vu lojas hike? Quik kande il
envenis, ni omna levis ni polite.

<k>kandida</k> candid, frank, ingenuous; <k>kandideso</k>
candor. Def.: (<k>kandideso</k>) Sincereso e naiveso
di persono senkulpa, bonvoloza, qua ne konocas la vicio;
III<k />

<k>kanelo</k>, <k>kanelaro</k>, <k>kanelizuro</k> channel(ing), slot,
fluting, groove (usually in form of half-circle: cf. ranuroand
VI

<k>kanetilio</k> purl: a spiral of gold or silver
wire used in lace work; silver wire (to cover violin strings,
etc.); (<ex>milin.</ex>) wire-ribbon.

<k>kanikulo</k> the dog days (22nd July to 23rd
Aug.); (<ex>astron.</ex>) Canicula: the Dog Star; <k>kanikulala</k>
canicular.

<k>kankro</k> crawfish, crayfish (family Astacidae);
(<ex>astron.</ex>) Cancer, The Crab.

<k>kanoo</k> (wooden) canoe: light and shallow boat
shart at both ends (as used for pleasure). Def. : Pirogatra
kanoto kun pintatra extremaji, facita ek dina ligno, movanta
ordinare per pagayi.

<k>kanono</k> (<ex>milit.</ex>) cannon; (<ex>eccl</ex>.)
canon, rules; <k>kanonaro</k> (<ex>milit.</ex>) artillery;
<k>kanonagar</k>, <k>kanonpafar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to cannonade; <k>kanonpafo</k>
c. shot; <k>kanonobuso</k> c. ball, shell; <k>kanonisto</k>
gunner; <k>kanonyuristo</k> (<ex>eccl.</ex>) canonist; <k>kanonaleso</k>
canonicity; <k>kanonbatelo</k> gun-boat, <k>kanonvishilo</k>
(<ex>artil.</ex>) sponge, wiper; <k>kanonacendilo</k>
quick-match.

<k>kanoto</k> punt, skiff, yawl, wherry; <k>kanoto
 granda</k> long-boat, barge, cutter; (<ex>cf.</ex> <k>barko</k>, <k>kanoo</k>, <k>pirogo</k>); <k>kanotagar</k> to go boating.
Def.: Mikra batelo senlerdeka, movata per remili, segli, motori,
e ordinare uzata en maral aqui.

<k>kantar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to sing, carol, (of
birds) to warble, (of a cock) to crow; (as in churches) to chant;
<k>kantetar</k> to hum (a tune); <k>kantera ucelo</k>:
songster (of birds).

<k>kantarido</k> (<ex>ent.</ex>) cantharis,
Spanish-fly, blister-beetle (Cantharis vesicatoria); <k>kantaridi</k>
(<ex>also pharm.</ex>) cantharides.

<k>kantileno</k> cantilena: a simple sentimental
melody. Def. Speco di kansono, anciena o lamentema; V

<k>kantino</k> canteen: refreshment place for
soldiers, workers, etc.
<k>kantono</k> canton: a district, as in Switzerland.

<k>kantoro</k> cantor: a chorister, chanter, singer;
esp. the leader of a church choir; a porcentor.

<k>kanulo</k> (<ex>surg.</ex>) canula, drainage tube
(for wounds), enema-pipe; (<ex>in gen.</ex>) pipe or nozzle (of a
syringe).

<k>kapo</k><k /> <ex>(anat. and fig.)</ex> head; <k>kapala</k><k />
relating to h., cephalic; <k>kapo avane</k><k />
headlong, headforemost; <k>kapnuda</k><k />
bareheaded; <k>kapdoloro</k><k /> headache; <k>kapkuseno</k><k />
pillow; <k>kapturn(ad)o</k><k /> giddiness; <k>kaplejera</k>, <k>kapo</k><k /> light-headed (person); <k>kaprupto</k><k />
headbreaking; <k>kapvesto</k><k /> head-gear; <k>kapo
 sencerebra</k><k /> a brainless head; <k>sen kapa</k><k />
head-less; <k>kapkaulo</k><k /> headed cabbage
(Brassica oleracea capitata); <k>kaptuko</k><k />
kerchief; <k>kaptranchar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
behead.

<k>kapabla</k><k /> able (to do, to execute),
capable; (cf. <k>kompetenta</k>, <k>apta</k>, <k /> suffix <k>kapabliv</k>); V.
exp.: vid. <k>habila</k>. Ant.: <k>nepovanta</k>, <k>nepotenta</k>, <k>nekapabla.</k>

<k>kapaca</k><k /> able (to contain, to hold); <k>kapac(esoz)a</k>:
capacious, spacious; <k>kapaceso</k>: capacity; <k>krugo kapaca de lu
 litri (o</k>, <k>krugo kun kapaceso de du litri)</k><k /> a
mug of two litres capacity; <k>tre kapac(esoz)a navo</k><k />
a very capacious ship.

<k>kapelino</k><k /> sun-bonnet: hood to shade head
and neck from sun.

<k>kapilara</k><k /> <ex>(phys.)</ex> capillary; <k>kapilareso</k><k />
capillarity; <k>kapilarag(ad)o</k><k /> c. action; <k>kapilara
 tubo</k>, <k>vaskulo</k> a c.

<k>kapistro</k><k /> <ex>(surg.)</ex> head bandage
for fracture of lower jaw.

<k>kapitalo</k><k /> <ex>(fin.)</ex> capital; <k>kapitalisto</k>, <k>kapitaliero</k><k /> capitalist; <k>kapitalala</k>, <k>kapitalista</k>, <k>kapitalism kapitalala</k><k />
capital, capitalistic; <k>kapitalismo</k><k /> capitalism;
<k>kapitaligar</k><k /> to capitalize.

<k>kapoto</k><k /> overcoat: storm or heavy coat
(as worn by soldiers: cf. <k>gabano</k>, <k>surtuto</k>) <ex>(nav.)</ex>
hood: a cover for a companion hatch, engine, etc.; (engine)
bonnet; (auto.) hood.

<k>kapro</k>, <k>kaprulo</k>, <k>kaprino</k><k /> goat; <k>kaprogardisto</k><k />
g. herd; <k>yun kaprala ganti</k><k /> kid gloves; <k>kaprosalto</k><k />
leap-frog. Def.: (<k>Kaprosalto</k>) Salto per qua unu saltas
super la dorso di altru plu o min inklinita; VII

<k>kaprico</k><k /> caprice, whim; <k>kapricoza</k>, <k>kapricema</k><k />
capricious; <k>me havis kaprico por ta muliero</k><k />
I had a fancy, a caprice for that woman; <k>la kaprici di la modo</k><k />
the caprices of fashion.

<k>kapriolar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to caper, cut
capers; (cf. <k>kabrar</k>); <k>kapriolo</k><k />
capriole: a leap, caper (as in dancing), a leap that a horse
makes with all fours without advancing.

<k>kaptar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to capture: catch
hold of, gripe, snatch; (cf. <k>sizar</k>, <k>prenar</k>); <k>kaptajo</k><k />
prize, prey, booty; <k>kaptat(ul)o</k><k /> captive,
prisoner; <k>kaptiteso</k><k /> captivity, bondage;
-ilo: trap, snare; -ar ye la kolumo; to collar (ulu).

<k>kaptacar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to inveigle: to obtain
by underhand manoeuvers or bribery or ruse, to captivate (in an
ill sense); <k>testamento obtenita per kaptaco</k>
will obtained by intrigue or undue influence; -o-laco,
-slingo:snare. Ex.: Kaptaca la fido, la heredajo di ulu.

<k>kapuco</k> (person's) hood, cowl; -izar: to hood,
put cowl on.

<k>kapucin(ul)o</k> a Capuchin (friar monk); <k>kapucinalajo</k>
(<ex>fig.</ex>) a dull sermon.

<k>karabino</k> carbine: short rifle; <k>karabiniero</k>
carbineer; <k>karabinhoko</k> c. hook, snap-hook,
swivel-hook.

<k>karafo</k> carafe, decanter (for wine, water, etc.
at table).

<k>karaktero</k> (distinctive quality of a person or
thing) character; <k>karakterizar</k> to characterize; <k>karakteriziva</k>, <k>karakterizivo</k>, <k>karakteruro</k> characteristic, specification. Ex.: il
esas homo di alte etikal karaktero. Ol havas la karaktero
distingiva di la vereso (E. it has the distinctive character
(characteristic or stamp) of truth; Tala ago bone karakterizas
mea amiko. La karakterizivi di morbo. Karakteriziva signo.

<k>karasino*</k> crucian, a carplike fish (Carassius
vulgaris); <k>karasinorea</k> goldfish (Carassius auratus).

<k>karato</k> carat: part or weight of precious
stones or gold.

<k>karbo</k> (<k>chem.</k>) carbon; <k>karbala</k>, <k>karboza</k> carbonaceous, carbonic; <k>karbido</k>
carbide; <k>karbato</k> carbonate; <k>karbobioxo</k>, <k>karbatacido</k> carbondioxide, carbonic acid. V. exp.:
L'Akademio adoptis karbono en la vulgara senco e karbo por la
kemial elemento; IV

<k>karbono</k> coal (cf. <k>karbo</k>); <k>karbonoza</k>
full of c., carboniferous; <k>karbonigar</k> to make into
or change to coal; <k>karbonizar</k> to cover with c.; (<ex>fig.</ex>)
to besmut; <k>ter</k>, <k>min karbono</k> pit-coal; <k>ligno
 karbono</k> charcoal; <k>karbonfairo</k> c. fire; <k>karbonfumo</k>
c. smoke: <k>karbongaso</k> c. gas; <k>karbonmineyo</k>, <k>karbonerio</k> c. mine; <k>karbonpulvero</k> c. dust; <k>karbonvendisto</k>
c. dealer; <k>karbonifar</k>, <k>karboneskar</k> to be charred, smolder
(of wicks).

<k>karcero</k> prison, gaol, jail; <k>karcerano</k>
prisoner; <k>karcergardisto</k> prison guard, warden; <k>karcero statala</k>
state's p.; <k>karcerocelulo (subtera)</k> dungeon; (<ex>milit.</ex>)
black-hole.

<k>karkamino</k> (<ex>bot.</ex>) cardamine:
bittercress, land-cress; <k>karkamino pratala</k> lady's
smock, cuckoo flower: the common buttercress.

<k>kardamomo</k> (<ex>bot.</ex>) cardamon (Eletaria
cardamomum, an species of Amomum).

<k>kardinala</k> (<ex>math. and fig.</ex>) cardinal; <k>kardinala
 nombro</k> c. number; <k>kardinala punto</k> c. point; <k>kardinalvertuo</k>
c. virtue.

<k>kardinalo</k> (<ex>prelate</ex>) cardinal; <k>kardinalea</k>
c. colored; <k>kardinaleso</k> cardinalate; <k>kardinalbireto</k>
cardinal's cap; <k>kardinalchapelo</k> c. hat.

<k>kardono</k> (<ex>bot.</ex>) thistle; <k>sen
 kardonigar</k> to clear of thistles.

<k>karear</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to do without
(involuntarily), to dispense with (from necessity); to make shift
without; <k>kareebla</k> dispensible: wanted but not
needed; <k>kareajo</k> something wanted but which one has
not or cannot have now. V. exp.: Me indijas ulo = to mankas a me,
e me bezonas ol; me kareas ulo = to mankas a me, e me ne bezonas
ol: me povas esar (agar, vivar) sen ol. Me facile kareas krinkar
kande me kelke durstas. Me ne povas karear fairo en vintro. Me ne
povas karear dormo. En voyajo on devas karear multa kozi
III<k />

<k>karelo</k> (square) slab, tile, plaque, plate; (<ex>in
cards</ex>) diamond; <k>karelizar</k> to pave (a surface
with tiles, bricks, etc.); <k>karelatra</k>, <k>kareloza</k>
tesselated.

<k>kareno</k> lower hull, ship's bottom (part under
water). V. exp.: Kareno signifikas ne nur la kilio, ma la tota
surfaco di navo, qua esas imersita; IV

<k>karesmo</k> Lent; <k>mez karesmo</k>
Mid-Lent; <k>praktikar la karesmo</k> to keep L.

<k>karezar</k> to caress: fondle with affection; <k>karezachar</k>
to fawn upon, cajole, wheedle. Ex.: Karezar infanto. La zefiro
karezas la flori. Karezachar oldulo por igar il facar sua
testamento.

<k>kragar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to load (goods; N.B. not
to load a vehicle): <k>kragajo</k> load, cargo, freight,
burden; <k>kragobatelo</k> ligher, barge; <k>kragokavalo</k>
parck-horse; <k>kragoletro</k> way-bill, bill of lading;
<k>kragoselo</k> pack-saddle; <k>kragoverturisto</k>
drayman. Ex.: Kargar vari sur veturo. Kargajo di navo. V. exp.:
vid. <k>chargar</k>.

<k>kariar</k> (<ex>intr., med.</ex>) to have caries,
to have decay or rot of teeth; (<ex>of wheat</ex>) to be smutly; <k>kariinta
 dento</k> a decayed tooth; <k>kariinta arboro</k>
rotten tree.

<k>kariatido</k> (<ex>arch.</ex>) caryatide. Def.:
Hominala figuro, qua servas kom suportilo: (cf. <k>atlanto</k>).

<k>kariero</k> (<ex>profession, trade</ex>) career; <k>la
 kariero di militisto</k> the military c., profession of arms; <k>legala
 kariero</k> legal c. or profession.

<k>kariko</k> box-coat; coat with long cape or
serveral short ones.

<k>karitato</k> charity: spiritual benevolence (N.B.
not alms; cf. <k>almono</k>).

<k>karno</k> flesh, meat; <k>karnea</k> f.
colored, rosy; <k>karnajo</k> a fleshy object, a piece of
meat; <k>karnala</k> of the flesh; carnal; <k>karnvendeyo</k>
butcher's establ.; <k>karnoza</k> fleshy, brawny; <k>karnomanjanta</k>, <k>karno; karnoavida</k> flesh-eat-ing; -er; fond of meat; (cf. <k>karnivora</k>);
<k>karnifar</k>, <k />  <k>karnigar</k> <ex>(intr., tr.)</ex>
to produce, to make flesh (on); <k>karneskar</k> to become fleshy; <k>karnofumizado</k>
smoke-drying beef; <k>karnoreda</k> blood-red, carnation (color); <k>karnovermo</k>
maggot.

<k>karnaciono</k> carnation: flesh-tint, complexion. Ex.: Ica
koloro ne konvenas a mea karnaciono. La karnacioni en ica pikturo
(protreto) esas tre natural.

<k>karonado</k> <ex>(artil.)</ex> carronade. Def.: Speco di
navala kanono (anciena); VI

<k>karoso</k> coach: a large closed carriage; ornamental coach
(for state occasions). V. exp.: vid. kalesho.

<k>karpentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to work timber, do carpenter
work. V. exp.: La <k>karpentisto</k> facas nur grosa laboruri ek
ligno, generale por domi e konstrukturi. La <k>menuzisto</k>
facas plu mikra laboruri, konseque plu preciza e delikata,
exemple por mobli, parqueti, eskaleri, e.c. La <k>ebenisto</k>
juste plakizas ebono(-plaki) sur mobli, tabli, e.c., ma per
extenso on povas uzar ica vorto por plak-laboristo en altra ligno
kam ebeno, en senco simila a menuzisto; IV

<k>karto</k> a card; <k>kartuyo</k> c. case: <k>intermixar la karti</k>
to shuffle the c.s; <k>pozar la karti</k> to lay down the c.s.

<k>kartavar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to pronounce one's r's
gutterally; <k>kartavo</k> (Northumbrian) burr.

<k>kartelo</k> cartel: letter of defiance or challenge, as to a
duel.

<k>karteziana*</k> Cartesian; <k>karteziandiablo</k>, <k>plunjanto</k> <ex>(phys.)</ex>
C. Devil or diver, bottle-imp; (cf. <k>ludiono</k>).

<k>kartocho</k> cartridge; <k>kartochuyo</k> c. holder, -box: <k>kartochiferio</k>
c. making establ.

<k>kartomancio*</k> cartomancy; <k>kartomanciisto</k> fortuneteller (by
cards). Def.: Speco di divinado, predicado per ludkarti;
V

<k>kartono</k> cardboard, pasteboard; <k>kartonbuxo</k>, <k>kartonkesto</k>
carton (box); <k>kartonizar</k>, <k>kartonbindar</k>, <k>kartonkovrar</k> to put up in
cartons <k>(ulo)</k>, <k /> to bind in boards (books).

<k>kaso</k> coffer, till, cash-box, treasury; <k>kasisto</k>, <k>kasero</k>
cashier, paymaster, treasurer; <k>kaserio</k> treasury (establ.); <k>kontar
 sua kaso</k> to make up the cash account.: <k>kasostando</k>, <k>enkasa
 sumo</k> cash in hand.

<k>kasacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to quash, annul, reverse, to
declare null and void, to invalidate; <k>korto di kasaco</k> (in
France) court of cassation (the supreme court of appeal); <k>kasacar
 testamento</k> to quash a will; <k>kasacar mariajo</k> to annul a
marriage.

<k>kasiso</k> <ex>(fruit)</ex> black currant; <k>kasisiero</k> b.c.
bush or tree; -liquoro: b.c. cordial.

<k>kasono</k> caisson: under-water cofferdam; cradle to lift
ships from the water; (cf. <k>municionofurgono</k>).

<k>kasqueto</k> <ex>(for men or boys)</ex> cap with visor (as
golf-cap, naval officer's cap, etc.).

<k>kastano</k> chestnut (edible nut); <k>kastaniero</k> c. tree
(genus: Castanea); <k>kaval kastaniero</k> horse-c. (Aesculus
hippocastanum); <k>kastanea</k>, <k>kastanbruna</k> c. colored cf. <k>marono</k>).

<k>kastoro</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> castor: a beaver (genus: Castor);
<k>kastorchapelo</k> a beaver-hat; <k>kastordrapo</k> beaver-cloth.

<k>kato</k>, <k>katulo</k>, <k>katino</k> cat, <k>kateto</k>, <k>katyuno</k> small cat,
kitten; <k>genituro di katino</k> litter of kittens.

<k>kataklismo</k> cataclysm. Def.: Irga subverso di la teral
surfaco per granda fenomeno: inundo, tertremo, erupto;
IV

<k>katalogo</k> catalogue; <k>katalogizar</k> to c. V. exp.: <k>vid.
 avizo.</k>

<k>kataro</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> catarrh; <k>katareto</k> a cold; <k>katarala</k>, <k>kataroza</k>, <k>katarika</k>, <k>katariko</k> catarrhal; <k>donar katar(et)o ad (ulu)</k>
to give a cold to; <k>kaptesar da katar(et)o</k> to catch cold.

<k>katastrofo</k> catastrophy (cf. <k>kalamitato</k>, <k>kataklismo</k>).
Ex. L'erupto di Vesuvius esis granda katastrofo.

<k>katedro</k> desk (of a professor); pulpit (in a church); <k>ek
 (la) katedro</k> (fig.) ex cathedra (L.), openly; avowedly,
professedly.

<k>katekizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to catechize; <k>katekizero</k>
catechist. Def.: Docar la <k>katekismo;</k> instruktar ulu per
questioni et respondi pri la precipua punti di (Kristana)
religio.

<k>kateno</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> chain; <k>katenizar</k> to c.
up <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>katenigar</k> to link together, connect; <k>katenifisto</k>
c.maker; <k>katenkurvo</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> catenary arch; <k>katenringo</k>
c. link; <k>katenmasho</k> c. mesh; <k>kateno di la eventi</k> c. of
events; <k>katenigo</k> concatenation.

<k>katisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give a gloss, a luster to
(cloth, by hot or cold pressing).

<k>katoptriko</k> <ex>(opt.)</ex> catoptrics; (cf. <k>dioptriko</k>).
Def.: Teorio di la speguli (omnaspeca) ed optikal instrumenti
kompozita ek speguli; IV

<k>kauciono</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> surety, bail, security, caution; <k>kaucionsumo</k>
 s. money; <k>kaucionizar</k> to stand bail or go surety for (<k>ulu</k>);
(cf. <k>garantiar</k>); <k>liberigar ulu per kauciono</k> to liberate
on bail.

<k>kaudo</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> tail; train (of a gown); <k>kaudala</k>
caudal; <k>kaudagar</k>, <k>kaudagitar</k> to wag or switch the tail; <k>sen
 kauda</k> tailless; <k>kaudportero</k> train-bearer.

<k>kaulo</k> cabbage (Brassica oleracea); <k>kaulrapo</k>
kohlrabi (B. o. caulorapa); <k>kaulosupo</k> c. soup.

<k>kaustika*</k> caustic; <ex>(chem.)</ex> burning, corrosive; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
biting, stinging, satirical (language, etc.); <k>kaustika kalko</k> c.
lime, quick-lime; <k>kaustiko</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> caustic curve; <k>kaustikajo</k>
a c. substance.

<k>kauzo</k> cause: that which produces an effect; <k>kauzala</k>, <k>kauziganta</k> causal, causative; <k>kauzeso</k> causality; <k>nula
 efekto sen kauzo</k> no effect without a c.; <k>prima kauzo</k>
primary c. Ant.: <k>efekto rezultajo</k>, <k>konsequant(aj)o</k>.

<k>kava</k> hollow, sunken; <k>kavo</k>, <k>kavajo</k> (natural) hollow,
cavity, <k>kavigar</k> to h. out, scoop out (by natural causes cf.
<k>exkavar</k>); <k>arboro kava</k> a h. tree, <k>dento kava</k> h.
tooth; <k>kava okuli</k>, <k>vangi</k> h. eyes; sunken cheeks; <k>la
 pluvi kavigis la tero</k> the rains hollowed out the ground.

<k>kavalo</k> horse, steed; <ex>(at chess)</ex> knight; <k>kavalala</k>
equine; <k>kavalulo</k> stallion; <k>kavalino</k> mare; <k>kavalacho</k>
hack; <k>kavalisto</k> horse-man; <k>kavaleyo</k>, <k>kavalstablo</k> stable; <k>kaval(eduk)erio</k>
stud; <k>kavalfako</k> h.stall, box; <k>kavalfeko</k> h.dung; <k>kavalferisto</k>
farrrier, h.shoer; <k>kavalkarno</k> h. meat; <k>kavalkrino</k> h.
hair; <k>kavalo bankardala</k> wheeler; <k>kavalpedo</k> foot of a h.;
<k>kavalpovo</k> <ex>(mechan.)</ex> h. power; <k>kavalraso</k> h. family;
<k>kavalservisto</k>, <k>kavalsorgisto</k> groom, ostler; <k>kavalstulo</k>
pannier <k>kavallegilo</k>, <k>kavalreto</k> covering for a h.: <k>kavalvendisto</k>
h. dealer.

<k>kavalkar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ride (as on a horse); <k>kavalkantaro</k>
cavalcade; <k>kavalkero</k>, <k>kavalkisto</k> horseman, equerry; <k>kavalkala</k>
equestrian; <k>kavalkodocisto</k> riding master; <k>kavalke</k>
astride; <k>kavalkbloko</k> h. block. Ex.: Kavalkar kavalo, asno. La
sorcistini kavalkas bastoni. Sidar kavalke (E. astride) sur
benko.

<k>kaverno</k> cavern, cave; <k>kavernano</k> inhabitant of a c.
(cf. <k>troglodito</k>); <k>kavernala</k>, <k>kavernoza</k> cavernous (of caves);
<k>kavernatra</k> cavernous, hollow (of sounds).

<k>kayo</k> quay; (R.R.) platform. Def.: Rivo masonita et
vertikal (alonge rivero, lago et metafore la senco fervoyala),
qua posibligas l'embarko o desembarko di personi, vari, o por
charjar e descharjar navi; VI

<k>kayero</k> blank-book: a few sheets of paper stiched
together and covered with a wrapper.

<k>kazo</k> <ex>(jur., gram., med. and general)</ex> case (N.B.
not casing); <k>kaze ke</k> (conj.) in case (that); <k>kazo</k> (o, <k>questiono)
 di koncienco</k> a case of conscience; <k>kazo di pendigo</k> a
hanging matter; <k>segun la kazo</k> according to the case; <k>omnakaze</k>
(o, <k>kazsupoze</k>): in any case; <k>takaze</k> in that case; <k>nulkaze</k>
in no case; <k>en omna kazo</k> in any case, in any event; <k>ni
 prenos nia parapluvi</k>, <k>kaze ke pluvo rikomencus</k> we will take
our umbrellas in case it may rain; <k>preparez la chambro por la
 kazo ke il venus</k> prepare a room in case he should come; <k>en
 la kazo ke il venoz</k>, <k>enduktez il</k> in case he comes, show him
in.

<k>kazako</k> cassock: a large sleeved coat formely worn by
soldiers; (woman's) long jacket (for outdoor wear); <k>kazaketo</k>
(woman's) short jacket; (cf. <k>sutano</k>).

<k>kazeo</k> (o, <k>kremkazeo</k>): cream cheese (cf. <k>fromajo</k>);
<k>kazealtra</k> caseous; <k>kazeifar</k> to make c..

<k>kazerno</k> barrack (for soldiers); <k>enkazernigar</k>
to quater troops in b.s.
<k>kazino</k> casino: assembly room for cardplaying, etc.

<k>kazuala</k> contingent, casual, fortuitous, precarious; <k>kazualo</k>
a contingent thing (as, a prequisite, extra salary, etc.); <k>kazuala
 ofico</k> office held during pleasure; <k>kazuala revenui</k>
incidental revenues; <k>la kazuali di la paroko</k> the casual
income or fees of the vicar. Def.: <k>Hazardala</k>, <k>acidentala
 acesora.</k>

<k>kazuistiko</k> casuistry: science or doctrine of right and
wrong; <k>kazuistikacha</k> sophistical.

<k>ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> that (where it unites a clause with the
principal sentence; it is often united with prepositions to form
subordinating conjunctions): <k>pro ke</k> because; <k>por ke</k>
in order that (followed by imperative); <k>dum ke</k> while,
during the time that; <k>pos ke</k> after; <k>til ke</k> until;
<k>de ke</k> because, from (with participle); <k>depos ke</k>, <k>de
 kande ke</k> since; <k>kontre ke</k> while (contrast); <k>malgre
 ke</k> notwithstanding that; <k>per ke</k> thru the fact that; <k>segun
 ke</k> accoding to whether; <k>sen ke</k> without (with
participle); <k>ultre ke</k> besides that; <k>vice ke</k>
instead that: (<k>ke</k> is likewise joinded with adverbs); <k>tale
 ke</k> so that, in such a way that; <k>tante ke</k> so much
that; <k>tante longe ke</k> so long that; <k>tante ofte ke</k>
so often that; <k>tante plu...ke</k> all the more so as; <k>kase
 ke</k> in case (that); <k>kondicione ke</k> on condition
(that); <k>unfoye ke</k> once (that).; <k>omnafoye ke</k>
everytime that; <k>supoze ke</k> supposing that; <k>time ke</k>
for fear that; (cf. Talmey's Text Book, p. 92).

<k>keglo</k> skittle; ninepin; <k>keglaro</k> a set of skittles
or ninepins; <k>kegleyo</k>, <k>keglsulo</k> bowling-alley, s. ground; <k>ludar
 per kegli</k> to play s.s.

<k>kelo</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> (wedge-) key, peg, cotter-pin,
linch-pin, gib; <k>kelagar</k>, <k>kelizar</k> to fasten with a pin.

<k>kelka</k>, <k>kelki</k> some, a few, a little: indicates an
indeterminate but not large number, quantity or degree; (cf <k>poka</k>);
<k>kelko</k> someting; <k>kelku</k> somebody, someone; <k>kelketo</k>
a little bit; <k>kelkafoye</k> sometime; <k>kelkatempe</k>
sometimes; <k>kelkaloke</k> somewhere, in some parts or, or some
place; <k>me esas kelke fatigita</k> I am somewhat tired; <k>donez
 a me kelka pano</k> give me some bread; <k>lu esas kelke
 maladeta</k> he is somewhat sick; <k>me vartis ilu dom kelka
 tempo</k> I waited some time for him. Def: Nedeterminita (tamen
negranda) nombro, o quanto, o grado. V. exp.: <k>Kelka</k>, <k>poka</k>:
On povas uzar <k>kelka</k> por indikar plu granda nombro (o,
quanteso) kam <k>poka</k>. Ex.: La mediko dicas a sua kuracato:
«Vu drinkas tro multa biro. (1) Vu darfas drinkar <k>kelka</k>
(t.e. negranda quanto, forasn tri o quar glasi singladie). (2) Vu
darfas drinkar <k>poka</k> (t.e. mikra quanto, forsan nur un
glaso de biro).» La signifiki di la sama radiki kelkafoye
(pokafoye) tote diferas en la Angla de la Franca (en ca frazo,
kelkafoye signifikas preske ofte, relative ofte; pokafoye
signifikus preske nultempe, relative des-ofte (E. rarely).

<k>kemio</k><k /> chemistry; <k>kemiala</k><k />
chemical; <k>kemiisto</k><k /> chemist (N.B. not a
druggist).

<k>kepio</k><k /> kepi: milit. cap worn by French
soldiers.

<k>kerlo</k><k /> fellow, chap, (N.B. this word
carries no proper moral valuation and is not used as an insult;
cf. II

<k>kerno</k><k /> kernel, stone (of fruits); core
(of statutes, etc.); <k>kerneto</k><k /> pip; <k>kernoza</k><k />
full of kernels.

<k>kesto</k><k /> packing-case, box, chest (of tea,
soap, etc.); case (of wine, etc.); (cf. <k>kofro</k>, <k>buxo</k>); <k>kesteto</k><k />
small case; <ex>(fig.)</ex> (small) casket.

<k>kikar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to kick (out
behind, of horses, and other animals); (cf. <k>pedofrapar</k>); <k>kikema</k>, <k>kikera</k><k /> kicker (tendency).

<k>kimero</k><k /> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> chimera; <k>kimera</k>, <k>kimerala</k>, <k>kimeratra</k>, <k>kimerema</k><k /> chimerical, fanciful,
visionary.

<k>kin</k><k /> five (for derivations, cf. <k>du</k>);
<k>kinadekyara</k>, <k>kino</k><k /> (person) 50 years old; <k>kinyarala</k><k />
quinquennial: which takes place every five years; <k>kinyara</k>, <k>kinopa</k><k />
quinquennial: which lasts five years; <k>kinfranka peco</k><k />
a five-franc piece.

<k>kiragro</k><k /> chiragra. Def.: Goto en la
manui.

<k>kiromanciar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to read the
hand of; <k>kiromancio</k><k /> chiromancy, palmistry.

<k>kisar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to kiss; <k>kisegar</k><k />
to give a hearty kiss to.

<k>klado</k><k /> first (or rough) draft (of a
writing); <k>kladifar</k><k /> to make a rough draft.

<k>klakar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to clap (<k>per</k>)
(as with the hands), to clack, smack (as the lips, the tongue
against the palate), to chatter (as teeth from cold); <k>klakigar</k><k />
to clap, to crack (the fingers, a whip, etc.); <k>klakoplanko</k>:
clapper; klak! smack! pop! V. exp.: Ta vorto indikas altra bruiso
kam <k>karkar</k>; <k>klako</k> esas bruiso di shoko (momentala)
di du surfaci plu or min plata; <k>krako</k> esas bruiso (qua
povas durar) di ulo qua ruptesas frakasesas;
III

<k>klamar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to shout, exclaim, vociferate, cry
aloud (words); <k>klam(ad)o</k> shout(ing), clamor: outcry; <k>klamala</k>
exclamative; <k>klamisto</k> public crier; <k>klamachar</k> to bawl,
squall; <k>klamopunto</k> exclamation point. V. exp.: On vokas
sempre ulu: on klamas olu. On povas sempre ulu; on klamas ulo. On
povas vokar sen klamar (per signalo, sonilo); on povas klamar sen
vokar; IV

<k>klapo</k> any flat piece turning on a axis; as: flapvalve;
leaf (of a folding door); flap (of a pocket or envelope or
table); <k>klapsidilo</k> flap-seat, folding-seat; <k>kamenoklapo</k> damper. Def.: Omna plana peco, qua povas turnar cirkum axo
en sua plano; V

<k>klara</k> clear: free from all dims, blurs, obscures,
obstructs; <ex>(fig.)</ex> plain, evident; <k>klareso</k> clearness,
light, plainness; <k>klarigar</k> to clarify, make clear,
elucidate; <k>klareskar</k> to become clear; <k>klarobskuro</k>
chiaroscuro; <k>klarvid(ad)o</k> clear sightedness, clairvoyance; <k>klara aquo</k>
clear water; <k>klara koloro</k> light color; <k>klarblua okuli</k>
clear (or light) blue eyes; <k>klara mento</k> clear mind; <k>klara
 voco</k> clear voice; <k>la defino ne esas klara</k> the
definition is not clear; <k>klarigar la signifiko</k> to
elucidate the meaning; <k>klarigar la voyo</k> to clear the road; <k>klarirgar
 afero</k> to clear up a business. Ant.: <k>obskura</k>, <k>nelimpida</k>, <k>konfuza.</k>

<k>klariono</k> clarion: military bugle; (cf. <k>buglo</k>, <k>trumpeto</k>). Def.: Speco di trumpeto kun sono akuta e
penetranta, uzata da soldati e milit-navisti.

<k>klaso</k> (all senses) class; <k>klaso laboristala</k>
laboring cl.; <k>klasolukto</k> c. struggle; <k>ca verko ne
 konvenas ad omna klasi di lektanti</k> this work does not suit
all classes (all kinds) of readers; <k>artisto di la unesma
 klaso</k> a first class artist; <k>bilieto di la duesma kalso</k>
a second class ticket; <k>dividar la lernanti en du klasi</k> to
divide the learners into two classes; <k>klaso di maniferi</k>
class of mammals.

<k>klaudikar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be lame, to hall, limp,
hobble, (in walking); <k>klaudikigar</k> to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to
limp, to make lame (in legs): <k>klaudikar en la du pedi</k> to be
lame, to limp with both feet.

<k>klauzo</k> clause, stipulation, article (in a contract,
will, etc.; N.B. not in sentence; cf. <k>membro di frazo</k>).

<k>klavo</k> key (of a key-board); (cf. <k>klefo</k>); <k>klavaro</k>
keys (collect.), key-board. Def. La extramjo di levero quan on
presas por produktar ula efekto (en piano, orgeno, telegrafilo,
tiposkribilo, e.c.); VI

<k>klefo</k> key <ex>(to locks, also fig.)</ex>; <k>klefagar</k>, <k>klefeklosar</k> <k>(tr.)</k> to lock (<k>ulu</k>); <k>klefisto</k> <k>(karcerala)</k>
turnkey; <k>klefringo</k> k. ring; <k>chefa klefo</k> master-key; -<k>o
 di cienci</k> k. to the sciences. Def.: Utensilo usata por
apelar seruri, generale per rotaco cirkum lua axo: VI-28.
<k />

<k>klemar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to press closely together, squeeze,
tighten, clench; <k>klemar la ligili</k> to tighten the bonds; <k>klemar
 la ligili di amikeso</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to tighten the bonds of
friendship. Ex.: Klemar skrubo, freno, nodo, junturo, manuo.
<k />

<k>klementa</k> clement, merciful, lenient. Def.: Indulgema e
pardonema (anke teologiala senco); III593. Ant. <k>severa</k>, <k>nepardonema</k>. <k />

<k>klerik(ul)o</k> cleric, clergyman; <k>klerikala</k> clerical; <k>klerikaro</k>
clergy (collect.); <k>klerikana; ano</k>, <k>klerikisto</k> clericalist, partisan
of clericalism; <k>klerikeso</k> ministry, holy orders; <k>klerikismo</k>
clericalism. <k />

<k>klerko</k> (office) clerk (of a notary, lawyer); <k>klerkeso</k>
clerkship; <k>chef klerko</k> chief c.; (cf. <k>komizo</k>).
<k />

<k>kliento</k> client (of a lawyer); patient (of a physician);
cutomer (of a tradesman); <k>klientaro</k> clientele, clients
(collect.); <k>klientizar</k> to get costumers for (a shop, etc); <k>klientizo</k>custom: patronage; <ex>(fig.)</ex> good-will. <k />

<k>kliko</k> pawl, (spring-)catch; <k>klikizar</k> to cog with a
catch; <k>klikoroto</k> ratchet-wheel. Def.: Movebla levero-brakio
qua, ingranante roto-denti, povas impedar la movo dil rotoen movo
en sinso kontrea. <k />

<k>kliktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to clank, click, clack, clash,
clatter: to make a sudden, sharp noise by striking; <k>klikt(ad)o</k>
clang(ing), clank (of armour, of chains); <k>klikteto</k> click,
jingle (as of classes); <k>kliktili</k> snappers, bones. <k />

<k>klimar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to climb (up), clamber (over),
mount, ascend (by hand or foot or tendrils). Ex.: Klimar (sur)
arboro, monto. La planto klimas til la duesma etajo. <k />

<k>klinar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to overlap, to cover partially,
to clinkerbuild. Def.: Superpozar la bordi di la folii di tolo o
la planki qui kompozas la kareno di batelo, e.c.; IV<k /><k />

<k>klishar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to take a stereotype of something to
be printed; <k>klishuro</k> stereotype; <ex>(photog.)</ex> negative,
cliche; (cf. <k>stereotipar</k>). <k />

<k>klistero</k> clyster: enema; <k>klisterizar</k> to give an enema to <k>(ulu)</k>;
<k>klistertubo</k>, <k>klisterpumpilo</k>, <k>klisterizilo</k>, <k>injektilo</k>, <k>klistersiringo</k> instrument
for giving an enema. <k />

<k>kloko</k> o'clock; of (by) the clock; <k>esas un kloko</k> it
is one o'clock; <k>esas du kloki</k> it is two o'clock; <k>tri
 kloki dek (minuti)</k> ten minutes past three; <k>quar kloki e
 quarimo</k> quarter past four; <k>kin kloki e duimo</k> half
past five; <k>sis kloki e tri quarimi</k> a quater to seven; <k>sep
 kloki kinadek (minuti)</k> ten minutes to eight; <k>ok kloki
 kinadek e kin (minuti)</k> five minutes to nine; <k>ante tri
 kloki matine</k> before three o'clock in the morning; <k>pos ok
 kloki e duimo verspere</k> after half past eight in the evening.
(Note: «What time is it?» is translated «Qua tempo esas?». In
some countries in Europe the hours are counted continuously from
midnight to midnight, therfore: <k>duadek kloki</k> (twenty
o'clock) eight o'clock in the evening. <k>kloklibro (di la
 fervoyo)</k> railway guide.

<k>kloro</k> chlorine (gas); <k>kloracido</k> hydro-chloric (or,,
muriatic) acid; <k>klorato</k> chlorate; <k>kloratacido</k> chloric
acid.

<k>klosho</k> a bell; anything in the form of a b.: <k>klosheto</k>
little b., hand b.; <k>klosharo</k> collections of b.s; chimes: <k>kloshturmo</k>
b. steeple, belfry; <k>kloshario</k>, <k>muziko</k> (the music of) chimes; <k>klosh(aro)plear</k>
<ex>(intr.)</ex>; <k>kloshsonigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to play chimes, to
ring the bells; <k>kloshpleisto</k>, <k>kloshero</k> chimer; <k>kloshsonigisto</k>, <k>kloshero</k> b. ringer.

<k>klostro</k> cloiter: coverered arcade, especially around a
monastic building.

<k>klovo</k> (metal) nail; <k>klovagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to nail (<k>ulo</k>);
<k>klovizar</k> to stud with n.s; <k>klovifar</k> to make n.s.; <k>klovostopar</k>
to spike (a gun).

<k>klozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to close, shut (up) (a door, a
window, a room, a way, the eyes, a wound, etc.); <k>klozeyo</k>
inclosed place, close; <k>klozajo</k> someting inclosed, an
inclosure; <k>klozilo</k> fence barrier; <k>klozagrafo</k>, <k>klozobuklo</k>
clasp, buckle, snap; <k>klefklozar</k> to lock; <k>klozetar la
 okuli</k> to blink the eyes; <k>miklozita</k> half-closed; <k>klozopetro</k>
keystone; <k>klozpunisar</k> to keep in (for punishment), to
restrict liberty <ex>(mililt.)</ex>.

<k>knikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bend a thing so as to occasion a
flaw in it (yet no entirely to break it), to crack, flaw; (cf. <k>krakar</k>, <k>flexar</k>, <k>fendar</k>). Def.: Strenar korpo relative longa, ex.
stango, per preso en la longesal directiono sur la du extremaji .

<k>koagular</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to coagulate, curdle, clot,
curd.

<k>koaktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to constrain, coerce, oblige,
compel, force (N.B. this refers espacially to moral; social,
