intellectual compulsion, rather than physical force; cf. <k>forco</k>, <k>forsar</k>); <k>respekto</k>, <k>gratitudo</k>, <k>autoritato koaktas me
 silencar</k> respect, gratitude, authority compel me to be
silent; <k>ne koatkez il</k> do not use compulsion with him; <k>vivo
 esas perpeuta koakto</k> life is a perpetual constraint; <k>koaktanta</k>, <k>koaktiva povo</k> coactive, coercive power; <k>koaktokamizolo</k>
strait-jacket.

<k>koalisar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to form a coalition (<k>kun</k>);
<k>koaliso</k>, <k>koalisuro</k> coalition: union of persons, parties or states.
<k>koaltaro*</k> coal tar: tar made from coal.

<k>koboldo</k> koblod: imp, hobglobin, familiar spirit or
brownie, puck, sprite.

<k>kodexo</k> <k>(legal</k>, <k>signal</k>, <k>etc.)</k> code, codex; <k>kodexo
 farmaciala</k> pharmacopoeia, dispensatory; <k>kodexigar</k>
to codify.

<k>kofio</k> bonnet, cap, coil (such as worn only by country
women).

<k>kofro</k> trunk, coffer, chest; (cf. <k>kesto</k>); <k>kofreto</k>
small trunk, portemanteau.

<k>koherar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to cohere, be coherent; <k>koheranta</k>, <k>koherema</k>, <k>koheriva</k> coherent, cohesive, consistent; <k>koherero</k>
coherer (radio).

<k>koketa</k> coquettish; <k>koketino</k> coquette; <k>koketulo</k>
coxcomb, beau; <k>koketesar</k> to be c.; <k>koketigar</k> to coquet
with, flirt with.

<k>kolo</k> <ex>(anat. and fig.)</ex> neck; <k>kolala</k> relating
to n., cervical; <k>kolumo</k> collar of shirt or garment); <k>kolumo
 rigida</k> stiff c.; <k>kolumo stacanta</k> standing c.; <k>kolumo
 jacanta</k>turn-down collar; <k>kolopeco</k> neck-piece
(butchery); <k>koloparto</k> neck part (of clothes); <k>kolligilo</k>
tie; <k>kolluko</k> neck-cloth, neckerchief; <k>kolo di veziko</k>
n. of the bladder; <k>kolo di botelo</k> n. of a bootle.

<k>kolacionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to collate: compare two
writings; to assemble and verify the sheets of a book for
binding.

<k>kolareto</k> collarret (of cambric, lace, etc, for women and
children).

<k>kolda</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> cold, frigid, cool: <k>koldeso</k>
coldness; <k>koldigar</k> to make cold, to cool; <k>kolda balno</k>
c. bath; <k>la supo koldeskas</k> the soup is becoming c.; <k>homo
 di kolda karaktero</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> a man of phlegmatic, or
cold character; <k>kolda mento</k> a cool mind; <k>traktar amiko
 kolde</k> to treat a friend coldly. Ant.: <k>varma</k>

<k>kolektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to collect (books, plants, etc.);
to gather (of persons, objects, matter, into a mass); <k>kolektala</k>, <k>kolektiva</k> collective.

<k>koliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gather, cull, pluck, pick off
(fruits, flowers, etc.).; <k>koliajo</k> crop (of fruit), object
picked.

<k>koliaro</k> necklace, neck-badge, collar (as on dogs or
horses); (natural marking of birds, and other animals) collar; <k>perlo
 koliaro</k> pearl necklace; <k>(fig.)</k> ring, hoop (as on a mast,
on engine).

<k>kolikar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have severe pain in the bowels; <k>koliko</k>
colic, griping, stomach-ache.

<k>kolino</k> hill; <k>kolineto</k> hillock, knoll, ridge. Ex.:
Roma esis konstruktata sur sep kolini.

<k>kolizionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to collide (<k>kun</k>); <k>koliziono</k>
collision: mutual striking of two bodies; <k>(fig.)</k> conflict,
encounter.

<k>kolmo</k> highest part, top (of a building or any
elevation); ridge (of a roof); <k>kolmotrabo</k> ridge-piece,
-pole; <k>kolmotegulo</k> ridge-tile.

<k>kolokar</k> <ex>(tr., fin.)</ex> to invest (money, funds); <k>kolokajo</k>
money invested.

<k>kolombo</k> dove, pigeon (family: Columbidae); <k>kolombea</k>
dove-colored; <k>kolombyuno</k> young pigeon; <k>kolombeyo</k>, <k>kolomboturmo</k>
dove-cot, pigeon-house (tower).

<k>kolono</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> colon; <ex>(arch., fig. in anat.)</ex>
column, pillar; <ex>(of  troops)</ex> column; <k>vertebrala kolono
 (spino)</k> verterbral column; <k>densa kolono di trupi</k> close
column of troops; <k>kolonbolto</k> tie-bolt.

<k>kolonio</k> colony; <k>koloniala</k> colonial, <k>koloniisto</k>
colonist: one who colonizes; <k>koloniano</k> colonist: member of a
c.; <k>koloniigar</k>, <k>koloniizar</k> to colonize.

<k>koloro</k> color (N.B. not pigment); <k>kolorajo</k> something
colored; <k>kolormaterio</k> coloring material; <k>kolorizar</k> to
color: <k>koloraro</k>, <k>izo</k>, <k>kolorizeso: izuro</k> coloring, coloration; <k>kolorizanta</k>
coloring; <k>sen kolorigar</k> to discolor: deprive of it's proper
color; <k>des kolorizar</k> to discolor: stain; <k>kolorochanjo</k>color-change,
play of colors; <k>kolorfairo</k> colored fire, Bengal lights.

<k>kolorito</k> color(ing), hue, shade: effect which results
from the mixture or use of colors; <ex>(fig.)</ex> brilliancy of
style; <k>Raphael montris profunda kompreno di kolorito</k>
Raphael showed a deep understanding of color (of the manner of
applying colors to produce a desired effect); <k>la kolorito di
 ca pikturo ne esas bona</k> the coloring of this painting is not
good; <k>persiko kun bela kolorito</k> a peach of a beautiful
color.

<k>kolportar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hawk about, peddle: carry
about wares for sale.

<k>kolubro</k> <ex>(genus)</ex> coluber: a common non-poisonous
snake, ring or grass snake.

<k>kolumno</k> column (of a page); <k>pagino de tri kolumni</k>
three columned page.

<k>koluzionar</k> <ex>(intr., jur.)</ex> to collude: to conspire
in a fraud; <k>koluziono</k> collusion. Def.: (<k>koluziono</k>):
Interkonsento sekreta por facar kune ula fraudo o nelegalajo;
V

<k>kolzo</k> colza, rape seed (Brassica Napus oleifera); <k>kolzoleo</k>
c. oil; <k>kolzokaulo</k> cole (Brassica campestris).

<k>kom</k> as (being), being, to be, in the capacity, character,
role, quality of; <k>egardar ulo kum neevitebla</k> to regard
something as (being) inevitable; kom exemplo: as (being) an
example; <k>me judikas kom mea devo raportar</k> I judge it as
(being) my duty to report; <k>me konsideras il kom honesta</k> I
consider him to be honest; <k>konsiderar la texto kom autentika</k>
to consider the text to be authentic; <k>judikar la vino kom
 bona</k> to judge that wine to be good; <k>me agas kom
 sekretario</k> I act as (in the capacity of) secretary; <k>il
 skribis ad me kom elua tutelanto</k> he wrote (in the capacity)
as her guardian; <k>aktoro X . . aparis kom Hamlet</k> actoro
X.. appeared as (assumed the role of) Hamlet; <k>kom la maxim
 olda</k>, <k>li elektis ku dom delegito</k> as (being) the oldest, they
elected him as (to be) delegate. V. exp.: <k>Quale</k>, <k>kom</k> On
devas uzar kom (e ne <k>quale</k>) en omna kazi, en qui kom povas
remplasesar da ula formo di la verbo esar: <k>esar</k>, <k>esante</k>, <k />
e.c. <k>Quale</k> signifikas, ke on komparas un kozo ad altra; ol
implikas sempre, ke on pensas ad-minime du kozi samtempe. <k>Kom</k>
expresas atribuo o qualifiko: ol unionas du nomi (o epiteti,
atributi) di un sola kozo (ulo esas atributo kande on atribuas ol
ad ula nomo, t.e. kande on asertas explicite od implicite, ke
tala qualeso apartenas a l'objekto). Ex.: Il agis kom prezidanto
(esante prezidanto ed en ta qualeso). Il agis quale prezidanto
(quale il esus prezidanto, ma il ne esis). Me amas il kom mea
fatron (il esas mea frato). Me amas il quale mea fraton (il ne
esas mea frato). Kom (esante) delegito di la granda republiko, il
esis aceptata quale (E. like) rejo; (kp. IV

<k>komao*</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> comma: a minute interval or
difference in pitch.

<k>komandar</k> <ex>(tr. milit, nav, tech)</ex> to command (an
army, a ship), to give word of command to (<k>ulu</k>); <k>komandala</k>, <k>komandanta</k>, <k>komandema</k>, <k>komandatra (voco</k>, <k>tono)</k> commanding (voice, tone); <k>komandita
 kliko</k> catch having positive motion; V. exp.: <k>Imperar</k>, <k>komandar</k> Komandar aplikesas a l'imperado militala o navala,
do extreme severa ed absoluta, qua supresas omna responsiveso che
l'imperati; IV

<k>komanditar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to finance a commercial
undertaking, to become a sleeping partner in: <k>komanditala societo</k>
a (French) limited, joint-stock company (in which some of te
partners take no active part); <k>komanditanto</k>, <k>komanditero</k> sleeping-,
dormant-partner; <k>komandito</k> (assuming) limited liability; <k>komanditeso</k>
(assumed) limited liability.

<k>kombatar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to fight, combat, make war
on: <k>kombatema</k> combative, pugnacious, quarrelsome; <k>kombateskar</k>
to start a fight: <ex>(milit.)</ex> to go into action; <k>kombatesko</k>, <k>kombateto</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> engagement; <k>li kombatis senespera
 kobambato</k> the fought a hopeless fight.

<k>kombinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to combine: <k>kombino</k>, <k>uro</k>
combination. Ex.: On povas kombinar la quar literi a, b, c, d, en
duadek e quar manieri diferanta. Kombinuro di kolori, di soni.

<k>kombustar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to burn (esp. in chemistery); <k>kombust(ad)o</k>
combustion, ignition: combination of a substance with oxygen, or
the like usually generating heat and light. V. exp.: vid. brular.

<k>komencar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to begin, commence; <k>komence</k>, <k>komencante</k> in the beginning, at first; <k>komencala</k> initial,
first; <k>komencolitero</k> initial.

<k>komendar</k> <ex>(tr., com.)</ex> to order (goods, a dinner,
etc.); <k>komendajo</k>, <k>komendi</k> goods bespoken.

<k>komentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to comment on (by speaking or by
annotation); <k>komento</k>, <k>komenturo</k>, <k>komentaro</k> comment, commentary. Ex.
Komentar temo, Virgilius. La komentaro di Caesar.

<k>komercar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to trade, traffic, deal (<k>pri
 ulo</k>, <k>kun ulu</k>); <k>komerco</k> commerce, trade; <k>komercala</k>, <k>komercoza</k>, <k>komercera</k> commercial, mercantile; <k>komercajo</k> good(s), article
of commerce, mechandise; <k>komercanta</k> trading; <k>komercanto</k>, <k>komercero</k>, <k>komercisto</k> trader, business man, mechant; <k>komercistachala</k>
profiteering; <k>komerco engrosa</k> wholesale trade; <k>komerco endetala</k>
retail trade.

<k>komico</k> comitia. Def.: Specala nomo di popul-asemblo
(pricipue antiqua Romana).

<k>komisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to commission: to charge, empower (<k>ulu
 facar ulo</k>), to appoint (<k>ulu por ulo</k>); <k>komiso</k>
charge instruction, mandate; <k>komisanto</k> one who orders,
employer, principal; <k>komisato</k> person commissioned:
commissioner, representative; (cf. <k>prokuraco</k>): <k>komisitaro</k>
commission: body of commissioners, board. Ex.: Komisar ula
komision-firmo komprar o vendar acioni por su, por ulu. Komisar
komisitaro studiar temo. Ca oficiro ne ja recevis sua komiso.
Komisar milit-navo. Komisitaro pri la budgeto. Facar la komisi:
(E. to carry out the instructions; (fig.) do the errands).

<k>komisario</k> commissary (di polico, di provizuro): <k>komisarieso</k>
(function) commissaryship; <k>komisarieyo</k> c. office.

<k>komisiono</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> commission: order by which a
person buys or sells goods for another: <k>komisionisto</k>, <k>komisionero</k> c;
merchant, c. agent; <k>komisiongelto</k>, <k>komisionpago</k> commission-money:
allowance for transacting business.

<k>komizo</k> clerk; writer, copyist in an office or
counting-house; salesman in a store or shop .

<k>komocionar</k> <ex>(tr., med. psychol.)</ex> to affect
strongly, unnerve, unstring, cause to shake; la violentoza pafado
-is la trupi: the hot fire unnerved the troops; san-eso
konocion-ita: shattered health.

<k>komoda</k> <ex>(of things)</ex> convenient, commodious:
adapted to its use or purpose, suitable; affording convenience,
conductive to comfort; <k>utensilo komoda</k> a convenient utensil; <k>ca
 loko ne esas komoda a ni</k> this place is not convenient for us; ca
<k>domo ne havas komodaji</k> this house has no conveniences.

<k>komono</k> commune (in France); parish, township (the
political division); <k>komonestro</k> mayor; <k>komonestreso</k>
mayorality; <k>komondomo</k> community-house, town-hall; <k>komonano</k>
an inhabitant, a member of the commune or parish.

<k>kompano</k>, <k>kompanulo</k>, <k>kompanino</k> companion, mate, one who keeps
company with another person, one associated with another in an
employement; <k>kompaneso</k> companionship; <k>joyoza kompanulo</k>
a good fellow, boon companion; <k>voyajo kompano</k>
fellow-traveller: <k>fidela kompano</k> faithful c..

<k>komparar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compare (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulo</k>); <k>komparebla</k>, <k>komparinda</k> comparable; <k>(ad) kompare</k> comparatively, in
comparaison (<k>ad</k>, <k>kun</k>); <k>komparanta gramatiko</k> comparative
grammar; <k>komparar la originalo kun la tradukuro</k> to compare the
original with the translation .

<k>kompaso</k> (a pair of) compass(es); <k>kompasagar</k> to
measure with c.; <k>trasar per kompaso</k> to line out with c.

<k>kompatar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to pity, have compassion,
be compassionate, commiserate, have mercy on: (cf. <k>simpatiar</k>);
<k>kompatanta</k>, <k>kompatema</k>, <k>kompatoza</k> compassionate; <k>kompatinda</k> worthy of
compassion, pitiable, miserable, piteous; <k>sen kompata</k>
merciless, pitiless; <k>pro kompato</k> for mercy's sake.

<k>kompensar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compensate: to be equivalent
to, to counterbalance, to make amends for, to make up for; <ex>(com.)</ex>
to offset.

<k>kompetenta</k> competent (<k>pri</k>), capable, having
(legal) power. Ex.: Kompetenta autoritato. Vu ne esas kompententa
facar to. Kemiisto kompetenta.

<k>komplemento</k> complement: that which it is necessary to
add to make a thing complete; <ex>(trig.)</ex> the difference
between an angle and 90°; <ex>(gram.)</ex> object, the added word
to complete a predication; <k>komplementa</k>, <k>komplementala</k> complementary,
completing, supplying a deficiency.

<k>kompleta</k> complete; <k>kompletigar</k> to c. (<k>ulo</k>, <k>per</k>);
<k>kompletigiva kazo</k> completive case, objective case. Ex.:
Vestaro kompleta. Kompleta floro. Ruino kompleta. Komplet-igar
sumo, laboro.

<k>komplexa</k> complex: not simple, consisting of many parts;
complicated intricate. Ex.: Temo, ideo komplexa. Komplexa nombro,
questiono. Ant.: <k>simpla</k>.

<k>komplexiono</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> complexion: constitution,
natural disposition of body; (cf. <k>konstituciono</k>); (N.B.
not color of skin).

<k>komplezar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to please, gratify, humor; to
be complaisant, obliging (<k>ad ulu</k>); <k>komplezo</k>, <k>komplezemeso</k>
complaisance, disposition to oblige; readiness to serve; <k>komplezachema</k>
obsequious; <k>komplezez</k> have the goodness, kindness; <k>nekomplezanta</k>
disobliging. Def. Konformigar su a la sentimenti, a la humoro di
altru. Ex.: Esas elua studio komplezar ad sua spozulo. Montrar su
komplezema ad ulu. Me facis to nur por ke me komplezez il.
Mis-uzar la komplezemeso di ulu. V. exp. vid. <k>voluntar</k>.

<k>komplica</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> party (to), privy (to); accessory
(to); <k>komplic(ul)o</k> accomplice (in a crime, in an ill-design); <k>kompliceso</k>
complicity. V. exp.: Indikas la neegaleso (etikal e legala) la
precipua kulpanto e di lua komplico o complici.III-264

<k>komplikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to complicate: render complex,
make intricate; <k>ca afero komplikateskas</k> this affair is
getting complicated.

<k>komplimentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compliment: to address with
expressions of civility: (cf. <k>gratular</k>). Ex.: La generalo
komplimentis la soldato pri lua kurajo. Il sendis la donacajo kun
sua komplimenti.

<k>komplotar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to complot: to plot (<k>ulo</k>, <k>kontre ulu</k>). V. exp.: <k>Komploto</k> esas plu generala; <k>konspiro</k>
esas komploto politikala, kontre la stato o statestri, por
revoluciono o por atento; II-646.

<k>kompostar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to set up in
type; <k>kompostisto</k>: <ex>(print.)</ex> compositor; <k>kompostilo</k><k />
composing - stick; <k>komposteroro</k><k /> printer's
error, wrong letter; <k>kompostmashino</k><k /> composing
machine.

<k>kompoto</k><k /> compote: stewed fruit; <k>kompotuyo</k><k />
comport, dish for compote.

<k>kompozar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compose: to
compound; to form (by uniting two or more things; N.B. not to set
up in type; cf. <k>kompostar</k>); to constitute; to invent and
set in order; to fashion, adjust; <k>kompozuro</k>, <k>kompozajo</k><k />
component, compound, ingredient; <k>kompozisto</k>, <k>kompozero</k><k />
composer (as of music); <k>kompozita</k><k /> composite,
composed (<k>da</k>); <k>kompozito</k><k /> compound; <k>kompozachar</k><k />
to scribble; Ex.: Omna parti qui kompozas ca mashino. La vorti
esas kompozata da literi. Kompozar libro, diskurso, opero.
Kompozita vizajo.

<k>komprenar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to comprehend:
to understand, apprehend by the senses; (cf. <k>intelektar</k>, <k>konceptar</k>, <k>konocar</k>, <k>savar; kontenar</k>, <k>inkluzar</k>); <k>komprenebla</k>, <k>kompreniva</k><k /> comprehensible, intelligible,
conceivable; <k>komprenende</k><k /> of course; <k>mis
 komprenar</k><k /> to misunderstand.

<k>kompresar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compress:
press or squeeze together.

<k>kompromisar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compromise:
to imperil or injure (the reputation, credit, etc. of a person); <k>kompromisanta</k>, <k>kompromisiva</k><k /> compromising.

<k>kompunciono*</k><k /> compunction: reproach of
conscience; contrition, remorse.

<k>komuna</k><k /> common: pertaining to, connected
with, or participated in by two or more persons or things; joint,
general; <k>komuneso</k>: community (of goods, of interests, etc.); <k>komunigar</k><k />
to communize; <k>komunismo</k><k /> communism; <k>komunisto</k><k />
communist; <k>komuna raciono</k><k /> common sense; <k>komuna
 eskalero</k><k /> a c. staircase; <k>interesti komuna</k><k />
co-interests; <k>komuna uzo</k><k /> c. use; <k>komuna nomo</k><k />
a common name; <ex>(gram.)</ex> a common noun; <k>komunigar la havaji
 di richi</k><k /> to communize the property of the
rich.

<k>komuniar</k><k /> <ex>(intr., rel.)</ex> to
communicate: to receive the sacrament; <k>komuniigar</k><k />
to administer the sacrament to (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>komunikar</k><k /> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to
communicate; have communication (by intercourse), be connected by
passage; <ex>(tr.)</ex> to communicate; impart, transmit, acquaint
with; <k>komuniko</k>, <k>komunikajo</k>: communication; <k>komunikigar</k><k />
to put (<k>uli</k>) into communication; to make a connection
between (buildings, etc.); <k>komunikema</k><k />
(tendency) communicative; <k>komunikopordo</k><k />
communicating door; <k>inter komunikar</k><k /> to be in
mutual communication. Ex.: Komunikar kun altra personi. Ca pordo
komunikas a koridoro. La magneto-petro komunikigas sua qualeso a
la fero. Li komunikigas sua projeto a me.

<k>komuniono</k><k /> communion: religious
fellowship; a denomination. Def.: Uniono en komuna kredo
(religiala); III-605. Ex.: La protestanta komunioni.

<k>komutar</k><k /> <ex>(tr., elec., math.)</ex> to
commute, commutate (a current); <k>komutilo</k><k />
commutator.

<k>kono</k><k /> <ex>(geom., bot., and fig.)</ex>
cone; <k>kona</k>, <k>konala</k>, <k>konatra</k><k /> conical; <k>konotrunko</k><k />
frustum of a c., truncated c.; <k>lum kono</k><k /> <ex>(opt.)</ex>
cone of rays.

<k>koncentrar</k><k /> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to concentrate:
to draw or converge to or toward a common center (troops, rays of
light, the mind, the affections, etc.); <ex>(chem.)</ex> to
concentrate: free from extraneous matter; (cf. <k>pludensigar</k>).

<k>konceptar</k> <ex>(tr. physiol. and psychol.)</ex> to conceive
(a child, an idea); (cf. <k>gravideskar</k>); <k>koncept(ad)o</k>, <k>koncepturo</k>
comceiving, conception, concept; <k>konceptebla</k> conceivable.

<k>koncernaar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to concern: relate or belong to
(<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>koncernao</k> concern: affair: <k>koncernaanta</k>, <k>koncernae</k>
concerning, relating to, regarding, <ex>(jur.)</ex> appertaining to
(cf. <k>apartenante</k>); <k>me parolas pri to quo koncernaas vu</k> I
am speaking about that which concerns you; <k>to ne koncernaas vu</k>
that is not your business.

<k>koncertar</k> <ex>(intr., mus.)</ex> to give a concert; <k>koncerto</k>
concert; <k>koncertopeco</k> concerto.

<k>koncesar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to concede (a point in argument).
Def.: Grantar ulo por obtenar konkordo; III-168.

<k>koncesionar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to grant a (public)
concession to, to enter into (public) contract (with); <k>koncesionario</k>
grantee; <k>koncesiono perpetua</k> concession in perpetuity. V. exp.:
Koncesiono esas specala kontrato por l'exekuto di publika labori.
Ol esas karakterizita per ke l'entraprezisto esas pagata ne da la
koncesionanto (stato, urbo, e.c.) ma da l'uzanti dum tempo
determinita. Exemple: ula urbo deziras posedar elektrala fili por
la lumizado di la stradi e di la privata domi. Ol povas procedar
per koncesiono, t.e. l'entraprezisto konstruktros la reto, e
recevos su pago, de l'aboni dum X yari e pos tempo donos
l'instaluro a la koncesioninto. Simila afero eventas pri fervoyi,
pri ponti, pri distributi di gaso, aquo, e.c.; IV

<k>konciar</k> <k>(tr.)</k> to be conscious of (<k>ulo</k>); <k>koncio</k>
consciousness: the knowlegde or perception of what passes in
one's own mind.

<k>konciliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to concilliate: bring to a state
of friendship, gain, win by moral influence; to reconcile: make
consistent or suitable; (cf. <k>rikonciliar</k>); <k>konciliebla</k>
reconcilable, consistent, accommodable, compatible; <k>konciliema</k>
conciliatory, accommodating, compliant, easy to get along,
tractable; <k>la multeso di nia reciproka intersiti devas
 konciliar ni</k> the great number of mutual interests should
overcome any feeling of hostility; <k>elua dolca manieri
 konciliis la favoro di elua nova familio</k> her gentle manners
gained the affection of her new family; <k>ne esas facila
 konciliar la historio profana e la historio sakra</k> it is not
easy to reconcile (make consistent) profane history with sacred
history.

<k>kondanmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to condemn: to sentence, doom; to
censure; to judge to be unfit for service. Ex.: Kondamnar ulu a
morto. Kondamnar libro. Il kondamnis ca entraprezaji: (E. he has
condemned (censured) these undertakings). Kondamnar navo,
furnisaji. Ant. : <k>absolvar</k>.

<k>kondensar</k> <ex>(tr., phys.)</ex> to condense; <k>kondensilo</k>
condenser. Ex.: Koldeso kondensas la aquo-vaporo. Ant.: <k>vaporigar</k>.

<k>kondicionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stipulate, make conditions
about; (cf. <k>stipular</k>); <k>kondiciono</k> condition, stipulation,
limitation, restriction; <k>kondicionala</k>, <k>kondicionita</k> conditioned: subject
to conditions; <k>kondicionizar</k> to place conditions, restrictions
on; <k>kondicionalo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> conditional, <k>kondicione ke</k> on
condition that, provinding that; <k>sen kondiciona</k>, <k>ne kondicionala</k>
unconditioned.

<k>kondimento</k> condiment; <k>kondimentizar</k> to season, flavor; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to give a relish to; (cf. <k>saporar</k>). V. exp.: <k>Kondimento</k>
havas senco tre generala, plu larja kam spici, pikli, e.c. Omno
quo servas por kondimentizar; III-264

<k>kondolar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to condole with (<k>ulu</k>): to
express or feel sympathetic sorrow; <k>kondololetro</k> letter of
c..

<k>kondominio</k> condominium: joint dominion or sovereignty; <ex>(Rom.
law)</ex> joint ownership; <k>kondominiar</k> to have c. Def.: Kunposedar
e komune dominacar.

<k>konduktar</k> <ex>(tr., phys.)</ex> to conduct, transmit,
convey (by tubes, wires, etc.) gas, electricity, heat, etc.; <k>konduktivo</k>, <k>konduktilo</k> conductor, conduit, transmitter; <k>konduktiveso</k>
conductibility; <k>gas konduktilo</k> gas-conduit, tube.

<k>konduktoro</k> <ex>(on trains, trams, omnibuses, etc.)</ex>
(Europe) guard; (U.S.) conductor.

<k>kondutar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to conduct onself, behave,
demean oneself; <k>ca muliero sempre kondutas bone</k> this
women always conducts herself well.

<k>konektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to connect (<k>ulo kun ulo</k>).
Def.: Juntar du organi qui servas por transmiso di energio, sive
elektrala, sive mekanikal (la energio esas una); III-417.

<k>konestablo</k> constable: a former title of
commander-in-chief of French armies.

<k>konfectionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make, manufacture clothing
(for); <k>konfectionuro</k> clothing (ready made).

<k>konfekto</k> confection, sugar-plum. Def.: Diversa-speca
sukraji generale mola; V-722.

<k>konferar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to confer: discourse with any
one on some subject; (cf. <k>grantar</k>).

<k>konfervo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> conferva: any of the threadlike
green algae that form in scum in ponds and ditches.

<k>konfesar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to confess, own up, avow (<k>ulo</k>);
<k>konfesigar</k> to receive the confesion of (<k>ulu</k>); <k>konfeso</k>
confession; <k>konfesanto</k> one who c.; <k>konfesiganto</k>, <k>konfesero</k>, <k>konfesario</k>
(father) confessor; <k>konfeseyo</k> confessional (cabinet): <k>irar
 por konfesar</k> to go to confession; <k>arachar konfeso</k> to extort a
confession. Ex.: On konfesas kulpo od irga fakto celita, sekreta
e desfavoroza.

<k>konfesiono</k> <ex>(theol.)</ex> confession: a formulary of
articles of a religious creed, profession of faith; creed; <k>konfesiono
 di Augsburg</k> Augsburg Confession.

<k>konfidar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to confide: instrust, commit, to
the care of; (cf. <k>fidar</k>, <k>konfidencar</k>). Def.: Livrar ula
kozo (<k>su</k>, <k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>) a la sorgo, a la fideleso, a la
habileso o la kapableso di ulu, di ulo. Ex.: Me konfidas a vu la
maxim kara e maxim precosa kozi quin me posedas.

<k>konfidencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tell in confidence <k>(ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu)</k>; <k>konfidenco</k> disclosure; <k>konfidencajo</k> that which is
confided: the information; <k>konfidenca</k>, <k>konfidencala</k> confidential; <k>konfidence</k>
in c.

<k>konfirmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to confirm: assure by added
proof, corroborate, verify; add firmness to, to strenghten; <ex>(jur.)</ex>
to ratify, sanction; <ex>(rel.)</ex> to receive into the church by
confirmation; <k>l'experienco konfirmas ke . .</k> esperience
corroborates that; <k>recenta informi konfirmas me en mea opiniono</k>
recent information confirms my opinion; <k>la korto konfirmis la
 verdikto</k> the court has confirmed the sentence; la sakramento
di -o: the sacrament of confirmation; <k>konfirmanta</k>, <k>konfirmiva evidentajo</k>
confirmatory, corroborative evidence . <k />

<k>konfitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to preserve (fruits, in sugar); <k>konfitajo</k>
jam, preserve, conserve.

<k>konfliktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to (be in) conflict <k>(kun)</k>.
Ex.: Nia interesti konfliktas. Konflikto di armei.

<k>konforma</k> conformable: that conforms, like, similar; <k>konforme</k>
in conformity; <k>konformigar</k> to (make) conform <k>(ulo</k>, <k>su</k>, <k>ad
 ulo)</k>. Ex.: Kopiuro konforma a la originalo. Vua interesti
konform-esas a nii. Konformeso a la volo di altru. Konform-igar
su a la manieri di vua tempo.

<k>konfrontar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to confront. Ex.: Konfrontar la
testo ad akuzato.

<k>konfundar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to confound: to make a muddle of
serveral things in not distinguishing them properly (with <k>kun</k>);
to confuse the indentity of something with something else (with <k>ad</k>).
V. exp.: Kunfundar kun ..., kunfundar ad ..: Se ek plura kozi on
facas pelmelo per mala o nesuficanta dsitingo mentala, qua mixas
iti kun ici, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas kun. Ex.
: «Nun il konfundas omno en sua odio, la kulpozi kun
l'inoncenti, la boni kun la mali». Se la spirito transportas
erore la qualesi od individueso di ulu od ulo ad altra, lore la
prepoziciono uzenda esas ad. Ex.: «Vu konfundis manekino ad
homo. - Ne konfundez lampiro a lanterno». En l'unesma kazo (kun)
la konfundo esas reciproka; en la duesma, ol ne esas reciproka;
VI-513-4; also Talmey's Test Book, p.90) Ant.: dicernar.

<k>konfuza</k> <ex>(physical and mental)</ex> confused: jumbled
together, indistinct. Ex.: Bruiso konfuza. Nepreciza e konfuza
idei. La multa intrucioni konfizigas mea mento. La konfuzeso di
la tempo. Ant. <k>klara</k>, <k>preciza</k>.
<k>kongresar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to hold a congress; <k>kongresano</k>, <k>kongresanto</k>, <k>kongresero</k> congressman, member of a c.

<k>kongruar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be congruous: <k>kongrueso</k>
congruity; <k>kongruanta</k> congruous, congruent, proper.

<k>konio</k> wedge, quoin (arch. print.); <k>koniagar</k> to
wedge; <k>koniumar*</k> to shape like (or, form into) an angle.

<k>konivencar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> ton connive <k>(kun)</k>: to
feign ignorranc; <ex>(fam.)</ex> to wink at

<k>konjedar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give leave or holiday to; to
furlough. Def. : Donar tempala libreso: IV-67.

<k>konjektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to conjecture: to surmise,
presume, guess, suppose; (cf. <k>divinar</k>).

<k>konjelar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to congeal; to freeze; (cf.
<k>koagular</k>, <k>glaciigar</k>, <k>forstigar</k>). Def.: Transformar
liquido a solido per la ago di koldeso. Ex.: Temperaturo di
130°K konjelas alkoholo. V. exp.: Frosto povas aplikesar nur a
vetero, a la meteorologiala stando, di qua konjelo di l'aquo esas
nur elemento o signo; III-330.

<k>konjestionar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to congest; <k>konjestiono</k>
congestion. Def.: Akumulo morbala di sango en parto limitizita di
la korpo.

<k>konjugar</k> <ex>(tr., gram.)</ex> to conjugate: to inflect (a
verb).

<k>kunjunturo</k> concurrence, combination of events and
circumstantces, conjuncture. Ex.: Me nultempe trovis plus
desfortunoca konjunturo.

<k>konkava</k> concave; <k>konkaveso</k> concaveness; <k>konkavajo</k>, <k>konkaviguro</k> concavity; <k>konkavigar</k> to make c., scoop or hollow
out.

<k>konkluzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to conclude: to bring to a
conclusion, settle, to come to a decision about; (cf. <k>inferar</k>);
<k>konkluziva</k> conclusive, final, decisive; (cf. <k>pruviva</k>); <k>konkluze</k>
in conclusion. Ex.: Konkluzar kontrato, pakto, mariajo, diskurso.
La konkluzo di la kontrato prizentis poka desfacilaji. Konlkuziva
pruvo. Konkluze me volas dicar.

<k>konkordar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to agree, be in harmony,
concord, concordance, <k>(kun)</k>; <k>konkordigar</k> to bring into
concord, to reconcile; <k>konkordo kordiala</k>cordial agreeement (F.
<ex>entente</ex>); <k>ne konkordanta</k> (moral) discordant,
disagreeing. Def.: Havar sama opiniono kam altru; (ol expresas
stando duriva, (eventuale) permananta); VII-97; tendencar a sama
skopo; harmoniar; (kp. <k>akordar</k>, <k>konsentar</k>). Ex.: La
konkordo di du gespozi. La konkordo regnas en ica familio. Lia
atesturi ne konkordas.

<k>konkordato</k> <ex>(rel.)</ex> concordat; <ex>(com.)</ex>
bankrupt's certificate; <k>konkordatala</k> certified (of bankrupts); <k>konkordatario</k>
certified bankrupt. Def.: (Kormercala) Konkordo di faliinto kun
sua kreditanti por pago di sua debi; II-76.

<k>konkubino</k> concubine; <k>konkubulo</k> man who lives in
concubinage.

<k>konkupicenco*</k> concupiscence. Def.: Inklineso juar la
bonaji di la mondo, particulare la kozi sensual.

<k>konkurencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to compete (in business, for
personal profit); (cf. <k>emulesar</k>); <k>konkurenc(ad)o</k>
competition, natural rivalry, common striving for the same
object. V. exp.: <k>Konkurenco</k> esas la naturala, spontana e
konstanta rivaleso, qua existas inter praktikanti di la sama
profesiono, komerco, industrio, qui penas ecelar por sua personal
profito e prospero. Konkurso esas quaze lukto institucata da
autoritato, en definita kondicionni tempala ed altra, por ganar
premii od adminime recevar rangi atribuata da judikanti. Konkurso
similesas do samtempe exameno e judiko. La sama komercisti od
industriisti, qui<k>konkurencas</k> sur la nacional e mondala
merkato, konkursas exemple en l'universala expozi, en qui on
distributas a li premii de diversa rangi. Li konkursas anke por
obtenar ula lur niso, prizentante specimeni (kun inkiko di
preco), quin ula experti specale komisita examenas, komparas e
rangizas; III-348.

<k>konkursar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go into a competition, match
(for prizes); <k>konkursanto</k>, <k>konkurskandidato</k> competitor. V. exp.: vid.
konkurencar.

<k>konkusionar</k> <ex>(intr., jur.)</ex> to peculate, practice
extortion, graft. Def.: (<k>konkusiono</k>): Prevariko o
pekuniala extorso facita da publika funcionero.

<k>konocar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to know: be aware of, be
acquainted with; (through the senses); <k>konocigar</k> to
make known (<k>ulo da ulu</k>); <k>konoc(ad)o</k>
acquaintance, knowing, cognition, cognizance; <k>konoceskar</k>: to
become acquainted; <k>konocato</k> acquaintance; <k>konocebla</k>
cognizable; <k>konocala</k>, <k /><k>konociva</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex>
cognitive; <k>rikonocar</k> to recognize: know again;
(cf. <k>agnoskar</k>). Ex.: Konocar ulu per la nomo, per la
reputo, per la vido. Me ne konocas lua skribado. Me bone konocas
omna parti di ca edifico. Me ne konocas la nomo di la strado. La
autoro ne esas konocata. Konocar lo bona de lo mala. La hundo
bone konocas sua mastro. Il atingis la evo di konoco (E.
discretion). Havar bona konoco di aferi. La konoco di krimino. V.
exp.: vid. savar.

<k>konosmento</k> <ex>(com., nav.)</ex> bill lading.
Def.: Dokumento signatata da kapitano o navestro, deklaranta la
naturo e quanto di la vari transportata e la kondicioni di
transporto; II-76.

<k>konsakrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dedicate, consecrate
(a church, one's life, etc.); (cf. <k>sakrigar</k>).

<k>konsekracar*</k> <ex>(tr., Cath. lit.)</ex> to
consecrate: to convert the bread and wine into the proper
substance of Christ.

<k>konsentar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to consent, give
consent, accede, agree, acquiesce; <k>agar konsente kun</k>
to act in concert with; <k>interkonsente</k> by
mutual agreement; <k>ne konsentar</k> to dissent. Def.:
Adherar a l'opiniono, propozo di altru; implikas chanjo, mental
ago e quaze movo; VII-98. Ex.: Kad vu venos kun ni? Me konsentas
(t.e. me volas la samo kam vi, o me voluntas sequar vi; ico
dependas nur de la volado, ne de l'intelekto). Lua gepatri ne
konsentus a lua mariajo. V. exp.: vid. asentar.

<k>konsequar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to follow, result,
ensue (<k>de ulo</k>); <k>konsequo</k>: <ex>(relation)</ex> consequence; <k>konsequantajo</k>
consequent (event, thing, issue), consequence; <k>konseque</k>:
consistently, consequently; therefore; <k>konsequanta</k>
consequent; <k>konsequema</k> consistent; <k>to ne
 konsequas de</k> that does not follow from; <k>ica
 kozi esas di granda konsequo</k> these things are of great
consequence; <k>la konsequentajo di ilua ago</k> the
consequence of his act; <k>il ne esas konsequema en lua
 aserti</k> he is not consistent in his statements.

<k>konservar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to conserve: keep in a
safe and sound state; (of fruits, etc.) to preserve; <k>konservo</k>
conservation, preservation; <k>konservajo</k> thing
conserved; preserve; <k>konservema</k>, <k>konservemo</k> <ex>(also
polit.)</ex> conservative (person); <k>konservemeso</k>
conservatism; <k>konservar sua saneso</k> to c. one's
health; <k>instinto di (su) konserv(ad)o</k> the
instinct of self-preservation.

<k>konsiderar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to consider; (cf. <k>egardar</k>, <k>regardar</k>, <k>atencar</k>, <k>pensar</k>, <k>judikar</k>, <k>evaluar</k>, <k>reflektar</k>, <k>deliberar</k>, <k>meditar</k>); <k>la soldati konsideris il quale
 patrulo</k> the soldiers looked upon him a father; <k>ol esas
 projeto bone konsiderita</k> it is a well-considered plan; <k>ol
 meritas konsidero</k> it merits consideration; <k>il agas
 nekonsiderante</k> he acts inconsiderately; <k>konsiderante
 vua laborado</k> in consideration (or, out of consideration) of
your work; <k>esas temo konsiderinda</k> it is a subject worthy
of consideration. <k />

<k>konsignar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to consign (goods); <k>konsignajo</k>, <k>konsigno di
 komercaji</k>, <k>di vari</k> consignment; <k>konsignario</k> consignee.
Def.: Sendar vari por vendo segun posibleso; II-76. <k />

<k>konsilar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to advise, offer counsel to (<k>ulo
 ad ulu</k>); <k>konsilantaro</k>, <k>konsilistaro</k> council (cf. <k>koncilo</k>).
<k />

<k>konsistar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to consist: have as its
foundation, essence, be composed, be made up of. Ex.: Feliceso
konsistas en moderemeso e vertuo. Ca armeo konsistas ek infantrio
ed ek kavalrio (kp. <k>kompozar</k>). <k />

<k>konskriptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to conscript: to enlist by
compulsion; <k>konskriptito</k> a conscript. <k />

<k>konsolacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to console: comfort (a person) in
grief. <k />

<k>konsonancar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be agreeable or uniform in
sound; <k>konsonanco</k> consonance, accord (of sounds). <k />

<k>konspirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to conspire: to hatch a treason
against a government; <k>li konspiris kontre la rejo</k> they
conspired against the king; <k>pulvero konspiro</k> gunpowder plot
(Eng. Hist.). V.exp.: vid. <k>komplotar.</k> <k />

<k>konsputar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to treat (publically) most
contemptuously, scorn, spurn, flout (cf. <k>mokegar</k>). V.
exp.: To esas nek desestimar, nek abominar, ma expresar extere,
per paroli, gesti, agi, la desestimo od abomino (etimologie:
kovrar per sputaji); III-203. <k />

<k>konstanta</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> constant; (cf. <k>sencesa</k>, <k>permananta</k>, <k>persistanta</k>); <k>konstanto</k> <ex>(math. phys.)</ex> a
constant (quantity); <k>konstanteso</k> constancy; <k>konstante</k>
constantly. Ex.: Job esis konstanta (E., steadfast) (od, ferma)
en desfortuno. Konstanta en amikeso. <ex>(math.)</ex> Konstanta
quanto (od, konstanto). Konstanta (od, sen-cesa) venti. Konstante
bona. Konstanteso di valoro. <k />

<k>konstatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to establish, substantiate (for
oneself by observation or experiment), to attest, state (after
investigation, to other people). (Note: This word applies to
serious even scientific observation and proof, rather than to the
perceptions of everyday life). <k>La mediko konstatis la
 prezenteso di…</k> the physician observed (verified,
proved, established) the prescence of…; <k>konstato</k>
establishing, authentication, verification; <k>postular</k>, <k>donar</k>, <k>recevar (oficala) konstato</k> to demand, give, receive an
(official) acknowledgement (or, certificate) (<k>pri ulo</k>); <k>konstatebla</k>
ascertainable, able to be verified or determined. Def.: Certeskar
pri la vereso di ula fakto, generale per percepto, observo;
VII-207. Vidar tote certe, explorar tale, ke la fakto esez por vu
tote nedubebla. Mondo, XII, 226. Ex.: Fakto konstatita (E.
established fact). Me verifikis la fakti per exameno di la
konstati (E. statements) en la protokolo (od, me konstatis la
fakti per exameno di la protokolo). <k />

<k>konsternar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dismay, to strike with, or throw
into consternation; <k>ni esis konsternata da ilua vorti</k> we
were dismayed by his words. <k />

<k>konstipar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to constipate; render costive, bind
(the intestines). <k />

<k>konstitucar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to constitute: to form, compose,
make a thing what it is, make up; <k>konstituco</k>, <k>konstituceso</k> <ex>(also
polit.)</ex> constitution; <k>konstitucanta</k>, <k>konstituciva</k> constituting:
component, composing, constituent (N.B. not elector; cf. <k>elektanto</k>);
<k>konstitucala</k> <ex>(polit.)</ex> constitutional (cf. <k>konstitutionala</k>);
<k>konstitucaleso</k> constitutionality. Ex.: La psiko e la korpo
konstitucas la homo. Ca agi ne konstitucas delikto. La
konstitucanti (E. <ex>elements</ex>) di ulo. La parti
konstituc-anta, -iva di korpo. <k />

<k>konstituciono</k> <ex>(physiol.)</ex> constitution; <k>konstitucionala
 morbo</k> constitutional disease. Def.: Generala stando di
l’organismo rezultanta del anatomiala stando e de la
funcionado di omna organi; VI-210. <k />

<k>konstriktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to constrict; to draw together,
bind, cramp. Def.: (<k>Konstrikto</k>) La diminuto di ampleso di
kavajo (stomako) o truo (ex. La natural aperturi di la korpo esas
cirkondita da muskuli konstriktiva); II-645. <k />

<k>konstruktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to construct: to put the parts of
anything together in their proper order, to build. <k />

<k>konsulo</k> <ex>(Roman, modern)</ex> consul; <k>konsulala</k>
consular; <k>konsuleso</k> (function, time) consulate; <k>konsuleyo</k>
(residence) consulate. <k />

<k>konsultar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to consult (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>);
(cf. <k>konferar</k>, <k>deliberar</k>); <k>konsult(ad)o</k> consultation
(also med.). Ex.: Konsultar advokato, vortaro, historio, sua
interesti. Konsultanta mediko. Havar konsultanta voco (E. to have
the right of discussion without the right of voting). <k />

<k>konsumar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to consume, destroy, use up, wear
out, expend. Ex.: La rusto konsumas la fero. La fairo konsumas la
domo (kombustante ol). Maladeso konsumas la energio. On konsumas
vino, karno, korbono, petrolo, papero, aquo, e energio en la
vapor-mashini e mem la mashini ipsa, uzante li. kp. IV-397.
<k />

<k>kontar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to count, reckon (money, trees, people,
hours, etc.); to take a census; (cf. <k>kalkular</k>, <k>enumerar</k>); <k>konto</k>
account, reckoning; <k>havar privata konto</k>to have a private
account (at a merchant’s, etc.); <k>kalular la konto (di
 ulu)</k> to make up the account; <k>kontado di la habitantaro</k>
census of the inhabitants; <k>kontisto</k>accountant; <k>verifikar
 la kontado</k>to verify the accounts, the book-keeping; <k>konto
 kuranta</k> current account; <k>kontar dekeduope</k> to count by
the dozens; <k>kontilo</k> counter (machine); <ex>(tech.)</ex> meter;
<k>kontomarko</k> counter (as in play); <k>kontoyaro</k> financial
year. <k />

<k>kontagiar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to communicate a
contageous disease to (<k>ulu</k>); <k>kontagio</k> contagion,
pestilence. Def.: Transmisar morbo per kontakto mediata od
nemediata kun ulu; <ex>(fig.)</ex> transmisar etikala malajo per
frequento, per imitado nevolata. Ex.: La kontagio di morbo, di
vicio. Rido kontagiiva. <k />

<k>kontaktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in touch, have contact (<k>kun</k>);
<k>kontakteskar</k> to come into c.; -<k>igar</k> to place in c. (<k>ulo</k>, <k>kun ulo</k>); <k>kontaktopunto</k> point of c.; <k>kontakte kun</k> in c.
with; <k>kontakto nemediata</k> direct contact. <k />

<k>kontantar</k> <ex>(of money)</ex> ready; <ex>(of payments)</ex>
cash; <k>kontanto</k> ready cash or money; <k>kontanta pago</k> cash
payment; <k>kontanta kompro</k> buying for cash. <k />

<k>kontemplar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to contemplate. Def.: Regardar
longe, ma aktive, kun reflekto o fervoro por studiar o admirar
l’objekto; V-35. Ex.: Kontemplar la belaji di naturo.
Kontemplado di la boneso di Deo. <k />

<k>kontenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to contain, hold; <k>konteno</k>, <k>konteneso</k>
containing, capacity; <k>kontenajo</k> content(s); <ex>(log.)</ex>
content; <k>kontenantajo</k>, <k>kontenilo</k> container; <k>kontenema</k>, <k>kontenoza</k>, <k>konteniva</k>
comprehensive. Ex.: Ca tanko kontenas duacent litri. La kontenajo
di libro. Donar kontenoza deskripto di ula afero. <k />

<k>kontenta</k> content(ed), satisfied; <k>kontentigar</k> to content,
satisfy. Ex.: Kontenta mieno. Havar kontenteso esas plu bona kam
havar richaji. V. exp.: vid. <k>saciar.</k> <k />

<k>kontestar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to contest, dispute, call into
question. Ex. Kontestar la yuro di ulu. Kontestar debajo,
heredajo. Il havas ne-kontestebla yuro facar to. <k />

<k>kontigua</k> contiguous, adjoining; meeting at the surface or
border, touching; <k>kontigua chambro</k> adjoining room; (cf. <k>apuda</k>).
<k />

<k>kontinencar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be continent; <k>kontinenco</k>
continence: forbearance of lawful pleasure, restraint of passion
for sexual enjoyment. <k />

<k>kontingenta</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex> contingent: happening by
chance, casual, accidental; <k>kontingento</k> <ex>(milit., fin.)</ex>
contingent, share, quota; <k>kontingenteso</k>, <k>kontingentajo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex>
contingency. Ex.: Kontingent evento; Singlu de la federiti
furnisos sua kontingento de trupi e pekunio. Ni agos segun la
kontingentajo. <k />

<k>kontinua</k> continuous: uninterrupted, unbroken, which goes on
without intermittance or break; joined without intervening space;
<k>kontinuo</k>, <k>kontinuajo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex> that which is indivisible
(matter, body, space); (cf. <k>sencesa</k>, <k>perpetua</k>, <k>duranta;
 prolonguro</k>, <k>sequantajo</k>); <k>kontinua proporciono</k> <ex>(math.)</ex>
c. proportion; <k>kontinua febro</k> continuous, uninterrupted fever; <k>la
 lego di kontinuo</k> the law of continuity. Ant.: <k>intermitanta</k>, <k>cesanta</k>, <k>neduranta.</k> <k />

<k>kontoro</k> counting-house, (business) office, (administrative)
bureau; <k>kontoristo</k> office clerk, <k>kontoristaro</k> office
force. <k />

<k>kontrabaso</k> contrabasso: the largest kind of bass-viol,
violone, double-bass. <k />

<k>kontradanso</k> contradance, country dance, old fashioned
quadrille. <k />

<k>kontrafaktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to counterfeit (money), to forge
(a signature); <k>kontrafakturo</k> counterfeit, forgery (made). <k />

<k>kontraforto</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> counterfort: a buttress, spur or
pillar serving to support a wall. <k />

<k>kontraktar</k> <ex>(tr., phys., anat., gram.)</ex> to contract:
to draw into a smaller compass, draw together or nearer; to
shrink (together); (cf. <k>konstriktar</k>, <k>astriktar</k>, <k>plukurtigar</k>).
Def.: Diminuto di longeso, di larjeso o di volumino; II-645. Ex.:
La maxim multa korpi kontraktesas da la frigoro; muskolo
aganta kontraktesas. <k />

<k>kontrakturo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> rigidity, stiffness of muscles.
Def.: Rigideso duranta, ma nevolita, di muskolo. Ex.: Tetano
efektigas grandega kontrakt-uro. <k />

<k>kontrastar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to contrast: stand, be in
contrast; <k>kontrastigar</k> to (put in) contrast (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulo</k>).
Ex.: Kontrastigar to quon on facas a to quon on intencas facar.
Kontrasto di ombro e di lumo. <k />

<k>kontratar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to make a contract (<k>kun</k>);
<k>kontrato</k> contract: agreement or covenant between two or more
persons; bargain; (cf. <k>paktar</k>). Ex.: Kontratar facar ulo.
Kontratar kun la stato facar ulo laboro. Donar vendo-kontrato (E.
to give a deed of sale). <k />

<k>kontravencar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to contravene: transgress,
infringe on (regulations, orders, the law, etc.). Ex.:
Kontravencar la dekalogo. V. exp.: vid. <k>krimino.</k> <k />

<k>kontre</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> against: in opposition to, with; in
contradiction to, contrary to; in an opposite direction;
opposite; <ex>(law term)</ex> versus; <k>kontremea volo</k> opposite my
wish; <k>marchar – la enemiko</k> to march against the
enemy; <k>luktar – desfortuno</k> to struggle with
adversity; <k>iritigar kontre</k> be exasperated with; <k>agar kontre
 sua koncienco</k> to act against one’s conscience; <k>irar
 – la fluo</k> to go against the current; <k>kontree</k> by way
of compensation, as a set off, per contra; on the contrary, on
the other hand; <k>kontreajo</k> the contrary, opposite <ex>(object)</ex>;
<k>kontreesar</k> to be opposed (<k>ad</k>); <k>kontre(ul)o</k>
adversary; <k>kontreeso</k> opposition; <k>kontre ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex>
while (in contrast). In composition <k>kontre</k> has the sense
of: counter, contra; (cf. <k>anti</k>). <k />

<k>kontreagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to act contrary or in opposition to
(<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>), to thwart; <k>kontreaganta</k>, <k>kontreema</k> opposing <ex>(fig.)</ex>
provoking; <k>kontreagemeso</k> spirit of contrariety.<k />

<k>kontredicar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to gainsay, contradict; <k>interkontredicanta</k>
mutually contradictory; <k>sukontredicanta</k>
self-contradictory. <k />

<k>kontributar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to contribute (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulo</k>). Ex.: Kontributar duimo di la sumo. Kontributajo a la
suceso di la afero. To esos kontributiva a vua feliceso (E. that
will be conducive to your happiness).

<k>kontricar*</k> <ex>(intr., rel.)</ex> to feel deep sorrow for
sin; -<k>o</k> contrition, remorse, repentance; <k>kontricanta</k>
contrite.

<k>kontrolar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to control by checking,
verification, entering into a counter-register or counter-roll; <k>kontrolo</k>
checking, verification; <k>kontrolisto</k> controller, comptroller; <k>kontroleyo</k>
comptroller’s office; <k>kontrololibro</k> register kept to
correct another register; <ex>(milit.)</ex> muster-roll; <k>kontrolomarko</k>
check-mark; hall-mark; <k>kontrolmarkizar</k> to counter-check, mark;
<k>kontrolobilieto</k> (<ex>theat</ex>. -) check; <k>kontrolexpertizo</k>
counter-survey; <k>kontrolinquesto</k> counter-inquiry; <k>kontrolvoko</k>
second roll-call, check-roll-call.

<k>kontroversar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to controvert, dispute,
discuss. Def.: (kontroverso) Debato pri questiono, opiniono,
e.c., precipue pri temi religiala, filozofiala.

<k>kontumaca</k><ex>(jur.)</ex> contumacious: disobedient to a
lawful summons; non-appearing; defaulting; <k>kontumac(ul)o</k> a c.
person; <k>kontumaceso</k> contumacy, default; <k>judiciar kom kontumaco</k>
to default, declare to be contumacious.

<k>konturo</k> contour, outline: the line that bounds a figure;
<k>konturizar</k> to outline, give proper contour.

<k>kontuzar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to contuse, bruise (by blow
or fall).

<k>konvektar</k> <ex>(tr., phys.)</ex> to transfer (heat,
electricity) by means of currents in liquids or gases; <k>konvekto</k>
convection. Def.: Modo di transporto di la koloro, dil elektro;
III-139.

<k>konvenar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to suit: be suitable, be
fitting, be congruous, be proper, fit in, match; (cf. <k>decar</k>);
<ex>(impers.)</ex> to be expedient, be advisable, be convenient; <k>konveno</k>
fitness, suitableness, pertinence; <ex>(pl.)</ex> good manners,
decorum, proprieties; <k>konvenanta</k> suitable, proper, expedient,
pertinent, convenient; <k>ne konvenajo</k> inconvenience; <k>ca loko
 konvenas bone ad il</k> this place will well suit him; <k>tala
 laudo ne konvenas a me</k> such praise does not suit me; <k>konvenas
 facar</k>it is advisable to be silent; <k>ne konvenas a me
 dicar</k> it does not beseem me to say; <k>obediar la konveni</k>
to observe the rules of decorum; <k>la konveno di mariajo</k>
the suitableness of marriage; <k>domo kun multa nekonvenaji</k>
a house with many inconveniences.

<k>konvencionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to make an agreement, come
to a (written) understanding; <k>konvenciono</k> agreement, covenant,
convention, pact; <k>konvencionala</k> conventional: stipulated; tacitly
understood, arising out of custom; <k>konvencionala linguo (</k>od,<k>parolado)</k> conventional language; <k>parola konvenciono</k> verbal
agreement; <k>skribita konvenciono</k> written agreement; <k>la
 historiisti ne konvencionas pri la dato</k> the historians do not agree
as to the date; <k>la testi konvencionis dicar</k> the witnesses
agreed to say.

<k>konvento</k> convention, assembly; conventicle: assembly,
usually secret, as of freemasons; <k>nacionala konvento</k> national
convention.

<k>konvergar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to converge: tend to a point.
Ant.: <k>divergar.</k>

<k>konvertar</k> <ex>(tr., rel., fin.)</ex> to convert; <k>konvertar
 pagani</k>, <k>pekanti</k> to convert heathen, sinners (cf. <k>transformar</k>).

<k>konvinkar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to convince (<k>ulu</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>);
<k>me konvinkesas ke il mentias</k> I am convinced that he is
lying; <k>konvinkanta</k>, <k>konvinkiva pruvo</k> convincing proof.

<k>konvoyar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to convoy: transport, convey
troops, munitions, etc. (usually under armed escort); <k>konvoyo</k>
convoy(ing), transport(ing); <k>konvoyonavo</k> transport (ship); <k>konvoyal
 eskortnavo</k> escort ship to a convoy. Def.: Transportar
soldati, municioni, e.c. per serio de veturi o navi. V. exp.:
Konvoyo esas la transporto e, per extenso, la serio de veturi (o
navi) ipsa. Konvoyar ne esas sinomimo di akompanar, eskortizar:
on eskortizas konvoyo; IV-12.

<k>konvulsar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have a violent and
involuntary contraction of the muscles; <k>konvulsigar</k> to
convulse; <k>konvulso</k> convulsion, fit; <k>konvulsala</k>, <k>konvulsatra</k>
convulsive. V. exp.:<k>Konvulso</k> (konvulsi) esas general e
duranta kontrakti di la muskuli, ne volita, ma pro nerval influo.
<k>Spasmo</k> esas kontrakto lokala (di un muskulo aparta),
generale bruska e neduranta. Krampo esas kontrakto partala e
doloroza di un muskulo (ex. En la suro); II-646.

<k>kooperar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to cooperate ( in a co-operative
institution); (cf. <k>kunlaborar</k>, <k>kontributar</k>(<k>ad</k>); <k>kooperala</k>, <k>kooperanta societo</k> cooperative society.

<k>kooptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to co-opt: to choose or elect a
fellow member. Def.: Adjuntar a su membro per interna elekto.
Ex.: La elektita komisitaro havis la yuro di koopto, e kooptis
Sro. X. pro la specala autoritato; IV-105.

<k>koordinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to co-ordinate: dispose, adjust; <k>koordiniti</k>
<ex>(geom.)</ex> coordinates. Def.: Kombinar en la ordino asignita
da la formo o la naturo id l’elementi. Ex.: Koordinodi la
muskuli.

<k>kopiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to copy: write, print, engrave, or
paint, alter an original; (cf. <k>imitar</k>); <k>kopio</k>
copying; <k>kopiuro</k> a copy; <k>kopianto</k>, <k>kopiero</k>, <k>kopiisto</k> copyist;
<k>kopiopresilo</k> copying-press; <k>kopioregistro</k> copying
register (for letters, etc.); <k>kopio atestita</k> a certified
copy; <k>kopiinko</k> copying ink; <k>kopiuro korektigita</k>, <k>emendita</k>
corrected copy; <k>kopio neta</k> a clean copy.

<k>kopulacar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to copulate: unite in sexual
intercourse (<k>kun</k>); <k>kopulacigar</k> to pair (animals for
breeding).

<k>koquar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cook (food) by baking, boiling,
broiling, roasting, etc.; (cf. <k>bakar</k>, <k>stufar</k>, <k>boliigar</k>, <k>grilar</k>, <k>rostar</k>); <k>koquarajo</k> something cooked; <k>koquaristo</k>
cook; <k>koquarartala</k> culinary; <k>koquarilaro</k> cooking
utensils; <k>koquareyestro</k> chief cook.

<k>koro</k>, <k>korkantaro</k> choir, quire, chorus (the singers); <k>korala</k>
choral; <k>korkanto</k> chorus (song); <k>korano</k>, <k>kor(kant)isto</k>
chorister; <k>korista puero</k> choir boy; <k>korestro</k> choir
leader; <k>kantar kore</k>, <k>koratre</k> to sing in chorus.

<k>koram</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> in the presence of; <k>koramme</k> in
my presence; <k>koramla rejo</k> in the presence of the king.

<k>kordo</k> line, cord, rope; <ex>(geom.)</ex> chord; <ex>(of an
arch.)</ex> span, chord; <k>kordego</k>large rope, hawser (cf. <k>kablo</k>);
<k>kordaro</k> cordage; <k>kordeto</k> small rope, string, twine; <k>kordigar</k>
to twist, twine (like a rope); <k>kordifar</k> to make ropes; <k>kordifeyo</k>, <k>korderio</k> rope-walk; <k>kord(et) izar</k>, <k>kordligar</k> to cord, bind; <k>kordodansisto</k>
rope-dancer; <k>kordoskalo</k> rope-ladder.

<k>kordio</k> <ex>(anat., fig. of affections and cards)</ex>
heart; <k>kordiala</k> cardiac; <ex>(fig.)</ex> cordial; <k>kordialeso</k>
cordiality; <k>kordiika</k>, <k>kordiiko</k> heart-diseased (person); <k>kordiolaceranta</k>
poignant; heart-rending, harrowing.

<k>kordono</k> a short cord or ribbon; as: <k>klosh(et) kordono</k>
bell-cord, -pull; <k>tir kordono</k> check-string for doors,
carriages, etc.); <k>zon kordono</k> girdle (as of monks); <k>shu
 kordono</k> shoe-string, lachet; <k>chapel kordono</k> hat-band,
-string; <k>umbilikala kordono</k> umbilical cord, navel string; <k>(honor)
 kordono</k> cord or ribbon worn as a decoration; <k>militala</k>, <k>epidemiala kordono</k> <ex>(fig.) </ex>military, sanitary cordon: a
line of sentinels, guards.

<k>korekta</k> correct: conforming to the rules or the
conventional standard, accurate, exact, right, faultless; <k>korektigar</k>
to correct (cf. <k>emendar</k>, <k>punisar</k>); <k>korektiguro</k>
(result) correction; <k>korektigebla</k> corrigible. Ex. Korekta
frazo, konduto. Korektigar la mori di ula naciono. V.exp.: vid. <k>emendar.</k>

<k>korelatar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in correlation; <k>korelatanta</k>, <k>korelativa: korelativo</k> correlative: standing in reciprocal relation; <k>korelativa
 termini</k> correlative terms.

<k>korespondar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to correspond: to hold
communication by letters, (<k>kun</k> <k>ulu</k>); to answer in
character, function, etc., be adequate (<k>ad ulo</k>); (cf. <k>konformesar</k>, <k>konkordar</k>).

<k>korifeo</k><ex>(antiq.)</ex> coryphæus (ballet) coryphee; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
one distinguished in his profession or in a society.
<k>koriono</k> chorion, the outside membrane of the foetus.

<k>korko</k> cork(-bark); <k>korkoquerko</k> c. tree; <k>korkizar</k>
to cork (a bottle), to lay c. on (a floor, etc.); <k>korkoflotacero</k>
c. float; c. belt; <k>korkotirilo</k> corkscrew.

<k>korno</k> horn (of animals, as material or as used in wind
instrument); <k>korna</k>, <k>kornoza</k>, <k>kornatra</k> corneous, horned, horny; <k>kornizar</k>
to put horns on; <k>kornagar</k> to horn, gore; <k>korneskar</k> to
become h.; <k>kornisto</k>, <k>kornero</k> horn-blower; <k>korne anuncar</k>, <k>proklamar</k> to blare out, trumpet; <k>kornoplear</k> to blow or
wind the h.; <k>kornobrancho</k> antler; <k>abundo korno</k> horn
of plenty, cornucopia; <k>trikorna chapelo</k> three cornered
hat; <k>kornokofio</k> cornet: head-dress worn by sisters of
charity. <k />

<k>korneto</k> <ex>(instr.)</ex> horn, kind of trumpet; <k>papera
 korneto</k> paper cone (as for holding candy); <k>valvo korneto</k>
cornet: cornet-a-pistons; <k>(valvo) kornetisto</k> cornetist.
<k />

<k>korodar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to corrode; <k>korodanta</k>, <k>korodiva</k>
corrosive. Ex.: La rusto korodas la fero. <k />

<k>korpo</k> body: total organised substance of a person, animal
or plant; the principal part of anything; <ex>(milit.)</ex> corps; <k>korpala</k>
corporal, corporeal, bodily; <k>korpeskar</k> to become body,
materialize; <k>korpexerc(ad)o</k> bodily exercise; <k>korpogardisto</k>
bodyguard. <k />

<k>korpulenta</k>corpulent, stout (cf. <k>obeza</k>, <k>repleta</k>).
Def.: Ta qua havas la tota korpo (anke la membri) grosa, dika; lu
esas muskuloza, do generale forta e sana; VI-601. <k />

<k>korso</k> public-drive, -walk. Def.: Speco di promeneyo en
urbo; III-203. <k />

<k>korseto</k> corset, stays; <k>korsetizar</k> to corset (<k>ulu</k>);
<k>korsetkovrilo</k> corset cover. <k />

<k>korto</k> <ex>(of justice, of sovereign)</ex> court: <ex>(of a
house)</ex> court(-yard); <k>kortana</k> courtly <ex>(person)</ex>; <k>kortano</k>
courtier, member of a court; <k>kortaneso</k> courtliness; <k>korto
 supera</k>, <k>eceptala</k> highest court, court of appeals. <k />

<k>kortico</k> <ex>(also anat.)</ex> cortex: bark (of trees); <k>senkorticigar</k>
to strip trees of bark. <k />

<k>koruptar</k> <ex>(tr., phys., moral)</ex> to corrupt: taint,
spoil; deprave, demoralize. Ex.: La kaloro balde koruptas karno
en la somero. Koruptar linguo, texto, judiciisto, la mori di ulu.
<k />

<k>korvear</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to do corvee; to do compulsory (or,
statute-) labo(u)r (on highways, etc.); <ex>(milit.)</ex> to do
fatigue duty. <k />

<k>kosmetiko</k> (art of using) cosmetics; <k>kosmetikajo</k> cosmetic
article; <k>kosmetikala</k> cosmetic. <k />

<k>kredar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to believe (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>me
 tote ne kredas to</k> I do not believe it at all; <k>kredar historio</k>
to believe (in) history; <k>kredar ulu kom richa</k> to believe
someone to be rich; <k>kredigar ulo da ulu (igar ulu kredar
 ulo)</k> to cause someone to believe something; <k>kredo</k>
faith, belief, believing; <k>kredendajo</k>, <k>kredformulo</k>, <k>kredartiklo</k>, <k>kredi</k>
creed; <k>kredema</k> credulous; <k>kredebla</k>, <k>kredinda</k> credible; <k>kredodeklaro</k>
declaration of faith; <k>kredar rumoro</k> to credit a rumo(u)r.
<k />

<k>kreditar</k> <ex>(tr., com.)</ex> to credit: to enter upon the
credit side of an account; to give trust or credit to (<k>ulu</k>)
(cf. <k>kredar</k>); <k>kredito</k> credit: reputation for solvency;
delay in payment (cf. <k>estimo</k>); <k>kreditajo</k> a c. entry; <k>kreditanto</k>, <k>kreditero</k> creditor; <k>kreditoletro</k> letter of c.; <k>kreditokonto</k>
a c. account; <k>kredite vendar</k> to sell on c.; <k>sen kreditigar</k>, <k>des kreditizar</k> to discredit; to deprive of (commercial) c.; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to bring into disrepute; (cf. <k>kredar</k>). Ant.: <k>debetigar.</k>
<k />

<k>kremo</k> cream; <ex>(fig.)</ex> the best part of anything; <k>kremea</k>, <k>kremeo</k> cream-color(ed); <k>kremuyo</k> c. holder, c. jug; <k>kremo
 quirlita</k> whipped-c.; <k>kremjeleo</k> blancmange. <k />

<k>kremono</k> window-fastening (vertical, as in car windows).
Def.: Stango qua restas vertikala, e qua, sive rotacante cirkum
sua axo, sive per shovo-movo (komandata per maneto) engajas su (o
sua hoki) en trui supre ed infre en la fenestro; IV-448; (kp. <k>spanyoleto</k>).
<k />

<k>krenelo</k> crenelle: loop-hole, embrasure (in a battlement); <k>krenelizo</k>, <k>krenelizuro</k> crenellation, indentation; <ex>(coins)</ex> milling.
<k />

<k>krepisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rough-cast, rough-coat, parget,
give a coat of plaster to (a wall). <k />

<k>krepitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to crepitate; to make a crackling
sound (also surg. of noise of fractured bones). <k />

<k>kreskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to grow (esp. of living things; cf. <k>augmentar</k>, <k>plugrandigar</k>, <k>divenar</k>); <k>kreskigar</k> to cause (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>)
to grow; <k>kreskeskar</k> to start growing; <k>kreskante</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex>
crescendo. Ex.: Herbi, hari, homi kreskas. La pluvo kreskigas la
frumento. <k />

<k>kresto</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> crest, top, ridge; <k>han(ul)o
 kresto</k> cock’s comb; <k>monto kresto</k> top of a mountain; <k>kresto
 di ondo</k> crest of a wave; <k>kresto di suceso</k> crest of
success. <k />

<k>krestomatio</k> chrestomathy: select passages to be used in
learning a language. <k />

<k>krevar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to burst, break suddenly, fly
open. Ex.: Se vu tro plenigus la sako, ol krevos. La abceso
krevis. Krevar pro rido. <k />

<k>krevisar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to crack, chap, chink (surface
only, as in china, hands). V. exp.: Expresas surfacala fendeto,
qua eventas ex. en la sulo, en la muri, en la glacio, en la pelo,
e.c. To esas altro kam fendeto: nam ex. vazo krevisita nule esas
fendita; III-203. <k />

<k>kriar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to scream, cry out: make inarticulate
noise (men and animals); <k>krietar</k> to whine, whimper; <k>kriachar</k>
to bawl (cf. <k>plorachar</k>). V. exp.: vid. <k>klamar</k>.<k />

<k>kriblo</k> screen: a coarse sieve for separating stones from
earth, dust from coals, etc.; (cf. <k>sivo</k>); <k>kribloreziduo</k>
siftings. <k />

<k>kriketo</k> <ex>(game)</ex> cricket; <k>kriketbatilo</k> cricket
bat; <k>kriketagro</k>, <k>kriketeyo</k> cricket ground; <k>kriketludanto</k>, <k>kriketero</k>, <k>kriketisto</k> cricketer. <k />

<k>kriminar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to commit a crime; <k>krimino</k> crime
(such as treason, murder, arson, etc.); <k>kriminala</k> criminal
(law, etc.); <k>kriminanta</k>, <k>krimininta</k>, <k>kriminoza</k> criminal (person); <k>kriminanto</k>
criminal, malefactor, <k>kriminaligar</k> to make a criminal out of
(<k>ulu</k>); <k>kriminalisto</k> criminal law specialist; <k>kriminozeso</k>
criminality; <k>krimino morte punisebla</k> a capital crime. V.exp.:
Segun la Franca yuro, la ofensi kontre la lego, segun la grado di
graveso, esas: <k>krimino</k> (E. crime), <k>delikto</k> (E.
misdemeano(u)r), <k>kontravenco</k> (E. trespass). <k />

<k>krino</k> hair (of animal’s mane or tail); <k>krinaro</k>
(horse’s) mane; <k>kaval krino</k> horse-hair; <k>krinkamizeto</k>
hair-shirt. <k />

<k>kripla</k> maimed, crippled; (cf. <k>infirma</k>); <k>kripligar</k>
to cripple, maim. Def.: Qua perdis membro, o lua uzebleso per
deformo; V-157. V. exp.: On povas esar <k>infirma</k> sen esar <k>kripla</k>:
multa oldi esas infirma (blinda, surda, nekapabla marchar, e.c.)
nam li ankore konservas omna sua membri e korpala integreso, sen
esar kripla. Ed on povas esar kripla sen esar infirma (ex. ulu a
qua mankas nur un fingro o falango esas kripla, ma ne remarkeble
infirma: segun la legala termino, lua labor-kapableso ne
diminutesis); V-95. <k />

<k>Kristo</k> Christ; <k>Kristana</k>, <k>Kristano</k> Christian; <k>Kristanaro</k>, <k>Kristmondo</k> Christendom; <k>Kristaneso</k> Christianity (quality); <k>Kristanismo</k>
Christianity (doctrine); <k>Kristoteologio</k> Christology; <k>ante
 Kristo (a K.)</k> before Christ (B.C.); <k>pos kristo (p. K.)</k>
after Christ, anno domini (A.D.); <k>Kristonasko</k>, <k>Kristala</k>
Christmas. <k />

<k>kristalo</k> crystal; <k>kristaligar</k>, <k>kristaleskar</k> to crystallize; <k>kristala
 glaso</k> cut glass; (cf. <k>quarco</k>). <k />

<k>kriticismo*</k> critical philosophy: the metaphysical system of
Kant.<k />

<k>kritikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to criticise (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); to
examine and judge critically; (cf. <k>blamar</k>); <k>kritikachar</k>
to make unjust criticism of, to carp at. <k />

<k>krizo</k> crisis, decisive moment, critical time, turning
point; <k>krizala</k> critical: relating to a crisis. <k />

<k>krizokalko</k> pinch-beck: an alloy of copper and zinc
resembling gold. <k />

<k>kroasar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> (of crows) to caw; <ex>(of frogs)</ex>
to croak. <k />

<k>krokar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to craunch, crunch <ex>(with the teeth
and fig.).</ex> Def.: Mastikar ulo harda qua ruptesas bruise;
IV-137. <k />

<k>krono</k> crown <ex>(also fig. as of teeth)</ex>; <k>kronizar</k>
to crown; <k>kronizo</k> crowning, coronation; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
crowning (as of a career); <k>kronizuro</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex>
crown-piece, coping; <k>sen kronigar</k>, <k>des kronizar</k> to uncrown.
<k />

<k>kronika</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> chronic: of long duration; <k>kronikeso</k>
chronic state; <k>kronikeskar</k> to become chronic. <k />
<k>kronometrio*</k> chronometry: the art of measuring time. <k />

<k>kroso</k> <ex>(gen.)</ex> any long object with a hook-like end; <ex>(of
bishop)</ex> crozier, pastoral staff; <ex>(in hockey)</ex>
hockey-bat; <ex>(of a pistol or musket) </ex>butt-end. Def.: Senco
generala: kurvigita extremajo; VI-116. <k />

<k>kruco</k> cross; <k>kruce</k> crossways; <k>krucumar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to c. (roads, etc.); <k>krucigar</k> to make a c. of (<k>ulo</k>); <k>krucforma</k>
cruciform; <k>krucvoyo</k> cross-way, cross-road; <k>krucsignizar su</k>
to c. oneself; <k>facar krucosigno</k> to make the sign of the
c.; <k>krucagar</k> to crucify (<k>ulu</k>); <k>krucagito</k>
crucified person; <k>kruceto di fenestro</k> sash-bar; <k>krucokapo</k>cross-head
(of a piston); <k>krucomilito</k> crusade; <k>krucomilitanto</k>
crusader; <k>krucoportisto</k> cross-bearer. <k />

<k>krucho</k> pitcher, jug; <k>kruchedo</k> pitcherful. Def.: Tera o
porcelana vazo kun larja ventro e streta kolo, kun anso e kun
varsilo. <k />

<k>kruda</k> crude: not changed from its natural state; (of foods)
uncooked; unwrought; <ex>(fig.)</ex> lacking finish, polish; <k>kruda
 petro</k> rough ashlar, rough building stone; <k>kruda karno</k>
raw, uncooked meat; <k>kruda ledro</k> crust leather; <k>kruda silko</k>
raw silk; <k>kruda metalo</k>crude metal, unwrought metal; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
-<k>a penso</k> crude thought; <k>kruda koloro</k> crude colo(u)r.
<k />

<k>kruela</k> cruel (tyrant, law, war, etc.); <k>kruelegajo</k> an
atrocity. <k />

<k>krugo</k> (wooden or metal) mug, pot (as used for carrying or
measuring liquids). <k />

<k>krular</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to fall in, collapse, tumble down (in
pieces with noise); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to sink in ruin; <k>la domo krula</k>
the house is falling; <ex>(fig.)</ex> <k>la tota sistemo krulas</k>
the whole system is sinking into ruin. V. exp.: To ne esas simple
falar, ma falar kun bruiso, rupteskante e dispeceskante; anke
rulante sur inklineso; III-326. <k />

<k>krumo</k> soft part of bread; (cf. <k>panopeceto</k>). Def.:
Parto interna e mola di pano; VI-140. <k />

<k>krumplar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to rumple, crumple, (rough) crease.
Ex.: Krumplar robo, papero. <k />

<k>krusto</k> crust (of bread, of earth, etc.); <ex>(of a sore)</ex>
scab; <k>krustizar</k> to encrust (<k>ulo</k>); <k>krustopeco</k>
crouton, piece of crust. <k />

<k>kruzelo</k> crucible: melting-pot; <k>kruzelagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to assay, refine (with a crucible). <k />

<k>kuafar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dress the hair of (<k>ulu</k>); <k>kuafisto</k>
hair-dresser, coiffeur. Def.: Aranjar la hararo di ulu. <k />

<k>kubo</k> <ex>(geom., arith.)</ex> cube; <k>kubigar</k> to c.; <k>radiko</k>
c. root; <k>metro kubo</k> cubic meter (metre). <k />

<k>kudo</k> elbow, knee; <k>kudigar</k>, <k>kudizar</k> to make an e. out of
(<k>ulo</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to bend (<k>ulo</k>) in the form of
an e.; <k>kudpulsar: (</k>od,<k>shokar</k>, <k>frapar per la kudi)</k>
to elbow, jostle (with elbows); <k>kudmezuro</k> cubit (-measure);
<k>kudapogar</k> to lean on the e., <k>kudapogilo</k> e. rest; <k>intertushar
 la kudi</k> to be e. to e. <k />

<k>kuglo</k> bullet, musket-ball; <k>kuglego</k> cannon-ball; <k>kugleto</k>
(small-) shot; <k>kuglespruva</k> bullet-proof. V. exp.: vid. <k>balono</k>.
<k />

<k>kuko</k> cake; <k>kukajo</k> a pastry; <k>kuk(if)isto</k>
pastry-cook; <k>kukvenderio</k> a pastry-selling establishment.
<k />

<k>kukurbitaceo</k> cucurbitaceous plant (as cucumber, melon,
squash, pumpkin, gourd). <k />

<k>kulo</k> bottom (of objects); arse, buttocks (of persons); <k>kulo
 di botelo</k>, <k>di lampo</k> bottom of a bottle, a lamp. V. exp.:
vid. <k>sedo.</k> <k />

<k>kulato</k> breech (of a cannon, musket, etc.); <k>kulatizar</k> to
cover the breech of. <k />

<k>kulbutar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> <k>kulbutigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
somersault, turn upside down; <ex>(nav.)</ex> to capsize; <k>kulbute</k>
head over heels; (cf. <k>renversar</k>). <k />
<k>«kuli»</k> coolie, cooly: cheap laborer in the Orient.<k />

<k>kuliso</k> coulisse: <ex>(tech.)</ex> a groove in which something
glides; <ex>(theat.)</ex> side scene, wing; <ex>(finan.)</ex> outside
stock-exchange, or «curb market»; <k>kulisisto</k> stock-jobber,
outside-broker; green-room frequenter <ex>(theat.)</ex>. <k />

<k>kulminar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> culminate: to reach its highest
altitude or meridian; to reach the highest point, as of rank,
number, size, glory, power, etc. <k />

<k>kulpar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to commit a fault, to err; <k>kulpo</k>
fault, blunder: deviation from duty, propriety through human
weakness; deviation from rule through indolence or ignorance;
(cf. <k>pekar</k>); <k>kulpanta</k>, <k>kulpinta</k>, <k>kulpoza</k> culpable; <k>sen
 kulpa</k> faultless, <ex>(fig.)</ex> guiltless;<k>kulpeto</k> petty
fault, peccadillo. <k />

<k>kultivar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cultivate: till (land); raise, as
plant or crop, by tillage; <ex>(of arts, letters, the mind, etc.)</ex>
to improve and develop by study and training; <ex>(of friendship,
acquaintance, etc.)</ex> to pay assiduous attention to, to foster;
<k>kultiv(ad)o</k>, <k>kultiveso</k> cultivation, tillage, husbandry; <k>kultivebla</k>
cultivable, arable. Ex.: Kultivar agro, viti, flori. Kultivar sua
spirito, sua memoro, mem sua korpo (on parolas pri korpala
kultivado). Instruktisto, edukisto, anke kultivas la spirito di
sua dicipuli, lia atenciveso, lia kurajo, ed altra fakultati e
vertui. Individui o populi povas kultivar ca or ta cienco, arto,
mestiero; ed on povas anke dicar, pri individuo o populo, ke ol
esas plu o min «kultivita»; (IV-349-350). Vu devas kultivar
amikeso kun ta bona homulo. <k />

<k>kulturo</k> culture; <k>kulturala</k>, <k>kulturema</k> cultural; <k>kulturoza</k>
cultured. Def.: Etikala, intelektala e sociala parto di
civilizeso (kontraste a progreso en la cienci, l’arti: la
civilizo). Ex.: On povus dicar, ke Rusia esis kulturlando, pro ke
tanta rusa autori, muzikisti, e.c. pruvis la alta stando di la
maxim progresinta Rusi, ma ke Rusia esis apene civilizita, quale
aparas per la sistemo di guverno e per la nesavo di la amasi;
III-561. <k />

<k>«kumis»</k> kumiss, koumiss: a fermented (or distilled) liquor
made from milk.<k />

<k>kumular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hold a plurality of (offices). V.
exp: <k>Kumular</k> havas specala, quaze teknikal senco: to esas
akumular sur su (akaparar) plura ofici, funcioni . . . e salarii;
II-645. <k />

<k>kun</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> with, in company with, in connection
with; <k>kune</k> together (with); both; (cf. Talmey’s Text
Book, p. 108). Ex.: La matro arivis kun la filiino. Lu drinkas
teo kun lakto. Me kompris ca domo kun la gardeno. La matro e la
filiino arivas kune. La infanti dormas kune en la lito. El esas
kune (E. both) bela e bona. Ant.: <k>sen.</k> <k />

<k>kunhabitar</k>, <k>kunvivar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to live together; <k>(quale
 spozulo e spozino)</k> to cohabit; (cf. <k>koitar</k>).<k />

<k>kunlaborar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to work together, to co-operate
(<k>kun</k> <k>ulu</k>; kp. <k>kooperar</k>).<k />

<k>kunsidar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be seated together; to hold a
sitting (meeting); <k>kuno</k> meeting; <ex>(fig.) </ex>recital; <k>klozar
 la kunsido</k> to close the meeting. V. exp.: vid. <k>sesiono.</k>
<k />

<k>kunvenar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to meet, come together; <k>kuno</k>
meeting, reunion.<k />
<k>kunvivanto</k> one who lives with another; chum.<k />

<k>kupo</k> (wine-)glass, vase (as for prize). Def.: Vazo antiqua
e ceremoniala, kun pedo, e plura larja kam profunda (on drinkas
ex. champano en kupi); II-645. <k />

<k>kupelo</k> <ex>(chem., tech.)</ex> cupel: a small dish made of
bone earth used in assaying. <k />

<k>kuperoso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> rosy-drop, pimple, grog-blossom; <k>kuperosika</k>
blotched and pimpled. Def.: Specala dermatoso di la nazala
regiono; V-675. <k />

<k>kuplar</k> <ex>(tr., mechan.)</ex> to couple, link together. V.
exp.: Kuplar implikas fixa, konstanta ligo di la peci, exemple
per skrubi, per kelo, per stango artikizita, e.c. tale ke li
nultempe povas movar nedependante (tam longe kam on ne desmuntas
la mashino). Ex.: on parolas pri lokomotivi kun 2 o 3 axi
«kuplita»; e l’organo di la kuplo esas «kuplo-stango»;
III-88. <k />

<k>kupleto</k> couplet, stave, stanza (in song). Def.: Strofo di
kansono; III-605. <k />

<k>kupra</k>, <k>kupro</k> copper; <k>kuproza</k> coppery: full of c.; <k>kuprea</k>
c. colo(u)red; <k>kuprizar</k> to cover with c.; <ex>(fig)</ex> to
copper-plate; <k>kupra moneto</k> a copper (money); <k>kuprooxo</k>
copper acetate, verdigris (cf. <k>verdigriso</k>); <k>kuprokloro</k>
cupreous chloride; <k>kuprikloro</k> cupric chloride. <k />

<k>kurar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to run, to race; (cf. <k>fluar</k>, <k>vehar</k>);
<k>kuragro</k>, <k>kureyo</k> running ground, race-course; <k>kure (</k>od, <k>per
 kuro)</k> by the run; <k>kurajila</k> swift-running; <k>kurkavalo</k>
race-horse; <k>for kurar</k> to run away. <k />

<k>kuracar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to treat (a patient); (cf. <k>risanigar</k>, <k>remediar</k>); <k>kuraciva</k>, <k>kuracivo</k> curative; <k>kuracato</k> a
patient; <k>kuracarto</k> therapeutics; <k>kuracisto</k> healer
(whether by medicine or not; cf. <k>mediko</k>). <k />

<k>kurajar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be courageous, have courage; <k>kurajigar</k>
to encourage (<k>ulu</k>); <k>kuraje</k> courageously; <ex>(interj.)</ex>
buck up! <k />

<k>kuraso</k> cuirass: breastplate; <ex>(ships)</ex> armo(u)r-plate;
<ex>(turtles)</ex> carapace; <k>kurasizar</k> to put armo(u)r-plate
on; to put a breast-plate on; <k>kurasiero</k> cuirassier; <k>kurasnavo</k>
armo(u)red ship, iron-clad. <k />

<k>kurato</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> guardianship over an orphan, minor,
etc.); trusteeship (of a property); <k>kuratanto</k>, <k>kuratero</k>, <k>kuratisto</k>
curator: trustee; (cf. <k>tutelanto</k>). <k />

<k>kurbaturar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to over-fatigue, become stiff all
over, be knocked up; <ex>(vet.)</ex> to founder. Def.: Indikas la
specala doloro quan on sentas en la muskuli pro granda fatigeso;
III-266. <k />

<k>kurbetar</k> <ex>(intr., of horses)</ex> to curvet; (cf. <k>kabrar</k>).
Def.: (<k>kurbeto</k>) Galopo per kurta salti en qua la kavalo
levas la avana pedi e preske samtempe kontraktas la dopa gambi;
VI-76.

<k>kurear</k> <ex>(tr., hunt. and fig.)</ex> to set (on): to
precipitate in a mass on something (as dogs on a quarry); to grab
one’s part while quarreling or fighting; <k>kureajo</k>
quarry; the part of the beast given to the hounds (to encourage
them). Def.: Precipitar su amase sur ulo por arachar, raptar sua
parto interlukante e disputante, de qua derivos «kureo» kom ago
di la chashundi, o, metafore, di homi os altra animali; VI-162-3.
<k />

<k>kurioza</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> inquisitive, curious; (cf. <k>vidinda</k>, <k>stranja</k>, <k>rara</k>, <k>remarkinda</k>); <k>kuriozacha</k> prying; <k>kuriozeso</k>
inquisitiveness; (cf. IV-322). <k />

<k>kurso</k> course (of lessons, of lectures, of study, etc.); <ex>(fin.)</ex>
rate (of exchange), current price, market price, ruling price; <k>kursolisto</k>
price-list (commercial exchange); <k>la kursi falis</k> prices
have gone down; <k>kurso di kambio</k> rate of exchange; <k>komprar
 ye</k>, <k>segun la kurso</k> to buy at the market price; <k>lasta
 kurso</k> closing price; (cf. <k>koto</k>; III-13, 14). <k />

<k>kursoro</k> <ex>(instr.)</ex> cursor; <ex>(tech.)</ex> slide-weight
(on scale). Def.: Indikas irga peco shovebla segun lineo, e quan
on povas fixigar en ula punti (ex. Sur vekto di balanco); IV-579.
<k />

<k>kurta</k> short; <k>kurtigar</k> to shorten; <k>kurte</k> in short,
briefly. Ex.: Kurta homo, kolo, tempo, vivo, parolado. Ant.: <k>longa.</k>
<k />

<k>kurtajar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to carry on the business of a
broker; <k>kurtajo</k> brokers’ business; <k>kurtajisto</k>, <k>kurtajero</k>
broker; <k>kurtajtaxo</k> pecentage paid to a broker. <k />

<k>kurteno</k> curtain (as of a window, a bed); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
screen (as of trees); <ex>(fort.)</ex> rideau. <k />

<k>kurtezar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pay court to (a king, etc.), to
woo (a woman); <k>kurtezanto</k> suitor, wooer, lover; <k>kurtezisto</k>, <k>kurtezero</k> courtier. <k />

<k>kurva</k> curved, bent, crooked, arched; <k>kurvo</k> curve; <k>kurveso</k>
(condition) curvature; <k>kurvolinea</k> curvilineal; <k>kurvagamba</k>
bandy-, bow-legged. <k />

<k>kuseno</k> cushion, pillow; <k>kuseneto</k> pad. Def.: Stofo mola
quan on pozas sur lito, divano, irga sidilo; II-647. <k />

<k>kushar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to put (<k>ulu</k>) to bed; (<k>su</k>)
to go to bed; to lie (<k>su</k>) down on (the ground, etc., to
sleep); (cf. <k>jacar</k>, <k>sternar</k>). <k />

<k>kustar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cost, to be bought for (<k>nulo</k>, <k>cherege</k>, <k>e.c.</k>); <k>kusto</k> cost, expense, charge (cf. <k>preco</k>);
<k>kustoza</k> costly, expensive (cf. <k>chera</k>); <k>kustopreco</k>
cost-price; <k>co kustas 10 fr.</k> this costs 10 francs; <k>quante
 to kustis de vu</k> how much did that cost<k /><k />

<k>kustumar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be accustomed to, to be in the
habit of, to be wont to (followed by infinitive); <k>kustumo</k>
custom, habit; <k>kustumala</k> customary, habitual; <k>kustumata</k>
accustomed (<k>kozo</k>, <k>e.c.</k>); <k>kustumigar</k> to accustom (<k>su</k>, <k>ulu</k>); <k>kustumale</k> customarily. <k />

<k>kuto*</k> long coat of a peasant; <k>mashkuto</k> coat of
mail. <k />
