<k>kutio</k> <ex>(fabric)</ex> ticking (as for a bed), drilling,
duck (as for tents, trousers). <k />

<k>kutro</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> cutter: small armed vessel with one
mast. <k />

<k>kuzo</k>, <k>kuzulo</k>, <k>kuzino</k> cousin; <k>kuzeso</k> <ex>(relation)</ex>
cousinship; <k>kuzo primara</k> first cousin, <k>kuzo sekundara</k>
second cousin. <k />

<k>a (ad)</k> <ex>(general sense)</ex> to.
indicating that toward which there is movment, tendency, or
position, with or without arrival; opposed to <k>from</k>
(de, ek); (cf. <k>vers</k>, <k>til</k>); <k>il iris a la
 kirko</k> he went to (the) church; <k>il venas de
 Paris a London</k> he is on his way from Paris to London; <k>la
 hundo jetis su a la kato</k> the dog sprang at the cat; <k>del
 (de la) esto al (ad la) westo</k> from (the) east to (the)
west; <k>de tempo a tempo</k> from time to time; <k>de
 un dio a l'altra</k> from one day to another, from day to
day; <k>de la supro a l'infro</k> from top to bottom; <ex>(dative:
indirect object)</ex> <k>donez a me la bastono</k>
give me the stick; <k>il parolis ad el</k> he spoke to
her. <ex>(object of action, thought, desire)</ex> <k>il
 elevas su a la richeso e a la honori</k> he is rising to
weather and honors; <k>atencema a la diskurso</k>, <k />
attentive to the discourse; <k>surda a la ditresokrii</k>
deaf to the cries of distress; <k>amo a Deo</k> love
to God;<k>me deziras a vu omna feliceso</k> I wish
you all happiness. <ex>(comparison or relation)</ex> <k>agreabla
 a la gusto</k> agreeable to the taste;<k>ca okupo
 konvenas ad il</k> this occupation suits him; <ex>(proportion;
total)</ex> <k>tri raportas a non quale du a sis</k>
three is to nine as two is to six; <k>evaluar lua revenuo a
 10.000 franki; taxar ol a 400 franki</k> to estimate his
income as (amounting to) 10,000 francs; to tax it at (at the rate
of, a total of) 400 francs. Note: <k>Ad</k> is often
joined to other prepositions, to verbal roots, adverbs,
particularly to add the idea of motion. <k />

<k>abandonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abandon, (wholly)
give up, (totally) relinquish, forego, forsake. Ex.: Abandonar
navo, domo, projeto, infanto. Abandonar su a desespero, a joyo.
Ant.: <k>gardar</k>, <k>retenar.</k> V. exp.: <k>Livar</k>
urbo, portuo, domo, persono ... esas simple <k>forirar</k>
de ol sen ula sentimental impliko. <k>Abandonar</k>
persono, ofico, posteno, esas sive lasar li, nevolunte o
kontrevole, sive violacante ula devo (abandonar infanti,
parenti). <k>Retretar</k> esas retromarchar: la senco
primitiva e propra esas militala; senci figurala e derivta: livar
la mondo (religiala retreto), funciono od agado (retreto di
oficisto, komercisto, e.c.); II

<k>abasar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lower: let down to a
lower level; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to abase (morally), debase; <k>abasez
 la tirani</k> down with the tyrants; <k>abasez la
 manui</k> hands off!; <k>abasez la chapeli</k>
hats off! Ex.: Abasar la kapo, la brakio, la manuo; abasar
levero, standardo, espado, fusilo, velo; omno to signifikas pozar
(plu) infre. En la figurala senco, on abasas persono, reduktante
lu ad infra rango, kondiciono, e.c.; on abasas su, prenante infra
rango, humila posturo, e.c.; IV <k /><k /><k /><k /><k />

<k>abatar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. sense)</ex> to knock,
beat, strike down, fell; <k>abatajaro</k> <ex>(fort.)</ex>
abatis. Ex.: Abatar arboro, domo, muro, persono

<k>abatiso</k> <ex>(of fowl, game)</ex> refuse parts,
as head, feet, wings, skin, etc.; small edible parts, as giblets.
Def.: Mikra parti di pultro, anke di leporo; VII <k />

<k>abceso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> abscess; <k>abceseskar</k>
to become or turn to an a. Def.: Pusoza kavajo en la korpo.

<k>abdikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abdicate. V. exp.: <k>Abdikar</k>
dicesas precipue pri la reji o suvereni, qui cesas regnar por
transmisar la povo a sucedanto, sive naturala, sive selektata; <k>abdikar</k>
ne esas simple <k>demisionar</k>, <k /> ma demisionar por
ulu, do facante ankore ago di suvereneso; IV-100. Vid. <k>abnegar</k>, <k>renuncar</k>, <k>rezignar.</k>

<k>abdomino</k> abdomen. V. exp.: <k>Abdomino</k>
esas ciencala vorto, plu preciza kam <k>ventro</k>
IV-512.

<k>abduktar</k> <ex>(tr., physiol.)</ex> to abduct.
Note: Not abduct: to kidnap; cf. <k>raptar.</k>

<k>abelo</k> bee; <k>abeleyo</k> apiary; <k>abeluyo</k>
beehive; <k>abelino</k> female or queen-bee; <k>abelulo</k>
drone-bee; <k>abeledukado</k> bee-culture; <k>edukisto</k>
bee-master.

<k>abjekta</k> (morally) abject, mean; <k>abjekteso</k>, <k />
abjectness (quality); <k>abjektajo</k> a. act. Def.: Qua
esas di extrema grado di etikala abaseso. Ex.: Persono,
sentimenti abjekta. Ant.: <k>nobla.</k>

<k>abjurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abjure. Def.:
Renuncar publike e solene. Ex.: Abjurar religio, doktrino,
opiniono.

<k>ablaciono</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> ablation; <k>ablacionar</k>
to ablate: to remove by surgical operation. Ex.: Ablaciono di
membro, di tumoro.

<k>ablaktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to wean; <k>ablakt(ad)o</k>, <k>ablakteso</k> (act, state) weaning, ablactation. Def.:
Deskustumigar (infanto) de l'alaktado; IV-512, 600.

<k>ablucionar</k> <ex>(tr., relig., med.)</ex> to
purify by washing; <k>abluciono</k> ablution. Def.: Lavar
parto di la korpo segun medicinal (o religiala) preskripti;
IV-515.

<k>abnegar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abnegate, deny
one-self; <k>abnego</k>, <k>abnegeso</k> abnegation, self-denial. V.
exp.: <k>Abnegar</k> esas renuncar omna profito,
personal interesto o mem plezuro, por konsakrar su ad altru or ad
ula sociala religiala verko. Abnegar esas propre renuncar su ipsa
t.e. sua propra feliceso; IV-101; vid. <k>renuncar</k>, <k>abdikar</k>, <k>rezignar.</k>

<k>abolisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abolish; <k>abolisismo</k>
abolitionism; <k>abolisismano</k> abolitionist. V. exp.: <k>Abolisar</k>, <k>abrogar</k>, <k>supresar: Supresar</k> esas la generala vorto, la
du altra esas specala e teknikal termini. On <k>abrogas</k>
lego per altra lego, dekreto per altra dekreto, qua nuligas
l'antea. On <k>abolisas</k> institucuro o kustumo (ex.
rejeso, privileji, sklaveso); II-649.

<k>abominar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abominate, abhor,
loathe, detest (cf. <k>odiegar</k>, <k>hororar); abominajo</k>
an abominable act or object; <k>abomininda</k> abominable,
detestable, execrable.

<k>abonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to subscribe for or to
(a periodical) <k>igarar</k> to cause (ulu) to
subscribe to (ulo); <k>abono</k> subscription (to a
journal); <k>abonopreco</k> cost of subscription; <k>abonanto</k>, <k>aboninto</k> subscriber.

<k>abordar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to land on a (shore, a
wharf, etc.); to board (a ship, a vehicle); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to go
alongside, come up close to. Def.: Irar sur ulo o, per extenso,
venar flanke ad, bordo an bordo kun ulo (por irar sur ol).
L’etimologiala senco esas: irar a (sur) la bordo di ulo.
Ex.: La Portugalani esis le unesma qui abordis la literi di
India. Abordar la navo dil enemiko. La navo abordas (ad, an) la
warfo. La pasajanti abordas sur la warfo.

<k>aborijena</k>, <k>aborijeno</k>aboriginal, autochthon. V.exp.: <k>Aborijeno</k>, <k>indijeno</k> <k>Indijeno</k> signifikas simple la populo (raso)
qua habitas la lando «de l’origino» (historiala). Ex. Omna
Amerikani qui naskis en Amerika esas <k>indijena</k>, opozite a
l’enmigranti ed a l’Europani (mem samlingua e samrasa),
ma nur l’Indiani e simila rasi esas <k>aborijena</k>;
IV-512-3.  <k />

<k>abortar</k><ex>(intr.)</ex> to abort, miscarry; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
come to nothing, fail; <k>aborto</k> miscarriage; <k>abortala</k>
abortive; <k>abortigar</k>to cause a. to (ulu); <k>abortigo</k>
miscarriage (caused); <k>abortigiva</k>, <k>abortanta</k>abortive (capable of
producing and abortion); <k>abortigivo</k>, <k>abortilo</k>something causing
abortion; <k>aborturo</k> an abortive child or thing. <k />

<k>aboyar</k> <ex>(int., also fig.)</ex> to bark, bay; <k>aboyetar</k>
to yelp; <k>aboyachar</k> to give tongue falsely, snarl,
bawl. <k />

<k>abreviar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abbreviate (words), abridge (a
book), curtail (a narrative); (cf. <k>rezumar</k>, <k>kurtigar)</k>; <k>abrevi(ad)o</k>, <k>abreviuro</k>abbreviation, abridgment. <k />

<k>abrogar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex> to abrogate, repeal, annul. V. exp.:
vid. <k>abolisar</k>. <k />

<k>abrupta</k>precipitous, cragged, abrupt; <ex>(fig.)</ex> rough,
broken, unpolished. Ex.: L’abrupta flanko di monto. Stilo,
karaktero abrupta. V. exp.: vid. <k>eskarpa.</k> <k />

<k>absenta</k>absent: not present (<k>de</k>); <k>absent(ul)o</k>absentee;
<k>absenteso</k>absence; <k>absenteskar</k> to absent oneself, keep out
of the way; <k>absenta de Paris</k>a. from Paris; <k>absenta per konjedo</k>a. on leave. Ant.: <k>prezenta.</k><k />

<k>absoluta</k>absolute: unlimited, unrestricted; <k>absolutajo</k><ex>(philos.)</ex>
something unconditioned; <k>absoluto</k>an absolute being; <k>absolute</k>absolutely;
<k>absolutismo</k>absolutism; <k>absolutisto</k>absolutist; <k>ablativo
 absoluta</k>ablative absolute. Ex.: Povo, rejo absoluta.
Absoluta neposiblajo. <k />

<k>absolvar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex> to absolve, acquit, exculpate; <k>absolvo</k>
<ex>(rel.)</ex> absolution, <ex>(jur.)</ex> acquittal; (cf. <k>indulgar</k>).
Def.: Deklarar senkulpa (do nepunisebla) ula akuzato; III-699.
Ant.: <k>kondamnar.</k><k />

<k>absorbar</k><ex>(tr.,physical sense)</ex> to absorb; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to engross (attention); <k>absorbo</k>, <k>absorbeso</k>absorption; <k>absorbiva</k>, <k>absorbanta</k>; <k>absorbivo</k>, <k>absorbilo</k> absorbent; <k>absorbiva papero</k>blotting
paper; <k>absorboputeo</k>cesspool. Ex.: Sablo absorbas aquo. Lo
nigra absorbas la lumo. Absorb-esar da meditado. Vaskularo
absorbiva. <k />

<k>abstenar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex> to abstain (voluntarily) from, to
refrain from (<k>ulo</k>); <k>absten(ad)o</k>abstention; <k>abstenanta</k>, <k>abstenema</k>abstemious, sober; <k>abstenanto</k>, <k>abstenero</k>abstainer; <k>abstenemeso</k>abstinence (habitual state); igar ar: to cause (<k>ulu</k>)
to abstain from (<k>ulo</k>); <k>absteneskar</k> to begin to abstain;
Ex.: Ne esas facila abstenar drinkar, kande on durstas. V. ex.: <k>Abstenar</k>, <k>karear: Karear</k> ne implikas «vole», ol prefere implikas
«nevole» o mem «kontrevole». On <k>abstenas</k> kozo, quan on
havas o povus havar; on <k>kareas</k> kozo, quan on ne havas o ne
povas havar (nun). Ex.: En voyajo on mustas <k>karear</k> multa
kozi (pro ke la kozi mankas); ma se on havus li, probable on ne <k>abstenus</k>
li, IV-658. <k />

<k>abstinencar*</k> (<ex>intr., relig</ex>.) to abstain (from
meat), to practise abstinence (from pleasure), to fast (<k>de</k>).

<k>abstraktar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to abstract: separate in
thought, <k>abstraktala</k> abstract (science, question); <k>abstraktema</k>, <k>abstraktata</k>, <k>abstraktita</k> (of mind) preoccupied, absent-minded; <k>abstrakturo</k>, <k>abstraktajo</k> abstract idea, object.

<k>abstruza</k> abstruse, recondite. Del.: Desfacile
komprenebla e tedanta; II-706.

<k>absurda</k> absurd, preposterous. Del.: Kontre la komuna
raciono. Ant.: <k>saja</k>, <k>racionoza</k>.

<k>abundar</k>(<ex>intr.</ex>) to abound, be plentiful (de); <k>abundanta</k>
abundant, exuberant, luxuriant; <k>abundeganta</k> superabundant; -<k>okorno</k>
horn-of-plenty, cornucopia. Ant.: <k>esar skarsa</k>, <k>mankar</k>.

<k>abutar</k> (<ex>intr</ex>.) to abut (<k>ad</k>), come out
(into), end (in); (<ex>abscess</ex>) to come to a head. Def.:
Tushar per un extremajo. Ex.: Omna radii di cirklo abutas al
centro.

<k>acelerar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to accelerate, hasten, quicken.
Ex.: Acelerar la pazi. Ant.: <k>moderar</k>, <k>(plu)lentigar</k>.

<k>acendar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to light (a lamp), to kindle (a
fire), to turn on (electric light); (<ex>fig</ex>.) to inflame (the
passions); <k>acendilo</k> (<ex>instr</ex>.) lighter; <k>acendoligno</k>
kindling. Ant.: <k>extingar</k>.

<k>acensar</k> (<ex>tr., intr</ex>) to go up, ascend, mount; <k>acensanta</k>
ascending, rising; <k>acenseyo</k>place to mount (as stair, ascent);
<k>acensilo</k> lift, elevator, hoist; <k>acensofesto</k> Ascension
Day; <k>acenso rekta</k><ex>(astron</ex>.) right ascension. Def.: Irar
ad-supere; II-136. Ex.: .Acensar (sur) kavalo, eskalero, monto.
Ant.: <k>decensar</k>.

<k>acento</k>accent: stress of voice (not written accent, cf. <k>supersigno</k>);
-<k>izar;</k> to accent, lay stress on; <k>acentizo</k>, <k>acentizuro</k>
accentuation; <k>senacenta</k>, <k>neacentizita</k>:
unaccented.

<k>aceptar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to accept (something willingly, as
a proposal, condition apology, challenge), to receive (a guest); <k>acepto</k>
acception, reception, greeting; <k>aceptebla</k> acceptable,
receivable (of guests); <k>aceptanto</k>acceptor (also of bills); <k>aceptinda</k>
worth accepting; <k>aceptodio</k> reception-day, levee. <k>Vu esas
 plezure aceptata</k> you are welcome, Ant.: <k>refuzar</k>.
V. exp.: <k>recevar</k>.

<k>acerba</k> (<ex>also fig</ex>.) acerb: sour, bitter and harsh
in taste (as unripe fruit); <ex>-</ex><k>eso</k>:
acerbity, harshness; severity. Ex.: Frukto acerba. Parolado
acerba. V. exp.: vid. <k>aspera</k>.

<k>acesar</k>: (<ex>tr</ex>.) to have access to (ulu, ulo); (<ex>med</ex>.)
to have an access, an attack; <k>aceso</k>: access, entry; (<ex>med.</ex>)
attack; <k>acesebla</k> accessible, approachable. Ex.: Il acesas
loko, persono (o havas aceso a loko, persono). Loko, persono
acesebla. Aceso di febro, (<ex>fig</ex>.) aceso di iraco, furio,
desespero.

<k>acesito</k> accesit: honorable mention accorded to a
student.

<k>acesora</k> accessory, subsidiary; (cf. <k>helpanta</k>, <k>konfirmanta</k>,
<k>surogata</k>); <k>acesoro</k>, <k>acesorajo</k> an accessory; (<ex>milit</ex>., <k>ledra</k>)
accoutrement. Def.: Qua akompanas precipuajo. Ant.: <k>esencala</k>, <k>precipua</k>.

<k>acida</k> acid; acetous; <k>acideta</k> sour, (cf. <k>acerba</k>, <k>akra</k>); (<ex>chem</ex>.) acid; <k>acidajo</k>an a. substance; <k>acideso</k>
acidity; <k>acidigar</k> to acidify; <k>acideskar</k> to become a.,
turn sour; <k>acidigo</k><k />, <k /> <k>acidesko</k>
acidification; <k>acid</k><k>oza</k>, <k>acidatra</k> acidulous: <k>acidizar</k>
to acidulate. <k />

<k>acidentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cause an accident to; <k>acidento</k>
accident (generally in an ill sense), mishap; <ex>(philos.)</ex>
accident; <k>acidenta</k>, <k>acidentala</k> accidental; <k>acidentanto</k>
on who or that which causes an a. <k>acidentito</k> vicitim
of an a.; <k>acidentoza</k> full of a.s; <k>acidente</k>
accidentally, by chance. Def.: Efektigar acidento ad ulu (ulo);
IV-105, VI-162. Ex.: Acidento bona o mala. La infirmaji e
acidenti di la vivo homala. Kozo acidental. Deskovrar acidente
ulo.

<k>aciono</k> <ex>(fin.)</ex> share (of a bank,
railway, joint-stock company, etc.); <k>acioni</k> stock; <k>acioniero</k>
share-, stock-holder;

<k>acizo</k> town or city tax on commodities, excise,
octroi.

<k>adaptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to adapt <k>ulo ad
 ulo; adaptar su</k> a. oneself; <k>adaptesar</k> to be
adapted.

<k>adbase</k> (with movement) to the bottom, (cf. <k>ad
 infre).</k> (cf. II-163.)

<k>aden</k> (with movement) into. Ex.: Irar aden la
gardeno. La ucelo flugis aden la kajo.

<k>adequata</k> adequate. Ex.: Havar ideo adquata pri
kozo.

<k>adfluar</k> <ex>(int.)</ex> to flow or run (to,
into, as a river to the sea); <ex>(med.)</ex> to rush (as blood
to the head); <k>ad(ad)o</k> afflux.

<k>adherar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to adhere <k>(ad)</k>
stick close to, be attached; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to give adhesion (to
a party, a principle); <k>adhero</k> adhesion, adherence; <k>adheriva</k>
adhesive; <k>adheremeso</k> adherency (tendency); <k>adheranta</k>, <k>adherema</k> adherent, sticking <k>(ad); adheranto</k>
adherer, follower; <k>adherigar</k> to cause to adhere,
stick. Ex.: La epidermo adheras a la pelo. Donar sua adhero a
projeto.

<k>adiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bid adieu to <k>(ulu)</k>, <k />
say good-bye; <k>adio</k> adieu; <k>adiala vizito</k>
farewell visit.

<k>adibe</k> (over) there, thither, (with movement).
Ex. Omnube vu iros, adibe me iros kun vu.

<k>adicionar</k> <ex>(tr., math.)</ex> to add: cast
up (numbers, cf. <k>adjuntar) adiciono</k> addition. Ant.: <k>sustracionar.</k>
<k>adinfre</k> (with motion) down(ward); (cf. <k>adsube</k>, <k>adbase).</k> Ex.: Irar adinfre sur l'eskalero.

<k>adirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go to, toward; to
approach.

<k>adjacar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be adjacent; <k>adanta</k>
adjacent: bordering upon.

<k>adjudikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to adjudicate,
adjudge: to award <k>(ulo ad ulo)</k> judicially in a
controversy: <ex>(at auctions)</ex> to knock down to, declare to
be the purchaser of; <k>adjudiko</k> awarding (of prizes),
granting (of contracts): <k>adjudikario</k> person who
receives the award; highest tenderer; <k>adjudikajo</k> what
is awarded. Ex.: Adjudikar la domo a la plendanto. Adjudikar
premio ad ulu.

<k>adjuntar</k> <ex>(tr., physical sense)</ex> to
add <k>(ulo od ulo); ado</k> adding, subjoining,
adjunction; <k>adajo</k> something added, an addition; <k>adita</k>
additional. Ex.: Adjuntar plu multa sukro a siropo. Facar
adjuntajo a domo. Adjuntaji a domeno. Modesteso adjuntita a
merito.

<k>adjurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to adjure: command in
the name of God, to charge solemnly. Ex.: Me adjuras vu, dicar la
verajo.

<k>adjustigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to adjust <k>(ulo
 ad ulo)</k>, <k /> to fit, to rectify, correct. Ex.: Adjustigo
esas la ago igar ulo justa ad ... Talioro adjustigas vesto ad
ulu. Adjustigar balanco, mezurilo.

<k>administrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to administer: to
manage, conduct (a business, an estate, a department of
government); <k>administreyo</k> office of a; <k>administrantaro</k>
<ex>(collect.)</ex>, <k>administrerio</k> (as institution)
board of administration.

<k>admirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to admire; <k>admirinda;</k>
worthy of admiration, admirable. Ant.: <k>desprizar</k>, <k>desestimar.</k>

<k>admisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to admit, to receive <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo;</k> cf. <k>agnoskar); admiso</k>, <k>admiseso</k>
admission, admittance, affiliation; <k>admisebla</k>, <k>admisinda</k>
admisable, allowable. Ex.: Admisar ulu aden domo, ulu en societo.

<k>admonte</k> above (i.e. further up on the same
general level; <ex>not</ex> overhead, cf. <k>super)</k>, <k />
up stream (toward the mountain, the source of the stream). <k>Aernavo
 flugas trans la rivero admonte de la urbo</k> the airship
flies over (crosses) the river above (i.e. not over the city
itself, but up-stream from the city). Ant.: <k>advale.</k>

<k>adolecar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be adolescent; <k>adoleco</k>, <k>adoleceso</k>, <k>adolectempo</k> adolescence, period of life between
puberty and maturity; <k>adolecanta</k> adolescent; <k>adolecanto</k>
an adolescent.

<k>adoptar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to adopt (an opinion, a
system); <ex>(jur.)</ex> to adopt (a child); <ex>(in assemblies)</ex>
to agree upon, carry (a motion, resolution), to pass (a bill); <k>adoptito</k>
an adopted child or person. Ant.: <k>repulsar.</k>

<k>adorar</k> <ex>(tr., rel.)</ex> to worship <k>(Deo);</k>
<ex>(gen.)</ex> to adore, idolize <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo); adorinda</k>
adorable.

<k>adosar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to set the back <k>(di
 ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k> to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>, <k /> to put back to
back; <k>adosar su</k> to lean one's back; <k>adostaluso</k>
<ex>(gard.)</ex> sloping bed (backed against a wall). Def.:
Apogar la dorso; II-17.

<k>adportar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bring: carry <k>(ulo)</k>
to a person or place; (cf. <k>venigar</k>, <k>querigar); adajo</k>
material brought. Ex.: Adportar ulo de Paris a London. Adportez a
me ta libro.

<k>adpozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to affix: put <k>(ulo)</k>
on <k>(ulo);</k> (cf. <k>surpozar</k>, <k>siglizar);
 ado</k> affixing; <ex>(gram.)</ex> apposition.

<k>adraganto*</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> gum-tragacanth,
gum-adraganth. Def.: Gumo extrakita de tragakanto. IV-644.

<k>adreso</k> address (on a letter, parcel, etc.); <k>adresizar;</k>
to address: put an <k>a.</k> on (a letter). Ex.: Ca
letro esas adresizita a vu.

<k>adsorbar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to adsorb: to
condense by adsorption.

<k>adsub</k> <ex>(with motion)</ex> under. Ex.: La
kato kuris adsub la tablo.

<k>adsur</k> <ex>(with motion)</ex> on to. Ex.: Irar
adsur agro.

<k>adube</k> <ex>(with motion)</ex> (toward) where,
whither. Ex.: Adube vu iras?

<k>adulterar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to commit adultery;
<k>adultero</k>, <k>adultereso</k> adultery; <k>adulteranto</k>, <k>adulterinto</k>
adulterer; <k>adulterala</k> adulterous, adulterine.

<k>advale</k> below: further down on the same general
level; (not below = under, cf. <k>sub)</k>, <k /> down stream
(toward the valley, the outlet); vid. <k>admonte.</k>
Ant.: <k>admonte.</k>

<k>advere</k> indeed, in truth, it is true, to be
sure. Ex.: Advere il venis, ma il agas nulo. Il venis, advere sen
instrumenti.

<k>adversa</k> adverse; <k>adverso</k>, <k>adversulo</k>, <k>adversino</k>: adversary,
opponent. Ex.: Fortuno adversa. Ant.: <k>(adverso) partenero</k>, <k>tederito</k>, <k>helpanto</k>, <k>defensanto</k>.

<k>advokar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to call, call to, hail. Ex.:
Advokar la konduktoro, la guardo.

<k>advokat(ul)o</k>advocate, barrister (who pleads in court); <k>advokateso</k>
bar (<ex>profession</ex>); <k>advokataro</k> the bar (<ex>collect</ex>.); <k>advokato
 statala</k> prosecuting attorney; <k>advokato konsilanta</k>: chamber
counsel.

<k>adyunto</k> deputy, associate: assistant (in some duty); <k>adyunta</k>
adjunct; <k>adyunto</k>-<k>profesoro</k> assistant professor; <k>adyunto
 di komonestro</k> deputy mayor.

<k>aero</k>air; <k>aerala</k> aerial; <k>aerizar</k> to air,
renew the air, (<ex>chem</ex>.) aërate; <k>aerigo</k>, <k /> -<k>ifo</k>, <k>aerizo</k> aeration, ventilation; <k>aerizita</k> aired,
ventilated; <k>aeroza</k> airy, well-ventilated; <k>aerizilo</k>
aerator, ventilator; <k>aerflueto</k> draught (of air); <k>aerodinamiko</k>
aero-dynamics; <k>aeronavo</k> airship (dirigible balloon; cf.
aerostato); <k>aeronavisto</k> aëronaut<k>; aernavig(ad)o</k>
aërial navigation, aeronautics; <k>aerostatiko</k> aërostatics;
<k>aeroterapio</k> air-therapeutics; <k>aerotimo</k> aërophobia;
<k>en libera aero</k> in the open air.

<k>aeroplano*</k> aëroplane. Note Technical terms may be found
in IV-330-333. DEFIRS

<k>aerostato</k> aërostat, balloon (without motive power); <k>aerostatala</k>
aërostatic. Def.; «Balonegi» qui flotacas passive en l'aero
(ne la «direktebla baloni» a qui esas rezervita la nomo:
aernavo). 11-706.

<k>afabla</k> affable, amiable; <k>afableso</k> affability; -<k>ajo</k>
amenity, courteous act. Ant.: <k>des</k>, <k>neafabia</k>, <k>ruda</k>,
<k>impertinenta.</k>

<k>afecionar</k> (<ex>tr</ex>.) to have an affection for, to
delight in, to be fond of (ulu, ulo); <k>afecionema</k>, <k>afecionoza</k>
affectionate, fond, loving; <k>afecionata</k> beloved, devoted, Ex.:
La Polonani afecionas sua patrio. Afecionoza fratino.El afecionas
sua matro.Ant.: <k>antipatiar</k>, <k>odiar</k>, <k>abominar</k>.

<k>afektar</k> (<ex>tr., psychol</ex>.) to touch (the feelings),
to move (emotionally); (<ex>med</ex>.) to take effect on, to
sicken; <k>afektesar (da)</k> to be moved, affected (by). Ex.: Lua
desfeliceso afektis me. Afekteso nervala.

<k>afektacar</k> (<ex>tr., intr</ex>.) to pose, to make an
artificial show, to pretend ostentatiously <k>; afektac(ad)o</k>
affectedness, affectation, mannerism; -<k>anta</k>, <k>afektacema</k>
affected, pretentious, finical. Ex.; Afectacar la
vertuo.Afektacar kom richulo, kom eleganto.

<k>afero</k> (<ex>com.</ex>.) business; (<ex>gen. sense</ex>)
affair: matter, thing, concern, question, etc.; (leg.) cause,
legal action; <k>aferi</k>(<ex>com</ex>.) trade, business; <k>aferisto</k>
business-man; -<k>agento</k> business-agent; <k>afero politikala</k>
political a.; <k>aferi extera</k> foreign a.s.; <k>afero mala</k> a
bad a.; a bad business; <k>afero amorala</k> a love a.; <k>afero
 honorala</k> a matter of honor<k>; pledar afero</k> to plead a
cause. V. exp.: La vorto afero aplikesas ne nur a l'aferi
komercala e financala, ma a le judiciala, politikala, mem social
e moral entraprezi ed agadi; V-623.

<k>afina</k> (<ex>chem</ex>.) having affinity (<k>ad</k>); (<ex>fig</ex>.)
akin, congenial; -<k>eso</k>: affinity; -<k>esar (ad)</k> to
have a. (to). Def.: Qua havas tendenco a kombino, ad uniono. Ex.:
Karbono afinesas ad oxo. Afineso spiritala, mentala. Ant.:<k>repulsanta</k>, <k>afiniva.</k>

<k>afirmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to affirm, aver (the truth, or that
something is true); <k>afirmo</k> affirmation, vouching for,
asseveration; <k>afirmajo</k> what is affirmed, the affirmative; <k>defensar
 la afirmajo</k> to support the affirmative. Ant.: <k>negar</k>, <k>dementiar.</k>

<k>afisho</k> poster, bill: placard posted in a public place; <k>afishigar</k>
to publish, gazette <k>(ulo); afishoglutinar</k> to post bill,
billstick; <k>afishexpozo</k>, <k>afishoglutino</k> bill posting; <k>afisheyo</k>, <k>afishtabelo</k> place for bill, bill-board; <k>afishoglutinisto</k>
bill-sticker.
<k>afixo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> affix: a prefix or a suffix.

<k>afliktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to afflict: to cause to suffer
mentally, to distress, grieve; <k>aflikto</k>, <k>aflikteso</k> affliction; <k>afliktanta</k>, <k>afliktiva</k> afflicting, distressing; <k>afliktar la karno</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to mortify the flesh.

<k>afrankar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to frank: to prepay (postage on
letters), carriage on parcels); <k>afranko</k>, <k>afrankuro</k> prepayment; <k>afrankita</k>, <k>afrankite</k> post free (of letters), carriage paid (of parcels); <k>afrankita
 ye bordo;</k> (f. o. b.) free on board.

<k>afrontar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to affront: to meet front to
front, to face; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to brave. Def.: Opozar (su) fronto
a fronto: figurale on afrontas danjero, tempesto, e.c.; II-136.

<k>afuzionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to affuse. <k>afuziono</k> <ex>(med.,
rel.)</ex> affusion; pouring of water, etc., on the body.

<k>agar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to do, to act; <k>agigar</k> to
make, cause <k>(ulu</k>, <k>olu)</k> to do <k>(ulo); ag(ad)o</k> acting,
deed, action; <k>aganta</k>, <k>agema</k>, <k>agiva</k> active; <k>agiveso;
 agemeso</k> activity; <k>ageskar</k> to begin to act, to come
into play; <k>aganto</k>, <k>aginto</k>: doer. V. exp.: <k>Agar</k>, <k>facar</k>
La difero inter <k>agar</k> e <k>facar</k> esas proxime ta qua
existas inter D. <ex>tun a machen</ex> (E. <ex>to do, to make</ex>).
Ica du verbi esas transitiva, ma kun diversa senci. On <k>facas</k>
ula kozo, konkreta objekto; ma <k>ago</k> havas nul objekto
extera. Pro to on darfas e devas dicar: <k>Quon</k> vu agas? Me
agas <k>nulo</k> (t.e.; me facas nula ago). La sequanta frazi
indikas ica difero: "Quon vu <k>agas</k> dum la tota jorno,
se on interdiktis a vu <k>facar</k> irga laboro manuala? Ho! me
ne restas nul-<k>aganta</k>; me <k>facas</k> argila statueti
(V-623, VI-482). Note: <k>Agar</k> is also used as a suffix with
the names of instruments to denote the act done with the
particular instrument, as: <k>bastonagar</k> to beat (with a
stick), <k>martelagar</k> to hammer; <k>fusilagar</k> to
shoot, etc.

<k>agacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to set on edge (teeth); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to irritate, annoy, tantalize, <k>agacanta</k>, <k>agaciva</k> irritating,
provoking. Def.: Senco propa esas iritar la nervi (specale e
prope di la denti, ex. per la froto di kultelo sur plado o
vitro); II-136. Ex.: Limar segilo agacas mea denti. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Agacar hundo.
<k>agendo</k> agenda: memorandum of things to be done.

<k>agento</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> agent; <k>agenterio</k> agency
(establ.) <k>agenteso</k> agency (function); <k>agenteyo</k> agency
(office); <k>borsagento</k> stock-broker; <k>agento kemiala</k>
chemical a.

<k>agitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to shake, agitate <k>(ulo</k>, <k>ulu);</k>
to wave (a flag, the hand, a handkerchief); (cf. <k>ondifar);</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to excite (the feelings; <k>agitesar</k> to be
agitated; <k>agit(ad)o</k>, <k>agiteso</k> agitation, (tossing as by waves); <k>agitanto</k>, <k>agitero</k> agitator (person); <k>agitilo</k> agitator (inst.) Ex.:
Agitar liquido. Agitar pupulo. El agitis sau brakio vers me.

<k>agloo</k> <ex>(orni.)</ex> eagle; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
heraldry, (milit. standard) eagle; <ex>(astron.)</ex> Aquilo; <k>agloonazo</k>
aquiline nose. Ex.: <ex>(fig.)</ex> Romana agli.

<k>aglutinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to agglutinate: stick
as with glue; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to join together.

<k>agnelo</k> <ex>(poetical and rel.)</ex> lamb; (cf.
<k>mutonyuno); agneleto</k> lambkin; <k>agnelino</k>
ewe-l.

<k>agnoskar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to acknowledge, admit,
own (something as right, good, true, false); <k>Me agnoskas
 vua motivi</k> I admit your reasons (i.e. receive them as
valid); <k>Me agnoskas la neceseso facar ol</k> I
admit the necessity to do it. <k>Agnoskar guvernerio</k>
to recognise a government. L

<k>agoniar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in the death
agony, in the last death struggle, in death pangs, in extremis.
DeFIRS

<k>agorafobio*</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> agoraphobia; morbid
dread of, or giddiness in crossing open spaces.

<k>agro</k> field: piece of ground; (cf. <k>feldo);
 agrala</k> agrarian, rural; <k>agrano</k>, <k>agristo</k>
agrarian, country person; <k>agrokultiv(ad)o</k>
agriculture; <k>agrkultivala</k> agricultural; <k>agrkultivisto</k>
agriculturist; <k>agromezur(ad)o</k> land-surveying.
Def.: Plu o min granda parto di sulo; VI-140.

<k>agrafo</k> hook, hook-and-eye (to fasten dresses,
etc.); clasp (for book-lids, cloaks, etc.); snap (of a necklace,
bracelet, etc.); (ancient) agraffe; <k>agrafagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to hook, clasp. DeFIS

<k>agreabla</k> agreeable, pleasant; <k>agreablajo</k>
a. act or object; <k>agreableso</k> agreeableness, charm.
Ex.: Agreabla muliero, loko, figuro, sento. Ant.: <k>desagreabla</k>, <k>desplezanta; ofensiva.</k>

<k>agregar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to aggregate,
incorporate; to admit (into a society, university); <k>agrego</k>
aggregation, admission; <k>agregajo</k> aggregate; <k>agregala
 grado</k> a special French university degree, lower than <k>doktoro</k>
(F. agrégé).

<k>agronomio</k> agronomics: the theory of
agriculture; <k>agronomiala</k> agronomic.

<k>agulo</k> needle; (R.R.) switch, (England) point; <k>aguledo</k>
needleful; <k>agulagisto</k> needle-worker, seamstress;
switch-man; <k>agulifisto</k> needle-maker; <k>agulagar</k>
to ply the needle; to switch, shunt; <k>agultruo</k> eye
of a n.; <k>agulpinto</k> point of a n. <k>trikotagulo</k>
knitting n.; <k>magnetagulo</k> magnetic n.

<k>ajila</k> agile, nimble, quick; <k>ajileso</k>
agility; <k>ajile</k> quickly, on the jump! Ant.: <k>lenta.</k>

<k>ajiotar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to speculate (in
public securities, stocks), to be a stock-jobber; <k>ajiot(ad)o</k>
agiotage; stock-jobbing; <k>ajiotanto</k>, <k>ajiotero</k>
stock-jobber. DeFIRS

<k>ajornar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to adjourn, put off,
defer, <k>(ulo til); ajorno</k> adjournment, postponement,
reprieve; <k>ajornema</k> dilatory.

<k>ajuro</k> ajour-work: open-work, fret-work, <ex>(of
fabric)</ex> webbed: carving, metal work, embroidery, etc. where
background is pierced or removed, or where it is translucent; <k>izita
 klozilo</k> lattice; <k>ajuroza kesto</k> crate.

<k>ajustar</k> <ex>(tr. tech.)</ex> to adjust,
regulate, set (cf. <k>adjustigar);</k> Ex.: Finita
instrumenti esas ajustebla. On ajustas teleskopo por la disto (ne
por la direciono: <k>apuntar);</k> III-219; cf. <k>regular.</k>

<k>ajuto</k> ajutage: nozzle, spout. Def.: Specala
tubulo o fino di tubo, destinita ne a juntar du tubi or
recipienti (quale tubulo), ma a determinar la formo di la sprico
ekiranta (ex. ya la fino di lanco por arozar); VII-197.

<k>akademio</k> academy: learned society, (<ex>not</ex>
"high-school"); <k>akademiala</k> academical; <k>akademiano</k>
academician. V. exp.: <k>Akademio</k> esas societo de
ciencisti (generale elektita ed en fix nombro) qui <k>ne
 docas.</k> On devas do evidente rezervar <k>akademiala</k>
a ta senco, e ne uzar ol parolante pri universitato (profesori,
studenti, kursi, e.c.); III-496

<k>akantonar*</k> <ex>(tr., milit.)</ex> to canton:
billet, allot quarters (to troops in a locality); <k>akantoneyo</k>
cantonment, quarters DeFIS

<k>akaparar</k> <ex>(tr., finan.)</ex> to corner
(goods, the market); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to monopolize. Def.:
Amasigar komercaji en granda quanto por skarsigar li e cherigar
lia preco.

<k>aklamar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to acclaim: to shout
approval or applause. Ex.: La rejo esis kronizata inter la aklami
di la turbo. Li aklamis il kom rejo. Li aklamis la propozajo.

<k>aklimatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to acclimate,
acclimatize: to season, to inure, accustom to a climate; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to habituate, make one feel at home.

<k>akomodar</k> <ex>(tr., tech., opt., etc.)</ex> to
accomodate: adapt, adjust; <k>akomodo</k> accommodation.

<k>akompanar</k> <ex>(tr., also mus.)</ex> to
accompany: escort; <k>(ad)o</k> accompanying; <k>akompanuro</k>
accompaniment; <k>akompanar su per piano</k> to a. oneself
on the piano.

<k>akonto</k> installment, partial payment; <k>akonte
 pagar</k> to pay on account. Def.: Partal pago di toto
debo; II-75.

<k>akordar</k> <ex>(intr., mus.)</ex> to be in tune;
(cf. <k>konkordar);</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> to agree; <k>akordigar</k>
to tune; <ex>(gram.)</ex> to make agree; <k>akordo</k>, <k>akordeso</k>
accord, agreement; <k>akordigo</k> tuning; <k>akordigilo</k>
<ex>(instr.)</ex> tuner; <k>akordigisto</k> (person)
tuner; <k>dis</k>, <k>mis ne akordo</k> discord (cf. <k>disonanco).</k>

<k>akra</k> acrid (taste, smell); (cf. <k>acerba</k>, <k>acida);</k> harsh (in voice); <ex>(fig.)</ex> acrimonious; <k>akreso</k>
acridity, asperity; <k>akrahumora</k> crabbed, peevish,
<k>akradolca</k> bitter-sweet. Ant.: <k>dolca.</k>

<k>akreditar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to accredit: to give
credit or sanction to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo); akreditita</k>
accredited; <k>akreditoletro</k> <ex>(dipl.)</ex> letter of
credence, credential.

<k>akrochar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hang (on a hook),
to hook on <k>(ulo ad ulo)</k>, <k /> to interlock, grapple
(a ship): <k>akrocho</k> hitch, hooking on; <k>akrochar su
 ad</k> to cling (like grim death) to.

<k>aktiva</k> active <ex>(opposed to passive; also
used in com., fin., gram., mil. senses);</ex> (cf. <k>agema</k>, <k>ajila); aktiveso</k> activity; <k>aktivo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex>
active (voice); <k>adebaji</k> debts which a person
has to receive: assets. Ex.: Aktiva puero, homo. Aktiva parto (en
afero). Aktiva verbo. La aktivi e pasivi di ban-krotinto. Ant.: <k>pasiva.</k>

<k>aktulaa</k> actual; <k>aktulaajo</k>, <k>aktulaeso</k>
actuality, question of the hour; <k>aktulaigar</k> to
actualize. Def.: Qua traktesas od interesas en la nuna instanto
(proxime reala); fakte e komplete existanta, opozite a to quo
povus esar, ma ne esas, ed a to quo naskas o divenas (ica od
ita); IV-495. Ex.: Aktuala energio, opozata a potencial energio.
La evento aktuala esas . . . . La jurnali povas vivar nur per
aktualaji (E. journals can live on passing events).

<k>akular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bring to bay <k>(ulu
 a ulo)</k> To drive into a place from which there is no
escape. Ex.: On povas akular kombatanto a muro, armeo a rivero o
monto, bestio chasata a klozilo; IV-135.

<k>akumular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to accumulate; <k>akumul(ad)o</k>, <k>akumulajo</k> accumulation. Ex.: Akumular richaji, trezori,
pruvi. Ant.: <k>disdonar.</k>

<k>akurata</k> punctual. Def.: Qua venas (persono) od
eventas precize ye la loko, ye la kloko fixigita, konvencionita,
IV-102. V. exp.: Persono povas dicesar <k>akurata</k>, <k />
ma ne <k>exakta</k> o <k>preciza. Akurateso</k>
indikas la ideo di sorgo; IV-102.

<k>akushar</k> <ex>(tr., obstet.)</ex> to deliver (a
woman); (cf. <k>parturar): akusho</k> accouchment: delivery
in child-bed; <k>akushistino</k> midwife; <k>akushala</k>
obstetrical; <k>akusharto</k> obstetrics.

<k>akustiko</k> acoustics; <k>akustikala</k>
acoustical; <k>akustikala tubo</k> hearing-tube; ear
trumpet.

<k>akuta</k> <ex>(also fig. of sound, pain, sickness,
accent)</ex> acute, sharp, keep; <k>akutajo</k> a sharp
object; edge; <k>akutigar</k> to sharpen, whet, put an
edge on; <k>akutigilo</k> sharpening instrument;
whetstone; <k>akuteso</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex>
acuteness, keen-ness; <k>akuta angulo</k> acute angle; <k>akutarista</k>
sharp-edged. Ant.: <k>obtuza.</k> DEFIS

<k>akuzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to accuse, inculpate,
charge with, indict; <k>akuzo</k>, <k>akuzajo</k> accusation:
impeachment (for state offenses); charge (before a police
magistrate); indictment (for larceny, etc.); <k>akuzala</k>
accusatory; <k>akuzato</k>, <k>akuzito</k> the accused, the
defendant; <k>akuzanto</k>, <k>akuzero</k> accusor, indicter,
prosecutor; <k>akuzebla</k> chargeable, impeachable; <k>akuzmotivo</k>
reason for accusation. Def.: Imputar kulpo, delikto, krimino ad
ulu. Ant.: <k>justifikar.</k>

<k>alo</k> <ex>(also fig. of army, aeroplane,
building, windmill, etc.)</ex> wing; <k>aleto</k> small
wing, pinion, aileron; <k>aloza</k>, <k>alizita</k> winged; <k>aloforma</k>
aliform, wing-shaped: <k>alostroko</k> wing beat,
flap; <k>brandisar la ali</k> to clap, flap the wings.

<k>alaktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suckle, give suck
to; <k>alakt(ad)o</k> lactation, nursing; <k>alaktato</k>
nursing; cf. <k>ablaktar; alaktofratulo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
foster-brother; <k>alaktofialo:</k>, <k>alaktvazo</k> nursing
bottle; <k>alaktata porkyuno</k> sucking pig.

<k>alarmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to alarm: sound the
alarm, give signal of danger; <k>alarmo</k> cry or signal
of danger; <ex>(fig.)</ex> sense of danger, fright (cf. <k>pavoro);
 alarmema</k>, <k>alarmemo</k>, <k>alarmisto</k> alarmist; <k>alarmoklamo</k>
shout of alarm; <k>misalarmo</k> false a.; <k>sonigar
 l'alarmo</k> to sound the a.

<k>albo</k> alb. Def.: Longa, blanka robo portata da
la sacerdoto dum la meso; III-42.

<k>albumo</k> album: book for photographs,
autographs, cards, etc.

<k>albumeno</k> albumen: white of egg; <k>albumenizar</k>
<ex>(cook.)</ex> to glair.

<k>aleo</k> lane, walk, path (in a garden, park,
wood, etc., generally between rows of trees); (cf. <k>stradeto).</k>

<k>alegar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to allege, adduce,
advance (arguments, facts, etc. in order to prove or justify
something); <k>alego</k> allegation (act); <k>alegajo</k>
allegation: what is alleged. V. exp. vid. <k>citar.</k>
DEFIS

<k>alejar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. sense)</ex> to lighten,
relieve (of a load); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to alleviate, ease, relieve
(the mind, etc.). Ex.: Alejar mulo di qua la portajo esas pezoza.
Alejar navo. Alejar dento-doloro. Alejar la mento. (vid. <k>lejerigar.</k>

<k>alerta</k> alert: wide-awake, smart, brisk,
sprightly; (cf. <k>ajila</k>, <k>agema</k>, <k>aktiva).</k> EF

<k>alezar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex> to ream, bevel out, bore
smooth (inside of a cannon, steam cylinders, etc.); (cf. <k>borar)
 alezilo</k> reamer; <k>alezala diametro</k> diameter
of bore. Def.: Glatigar l'internajo di tubo, truo.

<k>algo</k> alga(e): sea-weed, kelp, dulse,
sea-lettuce, etc.; (cf. <k>fuko).</k>

<k>alio</k> garlic; <k>aliopano</k> bread
rubbed with g.; <k>alisauco</k> g. sauce.

<k>aliancar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to unite, ally
(families by marriage); <k>alianco</k> family alliance (by
marriage); <k>aliancito</k> relation by marriage; (cf. <k>misaliancar).</k>
V. exp.: Ta verbo ne esas sinonimo di mari-ajar, qua relatas nur
la gespozi; aliancar relatas lia familii; II-706. DEFIS

<k>alibio</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> alibi; <k>pledar
 alibio</k> to plead an a.

<k>alienar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to alienate: to sell,
dispose of (estates, property, rights); <k>ne alienebleso</k>
<ex>(jur.)</ex> mortmain. (cf.<k>enemikigar</k>, <k>igar
 desfavoroza).</k>Ex.: Alienar sua havaji. <k />

<k>alienacar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to be in a state of alienation
(mental derangement); <k>alienacika</k>, <k>alienaciko</k>deranged, insane
(person). <k />

<k>alimentar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to supply with what is necessary (as
water, fuel to a machine, provisions to a town, food to a family
or person); (cf. <k>nutrar</k>); <k>alimento</k> alimentation:
supply, maintenance, feeding; -<k>ala</k>, <k>alimentanta;</k> alimental:
sustaining. <k />

<k>alineo</k> (<ex>print.</ex>) a line of which the first word is
indented; a new paragraph. <k />

<k>aliteracar</k> (<ex>tr., intr.</ex>) to alliterate. Def: Komencar
(finar) per la sama sono o soni; IV-649.<k />

<k>alizeo</k> trade-wind. Def.: Vento qua suflas konstante dum la
tota yaro inter la tropiki; II-641. <k />

<k>alkalio</k>(<ex>gen. sense</ex>) alkali; <k>alkalioza</k>, <k>alkaliatra</k>
alkaline; <k>alkaliema</k> alkalescent; <k>alkaliigar</k> to alkalize
(turn into <k>a.</k>); <k>alkaliizar;</k> to add a. to; <k>alkaliozeso</k>
alkalinity. <k />

<k>alkoholo</k> alcohol; <k>alkoholoza</k>, <k>alkoholema</k>, <k>alkoholatra</k> alcoholic,
spiritous; <k>alkoholigo</k>, <k>alkoholizo</k> alcoholization; <k>alkoholismo</k>
alcoholism; <k>alkoholajo</k> spirits<k>; alkoholozeso</k> alcoholicity; <k>alkoholika</k>, <k>alkoholiko</k> (<ex>med.</ex>) alcoholic (person); <k>alkoholmacerajo</k> a.
extract. <k />

<k>almanako</k>almanac: yearly calendar with variety of
information; (<ex>fig.</ex>) year-book; <k>adres almanako</k>
directory. <k />

<k>almonar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to give alms <k>(ad ulu);</k> <k>almono</k>
alms, alms-giving; <k>almonema</k>, <k>almonoza;</k> charitable (in giving); <k>almonero</k>, <k>almonisto; almonulo</k>, <k>almonino</k> almoner; charitable person; <k>almonkesto</k>
poor-box. <k />

<k>aloo</k> aloe (plant); <k>aloligno</k> a. wood: agalochum; <k>alosuko</k>
juice of <k>a</k>. <k />

<k>alodio</k> allodium, freehold estate, fee-simple estate; (opp.
to <k>feudo</k>); <k>alodiala;</k>allodial. <k />

<k>alonge</k> along, at the side of; <k>alongirar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to
go along, skirt, coast. Ex.; Ni iris alonge (od, alongiris) la
bordo dil lago. <k />

<k>alonjo</k> lengthening piece; leaf (of telescope, table), (<ex>jur.</ex>)
allonge (of bills of exchange); Def.: Tubo quan on adjuntas ad
altra por longigar ol o por igar ol komunikar kun altra tubo o
vazo (III-134), anke uzata por (la prolonguro di) la tabli e
trati; VII-197. <k />

<k>alopecio</k> (<ex>med.</ex>) alopecia: loss of hair, baldness;
(cf. kalva, sen-hara, senpila). <k />

<k>alloyar</k> (<k>tr.</k>) to alloy; combine metals by fusion; <k>alloyo</k>, <k>alloyuro</k> alloy (of metals); (<ex>fig.</ex>) any impure mixture;
quality (of things in general); <k>bon alloya</k>good quality,
blue-blooded (of per-sons), high standard of quality (of things).
Ex.: Bronzo esas aloyuro. (<ex>fig.</ex>) Esas poka vertui sen
kelka aloyeso. <k />

<k>alta</k>high, tall, lofty (also used with pressure, sound); <k>altajo</k>
a high object, a height; <k>altulo</k> a tall man; <k>alteso</k>
highness; <k>altigar</k>to make higher, raise;<k>alteskar</k> to
rise, get higher; <k>altareliefo</k><ex>(art.)</ex> high relief; <k>alta
 grada</k>, <k>alto</k> of high degree, high grade; <k>minimalteso (di
 aquo)</k>low-water mark; <k>ica chambro esas alta de dek e kin
 pedi</k>this room is 15ft. high. V. exp.: <k>alta</k>, <k>basa; suba</k>, <k>supera; infra</k>, <k>supra; sura; inferiora</k>, <k>superiora: Alta e basa</k>expresas
dimensiono. Ex.: La supra etajo esas basa e la infra etajo esas
alta (E. the uppermost story is low and the lowermost story is
high). Anke en la tekniko, on parolas pri vaporo ye alta (basa)
preso, od en la muziko, pri alta o basa noto, sono. <k>Suba e
 supera</k> havas senco relativa ed indikas nur situeso o
direciono relate determinita punto, t.e. nivelo plu a min alta.
Exemple, konsiderante domo kun sis etaji, e parolante de la
vidpunto di ta, qua lojas sur la triesma, la supera etaji esas la
4ª, 5ª, 6ª; la suba etaji esas la 2ª, la 1ª e la ter-etajo. <k>Supra
 ed infra</k> havas senco absoluta, ed indikas loki o parti en
determinita objekto. Según la supera exemplo, la supra etajo
esas la 6ª, la infra esas la ter-etajo. <k>Sura</k> relatas ulo
supera e kontakte kun ulo, do la sura etajo esas nur la 4ª. On
uzas prefere la<k>suprajo</k>, <k />la<k>infrajo</k>por indikar
la materiala parto di l’objekto, e la <k>supro</k> e la <k>infro</k>
por indikar la geometrial extremajo o surfaco. Ex.: la supro di
la komodo esas horizontal; la suprajo de la komodo esas marmora
(od: ek marmoro). En citado, on dicas: Videz supere (E. look
(anywhere) above) o videz supre (E. look at the top); videz sube
(E. see below) o videz infre (E. see at the bottom). On uzas <k>superiora</k>, <k>inferiora</k> en la sociologiala e ekonomikala senco por indikar
ta qua esas rispektive super o sub ulu per la povo ed autoritato;
II-163, 664; III-411. Ant.: <k>basa.</k> <k />

<k>alterar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to alter; modify the nature or quality
of anything (generally for the worse); <k>altero</k>, <k>altereso</k>
alteration; adulteration, deterioration; <k>alterebleso</k>
alterability. <k>Kelka veneni alteras la kompozeso di la sango</k>
some poisons alter (change) the composition of the blood. <k>Alterar
 la beleso</k>to spoil beauty. <k>Alterar moneti</k>to debase
coins; <k>alterar linguo</k>to corrupt a language. Def.:
Chanjar la naturo o qualeso di kozo (generale a min bona);
VII-203. <k />

<k>alternar</k><ex>(intr.)</ex> to alternate, take turns; <k>alternigar</k>to cause to a.; <k>altern(ad)o</k>alternation, succession; <k>alternanta</k>alternating (movement, crop, etc.) <k>alternigar la kultivo</k>to
vary, rotate the crops. Ex.: La sezoni alternas. <k />

<k>alternativo</k>alternative, choice, option. Def.: Posibleso di
selekto inter plura kozi, hipotezi. <k />

<k>altitudo</k> altitude; <k>ye altitudo de</k>at an a. of. Def.:
Alteso di loko relate la mar-nivelo. <k />

<k>altra</k>other, another; <k>altro</k>, <k>altrajo</k>another thing,
something else; <k>altru</k>another person; <k>altri</k>others; <k>altre</k>otherwise; <k>altre</k>, <k>altranome</k><ex>(leg.) </ex>alias; <k>altrigar</k>to alter; (cf. <k>alterar</k>); <k>altraloke</k>elsewhere; <k>altratempe</k>at another time; <k>altramaniere</k> in another manner or way;
<k>altrube</k>elsewhere, somewhere else; <k>altravorte</k> in other
words or terms; <k>l’una</k>, <k>l’altra</k>one another,
each other. <k />

<k>aludar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to allude to, have reference to,
refer to; <k>aludo</k>allusion; <k>aludanta</k>, <k>aludiva</k>
allusive, suggestive. <k />

<k>aluro</k> gait, pace. Def.: Maniero mar-char;
IV-234.

<k>alveolo</k> honey-comb cell; alveolus:
tooth-socket; <k>alveolala</k>, <k>alveolatra</k> alveolar; <k>alveoloza</k>
alveolated.

<k>amar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to love: to like (very
much), care for, have affection for, cherish; (cf. <k>amorar</k>, <k>prizar</k>, <k>afecionar); amo</k> love; <k>amado</k>
loving; <k>amanto</k> lover; <k>amata</k>, <k>ato</k>
beloved; <k>amegata</k> darling; <k>amanta</k>, <k>amoza</k>, <k>amema</k> loving; <k>aminda</k> worthy of l.,
loveable; kind;<k>amindeso</k> lovableness; kindness;
<k>pro amo a Deo</k> for the love of God, for God's
sake.

<k>amalgamo</k> <ex>(metal and fig.)</ex> amalgam; <k>amalgamigar</k>
to amalgamate; <k>amalgamigo</k> amalgamation.

<k>amansar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to tame, make docile
(animals), to make tractable, sociable (persons); <k>amansesar</k>
to be t.; <k>amans(ad)o:</k>, <k>amanseso</k> taming (act); docility
(state); <k>amansebla</k> tamable. Def.: Igar la animalo
min sovaja; <ex>(fig.)</ex> igar persono plu sociema. Ex.:
Amansar leono, urso. Il esas homulo di humoro sovaja; on ne povas
amansar il. V. exp. vid. <k>domtar.</k>

<k>amaro</k> mooring-cable, hawser; lashing (as for a
gun, etc.); <k>amaragar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to moor (by
cable), to belay, make fast; <k>amarago</k> mooring
(act).

<k>amaso</k> mass, heap, pile; <k>amasigar</k>
to heap up, hoard up, amass; <k>amaseskar</k> to get
together, crowd; <k>amasigo</k> piling up or together; <k>amasiganto</k>
stacker.

<k>amatoro</k> amateur; <k>kolomb amatoro</k>
pigeon fancier; <k>sport amatoro</k> sportsman; <k>amatoroteatro</k>
theater run by a.s.

<k>ambajo</k>, <k>ambaji</k> ambage(s): circumlocution, beaing
around the bush.

<k>ambiciar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to be ambitious of, to
aspire to; <k>ambicio</k> ambition; <k>ambicioza</k>, <k>ambiciozo</k>
ambitious (person); <k>ambiciar la mastreso</k> to aspire
to (aim at) the mastery.

<k>ambiguo</k> ambiguous, equivocal (cf. <k>dusenca</k>, <k>plursenca); ambigueso</k> ambiguousness; <k>ambiguajo</k>
an ambiguity. Ant.: <k>unasenca</k>, <k>klara.</k>

<k>ambulanco</k> ambulance: field hospital following
an army; <k>ambulancisto</k> a. attendant; <k>furgon
 ambulanco</k> ambulance (vehicle).

<k>amiko</k> friend; <k>amika</k>, <k>amikala</k>
friendly, amicable; <k>amikeso</k> friendship,
friendliness, amity; <k>amikalajo</k> friendly act; <k>amikeskar
 kun ulu</k> to become friendly with some one; <k>Francamanto</k>, <k>amikamiko</k> Francophile. Ant.: <k>enemiko.</k>

<k>amilo</k> starch: <ex>(chem.)</ex> amylaceous
substance in plants; <ex>(gen.)</ex> fecula used to stiffen
linen; (cf. <k>starchivo); amilizar</k> to starch: put
starch on (cf. <k>starchar); amiliferio</k> s. works; <k>amilatra</k>
amylaceous, starchlike.

<k>amnestiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to grant a general
pardon; <k>amnestio</k> amnesty.

<k>amneziar*</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have amnesia; <k>amnezio</k>
amnesia: loss of memory; <k>amneziifanta</k> amnestic.

<k>amorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to love (as man or
woman); <k>amoro</k> love: expresses not merely the
sexual relation but also the sentiment between sexes; <k>amoregar</k>
to adore; <k>igar amorar</k> to make fall in love, cause
to love; <k>amoreskar</k> to become enamored, smitten; <k>amoranta</k>, <k>amoroza</k>, <k>amorema</k> loving amorous, enamoured; <k>amoranto</k>, <k>amoroz(ul)o</k> lover, wooer, sweetheart; <k>amoreto</k>
petty love affair, intrigue, amour; <k>amoregata</k>, <k>amorato</k>
well-beloved, darling; <k>amoristulo</k> ladies' man,
gallant; <k>amoremino</k> flirt; <k>amoremulo</k>
woman chaster; <k>amoristino</k>, <k>amorvendistino</k>
courtesan; <k>amordeklaro</k> declaration of love; <k>amorletro</k>
love letter; <k>amorkurtezado</k> courtship; <k>amordeo</k>
<ex>(myth.)</ex> god of love, Cupid. Def.: Expresas specale l'amo
di la sexui, ne kom relato sexuala e pure korpala, ma kom specala
sentimento; VI-322.

<k>amorcar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to start a thing off,
set going (an instrument or a force); to prime (a gun); to fetch
(a pump); <k>amorcilo</k> <ex>(of firearms)</ex> primer.

<k>amortisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to weaken, deaden,
break, (the force of a stream, a blow, a fall or shock); to calm
(passions); to abate (inflammation); to blunt the feelings; to
tone down, soften (colors); <ex>(fin.)</ex> to pay, liquidate (a
debt), to redeem (an annunity); <ex>(jur.)</ex> to amortize: to
sell in mortmain; <ex>(cook.)</ex> to make (meat) tender by
long-keeping; <k>amortis(ad)o</k> deadening; liquidation,
amortization; <k>amortisuro</k>, <k>amortisajo</k>, <k>amortispekunio</k> <ex>(fin.)</ex>
sinking-fund; <k>amortisebla</k> redeemable; <k>amortisita
 kuglo</k> spent bullet; <k>amortisilo</k> extinguisher
(for charcoal, etc.). Def.: Igar ulo min violent-oza; febl-igar;
extingar debajo per pagar la kapitalo; igar plu mola.

<k>ampla</k> ample: (of space) spacious; <ex>(of
garments)</ex> full, easy; <ex>(of supplies)</ex> abundant; <ex>(of
reward)</ex> liberal, etc.; <k>ampleso</k> amplitude; <k>ampligar</k>
to amplify; <k>ampligo</k> amplification. V. exp.:
Expresas relato inter du kozi de diversa speci, maxim ofte la
relato di kontenanto e kontenajo. "Ampla" no-mizesas
mantelo, qua fitas tre laxe la portanto, chambro od agro ube
granda kunveno devas eventar; provizuro qua satisfacas la demandi
esas "ampla", stato qua havas granda mar-komerco mustas
havar "ampla" floto; IV-596. Ant.: <k>streta.</k>

<k>ampulo</k> ampulla: a bellied phial, glass bulb; <ex>(med.)</ex>
a blister (on feet as from walking, or on hands from rowing).

<k>amputar</k> <ex>(tr., surg. and fig.)</ex> to
amputate, cut off.

<k>amuzar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to amuse, entertain; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to distract, divert (cf.<k>distraktar); amuzar su; amuzesar</k>
to a. oneself <k>(per</k>, <k>pri)</k>, <k /> to be amused <k>(da);
 amuz(ad)o</k> amusement (act): <k>amuzivo:</k>, <k>ilo</k>
that which amuses: plaything, toy; <k>amuzanta</k>, <k>amuziva</k>
amusing; <k>amuzanto</k>, <k>amuzero</k>, <k>emo</k>entertainer; <k>amuzachar
 su</k> to trifle away one's time.

<k>an</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> at, on (indicates
contiguity, juxtaposition); <k>dorso an dorso</k> back
to back. Def.: Expresas relato di kontigueso, di apud-pozeso
IV-409. Ex.: Apogar skalo an muro. Pendar pikturi an la parieto.
Glutinar afisho an muro. Pendar chapelo an hoko. Sidar, sideskar
an tablo. An la bordo (rivo) di la fluvio. Ula urbo jacas an
rivero, an maro, an monto. Ta domo esas situita an la strado X .
. . La fenestri an la strado esas granda; ma la fenestri an la
korto esas mikra; IV-409.

<k>anado</k> <ex>(orni.)</ex> duck (family:
Anatidae); <k>anadulo</k> drake; <k>anadino</k>
female d.; <k>anadyuno</k> duckling; <k>anado nigra</k>
black d. (Anas nigra); <k>anadlageto</k> d. pond.; <k>anadembuskeyo</k>
d. ambuscade; <k>anadfusilo</k> d. gun.

<k>anakronismo</k> anachronism: error in chronology;
something incongruous in time.

<k>analgeziar*</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lull the
sensibilities, produce insensibility to pain; <k>analgezio</k>
analgesia.

<k>analitiko</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> analytics; <k>analitikala</k>
analytic(al). Ex.: Lingui, geometrio analitikala.

<k>analizar</k> <ex>(tr., log., chem.)</ex> to
analize; <k>analizo</k> analysis; <k>analizala</k>
analytical. Ant.: <k>sintezo.</k>

<k>analoga</k> analogous, similar; <k>analogeso</k>
(relation, quality) analogy; <k>analogajo</k> something
analogous. Es.: Rezonado analoga. La linguo Italiana havas multa
analogeso a la linguo Latina. An.: <k>nesimila.</k>

<k>anciena</k> ancient, old; <k>ancieneso</k>
oldness, ancientness; <k>ancienajo</k> something old. V.
exp.: <k>anciena</k>, <k>nova; yuna</k>, <k>olda; antiqua: anciena</k>, <k>nova</k>
relatas prefere la kozi; <k>yuna</k>, <k>olda</k> relatas
precipue l'evo, ma on darfas parolar pri homo anciena o nova en
lua profesiono, en ofico o funciono. Ex.: Persono qua esas yuna
(per evo) ma anciena en ofico (t.e. homo qua havas
"ancieneso" en ula ofico, kontraste ad oficisto qua ne
tam longe okupas sua ofico quale l'altru. <k>Antiqua</k>
koncernas exkluzive l'epoko, t.e. la <k>antea</k>
yarcenti, e plu precize la tempi di la Greki e Romani. Domo,
moblo, vesto povas esar anciena, e tote ne esar antiqua. O se on
qualifikas oli "antiqua," to esas nur per jokoza or
ironioza hiperbolo; III-225. Ant.: <k>nova.</k>

<k>anemio*</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> anemia, anaemia; <k>anemiala</k>
(relating to disease) anemic; <k>anemiika</k>, <k>iko</k> anemic
(person); <k>anemiigar</k> to render anemic.

<k>anesteziar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to anesthetize (as
by ether or chloroform); <k>anestezio</k> anesthetizing
(act); <k>anestezieso</k> anesthesia (state); <k>anesteziiva</k>, <k>ivo</k> anesthetic.

<k>anexar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to annex; <k>anexo</k>, <k>anexeso</k> annexation; <k>anexajo</k> an annex: <k>anexita</k>
annexed.

<k>angelo</k> fish-hook; <k>angelagar</k>, <k>angelkaptar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to hook; <k>angelizar</k> to put a hook on.
(cf. <k>peskar</k>).

<k>Angla</k> English; <k>Angl(ul)o</k>, <k>Anglano</k>
English-man; <k>Anglaparolanto</k> one who speaks
English; <k>Anglia</k> England; <k>Anglatra</k>, <k>Anglamode</k>
in the English fashion: <k>Anglomaniika</k>, <k>iko</k>
anglomaniac, <k>Anglago</k> E. idiotism, anglicism; <k>Angloodio</k>
anglophobia; <k>Angloodianta</k>, <k>Anglanto</k> anglophobe
(person); <k>la Angla</k> the English language.

<k>angorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in anguish; <k>angorigar</k>
to cause a. to, to agonize; <k>angoro</k> anguish: pang,
agony, violent pain (of body or mind); <k>angoriganta</k>
agonizing; <k>angoroza</k> full of a. V. exp.: vid. <k>pavorar.</k>

<k>angulo</k> angle, corner; <k>anguleto</k>
small angle, nook; <k>angulala</k> angular, corner; <k>anguloza</k>
many cornered, angulated; <k>angulo akuta</k> acute
angled; <k>angulo faciala</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> facial a.; <k>ort
 angula</k> right-angled; <k>angulo obtuza</k> obtuse a.;
<k>angulopetro</k> corner-stone; <k>angulopeco</k>
corner-piece; <k>angulfaldar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fold
the corners of <k>(ulo); angulmoblo</k> corner-piece
(furniture); <k>angulruptar</k> to break the corners off <k>(ulo).</k>

<k>anhelar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to pant, gasp for
breath; <k>anheligar</k> to put out of breath, to wind; <k>anhel(ad)o</k>
panting; <ex>(med.)</ex> anhelation. Ex.: Ca hundo anhelas. Lu
arivis anhelegante, tante rapide lu esis kurinta. Me anheligis
me, acensante ta eskalero.

<k>animar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to animate: endow with
life; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to enliven, give animation to; <k>animo</k>, <k>animeso</k> animation; <k>animata</k>, <k>animoza</k> animated.
Ex.: La anmo animas la korpo. La konversado esis animoza.

<k>animalo</k> animal; <k>animalala</k> animal;
<k>animaleto (mikroskopala)</k> animalcule; <k>animaleso</k>
animality; <k>animalaro</k> group of a.s; kingdom, fauna.

<k>anke</k> <ex>(adv., conj.)</ex> also; <k>me
 anke ne</k> (od, <k>anka me ne)</k> I neither; <k>ma
 anke</k> but also, but yet. Ex.: La lakto esas plu salubra
kam la biro ol esas anke plu nutriva.

<k>ankilosar</k> <ex>(tr., surg.)</ex> to anchylose:
make stiff; <k>ankilosesar</k> to be to become anchylosed; <k>ankiloso</k>, <k>ankiloseso</k> ankylosis, anchylosis.

<k>ankore</k> <ex>(adv., conj.)</ex> yet, still, until
now, until then (refers to a fact or act already existing); <k>lu
 ankore ne arivas</k> he has not yet arrived; <k>kad vu
 ankore hungras?</k> are you still hungry. V.exp.: <k>Ankore
 ja: Ankore</k> signifikas duro di ago o stando plu longa, e <k>ja</k>
komenco di fakto od ago plu frua kam on opinionis; III-335.

<k>ankroo</k> anchor; <k>ankroojetar</k>, <k>ankroagar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to anchor; <k>ankroago</k> anchoring; <k>ankroesaragita</k>
to be at anchor; <k>ankroageyo</k> anchorage; <k>ankrootrabo</k>
<ex>(nav.)</ex> cat-head; <k>ankrooboyo</k> a.-bouy; <k>driftar
 sur sua ankri</k> to drag one's anchors.

<k>anmo</k> soul (cf. <k>psiko); anmizar</k>
to put soul into, to hearten; <k>anmoza</k> soulful,
with spirit; <k>sen anma</k> without soul, inanimate; <k>kantar
 kun anmo</k> to sing with spirit. Def.: L'ento metafizikala,
la principo di vivo e di penso; V-32.

<k>anso</k> handle: the arc shaped handle of a cup,
bucket, etc.

<k>ante</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> before (of time); <k>antea</k>
preceding, former, previous, last, prior; <k>antee</k>
previously, before, heretofore; <k>anteeso</k>
anteriority, priority; <k>anteke</k> before (that); <k>lu
 arivis ante me</k> he arrived before me; <k>ante du
 kloki</k> before two o'clock; <k>ante nelonge</k>
not long ago; <k>ante nun</k> before now; <k>antediluvia</k>
antediluvian; <k>antehiere</k> the day before yesterday; <k>antelasta</k>
(the one) before last; <k>antemariaja</k> antenuptial; <k>antemortar</k>
to predecease: die first; <k>anteprelasta</k>
antepenultimate. Ant.: <k>pos.</k>

<k>antecedento</k> <ex>(gram., log., math.)</ex>
antecedent. Ex.: La antecedenti di individuo, t.e. lua antea
historio e konduto.

<k>anti</k> contra (use generally as a prefix with
scientific words) (cf. <k>kontre) antibakteria</k>
bactericide.

<k>anticipar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex> to anticipate; <k>anticipo</k>, <k>anticipeso</k> anticipation; <k>anticipe</k> in
anticipation; <k>anticipala pago</k> advance payment.

<k>antidoto</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> antidote. Def.:
Substanco qua neutrigas l'efekti di la veneni; IV-76.

<k>antifrazo</k> antiphrasis. Def.: Figuro di
retoriko, qua konsistas en uzar ula vorto o frazo en senco
kontrea a lua vera signifiko.

<k>antipatiar</k> (<ex>tr:</ex>) to have an antipathy, aversion to

L'anjelo     di la skolo (vice Santa Thomas).

<k>anuncar</k> (<ex>tr.</ex>) to announce; <k>anunco</k>, <k>anuncajo</k> (<ex>act;

<k>apanajo</k> appanage: royal grant of domain or allowance; <k>apanajizar</k>
to endow with an a.

<k>aparar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to appear (to or before: <k>aparo</k>, <k>aparajo</k> appearance (act); <k>ad</k>, <k>avan ulu</k>); to become

to; apparition (thing visible); to put in an appearance, <k>aparanta</k>
apparent, plain, obvious, ostensible, specious; <k>aparar por la
 formo</k> show oneself; <k>fantom aparo</k> apparition (ghost)
Ant: <k>Desaparar.</k>

<k>aparato</k> (<ex>tech., surg</ex>.) apparatus; machine,
instrument or appliance used to perform a certain operation.

<k>aparta</k> apart: separately, aside, alone; <k>aparta paroli</k>
words spoken aside. Def.: Signifikas quaze separita, izolita,
sola; VII-154. Ex.: Aparta parolo (en teatro od en vivo); aparta
lernado (lernar aparte, t.e. sole e sen docanto); prenar ulu
aparte (por parolar a lu specale, exter e for la ceteri). Lu
dormas en aparta chambro (ne en la komuna dormeyo). Lu manjas an
aparta tablo (ne an la   komuna tablo).

<k>apartenar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex>) to appertain, pertain; belong
to by right, nature or custom; <k>apartenajo</k> appurtenance. Ex.:
Algeria apartenas a Francia. Il apar tenas a bona familio. Domo e
lua apartenaji.

<k>apatio</k> apathy: want of feeling, indifference:
(cf. <k>indiferenteso); apatioza</k> apathetic,
impassive. Ant.: <k>animozeso</k>, <k>vivemeso.</k>

<k>apelar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to appeal (in law); <ex>(fig.)</ex>

 apelo</k> to lodge an a.; <k>asignar apelo</k> To
give notice of a. (pri). Ex.: Me apelas a vu por regulo di ca
questiono; apelar pri un judicio o tribunalo ad altra.

<k>apendico</k> <ex>(lit., anat., zool., bot.)</ex>
appendix; <k>apendico vermatra</k>, <k>apendicoforma</k> vermiform a.
Def.: Parto qua servas kom prolonguro di parto precipua.

<k>apene</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> hardly, scarcely, barely.
Ex.: Il apene arivis. Il apene eskapis la morto.

<k>apertar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to open, unclose (also

aperient, laxative; <k>mi apertar</k> to half open (a

<k>apetitar</k> <ex>(tr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to have

appetite, longing; <k>apetitigiva</k>, <k>apetitivo</k> appetizing,
appetizer; <k>apetitigar</k> to give or cause an a. for; <k>apetitiganta</k>
appetizing, relishing. Ex.: La stomako apetitas la nutrivi.
Apetito sensual, karnal, perversa. Il havas nesaturebla apetito
por richaji. Ant.: <k>saturar.</k>

<k>aplastar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to crush, squeeze,
squash (soft objects); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to overwhelm, overburnden,
oppress; <k>rul aplastilo</k> (a steam or other) roller
(as on streets). Ex.: Aplastar insekto per la pedo, vit-beri per
presilo. Aplastita per laborego. Aplastar adverso en diskuto. V.
exp.: On povas <k>presegar</k> stala bulo sen <k>aplastar</k>
ol, kontre ke on aplastas argilo sen presegar; III-198.

<k>aplaudar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to applaud, clap; <ex>(fig.)</ex>

plaudits; <k>aplaudanto</k>, <k>aplaudero</k> applauder; <k>aplaudistaro</k>
claque (paid clappers at theater).

<k>aplikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to apply, lay on,

applying; <k>aplikajo</k> thing applied; <k>aplikebla</k>
applicable, apposite, suitable. Def.: Pozar ulo sur ulo.

<k>aplombo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> assurance,

plummet, plumb-line; <k>aplomba</k> upright, plumb,

<k>apogar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to prop (up), stay,
support; to lean, to rest; to base, found, ground (assertions,

brace; <k>apogarko</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> flying buttress; <ex>(fig.)</ex>

 apogilo</k> head-support; <k>apogar skalo an la muro</k>

 per apogarki</k> to support a building by buttresses; <k>me
 apogis me an la muro</k> I leaned against the wall: <k>apogar
 sua manui sur tablo</k> to lean one's hands on a table;<k>sur quo vu apogas vua aserti</k>on what do you base your
assertions? Def.: Suportar (o, igar suportar) per lateral od

apogilo.

<k>apologiar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex> to vindicate (in writing or

<k>archo</k> (Noah's) ark; <k>archo di kontrato</k>

iro e riveno) por kuri o por turniri, II-646.

<k>arestar</k> (<ex>tr., legal</ex>) to arrest: make

-<k>o</k>, <k>aresteso</k> a.; custody; <k>arestanto</k>, <k>arestero</k>

<k>argilo</k> argil; clay, potter's earth; -<k>a</k>, <k>argiloza</k>, <k>argilatra</k> argillaceous, clayish; -<k>izar</k>

<k>argumentaar;</k>(<ex>intr.</ex>) to argue: hold an

<k>arida</k> arid: dry and barren; (cf. <k>sterila</k>);
<k>arideso</k> aridity, Ant: <k>humida</k>, <k /> <k>fruktoza</k>, <k>fertila.</k>

<k>arieto</k> (<ex>instr. of war and tech</ex>.)

 arieto</k>hydraulic ram.

<k>arjenta</k>, <k>arjento</k>silver; <k>arjentizar</k> to

cienci›› ne esas simple sekreta cienci ma la cienci qui

Armed from head to feet; <k>trupo armizita</k> armed

<k>armaturo</k> <ex>(elec.)</ex> armature; <ex>(tech.)</ex>
iron braces, stays (to strengthen masonry, etc.); <k>kabl
 armaturo</k> wire covering about a cable; <k>armaturizita cemento</k>
reinforced cement. <k />

<k>armeo</k> army; <k>armeo de triadek mil viri</k>
a. of 30,000 men; <k>armechefo</k>, <k>armeestro</k> head of the
a., general; <k>armekorpo</k> a. corps; <ex>(fig.)</ex> <k>cielal
 arme o</k> celestial a.; <k>reserv armeo</k> a. in
reserve.

<k>armoro</k> cupboard; <k>armoreto</k>
cabinet; <k>fer armoro</k> iron chest, strong-box; <k>glaci
 armoro</k> ice-box; <k>linj armoro</k> linen press; <k>mur
 armoro</k> c. in a wall; <k>nutriv</k>, <k>paramush armoro</k>
pantry; screened c.; <k>vest armoro</k> wardrobe; <k>plad
 armoro</k> dish-closet.

<k>arogar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to arrogate <k>(ulo
 a su)</k> to make undue claims; <k>arogema</k>, <k>aroganta</k>
arrogant, overbearing, supercilious, haughty. Ex.: Il arogas a su
autoritato sen havar la yuro.

<k>aroruto</k> arrowroot: starchy flour of Maranta
arundinatea and other plants.

<k>arozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to moisten, wet, water
(with any liquid); <k>arozilo</k> watering-pot; <k>arozventuro</k>
sprinkling cart; V. exp.: <k>aquizar</k>, <k>aspersar</k>, <k>irgacar</k>
On povas arozar materiale o figurale, per mult altra liquidi kam
aquo. La biblo dicas, ke Noa ‹‹arozis›› la
vito sucedante per sango di pavono, per sango di simio, per sango
di leono e per sango di porko. Do on ne povas uzar
‹‹aquizar››. On <k>aspersas</k>
planti ed arbori por preventar ula morbo. <k>Asperso</k>
relatas saneso. <k>Irigaco</k> esas brancho di
agrokultivado. Ol aquizas tota farmi, distrikti per fluigar aquo
de riveri, lagi, e.c., en artificala kanali a la kultivo-loki;
IV-353, 459.

<k>arto</k> art: practical skill guided by rules;
occupation requiring such skill; <k>artisto</k> artist
(in fine arts), adept (at anything); <k>artala</k>
artistic: (relating to arts); <k>artistala</k> relating
to the artist; <k>artaleso</k> artistic quality or
character (of a thing); <k>arte</k>, <k>artoze</k> artfully,
skillfully, cunningly; <k>artema</k> artistic (person); <k>artistino</k>
female artist; <k>arti bela</k> (the) fine arts; <k>artoverko</k>
work of art; <k>arti societala</k> social
accomplishments; <k>arti liberal</k>, <k>mekanikal</k> the
liberal, mechanical arts or professions; <k>poezi arto</k>
the poetic art; <k>akush arto</k> abstetrics (as a
profession); <k>arti utila</k> useful arts; <k>skribarto</k>
the art of writing. Def.: Aplik(ad)o di konoci por realigar
koncepto.

<k>artifico</k> artifice: artful or ingenious
expedient; <k>artificala</k> artificial; (cf. <k>falsa):
 artificacho</k> (in a bad sense) cunning, craft, wile, trick; <k>artific(ach)oza</k>
artful, crafty, factitious; <k>sen artifica</k> frank. Ex.:
Artificala dentaro, gambo, rido. La artifico qua movigas
automato.

<k>artiko</k> <ex>(anat., bot.)</ex> articulation:
joint; <k>artikala</k> articular; <k>artikizar</k>
to articulate: supply with a.s; <k>artikoza</k>, <k>artikizita</k>
articulated, jointed; <k>bul artiko</k> arthrodia; <k>artiko
 inter la kruro e la hancho</k> the a. of the thigh with the
hip: the hip-joint; <k>des artikizar</k> to unjoint.

<k>artiklo</k> <ex>(newspaper, gram.)</ex> article;
(cf. <k>varo</k>, <k>komercajo); artiklo redaktistal</k>
editorial; <k>kred artiklo</k> a. of faith; <k>definita
 artiklo</k> definite a.

<k>artikular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to articulate:
pronounce, utter words; <k>ne artikulita</k> inarticulate.

<k>artilrio</k> artillery: body of troops; (cf. <k>kanonaro);
 artilriano</k> a. man, gunner; <k>ped artilrio</k> foot a.

<k>artro</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> part or segment of a
limb or body; movable articulation. Ex.: La korpi di kelka
insekti havas multa artri.

<k>arufar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to ruffle up, turn back
(feathers, hair); <k>karezar kato arufe</k> to stroke
a cat the wrong way.

<k>aso</k> ace <ex>(cards, dice);</ex> <k>kordi
 aso</k> ace of hearts.

<k>asafetido</k> asafetida: gum resin of Ferula
Asafoetida.

<k>asaltar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assault, storm (a
fortified place); to assault, charge (the enemy); <k>asaltanto</k>, <k>asaltero</k> assailant aggressor; <k>ek asaltar</k> to
make a sally, sortie; <k>ri asaltar</k> to charge again; <k>asaltar
 quik l'obstaklo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to take the bull by the
horns; <k>sonigar por asalto</k> to sound the charge; <k>asaltoskalo</k>
scaling-ladder; <k>ne asaltebla</k> unassailable,
impregnable; <k>asalte kaptar</k>, <k>konquestar</k> to carry by
assault, (cf. <k>atakar</k>, <k>asomar</k>, <k>atentar).</k>

<k>asasinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assassinate. Def.:
Mortigar kun preintenco ed embuske o surprize; III-698.

<k>asekurar</k> <ex>(tr., finan.)</ex> to insure,
underwrite (against loss); <k>asekurar su</k> to insure
oneself; <k>asekurito</k> insured person; <k>asekuristo</k>
insurer, underwriter; <k>asekurar pluse</k>, <k>pose</k> to take
out additional i.; <k>asekuroakto</k>, <k>asekurkontrato</k> i.
policy; <k>asekurokontoro</k> i. office; <k>asekurotaxo</k>
premium (paid by insured to insurer).

<k>asemblar</k> <ex>(tr., gen.)</ex> to assemble:
collect, bring together (people, materials, etc.); <k>asemblo</k>, <k>asembluro</k>, <k>asemblajo</k> assembl-y, -age; <k>asemblo publika</k>, <k>politikala</k> public, political meeting. V. exp.: vid. <k>muntar.</k>

<k>asentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give assent to:
agree to, aquiesce in. Ex.: Me asentas vua judiko (t.e. me
opinionas same, me judikas to kom vera. V. exp.: <k>Asento</k>
koncernas opinioni pure teoriala; <k>konsentar</k>
relatas prefere opinioni praktikala, t.e. propozi e rezolvi;
VII-98.

<k>asepta</k> aseptic; <k>asepteso</k>
asepticism (state); <k>aseptigar</k> to asepticize; <k>aseptig(ad)o</k>
asepsis (act). Def.: Qua ne havas mikrobi; IV-175.

<k>asertar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assert, allege, set
forth, protest (declare); <k>asertita</k> pretended,
asserted, so-called; <k>asertar la falseso di</k> to deny
in toto; <k>asertar per sua honoro</k> to a. upon his
honor, give his word of honor; <k>aserto pri fideleso</k>
protestation of fidelity; <k>asertita inventuro</k>
so-called invention; <k>esar asertita absenta</k> to be
reputed (regarded, considered) as absent.

<k>asfalto</k> asphalt(um); <k>asfaltisar</k>
to asphalt; <k>asfalta</k>, <k>asfaltizita choseo</k> asphalted road.

<k>asfixiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to asphyxiate; <k>asfixiesar
 (da)</k> to be a.ed (by); <k>asfixio</k>, <k>asfixieso</k>
asphyxiation (act, state); <k>asfixiita</k> a.ed. V. exp.: <k>Sufokar</k>
esas la vulgara, <k>asfixiar</k> la ciencala vorto. <k>Asfixiar</k>
esas la halto dil arterio-pulsado. Ol esas stando sucedanta al
neperfekta oxigenizo dil sango, finanta per la morto, kande lu
tro duras. <k>Sufoko</k> esas speco de asfixio, per
obstaklo al adveno dil areo til pulmoni, obstruktado di naztrui,
di boko, kompreso di kolo, e.c.; II

<k>asidua</k> assiduous: constant, regular (in
attendance or work). V. exp.: <k>Diligenta</k> relatas
la fervoro od agemeso, ed <k>asidua</k> la akurata e
reguloza prezenteso, la kontinueso di laboro; II<k />

<k>asignar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assign, to
appropriate, allot, set apart (a sum), to fix, appoint (a day,
place, rank), <ex>(fig., legal)</ex> to summons, cite, subpoena;
(cf.<k>atribuar</k>, <k>cedar</k>); <k>asignoletro</k>
<ex>(jur.)</ex> subpoena, writ, summons. Ex.: La ministraro
asignas sumo por pagar salarii. Asignar dio por pagar debajo, la
limiti (di ulo), a singlu lua rango, lua tasko.

<k>asimilar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assimilate <ex>(physiol.
and fig.).</ex> Ex.: La animali povas asimilar nur animala o
vejetala substanci. Usa asimilas multa populi.

<k>asistar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to be present at,
attend; <k>asisto</k> attendance, presence; <k>asistanto</k>, <k>asistero</k> person present, onlooker, bystander (<ex>not</ex>
helper; cf. <k>helpanto</k>); <k>asistantaro</k>
audience, congregation; Ex.: On asistas spektaklo, acidento,
disputo. Il ne nur asistis, ma parto-prenis ta diskuto. La
diskurso esis asistata da multa personi, qui ofte aplaudis ol.

<k>asketo</k>, <k>asketala</k> ascetic; <k>asketeso</k>, <k>asketismo</k>
<ex>(state, doctrine)</ex> asceticism; <k>asketaji</k> a.
acts, austerities.

<k>askoltar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to listen to, hearken
to, give ear to; <k>askoltanto</k>, <k>askoltero</k> listener. V. exp.:
<k>Askoltar</k> implikas sempre intenco e volo. <k>Audar</k>
esas perceptar per l'orelo, vole o nevole. Ex.: Me askoltas vu ma
me ne audas pro la bruiso; V

<k>asno</k> donkey, ass; <k>asnulo</k>
jackass; <k>asnino</k> she-ass; <k>asnalajo</k>
asinity; stupidity, silly blunder; <k>asnacho</k> stupid
ass; <k>asnetyuno</k> ass's colt; <k>asnoreli</k>
ass's ears; <k>asnokargajo</k> load of an ass; <k>asnoduktisto</k>
donkey driver; <k>asnobramo</k> bray of an ass; <k>pedfrapo
 di asno</k> kick of an ass.

<k>asociar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make (a person)
one's associate, partner, colleague, companion, accomplice (in an
ill sense); to make <k>(ulu)</k> participate or share
in <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>asocio</k>, <k>asociuro</k>
association, partnership; <k>asociito</k> associate,
fellow, companion; <k>asociitaro</k> an association,
society (persons) <k>asociema</k> sociable; <k>asociemeso</k>
sociability; <k>asociado di idei</k> a. of ideas.

<k>asomar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fell, to knock down:
to knock on the head; <k>asomisto</k>, <k>asomero</k> feller (of
oxen); <k>asomilo</k> loaded bludgeon. V. exp.: On povas
asomar per mazo o sen instrumento (ex. per pugnobato);
II

<k>asortar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assort, match, suit,
sort out, classify things alike, or somewhat alike, or suited to
each other; <k>asort(ad)o</k>, <k>asortajo</k> assortment; <k>asorturo
 (di dimanti</k>, <k>di pladi</k>, <k>di kulieri</k>, <k>e.c.)</k> a set of
diamonds, plates, spoons); <k>butil asortajo</k> stock
(of a shop).

<k>asparago</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> asparagus; <k>asparagopinto</k>
the tip (or top) of a. shoots; <k>asparageyo</k> a. bed.

<k>aspektar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to look (like, as
if: <k>quale</k>), to seem (to be), appear; <k>aspekto</k>
aspect, view, sight, look, phase; <k>aspektar felica</k> to
look happy; <k>aspektar quale fola</k>, <k>folo</k> to look like,
seem to be a fool; <k>aspekto yun(es)ala</k> youthful look;
<k>la kozi chanjis sua aspekto</k> the aspect of things
changed.

<k>aspera</k> <ex>(of touch)</ex> rough, uneven. V.
exp.: <k>Acerba</k> koncernas la gusto, <k>aspera</k>
la takto; II-707. Ant.: <k>glata.</k>

<k>aspersar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sprinkle (to
prevent disease); <ex>(rel.)</ex> to asperse; <k>aspersilo</k>
sprinkler; <ex>(rel.)</ex> aspergillum. V. exp.: vid. <k>arozar.</k>

<k>aspirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to inhale, draw in
(air, smoke, etc.); to suck in or up (liquids); <ex>(gram.)</ex>
to aspirate (a sound); to aspire: desire eagerly, long for, aim
at; <k>aspir(ad)o</k> inhaling, inbreathing, suction,
aspiration: ardent wish; <k>aspirilo</k> <ex>(chem)</ex>
aspirator; <k>aspirajo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> aspirate; <k>aspirsigno</k>
<ex>(gram.)</ex> sign of aspiration; <k>aspirar la honori</k>, <k>ofici</k> aspire to honors, office; <k>aspirar la krono</k>, <k>rejeso</k> aspire to the crown, to kingship; (cf. <k>ambiciar);
 aspirar la venjo</k> to long for vengeance; <k>aspiro di aero
 en la pulmoni</k> inhaling of air into the lungs; <k>aspirotubo</k>
suction pipe; <k>pumpilo aspiras l'aquo</k> a pump
sucks (draws) up the water; <k>la feliceso quan me aspiras</k>
the happiness which I long for. V. exp.: vid. <k>sugar.</k>
Ant. <k>expirar.</k>

<k>asterismo</k> <ex>(astron., opt. of crystals)</ex>
asterism. Def.: Optikal fenomeno; reflekto radianta di la lumo
sur ula lapidi; III-135.

<k>astonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to astonish, surprise,
amaze: <k>astonegar</k> to astound, aghast; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to stupify; (cf. <k>stuporigar); astonesar</k> to be a.ed
<k>(da).</k>

<k>astro</k> star: any heavenly body; <k>astrala</k>
astral, sidereal; <k>astraro</k> constellation; <k>fixa
 astro</k> fixed s.; <k>astrofiziko</k> astrophysics.
V. exp.: <k>Stelo</k>, <k>astro</k> La <k>astri</k>
esas omna cielala korpi, qui kontenas ne nur las <k>steli</k>
(dicita <k>fixa</k>), ma la planeti, lia sateliti
(exemple la luno), la nebulosi, la kometi, e.c. VI-191.

<k>astriktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have an astringent
effect on; <k>astrikt(ad)o</k>, <k>astrikteso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex>
astriction; <k>astriktiva</k>, <k>ivo</k> astringent. Def.:
Astrikto esas densigo di ula organika texuri: ex.
‹‹aluno esas astriktiva›› II-645.

<k>asumar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to assume, take on
oneself, undertake; (cf. <k>entraprezar</k>); <k>asumajo</k>
assumption: something taken for granted; <k>asumar afero</k>
take a hand in an affair; <k>asumar debi</k> a. debts; <k>asumar
 devo</k>, <k>la responso</k> to a. a duty, the responsibility; <k>asumar
 la spensi</k> to undertake the expense; <k>asumar la
 instrukto di la infanto</k> to undertake the instruction of
the child (cf. <k>supozar</k>).

<k>atakar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to attack; <ex>(milit.)</ex>
to take the offensive; (cf. <k>asaltar</k>, <k>asomar</k>, <k>atentar);
 atako</k> <ex>(alo med.)</ex> attack(ing); <k>atakanto</k>, <k>atakinto</k>, <k>atakero</k> attacker, assailant, aggressor; <k>atakebla</k>
assailable; <k>atakanta</k>, <k>atakema</k> aggressive, attacking,
offensive (attack); <k>atakemeso</k> aggressiveness; <k>cirkum
 atakar</k> to a. on all sides; <k>flanke atakar</k> to
a. on flank; <k>atakar dorse</k>, <k>surprize</k> to a. at the
rear, to make a surprise a.; <k>kontre atako</k> counter
a.; <k>noktal atako</k> night a.; <k>atakiva federo</k>
offensive alliance.

<k>atencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pay attention to <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; to apply the mind to, heed; <k>atenco</k>
attention, care, heed; <k>atencema</k> attentive, mindful;
<k>atencez</k> attention! mind! look out! <k>ne
 atencoza</k>, <k>atencema</k> inattentive, heedless; <k>sen atencajo</k>
inadvertence, oversight (act).

<k>atentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make a criminal
attempt on <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>; <k>atento</k>
attempt (to commit an offense or crime); attack, assault (on
persons or property), outrage; <k>atenta</k>, <k>atentanta</k>, <k>atentema</k>
assailing, unlawful, hostile; <k>atentar la honoro di ulu</k>
to assail the honor of some one; <k>atentar la vivo (di ulu)</k>
to make an attempt on a person's life; <k>atentar su ipsa</k>
to attempt suicide; <k>atento kontre la majesto</k> crime
of lese-majeste; <k>atento kontre la pudoro</k> criminal
(or indecent) assult.

<k>atestar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to attest: certify,
bear witness, give proof of; <k>atest(ad)o</k>
attestation, testimony, deposition, certification; <k>atesturo</k>
certificate, voucher; <k>deb atesto</k> acknowledgement
of debt; <k>demandar atesto (di ulu)</k> to call for
witness: <k>donar atesto</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> to depose; <k>examen
 atesto</k> brevet, certificate, diploma; <k>facar atesto (pri
 ulo</k>, <k>ulu)</k> to bear witness; <k>falsa</k>, <k>menti atesto</k>
false testimony; <k>mariaj atest o</k> certification of
