marriage; <k>atesto di slaubreso</k> health certificate; <k>atestala</k>
testimonial: relating to testimony; <k>la dei atestas to</k>
the gods are witness to it, as the gods are our witnesses.

<k>atingar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to attain, reach; <k>ta
 infanto ruptas irgo quon il povas atingar</k> that child breaks
everything he can reach; <k>la vito atingas le triesma etajo</k>
the vine reaches to the 3rd story; <k>atingar sua skopo</k>
to hit one's mark, attain one's aim; <k>ta kalumnii ne povas
 atingar ni</k> those calumnies cannot reach (hurt) us; <k>atingar
 la simileso</k> to hit off the resemblance; <k>ye
 fusil atingo</k> at (within) gun shot; <k>atingodisto</k>
hand's reach; <k>ne atingebla</k> beyond reach.

<k>atlanto</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> atlas; <ex>(pl.)</ex>
atlantes; (cf. <k>kariatido</k>). Def.: Virala figuro,
qua servas kom suportilo.

<k>atomo</k> atom; <k>atomala pezo</k> atomic
weight; <k>atomismo</k> atomism (theory); <k>atomisto</k>
atomist (philos.).

<k>atraktar</k> <ex>(tr. also fig.)</ex> to attrack,
draw; <k>atrakt(ad)eso</k> attract -ing, -ion; <k>atraktiva</k>, <k /><k>atraktivo</k> attractive, inviting, engaging, winning
(object); <k>atraktilo di desfortuno</k> something which brings bad
luck. Ex.: La magneto atraktas la fero. Atraktar l'atenco di ulu.
Atraktar la odio di la publiko. Un desfortuno atraktas (E. brings
on) un altra. Atrakto-forco, -povo. Mieno atraktiva. Ant.: <k>repulsar</k>, <k>antipatiar.</k>

<k>atrapar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to entrap: take in, trick, hoax,
dupe; <k>April atrapo</k>, <k>atrapilo</k> April hoax; <k>atrapita da fripono</k>
taken in by a rogue.

<k>atribuar</k> to assign, give, bestow, vest, allocate, invest
with (something as due and appropriate); <k>atribuar a ta ofico la
 konoco di ica od ita aferi</k> to assign to that office the
cognizance of such and such affairs; <k>la funcioni atribuita a
 policestro esas tre multa</k> the functions assigned (or vested
in) the chief of police are very numerous; <k>on atribuis bela
 honorarii a ta ofico</k> handsome emoluments have been assigned
(attached, annexed) to that office; <k>atribuar la kulpo ad ulu</k>
to throw the fault on some one; <k>atribuar a su la honori di</k> to
take the credit, claim the honors of. (cf. <k>imputar</k>). DeFIS

<k>atricar*</k> <ex>(intr., theol.)</ex> to feel attrition; <k>atrico</k>
<ex>(theol.)</ex> attrition: grief for sin arising from fear of
punishment.

<k>atrofiar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to atrophy; <k>atrofiesar</k> to
be atrophied, waste away.

<k>aturdar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stun. V. exp.: <k>Aturdar</k> ne
esas sempre <k>vertijigar</k>, nek <k>ebriigar</k>; en sua propra
senco, ol indikas nekoncio o preska nekoncio produktita exemple
da frapo, granda shoko, e.c. IV-1102.

<k>aucionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bid for, offer a higher price; <k>aucion(ad)o</k>
bidding, bid; <k>aucionanto</k> bidder; <k>aucione vendar</k> to auction
off, to sell at auction; <k>auciono</k>, <k>aucionvendo</k> auction; <k>aucionvenisto</k>
auctioneer; <k>aucionar domo</k> to bid for a house. Def.: Ofrar
preco plu alta kam altru. VI-417.

<k>audar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hear: receive sensations by the
ear; <k>aud(ad)o</k>, <k>audeso</k> hearing, audition; <k>audala</k>, <k>audiva</k>
auditory, auricular; <k>audanta</k> audient, listening, hearing; <k>audanto</k>, <k>audero</k> hearer, auditor; <k>audantaro</k> audience, auditors,
congregation; <k>per audo</k> by hearsay. V. exp.: vid. <k>askoltar</k>,
kp. <k>auskultar</k>.

<k>audacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to dare, venture, be so bold as; <k>audaco</k>
audacity, hardihood; <k>audacoza</k>, <k>audacanta</k> bold, daring, intrepid; <k>audacego</k>
temerity; <k>audacanto</k>, <k>audacozo</k> audacious person; <k>audacigar</k> to
embolden; <k>audaceskar</k> to grow bold; <k>audacar ekasalto</k> to
venture (dare) a sortie; <k>me ne audacas informar il pri la mala
 novajo</k> I do not dare to inform him of the bad news; <k>simular
 audaco</k> to bluster. V. exp.: vid. <k>riskar</k>.

<k>audienco</k> audience, sitting, hearing (granted by person
in authority); <k>not</k> audience as in theaters, etc; cf. <k>audantaro;
 audienceyo</k> a. chamber; <k>Sro. X havis audienco kun la rejo</k> Mr. X
had an a. with the king; <k>hori di audienco</k> (fixed) hours for
hearing, times for cosultation (physicians, barristers).

<k>augmentar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to augment: to increase,
enlarge, to make larger or more numerous; to raise (rents,
prices, wages, etc. (cf. <k>plucherigar</k>); <k>augment(ad)o</k>, <k>augmenteso</k>, <k>augmenturo</k> augmentation, increase, aggravation; rise (in price); <ex>(gram.)</ex>
augment; <k>augmentiva</k>, <k>augmentivo</k> augmentative; <k>pluse augmentar</k> to
raise higher. Ex.: Augmentar sua fortuno; augmentar la preco di
nutrivi; augmentar sua domo, sua domeno. Augmentar la salarii. La
desfacilaji augmentis cirkum lu. Ant.: <k>diminutar</k>, <k>reduktar.</k>

<k>augurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to augur <k>(de
 ulo); auguro</k> augury, omen, presage; <k>auguristo</k>
augur, soothsayer; <k>mal augura</k> ominous; <k>augurar
 bone pri kozo</k> to augur well (have a favorable opinion)
of a thing; Ex.: Ta evento esas bona auguro. To bone auguras.

<k>augusta</k> august: imposing awe or veneration,
majestic. Ex.: Il esas persono di august aspekto.

<k>‹‹aula››</k> aula: hall in
universities, colleges, etc.; <k>‹‹aula››ala konsilistaro</k>
aulic council.

<k>aureolo</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> aureole, halo,
nimbus; <k>aureolizar</k> to put a halo around (as in
painting); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to crown with glory.

<k>auspico</k>, <k>auspici</k> <ex>(lit. and fig)</ex>
auspice(s); <k>me entraprezas ica afero kun auspici favoroza</k>
I undertake this business under favorable a.s.

<k>austera</k> austere: (in a moral sense) strict,
rigid. Def.: Tre severa por su pri la mori, kun nuanco di rigoro
ed asketeso; II-707.

<k>austro</k> <ex>(poet.)</ex> a south wind; <k>australa</k>
austral: southern; <k>australa latitudo</k> southern
latitude.

<k>autentika</k> authentic, genuine, properly
attested; <k>autentikigar</k> to authenticate; <k>garantiar
 la autentikeso di</k> to guarantee the authenticity of - - -

<k>auto</k> (prefix for scientific and technical
words) auto-, self-; <k>automovanta</k> self-moving,
-acting.

<k>autografa</k> autographic: written by one's own
hand; <k>autografo</k> autograph: original signature or
writing.

<k>autokalvo</k> autoclave: (French) steaming vessel;
<k>autokalvo da Papin</k> Papin's digester.

<k>autokrato</k> autocrat; <k>autokrata rejido</k>
autocratic prince; <k>autokratala guvernado</k> a.
government; <k>autokrataro</k> autocracy <ex>(coll.)</ex>; <k>autokrateso</k>
autocracy <ex>(quality);</ex> <k>autokratismo</k> autocracy <ex>(regime).</ex>

<k>automato</k> automaton; <k>automata</k>
automatic: self-acting; <k>automatala</k> automatic
(relating to an automaton); <k>automateso</k> automatism.

<k>automobilo</k> automobile: motor-car; <k>automobilero</k>, <k>automobilisto</k> automobilist; <k>automobilduktisto</k>
chauffeur; <k>automobilismo</k> automobilism; <k>automobilkorno</k>
a. horn.

<k>autopsiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hold an autopsy on
<k>(ulu); autopsio</k> autopsy, post-mortem.

<k>autoritato</k> authority: legal or rightful power;
<k>autoritatozo</k>, <k>autoritatozi</k> authorit-y, -ies; <k>autoritatoza</k>, <k>autoritatema</k> authoritative.

<k>autuno</k> autumn: fall of the year; <k>autunala</k>
autumnal.

<k>avo</k> grand-parent; <k>avulo</k>
grandfather; <k>avino</k> grandmother; <k>ge avi</k>
grand-parents (both sexes); <k>pre avo</k> great
grandparent; forefather; <k>triesma avulo</k>
great-great-grandfather; <k>prim avo</k> (our) first
parent; <k>avala nomo</k> patronymic.

<k>avalo</k> aval: guaranty, surety: a signature at
bottom of a bill to guarantee payment; <k>avalizar</k> to
guarantee (a bill by endorsement).

<k>avalanchar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to fall in an
avalanch; <k>avalancho</k> avalanch.

<k>avan</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> in front of, ahead of;
before (in space, cf. <k>ante); avane</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex>
in front; <k>avana</k> advance, forward, front; <k>avano</k>
the front; <k>avanajo</k> thing, object in front,
forepart; <ex>(fig.)</ex> forequarters (as of a horse); <k>avanirar</k>
<ex>(intr.)</ex> to advance, go forward; <k>kun la avano
 dope</k> with the front behind, or hindpart foremost; <k>la
 akuzato sidas avan la jurio</k> the defendant sits before
the jury; <k>avanbrakio</k> fore-arm; <k>avanceno</k>
front of the stage, proscenium; <k>avanchambro</k>
front-room, anteroom; <k>avanguardo</k> vanguard; <k>avanholdo</k>
forward hold (of a ship); <k>avankastelo</k> <ex>(mar.)</ex>
fore-castle, <k>avankorpo</k>, <k>avanparto</k> forepart; <k>avanpedo</k>
front foot (of an animal); <k>avanportuo</k> outer
harbor; <k>avanposteno</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> outpost; <k>avantekto</k>
fore-roof, projecting roof, eaves; <k>avanviro</k> front
man; <ex>(milit.)</ex> chief of file. Ant.: <k>dop.</k>

<k>avancar</k> <ex>(tr. intr.)</ex> to advance: to go
forward, move, put forward, (in space and time); <k>avancinta
 frukti</k>, <k>flori</k> forward fruits, flowers; <k>avancinta
 posteno</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> advanced post; <k>avance</k>
forward, onward, in advance; <k>avancez</k> forward! Ex.:
Avancar la manuo, la pedo. La armeo avancas en la lando. Avancar
sua departo. Avancigar la laboro. Ant.: <k>retro avancirar;
 regresar</k>, <k>tardigar.</k>

<k>avantajo</k> advantage; <k>avantajoza</k>
advantageous; <k>avantajizar</k> to advantage, bestow an a.
on, to favor; <k>publika</k>, <k>statala avantajo</k> public,
state utility. Ex.: Ula persono povas havar avantajo relate
altra. La avantaji dil paco. Ant.: <k>desavantajo.</k>

<k>avara</k>, <k>avaracha</k> avaricious, miserly, greedy,
covetous; <k>avareso</k> avarice; <k>avaracho</k>
sordid miser, skinflint; <k>avaregeso</k>, <k>avaracheso</k>
niggardliness, stinginess. Ant.: <k>prodiganta</k>, <k>spensema</k>, <k>disipanta.</k>

<k>avariar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to damage (in conveying
goods); <k>avario</k> damage, loss, <ex>(com.)</ex>
average. Def.: Avario indikas omna domajo, ne nur di navo, ma di
kozi transportita per navo, fervoyo, veturo; II-138.

<k>avelano</k> filbert, hazel-nut; <k>avelaniero</k>
filbert-tree (Corylus Avellana); <k>avelanea</k> hazel
colored.

<k>aveno</k> oats; <k>avenala</k>, <k>avenatra</k>
avenaceous; <k>avengrani</k>: oat-grains; <k>avenporciono</k>
a feed of oats; <k>avengruelo</k> porridge.

<k>aventurar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to seek adventures,
go on adventures, lead an adventurous (or roving) life; <k>aventuro</k>
adventure; <k>aventurema</k>, <k>aventuroza</k> adventurous, venturesome.
(cf. <k>riskar</k>).

<k>avenuo</k> avenue. Def.: Larja voyo arborizita,
duktanta ad ula loko, kastelo, monumento (forsan placo), III-16.

<k>averso</k> front-, right-side (of cloth, medals,
etc.) first page (of a book); <k>averse</k> front side to;
(cf. <k>facio</k>). Ant.: <k>reverso.</k>

<k>avertar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give notice,
apprise, caution, advertise, warn (N.B. not necessarily to warn
of danger); <k>averto</k> warning, hint; <k>avertanto</k>, <k>avertero</k> cautioner; <k>avertanta</k> admonitory,
premonitory; <k>avertilo</k> warning instrument; <k>avertar
 ulu pri ulo</k> to inform or apprise a person of something;
<k>avertar la patrulo pri la konduto di lua filiulo</k> to
apprise the father of his son's conduct; <k>mea infirmeso
 avertas me pensar pri morto</k> my infirmities warn me to
think of death; <k>avertilo di incendio</k> fire alarm.
Def.: Informar ulu pri ulo futura, bona o mala.

<k>aviacar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to practice aviation,
to fly; <k>aviac(ad)o</k> aviation; <k>aviacisto</k>, <k>aviacero</k>
aviator; <k>aviacilo</k> flying machine (heavier than
air). Note: for technical terms see IV-330-333.

<k>avida</k> avid, greedy, rapacious, craving, eager;
<k>venj avida</k> vindictive; <k>pekuni avideso</k>
cupidity; <k>avide askoltar ulu</k> to drink in the words
of someone. Ant. <k>jeneroza.</k>

<k>avizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to apprise, advise, give
notice of <k>(pri ulo); avizo</k> notice, notification
(generally an order or prohibition); <k>avizonavo</k>
advice-, dispatch-boat. Def.: donar ula praktikal informo,
konsilo od impero; II-646. V. exp.: <k>Avizo</k>, <k>notico: Avizo</k>
koncernas generale preskripto od interdikto; (III-204). <k>Notico</k>
esas texto instruktiva teoriale, sive en etiketo, sive en mikra
libro o broshuro. Exemple, se on eniras muzeo, on trovas ye la
pordo tala <k>avizi</k> <k>››</k>La
muzeo esas apertita de 10 til 16 kloki; ol esas klozita omna
lundio; on ne darfas enirar kun parapluvi, bastoni, hundi<k>‹‹</k>
e.c. Ma enirinte, on vidas <k>notici</k> sub la objekti
expozata, qui indikas lia autoro, tempo, origino, e.c.; on povas
komprar libreti titulizita <k>notico</k> pri ula
objekto or serio di objekti (N.B.: ne <k>katalogo</k>, <k />
qua implikas numeral ordino) V-32-33.

<k>axo</k> <ex>(all senses)</ex> axis, axle; <k>axala</k>
axial; <k>(rot)axo</k> axle (tree); <k>manivel
 axo</k> cranked axle; <k>rotac axo</k> axis of
rotation: the line round which a body revolves; <k>axoboxo</k>
a. case; <k>axometro</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> tell-tale (of
a tiller); <k>axostifto</k> a. bolt, pin; <k>axarboro</k>
horizontal shaft.

<k>axoido</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> axis: second vertebra
of neck; <k>axoidala</k> axoidal.

<k>azilo</k> asylum: place of refuge for poor, sick,
or helpless; <ex>(fig.)</ex> any place of retreat or security; <k>infant
 azilo</k> infant a.; <k>azilyuro</k> right of
sanctuary; <k>blind azilo</k> a. for blind.

<k>azimuto*</k> <ex>(astron. and. geodesy)</ex>
azimuth; <k>azimutala busolo</k> a. compass.

<k>la</k> <ex>(def. article)</ex> the; (cf. <k>le</k>).
When the following word begins with a vowel, the «a» may be
omitted; as: <k>l’infanto.</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> la: sixth note
diatonic scale.

<k>labio</k> <ex>(anat. and fig.)</ex> lip; <k>labiala</k> relating
to the lip; <ex>(gram.)</ex> labial; <k>labioza</k> full-lipped; <ex>(bot.)</ex>
labiate; <k>labi(ach)oza</k>, <k>groslabia</k> blubber-lipped,
thick-lipped; <k>labiobarbo</k> moustache; <k>labiopilo</k> whisker
(of an animal).

<k>laborar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to work, labo(u)r (<k>pri ulo</k>);
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to work (the earth, iron, wood, etc.); <k>laborego</k>
hard work, toil; <k>laboruro</k> piece of work (performed); <k>laboreso</k>
workmanship, manner in which work is executed; <k>laboranta</k>
working; <k>laboroza</k> laborious (task); <k>laborema</k> industrious,
hard-working; <k>laboranto</k>, <k>laborero</k>, <k>laboristo</k> worker, workman,
artisan; <k>labordio</k> working day; <k>laborjorno</k> day’s
work, day-labo(u)r; <k>laborbenko</k> work-bench; <k>laboreskar</k> to
start work; <k>laborista klaso</k>, <k>laboristaro</k> working class; <k>labordivido</k>
division of labo(u)r; <k>par laborar</k> to work through to the
end, to finish a work, elaborate.

<k>laco</k> lace: a plaited string to fasten something through
eyelet holes; shoelace, etc; <k>lacagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lace
(shoes, corsets, etc.); <k>lacizar</k> to put laces on (<k>ulo</k>);
(cf. <k>dentelo</k>).

<k>lacerar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lacerate, tear, rend, to fray
out (by rubbing).

<k>laciva</k> lascivious, libidinous, lewd, lustful, wanton,
lecherous.

<k>laika</k> lay, laic, laical; <k>laik(ul)o</k> layman; (cf. <k>lea</k>);
<k>laikeso</k> lay-character, non-religious character; <k>laikigar</k>
to laicize; (cf. <k>sekularigar</k>).

<k>lako</k> lac, lacquer; <k>gumlako</k> gum-lac; <k>lakverniso</k>
lac varnish, lacquer, japan; <k>shel lako</k> shellac.

<k>lakrimo</k> tear; <k>lakrimala</k> lachrymal; <k>lakrimoza</k>, <k>lakrimema</k>
lachrymose, tearful; <k>lakrimifar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>, <k>lakrimigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to produce tears, to cause to shed tears; <k>lakrimovazo</k>
lachrymatory, tear-vase. V. exp.: <k>Lakrimifar</k> nule esas
neutila duaplajo di <k>plorar</k>; ol havas per su senco kelka
diversa; on <k>ploras</k> pro psikologiala kauzo, on <k>lakrimifas</k>
pro fiziologial od extera kauzo (kataro, fumuro, sablo, onyono);
IV-605.

<k>lakto</k>milk; <k>laktoza</k>, <k>laktatra</k> milky, lacteal, lactic; <k>laktajo</k>
a m. preparation; <k>laktea</k> milk-colo(u)red; <k>lakteyo</k>, <k>lakterio</k>
dairy; <k>laktoportisto</k>, <k>laktvendisto</k> milkman; <k>laktifar</k> to
secrete or yield m.; (cf. <k>melkar</k>): <k>laktifo</k> lactation;
<k>laktobovino</k> milch cow; <k>laktopoto</k> m. jug; <k>laktovoyo</k>
<ex>(astron.)</ex> Milky-Way; <k>laktumo</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> milt, soft
roe.

<k>lakuno</k> lacuna, blank space, gap. Def.: Mi-teknikala
vorto uzata en diversa faki: indikas generale manko o vakuajo en
loko, qua devus esar normale plena (lakuno di texto; lakuno un
ula organal texuri); III-204.

<k>lamo</k> thin plate, sheet (-metal); blade (of sword, knife,
etc.); <k>lamizita</k> laminated.

<k>lamentar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to lament, bewail, mourn (<k>pri</k>);
<k>lamentala</k>, <k>lamentatra</k> woeful: relating to lamenting; <k>lamentinda</k>
lamentable: worth lamenting. V. exp.: <k>Lamento</k> esas expreso
vocala di doloro, ne nur per paroli, ma per krii, jemi, sospiri; <k>plendo</k>
esas expreso vortala di des-kontenteso; II-80.

<k>laminar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to laminate: to flatten out, roll
flat; <k>lamineyo</k>, <k>laminerio</k> rolling-mill; <k>laminilo</k> rolling
instrument; <k>laminar voyo</k> to roll a road.

<k>lampiono</k> cup or small pot filled with tallow or oil with
a wick, for illumination.

<k>lano</k> wool; <k>lanajo</k>, <k>lana stofo</k> woolen goods, worsted;
<k>lanatra</k> fleecy: wool-like; <k>lanfelo</k> fleece: entire
coat of animal; <k>lanograso</k> grease from sheep’s wool.

<k>lancinar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to shoot, dart, twinge (of
pain); <k>lancinanta</k> shooting (pain).

<k>lando</k> land, country; <k>landano</k> a native inhabitant; <k>dopa
 lando</k> hinterland.

<k>lango</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> tongue; <k>lang(et)o</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
any object shaped like a tongue: language, speech; <k>langeroro</k>
an error of the t.; <k>extensar la lango</k> to put out the t.; <k>retenar
 la lango</k> hold the t.; <k>mea lango faliis</k> my t. slipped,
tripped; <k>tera lang(et)o</k> neck of land; <k>faira lango</k> t. of
fire; <k>lango di seruro</k> bolt of a lock; <k>resorto lango</k>
spring bolt.

<k>langorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to languish, pine away, droop
(from hunger, love, etc.); to be languid. Def.: Deperisar pokope
pro maladeso od afekto qua deprenas la vigoro. Esar komplete
senenergia. Ex.: To esas morbo en qua on langoras longatempe ante
mortar. Langorar en karcero. La ardoroza suno langorigas la
flori. Depos la milito esas granda langoro en komerco.
Langor-anta, -oza, -ema spirito.

<k>langusto</k> spring (or spiny) lobster, sea crayfish
(Palinurus vulgaris); (cf. <k>homardo</k>).

<k>lansar</k> <ex>(tr., pr. and fig.)</ex> to fling, hurl, throw
out or forward, cast, lance, dart (stones, darts,etc.) to shoot
(an arrow); throw, cast (a look); throw in (an epigram, a word);
to send forth (a book, a pamphlet); to cast (a beam of light); to
launch (a ship); (cf. <k>jetar</k>, <k>spricar</k>, <k>impulsar</k>, <k>iniciar</k>).

<k>lanugo</k> fine soft hair or hairlike growth; down (of
birds); <ex>(anat.)</ex> lanugo; <ex>(of fruit)</ex> wool; <ex>(of
cloth)</ex> soft nap (cf. <k>pilo</k>).

<k>lapar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lap (up): take into the mouth with
the tongue; (cf. <k>lekar</k>).

<k>lardo</k> bacon, (cf. <k>saimo</k>); <ex>(of whales, etc.)</ex>
blubber; <k>lardofumizita</k> smoked bacon; <k>lardoplako</k>
rasher; <k>lardospiso</k> larding needle or pin; <k>lardofilo</k>, <k>lardkordono</k> strip, slice of bacon.

<k>larja</k> broad, wide; (N.B. not «large»; cf. <k>grosa</k>, <k>granda</k>); <k>larjeso</k> width, breadth, wideness, broadness; <k>(plu)
 larjigar</k> to widen, broaden; <k>du larjesi</k> two
breadths (of cloth); <k>longese e larjese</k> in length and
width; <k>ica agro esas larja de duadek metri</k> this field is
20 meters (metres) wide. Def.: Qua havas la un dimensiono de
dextre a sinistre (opozita a longa). Ex.: Larja shultri, nazo,
facio, rivero. Ant.: <k>streta.</k>

<k>larvo</k> <ex>(ent.)</ex> larva; <ex>(antiq.)</ex> a ghost,
spector (spectre); <k>larvo di batrako</k> the young of the frog or
other batrachians; <k>ran larvo</k> tadpole.

<k>lasar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to let, give leave, permit, allow:
not to hinder to have, to do; to let alone; (<k>pos</k>) to leave
behind; <k>lasar su</k> to allow, suffer oneself (to), <k>lasar ulu
 repozar</k> to let someone rest, let anyone alone; <k>me lasas vu
 imaginar</k> I let you think; <k>me lasas il parolar</k> I let
him speak. Ex.: Il volabus, se on lasabus lu agar, ke on demandas
de lu permiso pri omno. Me lasis il tranquila. Ni opinionas ne
vivar vane quankam nia verki apene lasas traci. Yen pomi, prenez
le bone e lasez le mala.

<k>lasta</k> last (in time and space); <k>laste</k> lastly (of
time) lately (cf. <k>recente</k>). Ex.: La lasta horo di la dio.
Lasta yaro. La lasta domo en la strado. Laste naskinta. En lasta
instanco. Laste, me parolis pri.

<k>lato</k> lath; <k>latizar</k> to lath; <k>lataro</k>, <k>latogreto</k>
lattice work (cf. <k>treliso</k>); <k>latego</k> batten, thin
scantling.

<k>latenta</k> latent. Def.: Qua ne aparas extere; II-20. Ex.:
Defekto latenta (en mashino, en animalo). Latenta kaloro.

<k>Latina</k> Latin; <k>Latin(ul)o</k> a Latin; <k>Latinajo</k> a
Latin idiom; <k>Latineso</k> Latinity; <k>Latinisto</k> Latinist; <k>Latinigar</k>
to Latinize; <k>la Latina</k> (linguo); the Latin.

<k>laudar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to praise, laud, commend; <k>laudodiskurso</k>
eulogy, panegyric. Ant.: <k>blamar.</k>

<k>lauro</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> laurel (genus: Laurus); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
glory, hono(u)r; <k>laurizar</k> to deck, crown with laurel; <k>ceriz
 lauro</k> cherry-laurel; bay-laurel; <k>roz lauro</k> common
oleander, rose-bay.

<k>lavar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to wash, wash off or up, lave; (of
clothes) to launder: <ex>(fig.)</ex> cleanse (cf. <k>netigar</k>, <k>skurar</k>); <k>lavistino</k> washerwoman; <k>(di linjo)</k>
laundress; <k>lavajo</k> laundry; <k>(linj) laverio</k> laundry; <k>lavmoblo</k>
wash-stand.

<k>laxa</k> loose, slack, lax, not tense, not tight, not close;
<ex>(med.)</ex> flaccid; (cf. <k>mola</k>); <k>laxigar</k> to
slacken, loosen, relax; <k>laxigiva</k>, <k>laxivo</k> laxative.
<k>«lazarone»</k> lazzaroni: the poor class in Naples.

<k>le</k> (pl. of def. article <k>la</k>) the: only to be used
when there is no other sign of plural, e.g. «the ayes and the
nayes»: <k>le yes e le no.</k>

<k>lego</k> <ex>(natural, moral, social, parl., legislative)</ex>
law (cf. <k>yuro</k>); <k>legisto</k> one skilled in law; <k>legala</k>, <k>segunlega</k> legal, lawful; <k>legaleso</k>, <k>legokonformeso</k>
legality; <k>legaligar</k> to legalize; <k>legifar</k> to
legislate; <k>legaro</k> laws <ex>(collect.)</ex>, legislation; <k>legifala</k>
legislative, relating to legislation; <k>legifanta</k>
legislative, law-giving (body); <k>legifantaro</k> legislature; <k>legifanto</k>, <k>legero</k>, <k>legisto</k> law-maker, legislator.

<k>legacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bequeath (<k>ulo ad ulu</k>); <k>legacajo</k>
legacy, bequest; <k>legacario</k> legatee. V.exp.: <k>Legacar</k>
diferas de <k>testamentar</k>, per ke ol koncernas specale la
kozi, havaji donata per testamento, e konseque havas sempre ta
kozi kom rekta komplemento. On povas <k>testamentar</k> sen <k>legacar</k>
ulo; III-160.

<k>legiono</k> legion; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a multitude; <k>HonorLegiono</k>
Legion of Hono(u)r; <k>me nomesas legiono</k> my name is legion
(Bib.).

<k>legitima</k> legitimate; having the sanction of law, custom
or logic; <ex>(of a child)</ex> born in wedlock; <ex>(of a king)</ex>
hereditary; <k>legitimigar</k> to legitimize; (cf. <k>yurizar:
 yustigar</k>, <k>justifikar</k>). Ex.: Legitima infanto, autoritato,
pretendo, plendo.

<k>lejero</k> light (in weight, force); <ex>(fig.)</ex> not
burdensome or severe (of food, clothing, work, punishment, etc.);
<k>lejerigar</k> to lighten (cf. <k>alejar</k>). Ant.: <k>grava</k>, <k>opresanta</k>, <k>pezoza</k>, <k>facila.</k>

<k>lekar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lick; (cf. <k>lapar</k>); <k>lekar
 sua fingri</k> to lick one’s fingers.

<k>lektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to read, peruse; <k>lektajo</k> what
is read; <k>lektebla</k> readable: legible; <k>lektinda</k> readable:
worth reading; <k>ri lektar</k> to read over again.

<k>lemo</k> <ex>(log., math.)</ex> lemma; loam (as used for
founding).

<k>lenta</k> slow: not acting, moving promptly, sluggish,
lagging; (cf. <k>tarda</k>); <k>lentacha</k> dawdling; <k>(plu)
 lentigar</k> to cause (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>) to slow down. Ex.: Lenta
treno, mento, exekuto, veneno, morto. Ant.: <k>rapida</k>, <k>ajila.</k>

<k>leono: ulo</k>, <k>ino</k> lion; <ex>(astr.)</ex> Leo; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
object of interest and curiosity; <k>yuno</k> young lion,
lion’s cub; <k>ala</k> leonine; <k>ala parto</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
the lion’s share; <k>dento</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> dandelion
(Leontodon taraxacum).

<k>leporo</k> hare (genus: Lepus); <k>leporraguto</k> jugged hare;
<k>leporlabio</k> hare lip.

<k>lernar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to learn (<k>ulo</k>); (cf. <k>instruktar</k>, <k>docar</k>, <k>studiar</k>, <k>saveskar</k>); <k>lernolibro</k> text-book,
manual. V. exp.: La gepatri docas ulo a la infanto, a la puero.
La infanto, la puero lernas ol.

<k>lesivar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to wash (clothes, etc. in lye); <ex>(chem.)</ex>
lixiviate; <k>lesivaquo</k> lye-water; lixiviation; <k>lesivajo</k>
linen or object to be washed, the laundry.

<k>levar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lift (up); to raise (from below); <k>levar
 su</k> to arise, get up; <k>levilo</k> lifting instrument; <k>levoskrubo</k>
screw-jack; <k>levar la shultri</k> to shrug the shoulders; <k>levponto</k>
lifting-bridge. Ex.: Levar la pedo, la manuo, la ankro. V.exp.:
vid. <k>elevar.</k>

<k>lexiko</k> lexicon, dictionary (esp. of Greek, Latin,
Hebrew); (cf. <k>vortaro</k>, <k>vortolibro</k>).

<k>lezar</k> <ex>(tr., physiol., jur.)</ex> to injure, hurt,
wrong; <k>lezo</k>, <k>lezuro</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> wrong, injury; <ex>(med.)</ex>
lesion.

<k>liano</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> liana, bind-weed, creeper; any
woody, climbing and twining plant.

<k>libacionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to offer up libations; <k>libaciono</k>
libation, potation.

<k>libelo*</k> libella: an instrument which measures levels:
(water-) level.

<k>libera</k> free; <k>libere</k> freely; <k>libero</k>, <k>liberulo</k>, <k>liberino</k> a
free person; <k>liberala</k> (of books, arts, education, principles,
political parties, etc.) liberal; <k>liberalo</k> a liberal,
liberalist; <k>liberaleso</k>, <k>liberismo</k> liberalism; <k>liberesana</k>, <k>liberano</k>
libertarian; <k>liberigar</k> to discharge, liberate, free; <k>liberigo</k>
deliverance, liberation; <k>liberiganta</k> liberating, freeing,
rescuing; <k>libertempo</k> leisure, spare time; (cf. <k>ocio</k>); <k>tempal
 homulo</k> a man of leisure; <k>en libera aero</k> in the open
air; <k>ne libera balonego</k> a captive baloon; <k>ne libereso</k>
captivity (cf. <k>kaptiteso</k>); <k>liberkambio</k> free-trade; <k>liberkambiisto</k>
free-trader; <k>liberpensado</k> free-thinking; <k>liberpenseso</k>
free-thought.

<k>libertina</k> <ex>(esp. of the imagination, mind)</ex>
unrestrained, wayward, flighty (to an excessive degree); <k>libertin(ul)o</k>
one characterized by excessive freedom in thought, manners,
habits, morals; (N.B. not E. libertine: cf: <k>debocho</k>); <k>libertineso</k>
libertinism <ex>(obs. sense),</ex> <k>libertinesar</k> to be free from
restraint, to go to excess. <k /><k /><k />

<k>libro</k> book, volume (cf. <k>tomo</k>); <k>libreto</k>
booklet; <ex>(mus.)</ex> libretto; <k>libretisto</k><ex>(mus.)</ex>
librettist; <k>libristo</k>, <k>librvendisto</k> book seller, <k>libraro</k>
collection of books, a library – books alone; cf. <k>biblioteko</k>).

<k>libraco*</k> <ex>(astron.)</ex> libration: an apparent
oscillatory motion (as of moon).

<k>lico</k> <ex>(ancient)</ex> lists; <ex>(modern)</ex> track, race
course. Def.: Voyo preparita specala (ed enklozita) per
konkursala kuri (sive di kavali, sive di homi, sive bicikli,
automobili, e.c.); IV-454. V. exp.: vid. <k>areno.</k>

<k>licencar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to grant a license, give
(official) permission (to sell spirits, to teach, etc.); <k>licenco</k>
license, licensing; <ex>(poetic)</ex> license; deviation from
strict fact, form or rule (by artist or writer); licentiate: a
European university degree between that of bachelor and doctor;
M.A. degree (= L <ex>licentia docendi </ex>), <k>licenciero</k> (univ.)
licentiate, an M.A.; <k>licencoza</k>, <k>licencema</k> uncurbed.

<k>ligar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to bind (down), tie (up), fasten,
attach; <k>lig(ad)o</k>, <k>ligeso</k>, <k>liguro</k> <ex>(act, state, result)</ex>
binding, fastening; league (association; cf. <k>federo</k>); <ex>(anat.)</ex>
ligature; <k>ligajo</k> something bound together, a bundle; <k>ligilo</k>
lash, band, strap (for tying); <ex>(fig.)</ex> bond (as of
matrimony); <k>hundligilo</k> dog leash; <k>kun ligar</k> to
tie together.

<k>ligno</k> wood (the material); <k>ligna</k>, <k>lignala</k>, <k>lignoza</k>, <k>lignatra</k>
woody, ligneous; <k>lignomortinta</k> dead wood; <k>lignoshuo</k>
wooden shoe, sabot; <k>lignobloko</k> block of wood, log; <k>lignopaneli</k>
wainscotting; <k>lignotrepano</k> auger; <k>lignomartelo</k>
mallet; <k>ligninkrustado</k>, <k>lignuro</k> marquetry.

<k>likar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to leak. Def.: (1) (aquo)
enirar navo; (2) (liquido o gaso) ekirar vazo, e.c.; (3) (navo)
enlasar aquo tra truo, fenduro; (4) (vazo) eklasar liquido o
gaso; II-76.

<k>likenino*</k> lichenin: a starch derived from Icelandic
moss.

<k>limar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to file; (cf. <k>raspar</k>); <k>limarilo
 triangula</k> a three-cornered file.
<k>limako</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> slug, naked snail (genus: Limax); <k>limakala</k>, <k>limakatra</k> limacine, snail-like.

<k>limbo</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> limb; an edge or border, as of a
disk.

<k>limfo</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> lymph; <k>limfala</k> lymphatic
(duct, gland, etc.); <k>limfoza</k> lymphatic (temperament; of
persons).

<k>limito</k> limit, boundary, bound; <k>limitizar</k> to set
bounds to, to bound (a field, a country; cf. <k>restriktar</k>); <k>limitiz</k>, <k>limituro</k> limitation; <k>limitizanta</k> limiting; <k>sen limita</k>, <k>ne
 limitizita</k> unlimited, boundless.

<k>limpida</k> limpid, clear (liquid, glass); <k>limpidigar liquido
 per filtrado</k> to clear water by filtering (cf. VI-528). Ant.:
<k>konfuza.</k>

<k>lino</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> flax (linum usitatissimum); <k>linajo</k>
<ex>(fabric)</ex> flax; <k>semino</k>, <k>lini</k> flaxseed, linseed; <k>linoleo</k>
linseed oil.

<k>linco</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> lynx (Felis Lynx); <k>lincokulo</k> <ex>(lit.,
and fig.)</ex> eye of a lynx, lynx-eye.

<k>lineo</k> <ex>(telegraphic, R.R., genealogical, military,
writing, printing)</ex> line; (cf. <k>streko</k>); <k>lineala</k>
lineal: relating to lines; in a direct line (as line succession;
cf. <k>lineara</k>); <k>lineizar</k> to rule (paper, etc.); <k>lineizilo</k>
ruler; (cf. <k>linealo</k>); <k>linee</k>, <k>rektolinee</k>in line, in
a straight line; <k>lineo direta</k> a direct line, <k>lineajo</k>
line <ex>(geneal., biol.)</ex>.

<k>lineara*</k> <ex>(math.) </ex>linear; of the first degree; <k>linearmezuro</k>
lineal measure.

<k>lingoto</k> ingot; <k>ora lingoto</k> bullion; <k>gisfera lingoto</k>
iron in pigs. Def.: Pecego di neformizita fuzita metalo, precipue
oro; II-76.

<k>linguo</k>language; <k>linguala</k> linguistic: relating to a
language (cf. <k>linguistikala</k>); <k>linguisto</k> linguist; <k>linguo
 matrala</k> mother tongue; <k>la doto di lingui</k> the gift
of languages.

<k>linguistiko</k> linguistics: science of language; <k>linguistikala</k>
linguistical; relating to l.; (cf. <k>linguala</k>).

<k>linjo</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> linen: a piece of washable
wearing apparel or household goods, made from flax , muslin,
cotton; <k>linjaro korpala</k> underclothing, lingerie; <k>linjaro
 domala</k> house linen (table-cloths, sheets, etc.); <k>linjo
 lavistino</k> laundress.

<k>lintelo</k> <ex>(carp.)</ex> lintel: head-piece of a
door-frame or window-frame.

<k>liquida</k> <ex>(also gram.)</ex> liquid; <k>liquido</k>, <k>liquidajo</k> a
liquid; <k>liquideso</k> liquidity; <k>liquidigar</k> to liquefy. V.
exp.: <k>Liquidaji</k> referas kozi qui havas, mem instantale, la
qualeso liquideskar; ex.: (liquida) metalo. <k>Fluido</k>
nultempe asumas formo solid; aero esas fluido; (kp. <k>fluido</k>).

<k>liquidacar</k> <ex>(tr., com.)</ex> to liquidate, settle, wind
up (property, debts, businesses).

<k>listo</k> list (of persons, of things); <ex>(parl., milit.)</ex>
roll; <k>listo di elekteri</k> list of electors; <k>listo di
 juriani</k> panel of jurymen; <k>listovoto</k> vote by ticket.

<k>lito</k> bed (<ex>(for sleeping, also fig. as bed of river)</ex>,
<k>litala kozi</k> bedding; <k>litoframo</k> bedstead; <k>litodoselo</k>, <k>litcielo</k> b. canopy, <k>litotuko</k> b. sheet; <k>litkovrilo</k>
b. cover; <k>porto lito</k> litter.

<k>litero</k> letter (of alphabet); <k>litereto</k> small letter;
(cf. <k>miniskulo</k>, <k>mayuskulo</k>); <k>literala</k> relating to
letters; literal: following the letter of exact meaning, not
figurative; (cf. <k>vortopa</k>); <k>literope</k> letter by letter.

<k>literaturo</k> literature: the collective body of literary
productions, belles-lettres; <k>literaturisto</k> (professional)
literary man; <k>literaturoza</k> literary, scholarly, lettered (of
persons); <k>literaturozi</k> the literati, literary people. Def.: La
artiste skribita verki, la «bela literaturo»; II-87. V. exp.: <k>Literaturo</k>
ne esas sinonima di <k>verkaro</k> qua indikas omnaspeca verki;
II-87.

<k>litiero</k> litter: straw, hay, etc. used for bedding of
animals.

<k>litijo</k> litigation: suit at law; <k>litijpunto</k> point at
issue; <k>litijala</k>, <k>litijoza</k> litigious, contentious.

<k>litoro</k> littoral: coastal region, seaboard. Def.: La tota
regiono plu o min larja, kontigua a la rivo; IV-426, 606; cf. <k>plajo</k>.
Exp.: Litorala voyo o fervoyo ne sequas ne sequas sempre la rivo.

<k>livar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to leave or depart; to leave behind;
to quit (a place or position). V.exp.: vid. <k>abandonar.</k>

<k>livida</k> livid: black and blue, leaden-colo(u)red. V.exp.:
<k>Palega</k> tote ne esas exakta: <k>livida</k> esas plu juste
plombo-kolora; III-20.

<k>livrar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to deliver (goods, culprits,
manuscripts, etc.); <k>livrar su</k> to deliver oneself up, give
oneself up, surrender; <k>livristo</k> delivery-man. V. exp.: La
furnisanto ne livras la vari, nam il havas nula livristo; II-79.

<k>lizo</k> lees, dregs; grounds (of wine, beer); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
dregs of the people.

<k>lo</k> it (referring to the contents of a previous sentence,
i.e. a fact, rather than a definite object; cf. <k>ol</k>); <k>prenez
 ica pomo</k>, <k>me volas lo</k> take this apple I desire it (= I
desire you to do so; <k>me volas ol</k> would mean I desire it,
i.e. the apple); <k>nia amiko ja arivis</k>, <k>kad vu savas lo? …
 lo joyigas me</k> our friend has already arrived, do you know
it? … it affords me joy. <k>Lo</k> is also used with
adjectives to mark an indeterminate sense: <k>lo bona</k>, <k>lo vera</k>, <k>lo bela</k> the good, the true, the beautiful; <k>lo sama</k>, <k>lo
 duesma</k> the same, the second (where it refers to an
indeterminate object or statement). Def.: Pronomo ed artiklo
indikanta kozo nedeterminita (antea frazo integra); VI-161, 239;
Mondo, IX, 55, 102.
<k>locionar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to wash with a lotion (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>lociono</k> lotion.

<k>logo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> log; <k>logtabelo</k>, <k>loglibro</k>
log-book. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la rapideso di navo;
III-140.

<k>logiko</k> logic; <k>logikisto</k> logician; <k>logikala</k>
relating to logic; <k>logikema</k>, <k>logikoza</k> logical (proposition,
person); <k>logikozeso</k>, <k>logikemeso</k> logicality; <k>ne logikala</k>, <k>kontre logika</k> illogical.

<k>lojar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to lodge, live, dwell for a limited
time (<k>che ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>lojigar</k> to lodge, put up (<k>ulu</k>);
<k>lojeskar</k> to take one’s abode, settle oneself; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to lodge itself, fix itself; <k>lojeyo</k> lodging place,
dwelling; <k>lojanto</k> a lodger; <k>lojiganto</k> lodging house
keeper; <k>lojbilieto</k> billet (for troops). V. exp.: vid. <k>habitar.</k>

<k>lojio</k> <ex>(theat.)</ex> box, loge; <ex>(actor’s) </ex>dressing-room;
<ex>(house-porter’s)</ex> lodge; <ex>(masonic, etc.)</ex> lodge;
<ex>(arch.)</ex> loggia.

<k>loko</k> place, spot, locality; (cf. <k>placo</k>); <k>lokala</k>
local; <k>loke</k>, <k>lokale</k> locally; <k>lokaro</k> premises, quarters,
general locality; <k>lokizar</k> to localize; (cf. <k>enfakigar</k>, <k>rangizar</k>, <k>situar</k>); <k>omnaloke</k> everywhere; <k>komuna
 loko</k> public place.

<k>lokacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hire, rent, lease (<k>ulo</k>, <k>de
 ulu</k>); (cf. <k>lugar</k>); <k>lokacokontrato</k> lease
(document); <k>lokacanto</k>, <k>lokacero</k> one who hires, rents, lessee,
tenant; <k>lokacajo</k> what is hired, leased (house, vehicle,
etc.); <k>lokacopreco</k> cost of hiring; <k>lokacokontoro</k>
box-office; <k>domo lokacebla</k> house to let.

<k>loklo</k>, <k>lokleto</k> lock of hair, curl, ringlet; <k>lokligar</k>, <k>loklifar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to curl (hair); <k>lokloza</k>
curly.

<k>lokomoco</k> locomotion; <k>lokomocar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to move
from place to place. Ex.: Lokomoco divenis plu rapida depos la
kreo di fervoyo. Muskuli lokomocala.

<k>loncho</k> slice, chop (of bread, meat, etc.); <k>pan loncho
 butrizita</k> slice of bread and butter.

<k>longa</k> <ex>(of time, space)</ex> long; <k>longeso</k> length;
<k>longajo</k> a long object; <k>longeta</k> longish, pretty long; <k>longesala</k>
longitudinal; <k>longe</k>, <k>longese</k>, <k>longesale</k> in length, lengthwise,
longitudinally; <k>longe</k>, <k>longatempe</k> (for) a long time, a
great while; <k>(plu) longigar</k> to lengthen, elongate,
prolong; <k>longeskar</k> to grow longer, stretch out; <k>de longe</k>
long since, long ago; <k>ica agro esas longa de cent metri</k> <k>(</k>od,
<k>havas cent metri de longeso)</k> this field is 100 meters
(metres) long. Ant.: kurta (cf. <k>oblonga</k>).

<k>lor</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> at the time of (a definite event), at
the same time as; <k>lore</k> then, at that time, by then; <k>lora</k>
at that time (cf. <k>dum</k>); <k>lore … lore</k> now
… then; <k>til lore</k> until then; <k>ja lore</k>, <k>de lore</k>
thenceforth; since then; <k>lor la milito</k> at the time of the
war; <k>lor elua mariajo</k> at the time of her marriage; <k>la
 lora ministraro</k> the then ministry, the ministry of that
time. Def.: En la tempo di (samtempe kam); III-667.

<k>lorno</k> (small) telescope, spy-glass; a single-barrelled
field glass; <k>lorneto</k> small spy-glass, lorgnette; (cf. <k>teleskopo</k>, <k>bilorneto</k>); <k>lornagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to look through a
spy-glass at (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>).

<k>loto</k> lot: portion, share; <ex>(things for sale)</ex> lot; <k>loto
 di komercaji</k> a portion of goods; (in a lottery) share; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
prize; <k>ganar la granda (</k>od<k>la maxima) loto</k> to win
the highest prize; (N.B. not in sense of fate: <k>destino</k>); <k>lotigar</k>
to divide into lots, to portion off: (cf. <k>porcionigar:
 parceligar</k>); <k>lotizar</k> to put a share, a lot into
something; <k>me havas (ya) bela loto</k> I have made a good
choice; <k>lotoludo</k> lotto; a game of chance.

<k>lotriar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cast lots for (<k>ulo</k>); to
raffle for; to draw (lots, in a lottery); <k>lotrio</k> lottery,
raffle.

<k>loyala</k> loyal: faithful in any relation implying trust or
confidence; straight-forward, fair-dealing; bearing true
allegiance. Ex.: Loyala a la rejo, a sua patrio, a sua promiso,
en amikeso. Ant.: <k>nesincera; hipokrita.</k>

<k>lu</k> <ex>(pron.)</ex> he, she, it (common gender form); <k>lua</k>
his her(s), its; (when desirable to indicate gender, the forms: <k>ilua</k>, <k>olua</k>, <k>elua are used</k> ); V. exp.: <k>su</k>, <k>lu</k> <k>il lavas su</k>
(E. he washes himself); <k>il lavis lu</k> (E. he washed him, or
her, or it). <k>Petro deziras pruntar de Karlo lua parapluvo</k>(E.
Peter desires to borrow from Charles his umbrella); <k>lua</k>
indikas ke la parapluvo esas la proprajo di Karlo; se <k>sua</k>
esis uzata vice <k>lua</k>, ol (<k>sua</k>) indikus ka la
parapluvo esas la proprajo di Petro, qua esas la subjekto di
pruntar; pluse kp. <k>su</k> e <k>lu</k>, Talmey, Text Book, p.
65-6.

<k>lubrifikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lubricate: to oil; grease
(part of a machinme); <k>lubrifikisto</k> oiler.

<k>lucida</k> <ex>(of mind)</ex> lucid, clear, sane. Ex.: Homo di
lucida mento. Instanti lucida.

<k>ludar</k> (<ex>intr.</ex> of games, sports) to play (<k>per</k>);
(cf. <k>plear</k>); <k>ludriskar</k> to gamble; <k>ludo</k>
playing, game; <k>lud(risko)</k> gambling; <k>ludanto</k>, <k>ero</k> a
player;<k>ludera</k>, <k>ludema</k> playful (child, animal); <k>ludemo</k>
playful person; <ex>(fig.)</ex> gamester, gambler; <k>ludilo</k>
paything, toy;<k>ludkubo</k>, <k>ludaro</k> dice; <k>ludodisko</k> <ex>(in
games)</ex> a quoit; <k>ludosplinto</k> spilikin; jackstaw; peg
(as for cribbage); <k>ludsonalio</k> toy bell; <k>vortoludo</k>
play upon words; <k>espritludo</k> play of wit; <k>ludotablo</k>
a table for play; <k>ludo di pacienteso</k> patience. Ex.: On
ludas per kegli, per buli, per biliardo, per karti, per shako,
e.c.

<k>ludiono</k> «ludion»; <ex>(toy)</ex> Cartesian devil,
bottle-imp. Def.: Aparato fizikala uzata por studiar la diferanta
efiki sur korpo plunjita en l’aquo, anke uzebla kom ludilo.

<k>lugar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to let (out), rent (out); hire (out),
lease (out) (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>); (cf. <k>lokocar</k>); <k>lugo</k>
letting, renting, leasing (by the proprietor); <k>lugokontrato</k>
lease.

<k>luktar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to wrestle: contend by grappling (<k>kun</k>)
and striving to throw; to scuffle, tussle; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
strive, struggle (<k>kontre</k>).

<k>lular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lull (<k>ulu</k>) to sleep, to
soothe, compose, quiet; <k>lulkanto</k> lullaby (cf. <k>bersokanto</k>).

<k>lumar</k> <ex>(intr. also fig.)</ex> to shine: emit rays of
light, give light; (cf. <k>brilar</k>); <k>lumo</k> light; <k>lumeto</k>, <k>esko</k> glimmer, gleam; <k>lumala</k> relating to light; <k>lumoza</k>
full of light; <k>lumigar</k> to cause (<k>ulo</k>) to shine; <k>lumifar</k>
to produce light; <k>lumizar</k> to light (a room, etc.) throw
light upon; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to elucidate (a subject); <k>lumizilo</k>
a light(ing instrument), luminary; <k>lumifanta</k> luminous:
light producing; <k>lumizata</k>luminous (from light received); <k>lumozeso</k>
luminosity; <k>lumrango</k> <ex>(theat.)</ex> foot-lights; <k>lumtruo</k>
<ex>(nav.)</ex> porthole; <ex>(in gen.) </ex>scuttle.

<k>lumbo</k>, <k>lumbi</k> lumbar region, loin(s); <k>lumbala</k> lumbar; <k>lumboza</k>
thick-backed (person); <k>lumbopeco (di bovo);</k> sirloin; <k>lumboruptar</k>
to break the back of.

<k>luno</k> moon; <k>lunala</k> lunar; <k>lunala periodo</k>
lunation, lunar month; <k>lunsunala</k>luni-solar; <k>lunolumo</k>
moonlight; <k>luno plena</k> full moon; <k>lunonova</k> new moon; <k>luneto</k>
<ex>(geom.)</ex> lune.

<k>lupo</k> <ex>(simple)</ex> magnifying glass, reading glass,
pocket lens. Def.: Optikal aparato, qua servas por «grandigar»
l’objekti (ye mikra raporto), e qua esas nek sempre simpla
lenso, nek mikroskopo. On nomizas ol anke «mikroskopo simpla»;
V-675.

<k>lupio</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> wen. Def.: Speco di tumoro sub la
pelo; V-675

<k>lurar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to lure, allure, entice; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
wheedle, cajole (cf. <k>seduktar</k>); <k>lurilo</k>, <k>lurizilo</k> a
lure; decoy, bait; <k>lurilizar</k> to bait (a trap); <k>lursiflilo</k>
call-whistle (for animals, birds); <k>lurucelo</k> decoy-bird.

<k>lustro</k> chandelier (cf. <k>kandeliero</k>); <ex>(antiq.)</ex>
lustrum: space of five years.

<k>lustracar</k> <ex>(tr., antiq.)</ex> to lustrate: make clear
or pure by propitiatory offering.

<k>luxo</k> luxury; <k>luxaji</k> luxuries, fancy goods,
articles <ex>de luxe,</ex> <k>luxala</k> sumptuary: relating to
luxury; <k>luxoza</k>luxuriant; <k>luxozeso</k> sumptuousness,
luxuriousness; (cf. <k>abundanta</k>, <k>richega</k>).

<k>luxacar</k> <ex>(tr., surg.)</ex> to luxate, dislocate, put
out of joint (cf. <k>dislokar</k>).

<k>luxurio</k> lust, lewdness, lechery, unchastity; <k>luxurioza</k>
lustful, lewd.

<k>sabato</k> Sabbath: seventh day of the
week among the Jews (Saturday); <ex>(fig.)</ex> the first day of
the week as observed by Christians (Sunday) (cf. <k>sundio</k>, <k>saturdio</k>).

<k>sablo</k> sand; <k>sabloza</k> sandy: full of s.; <k>sabla plajo</k>
s. beach; <k>sableto</k> fine s.; scouring s.; <k>sablograno</k>
grain of s.; <k>sabluyo</k> s. holder, s. box; <k>sableyo; sablomineyo</k>sandy spot, sandpit; <k>sablo movanta</k> shifting s.; <k>sablizar</k>
to s.: cover with s.; <k>sablohorlojo</k> hour-glass; <k>sablostrato</k>s. bar.

<k>sabro</k> saber (sabre), broadsword; <k>sabreto; sabro por
 abordar</k> cutlass; <k>sabruyo; sabrogaino</k> s. scabbard; <k>sabrfrapar</k>, <k>sabragar</k> to s. (<k>ulu</k>); <k>sabrfrapo</k>, <k>sabrvunduro</k> blow
with a s., s. wound; <k>sabroposho</k> sabretache. Def.: Speco di
espado kun tranchanta lamo larja.

<k>sacerdot(ul)o</k> priest; <k>sacerdotino</k> priestess; <k>sacerdotala</k>
sacerdotal, priestly; <k>sacerdoteso</k> <ex>(dignity, office)</ex>
priesthood; <k>sacerdotaro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex> priesthood.

<k>saciar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to give a bare sufficiency to, give
a minimum to (<k>ulu</k>); <k>saciesar</k> to content oneself; put
up with; <k>saciesar da poko</k> to put up with a little. V. exp.: <k>Saturar</k>
esas furnisar la maximo, e <k>saciar</k> esas furnisar la minimo
suficanta por kalmigar o cesigar irga bezono. On povas <k>saciar</k>
sua hungro per pano-peco, sua dirsto per glasedo de aquo; ma
kande on <k>saturas</k> su per manjaji o drinkaji, on riskas,
sive mala digesto sive ebrieso. Simile pri omna bezoni e deziri.
Existas ofte granda difero o neegaleso inter la minimo strikte
necesa por <k>saciar</k> e la maximo qua <k>saturas</k>. Me tre
deziras salario de dek franki; me <k>saciesus</k> da ok franki,
ma me ne esas <k>kontenta</k>, nam generale, por esar vere <k>kontenta</k>,
on bezonas plu kam la minimo necesa. Do <k>saciar</k>ne esas <k>kontentigar</k>,
nek saciesar esas <k>kontentesar</k>, <k>sacieskar. Saciar</k> expresas
esence sentimento; do <k>saciar</k> povas havar nur persono kom
objekto, kontre ke<k>suficar</k> povas havar omnaspeca objekti;
kp. VI-488.

<k>safrano</k> <ex>(bot. and colo(u)ring material)</ex> saffron
(Crocus [sativus]); <k>safranea</k> s. colo(u)red; <k>safranizar</k>, <k>safranagar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to s.: tinge with yellow.

<k>sagaca</k> sagacious, perspicacious, shrewd; <k>sagaceso</k>
sagacity, acumen, acuteness, discernment; <k>sagac(ul)o</k> a s.
person. Ex.: Sagaco dicernas multa diferi ube altri vidas nur
kozi uniforma. <k />

<k>saguino</k> <ex>(zool.)</ex> sagoin: squirrel-monkey, marmoset
of genus: Callithrix.

<k>saguto</k> sago (cf. <k>tapiokao</k>); <k>sagutiero</k> s. tree
or palm (Cycas Metrocylon).

<k>saimo</k> lard (cf.<k>lardo</k>). Def.: Porko-graso fuzita,
sen salo; IV-581.

<k>saja</k> wise, knowing, enlightened, sage, sensible,
reasonable; <k>sajeso</k>wisdom; <k>saj(ul)o</k> a wise person, a
sage; <k>sajigar</k>, <k>sajeskar</k> to make, to become wise; <k>ne saja</k>
unwise, ill-advised. Ex.: Saja lego, politikisto, konduto,
judiciisto. La sajeso di la Egiptiani. Il montris granda sajeso
en ta cirkonstanci. Ant.: <k>stulta</k>, <k>absurda</k>.

<k>sako</k> <ex>(also anat. and bot.)</ex> sack: bag, pouch; <k>sakedo</k>
sackful, bagful; <k>sako papera</k> a paper bag; <k>sakoreto</k>
net bag; drag net, trawl; <k>sako de frumento</k> s. of wheat; <k>ledor
 sako</k> leather pouch; <k>manu sako</k> handbag, satchel; <k>sablo
 sako</k> sandbag: bag for sand; <k>sako de sablo</k> sandbag: bag
of sand; <k>sakostrado</k> blind alley, cul-de-sac.

<k>sakra</k> sacred; <k>sakreso</k>sacredness; <k>sakrajo</k> a s.
object; <k>sakrigar</k> to render s., to consecrate (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to annoint, crown (a king); (cf. <k>konsakrar</k>);
<k>sakrosanta</k> sacrosanct, most holy. Ex.: Sakra historio. La
sakra ordi. La sakra fairo di Vesta. Sekretajo esas sakrajo.
Sakrigar episkopo, rejo.

<k>sakramento</k> sacrament. Ex.: Donar la lasta sakramenti ad
uli. Sakramentala vino. La katolikismo havas sep sakramenti:
sakramento di bapto, di konfirmo, di la extrema unciono, e.c.

<k>sakrifikar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.: lit. and fig.)</ex> to
sacrifice (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); to make offerings; <k>sakrifiko</k>, <k>sakrifikajo</k>
sacrifice, offering; <k>sakrifikala</k> sacrificial;<k>hom sakrifiko</k>
human s. Ex.: Sakrifikar viktimi, sua interesti, sua havaji, sua
tempo. La sakrifiko di la meso, di la honoro. La sakrifiko di
Izaak da Abraham.

<k>sakrilejar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to commit a sacrilege; <k>sakrilejanta</k>, <k>sakrilejinta</k> sacrilegious. Def.: Profanacar ulu, ulo veneracinda o
sakra. Ex.: Sakrilejar kontre sacerdoto, kontre vestalo. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Esus sakrilejo abatar ica belega arboro.

<k>salo</k> salt; <ex>(chem.)</ex> sodium chloride; <k>salifar</k>
to salify: to produce salt; <k>saligar</k> to salify: to form a
salt with; to impregnate (<k>ulo</k>) with salt; <k>salizar</k> to
cover (<k>ulo</k>) with salt; <k>sala kolono</k> a column <ex>(made)</ex>
of salt; <k>salala legi</k> laws relating to s.; <k>saloza fisho</k>
a salty fish; <k>salizita porkokarno</k> salt pork; <k>salifisto</k>
a salt-maker <ex>(producer)</ex>; <k>salizisto</k> a salter, curer;
<k>salatra</k> <ex>(tendency)</ex>salty; brackish; <k>saluyo</k>, <k>salizuyo</k>
salt-shaker, salting-box; <k>salozeso</k> saltness; <k>salaquo</k>
salt water; <k>salmineyo</k> salt-mine; <k>salo grosa</k> coarse
salt; <k>salgrano</k> grain of salt; <k>salmarsho</k> a salt marsh;
<k>amoniaksalo</k> sal ammoniac.

<k>salariar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to pay a stipend, wages, a salary to
(<k>ulu</k>); <k>salario</k>, <k>salariajo</k> salary, wages stipend; <k>salariato</k>
a salaried person; <k>salariatacho</k> hireling.

<k>saldar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to settle with: pay the balance due
on an account current; <k>saldo</k>, <k>salduro</k> settlement, payment; <k>saldajo</k>
balance due: difference between debits and credits of a running
account; (cf. <k>bilanco</k>). Ex.: Saldar trupi, employati.
<k />

<k>salepo</k> <ex>(esp. pharm.)</ex> salep: dried roots of various
orchids. <k />

<k>saliar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be protuberant, to jut out,
project. (N.B. refers to form not movement; cf.<k>spricar</k>); <k>saliigar</k>
to cause to jut out, to bring into prominence; <ex>(of fluids)</ex>
throw up; <k>salio</k>, <k>saliajo</k> jutting forth; protuberance,
prominence, projection; <ex>(fort.)</ex> salient; <k>salianta</k>
projecting, prominent, salient. <k />

<k>salika</k> Salic; <k>salika lego</k> S. law. V. exp.: Ideo di
heredado nur da e tra la maskuli; IV-581. <k />

<k>salino</k> salina: salt-works; (cf. <k>salmineyo</k>). Def.:
Loko ube produktesas la salo per vapigoro di la saloza aquo;
IV-715. <k />

<k>salivo</k> saliva, spittle; <k>salivala</k> salivary; <k>salivifar</k>
to salivate (cf. <k>sputar</k>). V. exp.: vid. <k>bavar</k>.
<k />

<k>salono</k> saloon: drawing-room, parlo(u)r; (cf. <k>artala
 expozeyo</k>). Def.: Chambro en apartamento destinita por
aceptar vizitanti. <k />

<k>saltar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to leap, jump, bound, hop (upward or
forward), vault (<k>ad</k>, <k>sur</k>, <k>trans</k>, <k>retro</k>, <k>adavane</k>);<k>saltigar</k> to bounce (<k>ulo</k>)<k /> cause to leap or jump; <k>saltetar</k>
to hop, skip, caper; <k>saltope</k> by leaps and bounds; <k>saltanta</k>, <k>saltetanta</k> leaping, skipping; <k>ri saltar</k> to rebound; <k>dorso
 salto</k> <ex>(game)</ex> leapfrog; <k>laterala salto</k> side jump; <k>turno
 salto</k> summersault; <k>transsaltar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to jump
across; <k>vento salto</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> a shift of wind. Ex.:
Saltar trans (od, trans-saltar) fosato. Irar super ulo per un
salto. Saltar al guturo di ulu. <k />

<k>salubra</k> <ex>(of places, things)</ex> salubrious, wholesome,
healthy; <k>salubreso</k> salubrity; <k>salubrigar</k>, <k>salubreskar</k> to render,
become s. V. exp.: <k>Salubra</k> tote ne esas <k>sana; sana</k>
koncernas la personi o vivanti; <k>salubra</k> koncernas la kozi
(klimato, lando, domo). Anke <k>salubreso</k> tote ne esas la <k>saneso</k>,
ma la extera, fizikal kondicioni di la saneso. Ol anke ne esas la
<k>higieno</k>, qua esas l’arto konservar la saneso. On
povas (e devas) sequar la <k>higieno</k> precipue en <k>nesalubra</k>
lando; II-711, anke <k>sana</k>. <k />

<k>salutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to greet, salute (cf. <k>salvear</k>, <k>reverencar</k>); <k>salutego</k> a very low bow, salaam; hearty
salute; <k>inter salutar</k> to salute each other; <k>salutar per
 espado</k>, <k>per manuo</k>, <k>per salveo</k> to salute with the sword, with
the hand, by firing a salute; <k>salutar per voco</k> to cheer.
Def.: Donar ad ulu extera signo di respekto, politeso. <k />

<k>salutara</k> salutary, wholesome, beneficial. Def.: Qua
risanigas o salvas; IV- 138. Ex.: Salutara legi, kura-civi
manjaji. V. exp.: vid. sana. <k />

<k>salvar</k> <ex>(tr., also theol.)</ex> to save (from danger,
peril, sickness), to deliver, rescue; to salvage (goods); <k>salv(ad)o</k>
saving, salvation, salvaging; <k>salveso</k> safety, salvation:
state of being saved; <k>salvanta</k> saving, rescuing; <k>salvanto</k>, <k>salvinto</k>, <k>salvonto</k> saver, deliverer; <ex>(theol.)</ex> Saviour; <k>salvita</k>
saved, safe (cf. <k>sekura</k>, <k>integra</k>); <k>salvoletro</k>
safe-conduct; <k>salvogardar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to safeguard; <k>salvogardilo</k>
<ex>(instr.)</ex> safeguard; <k>salvboyo</k> life-buoy. Ex.: Salvar
urbo, vivo, sua honoro. <k />

<k>salvear</k> <ex>(intr., milit.)</ex> to fire a salute, a volley
(cf. <k>salutar</k>); <k>salveo</k>, <k>salveopafado</k> salute, volley,
salvo; <k>aplaud salveo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> a round of applause.
<k />

<k>sama</k> same (cf. <k>identa</k>); <k>samo</k> the s. thing; <k>sameso</k>
sameness; <k>same</k> also, likewise, ditto; <k>samgentano</k>, <k>samcivitano</k>, <k>samstatano</k>, <k>samurbano</k> fellow citizen; <k>samgenera</k>
congenerous, of the same genus; <k>samspeca</k> of the same
species; <k>samideano</k>fellow thinker; partisan of the same
idea; <k>saminstanta</k> happening at the same moment,
simultaneous (cf. <k>samtempa</k>); <k>samlandano</k>
compatriot, fellow countryman; <k>sammatra</k> of the same
mother; <k>sampatr(ul)a</k> consanguine; <k>sampatriano</k>
compatriot, fellow counrtyman; (cf. <k>samlandano</k>); <k>samreligiano</k>
coreligionist; <k>samspecano</k> a kindred or cognate species;
<k>samsubstanceso</k> consubstantiality; <k>samtempa</k>
contemporaneous, simultaneous (cf. <k>saminstanta</k>); <k>samtempano</k>
contemporary; <k>samcentra</k> concentric. Ex.: Il ne plus esas
la sama homo. To esas la sama (od, to esas equivalanta). La
sameso di la peizaji. Il pensas same kam me. La sama rezultajo.
Me lektis la sama libro kam vu ( la sama verko, ma en altra
exemplero). La mediko probis desparigar samtempe la febro e la
dursto. <k />

<k>sana</k> <ex>(pr. of persons; fig. of things)</ex> healthy, well,
hearty, hale, sound in health; <ex>(fig.)</ex> sound, wholesome; <k>sana
 mente</k> sane; <k>saneso</k> healthiness, good health; <k>sanesar</k>
to be well, to be all right, be in good health; <k>sanesala</k>
sanitary, <k>sanigar</k> to make healthy, well; <k>saneskar</k> to
recover one’s health; <k>sanigiva</k> wholesome, hearty; <k>korpe
 e mente sana</k> sound in body and mind; <k>sana e sekura</k>
well (or, safe) and sound; <k>sana opiniono</k>, <k>kritiko</k> sane
opinion, sound criticism; <k>sana arboro</k> healthy tree. Def.:
Qua havas konstituciono (od figurale, konstituceso) sen-defekta o
koruptita (partikulare da morbo). V. exp.: Lo <k>sana</k> ne
povas nocar; lo <k>salubra</k> reale bonfacas; lo <k>salutara</k>
salvas de danjero, malajo. La ri-sanigeyo devas esar en <k>salubra</k>
loko ube la kuracati povas recevar <k>salubra</k> (E. wholesome)
manjaji e <k>salutara</k>remediili kande malada; kp. <k>salubra</k>.
<k />

<k>sancionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sanction: give validity to. Ex.:
Sancionar lego. Ica vorto ne havas la sanciono di kustumo. <k />

<k>sango</k> blood; <k>sangala</k> relating to b.: <k>sangoza</k>
sanguinary: bloody, blood-stained; <k>sangea</k> blood-colo(u)red; <k>sangatra</k>
b.-like; <k>sangifar</k> to bleed; <k>sangotirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to bleed (<k>ulu</k>); <k>sangosputar</k> to spit b.; <k>sangplena</k>
full-blooded; <k>sangamanta</k>, <k>sangodurstanta</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
bloodthirsty; <k>sangifar de la nazo</k> to have nose bleed; <k>sangifo</k>, <k>sangoformaco</k> sanguification; <k>sangekfluo</k> hemorrhage; <k>sen
 sanga</k> bloodless. <k />

<k>sanio*</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> sanies. Def.: Materio sangoza e
fetida, qua fluas de ula ulceri. V-349. <k />

<k>santa</k> holy, saintly; <ex>(of titles)</ex> saint; (cf. <k>sakra</k>);
<k>sant(ul)o</k> a saint; <k>santeso</k> holiness, sanctity,
saintliness, saintship; <k>santigar</k> to sanctify, make holy; <k>santigo</k>
sanctification; <k>santeyo</k> a holy place; <k>Santa Spirito</k>
Holy Ghost; <k>Santa Paulo</k> Saint Paul; <k>santa patrulo</k>
holy father; <k>santa tribunalo</k> holy office (Inquisition); <k>santa
 semano</k> holy week; <k>santa vivo</k> a holy life; <k>santaquuyo</k>
holy-water basin, font.

<k>santuario</k> sanctuary: that part of a church where the
altar is placed; chancel; altar; (Jewish) holy of holies. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
asylum, sacred refuge. Def.: Parto di kirko, di templo
interdiktata a la profani; IV-582.

<k>sapar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to sap, undermine; <k>sap(ad)o</k>, <k>sapuro</k> undermining, <ex>(milit.)</ex> sap(ping); <k>sapisto</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex>
sapper. Ex.: Sapar la fundamenti di basiono, di edifico. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Ta sistemo sapas la fundamenti di la Kristana religio.

<k>sapono</k> soap; <k>saponala</k>, <k>saponoza</k>, <k>saponatra;</k> soapy, saponaceous; <k>saponagar</k>, <k>saponizar</k> to use s., put s. on, lather; <k>saponigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>,
<k>saponifar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to saponify, make or produce soap; <k>saponiferio</k>
s.works; <k>saponbulo</k>, <k>saponpeco</k> a piece of soap.

<k>saporar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have a certain flavo(u)r
(taste) (cf.<k>gustar</k>, <k>savurar</k>); <k>saporo</k> flavo(u)r,
taste: <ex>(fig.)</ex> zest; <k>saporoza</k> tasty; succulent,
palatable; <k>sen sapora</k> tasteless; <ex>(fig. of things)</ex>
insipid, flat, vapid; <k>posa saporo</k> after-taste. Ex.: La biro
saporas bitre. Ta karno esas sen-sapora. Ca vino havas pikema
saporo. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Lua poemo havas nula saporo. <k />

<k>sapto</k> <ex>(of plants)</ex> sap. Def.: Suko quan la planti
tiras ek la tero, e qua acensante en li nutras oli; II-705.

<k>sarabando</k> saraband. Def.: Anciena danso, origine
Hispana; IV-582.

<k>sarklar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to weed (flowers, a garden); <k>sarkluro</k>
weeding (done); <k>sarklaji</k> weeds cut down (cf. <k>mala herbo</k>);
<k>sarklilo</k> a weeding instrument.

<k>sarmento</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> sarmentum: a running stem (as the
strawberry plant); <k>sarmentoza</k> sarmentose: having slender
prostrate branches or runners.

<k>sat(e)</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> enough, sufficiently (<k>de</k>);<k>sat(e)o</k> a sufficiency; <k>me havas sata</k>(od, <k>sat multa;
 sato de; suficanta</k>)<k>pekunio</k> I have enough money; <k>vu
 parolis sate</k> you have spoken enough; <k>savar sat multe</k>to
know enough; <k>sat bone</k> good enough. V.exp.: <k>Sat</k>, <k>suficante</k> Me manjis <k>sat multa</k>pano, me ne <k>suficante</k>
granda quanto por saturigar mea hungro. Ofte <k>sat</k> havas
preske la signifiko di <k>pasable</k>, <k /> ma existas tamen kelka
nuanco. «Homo, <k>pasable</k> granda, esas sat granda por esar
vertuoza, ma ne suficante granda por atingar ula pomo pendanta de
arboro.»

<k>satelito</k> <ex>(astron. and fig.)</ex> satellite. Ex.: La
luno esas satelito di ica planeto.

<k>satino</k> <ex>(fabric)</ex> satin; <k>satinatra pelo</k> a
satin-like skin; <k>satinumar</k> to glaze: give to fabrics, paper,
etc., a satin-like gloss; <k>koton satino</k> satinet.

<k>satiro</k> satire; <k>satirala</k>, <k>satiratra</k>, <k>satirema</k> satirical; <k>satire
 mokar</k> to satirize (<k>ulo</k>), lampoon (<k>ulu</k>).

<k>satisfacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to satisfy: to answer, fulfil
(expectation, promise), to discharge (an obligation); to make
amends, atone for (an offense, sin); <k>satisfaco</k> fulfilment,
satisfaction (given), amends; <k>satisfacanta</k> satisfactory: making
amends. V.exp.: On adoptas <k>satisfacar</k> en la sequanta uzo:
«satisfacar devo, obligo, kontrato, promiso, kondiciono», ne en
la senco di <k>kontentigar</k>; III-666.

<k>«satisfecit»</k> certificate of satisfaction, of good
conduct. Def.: Atesto-letreto donata (quale da skolestro a lua
skolano).

<k>saturar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fill completely; to satiate,
glut, saturate, surfeit; <ex>(chem.)</ex> to unite or dilute until
no more can be received. Ex.: Saturar acido. Saturar sua
kuriozeso. La saturo-punto varias segun la tempuraturo. Saturita
per manjajo, per aquo, per doloro. V.exp.: vid. <k>saciar</k>.
<k />

<k>sauco</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> sauce; <k>saucuyo</k> s. holder, s.
tureen; <k>saucizar</k> to put sauce on.

<k>savar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to know (by learning), to have a
knowledge of; to be versed in; be aware of; to know how (to do); <k>savigar</k>
to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to know (<k>ulo</k>), to apprise, inform,
instruct; <k>saveskar</k> to become informed, apprised (<k>pri</k>);
<k>(ad)o</k> knowing, learning; <k>savajo</k> knowledge: what is
known; <k>savema</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> desirous of learning,
curious (cf. <k>kurioza</k>); <k>savar lektar e skribar</k> to
know how to read and write; <k>savar plezar</k>, <k>facar</k> to know how
to please, to make; <k>savar la intenci</k> to be sensible, be
aware of the intentions. Ex.: Savar ulo, multo (pri). Me ne savas
quon me devas dicar. Savar gramatiko, lingui, matematiko. V. exp.
(1): <k>Savar</k>, <k>konocar</k> <k>Konocar</k> esas havar
l’ideo, la nociono pri ulu, ulo per sensi; <k>savar</k> esas
pure mental ago. On <k>konocas</k> ulu per la nomo, la vizajo; on
<k>savas</k> gramatiko. V. exp. (2): <k>Savigar</k>, <k>informar</k>, <k>instruktar</k>, <k>avizar</k>, <k>notifikar</k>, <k>instruciono</k> <k>Savigar</k>
esas la maxim generala vorto. <k>Informar</k>esas konocigar
fakti; <k>instruktar</k>, konocigar teoriala o ciencala veraji; <k>avizar</k>
donar ula praktikal informo, konsilo od impero; <k>notifikar</k>
konocigar fakto per oficiala formo. <k>Instruciono</k> esas
indiko di la metodo o maniero por uzar juste ed utile ula kozo,
instrumento, kuracilo, e.c.; II-646.
<k>savano</k> savanna: treeless plain or meadow; U.S.: prarie.

<k>savurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to savo(u)r, relish (a dish); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to enjoy, delight in; <k>savuro</k> savo(u)r, relish. Def.: Gustar
lente, kun atenco e plezuro. Ex.: Savurar ula vino, tasedo de
kafeo. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Savurar ula plezuro, la honori.
<k>sbiro*</k> sbirro: a former member of Italian Police.

<k>se</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> if (followed frequently, but not
necessarily by conditional); <k>sene</k> if not or else,
otherwise; <k>senur</k> if only, provided that. Ex.: Se me povus,
me venus. To esas importanta, se vera. Obediez; se ne, gardez! Me
facos to, se nur il venos.

<k>sebo</k> tallow or tallow-like substance, suet; (cf. <k>stearino</k>);
<k>seboza</k> tallowy; <k>sebifanta</k> sebaceous; <k>seboglando</k>
sebaceous gland; <k>sebgrano</k>, <k>sebpustulo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> black
pimple (on skin); <k>okul sebo</k> eye mucus, -rheum.

<k>seciono</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> section (cf. <k>segmento</k>). V.
exp.: Seciono signifikas la figuro (plana) obtenita «sekante»
objekto per plano (ex. la koniki esas konala secioni); kun ta
senco ol uzesas tre ofte en geometrio e cetera matematika cienci;
IV-351; V-660.

<k>sedo</k> bottom, backside: hinder part or seat of body; (cf.
<k>gropo</k>, <k>rumpo</k>, <k>lumbo</k>); <k>sedobalno</k> sitz-bath. V. exp.:
<k>Sedo</k> esas la ordinara vorto quan on uzas exemple en
gimnastiko: «la sedo maxim posible adsupre!» <k>kulo</k> povas
semblar shokanta; <k>gluteo</k> esas anatomiala.

<k>sedentaria</k> sedentary (life, profession). Def.: Qua
restas konstante sidanta, pro mestiero; per extenso, la mestiero
anke dicesas «sedentaria»; III-207. <k />

<k>sediciar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to (cause a) mutiny, to riot (cf. <k>rebeleskar</k>, <k>revoltar</k>); <k>populacho sedicioza</k> a riotous mob; <k>sediciema
 soldati</k> seditious (riotous) soldiers; <k>sediciema mento</k>
seditious mind. Def.: Facar mikra revolto.

<k>sedimento</k> sediment, grounds, dregs, lees; <k>sedimentala</k>, <k>sedimentatra</k> sedimentary; <k>sedimentoza</k> feculent, turbid, muddy.
<k />

<k>seduktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to seduce (chastity); to lead astray
(from the path of rectitude, duty); to beguile, entice (cf. <k>lurar</k>, <k>trompar</k>, <k>facinar</k>, <k>misduktar</k>, <k>koruptar</k>, <k>subornar</k>); <k>sedukto</k>, <k>sedukteso</k> seduction; <k>seduktanta</k>, <k>seduktiva</k> enticing, seductive,
captivating, engaging, winning; <k>seduktanto</k>, <k>seduktero</k> seducer (cf. <k>atraktiva</k>).
Ex.: Seduktar puerino. La charmo di lua manieri seduktas me.

<k>segar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to (cut with a) saw: <k>segilo</k> a
saw; <k>segillamo</k> blade of a s.; <k>trapar segar</k> to s.
through (<k>ulo</k>); <k>cirklo segilo</k> circular s.; <k>rubando
 segilo</k> ribbon-, band-s.; <k>segerio</k> sawmill; <k>segisto</k>
sawyer; <k>segpulvero</k> sawdust.

<k>seglo</k> sail (of a ship); <k>seglaro</k> sails (of a ship);
set of s.s.; <k>seglirar</k> to s.: go sailing before the wind; <k>seglonavo</k>
sailing vessel; <k>seglifisto</k> sailmaker; <k>hisar la segli</k>
to set, make sails.

<k>segmento</k> section, segment; <k>segmentigar</k> to segment:
divide into sections; <k>segmentigado</k>, <k>segmenturo</k> segmentation; <k>cirklosegmento</k>
segment of a circle; (cf. <k>seciono</k>). V. exp.: Segmento
signifikas ula determinita parto di objekto longa, lineatra, quan
on «sekas» o dividas segun lua longeso: segmento di voyo, di
fervoyo (ex. inter du stacioni), di rivero, di kanalo (inter du
sluzi), di filo telegrafala (inter du stacioni o posteni);
IV-351; V-660.

<k>segun</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> according to, agreeably to, in
conformity with; pursuant to, after; <k>segun ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex>
according to whether; <k>segunquante</k> as far as, in so far; <k>segunvola</k>
optional; <k>segunvole</k> at will. Ex.: Segun vua deskripto, vua
rekomendo, mea opiniono. Traktar ulu segun lua merito. Evangelio
segun St. Johano. Ni diskutos to, nur segun quante ol povas
kontributar a nia projeto. Segun ke vu esos richo o mizeroza, la
homi judikos vu kom bona o kom mala.

<k>seido</k> fanatical partisan, zealot. Def.: Fanatiko volunte
kriminas pro religiala zelo, e.c.

<k>sejornar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> sojourn, remain for some time at
a place (cf. <k>restar</k>).

<k>sekar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make a surface cut in; cut
partially through; divide into sections; <k>sekuro</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex>
section; <k>sekanto</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> secant; <k>sekvunduro</k>
gash, cut, slash. V. exp.: vid. <k>tranchar</k>.

<k>sekalo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> rye (Secale cereale); <k>sekalgrano</k>
a grain of rye; <k>sekalpano</k> rye-bread.

<k>sekondar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to second, back (up) support (a
motion, proposition); <k>sekondanto</k> seconder, backer.

<k>sekrecar</k> <ex>(tr., biol.)</ex> to secrete; <k>sekrec(ad)o:
 sekrecuro</k> secretion; <k>sekrecanta</k>, <k>sekrecala</k> secreting, secretory.

<k>sekreta</k> secret, not made known, not revealed,
clandestine (cf. <k>celita</k>, <k>privata</k>); <k>sekretajo</k> a secret
(cf. <k>misterio</k>); <k>sekreteso</k> secrecy; <k>sekrete</k> secretly,
in secret. V.exp.: vid. <k>arkana</k>.
<k>sekto</k> sect; <k>sektano</k> member of a s., sectarian.

<k>sekulara</k> secular, worldly; (cf. <k>laika</k>); <k>sekular(ul)o</k>
a secular priest (not a regular); <k>sekulara klerikaro</k> secular
clergy: clergy not bound by monastic vows; <k>sekularigar</k> to
secularize.

<k>sekundo</k> second: 60th of a minute of time or
of an arc.

<k>sekundara</k> secondary: indicates relationship as used in
geology, electricity, public school, medicine, etc., compared
with <k>primara</k>, <k>terciara</k>; (cf. <k>acesora: duesmagrada; min
 grava</k>).

<k>sekura</k> safe, secure: out of danger, without danger; <k>sekureso</k>safety, security; <k>sekuresar</k> to be s., <k>sekurigar</k> to
make safe, secure (cf. <k>certigar</k>); <k>sekurespolico</k>
detective police; <k>sekuresvalvo</k> valve; Ex.: Pozar ulo en
sekura loko. Voyajar sekure (od, en sekureso). Sekurigar sua
havajo.

<k>selo</k> saddle; <k>seleto</k>, <k>selkuseneto</k> s.-pad (as for
cart-horse); <k>selizar</k> to s., <k>seliferio</k> saddlery
(where saddles are made; cf. <k>harnesiferio</k>); <k>selkavalo</k>
s.-horse; <k>hominselo</k> side-s., lady’s s.; <k>selarko</k>
s. bow; <k>senseligar</k>to unsaddle.

<k>selektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to select, choose, pick out (cf. <k>elektar</k>, <k>preferar</k>, <k>asortar</k>); <k>selekto</k> selection, option; <k>selektajo</k>
what is chosen, choice. Ex.: Selektar sua amiki. Selektar la
maxim bona cerizi. Naturala selektado.

<k>semar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to sow, strew, scatter
(seed for growth); <k>semajo</k> what is sown; seed. <k />

<k>semano</k> week; <k>omna semane</k>, <k>singla semane</k> every w., each
w., weekly; <k>ca semane</k> this week; <k>santa semano</k> Holy Week;
<k>mi semana</k> twice a w., every half w.; <k>du semana</k>
bi-weekly, every two weeks.

<k>semantiko</k> semantics, semasiology. Def.: Cienco di la
signifiki (di vorti), di lia evoluciono (parto di la
linguistiko); IV-81.

<k>semblar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to seem, appear (to be), look
(like) (cf. <k>aspektar</k>, <k>simular</k>); <k>semblo</k> appearance,
semblance, external aspect, outward show; <k>semblanta</k> seeming; <k>semblo
 falsa</k> false show, pretence; <k>semblante</k> apparently (cf. <k>kredebla</k>).
Ex.: Ca vino semblas a me esar mala. Il semblas dormar. Semblo di
amikeso.

<k>sempre</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> always (cf. <k>perpetue</k>, <k>sencese</k>);
<k>por sempre</k> for ever, evermore; <k>sempra</k> perpetual. Ex.:
On ne esas sempre felica. Matine me levas me sempre tre frue.

<k>sen</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> without, not with, free from:
indicates absence, privation, exclusion, destitution; (Note: <k>Sen</k>
is often compounded with verbs in place of <k>des</k>, <k>ne</k>to
signify deprivation, absence: <k>desesperar</k> to despair; <k>senesperigar</k>
to deprive (<k>ulu</k>) of hope; <k>neesperanta</k> unhopeful; <k>senespera</k>hopeless. Note that in the adjective form the suffix <k>sena</k>is
used, not <k>senala</k>, <k>senoza</k>, <k /> etc. <k>senespera</k>, <k />not <k>senesperoza</k>, <k>senviva korpo</k> a lifeless body; <k>senfalio</k>without
fail, unfailingly; <k>sen to</k> without that, otherwise; <k>sen
 ke</k> <ex>(conj.)</ex> without (that), unless: <k>me ne povas
 parolar</k>, <k>sen ke il interruptas me</k> I cannot speak without
his interrupting me. Ant.: <k>kun</k>.

<k>senco</k> sense, meaning; <k>dusenceso</k>, <k>sencajo</k> double
meaning; <k>plursenca vorto</k> a word with various
significations; <k>nejusta senco</k> improper sense; <k>sensenca</k>
senseless; <k>sensencajo</k> a senseless thing or act;
nonsense. V.exp.: <k>Senco</k>, <k>signifiko</k> La <k>senco</k> di ula
vorto konsistas en la diversa idei, quin ol expresas od implikas;
lua <k>signifiko</k> konsistas en la diversa objekti, a qui ol
esas aplikebla. Ex.: La vorti «Blanka Monto» havas senco
aplikebla a omna blanka monti; ma lua signifiko restriktesas ad
un monto. Simile la Glacial Oceano, la Nigra e la Reda Maro,
e.c. La vorti «la maxim granda de la nombri» havas senco
komprenebla e mem klara, ma korespondas a nula objekto; ol
«signifikas nulo;» (Further discussion of these synonyms may be
found in VI-80-81).

<k>sencesa</k> continual, incessant: constantly renewed or
recurring (cf. <k>kontinua</k>).

<k>sendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to send: cause to go, dispatch,
forward; <k>sendajo</k> what is sent; parcel (of goods); <k>sendato</k>
person sent; messenger, emissary; <k>sendato diplomacala</k>
envoy. <k />

<k>senheredanteso</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> escheat: failure of
heritable heirs by which property reverts to the State.

<k>senhonora</k> unhono(u)red: without hono(u)r: <k>senigar</k>
to dishono(u)r, deprive (<k>ulu</k>) of hono(u)r.

<k>seniora; o</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>ino</k> senior, elder, eldest; <k>eso</k>
seniority, eldership; <k>yuro</k> birthright; <ex>(jur.)</ex>
primogeniture.

<k>senkapa</k> headless, acephalus; <k>senigar</k> to lop the
head from, decapitate.

<k>senkernigar</k> to stone (peaches, etc.); to core (apples,
etc.).

<k>senpeligar</k> to depilate, remove the hair, the bristles
from; <k>seneskar</k> to lose (shed) the hair <ex>(of animals);</ex>
<k>senigiva</k>, <k>senivo</k> depilatory.

<k>senpudora</k> immodest, wanton: without (womanly) modesty; <k>senajo</k>
immodest act (cf. <k>sordidajo</k>, <k>lacivajo</k>).

<k>senso</k> sense: one of the five physical senses or
faculties; <k>sensala</k> <ex>(physiol.)</ex> sensorial, sensory; <k>sensala
 plezuri</k> pleasures of the senses; <k>sensalismo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex>
sensualism: sensationalism, the doctrine that all knowledge
originates in sensation (cf. <k>sensualismo</k>).

<k>sensaciono*</k> sensation: excited interest or feeling (cf. <k>sento</k>);
<k>sensacionala</k> sensational (cf. <k>impresanta</k>, <k>sensacioniva</k>). Ex.: Ula
novaji ofte produktas sensaciono. Sensacionala jurnali, libri.

<k>sensuala</k> sensual: devoted to the gratification of the
senses; voluptuous; <k>sensual(ul)o</k>, <k>sensualisto</k> s. person; sensualist; <k>sensualismo</k>
sensualism: sensuality (cf. <k>sensalismo</k>). Def.: Devota a
sensala plezuri; agreabla a la sensi.

<k>sentar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to feel (a sensation) (cf. <k>konciar</k>, <k>perceptar</k>, <k>flarar</k>, <k>odorar</k>, <k>saporar</k>); <k>sent(ad)o</k> feeling,
sensation; <k>sentebla</k> sensible: which is felt; <k>senteble</k>
sensibly: perceptibly; <k>sentiva</k>, <k>sentema</k> sensitive,
impressionable, susceptible; <k>sentiveso</k>, <k>sentemeso</k>
sensitiveness, sensibility, susceptibility; <k>senteyo</k>, <k>sentocentro</k> sensorium, place of sensation; <k>sentivigar</k>
to make sensitive; <k>me sentas me varma</k> (od, <k>kom varma</k>)<k />
I feel warm (cf. IV-691). Ex.: Sentar koldeso, hungro, dursto,
doloro.

<k>sentenco</k> sentence: maxim: short saying containing an
axiom, saw (cf. <k>proverbo</k>). (N.B. This is not the E.
grammatical «sentence» cf. <k>frazo</k>); <k>sentencema</k>, <k>sentencatra</k>
sententious, terse, pithy. Ex.: Sentenco da Seneca. Stilo,
maniero sentencala.

<k>sentimento</k> sentiment, mental feeling, emotion (opp. to
physical sensation), <k>sentimentala</k> <ex>(of things)</ex> sentimental;
<k>sentimentema; sentimentemo</k> sentimental (person); <k>sentimentemeso</k>
sentimentality. Ex.: La sentimento di lo bela. Me havas nula
sentimento ecepte la tristeso. Sentimento di odio. Sentimentala
tono, diskurso. Yunino sentimentema.

<k>sentinelo</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> sentinel, sentry; <k>sentinelesar</k>to
be on s. watch (cf. <k>facionar</k>); <k>sentineligar</k> to post (<k>ulu</k>)
as a s.

<k>senvalora</k> worthless; <k>senigar</k> to render worthless;
<ex>(of money)</ex> to demonetize.

<k>sep</k> seven; <k>sepesma</k> seventh; <k>sepimo</k>
one-seventh; <k>sepyara</k> septennial; <k>sepadek</k> seventy; <k>sepadekyara</k>, <k>sep(ul)o</k> septuagenar-y, -ian; (for other derivative forms, cf.
<k>du</k>).

<k>separar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to separate, part, divide, (<k>ulo</k>, <k>de ulo</k>); <k>(su)</k> to secede, withdraw; <k>separo</k>, <k>separeso</k>
separation, severing, partition; secession; <k>separilo</k> anything
which separates: a partition; <k>separajo</k> that which is
separated, a s. part; <k>separanta</k>, <k>separiva</k> separating, seceding,
separative: <k>separate</k> separately; <k>separanto</k>, <k>separemo</k>
secessionist, separatist; <k>separebla</k>separable; <k>separolineo</k>
line of demarcation. Ex.: Separar la kapo de la korpo. Ta rivero
separas ca du provinci. Separar su de ula societo. Lia diversa
interesti separas li. Ni judikos separate la du kozi.

<k>sepio</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> sepia, cuttlefish (genus: Sepia); <k>sepiajo</k>
sepia (pigment); <k>sepidesegno</k>, <k>sepiuro</k> s. drawing.

<k>sepultar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to entomb, bury (a dead body) (cf.
<k>enterigar</k>); <k>sepulteskar</k> to prepare for burial, lay
out (a body); <k>sepulto</k>, <k>sepulturo</k> sepulture, burial (cf. <k>tombo</k>);
<k>sepulteyo</k> place of burial; <k>sepultotuko</k> shroud, winding
sheet.

<k>sequar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to follow, go or come after, go
next, to be or come next; <k>sequo</k> sequence, continuation; <k>sequanto</k>
a follower; <k>sequanta</k> next, subsequent; <k>sequantaro</k>
retinue, train, attendants, suite; <k>sequantajo</k> sequel,
continuation: that which follows; <k>sequante</k> in pursuance, in
conformity; <k>seque</k> then, (here)after; <k>sequinda</k> worth
following; <k>sequenda</k> which must be followed. Ex.: Il marchis
adavane e la altri sequis il. Sequar ulu per la okulo. Sequar
voyo, metodo. La sequantaro venis dop (od, sequante) il. Sequo di
lud-karti. Il remarkis sua eroro erste ye la sequante matino.
Exemplo sequinda. Voyo sequenda.

<k>sequencio*</k> <ex>(R.C. liturgy)</ex> sequence: a certain
hymn sung during mass.

<k>sequestrar</k> <ex>(tr., jur.)</ex> to sequester; <k>sequestr(ad)o</k>, <k>sequestreso</k> sequestration; <k>sequestrajo</k> what is sequestered. Ex.:
Sequestrar la havajo di ulu.

<k>sequoyo</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> sequoia: red-wood tree (Sequoia
gigantea; Sequoia sempervirens).

<k>sero</k> <ex>(physiol.)</ex> serum: thin, transparent part of
blood (cf. <k>serumo</k>); <k>seroza</k> serous: <ex>(fig.)</ex>
watery; <k>lakto sero</k> whey: thin part of milk (cf. <k>selakto</k>).

<k>serbatano</k> air-cane; pea-shooter. Def.: Longa tubo uzata por
lansar, per suflado, mikra projektili. <k />

<k>serchar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to seek, look for, search for, be in
quest of; <k>serch(ad)o</k> search(ing); <k>serchanto</k>, <k>serchero</k>, <k>serchemo</k>
seeker, searcher; <k>tra serchar</k> to s. through, to rummage.
Ex.: Serchar oro. Serchar vorto en vorto-libro. Serchar lojeyo.
Il serchas oportunajo por ganar la pekunio. <k />

<k>serena</k> <ex>(phys., mental)</ex> serene, placid; <k>sereneso</k>
serenity. Ex.: Mieno, fronto, tempo serena. <k />

<k>serio</k> series, row, file; continued succession, order or
course (cf. <k>intersequo</k>, <k>sucedo</k>); <k>serie</k> in s., in
rows. Ex.: Serio di personi, di objekti, di questioni, di soni.
<k />
