<k>serioza</k> serious, sedate, grave; not lively or amusing; <k>serioz(ul)o</k>
a s. person; <k>seriozeso</k> seriousness. Ex.: Serioza karaktero,
konverso, morbo. Parolar serioze. Konsiderar ulu, ulo kom
serioza. V. exp.: vid. <k>grava.</k> Ant.: <k>vivaca</k>, <k>gaya</k>, <k>amuzanta</k>, <k>ridiganta</k>, <k>komika</k>, <k>jokema.</k> <k />

<k>serono</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> seroon: a bale of tea, indigo, etc.
wrapped in hide. <k />

<k>serpo</k> bill-hook, pruning-bill; <k>serpeto</k> pruning-,
garden-knife. Def.: Speco di kultelo larja kun pinto kurvigita
(en la sama plano), qua servas por taliar la arbori, tranchar la
branchi; VI-539. <k />

<k>serpento</k> serpent, snake; <k>serpentala</k> relating to s.; <k>serpentatra</k>, <k>serpentoforma</k> serpentine; <k>serpentofuzeo</k> Pharaoh’s
serpent: a species of fireworks; <k>serpentokorno</k> serpent: a
former musical instrument; <k>serpentotubo</k> a winding tube. <k />

<k>seruro</k> lock; <k>serur(if)isto</k> locksmith; <k>serurhoko</k> l.
catch; <k>resort seruro</k> spring l.; <k>sekures seruro</k> safety
l. Ex.: Klef-agar la seruro do pordo. <k />

<k>servar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to be of service to, to serve
(as an assistant or domestic); to be in the service (of), to
serve (customers), to tend (a machine); <k>serv(ad)o</k> serving,
service (cf. <k>servico</k>); <k>servanto</k>, <k>servisto</k> servant,
servitor; <k>servistino</k> maid servant; <k>servistaro</k> <ex>(collect.)</ex>
domestics, servants; <k>servema</k> obliging, willing to serve; <k>servemeso</k>
obligingness; <k>servo tablo</k> serving table; <k>vua servanto</k>
(polite phrase) your servant; <k>servachar</k>to dance attendance
on (<k>ulu</k>), <k>servemacha</k> servile. Ex.: Servar ulu. Esar
servisto di ulu. Facar servo ad ulu. Me esas pronta servar vu.
Administrala servado. Servar ulu kom sekretario. Servar kliento,
mashino. <k />

<k>servico</k> <ex>(table dishes)</ex> service; <k>servico kristala</k>, <k>arjenta</k>, <k>porcelana</k> crystal, silver, china service (cf. <k>disho</k>).
<k />

<k>servitudo</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> servitude: liability of property to
rights of other persons, as a right of way over it. Def.: Obligo
pri domeno relate altra domeno; III-606.<k />

<k>sesgar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cut (<k>ulo</k>) in the form of a
crescent; <ex>(of dresses)</ex> to cut low; (cf. <k>dekoltar</k>).
Ex.: Sesgar korsajo. <k />

<k>sesiono</k> session, sittings (of a deliberative body, as a
court, legislature, etc.). V. exp.: Duro dum qua deliberanta
korporaciono kunsidas kontinue. To ne esas <k>kunsido</k>, qua
indikas la duro di singla kunveno; III-332. <k />

<k>severa</k> severe, hard, stern, harsh, strict (cf. <k>austera</k>);
<k>severeso</k>, <k>severajo</k> <ex>(quality, act)</ex> severity; <ex>(of
weather) </ex>inclemency. Def.: Rigoroza; ne-indulgema. Ex.:
Severa judiciisto, lego, morbo, klimato. Ant.: <k>indulgema</k>.
<k />

<k>sexto</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> sixth: an interval of six diatonic
degrees. <k />

<k>sexuo</k> sex; <k>sexuala</k> sexual; <k>sexualeso</k> sexuality:
state of being distinguished by s.; <k>sen sexua</k> sexless. Ex.:
La sexuo maskala, femina. Personi di la du sexui. Sexuala diferi,
orgami. <k />

<k>sezono</k> season (of the year; cf. <k>okaziono</k>, <k>oportunajo</k>);
<k>sezonala</k> seasonable (weather, etc.); -<k>lugumi</k>
vegetables in s.; <k>pluv sezono</k> rainy s.; <k>stagno sezono</k>
dull, dead s.; <k>posa sezono</k> latter part of the s.; <ex>(fig.) </ex>autumn.
<k />

<k>sfero</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> sphere, globe; <k>sfera</k>, <k>sferala</k>, <k>sferatra</k>
spherical. V. exp.: vid. <k>balono</k>. <k />

<k>shablono</k> pattern (cf. <k>modelo</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex> routine
(cf. <k>rutino</k>). Def.: Plana figuro, qua indikas la konturi
sugun qui on devas taliar stofo; anke utila metafore (por
expresar sklavatra kopiado); IV-447 <k />

<k>shabrako</k> shabrak: ornamented saddle cloth, caparison. Def.:
Tegilo ornita di kavalo; VI-75. <k />

<k>shafto</k> shaft, staff: long handle, as of a lance; stock (of
a gun); shank (of a tool); (cf. <k>shakto</k>). <k />

<k>shako</k> chessman; <k>shakludo</k>chess (the game); <k>shakludar</k>
to play c.; <k>shakplanko</k> chess board; <k>shakar</k> to give a
check (to the king). V. exp.: Por la shako-ludo on adoptas: damo,
episkopo, kavalo, turmo, e la expresuri: soldati, oficeri,
roquar, shakar la rejo; VI-116; for other descriptive terms, cf.
VI-299. <k />
<k>shakto</k> shaft, pit (of a mine or quarry). <k />

<k>shalmo</k> pipe or tube of straw, reed, glass, or metal (as
used for sucking up liquids); (chemist’s) blowpipe; shawm:
an acient reed instrument; shepherd’s pipe; <ex>(bot.)</ex>
hollow sterm (of a plant). <k />

<k>shalupo</k> (sailing-) launch, long boat or cutter propelled by
sails or oars; shallop; <k>vapor shalupo</k> steam launch. <k />

<k>shamar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be ashamed (<k>pri</k> <k>ulo</k>);
<k>shamigar</k> to s. (<k>ulu</k>), to make (<k>ulu</k>) feel
ashamed, to humiliate, mortify; (cf. <k>pudoro</k>); <k>shamo</k>
shame, disgrace; <k>shaminda</k>, <k>shamiganta</k> shameful, disgraceful,
foul, dirty (word, act); <k>shamindajo</k> act of vileness; <k>shamindeso</k>
turpitude, baseness, vileness, shamefulness; <k>sen shama</k>
shameless; <k>sen shameso</k> shamelessness, effrontery. Def.:
Shamo: perturbo di la koncienco, igita da deshonoro, ridindajo,
e.c. Ex.: Il devos balde shamar pri sua mala agado. Vua
diligenteso shamigas me. Il esas shamoza pri sua ofenso. Shaminda
(od, sham-iganta) konduto, vorti, agi. <k />

<k>shancelar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to stagger, totter, waver, reel,
be unstready, shake; <k>shanceligar</k> to cause something to totter; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to shake (an opinion, decision, etc.); <k>shancelo</k> reeling,
tottering. <k />

<k>sharko</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> shark. V. exp.: <k>Sharko</k> esas la
nomo vulgara di Squalus carcharius; <k>squalo</k> esas la nomo di
la genero Squalus. <k />

<k>sharlatano</k> charlatan, quack-doctor, mountebank; <k>sharlataneso</k>
charlatanism, quackery. Def.: Venderacho di drogi,
dent-extirpero, e.c. en publika loki; <ex>(fig.)</ex> ne-savanta
mediko qua explotas la publiko. <k />

<k>sharpo</k> scarf (for shoulders); sash (as insignia or
ornament); <ex>(surg.)</ex> sling; (cf. <k>zono</k>); <k>havar la
 brakio en sharpo</k> to have the arm in a sling; <k>dentala sharpo</k>
lace scarf. <k />
<k>sheiko</k> sheik. Def.: Chefo di Araba tribuo; III-603. <k />

<k>sheklo</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> shackle. Def.: Masho di kateno qua
havas altra formo kam la cetera mashi e servas por specala skopo
(fixigo di la hoko, di siteli en dragilo, e.c.); III-85-6. <k />

<k>shelo</k> shell, peel, rind, hull: hard outer case of eggs,
nuts, etc.; (cf. <k>skalio</k>, <k>bruo</k>); <k>ovo shelo</k> egg-shell;
<k>senshela pizi</k> shelled peas; <k>sensheligar</k> to
shell, peel: <k>onyonshelo</k> onion skin. <k />

<k>shibro</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> slide-valve (in steam engine);
sluice-gate (for water). Def.: Valvo-pordo qua agas glitante en
sua plano tale ke ol obstruktas (parte o tote) vaporo en la
vapor-mashino, aqua en kanalo, tubo, e.c.; III-293. <k />

<k>shifono</k> rag: piece of cloth torn off (cf. <k>rago</k>);
scrap (of paper, etc.); <k>shifonisto</k> rag-picker; <k>shifonuyo</k>
rag-, scrap-holder. <k />

<k>shikanar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to chicane: to pettifog, quibble,
prolong a contest by shifts, subterfuges; <ex>(tr.)</ex> to quibble
over something or with somebody about something; to wrangle
(without motive); <k>shikano</k>, <k>shikanemeso</k> chicanery, sharp practice,
pettifogging, quibbling. <k />

<k>shinko</k> ham: thigh of a hog prepared for food; <k>shinketo</k>
small h.; knuckle of h. <k />

<k>shirmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to shelter, shield, screen: <k>shirmar su</k>
to take shelter; <k>shirmanta</k>, <k>shirmiva</k> sheltering; <k>shirmilo</k>, <k>shirmivo</k>
shelter, cover; <ex>(fig.)</ex> refuge; <k>shirmtekto</k> penthouse,
lean-to (cf. <k>hangaro</k>). Ex.: Parasuno shirmas el. Shirmata
da la foliaro kontre la vento e suno. <k />

<k>«shirting»</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> shirting: cloth suitable for
making shirts.<k />

<k>shokar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to shock: (physical) to strike
on or against, dash against; give a shock to, clash with;
(mental) to offend, be offensive to; (cf. <k>kolizionar</k>); <k>shoko</k>
shock, clashing, concussion; <k>shokanta</k> shocking, clashing; <k>shokar
 glasi</k> to hobnob; touch glasses; <k>retro shoko</k>
counter-shock, -blow; <k>shokopulsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to
hustle, jostle (<k>ulu</k>). Ex.: La navo shokas rifo. Du
inter-shokanta korpi produktas sono. Nulo quon vu dicas povas
shokar me. La shoko renversis il. Vorto, konduto shokanta. <k />

<k>shovar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to shove or push (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>)
along; (cf. <k>pulsar</k>, <k>glitar</k>). Ex.: Shovar ulu sur glacio.
Shovar su tra turbo. Shovar botelo sur tablo, batelo al aquo.

<k>shuo</k> (low-) shoe for the human feet); <k>shuo alta</k>
high s. (which extends above tha ankles; cf. <k>boteto</k>); <k>shutalono</k>
heel of a s.; <k>shureparar</k> to cobble; <k>shuiferio</k>
manufactory; <k>shuvendeyo</k> s.-selling shop; <k>shumetilo</k>
s.-horn; <k>shuformizilo</k> s.-tree; <k>senshuigar</k> to
pull off shoes; <k>shunetigisto</k> s.-cleaner, -black. V.
exp.: <k>Shuo</k> ne esas <k>boto</k> shuo esas basa pedvesto,
sub la maleoli; IV-101.

<k>shultro</k> shoulder; <k>shultri larja</k> broad s.s; <k>shultropozar
 (fusilo)</k> to shoulder (a gun); <k>shultropulsar</k>, <k>shultrshovar</k> to
push or shove with the s.s.; <k>levar la shultri</k> lift, shrug the
s.s; <k>shultropeco</k> s.piece (cf. <k>epoleto</k>).

<k>shutro</k> blind, shutter (as for window); <k>shutro faldebla</k>
folding s.
<k>si</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> si: seventh note of diatonic scale.

<k>sidar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to sit , be seated (of persons,
assemblies, courts); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to lie, reside <ex>(of things)</ex>;
<k>sidigar</k> to seat (<k>ulu</k>); <k>sideskar</k> to take
one’s seat, sit down; <k>sidilo</k> <ex>(furniture)</ex> seat; <k>bisidilo</k>
seat for two persons; <k>sideyo</k> place where one sits; seat,
bench (as of a court); see (of a bishop); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
residence; <k>santa eyo</k> Holy See; <k>sidobalno</k> hip-bath;
<k>sidoposturo</k> manner of sitting; <k>kunsidar</k> to sit
together, meet (of several persons). Ex.: Me sideskas an la
tablo. Me sidigas gasti an mea tablo, pose me sideskas. La korto
di kasaco sidas en Paris. Paris esas la sideyo di la guvernerio. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
La sideyo di morbo.

<k>siejar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to besiege, lay s. to, invest (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>siejostando</k> condition of s.; <k>cesar la siejo</k>
to raise the s.

<k>siestar</k> <ex>(intr.) </ex>to have a nap; <k>siesto</k> siesta,
midday or afternoon nap.

<k>sifiliso</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> syphilis; <k>sifilisala</k>
syphilitic: relating to s.; <k>sifilisika</k>, <k>sifilisiko</k> syphilitic
(person).

<k>siflar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to whistle: make a shrill
sound ordinarily musical; <ex>(fig., med.)</ex> to wheeze; to whiz;
<k>siflilo</k> a whistle; <k>siflanto</k>, <k>siflero</k> a whistler, one who
whistles. Def.: Facar la sono (ordinare) muzikala, kun alteso
definita, quan produktas sifl-ilo, t.e. orgen-tubo kurta e
konseque akuta, o la sifilo di lokomotivo; VII-207. Ex.: Siflar a
hundo. Siflar ario. La respirado di asmatiko siflas. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
La vento, flecho, paf-kuglo (ulfoye) siflas. V. exp.: vid. <k>sisar</k>.

<k>sigaro</k> cigar; <k>sigareto</k> cigarette; <k>sigarifisto</k>
c. maker; <k>sigaruyo</k> c. holder; <k>sigartranchilo</k> c. cutter.
<k />
<k>sigilario*</k> sigillaria: a genus of fossil trees.

<k>sigiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to seal, affix a s., as a mark of
authenticity, to a document, letter, bottle, etc.; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to seal up: close for security, as a closing a letter by means of
gum or wafer; (cf. <k>masonar</k>); <k>sigi(ad)o</k> <ex>(act)</ex>
sealing; <k>sigiuro</k> <ex>(imprint)</ex> seal; <k>sigiilo</k> <ex>(instr.)</ex>
seal; <k>sigianto</k>, <k>sigiisto</k> sealer: <k>sigiovaxo</k> sealing wax; <k>sigioringo</k>
signet ring.

<k>signo</k> <ex>(natural or artificial)</ex> sign, mark (cf. <k>indikajo</k>, <k>indico</k>); <k>signizar</k> to put a s. on (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>); <k>signifar</k>
to make signs; <k>tempo signo</k> sign of the times; <k>facar
 kruco signo</k> to make the s. of the cross; <k>krucosignizar
 su</k> to cross oneself; <k>puntizo signo</k> s. of punctuation; <k>kapo
 signo</k>nod or shake of the head; <k>zodiakala signo</k> s. of the
zodiac. Ex.: Vorti esas signi di idea. Muti parolas (od,
signalifas) per signi. Signi aparis en la cielo.

<k>signalar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to signal: convey (<k>ulo</k>) by
s.; <k>signalizar</k> to hoist signals on (a mast,etc.), to cover
with signals; to write or put a s. (on a tree, etc.); <k>signalifar</k>
to make signals.

<k>signatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sign, subscribe (one’s
name), put signature to (cf. <k>subskribar</k>); <k>signato</k>
signing (by name); <k>signaturo</k> signature; <k>signaturo blanka</k>
signature in blank; <k>signatajo</k> what is signed, the document; <k>stereotipa
 (</k>od<k>klishita) signaturo</k> stamped facsimile of a signature.
Def.: Skribar sua nomo por certigar od autentikigar dokumento;
V-494.

<k>signifikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to signify, mean; <k>signifiko</k>
signification, meaning; <k>signifikanta</k>, <k>signifikiva</k> significant,
significative; <k>sen signifika</k> insignificant (cf. <k>senvalora</k>, <k>neimportanta</k>). Ex.: Quon signifikas ta vorto? Bona defini
establisas la signifiki di la vorti. V. exp.: vid. <k>senco</k>.

<k>sikar</k> dry, dried: free from moisture; <k>sikeso</k>
dryness, drought: <k>sikigar</k>, <k>sikeskar</k> to dry (up), desiccate; <k>sikigiva</k>
desiccative, siccative, drying. Ant.: <k>humida</k>.

<k>sikio</k> sickle. Def.: «Falchileto», t.e. longa streta
lameno kun mi-cirklatra formo, quan on uzas (od uzis) por
tranchar ex. la frumento; VI-538.

<k>silabo</k> syllable; <k>silabala</k> syllabic; <k>silabigar</k> to
separate into s.s.; to spell by s.s.; <k>du silab silaba vorto</k> a
word of two s.s.

<k>silencar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be silent: not to make noise;
<k>silencigar</k> to silence (a machine etc.); <k>silenco</k> silence,
stillness; <k>silencanta</k>, <k>silencoza</k>, <k>silencema</k> silent, still; <k>silencez</k>
stop that noise! Ex.: La mashino silencis. Dum la silenco di la
nokto. Foresto silencoza. V. exp.: <k>Taco</k> esas absenteso di
parolado; <k>silenco</k> absenteso di bruiso. Ant.: <k>bruisar</k>.

<k>silexo</k> silex: pure quartz, flint; <k>silexatra</k>
flintlike; <k>pafilala silexo</k> gun-flint. Ex.: La primitiva homi
facis sua hakili ek silexo.

<k>siliko</k> <ex>(chem.)</ex> silicon; <k>silikato</k> silicate; <k>silikatacido</k>
silicic acid. Def.: La kemiala elemento Si; V-159. <k />

<k>silko</k> silk; <k>silka</k> <ex>(made of)</ex> silk; <k>silkajo</k>, <k>silka stofo</k> s. goods; <k>silkofilo</k> s. thread; <k>silkokulturado</k>
s. culture; <k>silkoraupo</k> silkworm.

<k>simaro</k> simar: <ex>(of priests)</ex> cassock; (cf. <k>sutano</k>);
<ex>(justice’s)</ex> robe; a former long gown worn by women.

<k>simbolo</k> symbol, emblem, sign; <k>simbola</k>, <k>simbolala</k>, <k>simbolatra</k>
symbolic(al), typical, emblematic; <k>simbolismo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex>
symbolism; <k>simbolizar</k> to symbolize; <k>simbolesar</k> to be
symbolized (<k>da ulo</k>). Ex.: La balanco esas la simbolo dil
yusteso. La glavo simbolizas la lego.

<k>simetra</k> symmetrical: which corresponds in proportion,
position; <k>simetreso</k> symmetry; <k>simetresoza</k> symmetrical:
full of symmetry; <k>simetrigar</k> to symmetrize: reduce to
symmetry; <k>ne simetreso</k> asymmetry. Ex.: Simetra aranjo di
vazi. Simetreso di diskurso. Simetra arkitekturo.

<k>simio</k> <ex>(general term)</ex> simian: ape, monkey, baboon,
etc.; <k>simialajo</k> an ape-like trick.

<k>simila</k> similar, like; <ex>(plural)</ex> alike (<k>ad</k>);<k>simil(ul)o</k> a like person; a fellow creature; <k>simileso</k>
similarity, similitude; <k>similajo</k> <ex>(objective)</ex> a s.
thing, a similarity; <k>similigar</k> to render s., to assimilate
(cf. <k>asimilar</k>); <k>similesar</k> to be s., be alike,
resemble; <k>simile</k> in like manner; <k>ne simila</k> unlike,
dissimilar; <k>sen simila</k> matchless (cf. <k>sen similegala</k>).
Ex.: Vizaji, kozi, anguli simila. Ebriemeso similigas la homo a
la bruto.

<k>simoniar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to practice simony; <k>simonio</k>
simony. Def.: <k>Simonio</k> komerco kontre-etika di la sakra
kozi: III-332.

<k>simpatiar</k> <ex>(tr., moral and physical)</ex> to sympathize
with, have sympathy for (<k>ulu</k>); <ex>(phys.)</ex> be in
sympathy with; <k>simpatiala</k> sympathetic: relating to s.; <k>simpatioza</k>
sympathetic: full of s., congenial; <k>simpatiinda</k> which inspires
sympathy; <k>inter simpatiar</k> to mutually sympathize; Ex.:
Simpatiala vibri, soni. Simpatioza sentimento, amiko. Simpatiinda
povrulo. Merkurio simpatias la oro. Me simpatias vu pro vua
desfortuno. Ant.: <k>antipatiar.</k>

<k>simpla</k> simple: not complex or complicated; easy; <ex>(of
dress)</ex> plain, common; <k>simpleso</k> simplicity; plainness; <k>simple</k>
simply, with simplicity; <k>(plu) simpligar</k> to simplify; <k>simpleskar</k>
to become simplified; <k>simpla soldato</k> common soldier, private;
Ex.: L’oro, l’arjento, la fero esas simpla korpi.
Mekanismo, metodo nekomplikita esas simpla. Simpla stilo, gusti.
Simpleso di mori, di vestaro. Vestizar simple. Plu-simpl-igar
problemo. Ant.: <k>komplexa</k>, <k>kompozita</k>, <k>komplikita.</k>

<k>simptomo</k> <ex>(med. and fig.)</ex> symptom: <k>simptoma</k>, <k>simptomatra</k>
symptomatic. Ex.: Simptomo di anemio. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Simptomo di
revolto.

<k>simular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to simulate (cf. <k>fingar</k>, <k>imitar</k>);
<k>simulachar</k> to ape; <k>simulita paco</k> fictitious peace. Def.:
Aparigar kom reala ulo quo ne esas tala. Ex.: Simular kombato,
maladeso.

<k>simultana</k> common, co-existing, co-equal, simultaneous.
V. exp.: Qua valoras egale e kune, solidare, ex.: equacioni
simultana. Konseque simultana ne esas sinonimo di samtempe. Dec.
1212, VII-66

<k>sino</k> intimate place, internal part, close or secret
receptacle: <ex>(fig. senses of)</ex> bosom, heart (midst), womb.
Ex.: En la sino dil eklezio. En la sino di la tero. La sino di
Deo. En la sino di sua familio.

<k>sincera</k> sincere, frank, honest; <k>sincereso</k> sincerity; <k>ne
 sincera</k> insincere. Ex.: Homo, amikeso, regreti, laudo sincera.
Sincereso esas valoroza qualeso. Ant.: <k>hipokrita.</k>

<k>sindiko</k> syndic: a municipal officer; manager, business
agent (of corporation, company); administrative assignee (of an
insolvent’s estate).

<k>sindikato</k> <ex>(industrial, finan.)</ex> syndicate; <k>sindikatismo</k>
syndicalism; <k>sindikatisto</k> <ex>(partisan)</ex> syndicalist; <k>sindikatano</k>
member of a s.; <k>sindikatigar</k>, <k>sindikatifar</k> to s. Def.: Grupo formacita
por la defenso di sua ekonomikala interesti komuna.
<k>sinekuro</k> sinecure. Def.: Ofico sen responsiveso o devi.

<k>singla</k> each (= every single individual); <k>singlu</k> each
one, every single one; <k>single</k> singly; <k>singla karti</k> single
cards; <k>li venis single</k> they came singly (one by one); <k>dek
 centimi po singla</k> a penny apiece. Ex.: A singla dio lua
tasko. Singla spozulo havas spozino. Ica libro kustas single kin
franki. Singla soldato havas fusilo, od, singla soldati havas
fusilo (o mem <k>fusili</k>) signifikas: un fusilo ad un soldato.
V. exp.: <k>Omna</k>, <k>singla: Omna</k> havas senco kolektiva; <k>singla</k>
havas senco distributiva. Ex.: Omnu parolis, singlu en sua linguo
(E. everyone spoke, each in his own language). Omna testo juris
dicar la verajo, e singlu naracis la evento diverse (E. every
witness swore to tell the truth, and each one related the event
differently); Generale, <k>singla</k> (quale L. <ex>singulus</ex>)
signifikas: un po un, unope (pro to ta pronomo dicesas
«distributiva»; kp. II-665. Note: «Omna singla» is a
pleonasm, <k>singla</k> being sufficient to translate «every
single». The E. «single» in the sense of alone, is to be
translated by <k>sola</k>, <k>izolita</k>, <k>unika</k>, <k>separita.</k> Both <k>omna</k>and<k>singla</k> may be used with the singular and the
plural with the same sense. «Every soldier is brave» may be
trnaslated: <k>Omna soldato esas brava. Omna soldati esas brava.
 Singla soldati esas brava.</k> <k />

<k>singulara</k> singular: pertaining to one (cf. <k>stranja</k>);
<k>singularo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> s. number; <k>singulareso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>,
<k>singularajo</k> <ex>(something pertaining to one)</ex> singularity,
peculiarity. Ex.: Verbo en la singulara nombro (od, en la
singularo). Singulara propoziciono, ideo, kazo. Singulareso di
opiniono. Singularajo en la manieri di ulu.

<k>sinior(ul)o</k> lord, highness, seignior, sire (of rulers);
sir (of lords); (cf. <k>sioro</k>); <k>siniorino</k> noble lady,
Lady; <k>sinioreso</k> seigniory, lordship; <k>siniorala</k> seignioral,
lordly; <k>Nia Sinioro</k> <ex>(rel.)</ex> our lord; <k>mea sinioro</k>
your lordship; <k>sinioro rejido</k> his royal highness; <k>sinioro
 episkopo</k> his eminence, the bishop; <k>sinioro prezidanto</k> his
excellency, the president.

<k>sinistra</k> left; <ex>(nav.)</ex> port; <k>sinistra latero</k>
left side; <k>sinistruzero</k> left-handed person; <k>turnez (ad)
 sinistre</k> turn to the left. Ant.: <k>dextra.</k><k />

<k>sinkar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to sink (<k>ulo</k>, <k>en ulo</k>, <k>su</k>);
to settle, subside; Ex.: Sinkar palisegaro en la tero. La fero
sinkas en l’aquo. V.exp.: kp. <k>Dronar</k>. DE

<k>sinkopar</k> <ex>(intr., med.)</ex> to swoon; <k>sinkopigar</k> <ex>(gram.,
mus.)</ex> to syncopate; <k>sinkopo</k> <ex>(gram., mus., med.)</ex>
syncope.

<k>sinonima</k> synonymous: <k>sinonimo</k> synonym; <k>sinonimeso</k>
synonymy: quality of being a s. Ant.: <k>antonimo.</k>

<k>sinoptika</k> synoptic(al). Ex.: Sinoptika tabelo di cienci.
La sinoptika evangelio. <k />

<k>sinso</k> direction (one way); <ex>(math.)</ex> sense: one of
two opposite directions; <k>sam</k>, <k>kontresinsa</k>, <k>sinse</k>
same, contrary direction. V. exp.: <k>Direciono</k>, <k>sinso</k>
Konsiderez rekto delinita per du punti A e B. La rekto infinita
reprezentas <k>un direciono</k>, <k /> qua esas komuna ad ol e ad omna
rekti paralela; ma ol havas <k>du sinsi</k>, <k /> en qui on povas
imaginar la movo di punto sur olu: la sinso de A ad B, e la sinso
(inverso o kontrea) de B ad A. Sur mapo on kustumas indikar la
sinsi per flechi. On direktas automobilo en ula direciono per la
direktilo. E sen tushar la direktilo, sen chanjar do la
direciono, on povas movar ol en du sinsi: ad-avane e ad-dope;
V-264<k />

<k>sintezo</k> <ex>(log., math., chem.)</ex> synthesis; <k>–ala</k>, <k>ema</k> synthetic; <k>sintezar</k> to synthesize. V. exp.: Sintezo
esas l’ago inversa di analizo. Kemiala sintezo, metodo
sintezala. Sintezar albumino.

<k>sinuo</k> sinuosity, winding, bend; <k>sinuoza</k> sinuous,
winding, meandering, serpentine, tortuous; <k>sinuifar</k> to wind
about, meander. Ex.: La sinui di litoro, di rivero.

<k>sioro</k> sir or madam; <k>siorulo</k> sir, Mr., gentleman; <k>siorino</k>
Mrs., Miss, madam, lady (married or not); (cf. <k>sinioro</k>, <k>damzelo</k>, <k>damo</k>); <k>gesiori</k> ladies and gentlemen. <k />

<k>sireno</k> siren: powerful whistle; <ex>(acoustics)</ex> a
measuring instrument for air vibrations; <ex>(myth.)</ex>
sea-nymph, mermaid; <ex>(fig.)</ex> a seductive woman; <k>sirenala</k>, <k>sirenatra voco</k>, <k>kanto</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> a siren (bewitching,
fascinating) voice, song. <k />

<k>siringo</k> syringe, squirt; <k>siringagar</k> to syringe, squirt
(with a s.).

<k>sis</k> six; <k>sisadek</k> sixty; <k>siso</k> a half dozen
(Note: For other derivative forms cf. <k>du</k>).

<k>sisar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to hiss; to siss, sizzle; <k>sisanta</k>, <k>sisanto</k> sibilant. Def.: Produktas la sono sss…od
fff…, t.e. bruiso ne-muzikala, qua esas fonetike konsonanto;
VII-207. Ex.: Serpenti, gansi sisas. V. exp: Lokomotivo <k>siflas</k>
per sua siflilo, e samtempe <k>sisas</k> emisante vaporo ek la
kaldiero o la cilindri, tra robineti, ma ne siflante.<k />

<k>sismo*</k> earthquake, vibration of the earth; <k>sisma</k>, <k>sismala</k>
seismic.

<k>sismografo</k> seismograph. Def.: Instrumento por enskribar
la ter-tremi; VI-135. <k />

<k>sismometro</k>seismometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la
ter-tremi. <k />

<k>sistemo</k> system; <k>sistemala</k> <ex>(tendency)</ex> <k>sistemema</k>
systematic, methodical (cf. <k>metodala</k>, <k>sistemoza</k>); <k>sistemigar</k>
to systematize. Ex.: La sistemo di Descartes. Planetala sistemo,
od planetosistemo, od planetaro. Il esas persono tre sistemema.
Sistemigar sua idei, sua dokumenti.

<k>sistematiko*</k> systematizing: scientific (or efficient)
disposition; labo(u)r saving arrangements.

<k>situar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to place, seat, locate (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ulu</k>)
(cf. <k>jacar</k>, <k>pozar</k>, <k>plasizar</k>, <k>lokizar</k>); -<k>o</k>, <k>situeso</k>
situation, site location; <k>situita</k> situate(d). Ex.: Domo,
urbo bone situita (o kun bona situeso). Dramatatra situeso.
Situeso bona, mala, embarasiva. V. exp.: <k>Situeso</k>, <k /> relate
personi, esas generale acidentala, tempala; la <k>stando</k> esas
kustumale permananta. On trovas sua aferi en neagreabla <k>situeso</k>, <k />
qua forsan developos a permananta mala <k>stando.</k>

<k>sivo</k> sieve, sifter (for flour, etc.); strainer (for
liquids) (cf. <k>kriblo</k>, <k>filtrar</k>); <k>sivagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to sift, bolt, strain; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to examine minutely,
separate the good from the bad; to winnow.

<k>sive</k> (1) whether; (2) either; (1) <k>sive ... sive</k>
(alternative and condition) whether … or whether; <k>sive vu
 parolas</k>, <k>sive vu tacos</k>, <k>vu esos blamota</k> whether you speak,
or whether you are silent, you will be blamed; (2) <k>me drinkos</k>, <k>sive biro</k>, <k>sive vino</k> I shall drink beer or wine (N.B. In the
last example it is to be noted that <k>sive</k> is equivalent to <k>od…od</k>).
V. exp.: <k>Sive</k>, <k>od</k> <k>Sive</k> implikas sempre (segun
etimologio origino: L. sive = si-ve = od se) supozo, kondiciono,
konseque ne-certeso o questiono. Sive vu parolos, sive vu tacos,
t.e. se vu parolos, o se vu tacos. <k>Od</k> expresas simpla
alternativo; III-689, VIII-409.

<k>sizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sieze, gripe, catch or lay hold
of; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to take, grasp quickly, apprehend (arrest); to
distrain (property); <k>sizilo</k> griping. Def.: prenar o
manukaptar vivace e vigoroze ulu, ulo. ex.: Sizar l’espado
per la pinto. Sizar la brakio di ulu. Sizar la havajo di ulu.
Sizar oportuna instanto (o tempo). Sizar pretexto. Teroro sizis
la menti. La febro sizas me.

<k>skabelo</k> (wooden-) stool, foot-stool (cf.<k>tabureto</k>).
Def.: Moblo por la pedi, o por acensar sur olu; II-647.

<k>skabio</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> scabies, itch; <ex>(of animals)</ex>
mange; <k>skabiala</k>, <k>skabiatra</k>, <k>skabioza</k> scabious; <k>skabiika</k>, <k>skabiiko</k> <ex>(person,
animal)</ex> infected with itch; (N.B. A scab on a sore is to be
translated by krusto).

<k>skafandro</k> diving suit (with helmet, etc.); <k>skafandriero</k>, <k>skafandristo</k> diver. Def.: Plunj-vestaro kompleta kontenanta homo
tota; III-267.

<k>skalo</k> ladder; scale: instrument of measurement; <ex>(math.,
mus.)</ex> scale; <k>skalatre</k> ladder-like; in gradation; <k>skalogrado</k>
round rung (of a ladder); <k>skalatre dispozar</k> to arrange in
gradations; <ex>(milit.)</ex> to draw up in echelon; <k>kordo skalo</k>
rope ladder; <k>helpar ulu kom skalo</k> to act as a ladder for
someone to mount; <k>skalacensar</k> to climb a ladder; <k>skalo
 aritmetikala</k> arithmetic scale; <k>skalo sociala</k>social
scale; <k>laborar ye granda skalo</k> to work on a large scale; <k>skaloplako</k>
dial-face (for dials other than those with numbers; cf. <k>cifroplako</k>).

<k>skalio</k> shell (as of an oyster, etc.) (cf. <k>shelo</k>);
<k>skalia pektilo</k> a tortoise-shell comb; <k>tortugala skalio</k>
tortoise s.; <k>skalioza</k> scaly, squamous. Def.: La krusto dika e
solida qua kovras la korpo di la tortugi, ostri, musli, e.c.;
VI-603.

<k>skalpar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scalp: deprive of s.; <k>skalpo</k>
scalping; <k>skalpajo</k> s.: skin on top of the head.

<k>skandalar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scandalize, shock, offend (<k>ulu</k>);
<k>skandalesar</k> to be scandalized (<k>da</k>, <k>pri</k>); <k>skandalo</k>
scandal(izing); <k>skandalanta</k>, <k>skandaloza</k>, <k>skandaliva</k> scandalous. Ex.: Lua
konduto skandalis la tota urbo.

<k>skaramucho</k> scaramouch; <ex>(fig.)</ex> cowardly buffoon.
Def.: Persono di la komedio Italiana; IV-583.

<k>skarifikar</k> <ex>(tr., surg.)</ex> to scarify (the skin of
someone). V.exp.: <k>tranchar.</k>

<k>skarmuchar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to skirmish, to have a brush
with the enemy.

<k>skarsa</k> scarce: not plentiful; scanty (cf. <k>rara</k>, <k>desdensa</k>); <k>skarseso</k> scarcity. Def.: <k>Desabundanta</k>;
V-595. Ant.: <k>densa</k>, <k>abundanta.</k>

<k>skemo</k> schema, scheme: systematic plan; outline or
demonstration of a system, showing relations and functions; (N.B.
not «scheme» project); <k>skemala</k>, <k>skematra</k> schematic; <k>skemifar</k>, <k>skemizar</k> to schematize.

<k>skeno</k> hank, skein; <k>skenuno</k> one of the threads of a
skein.

<k>skeptika</k>, <k>skeptik(ul)o</k> sceptic(al); (cf. <k>nekredema</k>); <k>skeptikeso</k>
(spirit of) scepticism; <k>skeptikismo</k> scepticism: doctrine of the
sceptics. <k />

<k>skermar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to fence: pracrtise sword-play; <k>skermarto</k>art of f.; <k>skermodocanto; skermomaestro</k> fencing-master, a
master of fencing.

<k>skio</k> skee, ski; <k>skikurar</k>, <k>skiglitar</k> to skate on
skees. Def.: Speco de sketilo longa, ligna, por kurar e glitar
sur la nivo; IV-707.

<k>skisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sketch, outline, make a rough
draft of; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to delineate: give the plan or idea of; <k>skiso</k>, <k>skisuro</k> sketch, outline; (rough) drawing. Ex.: Skisar peizajo,
portreto, <ex>(fig.)</ex> poemo. Skisar demarsho. Skisuro di
romano. V. exp.: vid. <k>esbosar.</k>

<k>sklavo</k>, <k>sklavulo</k>, <k>sklavino</k> slave; <k>sklavala</k>, <k>sklavatra</k>, <k>sklavema</k>
slave, slavish, servile; -<k>eso</k>, <k>sklavatreso</k>, <k>sklavigo</k>, <k>sklavesko</k>
slavery, servility, servitude, bondage; <k>sklavesar</k> to be a s.,
be in slavery; <k>sklavigar</k> to enslave, enthrall (<k>ulu</k>); <k>sklavisto</k>
partisan of slavery; <k>sklavigisto</k> slaver.

<k>skolo</k> school: a place or establishment where instruction
is given, usually elementary; disciples or followers of some
teacher or doctrine in art, philosophy, -etc.; <k>skolala</k>
school, academic; <k>skolo komuna</k> common s.; <k>skolo di kavalko
 arto</k> riding school; <k>skolo militala</k> military academy,
school; <k>skolo yurocienco</k> law s.; <k>skolo di Platon</k> s. of
Plato; <k>skolano</k> schoolchild, pupil, scholar (cf. <k>erudito</k>, <k>ciencisto</k>, <k>lernanto</k>, <k>stipendiero</k>, <k>dicipulo</k>); <k>skolestro</k>
schoolmaster; <k>aplik skolo</k> technical school or college,
polytechnic, trade s.; <k>aplikoskolo di artilrio</k> artillery
s.

<k>skolio</k> <ex>(lit., geom.)</ex> scholium. Def.: Komento od
expliko di texto; matematikal expliko di teoremo; IV-583.

<k>skopo</k> that at which one aims; aim, scope, objective,
intent(ion), purpose, view, goal, butt, object to attack; <k>skopoplako</k>
target; <k>skopopunto</k> bull’s eye. Ex.: Vizar skopo per
flecho. Frapar la skopo per kuglo. Atingar sua skopo di vivo.
Mariajar su esis la skopo di elua esforci. Pafar a la
skopo-plako.

<k>skorbuto</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> scurvy; <k>skorbutala</k>, <k>skorbutatra</k>
scorbutic: relating to the disease; <k>skorbutika</k>, <k>skorbutiko</k> <ex>(person)</ex>
affected with s.

<k>skorio</k> <ex>(metal) </ex>scoria, dross, slag; <k>skoriigar</k>
to scorify: reduce to s.

<k>skrachar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scratch, claw, graze, gall; <ex>(of
ropes) </ex>to chafe; <ex>(of clothing)</ex> to make a rent in; (cf.
<k>lacerar</k>, <k>gratar</k>, <k>skrapar</k>, <k>exkoriar</k>). Def.: Facar sek(et)o
en la pelo (od altra surfaco), do vundeto; IV-656. V. exp.: La
ungli di kato <k>skrachas</k> bonege, ma nule <k>exkorias</k>. Me
tante <k>gratis</k> me, ke me fine <k>skrachis</k> me.

<k>skrapar</k>: <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scrape (with a tool), scrape
off, abrade; <ex>(of chimneys)</ex> to sweep; to scale off; <k>skrapuri</k>
scrapings. Def.: Deprenar gratante per instrumento ula parti de
la surfaco di korpo. Ex.: Skrapar anciena pergameno. La stono
skrapis la pelo. Skrapar kraso de la pelo, o fango de la vestaro.

<k>skribar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to write (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>); <k>skrib(ad)o</k>, <k>skriburo</k> <ex>(act, result) </ex>writing; <k>skriburo santa</k> Holy
Scriptures; <k>skribformo</k>, <k>skribmaniero</k> form or manner of writing; <k>skriba</k>
being written, being in writing; <k>skribajo</k> what is written:
written paper, document; <k>skribala</k> relating to the writing; <k>skribe</k>
in writing; <k>skribita</k> written; <k>skribanto</k>, <k>skribinto</k> writer; <k>skribisto</k>
professional writer, scribe (N.B. not author; cf. <k>autoro</k>);
<k>skribilo</k> a writing instrument, pen, etc.; <k>skribilaro</k>
stand for ink and pens; collection of writing instruments, pens; <k>enskribar</k>
to inscribe; <k>enskriburo</k> inscription; <k>skribachar</k> to
scrawl, scribble; <k>skribkuseno</k> a pad to write upon; <k>skribmashino</k>
typewriter; <k>mashinskribar</k> to typewrite; <k>skribtablo</k>
writing-table, -desk.

<k>skrofulo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> scrofula, king’s evil; <k>skrofulala</k>, <k>skrofulatra</k> scrofulous: relating to the disease; <k>skrofulika</k>, <k>skrofuliko</k>
scrofulous (person).

<k>skrubo</k> screw (cf. <k>helico</k>); <k>skrubagar</k> to s.
down, s. on (something with screws. N.B. not to screw the screw;
cf.<k>visar</k>); <k>skrubizar</k> to put screws on: cover with
screws; <k>skrubtenilo</k>, <k>skrubmordilo</k> vise (vice); <k>skrubokrampono</k>screw-clamp;
<k>preso skrubo</k> thumb-screw, adjusting-screw; <k>Arkimedala
 skrubo</k> Archimedian s.; <k>senfina skrubo</k> endless s.; <k>ligno
 skrubo</k> wooden s.; <k>skrubino</k> female s.; a nut; <k>skrubturnilo</k>
screwdriver, turnscrew.

<k>skrupulo</k> <ex>(moral)</ex> scruple, qualm; <k>skrupuloza</k>, <k>skrupulema</k>
scrupulous. Ex.: Havar skrupulo pri ulo. Homo sen-skrupula.
<k />

<k>skudo</k> (e)scutcheon; <ex>(Italian money)</ex> scudo; <k>skudoforma</k>
scutiform: shield-shaped. Def.: Speco di shildo, mikra, portanta
la blazono di ulu; e konseque, irga planko shild-forma e portanta
blazono, imajo o sur-skriburo; V-432. <k />

<k>skultar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sculpture, carve (<k>ulo</k>, <k>en</k>, <k>ek</k>);
<k>skult(ad)o; skultarto; skulturo</k> sculpture; <k>skultisto</k>, <k>skultero</k>
sculptor, carver. Def.: Produktar statuo en korpala naturaleso od
en vera reliefo; VII-414. V. exp.: On povas ex. <k>cizelar</k>
kapo (vizajo) homala segun la perspektivo, ma on skultas ol
donante ad ol la reala formo. On <k>cizelas</k> perspektiva
figuro <k>sur</k> bloko, on <k>gliptas</k> reala figuro <k>sur</k>
bloko, ma on skultas figuro <k>de</k> bloko, t.e. on transformas
la bloko a ta figuro korpala; VII-414. <k />

<k>skunero</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> schooner; <k>skunero kinmasta</k> a
five-masted s. Def.: Navo kun seglo-rigaro ne transversa ma
longesala.

<k>skurar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to scour, furbish: to cleanse by
scrubbing; <k>skuristo</k> scourer; scullion. Def.: Destruktar e
forprenar partikli o despuraji de la surfaco di ula korpo per
friciono; III-163. <k />

<k>slamo</k> slimo, mire, ooze, silt; <k>slameyo</k> miry place,
slough, mudhole, quagmire (cf. <k>marsheto</k>); <k>slamizar</k>
to cover with, choke up with fine oozy mud or silt.

<k>slango</k> slang; <k>slangar</k> to speak s. (cf. <k>jargono</k>, <k>galimatiaso</k>). Def.: Linguo specala, konvencionala e plu o min
sekreta, propra a profesiono od a societo klozita (studenti,
raptisti); VII-158.

<k>Slavo</k> Slav, Slavonian; <k>la Slava (lingui)</k> the
Slav(onian) languages.

<k>slingo</k> noose, sling, snare, loop (cf. <k>glitnodo</k>, <k>lazo</k>).
Def.: Nodo en kordo, e.c. ne forsita per tiro; III-288. <k />

<k>slupo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> sloop. Def.: Speco de seglo-navo kun
un masto; IV-583.

<k>sluzo</k> lock, sluice; <k>sluzpordo</k> lock-, sluice-gate; <k>sluzbaseno</k>
l. chamber; <k>sluzisto</k> l. keeper; <k>sluzagar</k> to take (a
boat, ship) through a l.; to open a l. for a boat; <k>sluzo di
 muelilo</k> mill-dam, penstock.

<k>smerilo</k> <ex>(min.)</ex> emery; <k>smerilagar</k> to polish
with e.; <k>smerilpulvero</k> e. powder; <k>smerilpolvo</k> e. dust; <k>smerilpapero</k>
e. paper.

<k>snapar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to snap, snatch: bite or catch
suddenly with the teeth ( as a dog) or with beak (as a bird).
Def.: Kaptar bruske per la boko; IV-512. <k />

<k>sniflar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to sniff: inhale strongly;
snuff up; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to turn up one’s nose (at); <k>sniflotabako</k>
snuff.

<k>snortar</k> <ex>(intr., of horses)</ex> to snort: blow through
the nose (cf. <k>sternutar</k>, <k>mungar</k>). <k />

<k>sobrar</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> temperate: moderate in food or
drink; sparing, abstemious, sober; (cf. <k>neebria</k>, <k>temperema</k>, <k>sobrmoderema</k>); <k>sobreso</k> temperance, sobriety, moderation; <k>sobresala
 societo</k> temperance society; <k>sobre</k> soberly, with
sobriety. Ex.: La homo qua ne exajeras manjante, drinkante, qua
esas moderema e su-dominacanta, esas sobra persono. Esar sobra en
parolado, en laudado.

<k>socio</k> society <ex>(in general)</ex> community: any large
body of persons or living beings living a community life; <k>societo</k>
society (formed for a particular object), association; <ex>(com.)</ex>
company, partnership (cf. <k>firmo</k>); <k>sociano</k> member of a
(large) society; citizen; <k>societano</k> member of an
association; <k>sociala</k> social: relating to society; <k>societala</k>
relating to an association; <k>sociema</k> sociable; <k>sociemeso</k>
sociability, good fellowship; <k>socialismo</k> socialism; <k>socialista</k>, <k>sociala</k> socialist. Ex.: Omnu havas devi a la socio. Abeli vivas
en societi. Societi komercal, literaturala, ciencala. <k />

<k>sofismo</k> sophism, (conscious) fallacy; <k>sofismala</k>
sophistical (cf. <k>sofistala</k>). V. exp.: vid. <k>paralogismo.</k>
<k />

<k>sokursar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to succo(u)r: to come to the aid of
when in danger; <k>sokursarmeo</k> relief army. Ex.: Sokursar ulu
dronanta. V. exp.: <k>Sokursar</k> signifikas irar rapide e
kurajoze helpar ulu, uli, en situeso di minacanta danjero; on <k>helpas</k>
ulu en desfortunoza o perturbita situeso per la donaco di
adicionala forci o moyeni.  On <k>sokursas</k> amiko en
batalio; on <k>helpas</k> la povri, falinto. <k />
<k>sol</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> sol: fifth note of diatonic scale.<k />

<k>sola</k> alone; without company, sole, only (cf. <k>nura</k>, <k>unika</k>, <k>solitara</k>); <k>soleso</k> solitude; <k>solisto</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex>
soloist; <k>solo</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> solo. Def.: Qua esas
ne-akompanata; izolita. Ex.: Il esas sola en la chambro. Unu sola
ne povas facar to. Laborar sole. Il esas sola en solitara loko.
<k />

<k>soldar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to solder (metals); <k>soldilo</k>
soldering-iron; <k>soldostano</k> (metal) solder; <k>kun soldita</k>
soldered together. V. exp.: vid. <k>weldar.</k> <k />

<k>soldato</k> soldier, trooper; <k>soldatala</k>, <k>soldatatra</k> soldierly; <k>soldato
 (simpla)</k> an ordinary s., a private. <k />

<k>soleo</k> <ex>(ich.)</ex> sole (genus: Solea); <k>soleo*</k>, <k>solea
 muskulo</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> soleus: a leg muscle. <k />

<k>solena</k> solemn; <k>soleneso</k>, <k>solenajo</k> <ex>(quality, art)</ex>
solemnity; <k>solenigar</k> to solemnize. Ex.: Solena festo, vovo,
dio, tono, vizajo. <k />

<k>solfejar</k> <ex>(tr., mus.)</ex> to (sing) sol-fa: sing the
notes of the scale; <k>solfejo</k> sol-faing; solfeggio. <k />

<k>solio</k> threshhold (of a door, of a window; <ex>also fig.</ex>),
door-soll. Ex.: <ex>(fig.)</ex> la solio di vivo. <k />

<k>solicitar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to solicit: earnestly apply for (cf.
<k>suplikar</k>, <k>peticionar</k>); <k>solicitema</k> solicitous (cf. <k>suciema</k>);
<k>solicitanto</k>, <k>solicitero</k>, <k>solicitisto</k> solicitor, canvasser. Def.: Insistoze
demandar. Ex.: Solicitar audienco, employeso, ofico, favoro.
Segun la solicito (di). Solicitero por voti. <k />

<k>solida</k> <ex>(also geom.)</ex> solid: not liquid; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
firm, substantial, sound; <k>solido</k>, <k>solidajo</k> a s. body; <ex>(geom.)</ex>
a s. figure; <k>solideso</k> solidity, stability; <k>solidigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
<k>solideskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to solidify; <k>plu solidigar</k> to
consolidate. Ex.: Solida korpo, angulo, nutrivi, edifico. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Motivi, argumenti solida. La solideso di domo. Koldeso solidigas
aquo. Ant.: <k>liquida</k>, <k>fluida</k>, <k>frajila.</k>

<k>solidara</k> <ex>(jur. and gen.)</ex> solidary: jointly and
severally responsible or liable; binding upon every one; <k>solidare</k>
conjointly, jointly and severally; <k>solidareso</k> solidarity, joint
responsibility; <ex>(fig.)</ex> coherence, fellowship, community of
interests; <k>solidarigar</k> to make jointly liable; to unite the
interests of (cf. <k>konsolidar</k>). Ex.: Solidara obligaciono.
La spozulo esas solidara por la debaji di sua spozino. Asociiti
en komercal societo esas solidara. <ex>(fig.)</ex> La solidareso en
la interesti di omna laboristi. <k />

<k>solitara</k> <ex>(of places)</ex> solitary, lonely, deserted; <ex>(of
persons)</ex> (living) alone; <k>solitareso</k> loneliness, solitude.
V.exp.: <k>Solitara</k> esas ulo plu kam <k>sola</k>, <k /> mem kam <k>solesema</k>
to esas: «qua restas kustume tote sola ed izolita». Exempli: <k>Solitar</k>
querko stacas meze di la planajo. On povas anke parolar pri <k>solitara</k>
loko; to nule esus sinonima si <k>dezerta</k> ex.: «ta <k>solitara</k>
templo esas frequentata da multa pilgrimanti.» <k>Solitareso</k>
expresas la L. solitudo. On povas vivar <k>sola</k>, <k /> mem en urbo;
to ne esas vivar <k>solitara</k> od en <k>solitareso.</k> On anke
havas la substantivo <k>solitaro</k> por persono; V-101.

<k>solvar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to solve (a problem, etc.) (cf. <k>dissolvar</k>);
<k>solvaruro</k> <ex>(also physical)</ex> solution; <k>solvarajo</k> what
is to be solved, the problem; <k>solvarebla</k> <ex>(also phys.)</ex>
solvable; soluble, dissolvable. Ex.: Solvar problemo,
desfacilajo. La rezultajo di dis-solvo di sukro per aquo esas
sukroza (dis-)solvuro. <k />

<k>solventa</k> <ex>(fin.)</ex> solvent; <k>solventeso</k> solvency; <k>ne
 solventa</k> insolvent (cf. <k>bankrotar</k>). Def.: Pago-kapabla;
II-76.

<k>somito</k> <ex>(geom., also of trees, mountains, etc.)</ex>
summit, top. V. exp.: La <k>suprajo</k> ne esas sempre nek necese
la <k>somito</k>, <k /> nam ol povas esar larja e plana; on ne parolas
pri la «somito» di moblo, di (plata) domo. La <k>suprajo</k> di
la tero tote ne identesas kun la <k>somiti</k> di la monti;
II-163. <k />

<k>somnolar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be sleepy, drowsy; <k>somnolo</k>
somnolence; <k>somnolanta</k>, <k>somnolema</k> sleepy, drowsy; <k>somnolegar</k> to
be overpoweringly sleepy. Def.: Sentar la bezono o tendenco
(momentala) dormar; IV-463. V. exp.: <k>Dormema</k> indikas
kustumala tendenco a dormar, ne instantala stando. <k />

<k>son(ad)ar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to sound: emit a sound; (of
clocks) to strike; <k>sonigar</k> to ring (<k>ulo</k>); (cf. <k>tinklar</k>);
<k>sono</k> sound, ring, striking: <k>sonludilo</k> rattle. Ex.:
La horlojo sonas. Sonigar la korno. Sonigar (ulo) por la retreto,
por servisto, por la dineo. EFIS

<k>sonalio</k> small bell (as used on the harness of horses).
Def.: Instrumento sonora, en formo di bulo kava, fendita, qua
sonas per la bulo agitata interne; IV-14. <k />

<k>sondar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to take soundings in; <ex>(gen.)</ex>
to sound: ascertain the depth of, explore the nature of the
bottom; to fathom; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to try, test; <ex>(med.)</ex> to
probe (with a probe), to sound (with a sound); <ex>(mining) </ex>to
make a boring; <k>sondilo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> sounding-line, -lead; <ex>(surg.)</ex>
probe; sound; <k>jetar la sondilo</k> to heave the lead. Ex.:
Sondar rivero, tereno, vunduro, veziko <ex>(fig.)</ex>
l’intenci di ulu.

<k>sonjar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to dream (while asleep; cf. <k>revar</k>).
Ex.: Me dormis e sonjis ke me esis richa.

<k>sonora</k> sonorous, resonant; <k>sonoreso</k> sonorousness.
Ex.: Sonora voco, linguo. Ant.: <k>matida.</k>
<k>soquo*</k> sock: shoe used by actors in ancient comedy.

<k>sorbo</k> <ex>(bot.) </ex>sorb-apple, mountain-ash berry; <k>sorbiero</k>
sorb-tree, service tree, mountain-ash, rowan tree (genus:
Sorbus).

<k>sorcar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to practise sorcery, witchcraft; <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to bewitch; <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to charm, enchant; <k>sorc(ad)o</k>
sorcery, witchcraft; <k>sorceso</k> <ex>(state)</ex> bewitchment;
enchantment; <k>sorcilo</k> charm; <k>sorcisto</k> sorcerer: one who
is supposed to be in league with evil spirits; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
wizard, conjuror, magician; <k>sorcistino</k> witch. Ex.: On
ankore trovas kredo ad sorcado inter la populi savaja. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Ta muliero sorcas me. <k />

<k>sordida</k>, <k>sordidega</k>, <k>sordidacha</k> <ex>(of things)</ex> dirty, nasty, foul,
soiled, sordid, slovenly, sluttish; <ex>(fig. of persons, acts)</ex>
mean, disgusting (cf. <k>shaminda</k>, <k>pudora</k>); <k>sordideso</k>, <k>sordidajo</k>
<ex>(quality, object)</ex> dirtiness, filthiness: dirt, filth; <k>sordid(ul)o</k>, <k>sordidacho</k> a dirty person; <k>sordidigar</k> to dirty, soil. Def.: <k>Desneta.</k>
Ex.: Sordida aquo, linji, chambro, manui, homo, avareso.

<k>sordino</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> sordino: a mute or damper
on trumpet, violin, piano, etc.

<k>sorgar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to care for (by physical acts), take
care of, look after (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); to take pains with; <k>sorg(ad)o</k>
care, attendance; <k>sorgema</k> careful, painstaking, regardful
(cf. <k>diligenta</k>). Ex.: Konfidar ad ulu la sorgo (pri).
Komisar ulu por sorgar (pri). El esas la flegisto qua sorgas il.
Sorga la stilo. Sorgema laboristo. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Esar sorgema pri
sua honoro, sua reputo. V. exp.: vid. <k>suciar.</k> <k />

<k>sorto</k> sort, kind: brand (of goods); <k>sortaro</k>
assortment. (Note: For idiomatic uses of the E. «sort»,
«kind», cf. <k>quaza</k>, <k>quala</k>, <k>tala</k>, <k>ulmaniere</k>). Ex.: Ibe
esas omna sorti di bestii. Quala viro! Il esas ulsorta (o quaza,
od ulspeca) giganto.

<k>sospirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to sigh, heave or fetch a s.; <ex>(tr.,
fig.)</ex> to sigh out, breathe forth. Ex.: Sospiro pro doloro. <ex>(fig.)</ex>
Sospirar versi. <k />

<k>sovaja</k> (referring to living and growing persons, plants,
trees, etc.) savage: wild (living in a state of nature) not
domesticated, uncivilized; <ex>(fig.)</ex> unsociable; ferocious,
fierce; <k>sovaj(ul)o</k> a s.; <k>sovajeso</k> savagery, wildness; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
fierceness; <k>sovajigar</k>, <k>sovajeskar</k> to make, become s. Ex.: Sovaja
populi, animali. Anado sovaja (E. wild). <ex>(fig.)</ex> Mieno
sovaja.

<k>sozio</k> double, second self, counterpart. Def.: Persono
qua esas perfekte simila ad altru.

<k>spaco</k> space; <k>spacala</k> spacial; <k>spacoza</k>
spacious, roomy. Ex.: spaco havas tri dimensioni. Hike ne esas
sata spaco. Spacala relati. Spacoza chambro.

<k>spano</k> chip (of wood, metal) (cf. <k>raboturo</k>). Def.
Reziduo dil ago limar, rabotar o di altra tranchanta instrumento.
V. exp.: vid. <k>splito.</k>
<k>spanto</k> a timber, rib, in the frame of a ship.

<k>spanyoleto</k> window-sash fastening (the ordinary bolt and
catch; cf. <k>kremono</k>). Def.: Vekto ocilanta cirkum sua
mezpunto e qua ingranas od embragas en hoki supre ed infre di la
fenestro; IV-448.

<k>sparar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to economize, save, put by, husband;
<ex>(intr.)</ex> to be economical, frugal; <k>sparegar</k>, <k>sparachar</k> to
be stingy, parsimonious, niggardly; <k>sparo</k>, <k>sparemeso</k> economy,
thrift; <k>sparajo</k> what is saved, savings; <k>sparala</k>, <k>spariva</k>
saving, economizing; <k>sparema</k> thrifty, frugal; <k>sparkaso</k>
savings bank; <k>sparbuxo</k> money-box. Ex.: Sparar la revenui di
la heredajo. On povas sparar tempo, kredito, forteso. Me sparis
mil franki por futura uzo. Spariva procedo. Sparema mento.

<k>sparadrapo*</k> <ex>(pharm. Med.)</ex> cerecloth, sparadrap.
Def.: Kataplasmo aglutinanta extensita sur linjo o papero. Ex.:
Kovrar vunduro per sparadrapo.<k />

<k>speco</k> species <ex>(fig.)</ex> kind (cf. <k>genero</k>, <k>sorto</k>, <k>qualeso</k>); <k>specala</k> special: relating to s.; particular,
(e)special; <k>specvari omnaspeca</k> all sorts of wares; <k>specaleso</k>
(quality) peculiarity; <k>specalajo</k> something special, a
specialty; <k>specalisto</k> specialist; <k>specaligar</k> to
specialize: adopt a specialty (<k>su</k>, <k>ulu</k>); <k>specigar</k> to
specify: designate particularly, particularize; <k>speciganta</k>, <k>speciva</k> specifying, particularizing; specific (<k>specifika</k>).
Ex.: Homala speco. Speci esas dividata en varietati. Il esas
stranja speco di homo. Specala studio. To esas specale dezirenda.
La specalesi di diferanta kozi. Existas multa specalaji en la
medicinala praktikado. La lego specigas to quon on darfas facar.
Speciganta nomo. Specigiva (od, partikulara) instrucioni.

<k>specifika</k> <ex>(med., physics)</ex> specific (cf. <k>speciganta</k>, <k>specifikigiva</k>); <k>specifiko</k> a specific. Ex.: Graveso specifika. Esas
specifika mikrobo en tuberkloso. Quinino esas specifiko kontre
ula febro.

<k>specimeno</k> specimen, sample. Ex.: Montrar specimeno di
frumento, di drapo, di vino, di insekto.

<k>spegulo</k> mirror, looking-glass; <k>spegulo brulanta</k>
burning-m.; <k>regardar su en spegulo</k> to look at oneself in the
glass; <k>kirurgiala spegulo</k> speculum.

<k>spektarar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to look at or on, be a spectator
of, witness; (cf. <k>regardar</k>, <k>vidar</k>, <k>kontemplar</k>); <k>spektaranto</k>
spectator; <k>spektarajo</k> spectacle, sight, view (cf. <k>spektaklo</k>).
Def.: Regardar longe, pasive, ma kun atenco ed intereso, quale en
teatro od altra spektaklo; V-35. Ex.: Il spektis ta eventi. La
aktori e la spektanti. La spektajo (od, vidajo) de ta vidpunto
esis bela. Ta veneracinda viro esas spektindajo.

<k>spekular</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to speculate: <ex>(philos.)</ex>
to theorize; <ex>(finan.) </ex>to make (financial) speculations.
Ex.: Spekular pri metafizikala problemi, pri frumento.

<k>spensar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to spend, expend; <k>spens(ad)o</k>
spending, expenditure; <k>spensi</k>, <k>spensajo</k> expenses: sum(s) spent; <k>spensema</k>
extravagant, spendthrift; <k>vivar per la spensi di ulu</k> to
live at the expense of someone; <k>asumar la spensi</k> to
finance (<k>ulo</k>). Ex.: Spensar pekunio, sua vigoro. Ta esas
povra di qua la spensi transpasas la recevaji.

<k>spico</k> spice: pepper, nutmeg, ginger, etc; (cf. <k>kondimento</k>, <k>piklo</k>); <k>spicaro</k> spices (collect); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
groceries; <k>spicizar</k> to spice; <k>spicokomerco</k>, <k>spicovenderio</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> grocery business; <k>spic(ovend)isto</k> grocer.

<k>spiko</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> ear: spike or head of corn, grain; <k>spikifar</k>
to ear; <k>haro spiko</k> tuft of hair.

<k>spino</k> spine, backbone; chine; <k>spinala</k> spinal; <k>ruptar
 la spino</k> to break the back.

<k>spindelo</k> spindle: piece of wood used for twisting and
winding thread (cf. <k>fuzelo; bobino</k>, <k>ruko</k>); <k>spindelatra</k>
s.-shaped, s.-like.

<k>spionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to spy on (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <ex>(intr.)</ex>
to act as a spy; <k>spion(ad)o</k> spying, espionage:<k>spionanto</k>, <k>spionero</k>, <k>spionisto</k> spy.

<k>spiro</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> a winding line like the threads of
a screw, helix.

<k>spiralo</k> <ex>(geom.)</ex> spiral; <ex>(of a watch)</ex> hair
spring; <ex>(in gen.)</ex> a spiral spring; <k>spirala</k>, <k>spiralatra</k>
spiral: winding like the turns of a screw. <k />

<k>spirito</k> spirit: incorporeal being; <k>spiritala</k>
spiritual; <k>spiritisto</k> spiritist, spiritualist: one who
professes to hold intercourse with departed spirits or believes
such intercourse possible; <k>spiritismo</k> spiritism, spiritualism:
doctrine or beliefs of spiritists; <k>spiritista</k>, <k>spiritala</k>
spiritistic; <k>spiritalismo</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex> spiritualism: a
system opposed to materialism; <k>spiritalisto</k> spiritualist
(opp. to materialist); <k>spiritaleso</k> spirituality; <k>spiritaligar</k>
to spiritualize: render spiritual; <k>Santa Spirito</k> Holy
Spirit. Def.: Pensanta ento senkorpa. Ex.: On dicas ke deo, la
anjeli, la mortinta anmi esas spiriti, anke same pri imaginala
enti quale fantomi, fei, e.c.

<k>spiso</k> spit (for roasting); <k>spiseto</k> skewer; <k>spisagar</k>
to spit (meat for cooking); <k>spisoturnilo</k> turnspit; <k>spisego</k>
spear (cf. <k>lanco</k>).

<k>splendida</k> splendid; <k>splendideso</k> splendo(u)r. Def.:
Brilanta; belega; luxoza. Ex.: Palaco splendida. Splendideso di
la suno, di la trono.

<k>splinar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be splenetic, be in low
spirits; <k>splinigar</k> to give the blue devils to (<k>ulu</k>); <k>splino</k>
spleen: hypochondriasis: morbid depression of mind; (cf. <k>spleno</k>).
<k />

<k>splinto</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> small metal pin (used to fasten
parts); (cf. <k>stifto</k>); <k>fendita splinto</k> split-pin; <k>splintoludo</k>
<ex>(game)</ex> spilikins.

<k>splisar</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to splice; <k>splisilo</k>
splicing-fid, marlingspike. Def.: Specala maniero juntar du kordi
per desplekto di l’extremaji e posa riplekto; III-86.

<k>splito</k> splinter, sliver, shiver, (of metal, glass, wood,
etc.); <k>splitoza</k> splintery; <k>splitigar</k> to splinter: cause
to fly into splinters. V. exp.: <k>Splito</k> esas spano di tote
nereguloza formo, dum ke <k>spano</k> havas formo dependanta de
la materio e de l’instrumento per qua on laboras ulo;
III-488.

<k>spoliar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to spoliate, (des)spoil, rob,
pillage, sack, plunder. Def.: Desposedigar ulu, ulo de ulu per
fraudo, o violento; for-portar violentoze. Ex.: Spoliar orfano de
lua heredajo. Spoliado di urbo. Domo spoliita.

<k>sponjo</k> sponge; <k>sponjagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sponge (a
garment, etc.); <k>sponjala</k>, <k>sponjatra</k> spongy.

<k>spontana</k> spontaneous: voluntary, self-acting, -moving.
Ex.: spontana genitado. La movi di la kordio esas spontana.
Spontaneso di ula ago.

<k>sporadika</k> sporadic; scattered; <ex>(med.)</ex> not epidemic.
Ex.: Dum ta yaro aparis sporadika kazi di kolero.

<k>sporno</k> <ex>(natural, artificial)</ex> spur; <k>spornoza</k>, <k>spornizita</k> spurred; <k>spornagar</k> to spur (a horse, etc.); <k>spornizar</k>
to put spurs on.

<k>sporto</k> sport; <k>sportala</k>, <k>ema</k> sporting, sportive; <k>sportist(ul)o</k>
sportsman; <k>sportar</k> to take part in sport.

<k>spozo</k> spouse: either one of a married couple; <k>spozala</k>
marital, conjugal, connubial; <k>spozulo</k> husband; <k>spozino</k>
wife; <k>spozigar</k> to make (<k>ulu</k>) one’s spouse, to
espouse, wed (<k>ulu</k>); <k>spozuligar</k> to wed (a husband); <k>spozinigar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex>, <k>spozineskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to wed (a wife); <k>spoziganto</k>
person marrying, suitor; <k>ge spozi</k> husband and wife; <k>grantar
 ulu kom spozo</k> to give in marriage. V. exp.: vid. <k>mariajar.</k>

<k>spricar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to spout (out), gush (forth); <k>spricigar</k>
to cause (<k>ulo</k>) to spout, to throw up, dash (liquids); <k>makulo</k>
a dash, splash (of liquid).

<k>springar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to spring: rise upward and go
forward with impetuosity; <k>springo</k> spring, dash, rush, leap,
bound; (cf. <k>precipitar</k>). Ex.: Il springis e saltis super
la fenco.

<k>spular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reel: wind on a spool (thread,
wire, etc.).

<k>spumo</k> foam, froth, spume: <k>spumacho</k> scum (bad
sense); <k>spumifar</k> to foam, froth; <k>spumoza</k>, <k>spumatra</k>, <k>spumifanta</k>
frothy, seething, foaming; <k>spumkuliero</k> skimmer; <k>blanka
 spumo</k> white foam; <k>maro spumo</k> meerschaum; <k>senspumigar</k>
to skim off foam.

<k>sputar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to spit, spit out; <k>sputajo</k>
spit(tle), sputum; <k>sputuyo</k>, <k>sputvazo</k> spittoon; <k>sango sputo</k>
spitting of blood. V.exp.: vid. <k>expektorar</k>, <k>salivifar</k>, <k>bavar.</k>

<k>squadro</k> (set) square: instrument for determining right
angles; <k>T squadro</k> T-square.

<k>squamo</k> scale (of skin, fish, serpents); <k>squamoza</k>, <k>squamatra</k>
scaly, squamous. Def.: La lameneti qui dependas de la pelo (di
fishi, serpenti, e.c.); VI-603.

<k>squatar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to squat down (on one’s hams
or heels); (cf. <k>blotisar</k>). <k />

<k>stabila</k> stable; <k>stabileso</k> stability, consistence,
steadiness; <k>stabiligar</k><ex>(tr.)</ex>, <k>stabileskar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>
to stabilize. Def.: Qua esas en stando, en situeso ferma, solida.
Ex.: Stabila equilibro. Stabileso di edifico.

<k>stablo</k> stable (for beasts); <k>stablofako</k> stall (in
s.); <k>bovo stablo</k> cattle s.; <k>lojigar kavalo en stablo</k> to
stable a horse.

<k>stacar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to stand (upright), be standing; <k>stac(ad)o</k>
standing (up); being on one’s feet; <k>stacanta</k>, <k>stace</k>
standing, upright, on end; <k>stacigar</k> to cause (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>)
to stand; <k>staceskez</k> stand up; <k>stacigilo</k> stand (as for
camera, telescope, etc.). Ex.: La monumento ankore stacas. Ol
stacas vertikale. V.exp.: vid. <k>erektar.</k>

<k>staciono</k> <ex>(building and place)</ex> station; R.R.
depot; <ex>(R.C. rel.)</ex> station; (cf. <k>gareyo</k>); <k>stacionnavo</k>
s. ship. Ex.: Fervoyala staciono. Katoliko facas sua stacioni en
la kirko.

<k>stacionara</k> steady, stationary: not moving or changing at
the time; <k>stacionareso</k> steadiness. Ex.: La temperaturo povas esas
stacionara, anke la stando di morbi, di arti. V. exp.: <k>Stacionara</k>
ne esas la sama ideo kam <k>fixa</k> ol esas plu proxima ad <k>konstanta</k>,
ma indikas konstanteso en movo, per quaza equilibro sempre
ruptebla; <k>konstanteso</k> di ulo, qua povas variar en omna
momento, o fixeso nur semblanta e rezultanta (stacionara ondi);
III-268.

<k>stadio</k> <ex>(Gr. measure and place for gymnastic contests)</ex>
stadium.

<k>stagnar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to stagnate (of liquids); be at a
standstill; <k>stagnanta</k> stagnant. Ex.: Stagno di aquo od
stagnanta aquo. <ex>(fig.)</ex> Mea aferi, komerco stagnas.

<k>stalo</k> steel; <k>stala</k> of steel; <k>stalala</k> steely;
relating to s.; <k>stalatra</k> s.-like; <k>stalifar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>,
<k>staligar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to make, convert into s.; <k>staliferio</k>
s.works; <k>stalaji</k> s.wares.

<k>stampo</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stamp: imprint on the surface of
something; <k>stamp(ad)o</k>, <k>stampuro</k> stamp(ing); <k>stampilo</k> a stamp;
<k>postala stampo</k> postal mark (N.B. not postage stamp; cf. <k>postomarko</k>);
<k>ica letro havas Angla postomarko e la postal stampuro di
 London</k> this letter bears an English postage stamp and the
postal mark of London. Ex.: Stampar la libro-titulo sur la
binduro. V.exp.: vid. <k>puncar.</k>

<k>stano</k> tin; <k>stana</k> (made) of tin; <k>stanoza</k> tinny,
stannic; <k>stanizar</k> to cover (<k>ulo</k>) with tin; <k>stanfolio</k>
tin-foil; <k>stanvazo</k> a tin pot, pewter; <k>kupro stano</k>
pewter. (N.B. Not tin-plate; cf. <k>lado</k>).

<k>standar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be in a certain state,
relative condition; to be in good or bad health; <k>stando</k>
state, stand, condition: state of being, manner of existing; <k>quale
 vu standas? La stando di mea saneso esas bona</k> How are you? I
am well; <k>quale vu aferi standas?</k>How is your business? <k>Plubonigar
 la stando di aferi</k> to better the condition of a business (or
of affairs). V. exp.: vid. <k>situar.</k>

<k>standardo</k> <ex>(milit.)</ex> standard, ensign, flag; <k>standardportisto;
 standardiero</k> s.-bearer (cf. <k>flago</k>, <k>banero</k>). Def.: La
nacional insigno, fixigita per un vertikal latero, sive a stango
(teral armeo), sive a kordo (naval armeo): III-31.

<k>stango</k> bar (of wood or metal), rod, pole; leg (of a
table); stem (of a candlestick, etc); stock (of a key, nail,
anchor); <k>piston stango</k> piston-rod; <k>vito stango</k>
vine-pole; <k>stangizar</k> to pole (vines, etc.).

<k>staplo</k> distributing point for goods, as a seaport or
large inland city, staple-mart or entrepot.

<k>starchar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to (stiffen with) starch; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to stiffen; <k>starchita</k> starched; <ex>(fig. of style)</ex> stiff,
formal; <k>starchivo</k> starch (for linen). Def.:<k />Rigidigar
per amilo. <k />

<k>startar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to start: set going, cause
to act (as a machine, train, sport). Ex.: Me startas la motoro.
La motoro startas facile. On povas startar la motoro di
automobilo sen departigar la veturo. Starto di konkurso. <k />

<k>startero</k> starter (of a race). Def.: Ta qua direktas,
imperas la departo; IV-338. <k />

<k>stato</k> <ex>(political)</ex> state; <k>statala aferi</k> state
affairs; <k>statostroko</k> a stroke of state policy.

<k>statuo</k> statue; <k>statueto</k> statuette; <k>marmora statuo</k>
marble s.; <k>kavalkala statuo</k> equestrian s.

<k>staturo</k> stature; <k>staturmezurilo</k> instrument to
measure height. Def.: Alteso naturala di persono od animalo. Ex.:
Alta-statura homo, od, homo di alta staturo.

<k>statuto</k> statute, written decree or law; by-law; article
(of association; cf. <k>lego</k>); <k>statutala</k> statutory.

<k>stebar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to quilt, to (pad and) stitch; to
stitch (with a machine); <k>stebmashino</k> sewing machine. V.exp.:
<k>Stebar</k> esas <k>sutar</k> per mashino, quo ne esas propre
sutado, nam mashino uzas generale du fili, e la sutado nur un;
II-646.

<k>stekar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stick: thrust point in, drive in
(by point); <ex>(hort.)</ex> to propagate by cuttings or slips (cf.
<k>sprosifar</k>); <k>stekajo</k> <ex>(hort.)</ex> slip, cutting.
Def.: Enirigar ulo en ulo per la pinto. Ex.: Stekar paliso en la
sulo.

<k>stelo</k> <ex>(also fig. and theat.)</ex> (fixed) star; <k>steleto</k>
small star; <ex>(print.)</ex> asterisk; <k>stelala</k> stellar; <k>steloza</k>
<ex>(natural)</ex> starry: full of stars; <k>stelizita</k> <ex>(artificial)</ex>
studded or covered with stars; spangled; <k>stelatra</k>, <k>steloforma</k>
starlike, star-shaped; stelliform; <k>stelolumo</k> starlight; <k>stelizar</k>
to star: stud, cover (<k>ulo</k>) with stars; <k>stelaro</k>
constellation; <k>matin stelo</k> morning star; <k>polo stelo</k>
polar star. V. exp.: vid. <k>astro.</k>

<k>stelto</k>, <k>stelti</k> stilt(s); <k>steltirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to
walk on stilts; <k>steltucelo</k>, <k>steltiero</k> <ex>(orni.)</ex> stilt-bird
(order Grallæ).

<k>stenogfrafar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to take down (<k>ulo</k>) in
short-hand; <k>stenogfrafado</k>, <k>stenogfrafarto</k>, <k>stenogfrafuro</k> <ex>(act, art, result)</ex>
stenography.

<k>stentoro</k> <ex>(antiq.)</ex> Stentor: a person with a
powerful voice; <k>stentorala</k> stentorian: extremely loud. Ex.:
Stentorala voco.

<k>stereotipar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stereotype; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
fix firmly or unchangeably; (cf. <k>klishar</k>); <k>stereotipuro</k>, <k>stereotipajo</k>
stereo(plate).

<k>sterila</k> sterile, barren, unfruitful; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
fruitless, vain; (cf. <k>arida</k>); <k>sterileso</k> sterility; <k>steriligar</k>
to sterilize; <k>steriligilo</k> sterilizer; <k>sterila roko</k> barren
rock. Ex.: Sterila persono, arboro, tereno, autoro, diskuto.
Steriligar aquo, filtro, vazo. Ant.: <k>fekunda</k>, <k>fertila.</k>

<k>sterko</k> dung (-litter), muck (cf. <k>dungo</k>); <k>sterkizar</k>
to manure, dung; <k>sterkamaso</k> dung-heap; <k>sterkaquo</k> liquid
manure; <k>sterkskarabeo</k> <ex>(ent.)</ex> coprophagan; dung-beetle.
Def.: La dungo formacita ek la exkrementi di animali (mixita kun
palio); VI-248.

<k>sternar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to lay (<k>ulu</k>, <k>su</k>) down at
full length.

<k>stertorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have a death rattle; to have
a rattle in the throat (from respiratory trouble). <k />

<k>stifa</k> (relationship) step-; <k>stifa filiino</k>
step-daughter (cf. <k>bofiliino</k>); <k>stifa matro</k>
step-mother (cf. <k>bomatro</k>); <k>stifa fratino</k>
step-sister. V. exp.: <k>Stifa</k> signifikas la parenteso, qua
rezultas de duesma mariajo di un de la gepatri. Mea <k>stifa
 frato</k> esas la filio de la (duesma) spozo di mea patro; do lu
esas nek mea <k>frato</k> nek mea <k>mifrato</k>, nam lu havas
nula patro komuna kun me. La spozo ipsa di mea patro esas mea <k>stifa
 patro (patrulo</k>o<k>patrino);</k> lu esas tote diversa de mea
<k>bopatro (ulo</k>od<k>stifino)</k>, <k /> qua esas patro di <k>mea</k>
spozo <k>(ulo</k>od<k>stifino);</k> VI-489.

<k>stifto</k> peg: small pin of wood or metal used for
fastening hinges, frames, clocks, etc.; <k>stiftagar</k>, <k>stiftunionar</k>, <k>stiftstopar</k> to peg, fasten with pegs (<k>ulo</k>); <k>stopo stifto</k>
spigot, bung-stopper (as for casks).

<k>stigmato</k> brand (of a hot iron); <ex>(bot.)</ex> stigma;
scar of a wound (cf. <k>cikatro</k>); <ex>(pl. theol.)</ex>
stigmata (of Christ); <ex>(entom.)</ex> stigmati (on the tracheæ);
<ex>(fig.) </ex>stigma: mark of infamy; <k>stigmatizar</k> to mark with
a brand or with scars; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to set a mark of disgrace on
(<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>). Ex.: La stigmato di puniso, di la variolo, di
vicio, sur la korpo di Francisko di Assisi. Variolo (e metafore,
krapulado) stigmatizas la vizajo. Me stigmatizas ta aserto kom
mentio.

<k>stilo</k> <ex>(lit., artist)</ex> style, tone, manner;
diction: selection of words (cf. <k>diciono</k>); <ex>(bot. and
antiq.)</ex> style; <k>stileto</k> <ex>(fig.)(surg. probe)</ex>
stylet; <k>stilisto</k> stylist: master of style; <k>stiloida</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex>
styloid. Ex.: Moblaro segun la stilo di Louis XIV. Stilo moderna,
historiala. Ta auturo havas bona stilo. <k />

<k>stilistiko</k> stylistics. Def.: Cienco o teorio di stilo;
IV-707.

<k>stimular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stimulate, rouse, excite; to
spur on, incite; to goad (oxen); (cf. <k>ecitar</k>); <k>stimularivo</k>, <k>stimularilo</k> stimulant, stimulus; <ex>(fig.)</ex> goad, spur. Ex.:
Intereso stimulas la mento. Lua indolenteso bezonas stimulivo.
Porciono stimulanta. Stimul-ilo por bovuli. Stimulita da hungro.
Ant.: <k>stuporigar.</k>

<k>stipendio</k> (in public schools or colleges) exhibition,
scholarship, bursary (in Scotland): a sum of money granted to
pay, wholly or in part, the expenses of a pupil’s education;
<k>stipendiiero</k> a foundation scholar.

<k>stipular</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to stipulate; <k>stipulo</k>, <k>stipuluro</k>
stipulation. Ex.: Stipular garantio. Stipuluro di kontrato.
<k />

<k>stivar</k> <ex>(tr., nav.)</ex> to stow (a cargo), trim (a
hold); <k>stivisto</k> stevedore.

<k>stofo</k> stuff, fabric, tissue, cloth: any woven fabric; <k>lana
 stofo</k> woollen stuff, woollen cloth.

<k>stoika</k> <ex>(philos. and fig.)</ex> stoic(al): unaffected
by passion; <k>stoik(ul)o</k> a stoic; <k>stoikala</k> stoical; <k>stoikeso</k>, <k>stoikismo</k> (quality, doctrine) stoicism. Ex.: Stoika vertuo. Zeno
esis stoiko e docis stoikismo. Ica homo manifestas stoikeso.
Stoikala doktrino. <k />

<k>stoko</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> stock. Def.: Quanto de komercaji o
pekunio disponebla da vendisto. Ex.: Stoko de frumento. Stoko en
magazino. Stoko de oro en banko.

<k>stomako</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> stomach; (cf. <k>abdomeno</k>, <k>ventro</k>);
<k>stomakala</k> stomachic, gastric; <k>stomakdolori</k> s.ache (cf. <k>gastralgio</k>);
<k>stomakspasmo</k> s. griping; <k>stomakmembrano</k>, <k>stomaktripo</k> tripe.
<k />

<k>stono</k> pebble, small stone, loose rock (cf. <k>petro</k>, <k>roko</k>);
<k>stonoza</k> full of (small) stones, pebbly, flinty (of roads,
etc.); <k>stonizar</k> to macadamize, gravel, ballast: cover with
small stones; <k>stonagar</k>, <k>stonasomar</k>, <k>stonmortigar</k> to stone (kill); <k>sen
 stonigar</k> to clear (<k>ulo</k>) of stones; <ex>(fig.)</ex> <k>stone
 mortinta</k>, <k>surda</k>, <k>blinda. e.c.</k> stone dead, deaf, blind; <k>kruda
 stono</k> uncut stone, rough ashlar (opp. of <k>quadro</k>).

<k>stopar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stop up, choke up, stuff up (a
hole, bottle, etc.; cf. <k>obstruktar</k>, <k>obturar</k>); <k>stopilo</k>
stopper; stop-gap; <k>korka stopilo</k> cork; <k>stopilego</k> bung;
<k>des stopar</k> to unstop.

<k>storaxo</k> <ex>(bot., pharm.)</ex> storax. Def.: Speco di
balzamio; IV-707.

<k>stoterar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to stammer, stutter, lisp
from natural defect). V. exp.: <k>Balbutado</k> eventas che
l’infanti, pro ne-habileso, o che l’adulti pro pavoro
od altra emoco; kontre ke <k>stoterado</k>esas konstanta defekto
di pronuncado; IV-518. <k />

<k>straba</k> squint-, cross-eyed; <k>strab(ul)o</k> squint-eyed
person; <k>strabeso</k> squinting (condition), strabismus; <k>strabesar</k>
to squint.

<k>strado</k> street; <k>stradeto</k> small s.; lane (in town);
alley, court; <k>stradangulo</k>s. corner; <k>strado transversa</k>
cross-street; <k>stradobubo</k> a s. urchin; <k>stradovendisto</k>
s. peddler; <k>vagar tra la stradi</k> to rove about the streets.

<k>strandar</k> <ex>(intr., also fig.)</ex> to strand: run
aground or on shore: <k>strandigar</k> to run (a ship, boat) aground,
to beach.

<k>strangular</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to strangle, choke, stifle,
throttle (<k>ulu</k>); (cf. <k>asfixiar</k>, <k>sufokar</k>, <k>garotagar</k>);
Def.: Mortigar per presar la trakeo; perdigar, haltar la
respirado. Ex.: Li strangulis per kordo. Il mortis pro
stranguleso. <ex>(fig.)</ex> strangular ula cienco, ula arto.

<k>stranja</k> strange, unusual, uncommon, odd, singular, queer
(cf. <k>baroka</k>); <k>stranjeso</k> strangeness, oddness,
queerness; <k>stranjajo</k> a strange thing, oddity, curiosity. Def.:
Qua esas kontre kustumo, ordinara experienco, kustumala ordino,
la komuna raciono. Ex.: Stranja dicajo, bruiso, aranjo, vivo.
Esas stranja ke il ne ja advenas. La stranjeso di lua vestaro, di
lua konduto.

<k>stranjera</k> foreign, not native; <ex>(fig.)</ex> extraneous <ex>(jur.)</ex>
irrelevant; <k>stranjer(ulo)</k> a foreigner; <k>stranjerajo</k> an
extraneous body; <ex>(chem., surg.)</ex> a foreign substance. Def.:
Qua esas de altra naciono; qua ne apartenas ad korpo. Ex.:
Stranjera lando; linguo, milito, aferi, relati. Trovar ulo
stranjera (kontre-natura) en korpo. Argumento stranjera
(ne-apartenanta, ne aplikebla) a la kazo, proceso, temo. Note:
The E. word «stranger» is ordinarily to be translated by <k>nekonocato</k>
He is a stranger to me: <k>me tote ne konocas il: il esas
 nekonocata da me.</k><k />

<k>straso</k> strass: a brilliant glass used for artificial
gems; a paste (diamond).

<k>strato</k> <ex>(geol.)</ex> stratum: layer; <k>stratigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>,
<k>stratifar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to stratify; <k>stratig(ad)o</k>, <k>stratif(ad)o</k> stratification; <k>sablo strato</k> layer of sand;
sand-bank; <k>ostro strato</k> oyster-bank.

<k>strategio</k> strategy; <k>strategiala</k> strategical; <k>strategiisto</k>
strategist. Ex.: Napoleon esis maestro do strategio. Jomini esis
strategiisto. Strategiala pozicino.

<k>streko</k> stroke, dash (as of a pen); <ex>(print.)</ex> dash;
<ex>(geom.)</ex> a straight line; <k>streketo</k>, <k>juntostreko</k> short
dash; <ex>(print.)</ex> hyphen; <k>tra strekizar</k> to draw a line
through, strike out. Ex.: On formacas ta litero per du
plumo-streki. Note: The use of the <k>streko</k> in printing does
not, as in E., indicate merely an interruption, but a change of
subject or speaker; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 104;
IV-533).

<k>streta</k> narrow, strait; <ex>(fig.)</ex> limited, scanty; <k>strete</k>
narrowly; <k>streteso</k> narrowness; <k>stretigar</k> to narrow; <k>streteskar</k>
to become narrower, shrink; <k>trostretigar</k>to scant (cf. <k>meskinigar</k>);
<k>streta mento</k> a narrow mind; <k>marala stretajo</k> a strait.
Ex.: Streta voyo, rubando, enireyo. Ant.: <k>larja.</k>

<k>strio</k> stripe, stria; <k>striizar</k> to streak, stripe; <k>strioza</k>
<ex>(natural)</ex>, <k>striizita</k> <ex>(artificial)</ex> streaked,
striped; <k>strirolero</k>rowell (of a bit). Def.: Lineo
trasita o grabita sur surfaco per akutajo; lineo o tre dina
kanelo (ne bendo); IV-463. Ex.: Vitro o spegulo, sur qua on
frotis diamanto o silexo, havas strii. Glacierala strii. La kapo
di ula skrubi esas striizita, por ke on povas manuagar li plu
facile.

<k>stridar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to produce a strident noise, to
creak; <k>stridanta</k> strident, shrill, creaking, grating. Def.:
Produktar sono akra e penetranta. Ex.: Cikadi, gondo-bendi
stridas. Voco stridanta.

<k>strigo</k> barn-, white-, screech-owl (genus: Strix
flammea). Def.: Noktala raptema ucelo di qua la facio esas ornita
per plumoza koliaro kompleta; IV-296.

<k>strikar</k> <ex>(intr., of workmen)</ex> to strike, to go on
strike, quit work: <k>strikanto</k> striker.

<k>strikta</k> strict, precise, rigorous; <k>strikte</k> strictly; <k>strikteso</k>
strictness. Def.: Des-ampla; IV-434. Ex.: Strikta senco, obligo,
devo, en aferi. To esas strikte vera. Strikte parolanta. <k />

<k>stroko</k> indicates a single movement, an elementary,
sudden act: stroke, coup, feat; <ex>(in game)</ex> move; <ex>(fencing)</ex>
thrust; <ex>(of dice)</ex> throw; <ex>(rowing)</ex> stroke; <ex>(of
whips)</ex> smack; <k>alo stroko</k> wing-beat; <ex>(fig.)</ex> <k>brilanta
 stroko</k> striking act, brilliant feat; <k>cizo stroko</k> single cut
with scissors; <k>fortunoza stroko</k> happy move, thrust, hit,
etc.; <k>piston stroko</k> stroke of piston; <k>perfida stroko</k>
treacherous act; <k>preparita stroko</k> got-up affair; <k>probo
 stroko</k> trial, first attempt; <k>plum stroko</k> stroke of the pen;
<k>pinsel stroko</k> dash, stroke of brush; <k>fola stroko</k> foolish
trick, move, act; <k>lim(ilo) stroko</k> stroke of a file; <k>reto
 stroko</k> cast of net; <k>stroko di stato</k>stroke of state,
violent or quick exercise of state authority; <k>il facis la
 stroko</k> he has done the deed; <k>stroko di teatro</k>
theatrical effect; clap-trap; <k>yunesala stroko</k> juvenile
trick; youthful act of folly; <k>strokar</k> to do the act called
for by the ideas above defined; <k>vu strokos pos me</k> it is
your turn after mine.

<k>stropo</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> strop, strap, sling (for a block,
or piece of cargo); <k>stropizar</k>, <k>stropligar</k> to strop (a block); to
sling (casks, etc.).

<k>strukturo</k> structure: manner of building, construction,
form; <ex>(fig.)</ex> disposition, arrangement. Ex.: Ta edifico
havas stabila strukturo. La strukturo di la vivanta korpo, di
poemo.
<k>strumo*</k> goitre, wen in the throat; <k>strumoza</k>, <k>strumika; strumozo</k>, <k>strumiko</k> goitrous (person).

<k>studento</k>, <k>studentulo</k>, <k>studentino</k> student; undergraduate; (cf. <k>lernanto</k>).
Ex.: Studento pri lego. Medicin-studento.

<k>studiar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to study (<k>ulo</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>);
(cf. <k>lernar</k>); <k>studi(ad)o</k> <ex>(act)</ex> study(ing); <k>studiuro</k>
<ex>(result)</ex> a study; <ex>(paint.)</ex> sketch; <k>studieyo</k>
place for study; <k>studieyo di artisto</k> studio, «atelier»; <k>studiema</k>
studious; <k>studiokapo</k> a head for study (by artist); <k>pre
 studiar</k> to make a preliminary study of; <k>par studiar</k> to make
a complete study of. Ex.: Studiar piktado, portreto, matematiko,
leciono. Kurso di studii.

<k>stufar</k> <ex>(tr., cook)</ex> to stew; <k>stufovazo</k>
stewing-pot; <k>stufita bovyuno</k> stewed veal. V. exp.: vid. <k>stuvo.</k>

<k>stuko</k> stucco; <k>stukajo</k> s. work; <k>stukizar</k> to
cover with s.

<k>stulo</k> chair: seat with back; (cf. <k>tabureto</k>, <k>benko</k>);
<k>stulego</k> large c., arm-c.; <k>stulego ocilanta</k> rocking c.;
<k>stulego longa</k> lounging c., deck c., <k>stulifisto</k> c.
maker; <k>porto stulo</k> sedan c.; <k>rul stulo</k> bath-c.; <k>truo
 stulo</k> night-stool.

<k>stulta</k> foolish, silly, senseless; (cf. <k>frivola</k>); <k>stult(ul)o</k>
fool, booby, simpleton; (cf. <k>naiv(ul)o</k>); <k>stulteso</k>
silliness, folly; <k>stultajo</k> silly thing; foolish act;
absurdity. V. exp.: <k>Stulta</k> expresas ideo min forta kam <k>stupida.</k>
<k>Stupideso</k>esas kompleta manko di inteligenteso. <k>Stulteso</k>
esas plu juste manko di sagaceso, di judikado; II-711. Ant.: <k>saja.</k>
I<k />

<k>stumpo</k> stump (of tree, limb, column, cabbage, etc.); core
(of an apple); <k>stumpigar</k> to truncate; <k>stumpa pedo</k>
club-foot.

<k>stuntar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to stunt (growth of); <k>stuntesar</k>
to be stunted; <k>stuntita</k> stunted. Def.: Impedar la kresko e
developo di ulu, ulo; IV-512.

<k>stupo</k> tow; <ex>(tech.)</ex> packing (of a piston, etc.); <k>gudrizita
 stupo</k>, <k>gudrostupo</k> oakum; <k>stupizar</k> to stop or cover
with tow or oakum; <ex>(nav.)</ex> to calk (caulk); <ex>(tech.)</ex>
to pack (a piston, etc.); <k>stupobuxo</k> stuffing-box. V. exp.:
vid. <k>filaso.</k>

<k>stupida</k> stupid: without intelligence; <k>stupid(ul)o</k> a
s. person; <k>stupidajo</k> s. act; <k>stupidigar</k> to make (<k>ulu</k>)
s.; stultify, besot, dull. Ex.: Homi obtuza e stupida. Mieno
stupida. Mala traktado stupidigas infanto. V. exp.: vid. <k>stulta.</k>
Ant.: <k>inteligenta.</k>

<k>stuporo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> stupor; <k>stuporigar</k> to stupefy; <k>stuporigiva</k>, <k>stuporivo</k> stupefacient. Ex.: La stuporo de ebrieso. Opiumo
stuporigas. <ex>(fig.)</ex> La mala informo stuporigas lu.

<k>sturmo</k> storm, with thunder and lightning, thunderstorm; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
tumult. V. exp.: <k>Sturmo;</k> mala vetero konsistanta ek
fulmini, tondri, akompanata o sequata generale da pluvo o grelo. <k>Tempesto</k>
mala vetero konsistanta ek granda vento, qua sur la maro
efektigas ondegi danjeroza por la navigado, e qua ofte
akompanesas da pluvo. L’unesma fenomeno povas eventar sen
vento; la duesma konsistas esence en vento, e povas eventar, sive
sen pluvo o grelo, sive sen ula elektrala fenomeno; VIII-198.

<k>stuvo</k> a stove or room used to produce hot air for
drying, or hot vapo(u)r for sweating; sweating room; hot-air
bath; vapo(u)r-bath; drying-room; <k>stuvagar</k>to dry or heat in
a slow, moist heat; <ex>(med.)</ex> to foment (a wound); (cf. <k>furnelo</k>).
V. exp.: On <k>stufas</k> koquajo en irga vazo klozita, e ne en <k>stuvo.</k>
Existas stuvi humida e sika, t.e. kun o sen aquo-vaporo; II-648.

<k>su</k> <ex>(reflex. Pronoun, 3</ex><ex>rd</ex><ex>
person, singular or plural; acc.: </ex><k>sun</k>)<k /> self,
oneself, himself, herself, itself, themselves; <k>sua</k> <ex>(pl.:</ex>
<k>sui</k>) his, hers, its, their; <k>sudicanta</k>self-styled,
so called. Ex.: Li ne konkordas inter su. Il amas sua patrino. Il
ri-trovis elua libri, ma il ne povis ritrovar sui <ex>(pl.).</ex>
