La soldati defensis su brave. Egoisto sorgas nur por su (ipsa).
Note: <k>Su</k> is used in the third person only and refers
directly to the subject: <k>il lavas su</k> he washes himself; <k>li
 lavas su</k> they wash themselves; <k>singlu por su</k> each
one for himself. But, <k>me lavas me</k> I wash myself; <k>vu
 lavas vu</k> you wash tourself. <k>Su</k>, <k>lu: Petro pregis Karlo
 defensar su</k> Peter asked Charles to defend him (<k>su</k>
relates to Karlo who is the subject of <k>defensar</k>); (cf.
Talmey’s Text Book, p. 65-6).

<k>sub</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> under, below, beneath; lower in place
or rank; denoting subordination, dependence; <k>sube</k> (there)
under, underneath, below; <k>suba</k>under, subordinate; <k>suba
 busharo</k> underbrush. Ex.: sub la tablo. Servar sub ulu. Il
havas cent soldati sub sua komando. Il esas nur suba oficiro.
Suba etajo. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>super.</k>

<k>subdelegar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to subdelegate. Def.: Donar ad
altru la povo agar vice su.

<k>subdestruktar</k> <ex>(tr., fig.)</ex> to undermine: to
injure or destroy by clandestine means (cf. <k>minar</k>).

<k>subcherpar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to draw off (liquors, etc.,
from the bottom; vid. <k>rakar</k>).

<k>subemendo</k>, <k>suburo</k> additional amendment, amendment to an
amendment.

<k>subfarmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to farm (land, taxes) as an
under-lessee.

<k>subisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to undergo, endure, bear; <k>subisar
 tormento</k> to undergo tortures; <k>subisar yugo</k> to bear a
yoke; <k>subisar destino</k> to submit to one’s destiny. Def.:
Recevar force o kontrevole; III-207. Ex.: Ica korpo subisas
kompreso.

<k>subita</k> sudden, unexpected; <k>subite</k> suddenly, all of a
sudden; <k>subiteso</k> suddenness. Def.: qua esas tote
ne-previdita. Ex.: Subita morto, chanjo di la vetero.

<k>subjekto</k> <ex>(gram., log.)</ex> subject (cf. <k>temo</k>);
<k>subjektala</k> <ex>(philos.)</ex> subjective (opp. to <k>objektala</k>);
<k>subjektaleso</k> subjectivity. Ex.: La subjekto di verbo, di
propoziciono. Subjektala metodi, koncepti. <k />

<k>sublima</k> sublime; <k>sublimeso</k> sublimity; <k>sublimajo</k>
sublime object. Ex.: Sublima abnego, genio. <k />

<k>sublimar</k> <ex>(tr., chem.)</ex> to sublime, sublimate; <k>sublim(ad)o</k>
sublimation; <k>sublimato</k> a sublimate. Def.: Vaporigar ulo e lore
rikondensar ol a stando solida. <k />

<k>sublokacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to under-hire, sub-rent, sublet
(by tenant) (<k>ulo</k>, <k>de ulu</k>); (cf. <k>sublugar</k>).<k />

<k>sublugar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to under-lease, sub-rent (by the
proprietor) (<k>ulo ad ulu</k>); (cf. <k>sublokacar</k>).<k />

<k>submersar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to submerge (under water) (cf. <k>inundar</k>);
<k>submersonavo</k> submarine (boat). Ex.: Nil periodale submersas
Egiptia. V. exp.: vid. <k>imersar</k>.

<k>submisar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to reduce (<k>ulu</k>) to a state
of submission, dependence, to subdue, subjugate; <k>submisar su</k>
to submit, yield, succumb (cf. <k>vinkar</k>, <k>domptar</k>, <k>cedar</k>, <k>subisar</k>, <k>prizentar</k>, <k>submisionar</k>); <k>submiso</k> subjection
(act); <k>submiseso</k> submission, submissiveness, compliance (cf. <k>obediemeso</k>);
<k>submisita</k> subdued, subjugated. Ex.: Submisar la rebeli, sua
pasioni. Me submisas me a vua decido. La submiso di la urbo. Ica
populo submisesas (facis sua submiso) ed esas nun en (stando di)
perfekta submiseso.

<k>submisionar*</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to (make a) tender (<k>por</k>, <k>pri</k>) (a contract, loan); <k>submisiono</k> tender; <k>submisionanto</k>, <k>submisioninto</k>
party making tender, contract. V. exp.: <k>Submisionar</k> esas:
propozar su por entraprezar ula laboro (generale publika),
aceptante la kondicioni anuncita da la labor-donanto, e
demandante ula preco. Generale, plura entraprezisti esas invitata
<k>submisionar</k> samtempe per letri siglita e sekreta, ed on
adjudikas l’entraprezo a ta qua demandas la minima preco. To
esas speco di auciono, o prefere, inversajo di auciono: vice
vendar a la maxim-ofranto, on «kompras» de la minim-demandanto;
VI-385.

<k>subordinar*</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to (make) subordinate, subject (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>subordin(ad)o</k>, <k>subordineso</k> subordination; <k>subordinita</k>
subordinate(d); <k>subordinito</k> a subordinate; inferior; <k>subordinite</k>
subordinately. Ex.: La guvernerio subordinas la civitani a
la  judiciisti. La legi subordinas la civitani a la
judiciala oficisti. Subordinar sua volo ad altru. Mantenar
subordineso en la armeo. Propoziciono subordinita. La chefo fidas
a lua subordinati (od inferiori, od imperati).

<k>subornar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suborn: induce or instigate (<k>ulu</k>, <k>uli</k>) to do an evil deed, by bribes or the like; to bribe,
tamper with; (cf. <k>seduktar</k>, <k>koruptar</k>); <k>suborno</k>, <k>suborneso</k>
subornation, bribery; <k>subornar testi</k> to bribe witnesses; <k>subornebla</k>
venal; <k>subornebleso</k> venality.

<k>subsidiar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to subsidize: grant a subsidy to
(<k>ulu</k>); <k>subsidio</k> subsidizing, subsidy; sum granted. Ex.:
Subsidiar paketboto. La subsidiajo esis 50 mili, ma mem ca
subsidio ne esis suficanta. <k />

<k>subskribar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to write below, underneath
(cf. <k>signatar</k>); <k>suburo</k> what is written below; (cf. <k>surskriburo</k>).
Ex.: Noto skribita sub texto o letro esas subskribita, quankam la
subskriburo ne esas signatita da la skribinto.<k />

<k>substanco</k> substance; <k>substancala</k> substantial (cf. <k>esenco</k>).
Exd.: Substanci korpala, metala, liquida. Esis multa vorti ma
nula substanco en la diskurso. Indemno substancala. Griza
substanco di la cerebro.

<k>substantivo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> substantive, noun; <k>substantivigar</k>
to substantivize: to convert into, or use as, a substantive.

<k>substitucar</k> <ex>(tr.) </ex>to substitute: put in place of
another (<k>ulu ad ulu</k>, <k>ulo ad ulo</k>) <ex>(jur.)</ex> to entail
(an estate); <k>substitucato</k> a substitute. V. exp.: A <k>remplasas</k>
(E.: takes the place of) B = A okupas (provizore o definitive) la
loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di B.  A <k>remplaseskas</k> =
A prenas (komencas okupar la loko di B, pozas su od aparas en la
loko di B.  C <k>remplasigas</k> B per A = C pozas (o
produktas) A en la loko antee okupita da B. En la sama kazo, C <k>substitucas</k>
A a B, od, C <k>remplasigas</k> B per A (E. puts A in place of
B). Praktikal regulo: Omnafoye kande la propoziciono kontenas <k>tri</k>
termini, on devas uzar <k>remplasigar</k> o <k>substitucar</k>, <k />
ne <k>remplasar.</k> Uzez la prepoziciono «ad» kun substitucar,
ne «per». Uzez «per» kun remplas-igar. (Substitucar un kozo <k>ad</k>
ultra; remplas-igar un kozo <k>per</k> altra; do, en la pasivo: <k>remplasata</k>
da … remplasigata per … e substitucata a ….. );
III-102. V-283; kp. <k>suplantar</k>, <k>suplear.</k>

<k>substituto</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> deputy magistrate, surrogate.
V. exp.: <k>Substituto</k> esas la nomo di ofico di persono; por
la kozi ni havas <k>surogato;</k> IV-583. <k />

<k>subtenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to support (by holding
underneath; cf. <k>sustenar</k>, <k>apogar</k>). Ex.: Ta trabo subtenas
la konstrukturo.

<k>subteretajo</k> basement (below ground), underground floor
or chamber.

<k>subtila</k> <ex>(physical)</ex> subtile: not dense or gross; <ex>(mental)</ex>
subtile, subtle: keen, sharp, acute; <k>subtileso</k>, <k>subtilajo</k> <ex>(quality,
objective)</ex> subtleness, subtility; <k>subtilachajo</k> subtlety
(in bad sense), quibble, hair-splitting distinction; <k>subtiligar</k>
to subtilize: render fine or ethereal; to draw subtle
distinctions in, refine into niceties. Ex.: Subtila veneno,
polvo. Subtila intelekto, mento. La subtilaji di metafiziko. Troa
subtileso nocas argumento.

<k>suburbo</k> suburb, outskirts (of a town, city; cf. <k>preurbo</k>);
<k>subala</k> suburban; <k>subano</k> suburbanite.

<k>subvencionar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to grant a subvention to,
subsidize; <k>subvenciono</k> subvention: government aid or bounty; (cf. <k>subsidiar</k>).
Ex.: Subvenciono di teatro di la stato.

<k>subversar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to subvert: overturn from the
foundation: bring to ruin or destrucion, as by moral or political
force; (cf. <k>renversar</k>); <k>subverso</k>, <k>subverseso</k> <ex>(act, state)</ex>
subversion, ruin; <k>subversanta</k>, <k>subversiva</k>, <k>subversema</k> subversive. Ex.: Ta
doktrino subversas la principi di etiko. Subverso di la stato per
anarkio. Doktrino subversiva.

<k>sucedar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to succeed: came after,
follow in order, (cf. <k>sequar; sucesar</k>); <k>sucedo</k>, <k>sucedado</k>
succession; <k>sucedanto</k>, <k>sucedinto (di)</k> successor; <k>sucedanta</k>
successive subsequent; <k>sucede</k>, <k>sucedante</k> successively, in
succession, inturn; <k>sucedar</k> (od, <k>intersequar</k>) <k>l’una
 l’altra</k> to succeed, follow one another. Ex.: Jorno
sucedas la nokto. La sucedado di nia idei. Louis XII esis la
sucedanto di Charles VIII. Chapitri sucedanta. <k />

<k>sucesar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to succeed: accomplish one’s
purpose, be successful; <k>suceso</k> success; <k>sucesanta</k>, <k>sucesoza</k>
successful; <k>mi suceso</k> indifferent success. Ex.: Lu sucesas
en sua entraprezajo. La suceso di teatrajo. La verko ne esis tre
sucesoza.

<k>suciar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to care about: be concerned,
solicitous, anxious about (<k>ulu</k>, <k>ulo</k>); <k>sucio: suciego</k>
(mental) care, solicitude, anxiety; <k>sucianta</k>, <k>sucioza</k>, <k>suciema</k>
solicitous, anxious, careworn; <k>sen sucia</k> careless,
thoughtless; <k>me ne sucias</k> I do not care. Def.: Havar sua
spirito okupata pri o por la bona stando di persono o kozo amata;
VI-345. V. exp.: <k>Suciar</k>, <k>sorgar</k>, <k>flegar: Sorg(ad)o</k> esas
ago, kontre <k>sucio</k> esas mentala stando. Exempli: Matro
povas <k>suciar</k> sua infanto, ma konfidas a la nutristino la <k>sorgo</k>
pri lu. On <k>flegas</k> malado, infanto. On ne povas dicar, ke
ta matro ne <k>sucias</k>sua filieto, nam elua paroli klare
montras, ke sempre el pensas a lua stando e deziras ke ol
esez bona; ma fakte el <k>sorgas</k> lu nultempe, nam el
abandonas a lua nutristino omna <k>sorgi</k>, <k /> quin el devus ipse
facar a l’infanto. Mea tutelanto ne nur <k>suciis</k> mea
saneso e feliceso, ma il <k>sorgis</k> li omnamaniere, ed il esis
quik extreme nequieta, kande me sentis irga sufreto. Yes, nun me
esas nequieta pri la mala stando di vua aferi; ma li ne esus
tante desesperiganta, se olim vu esabus plu <k>sucioza</k> o <k>suciema</k>
pri oli; VI-345.

<k>sudo</k> south; <k>sudala</k> southern, southerly; <k>sude</k>
southward; <k>sudesto</k> south-east; <k>sudano</k> a southerner.

<k>sudoro</k> sweat, perspiration; <k>sudorifar</k> to perspire,
be in a sweat; <k>sudorifanta</k> sweating, sudoriferous; <k>sudorifigar</k>
to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to sweat; <k>sudorifegar</k> to perspire
profusely; <k>sudorifigiva</k>, <k>sudorivo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> sudorific.
<k />

<k>suficar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to suffice, be sufficient (<k>ad</k>, <k>por</k>); <k>suficas</k> <ex>(impers.)</ex> it is sufficient; that is
enough; that will do; <k>sufico</k>, <k>suficajo</k> sufficing; sufficiency,
adequacy, competency; <k>suficanta</k> sufficient (cf. <k>sat</k>); <k>suficante</k>
sufficiently. Ex.: Cent franki suficos a me. Suficajo de
frumento.Kapaceso suficanta. Esar suficante klara. To suficas a
me, equivalas: me konsideras, aceptas to kom suficanta. V. exp:
vid. <k>saciar</k>, <k>sat.</k> <k />

<k>sufixo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> suffix; <k>sufixigar</k> to suffix:
annex at the end of a word.

<k>suflar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to blow (wind, etc.); <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to blow: force wind or breathe upon; <ex>(theat.)</ex> to prompt (a
speaker); <ex>(chess, checkers)</ex> to huff; <k>sufl(ad)o</k>
blow(ing), puffing, breath, breathing (cf. <k>respiro</k>, <k>anhelo</k>);
<k>sufleto</k>, <k>suflego</k>, <k>suflajo</k> (the air) puff, gust, blast, whiff; <k>forjosuflilo</k>
blacksmith’s bellows. Ex.: La vento suflas. Suflar (ad) sua
fingri. Suflar fairo, vitro, orgeno. Suflar aktoro. Suflar piono.
Ne esis mem vento-sufleto. Extingar buijio per sufl(et)o di la
respirajo.

<k>sufokar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to suffocate, stifle,
smother, choke; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to check, subdue; (cf. <k>strangular</k>);
<k>sufokanta</k>, <k>sufokiva</k> suffocating, stifling. Ex.: La nutristino
sufokas la dormanta infanto. Sufokar la karbonfairo. Sufokar sua
singluti. Me sufokis pro irocego, pro la varmegeso. Astmo donas
la sento di sufoko. Aero sufokanta. V. exp.: vid. <k>asfixiar.</k>

<k>sufrar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to suffer (from), be
afflicted with; (cf. <k>dolorar</k>, <k>subisar</k>, <k>tolerar</k>); <k>il
 sufras en la hepato</k> his liver is out of order. Ex.: Sufrar
(de, pro) la hungro, la dursto, la doloro, lo morto. Persono
infirma e sufranta.

<k>sugar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suck (candy, etc., <k>ulo de ulo</k>);
<k>suganta</k> sucking; <ex>(zool.)</ex> suctorial; <k>sugilo</k>
sucker (as of an insect); <k>mamsugar</k>to suckle (cf. <k>alaktar</k>).
Ex.: Sugar la suko de oranjo. V. exp.: On povas <k>aspirar</k>, <k />
ne nur aero od altra gaso, ma anke liquido. Do on povas e devas
dicar, ke pumpilo <k>aspiras</k>, <k /> e distingar teknikale la
pumpili <k>aspirante</k>e <k>presanta.</k> (Pumpilo <k>aspiras</k>
unesme l’aero, e per la sama procedo, kande ol esas
amorcita, ol duras <k>aspirar</k> l’aquo. Sugar expresas ago
di la boko, labii, lango, qua ne implikas necese <k>aspiro</k>.
Exemple, on <k>sugas</k> bonbono en la boko; on nule <k>aspiras</k>
ol; V-156.

<k>sugestar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suggest, intimate (<k>ulo ad
 ulu</k>); <k>sugestetar</k> to hint; <k>sugest(ad)o</k> suggestion; <k>sugestajo</k>
what is suggested, suggestion, intimation; <k>sugestanta</k>, <k>sugestiva</k>
suggestive. Ex.: To sugestis ideo a me. Sugesto hipnotala.
Sugestiva penso. Lu mem ne sugestetis la ago a me.

<k>suko</k> juice: sap (of vegetables) the water (of fruit); <k>sukoza</k>
juicy; <k>suko stomakala</k> gastric juice. Ex.: La suko di
oranjo.

<k>sukombar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to succumb (ad), to yield, get
worsted. Ex.: Sukombar a tento, a doloro, sub la pezajo.

<k>sukro</k> sugar; <k>sukrala</k> relating to s.; <k>sukratra</k>
s.-like; <k>sukroza</k> sugary: naturally sweet; <k>sukrizita</k>
sugered: covered with s.; sweetened; <k>sukrizar</k> to s.; put s.
in or on; to sweeten; <k>sukrajo</k> a sweet(meat);<k>sukrajerio</k>
confectioner’s shop; <k>sukrifisto</k> s. maker; <k>sukriferio</k>
s.-works, s. refinery; <k>sukrolumpo</k>, <k>sukrobloko</k> s. loaf; <k>sukropulvero</k>
powdered, ground s.; <k>sukrokano</k> s. cane.

<k>sukusar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to cause violent vibrations in, to
shake, shake off, jerk, jog, jostle, jolt; (cf. <k>agitar</k>, <k>ocilar</k>, <k>shanceligar</k>, <k>tremar</k>); <k>sukusope</k> by shakes, jerks.
Ex.: Sukusar arboro, tablo, sua kapo. Sukusado la polvo de la
vesto. Sukusado di veturo sur voyo aspera.

<k>sulo</k> soil (cf. <k>tero</k>, <k>tereno</k>); <k>sub sulo</k>
subsoil. Def.: La supra strato di la tero, konsiderata pri lua
produktive qualesi; Ex.: sulo fertila, sterila, e.c.

<k>sulfo*</k> sulphur, brimstone; <k>sulfoza</k>, <k>sulfatra</k>
sulphurous; <k>sulfopulvero</k> flowers of s.; <k>sulfizar</k>, <k>sulfagar</k>
to sulphurize; <k>sulfeyo</k>, <k>sulfjaceyo</k>, <k>mineyo</k> s. mine; <k>sulfatacido</k>
sulphuric acid (H2SO­­­4); <k>sulfido</k>
sulphuret; <k>sulfito</k> sulphite; <k>sulfitoacido</k> sulphurous
acid (H2SO3).

<k>sulko</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> furrow (as made by plow);
ship’s track; <k>sulkizar</k> to furrow; <k>roto sulko</k>
wheel rut.

<k>sumo</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> sum, amount, total; (cf. <k>toto</k>, <k>agregajo</k>); <k>sumo totala</k> s. total; <k>sume</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
finally, on the whole, after all; <k>sumigar</k> to sum up, cast
up, totalize; <k>sumigo</k> summing up. Def.: Rezultajo di la
adiciono di plura nombri o quanti. Ex.: La sumo di la unaji.
Sumigar du nombri.

<k>sumaria</k> <ex>(adj.)</ex> summary. Def.: Dic-esas pri agi
facita rapide, sen tempo-perdo o neutila formulaji. V-623. Ex.:
Sumaria judiko.

<k>sumnar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to summon, call authoritatively
upon; <k>sumno</k> summons, Def.: Demandar impereme o postular
segun yuro e legala formi; III-417. Ex.: Sumnar debanto pagar.
Sumnar fortreso kapitulacar. <k />

<k>suno</k> sun; <ex>(fig.)</ex> sunlight; <k>sunala</k> solar; <k>sunoza</k>
sunny; <k>sunfrapo</k> sunstroke; <k>sunfloro</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex>
sunflower (genus: Helianthus); <k>sunhorlojo</k> sun-dial; <k>para
 suno</k> parasol; <k>sunbrulita</k> sunburned.

<k>suocidar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to commit suicide; <k>suo</k>
suicide; <k>suinto</k> a suicide.

<k>suolo</k> sole (of boots, shoes) (cf. <k>plando</k>); a sort
of horn under a horse’s hoof; <k>suolo ledra</k> leather sole;
<k>suolizar</k> to sole; <k>ri suolizar</k> to resole.

<k>supo</k> soup; porridge; <k>supuyo</k> s. holder, s. tureen; <k>legum
 o</k>vegetable s.; <k>lakto supo</k> milk porridge.

<k>supear</k> <ex>(intr.) </ex>to sup, take a (midnight) supper;
(<k>noktomezala</k>) -<k>o</k> (midnight) supper; <k>supeo santa</k>
Holy Supper; (cf. <k>dejunar</k>, <k>dinear</k>). Def.: La repasto quan
on facas cirkum o pos noktomezo ti qui vigilas, pos teatro, balo,
festo, e.c.; V-278; kp. VI-162. Ex.: Supear delikate (od,
supeetar) pos l’opero.

<k>super</k> <ex>(prep., elevation)</ex> over, above (but not in
contact with; cf. <k>sur</k>); <ex>(of degree)</ex> over, more
than, greater than, superior to; <k>supere</k> over, above (that); <k>supera</k>
higher, upper (cf. <k>superiora</k>); <k>ucelo flugis super la
 domo</k> a bird flew over the house; <k>super la suprajo</k>
over the top; <k>dekekin gradi super zero</k> fifteen degrees
above freezing point; <k>il stacis supere</k> he stood above; <k>supere
 dicita</k> aforesaid; <k>supere nomita</k> above named; <k>supera
 etaji</k> upper floors, stories above (cf. <k>supra etajo</k>); <k>supera
 klaso</k> upper class; <k>supera genio</k> superior genius; <k>superesar</k>
to be over, overtop, surpass, have a superiority; <k>supereso</k>
highness, superiority (cf. <k>superioreso</k>); <k>ica vino
 superesas ta</k> this wine is superior to (better than) that; <k>la
 monto superesas</k> (od, <k>dominacas</k>) <k>la urbo</k> the
mountain is above the city; <k>supereso di kurajo</k>
superiority of courage. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>sub.</k>

<k>superavancar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to advance over; to overhang;
(cf. <k>saliar</k>, <k>superpendar</k>). Ex.: La muro super-avancas.

<k>superba</k> conceited, supercilious (cf. <k>aroganta</k>); <k>superbeso</k>
conceitedness: excessive self-esteem; <k>superbigar</k> to make (<k>ulu</k>)
c., to puff up; <k>superbesar</k>, <k>superbeskar</k> to be, become c. V. exp.: <k>Superbeso</k>
produktas ecesiva su-estimo; <k>vanitateso</k> produktas deziro
por l’aplaudo di altri; <k>prezunto</k> esas sufidego pri la
imaginita posedo di ulo quon on fakte ne posedas; kp. <k>fiera.</k>
Ant.: <k>humila.</k>

<k>supercharjar</k> <ex>(tr., also fig.)</ex> to overload,
overburden. Ex.: Supercharjar kavalo, veturo, sua stomako, sua
employati.

<k>superflua</k> superfluous; superogatory; <k>superflueso</k> <ex>(quality)</ex>
superfluousness; <k>superfluajo</k> <ex>(object)</ex> superfluity;
overplus, (work of) superogation. Def.: Qua esas troa. Ex.:
Ornivi, regreti superflua. Superflueso de vorti. Esas superfluaji
en ta verko.

<k>superfluar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to overflow; <k>supero</k>
overflowing; <k>superantajo</k> the overflow, waste; <k>superotubo</k>
waste pipe.

<k>superiora</k> <ex>(social, hierarchical)</ex> superior; <k>superior(ul)o</k>
superior; <k>superioreso</k> superiority. Ex.: La arki-episkopo esas la
superioro di (od esas superiora ad) la episkopo, e do havas
superioreso. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>inferiora.</k>

<k>superirar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to go over, to rise above; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to surpass; <k>superar su</k> to surpass, outdo oneself. Ex.:
Superirar la monto. Ca lernanto superiras (od, superesas) omna
kunlernanti. Me superiris mea tasko.

<k>supernumerario</k> a supernumerary; <k>supernumerarieso</k> s. service
or time; state of being a s. Def.: Employato quan on admisas
exter rango, por vartar ordinara employo; IV-584.

<k>superpendar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to hang over. Ex.: La roko
superpendas la ravino.

<k>superpozar</k> to superpoze: to lay upon (<k>ulo ad</k>, <k>sur
 ulo</k>).

<k>supersigno</k> diacritic(al) mark; written or printed sign
of accent (cf. <k>acento</k>); <k>superizar</k> to mark with, add
diacritics.

<k>supervido</k> (rapid) survey, view; <k>me havis nur
 supervido di la loko</k>, <k>di la afero</k> I had but a summary view
of the place, but a faint knowledge of the matter.

<k>supino</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> supine: verbal noun, similar to
the English verbals in -ing.

<k>suplantar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to supplant (a rival, etc.). V.
exp.: B <k>supleas</k> A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico,
funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado.
B <k>suplantas</k> A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por
remplasar lu permanante; kp. <k>Substitucar.</k>

<k>suplear</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to supply: make up, make good (the
defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the
duty of (temporarily); <k>supleanto</k> substitute, assistant,
deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di)
talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. <k>suplantar.</k>

<k>suplemento</k> <ex>(also math.)</ex> supplement; <k>suplementa</k>, <k>suplementala</k>
supplementary, additional, extra; <k>suplemente</k> in addition, by way
of s.; <k>suplemento di angulo</k> s. of an angle: the quantity by which
an arc or an angle falls short of 180º. Ex.: Suplemento di (ad)
libro. Suplementala pago, preco, kusto.

<k>suplikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to supplicate, humbly beseech,
entreat, beg (<k>ulu pri</k>, <k>por ulo</k>). Def.: Pregar ulu kun
insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. <k>implorar.</k>

<k>suportar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to support: bear
the weight of; (cf. <k>sustenar</k>, <k>tolerar</k>); <k>suportilo</k> a
support, prop; <k>suportanto</k> <ex>(person)</ex> supporter, upholder.
Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar
la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. <ex>bear</ex>) la koldeso, la
doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la
guvernerio. V. exp.: <k>Suportar</k> esas portar kozo sen movo,
tale ke ol ne falez; ma <k>portar</k> uzesas generale kun movo.
Metafore, <k>suportar</k> uzesas en senco vicina di <k>tolerar;</k>
IV-162

<k>supozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suppose, assume (<k>ulo</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>);
<k>supozo</k> <ex>(act)</ex> supposition; <k>supozajo</k> supposition,
assumption; <k>supozebla</k> supposable; <k>supozite ke</k> on the
supposition that; <k>supozez ke</k> let us suppose that; <k>en omna
 supozo</k> however it may be. Def.: Admisar kom hipotezo; imaginar
ulo kontre la vereso. Ex.: Supozar ulo neposibla. To esas riskema
supozajo.

<k>supre</k> on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards,
upstairs (cf. <k>supere</k>); <k>supra</k> top, of or relating to
what is highest up in space or degree; <k>suprajo</k> highest part,
top (cf. <k>somito</k>); <k>il esas ibe supre</k>he is up
there; <k>irar adsupre</k> to go to the top, to go up; <k>supra
 etajo</k> top or highest floor; <k>supr(eg)a povo</k>, <k>autoritato</k>
supreme power, authority; <k>la supro</k> <ex>(geometrical sense, </ex>or,
<k>suprajo</k> material part) <k>di la monto</k> the top of the
mountain. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>infre.</k>

<k>supresar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suppress, do away with; <k>supreso</k>
<ex>(act)</ex> suppression; <k>supresajo</k> what is suppressed. Def.:
Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio,
libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. <k>abolisar.</k>

<k>sur</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> on, upon: above and in contact with
the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. <k>super</k>, <k>an</k>); <ex>(arith.)</ex> divided by; <k>sura</k> upper (cf. <k>supera</k>);
<k>adsur</k> onto (with motion); <k>sur la tablo</k> on the
table; <k>navo sur la maro</k> ship on the sea; <k>sur la
 rivero</k>, <k>la strado</k> on the river (itself) on the street
(itself; N.B. not on the bank of the river or the side of the
street, <k>an</k>); <k>saltar ad sur la lito</k> to jump onto
the bed; <k>sura etajo</k> the floor (just) above; <k>non sur
 tri facas tri</k> 9:3 = 3. Def.: Plu alta kam ula objekto e
kontaktanta; III-228. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>sub.</k>

<k>supervido</k> (rapid) survey, view; <k>me havis nur
 supervido di la loko</k>, <k>di la afero</k> I had but a summary view
of the place, but a faint knowledge of the matter.

<k>supino</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> supine: verbal noun, similar to
the English verbals in -ing.

<k>suplantar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to supplant (a rival, etc.). V.
exp.: B <k>supleas</k> A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico,
funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado.
B <k>suplantas</k> A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por
remplasar lu permanante; kp. <k>Substitucar.</k>

<k>suplear</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to supply: make up, make good (the
defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the
duty of (temporarily); <k>supleanto</k> substitute, assistant,
deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di)
talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. <k>suplantar.</k>

<k>suplemento</k> <ex>(also math.)</ex> supplement; <k>suplementa</k>, <k>suplementala</k>
supplementary, additional, extra; <k>suplemente</k> in addition, by way
of s.; <k>suplemento di angulo</k> s. of an angle: the quantity by which
an arc or an angle falls short of 180º. Ex.: Suplemento di (ad)
libro. Suplementala pago, preco, kusto.

<k>suplikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to supplicate, humbly beseech,
entreat, beg (<k>ulu pri</k>, <k>por ulo</k>). Def.: Pregar ulu kun
insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. <k>implorar.</k>

<k>suportar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to support: bear
the weight of; (cf. <k>sustenar</k>, <k>tolerar</k>); <k>suportilo</k> a
support, prop; <k>suportanto</k> <ex>(person)</ex> supporter, upholder.
Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar
la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. <ex>bear</ex>) la koldeso, la
doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la
guvernerio. V. exp.: <k>Suportar</k> esas portar kozo sen movo,
tale ke ol ne falez; ma <k>portar</k> uzesas generale kun movo.
Metafore, <k>suportar</k> uzesas en senco vicina di <k>tolerar;</k>
IV-162

<k>supozar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suppose, assume (<k>ulo</k>, <k>pri ulo</k>);
<k>supozo</k> <ex>(act)</ex> supposition; <k>supozajo</k> supposition,
assumption; <k>supozebla</k> supposable; <k>supozite ke</k> on the
supposition that; <k>supozez ke</k> let us suppose that; <k>en omna
 supozo</k> however it may be. Def.: Admisar kom hipotezo; imaginar
ulo kontre la vereso. Ex.: Supozar ulo neposibla. To esas riskema
supozajo.

<k>supre</k> on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards,
upstairs (cf. <k>supere</k>); <k>supra</k> top, of or relating to
what is highest up in space or degree; <k>suprajo</k> highest part,
top (cf. <k>somito</k>); <k>il esas ibe supre</k>he is up
there; <k>irar adsupre</k> to go to the top, to go up; <k>supra
 etajo</k> top or highest floor; <k>supr(eg)a povo</k>, <k>autoritato</k>
supreme power, authority; <k>la supro</k> <ex>(geometrical sense, </ex>or,
<k>suprajo</k> material part) <k>di la monto</k> the top of the
mountain. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>infre.</k>

<k>supresar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suppress, do away with; <k>supreso</k>
<ex>(act)</ex> suppression; <k>supresajo</k> what is suppressed. Def.:
Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio,
libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. <k>abolisar.</k>

<k>sur</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> on, upon: above and in contact with
the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. <k>super</k>, <k>an</k>); <ex>(arith.)</ex> divided by; <k>sura</k> upper (cf. <k>supera</k>);
<k>adsur</k> onto (with motion); <k>sur la tablo</k> on the
table; <k>navo sur la maro</k> ship on the sea; <k>sur la
 rivero</k>, <k>la strado</k> on the river (itself) on the street
(itself; N.B. not on the bank of the river or the side of the
street, <k>an</k>); <k>saltar ad sur la lito</k> to jump onto
the bed; <k>sura etajo</k> the floor (just) above; <k>non sur
 tri facas tri</k> 9:3 = 3. Def.: Plu alta kam ula objekto e
kontaktanta; III-228. V. exp.: vid. <k>alta.</k> Ant.: <k>sub.</k>

<k>surda</k> deaf; <k>surd(ul)o</k> a d. person; <k>surdeso</k>
deafness; <k>surdigar</k> to deafen (<k>ulu</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
stun (with noise); <k>surdeskar</k> to become d.; <k>surdamuta</k>, <k>surd(ul)o</k> deaf and dumb (person); <k>simular surdo</k> to
make-believe to be d., to turn a d. ear to; <k>surdega</k>, <k>stone surda</k>
stone-deaf, deaf as a post.
<k>surdento</k> tooth grown over another, projecting tooth.

<k>surfaco</k> surface, outside; <ex>(fig.)</ex> appearance; (cf.
<k>areo</k>); <k>surfacala</k>superficial: relating to the s.; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
specious (plan, judgement, reasoning; cf. <k>neprofunda</k>, <k>neserioza</k>); <k>surfacale judikar</k> to judge superficially, by
appearance; <k>suface flotacar</k> to float upon the s. Def.: La
suprajo, la exterajo di ula korpo. Ex.: La surfaco di la tero.
Vunduro surfacala. <k />

<k>surmenar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to overdrive, drive beyond
one’s strength, overtax, overstrain (<k>supercharjar</k>, <k>fatigar</k>). Ex.: Surmenar kavalo. Surmenar sua forteso per
laborado, sua mento per studiado.

<k>surnomo</k> surname, family name; <k>suracho</k> nickname,
sobriquet; <k>surizar</k> to surname. Ex.: Il surnomizis Simon kom
Peter, t.e. kom Simon Peter.

<k>surogato</k> <ex>(of things) </ex>substitute: that which is
put in place of another thing; <ex>(med.)</ex> succedaneum; <k>surogata</k>
substitute. V. exp.: vid. <k>substituto.</k>

<k>suprizar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to surprise, take by s., take
unawares, to come or fall upon suddenly and unexpectedly,
overtake suddenly; (cf. <k>astonar</k>, <k>kaptacar</k>); <k>suprizo</k>, <k>suprizeso</k>
<ex>(act, state)</ex> surprisal, surprise; unawareness; <k>suprize</k>
by s.; <k>suprizanta</k> surprising. Ex.: Surprizar furtero, la
enemiko. Mi-voye la pluvo surprizis ni. Li timas surpriz-atako da
la enemiko. Donar surpriz-buxo a la puero.

<k>surveyar</k> to keep an eye on, superintend, look after,
watch over, inspect; <k>survey(ad)o</k> supervision, superintendence,
oversight, surveillance; <k>surveyanta</k>, <k>surveyema</k> superintending,
watchful, vigilant; <k>surveyanto</k>, <k>surveyero</k>, <k>surveyisto</k> inspector,
overseer, superintendent. Def.: Sorgar afero, tasko, ulo, kun
partikulareso e autoritato. Ex.: Generalo devas surveyar omno.
Surveyar la afero e la laboristi en fabrikerio. Surveyar la
konduto di ulu. Surveyo di lernanti o karcerani.

<k>suskriptar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to subscribe: contribute
a definite sum to an undertaking; (cf. <k>signatar</k>, <k>subskribar</k>);
<k>suskripto</k> subscription: act of contributing (N.B. not to a
newspaper, cf. <k>abono</k>); the consent in writing; <k>suskriptajo</k>
subscription: amount contributed. Ex.: Me suskriptas cent franki
kom yarala kontributo ad ca entraprezo. Me abonas ta revuo ed
anke suskriptas pekunio por la mantenokaso.

<k>suspektar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suspect: hold in suspicion, to
distrust; doubt the hono(u)r, fidelity or sincerity of; to
imagine guilty; (cf. <k>desfidar</k>, <k>konjektar</k>); <k>suspekto</k>
suspicion; <k>suspekteskar</k> to grow suspicious; <k>igar ulu
 suspektinda</k>, <k>suspektigar ulu</k> to cause (<k>ulu</k>) to be
suspected, to cast suspicion on (<k>ulu</k>); <k>suspektema</k> <ex>(tendency)</ex>
suspicious, mistrustful; <k>suspektebla</k>, <k>suspektinda</k> suspicious; <k>suspektindo</k>
a suspect. Ex.: Suspektar ulu pri krimino, pri herezio. Ta
suspekto esas male fondita. Lu mem suspektas sua amiki.

<k>suspendar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. sense)</ex> to suspend, hang up:
fix (<k>ulo</k>) on high and leave hanging; (cf. <k>pendar</k>, <k>akrochar</k>); <k>suspendo</k>, <k>suspendeso</k> suspending, suspension; <k>suspendanta</k>
hanging; <ex>(med. etc.)</ex> suspensory; <k>ponto suspendita</k>
suspension bridge. Ex.: Suspendar (od, pend-igar) lampo de la
plafono. Pulvero suspendita en liquido.

<k>suspensar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to suspend (functionaries,
judgement, privileges, work) (cf. <k>suspendar</k>, <k>haltigar</k>, <k>interruptar</k>). Def.: Revokar dum tempo; VI-163.

<k>sustenar</k> <ex>(tr., phys. and fig.)</ex> to sustain, bear,
uphold; prevent from falling (cf. <k>subtenar</k>, <k>suportar</k>, <k>mantenar</k>, <k>helpar</k>, <k>defensar</k>); <k>sustenilo</k> stay, prop; <k>sustenomuro</k>
retaining wall; <k>sustenostango</k> sustaining rod, prop. Ex.: La
fundamento sustenas la edifico. Sustenar sua reputo, entraprezo.
<k>sustracionar</k> <ex>(tr., arith.)</ex> to subtract, deduct (<k>ulo</k>, <k>de ulo</k>). Ant.: <k>adicionar.</k>

<k>sustraktar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to abstract, appropriate (<k>fraude</k>);
purloin, steal, embezzle (money, etc.). Def.: Deprenar o furtar
ulo per habileso o per fraudo.

<k>susurar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to whisper, murmur or mutter
(words); <ex>(fig.)</ex> to whisper, sough (of the wind); <k>susur(ad)o</k>
whisper(ing), speaking under the breath; <k>susuranta</k>, <k>susurema; susuranto</k>, <k>susuremo</k> whisper-ing, -er. Def.: Parolar nelaute; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
facar duranta nelauta bruiso, ex, «la vento susuras en
l’arbori;» IV-600.

<k>sutar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to sew, stitch; <k>sut(ad)o</k>, <k>suturo</k>
sewing; seam; <ex>(surg.)</ex> suture; <k>sutomashino</k> sewing
machine; <k>sutistino</k> seamstress; <k>sutokorbo</k>
sewing-basket. V. exp.: vid. <k>stebar.</k>

<k>suverena</k>, <k>suveren(ul)o</k> sovereign; (cf. <k>suprega</k>); <k>suvereneso</k>
sovereignty. Ex.: Autoritato suverena. En demokratio, la populo
havas la suvereneso.

<k>fa</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> fa: fourth note of the diatonic
scale.

<k>fabrikar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to manufacture (cf. <k>manufabrikar</k>);
<k>fabrik(ad)o</k> fabrication, manufacture; <k>fabrikuro</k> object
made, <k>fabrikerio</k> factory, works, mills. (cf. <k>manufakturo</k>);
<k>fabrikomarko</k> trademark. Def.: Facar laboruri segun procedi
mashinala o mekanikal. Ex.: Fabrikar horloji, stofi.

<k>facar</k> <ex>(tr., lit. and fig.)</ex> to make (a concrete
object); to do, perform (a certain act); <k>facigar</k> to cause <k>(ulu)</k>
to make <k>(ulo)</k>; to have <k>(ulo)</k> done (<k>da ulu</k>);
(cf. <k>igar</k>); <k>facesar</k> to be made, performed; <k>faco</k>
making, doing; <k>facanto</k>, <k>ero</k> maker, doer; <k>facebla</k>
practicable, feasible; <k>facar shui</k> to make shoes; <k>facar
 bona komercado</k> to do a good business. V. exp.: vid. <k>agar.</k>

<k>faceto</k> facet (as of a diamond); <k>facetizar</k> to put f.s
on, cut with f.s; <k>facetizita</k>, <k>facetoza</k> faceted.

<k>facio</k> <ex>(gen.)</ex> front part or view (of anything);
(cf. <k>vizajo</k>, <k>averso</k>); <k>faciala</k> facial, frontal; <k>mi
 facio</k> <ex>(photog.)</ex> pose between face and profile; <k>facio
 kontre facio</k> f. to f.; <k>avan la facio</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> in the
presence of. Def.: L'avana parto di irga korpo; V-679. Ant.: <k>reverso</k>, <k>dorso.</k>

<k>«facies»</k> <ex>(anat., geol., biol.)</ex> facies: general
aspect or appearance of anything.

<k>facila</k> easy (to do), facile, not difficult; <k>facileso</k>
facility (quality); <k>facilajo</k> an e. thing; <k>faciligar</k> to
facilitate (<k>ulo</k>, <k>ad ulu</k>); <k>facile laborar</k> to work
easily; <k>facile komprenebla</k> e. to understand; <k>facilmora
 muliero</k> a woman of e. virtue.

<k>facinar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fascinate. Ex.: L'amoro facinas
la okuli. On dicas ke la serpento facinas sua viktimi.

<k>facionar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be on sentry duty, mount
guard; <k>faciono</k> sentry watch; <k>facionanto</k>, <k>facionero</k> sentry (cf. <k>sentinelo</k>);
<k>facionigar</k> to post (a sentry); <k>chanjar la faciono</k> to
relieve the watch. Def.: Stacar en posteno, gardar posteno;
VII-130.

<k>fago</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> beech(-tree) (genus: Fagus); <k>fagofrukto</k>
b. nut; <k>fageyo</k> b. grove.

<k>fairo</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> fire; <k>fairoza</k>, <k>fairatra</k>
fiery, igneous; <k>faireyo</k> f. place, hearth (cf. <k>herdo</k>);
<k>fairea</k> f. colored; <k>fairifar</k> to produce f. (as by
friction); <k>fairifilo</k> f. producer; <k>fairespruva briko</k>
fireproof brick; <k>fairextingilo</k> f. extinguisher; <k>fairoglutero</k>
fire-eater; <k>fairogreto</k> f. grate; <k>fairohoko</k> f. rake,
(bent) poker; <k>fairokulto</k> f. worship; <k>fairomusho</k> f.
fly (cf. <k>luciolo</k>, <k>lampiro</k>); <k>fairopincego</k> f. tongs; <k>fairoligno</k>
f. wood; <k>pikar</k>, <k>suflar la fairo</k> to poke, to blow the f.; <k>fairpikilo</k>
poker; firing-bar; <k>fairoskreno</k> f. screen; <k>faireyaltapiso</k>
hearth rug; <k>fairostalo</k> steel for striking fire; <k>para
 fairo</k> fender, fire-guard; <k>palio fairo</k> fire of straw; (cf.
<k>incendio</k>).

<k>fako</k> anything portioned off, as a compartment, division
(in a desk), stall (in a stable); branch, proper office,
province, department, speciality (in a business, profession,
government, field of knowledge); <k>faketo</k> pigeon-hole; small
specialty of duty, in research; <k>fakaro</k> set or nest of
drawers; <k>fakestro</k> department head; <k>to ne esas en mea fako</k>
that is out of my province; that's not in my line; <k>komprenar
 sua fako</k> to understand one's business.

<k>fakto</k> fact; <k>fakta</k>, <k>faktala</k> real, relating to f.; <k>fakte</k>
in fact; <k>faktala questiono</k> a question of f.

<k>faktorio</k> <ex>(com.)</ex> factory: trading agency. Def.:
Kontoro di agenti di kompanio komercala en lando stranjera.
<k>«faktotum»</k> factotum: a doer of all kinds of work.

<k>fakultato</k> faculty, power of doing anything; (of a
university) faculty; <k>grantar fakultato ad ulu</k> to grant a
person the faculty (or power);<k>la fakultati natural</k> the
natural faculties; <k>la fakultato di medicino</k> the f. of
medicine.

<k>falar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to fall (down), tumble; <k>faletar</k>
to stumble (cf. <k>mispazar</k>, <k>pedbutar</k>); <k>falanta</k>
falling; <k>falinta</k> fallen, <k>faligar</k> to cause to fall, to
fell, <k>(ulo</k>, <k>ulu)</k>; <k>lasar falar</k> to let <k>(ulo)</k>
fall, drop <k>(ulo)</k>.

<k>falbalo</k> furbelow, flounce; <k>falbalizar</k> to cover with
f.s.

<k>falco</k> <ex>(carp.)</ex> check, rebate, ledge (of a door or
shutter). Def.: Speco de kanelo en la kadro di pordo, por recevar
la bordo di ca pordo; V-621.

<k>falchar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to mow down (with a scythe); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to cut down, destroy; <k>falchajo</k> what is mowed, the crop; <k>falchedo</k>
swath, wind-row; <k>falchilo</k> scythe.

<k>faldar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fold (a letter, etc.) (cf. <k>plisar</k>);
<k>faldebla</k> foldable; <ex>(fig.)</ex> pliant (cf. <k>flexebla</k>);
<k>falduro</k> a fold.

<k>faliar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to fail, miscarry, miss (an
aim), not to succeed; <ex>(com.)</ex> to fail, to become insolvent
without implication of disgrace; (cf. <k>bankrotar</k>); <k>falio</k>
failure, insolvency; <k>faliigar</k> to cause to miss, to fail; to
frustrate; <k>faliinto</k> insolvent person; <k>faliego</k> debacle,
break up, down-fall; <k>faliar renkontrar</k> fail to meet <k>(ulu)</k>;
<k>faliar ocidar su</k> fail to kill oneself; <k>me iros sen faliar</k>
I will go without fail.

<k>falsa</k> false, imitating in order to deceive as, f. hair,
teeth, windows, signatures, money, jewels, drugs, etc.; not
genuine, spurious; <k>falseso</k> falsity; <k>falsajo</k> falsehood; <k>falsigar</k>
to falsify, pervert, adulterate (drugs) debase (coin); <k>falsamonetifisto</k>, <k>falsigero di moneti</k> forger, coiner; (cf. <k>artificala</k>).

<k>falva</k> fallow, fawn-colored, tawny, of a yellowish-brown
color, pale red; <k>falva bestio</k> fallow deer, stag, etc. (cf. <k>daimo</k>).

<k>famo</k> fame, renown; (cf. <k>reputo</k>); <k>famoza</k>
famous, celebrated; <k>famoz(ul)o</k> a celebrity; <k>famizar</k>
to cover with fame, render illustrious.

<k>familio</k> <ex>(also zool., bot.)</ex> family, kin(dred); <k>familiala
 konsilantaro</k> f. counsel; <k>familiala simileso</k> family
likeness; <k>vorto familio</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> collection of words of
the same root.

<k>familiara</k> familiar, intimate; <k>familiareso</k> familiarity
(state), close acquaintance; <k>familiarajo</k> familiarity (act); <k>familiaraji
 produktas desestimo</k> familiarities breed contempt; <k>familiarigar
 persono pri lua tasko</k> to familiarize a person with his job; <k>ne
 familiareskez kun male edukita personi</k> do not get familiar with
ill-bred people; <k>familiara amiko</k> an intimate friend. Ex.: Lua
vizajo esas familiara a me. Lua konduto esas tro familiara.

<k>famino</k> famine. V. exp.: Ne esas hungro, mem general, ma
manko di la maxim necesa nutrivi en tota lando o populo; IV-10;
(cf. <k>indijar</k>).

<k>fanatika</k> fanatical, <k>fanatik(ul)o</k> a fanatic, bigot; <k>fanatikeso</k>
fanaticism; <k>fanatikigar</k> to fanaticize <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>fanatikeskar</k>
to become a f., infatuated (cf. <k>foleskar</k>). Ex.: Fanatika
zelo, doktrini, homi.

<k>fanfaronar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to bluster, boast,
brag, swagger, bluff. V. exp.: <k>Fanfaronar</k> esas
exajerar sua avantaji, sua forteso, e.c., per paroli od altra
signi, por trompar la ceteri. <k>Ostentar</k> esas
montrar ed expozar kun afektaco e superbeso sua avantaji,
precipue la luxo, richaji, belaji, por ecitar l'admiro di la
ceteri; II

<k>fango</k> mud, mire, watery dirt as on streets,
etc.; <k>fangoza</k>, <k>fangatra</k> muddy; <k>fangeyo</k>
mud-puddle; <k>fangizar</k> to muddy, bedraggle; <k>fangizita</k>
bespattered (with mud); <k>fangoza anmo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex>
base, mean soul; <k>sen fangigar</k>, <k>des fangizar</k> to
clean (off mud); <k>para fango</k>mud-guard; <k>fangobalno</k>
m.bath.

<k>fantasmagorio</k> phantasmagoria, dissolving view.
Def.: Arto produktar fantomi, t.e. ombri od imaji iluzioniganta;
IV

<k>fantastika</k> fantastical, fanciful. Def.: Qua
relatas kozi od enti nereala o neposibla; IV

<k>fantaziar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to have a fancy for <k>(ulu</k>, <k>ulo)</k>, to have an idea an inclination <k>(facar
 ulo); agar segun sua fantazio</k> to act according to one's
fancy; <k>fantazieto</k> whim, crochet; <k>fantaziajo</k>
a f. article; <k>fantaziala</k>, <k>fantaziema</k> fanciful; <k>fantaziemo</k>
a fanciful person, a crank; <k>fantaziala kostumo</k>f.
dress. Ex.: Me fantazias voyajar, ludar. Havar fantazii
fantastika. V. exp.: <k>L'imaginado</k> (od
imaginiveso) esas la psikala fakultato, formacar, imaji, t.e.
reprezenti di objekti nereala; ol agas example en la revi, anke
en l'artistala produktado; ol povas esar regulizita e racionoza.
La <k>fantazio</k> esas l'imaginado senregula e
kapricoza, ofte arbitriala. Pluse, ta vorto ne aplikesas propre a
fakultato (qua esas nulo altra kam l'imaginado ipsa), ma a l'agi
di ta fakultato; on parolas pri un fantazio. Tale on nomizas
fantazi(aj)i ula artistala verki, qui manifestas precipue
libereso, spontaneso e mem kaprico; V

<k>fantomo</k> phantom, shade, ghost, specter,
apparition; <ex>(fig.)</ex> something unreal; <k>Roma esis
 nur la fantomo di republiko</k> Rome was only the shadow of
a republic.

<k>faradizar*</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to faradize,
to stimulate with faradic electric currents.

<k>farbo</k> paint, artificial coloring matter (cf. <k>fardo</k>, <k>pigmento</k>); <k>farbizar</k> to paint (buildings,
objects; cf. <k>piktar</k>); <k>farbizuro</k>
the paint (put on); <k>oleo farbi</k> oil paints; <k>aquo
 farbi</k>water-colors. Def.: Preparita materio por kolorizar
objekti; V

<k>farcino</k> <ex>(vet.)</ex> farcin, farcy, a form
of glanders.

<k>fardo</k> paint (for face or body); <ex>(theat.)</ex>
make-up; <k>reda fardo</k> rouge; <k>fardizar</k>
to paint <k>(ulu</k>, <k>su)</k>.

<k>farino</k> flour, farina, <k>(grosa)</k>
meal; <k>farinoza</k>floury, mealy, farinacious; <k>farinvendisto</k>
f.dealer; <k>farinigar</k>, <k>farinifar</k> to make, produce f.; <k>farinizar</k>
to cover, sprinkle with f.; <k>farinspricilo</k>
f.dredger; <k>farinmueleyo</k>, <k>farinerio</k> f.mill.

<k>farmar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to farm (land taken on
lease); <k>farmo farm lokacar</k>, <k>farmprenar</k> to take (land,
etc.) on lease (cf. <k>kultivar</k> ); <k>farmodonar</k>, <k>lugar</k> to farm out, lease to, rent out to (someone for a
fixed sum); <k>farmluganto</k> lessor (of a farm); <k>farmlokacanto</k>
lessee: tenant-farmer; <k>farmo</k> farming (on lease); <k>farmajo</k>
what is farmed; a farm; <k>farmodomo</k>, <k>odomeno</k> homestead
(rented); <k>farmopreco</k> rent of a farm; <k>farmisto</k> tenant
farmer, husbandman; <k>farmisto di imposto</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> farmer
of the revenue; <k>mi farmisto</k> metayer: farmer on half shares;
<k>farmolaborero</k> a farm-hand.

<k>farso</k> <ex>(cook.)</ex> farce: stuffing, forcemeat; <ex>(theat.
and fig.)</ex> farce.
<k>fasado</k> facade, the front or chief face of a building.

<k>fasko</k> bundle, a number of things of a certain length,
put together; sheath; stack; bunch; <ex>(opt.)</ex> pencil (of
luminous rays); <ex>(antiq.)</ex> fasces; <k>vergo fasko</k> faggot,
bundle of sticks, rods; <k>flecho fasko</k> sheaf of arrows; <k>faskigar</k>, <k>faskifar</k> to bundle up, stack, put in sheaves.

<k>fasonar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fashion, shape, form <k>(ulo)</k>;
<k>fasono</k>, <k>fasonuro</k> the build, fashion, make, cut, workmanship.
Def.: Laborar ula materio por fabrikar objekto definita (fasono
di vesto, di juvelo); IV-165.

<k>fato</k> fate, lot, (cf. <k>destino</k>); <k>fatala</k>
fatal; <k>fatalismo</k> fatalism; <k>fatalisto</k>, <k>fatista</k>
fatalist(ic). Ex.: Vua fato esas kompatinda. La fatal horo.

<k>fatigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to fatigue, tire, weary; (cf. <k>tedar</k>, <k>enoyar</k>); <k>fatigesar</k> to be tired; <k>fatigeso</k> <ex>(state)</ex>
weariness, lassitude; <k>fatiganta</k> fatiguing, toilsome, irksome;
<k>fatigegar</k> to overtire, harass.

<k>fatua</k> foppish (in dress); self-conceited, fatuous (in
mind); <k>fatu(ul)o</k> snob, coxcomb; <k>fatuacho</k> puppy
(person); <k>fatueso</k> snobbishness, fatuity, self-conceit.

<k>fauco</k> <ex>(anat. and fig.)</ex> (exterior) throat, gullet,
fore part of neck (cf. <k>guturo</k>); <ex>(geog.)</ex> space from
which something has been gouged, defile, ravine, deep glen; <k>faucala</k>
<ex>(anat.)</ex> jugular. Def.: Indikas <k>l'extera</k> ed avana
parto di la kolo (do anke la laringo, ma extere vidata); e, pro
ke ta parto formacas kava profilo (inter la mandibulo o mentono e
la pektoro), la vorto fauco uzesas per metaforo internaciona por
expresar multa formi kava, en tekniko, en geografio (montala
fauco), e.c.; III-165. IL

<k>favorar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to favor, treat or regard with
kindness, befriend; <k>favoroza</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> favorable
(cf. <k>oportuna</k>); <k>favorat(ul)o</k>, <k>favorat(in)o</k> a favourite; <k>favorismo</k>
favoritism; <k>favorigar</k> to propitiate, appease; <k>favoriganta</k>
propitiatory; <k>favordii</k> days of grace; <k>la princo e la tempo
 favoras nia projeti</k> the prince and the time are favorable to
our projects; <k>omni qui konocas il esas favoroza ad il</k> all
who know him are favorably disposed toward him.

<k>febla</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> feeble, weak, faint; (cf. <k>debila</k>, <k>frajila</k>); <k>feblajo</k> a weak object or spot, foible; <k>febl(ul)o</k>
a weak person; <k>febleso</k> weakness; <k>febligar</k> to enfeeble,
weaken; <k>febleskar</k> to grow weak; <k>febligo</k>, <k>feblesko</k>
enfeebling, weakening, impairment; <k>feblanma</k> pusillanimous.
Ant.: <k>forta.</k>

<k>febrar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to have a fever; <k>febro</k> fever; <k>febrozeso</k>
feverishness; <k>febrala</k> febrile; <k>febroza</k>, <k>febrema</k>, <k>febrika</k>
feverish, fevered; <k>febreto</k> a slight f.; <k>febrigar</k>, <k>febrizar</k>
to infect with f.

<k>federar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to (con-)federate, federalize,
ally, form an alliance (of states, nations; cf. <k>aliancar</k>);
<k>federuro</k> (con-)federation, league, alliance; <k>federalismo</k>
federalism; <k>federalista</k>, <k>federisto</k> federalist; <k>(kun)federito</k>
ally, confederate (state, nation).

<k>feko</k> feces, excrement (of man or animal); <k>fekala</k>
fecal; <k>fekifar</k> to void the bowels, defecate (cf. <k>kakar</k>);
<k>fekizar</k> to befoul (with f.); <k>fekopulvero</k> dried
night-soil.

<k>fekunda</k> fecund, prolific (of living beings only; cf. <k>fertila</k>);
<k>fekund(ul)o</k> a f. man; <k>fekundeso</k> fecundity; <k>fekundigar</k> to
make f., impregnate. V. exp.: vid. <k>fertila.</k> Ant.: <k>nefekunda</k>, <k>sterila.</k>

<k>felo</k> hide, pelt, fell, skin detached from body and
dressed; (cf. <k>furo</k>).

<k>feldo</k> (electric, magnetic, optical, scientific) field; <k>feldo
 di ago</k> field of action; (cf. <k>agro</k>). Def.: Spaco en
qua existas ula distributo di forci (elektrala, magnetala, e.c.);
VI-140. V. exp.: On parolas pri elektrala, magnetala feldo, mem
(identigante la feldo kun la forco existanta en singla punto) pri
<ex>l'intenseso</ex> di feldo en ula punto. Kompreneble, on povas
anke parolar metafore pri la <k>feldo di ago</k> o di <k>influo</k>
di ula povo o potento. Ma en omna altra kazi on devas uzar <k>agro</k>,
exemple, pri plu o min granda parto dil sulo. Do on devas dicar <k>kombatagro</k>,
nam to esas vere agro, en qua on kombatas, o agro di kombato:
VI-140.

<k>felgo</k> felly, outer rim of wheel; <k>felgfreno</k> (wheel)
rim brake.

<k>felica</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> happy (cf. <k>fortunoza</k>);
<k>felic(ul)o</k> a h. person; <k>feliceso</k> happiness, felicity; <k>des
 felica</k> miserable; <k>aspektar felica</k> to look happy.
<k>felpo</k> <ex>(fabric)</ex> a kind of plush, shag, velveteen.

<k>femina</k>, <k>feminala</k> she, feminine (N.B. applied chiefly to
animals to distinguish sex); (cf. <k>homina</k>, <k>feminala</k>); <k>femino</k>
a female (animal); <k>feminismo</k> feminism; <k>femineso</k>
femininity; <k>feminacho</k> a vile woman; <k>feminatra</k> effeminate;
<k>femin(atr)igar</k> to render, make effeminate; <k>feminalo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex>
the feminine.

<k>feno</k> hay; <k>feneyo</k> place for h., h.loft; <k>fenifar</k>
to grow h.; <k>fenigar</k> to h. make.

<k>fenco</k> fence, enclosing barrier; <k>muro</k>, <k>palis</k>, <k>greto</k>, <k>latofenco</k> wall-, plank-, paling-, grate-,
lath-fence.

<k>fendar</k> (tr.) to split (lengthwise), slit, cleave; (cf. <k>krevisar</k>);
<ex>(fig.)</ex> to rend (the heart); <k>fendetar</k> to crack; <k>fendeturo</k>
a chink, flaw, crack; <k>fenduro</k> fissure, cleft, interstice; <k>fendilo</k>
cleaver, chopper.

<k>fenomenologio*</k> phenomenology, description,
history, or explanation of phenomena.

<k>fero</k> iron; <k>fera</k>, <k>ferala</k>, <k>feroza</k>, <k>feratra</k>
of, relating to iron; ferrous, ferruginous; <k>ferizar</k>
to put iron on <k>(ulo)</k>, to bind, fit, hoop (with
iron); <k>ferolaboristo</k>i. worker; <k>fererio</k>
i. foundry; <k>feroraboturi</k>, <k>ferspani</k> i. filings,
chips: <k>ferajo</k>, <k>fergarnituro</k> i. fitting; <k>ferizita</k>
ironed, metalled; <ex>(of horses)</ex> shod; <k>olda fero</k>
scrap i.; <k>fertolo</k>, <k>ferlameno</k> sheet i.; <k>forjita
 fero</k> wrought iron; <k>ferskorio</k> slag,
scoria, dross; <k>ferocianato</k> potassium
ferrocyanide; <k>fervoyo</k> railway, railroad.

<k>ferdeko</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> deck (of a ship); <k>ferdekizar</k>
to d.; <k>navo tri ferdeka</k> a three-decker, ship with
three decks.

<k>ferma</k> firm: solid, stable, fixed, compact,
stout; (cf. <k>solida</k>, <k>stabila</k>); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
which does not tremble, steady, steadfast, bold, resolute; <k>fermeso</k>
firmness, stability; <k>fermigar</k> to make firm, <k>(ulo)</k>
(cf. <k>sekurigar</k>); <k>fermeskar</k>to
become firm, strong, established, settled. <k>ferme</k>
firmly, steadily; <ex>(interj.)</ex> hold fast; do not flinch!
Ex.: Ferma tero. Stacar ferme. Karno ferma. Parolar en tono
ferma. Fermigar sua rezolvo. Ant.: <k>mola</k>, <k>shancelanta</k>, <k>vacilanta</k>, <k>febla.</k>

<k>fermento</k> a ferment (as yeast, leaven); <ex>(fig.)</ex>
which excites or gives rise to.

<k>fermentacar</k> <ex>(intr.; also fig.)</ex> to
ferment; <ex>(of dough)</ex> to rise.

<k>feroca</k> ferocious. Def.: Sovaja, kruela e
violentoza; III

<k>fertila</k> fertile <ex>(ground, also fig.)</ex>; <k>fertileso</k>
fertility, fruitfulness; <k>fertiligar</k> to fertilize. V.
exp.: <k>Fertila</k> ne esas la sama ideo kam <k>fekunda</k>:
ento <k>fekunda</k> genitas ento simila a su; <k>fertila</k>
esas simple produktema, qua produktas multo (ex.: agro); <k>fekunda</k>
dicesas pri la vivanta enti, <k>fertila</k> pri la
tero; IV

<k>fervorar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to be fervent, be
earnest, eager, zealous; (cf. <k>ardorar</k>, <k>zelar</k>); <k>fervoroza
 prego</k> fervent prayer; <k>fervorar pri ulo</k> to
be eager about something, take a thing to heart.

<k>festar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to observe a holiday; <ex>(rel.)</ex>
to keep a feast; <k>festo</k>, <k>festodio</k> festival,
celebration, holiday, saint's day; <k>festala</k> festal,
festive (of holidays); <k>Pasko festo</k> Easter; <k>muzik
 festo</k> music festival; <k>garden festo</k>garden
fête.

<k>festinar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to feast, eat
sumptuously, banquet; <k>festinala</k> festal: of a f.

<k>feudo</k> fief, feud, fee; <k>feudala</k>feudal;
<k>feudismo</k> feudalism, feodality; <k>feudigar</k>
to enfeoff.
<k>fi!</k> fie! shame! faugh! ugh! pish! phew!

<k>fiakro</k> hackney-coach, cab, four-wheeled public
carraige; <k>fiakrokavalo</k> cab-horse.

<k>fiancar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to betroth, affiance,
pledge in marriage; <k>(ulu kun)</k>; <k>fianceskar</k>
to become engaged; <k>fianco</k>, <k>fianceso</k> betrothal,
engagement; <k>fiancito</k>, <k>fianculo</k>, <k>fiancino</k> fiance; <k>ge
 fianciti</k> the two affianced.

<k>fibro</k> fiber; <k>fibreto</k> fibril; <k>fibrala</k>, <k>fibroza</k>, <k>fibreskema</k>, <k>fibratra</k> fibrous, thready; <k>fibrigar</k> to thread
out <k>(ulo); fibreskar</k> to become fibrous.

<k>fibulo</k> <ex>(antiq.)</ex> fibula, a buckle or clasp (cf. <k>peroneo);
 fibulizar</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> to infibulate.

<k>ficho</k> (play-) counter, token, check; <k>asisto ficho</k>
token of presence. Def.: Lud-, konto – marko. Asisto –
ficho pagesas a la membri di ula konsilantari, qui asistis singla
kunveno; V

<k>fidar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to trust, put one’s trust
(in); rely (upon); put confidence <k>(ad ulu</k>, <k>ulo);</k>(cf. <k>konfidar);
 o</k> confidence, reliance, faith; <k>fidema</k> trusting,
confiding; <k>fidinda</k> faithful, trustworthy;<k>fidala</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex>
fiduciary; <k>su fidego</k> great self-confidence; <k>sufideganta</k>
overweening; <k>me fidas a lua parolo</k>I rely on his word.

<k>fideikomiso</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex> a trust (of an estate or
property);<k>fideikomisario</k> trustee.

<k>fidela</k> <ex>(of persons)</ex> faithful, true, trusty; <k>fidel(ul)o</k>a f. person; <k>fideleso</k> fidelity, fealty, allegiance (cf. <k>vasaleso</k>, <k>devoteso</k>, <k>loyaleso); fidelojuro</k> oath of allegiance; <k>fidela a
 sua obligi</k> faithful to one’s engagements; <k>fidela amiko</k>
a faithful friend.

<k>fiera</k> proud, proper sense of self-respect or
self-esteem; <k>il esas fiera e superba</k> he is proud and
haughty. V. exp.: <k>Fiera</k> esas ta qua havas alta (ma
generale justa) opiniono pri sua valoro, merito, povo, e qua
manifestas ol extere. <k>Superba</k> esas ta qua havas ecesa
opiniono pri sua valoro e merito, e konseque manifestas exajerata
pretendi; IV<k />

<k>figuro</k> <ex>(also geom. rhet.)</ex> figure, outside form,
shape of a body; appearance, representation; <k>figurala expresuro</k>, <k>senco</k>, <k>stilo</k> a figurative expression, sense, style; <k>figuro
 vortala</k> figure of speech; <k>figurizar</k> to figure, form
into a determinate shape, represent (in picture) or statuary; <k>figurizar
 kombato</k> to figure, to represent a fight; <k>figurizo</k>
figuration; <k>figurizanta</k>, <k>figuriva</k> figurative, typical; <k>figurizebla</k>representable. Def.: Formo di tota korpo, homala o ne;
V

<k>fiktiva</k> fictitious, imaginary, not real. Ex. Fiktiva
persono, valoro.

<k>filo</k> thread; <k>(lina</k>, <k>lana</k>, <k>kotona</k>, <k>e.c.)</k> (flax,
wool, cotton, etc.) yarn; <k>(metal) filo</k> wire; <k>filala</k>, <k>filoza</k> thready; <k>filifar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to spin; <k>filigar</k>
<ex>(tr.)</ex> to spin<k /><k>(ulo)</k>, <k /> to make into
threads; <k>filiferio</k> spinning mill; <k>filifroto</k>
spinning-wheel; <k>metalfiligar</k> to wire draw, draw into
wire; <k>filizar</k> to thread (a needle); <k>filmarioneto</k>, <k>filpupeo</k>
dancing Jack.

<k>filaso</k> tow, harl (of flax, hemp, for spinning). V. exp.:
La materio ek qua on filifas. <k>Filaso</k> ne esas <k>stupo;</k>
nam on ne povas filigar stupo; III

<k>filatelio</k> philately, stamp collecting; <k>filateliar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex>
to collect stamps; <k>filateliero</k> philatelist.

<k>fileto</k> fillet, chine (of beef, fish); thread (of a
screw, worm); <k>filetino</k> female thread <ex>(tech.)</ex>; <k>filetizar</k>
to cut a thread on. Ex.: Fileto de soleo. Skrub-fileto.

<k>filharmonio</k> philharmony; <k>filharmoniala</k> philharmonic
(society, etc.). Def. Amo pasionoza por muziko.

<k>filio</k> child (of), son or daughter; <k>filiulo</k> son; <k>filiino</k>
daughter; <k>filiala</k> filial; <k>filieso</k> filiation, relations
of children to parents; <k>filialigar</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
affiliate (cf. <k>adoptar</k>); <k>filialo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> branch
establishment; <k>filiino di la karitato</k> sister of charity.

<k>filtrar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to filter, strain,
percolate; <k>filtrilo</k> filter.

<k>finar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to finish, to end, leave off,
to have done, come to an end; <k>finigar</k> to finish <k>(ulo)</k>,
to cause to end, put an end to, terminate; <k>fino</k> end,
finish; <k>fina</k>, <k>finala</k> final; <k>finalo</k> <ex>(gram.)</ex> final
syllable; <ex>(mus.)</ex> finale; <k>fine</k> finally, at last,
lastly; <k>fineskar</k> to draw to, to approach the end; <k>par
 finita</k> entirely completed, finished; <k>sen fina</k> endless,
interminable; <k>sen fine</k> indefinitely; <k>finevento</k>
denouement, final event, outcome; <k>la muro finas ye ca loko</k>
the wall finishes at this place; <k>finigez vua parolado</k> put
an end to your talk; <k>ye la fino di ca monato</k> at the end
of this month; <k>finala kauzo</k> final cause.

<k>fingar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to feign, sham, pretend, (cf. <k>simular</k>);
<k>fingo</k>, <k>finguro</k> dissimulation; false appearance, pretence, sham;
figment; <k>fingajo</k> a fiction, make-believe; <k>fingita</k>
feigned, fictitious. Def.: Simular por trompar. Ex.: Fingar joyo,
maladeso. Il fingis amorar me.

<k>fingro</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex> finger, digit; <k>fingrala</k>
digital; <k>ped fingro</k> toe (cf. <k>haluxo</k>); <k>fingruyo</k>, <k>fingrchapo</k>, <k>fingrshirmilo</k> thimble; f. stall; <k>fingragar</k>, <k>fingrordinar</k>
<ex>(tr., mus.)</ex> to finger; <k>fingrofrapeto</k> fillip; <k>indik
 fingro</k> forefinger, index f.; (cf. <k>polexo</k>); <k>meza fingro</k>
middle f.; <k>ringo fingro</k> ring finger, third f.; <k>mikra</k>, <k>orel fingro</k> little f.

<k>finisar</k> <ex>(tr., tech.)</ex> to finish off (an article),
to put the finishing touches to <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>finislimar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to finish off <k>(ulo)</k> with a file. Def.: Finisado esas la
lasta laboro, quan on facas pri ula material produkturo, por ke
ol havez sua definitiva forma ed aspekto; VI-383.

<k>finto</k> <ex>(milit., boxing, fencing)</ex> feint; <k>fintar</k>
<ex>(intr.)</ex> to (make a) f. Def.: Simulita atako. Termino
teknikal di la skerm-arto, uzata anke metafore; V-484, 676.

<k>firmamento</k> <ex>(lit. and fig.)</ex> firmament. Def.:
L'antiqua nociono di la cielo (kom solida vulto); V-484.

<k>fisho</k> <ex>(also astron.)</ex> fish; <k>fishetaro</k> small
f., fry (collect.); <k>fishoza</k> abounding in f.; <k>fishizar</k>
to stock with f.; <k>fishatra</k>, <k>fishforma</k> f. like, f. shaped; <k>fishkaptar</k>
to catch a f. (cf. <k>peskar</k>); <k>fishvendar</k> to sell f.; <k>fishkoquar</k>
to cook f.; <k>fishvendeyo</k> f. market; <k>fishkoquilo</k> f.
kettle; <k>fishosto</k> f. bone; <k>fishmanjanta</k> f. eating,
ichthyophagous; <k>fishedukado</k> pisciculture: raising of f; <k>populizar
 per fishyuni</k> to stock with fry.

<k>fisko</k> fisc: state or royal treasury; an exchequer; <k>fiskala</k>
fiscal; <k>fiskala bilieto</k> treasury note; <k>fiskala
 administrado</k> fiscal administration.

<k>fitar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> <k>fitigar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>: <ex>(mechan.,
also of garments)</ex> to fit: suit as to shape, size; <k>fiteganta</k>
tight-fitting. Def.: Tale adjustigar mashinal peci, ke li ne plus
movas en ula direciono exter l'axala (anke uzata por la vesti);
(VII-99). Ex. Ica fitas quale ganto.

<k>fixa</k> fixed (day, star, look, idea); <k>fixe</k> fixedly,
steadfastly; <k>fixigar</k> to fix, fasten <k>(ulo)</k>, to
appoint (a day); <k>fixeso</k> fixity, fixedness; <k>fixigo</k>
fixation; <k>fixigiva</k>, <k>fixivo</k> <ex>(photog.)</ex> fixing (agent).
Ex.: Stelo fixa. Regardar fixe. Fixigar ulo per pinglo. Fixigar
preco. Fixigar la atenco.

<k>fiziokratio</k> physiocracy: economic doctrine of Quesnay; <k>fiziokratiisto</k>
physiocrat.
<k>flado</k> flawn, a sort of flat custard cake.

<k>flago</k> <ex>(especially nav.)</ex> flag; (cf. <k>standardo</k>, <k>banero</k>); <k>flageto</k> pennant; <k>flagizar</k> to dress with
f.s. Def.: <k>Flago</k> esas insigno (generale min granda kam <k>standardo</k>),
qua indikas la lojeyo, navo o loko di ula chefo o di ula
establisuro: ex. la Reda Kruco; III-31.

<k>flagrar</k> <ex>(intr., chem.)</ex> to deflagrate: to blaze
suddenly, flare up; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to be flagrant, flame into
notice, be notorious; <k>flagranta delikto</k> <ex>(jur.)</ex>
flagrante delicto, in the very act. Def.: Kombusto rapida kun
granda e subita flami (anke uzata metafore); III-469. Ex.: La
flagro di nitrokotono esas instantala. Flagranta ne-egaleso.
<k>flako</k> small pool, puddle (of water, blood, etc.)

<k>flakono</k> flask, cruet; <k>vinagro flakono</k> vinegar cruet.
V. exp.: vid. <k>botelo</k>.

<k>flamo</k> flame, blaze, flash, flare; <ex>(fig.)</ex> flame
(of passion), ardour, warmth (of affection); <k>flamoza</k>
flaming; <k>flamifar</k> to blaze up, produce flame; <k>flamagar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to pass <k>(ulo)</k> over a fire, to singe; <k>flamif(ad)o</k>
flaming, blazing.

<k>flanar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to lounge, saunter, loiter,
stroll; <k>flan(ad)o</k> an idle and leisurely walk; <k>flananto</k>, <k>flanero</k>, <k>flanemo</k> lounger, stroller, idler.

<k>flanjo</k> flange (of a tube). Def.: Diskatra, salianta
parto di tubi, stangi, e.c., qua uzesas por ligar li per skrubi;
III-82. V. exp. vid. <k>rebordo</k>.

<k>flanko</k> side (of body); flank (of enemy);
breast (of ship); <k>flanke</k> at or from the side,
flank; <k>flankala</k> lateral; <k>flankala atako</k>
flank attack; <k>flankumar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to be on the
f. of <k>(ulo)</k>; <k>flankumo</k> flanking; <k>flankumanto</k><ex>(milit.)</ex> flanker; <k>flankapogar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex>
to prop up <k>(ulo)</k> on one side; <k>flankizar</k>
<ex>(milit., arch.)</ex> to f., cover the f. of <k>(ulo</k>, <k>per)</k>; <k>flankirar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to go
aside.

<k>flarar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to smell, scent (an
odour, an object; cf. <k>odorar</k>); <k>flarar rozo</k>
to smell a rose; <k>flarar danjero</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> to
smell a rat, scent danger; <k>flar(ad)o</k> smelling; <k>flaranta</k>, <k>flarala</k> olfactory.

<k>flatar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to flatter; <k>flatachar</k>
to f. servilely, fawn upon, toady to <k>(ulu)</k>; <k>flatanta</k>, <k>flatema</k>, <k>flatoza</k> flattering, adulatory; <k>flatachanto</k>, <k>flatero</k> sycophant, toady.

<k>flatuar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to break wind, <k>flatu(ad)o</k>
breaking wind, flatus, poop; <k>flatuoza</k>, <k>flatuema</k>
flatulent, <k>flatuozeso</k> flatulence.

<k>flava</k> yellow; <k>flaveso</k> (color)
yellow, yellowness; <k>flavajo</k> y. object; <k>flavigar</k>
to render, make y.; <k>flaveskar</k> to become, turn,
grow y.

<k>flecho</k> <ex>(weapon)</ex> arrow; <ex>(arch.)</ex>
spire; <ex>(fort.)</ex> bonnet, fleche, simple redan; <ex>(geom.)</ex>
absciss (of a curve); <ex>(trig.)</ex> versed sine; <k>flechuyo</k>
quiver.

<k>flegar</k> <ex>(tr)</ex> to nurse, care for (sick
person, child; cf. <k>sorgar</k>); <k>fleg(ad)o</k>
nursing; <k>flegist(ul)o</k>, <k>flegino;</k> nurse; <k>flegeyo</k>
sick-ward, place for nursing. V. exp.: vid. <k>suciar</k>.

<k>flegmo</k> <ex>(med.)</ex> phlegm; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
coldness, sluggishness (of character); <k>flegmoza</k> <ex>(med.
and mental)</ex> phlegmatic.

<k>flereto</k> (fencing-) foil. Def.: Speco di espado
tenua e flexebla por skermado (generale kun butono ye la fino);
IV

<k>flexar</k> <ex>(tr., intr.)</ex> to bend (out of
the straight), bow, flex; <k>flexo</k>, <k>flexeso</k>, <k>flexuro</k>
bend(ing), flexion; <k>flexanta</k> <ex>(anat.)</ex>
flexor; <k>flexebla</k> flexible, pliant, supple; <k>flexoza</k>
<ex>(bot.)</ex> flexuous; <k>flexigar</k> to cause to b.

<k>flirtar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to flirt, coquet,
make love in a trifling manner;

<k>flitro</k>, <k>flitrajo</k> spangle (cf. <k>oripelo</k>);
<k>flitrizar</k> to spangle. Def.: Ronda plaketo quan on
sutas exemple sur vesto por igar ol brilanta; VI

<k>flogar</k> to flog, whip, lash, flagellate,
scourge (cf. <k>vergagar</k>): <k>flogilo</k>
whip, lash.

<k>floko</k> flake (as of snow); flock: lock of wool
or hair; tuft; <k>flokoza</k>, <k>flokatra</k>flaky; <k>nivo
 floko</k> snow-f.

<k>floro</k> flower, bloom, blossom; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
flower (of speech), prime (of life), bloom (of innocence), etc.; <k>floreto</k>
flowerlet; <k>florala</k> floral; <k>florifar</k>
to bloom, blossom, be in flower; <k>florif(ad)o</k>
blooming, efflorescence; <k>florifanta</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex>
floriferous; <k>florizar</k> to cover, deck (with
flowers); <k>floroza</k>, <k>florizita</k> flowery; <k>flor(vend)isto</k>
florist; <k>floristino</k> flower girl; <k>florkultiv(ad)o</k>
floriculture; <k>floreyo</k>, <k>florbedo</k>f. bed; <k>floruyo</k>, <k>florvazo</k> f. holder, -vase; <k>floruno</k> <ex>(bot.)
</ex>floret; <k>sen florigar</k>, <k>des florizar</k> to
deflower; <k>en la floro di l'evo</k><ex>(fig.)</ex>
in the prime of life.

<k>florono</k> <ex>(arch.)</ex> flower-work; <k>floronizita</k>
ornamented with f.w. Def.: Ornivo imitanta la formo di floro;
IV

<k>floto</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> fleet; <k>floteto</k>
a small f. V. exp.: <k>Floto</k> indikas «ensemblo de
navi» naviganta kune e komandata da un chefo; <k>navaro</k>
restus por indikar l'ensemblo di la navi di un naciono, kompanio,
e.c.; IV

<k>flotacar</k>: <ex>(intr.)</ex> to float, to be afloat on the
surface of a liquid; <k>flotacigar</k> to (cause to) float, waft,
raft (wood, etc.); <k>flotaclineo</k>, <k>flotacnivelo</k> load, water line.

<k>flotilio</k> <ex>(nav.)</ex> flotilla. Def.: Floto (ne
flot-eto) de mikra navi; VI

<k>fluar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to flow, run, glide (of liquids,
elec.); <k>flu(ad)o</k> flow, current, stream(ing); <k>fluanta</k>
flowing, running; <k>fluanto</k> <ex>(math.)</ex> fluent, variable
quantity; <k>fluanta stilo</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> flowing style; <k>segun
 la fluo</k> with the current; <k>lavafluajo</k> lava flow; <k>elektrala
 fluo</k> f. of electricity.

<k>flugar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to fly (in air), fly about, be
wafted (by wind); <k>flugetar</k> to flutter, hover; <k>flugeskar</k>
to take wing, flight; <k>flugbalono</k> <ex>(fig.)</ex> a
shuttlecock; <k>fluganta fisho</k> flying-fish (genus: Exocoetus and allied species); <k>flugfolio</k>
loose or detached sheet of paper; <k>flugroto</k> flywheel (of
machinery).

<k>fluida</k> fluid, having parts freely mobile, separate and
penetrable, as water, vapor, and air; <k>fluido</k> a fluid; <k>fluideso</k>
fluidity. V. exp.: Fluido esas gaso o liquido; IV-162; (cf. <k>liquida</k>).

<k>fluktuar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to fluctuate, waver, float, move
to and fro; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to be irresolute; <k>fluktu(ad)o</k>
fluctuation, a motion like that of waves; wavering, unsteadiness;
<k>la flukti di opiniono publika</k> the fluctuations of public
opinion. <k>Flago fluktuas en la vento</k> a flag floats in the
wind; <k>Aquo fluktuanta</k> moving water.

<k>fluto</k> <ex>(mus.)</ex> flute; <k>fluto rurala</k> reed-pipe;
<k>fluteto</k> child's whistle; <k>fluto transversa</k> German f.,
traverse f.; <k>flutatra</k> flutelike, fluty; <k>flut(ple)ero</k>, <k>flutisto</k>
flute player, flutist.

<k>fluvio</k> (large) river, a large stream of water flowing
into the sea; <ex>(fig.)</ex> copious flow, torrent; <k>irar
 admonte la fluivo</k> to go up the river; <ex>(fig.)</ex> fluvio
di sango: torrent of blood; <k>fluvio di fairo</k>, <k>di eloquenteso</k>
stream of fire, of eloquence; <k>fluviala</k> fluvial.

<k>fluxo</k> rise of tide, high, flood-tide; <k>fluxo e refluxo</k> flood and ebb of
tide; <k>fluxar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to rise (of tide).

<k>fola</k> mad, crazy, mentally deranged; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
foolish, nonsensical, senseless; <k>foleta</k> <ex>(fam.)</ex>
cracked, touched (in the head); mad after, infatuated, doting on;
(cf. <k>dementa</k>); <k>fol(ul)o</k> madman, fool; <k>foleso</k>
madness, folly; <k>folajo</k> mad, foolish act, prank; <k>fola
 stroko</k> a foolish play, act; <k>fole amorar</k> to love to
distraction, be madly in love with (ulu); <k>foligar</k> to make
(ulu) crazy, to make some one foolish; <k>foleskar</k> to go mad,
become infatuated; <k>foligita</k> maddened, distracted,
infatuated; <k>fole  ludar</k> to sport, romp, frolic, play
pranks; <k>folfolludema</k> playful, sportive, frolicsome; <k>foloceptro</k>
fool's bauble; <k>kortfol(ul)o</k> court-fool, -jester. Def.:
Vulgara termino, qua aplikesas precipue a la formi maxim
videbla e shokanta di alienaco, a ti qui manifestas su per
sensenca parolado, agiteso e violento; VI

<k>folio</k> <ex>(bot.)</ex> leaf; thin sheet of something;
folio: page number (folio 12 = pagino 12 of a sheet of which the
reverse side is blank); <k>foliaro</k> foliage, leaves (collect.); <k>folieto</k>
leaflet; <ex>(bot.)</ex> foliole; <k>foliala</k> relating to leaves; <k>folioza</k>
leafy; <ex>(bot.)</ex> foliated; <k>foliifar</k>, <k>folieskar</k> to produce
l.s, break forth in l.; <k>foliigar</k> to make into l.form; <k>foliif(ad)</k>, <k>foliiz(ad)o</k> foliation, leafing; <k>foliizita</k> foliated,
flaky; <k>folioshirmo</k> bower (of leaves); <k>foliorekolto</k>
leaf-harvest; <k>sen foliigar</k> to strip of leaves; <k>foliajo</k>
<ex>(arch.)</ex> foliaceous ornament, leaf-work; (cf. <k>florono</k>);
<k>foliumar</k> to turn over the leaves of a book.

<k>folietono</k> feuilleton, literary part of a F. newspaper; <k>folietonisto</k>
a writer of f.s.

<k>folkloro</k> folklore. Def.: Ico esas nek populala
literaturo, nek populala tradicionaro, ma l'ensemblo di la verki,
rakonti, kanti, kustumi qui naskis de la populo e karakterizas
ol, e lua studiado: VII-279.

<k>fomentar</k> <ex>(tr., med.)</ex> to foment, apply warm
lotions to; <ex>(fig.)</ex> to encourage, stir up.

<k>fondar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to found, establish <k>(ulo</k>, <k>sur
 ulo);</k> (cf. <k>establisar</k>); <k>fondajo</k>, <k>fonduro</k> that which
is founded, establishment, foundation (cf. <k>fundamento</k>).
Ex.: Il fondis sua sistemo sur fakti nekontestebla. Fondar
komercala firmo, imperio, religio.

<k>fonografar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to record <k>(ulo)</k> on a
phonograph; <k>fonografilo</k> phonograph; <k>fonografuro</k>
phonograph-record; <k>plear fonografilo</k> to play a phonograph

<k>fonto</k> <ex>(pr. and fig.)</ex> font, spring: natural source
(cf. <k>fonteno</k>); <k>fontaquo</k> spring-water. Ex.: La fonti
di Nil. Acensar rivero til la fonto. La fonto di lo bona e di lo
mala. Laboro esas la fonto di richaji. Recevar novaji de bona
fonto.

<k>for</k> <ex>(prep.)</ex> far from, away from; <k>fore</k> (far)
away; <k>fora</k> distant, remote, far distant <k>(de)</k>; <k>forajo</k>
a distant object; distance (prospect); <k>de fore</k> from a, at
a, distance; <k>foresar</k> to be away; <k>forigar</k> to remove,
send away; <k>for de hike</k> a great way off (from here); <k>foreso</k>
remoteness; <k>forirar</k> to go away; <k>fora komerco</k>, <k>navigado</k>
foreign trade, navigation. (In composition with verbs «away» as
in: <k>forduktar</k>, <k>forportar</k>, <k>fortirar</k>, <k>fortranar</k>, <k /> etc.); <k>il
 esas for sua patrio</k> he is away from his fatherland; <k>il
 vidis il de fore</k> he saw him from a distance; <k>kad vu volas
 forirar?</k> do you wish to go away? <k>la soldato forkuris</k>
the soldier ran away.

<k>forco</k> <ex>(mechan.)</ex> force. Ex.: La forci natural esas
l'aero, l'aquo, e.c. Forco centripetala.

<k>forcepso</k> <ex>(surg.)</ex> forceps, an instrument used in
midwifery (cf. <k>pinceto</k>).

<k>forejo</k> forage, fodder, food for beasts; <k>forejifar</k> to
forage (for fodder); <k>forejoplanti</k> plants fit for fodder.

<k>foresto</k> forest; <k>forestala</k> pertaining to f.s, silvan; <k>forestisto</k>
forester; <k>forestokultivado</k> forestry; <k>forestizar</k> to cover
with f.

<k>forfeto</k> contract, tender (at a stipulated price, whether
the contractor lose or gain); <k>forfetale</k> by contract, by the
job, at a lump sum; <k>kontratar per forfeto</k> to engage to do
<k>(ulo)</k> by contract. Def.: Kontrato per qua on engajas su
exekutar ula laboro po totala sumo fixigita antee; IV-454.

<k>forjar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to forge (metals); <k>forjebla</k>
forgeable; <k>forjisto</k> blacksmith, forger (of iron); <k>forjeyo</k>, <k>forjerio</k> smithy, blacksmith's shop, iron works.

<k>forjetar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to throw away (cf. <k>repulsar</k>, <k>retrojetar</k>); (of cards) to discard; <k>forajo</k> refuse,
waste; <k>forinda</k> worthy of rejection.

<k>forko</k> <ex>(agri.)</ex> pitchfork, hayfork, dungfork; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
any two or three-pronged instrument; <k>forketo</k> tablefork; <k>forkatra</k>
forklike, cloven; <k>forkodento</k> prong of a f.; <k>forkopikar</k>
to pierce with a f.

<k>formo</k> form, shape, conformation; <k>formala</k> formal; <k>formalajo</k>
formality; <k>formalismo</k> formalism; <k>sen forma</k> shapeless.

<k>formacar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to form, shape; <k>formac(ad)o</k>, <k>formacuro</k>
formation; <k>formacanta</k>, <k>formaciva</k> formative. Ex.: Formacar literi,
nubi, triangulo, karaktero. Geologiala formacuro.
<k>formato</k> format, shape, size of a book.

<k>formiko</k> <ex>(ent.)</ex> ant; <k>formikeyo</k> ant-hill, -nest;
<k>formikumar</k> <ex>(intr.)</ex> to swarm, teem, be full of (like
ants); <k>formikum(ad)o</k> swarming; <ex>(med.)</ex> formication.

<k>formulo</k> formula; <k>formularo</k>, <k>formullibro</k> formulary; <k>formuligar</k>, <k>formulizar</k> to formulate, draw up in due form; <k>formuligo</k>, <k>formulizo</k>
formulation.

<k>forno</k> (bake-)oven; <ex>(tech.)</ex> kiln; (cf. <k>furnelo</k>);
<k>fornego</k> furnace, blast f.; <k>fornedo</k> a baking, ovenful,
batch; <k>forneyo</k> baking place, bake-house; <k>fornopago</k>
charge for baking. Def.: Kesto klozita, en qua on pozas kozi
koquenda o varmigenda; IV-135.

<k>foronomio*</k> phoronomics: geometry of kinematics. Def.:
Geometrio di la movo, o cinematiko geometriala; III-263.

<k>forsar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to force, break open (a door, a
lock), to compel (by mechanical means or power) ; (cf. <k>koaktar</k>).

<k>forsan</k> <ex>(adv.)</ex> perhaps, may be, perchance. Ex.:
Forsan il kredas lo. Forsan il venos, forsan no. Me ne savas
precize quanta komizi laboras en ica kontoro; forsan tri o quar.

<k>forta</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> strong, stout; <k>forte</k>
strongly; <ex>(mus.)</ex> forte; <k>fortulo</k> a s. man; <k>forteso</k>
strength; <k>fortigar</k> to strengthen; <k>forteskar</k> to get s.;
(of wind) to freshen; <k>fortiganta</k>, <k>fortiva</k> strengthening,
invigorating; <k>fortigivo</k> strengthener, tonic. Ant.: <k>febla</k>, <k>debila</k>, <k>frajila.</k>

<k>fortreso</k> fortress, a large fort holding a garrison.; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
a stronghold.

<k>fortranar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to draw, drag away; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to sweep away, carry off (by passion).

<k>fortuno</k> good fortune, good luck; <ex>(myth.)</ex> Fortuna;
<k>fortunoza</k> fortunate, lucky; (cf. <k>hazardoza</k>). Def.:
Bona chanco; V-492. Ant.: <k>desfortuno</k>, <k>desfeliceso.</k>

<k>foso</k> hole, pit, cavity; <k>foseto</k> small hole; (of
face or body) dimple; <k>fosifar</k> to dig or make a pit. Def.:
Kavajo o exkavajo plu o min larja e profunda (en tero).

<k>fosato</k> ditch, trench; <ex>(milit.)</ex> moat.
Def.: Foso longa o plu juste linea, qua formacas limito od
obstaklo; IV

<k>fosila</k>, <k>fosilo</k> fossil; <k>fosiligar</k> to
fossilize; <k>fosileskar</k> to become fossilized.

<k>fosto</k> post, a piece or timber set upright;
stake (cf. <k>paliso</k>); jamb (of a door); <k>indiko
 fosto</k> way-post, guide-post, signpost.

<k>fotografar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to photograph; <k>fotografilo</k>
camera; <k>fotografajo</k>, <k>fotografato</k> object, person photographed;
<k>fotografuro</k> a photograph.

<k>foyo</k> time (in counting); occasion
(repetition); turn (in series); <k>singlafoye</k>, <k>omnafoye</k>
evey time (that), all the time, whenever; <k>multafoye</k>
many times, often (when), repeatedly; <k>quantafoye</k>
how many times; <k>kelkafoye</k> sometimes; <k>esas
 mea foyo</k> it is my turn; <k>a singlu lua foyo</k>
to each a turn, every one in turn; <k>me vidas il dufoye en
 la monato</k> I see him twice a month. F

<k>fragmento</k> fragment, broken piece, scrap; <k>fragmentigar</k>
to make into or reduce to f.s.

<k>frajila</k> <ex>(also fig.)</ex> fragile, brittle,
easily broken or destroyed, not durable; <k>hom frajil ala frajileso</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> man's frailty; <k>la frajileso dil fortuno</k>
<ex>(fig.)</ex> the instability of fortune. V. exp.: Ne omna
objekto <k>ruptebla</k> esas <k>frajila;</k>
bastono esas <k>ruptebla</k>, <k /> vitro dina esas <k>frajila;</k>
III<k />

<k>frakasar</k> <ex>(tr.)</ex> to break to pieces,
shatter, smash; <k>frakasbruiso</k> crash (sound). (cf. <k>ruptar).</k>
Ex.: Frakasar porcelana taso. Omna osti en lua korpo esis
frakasata.

<k>framo</k> <ex>(tech.)</ex> frame (work) (of a
machine, wagon, etc.); chassis (of autom.); sash (of a window,
etc.) N.B. not frame of picture; cf. <k>kadro.</k>

<k>frambo</k> rasberry; <k>frambiero: r.</k>
bush (genus: Rubus); <k>frambizar</k> to cover with r.s; <ex>(fig.)</ex>
to give a r. flavor to.

<k>Franca</k> French; <k>Franco</k>, <k>Franculo</k>, <k>Francino;
 Franciano</k> a F. person; <k>Francia</k> France; <k>Francigar</k>
to frenchify, gallicize; <k>Franceskar</k> to become F.; <k>Francig(ad)o</k>
gallicizing; <k>Francamanta; Francamiko</k> francophil; <k>Francodianto;
